original: Namo tassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa
analyzed: namaḥ tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: Homage to that Blessed One, perfected one, fully awakened Buddha.

original: Khuddakanikāye
analyzed: khuddaka nikāye
translated: In the Khuddaka Nikāya

original: Nettivibhāvinī
analyzed: na itti vibhāvinī
translated: Netti Commentary

original: Ganthārambhakathā
analyzed: gantha ārambha kathā
translated: Introduction to the Text

original: Yajitabbaṃ yajitvāna, namitabbaṃ namāmahaṃ;
analyzed: yajitabbam yajitvāna namitabbam namāmaham
translated: Having worshipped the one who should be worshipped, I pay homage to the one who should be paid homage;

original: Yajanādyānubhāvena, antarāye jahaṃ sadā.
analyzed: yajana ādya anubhāvena antarāye jaham sadā
translated: By the power of worshipping and so on, may I always abandon obstacles.

original: Yena yā racitā netti, yena sā anumoditā;🔽Yehi saṃvaṇṇanā katā, tesānubhāvanissito.
analyzed: yena yā racitā na itti yena sā anumoditā  yehi saṃvaṇṇanā katā
translated: By whom the Netti was composed, by whom it was approved;🔽By whom the commentary was made, relying on their power.

original: Kiñci kiñci saritvāna, līnālīnānusandhyādiṃ;
analyzed: kiñci kiñci
translated: Having remembered this and that, the condensed and uncondensed sequence and so on;

original: Karissaṃ jinasuttānaṃ, hitaṃ nettivibhāvanaṃ.
analyzed: karissam jina suttānam hitam netti vibhāvanam
translated: I will compose the Netti Commentary, for the benefit of the Victor's discourses.

original: Appameyyaguṇo mahādhammarājavhayo bhave;🔽Acchariyo abbhuto yo, bodhisambhārapūraṇo.
analyzed: acchariyaḥ abbhutaḥ yaḥ bodhi sambhāra pūraṇaḥ
translated: Having immeasurable qualities, the great king of the Dhamma,🔽The wonderful and marvelous one, who fulfilled the requisites for enlightenment.

original: Nānāraṭṭhissarissaro, seṭṭho sāsanapaggaho;🔽Pāsaṃsarājapāsaṃso, narācinteyyacintako.
analyzed: seṭṭhaḥ sāsana paggaho  pāsaṃsa rājapāsaṃsaḥ
translated: The lord of various countries, the best supporter of the Dispensation;🔽The king praised by kings, the one who thinks what humans should think.

original: Cintitakārako rājā, siraṭṭhimālapālako;
analyzed: cintita kārakaḥ rājā siraṭṭhimāla pālakaḥ
translated: The king who thinks and acts, the protector of the crown and garland;

original: Ajeyyajeyyako mahācetyādikārako sadā.
analyzed: sadā
translated: The unconquerable conqueror, the one who always makes great stupas and so on.

original: Assāmaccena byattena, jinacakkahitatthinā;
analyzed: assāmaccena byattena jina cakka hitatthinā
translated: By the wise horse minister, who seeks the welfare of the Victor's wheel;

original: Anantasutināmena, sakkaccaṃ abhiyācito.
analyzed: anantasuti nāmena sakkaccam abhiyācitaḥ
translated: Urged respectfully by the one named Anantasūti,

original: Kāmaṃ saṃvaṇṇanā katā, therāsabhehi gambhīrā;
analyzed: kāmam saṃvaṇṇanā katā thera āsabhehi gambhīrā
translated: The Elders’ Chief, though he has praised it, Has praised it as profound;

original: Gambhīrattā tu jānituṃ, jinaputtehi dukkarā.
analyzed: tu jānitum jinaputtehi dukkarā
translated: And because of its profundity, It is hard for the Conqueror’s Sons to know.

original: Tasmā yācitānurūpena, karissaṃ sādaraṃ suṇa;
analyzed: tasmai yācita anurūpena karissam sādaram suṇa
translated: So I shall do it with respect, As requested, so please listen;

original: Sissasikkhanayānugaṃ, yottaṃ nettivibhāvananti.
analyzed: sissa sikkha naya anugam yottam netti vibhāvanam ti
translated: It is called the ‘ Elucidation of the Path of Purification ’, And it is in the form of a pupil’s task.

original: 1. Saṅgahavāraatthavibhāvanā🔽Tattha yassa sikkhattayasaṅgahassa navaṅgassa satthusāsanavarassa atthasaṃvaṇṇanaṃ
analyzed: tattha yassa sikkhattaya saṅgahassa navaṅgassa satthu sāsana varassa attha saṃvaṇṇanam
translated: The Elucidation of the Meaning of the Chapter on Compendium🔽Herein, the meaning of the nine-factored excellent True Idea, which is the Master’s Dispensation, that is to say, the three Trainings, is to be expounded in the book called the ‘ Path of Purification ’,

original: yaṃ nettippakaraṇaṃ kātukāmo, tassa nettippakaraṇassa nissayaṃ visayabhūtaṃ saṃvaṇṇetabbasahitaṃ,
analyzed: yam netti pakaraṇam kātu kāmaḥ tassa netti pakaraṇassa nissayam visaya bhūtam saṃvaṇṇetabba sahitam
translated: and the meaning of that Path of Purification book, which is the support and the province of the Path of Purification book, together with what is to be expounded,

original: saṃvaṇṇetabbaṃ eva vā salokapālena tilokena sadā pūjetabbassa ceva namassitabbassa
analyzed: saṃvaṇṇetabbam eva vā sa lokapālena ti lokena sadā pūjetabbassa ca iva namassitabbassa
translated: or else what is to be expounded alone, which is always to be worshipped and revered by the three worlds with the world’s guardian,

original: ca naruttamassa satthuno sāsanavaraṃ vidūheva ñātabbaṃ. Etaṃ sāsanavaraṃ tāva dassento
analyzed: ca naruttamassa satthunaḥ sāsana varam vidūha iva ñātabbam etam sāsana varam tāva dassento
translated: should be known by the wise as the Master’s Dispensation, which is the best of all dispensations. And so, showing that best of all dispensations,

original: taṃjanakena, taṃvijānakavidūhi ca niyametuṃ, ratanattayaguṇaparidīpanañca kātuṃ –
analyzed: ca niyametum kātum
translated: he who is the author of the Path of Purification, in order to make it known to those who are the originators of the Path of Purification and to those who are the wise who know it, and in order to make them proclaim the special qualities of the Three Jewels,

original: “Yaṃ loko pūjayate, salokapālo sadā namassati ca;
analyzed: yam pūjayate sa lokapālaḥ sadā ca
translated: said this: ‘ The world worships what the world’s guardian always reveres,

original: Tasseta sāsanavaraṃ, vidūhi ñeyyaṃ naravarassā”ti. – paṭhamagāthamāha;🔽Imāya hi paṭhamagāthāya “etaṃ sāsanavaraṃ ñeyya”nti ettakameva ekantato karaṇavisesabhāvena
analyzed: sāsana varam vidūhi ñeyyam nara varassa ati paṭhama gātham āha  imāya hi paṭhama gāthāya etam sāsana varam ettakam eva ekantataḥ karaṇa visesa bhāvena
translated: The wise should know this excellent Dispensation, The best of men’s possessions.”🔽For in this first stanza only so much is intended in the sense of a special kind of action, namely, “This excellent Dispensation should be known.”

original: adhippetaṃ. Eteneva visesakaraṇena ekantādhippetanettivisayasāsanavarassa dassitattā.
analyzed: adhippetam etena iva visesa karaṇena ekanta adhippeta netti visaya sāsana varassa dassita ttā
translated: And it is shown that the excellent Dispensation, which is the object of the guide, is intended in the sense of a special kind of action by the very fact that the guide is intended in the sense of a special kind of action.

original: Ekantādhippetasāsanavarameva nettisaṃvaṇṇanāya saṃvaṇṇetabbattā visayaṃ teneva vakkhati aṭṭhakathācariyo –🔽“Etaṃ idāni amhehi vibhajitabbahāranayapaṭṭhānavicāraṇavisayabhūtaṃ sāsanaṃ ādikalyāṇatādiguṇasampattiyā varaṃ aggaṃ uttamaṃ nipuṇañāṇagocaratāya paṇḍitavedanīyamevā”ti ca,
analyzed: ekanta adhippeta sāsana varam eva netti saṃvaṇṇanāya saṃvaṇṇetabba ttā visayam tena iva vakkhati aṭṭhakathā cariyaḥ  etam idāni amhehi vibhajitabba hāra naya paṭṭhāna vicāraṇa visaya bhūtam sāsanam ādi kalyāṇa tā ādi guṇa sampattiyā varam aggam uttamam nipuṇa ñāṇa gocara tāya paṇḍita vedanīyam eva ati ca
translated: And because it is the excellent Dispensation, which is intended in the sense of a special kind of action, that should be commended by a commentary on the guide, the Master of the Commentary says this in order to show the object:🔽“This Dispensation, which is the object of the investigation of the method of distribution of the burden that is now to be undertaken by us, is excellent, foremost, supreme, and it is only to be known by the wise because it is the province of subtle knowledge.”🔽And he says this in order to show the object of the commentary:

original: “Etaṃ tividhampi ‘sāsanavara’nti padena saṅgaṇhitvā tattha yaṃ paṭhamaṃ, taṃ itaresaṃ
analyzed: etam tividham pi padena saṅgaṇhitvā tattha yam paṭhamam tam itaresam
translated: “This Dispensation, which is the object of the commentary, is excellent in the sense of a special kind of action. The first of these three kinds of excellence is to be known by the wise because it is the province of subtle knowledge. The second is to be known by the wise because it is the province of subtle knowledge and because it is the province of the knowledge of the noble ones. The third is to be known by the wise because it is the province of subtle knowledge and because it is the province of the knowledge of the noble ones and because it is the province of the knowledge of the fully enlightened ones.

original: adhigamūpāyoti sabbasāsanamūlabhūtaṃ, attano pakaraṇassa ca visayabhūtaṃ pariyattisāsanamevā”ti ca,
analyzed: adhigama upāyaḥ ti sabba sāsana mūla bhūtam attanaḥ pakaraṇassa ca visaya bhūtam pariyatti sāsanam eva ati ca
translated: The word “root” is used because the scriptures are the root of the whole dispensation and the province of this work.

original: “Idāni yaṃ vuttaṃ ‘sāsanavaraṃ vidūhi ñeyya’nti, tattha nettisaṃvaṇṇanāya visayabhūtaṃ pariyattidhammameva pakārantarena niyametvā dassetu”nti ca.
analyzed: idāni yam vuttam sāsana varam vidūhi ñeyyanti tattha netti saṃvaṇṇanāya visaya bhūtam pariyatti dhammam eva pakāra antarena niyametvā dassetun ti ca
translated: Now, as to the words “the wise should know the best of dispensations,” the scriptures, which are the province of the commentary on the Path, are shown by the next work as being the dispensation.

original: Tattha pariyattisāsanassāpi mūlaṃ hotīti vuttaṃ “sabbasāsanamūlabhūta”nti. Etena
analyzed: tattha pariyatti sāsanassa api mūlam hoti iti vuttam sabba sāsana mūla bhūtan ti etena
translated: Herein, the scriptures are said to be the root of the whole dispensation because they are the root of the dispensation of the scriptures.

original: kammasādhanenapi adhippetatthe siddhe nānāvidhasādhakavacanaṃ nānāvādānaṃ anokāsakaraṇatthāya🔽kataṃ. Svākkhātatādidhammaguṇā pana sāsanassa visesadesakanaravarasaddena vā paridīpakatthabhāvena
analyzed: kamma sādhanena api adhippeta tthe siddhe nānāvidha sādhaka vacanam nānā vādānam anokāsa karaṇa tthāya  katam svākkhāta tā ādi dhamma guṇā pana sāsanassa visesa desaka nara vara saddena vā paridīpaka attha bhāvena
translated: And the various ways of expressing the meaning of the word “root” are given in order to make room for the various ways of explaining it.

original: vā dīpitā avinābhāvato. Sāsanavarassa pana janakasambandhipekkhattā “naravarassā”ti
analyzed: vā dīpitā avinābhāvato sāsana varassa pana janaka sambandhi pekkha ttā nara varassa ati
translated: But the special qualities of the dispensation, such as being “well proclaimed,” are shown by the word “of the Best of Men” either as the quality of the person who proclaims it or as the purpose for which it is proclaimed, since they are inseparable from it.🔽And the word “of the Best of Men” is used because it is the person who is the cause of the dispensation that is intended.

original: vuttaṃ. Tena ca aggapuggalo sāsanavarajanako vācakatthasambandhibhāvena vutto. Anaññasādhāraṇamahākaruṇāsabbaññutaññāṇādiguṇavisesā
analyzed: vuttam tena ca agga puggalaḥ sāsana vara janakaḥ vācaka attha sambandhi bhāvena vuttaḥ anañña sādhāraṇa mahā karuṇā sabbaññuta ññāṇa ādi guṇa visesā
translated: And the foremost man who has set the Dispensation going is stated by the word “foremost” in the sense of the relation of speaker to meaning.

original: pana janakasambandhibhūtassa narassa visesakenavarasaddena vā paridīpakatthabhāvena vā dīpito.
analyzed: pana janaka sambandhi bhūtassa narassa vā paridīpaka attha bhāvena vā dīpitaḥ
translated: But the special qualities of great compassion, omniscience, etc., which are not shared by others, are shown either by the word “foremost” as the special quality of the man who is the relation of speaker to meaning, or by the word “foremost” in the sense of the relation of what is shown to what shows.

original: Kiṃ nu so sāsanavarajanako naravaro paramatthova, udāhu pūjanīyo ceva namassanīyo
analyzed: kim nu saḥ sāsana vara janakaḥ nara varaḥ udāhu pūjanīyaḥ ca iva namassanīyaḥ
translated: But is this foremost man who has set the Dispensation going only the ultimate meaning, or is he also to be honoured and revered?

original: cāti vuttaṃ “yaṃ loko…pe… namassati cā”ti, tena sāsanavarajanako naravaro paramatthova
analyzed: ca ati vuttam yam loka upe namassati ca ati tena sāsana vara janakaḥ nara varaḥ paramatthaḥ uva
translated: So it is said, “What the world … and reveres” . Thereby it is specified that the foremost man who has set the Dispensation going is not only the ultimate meaning,

original: na hoti, atha kho salokapālena lokena sadā sabbakālesu pūjanīyo ceva namassanīyo🔽cāti visesito thomitoti.🔽Ettha ca pūjananamassanacetanāvācakena vā pūjananamassanasaddena phalūpacārattho
analyzed: na hoti atha kho sa lokapālena lokena sadā sabba kālesu pūjanīyaḥ ca iva namassanīyaḥ  ca ati visesitaḥ thomitaḥ ti  ettha ca pūjana namassana cetanā vācakena vā pūjana namassana saddena phala upacāra atthaḥ
translated: but he is also to be honoured and revered by the world with its gods, by the generation with its ascetics and brahmans, by the great crowd with its devas and men, at all times.🔽And here the state of being honoured, which is the greatness of the merit consisting in the offering of the fruit of worship and reverence, is specified by the word “honoured” in the sense of the volition of worship and reverence, or by the word “honoured” in the sense of worship and reverence.

original: puññamahattasaṅkhāto pūjanīyabhāvo ceva āsavakkhayañāṇapadaṭṭhānasabbaññutaññāṇādiguṇasaṅkhāto
analyzed: puñña mahatta saṅkhāto pūjanīya bhāvo ca iva āsava kkhaya ñāṇa padaṭṭhāna sabbaññuta ññāṇa ādi guṇa saṅkhāto
translated: And the state of being revered, which is the special qualities consisting in the knowledge of the destruction of the taints, the knowledge of the recollection of past lives, etc.,

original: namassanīyabhāvo ca dīpakatthabhāvena pariggahetvā dīpito. Tenāha aṭṭhakathācariyo
analyzed: namassanīya bhāvaḥ ca dīpaka attha bhāvena pariggahetvā dīpito tena āha aṭṭhakathā cariyo
translated: and the state of being worthy of worship is shown by the word “worship” as the reason for the light. Hence the teacher of the commentary says:

original: “bhagavato sadevakassa lokassa pūjanīyavandanīyabhāvo, aggapuggalabhāvo ca vuccamāno
analyzed: bhagavataḥ sa devakassa lokassa pūjanīya vandanīya bhāvo agga puggala bhāvo ca vuccamāno
translated: “The Blessed One’s state of being worthy of worship and adoration by the world with its gods, and his state of being the highest person,

original: guṇavisiṭṭhataṃ dīpetī”tiādi.
analyzed: dīpeti itiādi
translated: are shown by the word ‘worship’ as the reason for the light” .

original: Tādisassa naravarassa tādisaṃ sāsanavaraṃ kiṃ yena kenaci viññeyyanti vuttaṃ “vidūhī”ti.
analyzed: tādisassa nara varassa tādisam sāsana varam kim yena kenacid viññeyyanti vuttam vidūhi iti
translated: “How can such a noble one’s supreme Dispensation be known by anyone at all?” is what is said by the word “vidū” .

original: Tena tipiṭakadharā ariyabhūtā paṇḍitā vācakatthabhāvena gahitā, suppaṭipannatādisaṅghaguṇā🔽pana vandadhātuvacanena vā dīpakatthabhāvena vā dīpitāti. Evaṃ pariggahetvā dīpite
analyzed: tena tipiṭaka dharā ariya bhūtā paṇḍitā vācaka attha bhāvena gahitā suppaṭipanna tā ādi saṅgha guṇā  pana vanda dhātu vacanena vā dīpaka ttha bhāvena vā dīpitā ati evam pariggahetvā dīpite
translated: By that word are included the wise who are bearers of the Three Baskets and have become Noble Ones, and the special qualities of the Community such as its being well practised,🔽are shown by the word “worship” as the reason for the light. So having shown the special qualities of the Three Jewels in this way,

original: ratanattayaguṇe sandhāya “evaṃ paṭhamagāthāya sātisayaṃ ratanattayaguṇaparidīpanaṃ
analyzed: rata nattaya guṇe sandhāya evam paṭhama gāthāya sa atisayam rata nattaya guṇa paridīpanam
translated: he says “having shown the special qualities of the Three Jewels in this way by the first stanza,”

original: katvā”ti vakkhati, na gāthāya niravasesatthe. Tattha evanti evaṃ sāsanavaradassanabhūtāya
analyzed: katvā iti vakkhati na gāthāya niravasesa atthe tattha evam ti evam sāsana vara dassana bhūtāya
translated: not by the stanza’s meaning in its entirety. Herein, “in this way” means in this way by the word “worship” as the reason for the light.

original: paṭhamagāthāyāti atthova daṭṭhabbo. Apare panācariyā “imāya paṭhamagāthāya ekantato
analyzed: paṭhama gāthāya ti atthaḥ uva daṭṭhabbo apare pana ācariyāḥ imāya paṭhama gāthāya ekantato
translated: The meaning should be seen as stated in the first stanza.🔽But other teachers, without properly investigating the words of the first stanza, which are used in the sense of “intended” and “not intended,”

original: adhippetānādhippetavacanāni ceva vācakatthadīpakatthavisesāni ca suṭṭhu avicāretvā
analyzed: adhippeta an adhippeta vacanāni ca iva vācaka attha dīpaka ttha visesāni ca suṭṭhu a vicāretvā
translated: and the words of the commentary, which are used in the sense of “indicating” and “not indicating,”

original: ‘evaṃ paṭhamagāthāya sātisayaṃ ratanattayaguṇaparidīpanaṃ katvā’ti vacanacchāyaṃ🔽nissāya sātisayaṃ ratanattayaguṇaparidīpanaṃ kātuṃ ‘yaṃ lokotyādimāhā’ti ca sātisayaratanattayaguṇe
analyzed: evam paṭhama gāthāya sa atisayam rata nattaya guṇa paridīpanam katvā ati vacana chāyam  nissāya sa atisayam rata nattaya guṇa paridīpanam kātum yam loka utyā ādim āha ati ca sa atisaya rata nattaya guṇe
translated: and relying on the words of the commentary, “Having thus shown the special qualities of the Three Jewels in the first stanza,”🔽and showing the special qualities of the Three Jewels, say, “The special qualities of the Three Jewels are shown in the words ‘What he said beginning with the world’s transcendence.’ ”

original: dassento ‘yaṃ lokotyādimāhā’ti” ca vadanti. Tesaṃ vādo amhākaṃ nakkhamati. Kāraṇaṃ🔽pana mayā heṭṭhā vuttānusārena ñātabbanti ayaṃ padānukkamānurūpānusandhyattho.
analyzed: dassentaḥ yam loka uti ādim āha ati ca vadanti tesam vādaḥ amhākam na khamati kāraṇam  pana mayā heṭṭhā vutta anusārena ñātabban ti ayam pada anukkama anurūpa anusandhi atthaḥ
translated: But their statement does not appeal to us. The reason🔽should be understood according to the method stated above.🔽Or else, at one time, while sitting in the Rose-Apple Wood, thinking of the welfare of his disciples,

original: Atha vā ekaṃ samayaṃ jambuvanasaṇḍe nisīditvā sissānaṃ hitaṃ cintento, attano abhinīhārasampattiṃ
analyzed: atha vā ekam samayam jambu vana saṇḍe nisīditvā sissānam hitam cintentaḥ attanaḥ abhinīhāra sampattim
translated: seeing the perfection of his own aspiration,🔽Mahākaccāyana, praised by the Perfectly Enlightened One,

original: passanto, sammāsambuddhena pasaṃsito, mahākaccāyano satthārā anumoditaṃ sāsanāyattaṃ
analyzed: passantaḥ sammāsambuddhena pasaṃsitaḥ mahākaccāyano satthārā anumoditam sāsana āyattam
translated: was delighted by the Teacher’s approval of the Dispensation.

original: navaṅgassatthavaṇṇanaṃ soḷasahārādianekatthavidhaṃ nettippakaraṇaṃ ārabhanto, “yaṃ🔽loko”tyādimāha. Yadi evaṃ yathāvuttappakāraṃ nettippakaraṇabhūtaṃ soḷasahārātyādikaṃ
analyzed: navaṅgaḥ attha vaṇṇanam soḷasa hāra ādi aneka atthavidham ārabhantaḥ yam  loka uti ādim āha yadi evam yathāvutta ppakāram netti pakaraṇa bhūtam
translated: and the Netti-Pakaraṇa, which is the commentary on the nine-fold teaching and which has many meanings such as the sixteen-fold method, etc.,🔽he began by saying: “What the world calls gain, etc.” If it is so, then the sixteen-fold method, etc., which are the Netti-Pakaraṇa of the above-mentioned kind,🔽🔽

original: ārabhitabbaṃ, taṃ anārabhitvā kasmā nettippakaraṇato bahibhūtaṃ “yaṃ loko”tyādikaṃ🔽ārabhitabbaṃ, seyyathāpi ambaṃ puṭṭho labujaṃ byākareyya, labujaṃ puṭṭho ambaṃ byākareyya,🔽evameva nettippakaraṇamārabhanto aññaṃ ārabhatīti? Tathāpi yassa yathāvuttassa sāsanavarassa
analyzed: ārabhitabbam tam an ārabhitvā kasmā na itthi pakaraṇataḥ bahibhūtam yam loka uti ādikam  ārabhitabbam seyyathā api ambam puṭṭhaḥ labujam byākareyya labujam puṭṭhaḥ ambam byākareyya  evam eva na itti pakaraṇam ārabhantaḥ aññam ārabhati iti tathā api yassa yathā vuttassa sāsana varassa
translated: He who was about to compose the Netti-Pakaraṇa, which is the commentary on the nine-fold scriptures and which has many meanings such as the sixteen methods, etc., said thus: “Yaṃ loko” . If it is so, the sixteen methods, etc., which are the Netti-Pakaraṇa of the aforesaid nature should be commenced. Without commencing them, why did he commence “Yaṃ loko” , which is outside the Netti-Pakaraṇa? Just as one who is asked about mango would explain about bread-fruit, and one who is asked about bread-fruit would explain about mango,

original: atthasaṃvaṇṇanaṃ yaṃ nettippakaraṇaṃ kātukāmo yassa nettippakaraṇassa visayabhūtaṃ
analyzed: attha saṃvaṇṇanam yam netti pakaraṇam kātu kāmaḥ yassa netti pakaraṇassa visaya bhūtam
translated: in the same way, he who is about to commence the Netti-Pakaraṇa commences another . In that way, however, he who was desirous of composing the Netti-Pakaraṇa, which is the commentary on the aforesaid treasure of the Dispensation, and which is the domain of the Netti-Pakaraṇa,

original: saṃvaṇṇetabbasahitaṃ, saṃvaṇṇetabbaṃ eva vā taṃ sāsanavaraṃ tāva dassento taṃjanakena,
analyzed: saṃvaṇṇetabba sahitam saṃvaṇṇetabbam eva vā tam sāsana varam tāva dassento taṃjanakena
translated: either together with the commentable or only the commentable treasure of the Dispensation, first of all, showing that treasure of the Dispensation, in order to make it known by him who was born at that time,

original: taṃvijānakavidūhi ca niyametuṃ, ratanattayaguṇaparidīpanañca kātuṃ “yaṃ loko”tyādimāha.
analyzed: ca niyametum kātum yam loka utyā ādim āha
translated: and by the wise who were born at that time, and in order to make the exposition of the virtues of the Three Gems, said thus: “Yaṃ loko” .

original: Ayaṃ līnantaracodanāsahito anusandhyattho.🔽“Yaṃ loko pūjayate, salokapālo sadā namassati ca;🔽Tasseta sāsanavaraṃ, vidūhi ñeyyaṃ naravarassā”ti. –
analyzed: ayam  yam pūjayate sa lokapālaḥ sadā ca  tassa ita sāsana varam vidūhi ñeyyam nara varassa ati
translated: This is the meaning of the verse, which is given with the prompting of the Elder Tissa of Lanka.

original: Niggahitalopaṃ katvā racitā gāthā ariyāsāmaññalakkhaṇena sampannā. Kathaṃ? Pubbaḍḍhe
analyzed: niggahita lopam katvā racitā gāthā ariya asāmañña lakkhaṇena sampannā katham pubbaḍḍhe
translated: The verse is composed by the Elder Tissa of Lanka, who is skilled in the three Piṭakas, in the manner of the ancient poets, with the characteristics of the ancient poets, with the characteristics of the ancient language, with the characteristics of the ancient verses, with the characteristics of the ancient prose, with the characteristics of the ancient language and the ancient verses, with the characteristics of the ancient language and the ancient prose, with the characteristics of the ancient verses and the ancient prose, with the characteristics of the ancient language, the ancient verses, and the ancient prose.

original: tiṃsa mattā, aparaḍḍhe sattavīsa mattā. Sampiṇḍitā sattapaññāsa mattāva bhavanti.
analyzed: tiṃsa mattā aparaḍḍhe sattavīsa mattā sampiṇḍitā sattapaññāsa mattā ava bhavanti
translated: The first half of the verse has thirty syllables, the second half has twenty-seven syllables. The two halves together have fifty-seven syllables.

original: Akkharānaṃ pana imissaṃ gāthāyaṃ sattatiṃsa. Tesu garukkharā vīsati, lahukkharā sattarasa
analyzed: akkharānam pana imissam gāthāyam sattatiṃsa tesu garukkharāḥ vīsati lahukkharāḥ sattarasa
translated: In this verse there are thirty-seven syllables. Of these, twenty are heavy syllables, seventeen are light syllables.🔽The words “Tassetaṃ sāsanavara” are not in the meter.

original: bhavanti. “Tassetaṃ sāsanavara”nti pana sānunāsikaṃ virujjhati.🔽Tattha niddesattho aṭṭhakathānusārena vijānitabbo. Salokapālo sabbo sattaloko sakkaccaṃ
analyzed: bhavanti tassa itam pana sa anunāsikam virujjhati  tattha niddesa atthaḥ aṭṭhakathā anusārena vijānitabbaḥ sa lokapālaḥ sabbaḥ satta lokaḥ sakkaccam
translated: The meaning of the words should be understood according to the commentary.

original: sabbaññutaññāṇādianekaguṇānussaraṇena vā pūjetabbapūjanena vā paṭipattipūjanena vā
analyzed: sabbaññu taññāṇa ādi aneka guṇa anussaraṇena vā pūjetabba pūjanena vā paṭipatti pūjanena vā
translated: The verse is composed by the Elder Tissa of Lanka, who is skilled in the three Piṭakas, in the manner of the ancient poets, with the characteristics of the ancient poets, with the characteristics of the ancient language, with the characteristics of the ancient verses, with the characteristics of the ancient prose, with the characteristics of the ancient language and the ancient verses, with the characteristics of the ancient language and the ancient prose, with the characteristics of the ancient verses and the ancient prose, with the characteristics of the ancient language, the ancient verses, and the ancient prose.

original: sadā sabbakālesu sakkaccaṃ yaṃ naravaraṃ pūjayate ceva namassati ca, tassa pūjetabbassa
analyzed: sadā sabba kālesu sakkaccam yam nara varam pūjayate ca iva namassati ca tassa pūjetabbassa
translated: He who reverently worships and honours the Best of Men at all times,

original: ceva namassitabbassa ca satthuno naravarassa tilokaggassa mayā saṃvaṇṇetabbasahitaṃ,🔽saṃvaṇṇetabbaṃ eva vā vidūheva ñeyyaṃ ñātabbaṃ. Nipuṇañāṇagocaraṃ etaṃ mayā buddhiyaṃ
analyzed: ca iva namassitabbassa ca satthunaḥ nara varassa ti lokaggassa mayā saṃvaṇṇetabba sahitam  saṃvaṇṇetabbam eva vā vidūha iva ñeyyam ñātabbam nipuṇa ñāṇa gocaram etam mayā
translated: of that Teacher who is to be worshipped and honoured, the Best of Men, the Light of the Three Worlds, I shall expound the Dhamma,

original: ṭhapitaṃ sāsanavaraṃ mayā ārabhitabbassa nettippakaraṇassa visayanti paṭhamaṃ jānitabbaṃ
analyzed: ṭhapitam sāsana varam mayā ārabhitabbassa netti pakaraṇassa visayanti paṭhamam jānitabbam
translated: which is to be understood, known, by the wise, which is the province of subtle knowledge, which I have placed in my mind, the excellent Dispensation, the province of the Netti-Pakaraṇa, which I shall undertake.

original: dassetvā tassa atthasaṃvaṇṇanābhūtaṃ nettippakaraṇaṃ ahaṃ ārabhissāmi, taṃ tumhe
analyzed: dassetvā tassa attha saṃvaṇṇanā bhūtam netti pakaraṇam aham ārabhissāmi tam tumhe
translated: Having shown this, I shall undertake the Netti-Pakaraṇa, which is a commentary on the meaning of that. You

original: sādhavo suṇātha manasi karothāti samudāyayojanā, avayavayojanāpi kātabbā.🔽Kathaṃ? “Salokapālo loko”ti visesanavisesitabbabhāvena yojanā. Lokapālo vajjetvā
analyzed: sādhavaḥ manasi karotha ati samudāya yojanā avayava yojanā api kātabbā  katham sa lokapālaḥ visesana visesitabba bhāvena yojanā lokapālaḥ vajjetvā
translated: good people, listen and give attention. This is the connection in brief. The connection in detail should also be made.

original: avaseso loko ca na hoti, atha kho lokapālasahito lokoti viseseti. “Loko pūjayate
analyzed: avasesaḥ loko ca na hoti atha kho lokapāla sahitaḥ loko iti pūjayate
translated: How? The connection is made by the relation of the qualified and the qualifier in the words “The world with its protectors is the world.” The world without its protectors is not the world, but the world with its protectors is the world. “The world worships🔽and honours the Best of Men at all times.”

original: ceva namassati cā”ti kattukārakaākhyātakiriyābhāvena yojanā “yo karoti, sa kattā”ti
analyzed: ca iva namassati ca ati kattu kāraka ākhyāta kiriyā bhāvena yojanā yaḥ karoti sa kattā ati
translated: and worships and honours him, is the maker, the doer, the one who has the deed done, the one who acts, the one who has the action done.”

original: vuttattā. Yo loko kārako, so kattā hotu. Yo loko pūjayate ceva namassati ca, kathaṃ
analyzed: vutta ttā yaḥ loko kārako so kattā hotu yaḥ loko pūjayate ca iva namassati ca katham
translated: So let the world be the maker, the doer, the one who has the deed done, the one who acts, the one who has the action done. But how can the world be the maker, the doer, the one who has the deed done, the one who acts, the one who has the action done,🔽since it is said, “He who does, he is the maker”?

original: so kattāti? “Yo karoti, sa kattā”ti suttassa “yo karoti kiriyaṃ nipphādeti, so kiriyānipphādako
analyzed: so kattā ati yaḥ karoti sa kattā ati suttassa yaḥ karoti kiriyam nipphādeti so kiriyā nipphādako
translated: The meaning of the sutta is this: “He who does, who produces the action, is the maker, the producer of the action.”

original: kattā”ti atthasambhavato sayanabhuñjanādisabbakiriyānipphādako kattāyeva hoti. Ayañca
analyzed: kattā ati attha sambhavato sayana bhuñjana ādi sabba kiriyā nipphādako kattāya iva hoti ayam ca
translated: So the maker is the one who produces all actions such as lying down, eating, etc.

original: loko pūjananamassanakiriyānipphādakoyevāti. Kathaṃ ayaṃ loko kiriyānipphādakoti?🔽“Loko”ti sattapaññattiyā paramatthato avijjamānāyapi paññāpetabbo santāne pavattamāno
analyzed: katham ayam loko kiriyā nipphādako ti  lokaḥ iti satta paññattiyā paramatthataḥ a vijjamānāya api paññāpetabbaḥ santāne pavattamāno
translated: And this world is the producer of the action of worshipping and honouring. But how is this world the producer of the action?

original: hadayavatthunissito cittuppādo gahetabbo, so yathārahaṃ hetādhipatisahajātādipaccayena
analyzed: hadaya vatthu nissitaḥ cittuppādaḥ gahetabbaḥ saḥ yathāraham hetā adhipati sahajāta ādi paccayena
translated: “World” is the arising of consciousness in a continuity, which is to be spoken of though it does not exist in the ultimate sense in the individual, and which is to be taken as based on the heart-basis. That arises by means of the conditions of root-cause, predominance, conascence, etc.,

original: paccayo nipphādako bhave. Evaṃ lokassa kattukārakabhāvo vijānitabboti paccayapaccayuppannabhāvena
analyzed: paccayaḥ nipphādakaḥ bhave evam lokassa kattu kāraka bhāvaḥ vijānitabbaḥ iti paccaya paccaya uppanna bhāvena
translated: and a condition is a producer. Thus the way in which the world is to be known as having a maker should be understood as the construing of the words in the passage in this way by means of the condition and the conditionally-arisen.

original: yojanā. Esa nayo tīsu piṭakesupi evarūpesu ṭhānesu.
analyzed: yojanā esa nayo tīsu evarūpesu ṭhānesu
translated: This is the method in the three Piṭakas in such passages as this.

original: “Yaṃ naravaraṃ pūjayate ceva namassati cā”ti kammakārakaākhyātakiriyābhāvena yojanā🔽“yaṃ karoti, taṃ kamma”nti vuttattā. Yaṃ kātabbaṃ, taṃ kammaṃ hotu. Yaṃ pūjayati🔽ceva namassati ca, kathaṃ taṃ kammanti? “Yaṃ karoti, taṃ kamma”nti suttassa “yaṃ
analyzed: yam nara varam pūjayate ca iva namassati ca ati kamma kāraka ākhyāta kiriyā bhāvena yojanā  yam karoti tam kamman ti vutta ttā yam kātabbam tam kammam hotu yam pūjayati  ca iva namassati ca katham tam kammanti yam karoti tam kammanti suttassa yam
translated: The construing by means of the verbal noun and the verb in the passage, “He who worships and extols the Best of Men” ,🔽is as follows. Since it is said, “What one does is one’s deed” , what is to be done is a deed. But how is it a deed that he worships and extols? Since the meaning of the passage, “What one does is one’s deed” , is this,🔽namely, “What one does is what one is bound to by action, and what one is bound to by action is a deed” ,

original: karoti kiriyāya sambajjhati, kiriyāya sambajjhitabbaṃ kamma”nti atthasambhavato karaṇavācakavacanīyādisabbakiriyāya
analyzed: karoti kiriyāya sambajjhati kiriyāya sambajjhitabbam kammanti attha sambhavataḥ karaṇa vācaka vacanīya ādi sabba kiriyāya
translated: it is a deed that one is bound to by any action whatsoever, whether it be expressed by a verbal noun or by a verb.

original: sambajjhitabbaṃ kammaṃ hotveva. Ayañca naravaro pūjananamassanakiriyāya vācakavacanīyabhāvena
analyzed: sambajjhitabbam kammam hotvā iva ayam ca nara varaḥ pūjana namassana kiriyāya vācaka vacanīya bhāvena
translated: And this Best of Men is a verbal noun and a verb in the sense of the action of worshipping and extolling.

original: sambajjhitabboyevāti. Kathaṃ ayaṃ naravaro vacanīyoti? Pūjananamassanacetanāya ārammaṇakaraṇavasena
analyzed: katham ayam nara varaḥ vacanīyaḥ iva ati pūjana namassana cetanāya ārammaṇa karaṇa vasena
translated: By making him the object of the volition that wishes to worship and honour him.

original: naravaro vacanīyo, cetanā vācakā, evaṃ vācakavacitabbabhāvo hotveva. “Yaṃ naravara”nti🔽paññattiyā paramatthato avijjamānāyapi paññāpetabbo santānavasena pavattamāno lokiyalokuttaraguṇasahito
analyzed: nara varaḥ cetanāḥ vācakāḥ evam vācaka vacitabba bhāvaḥ hotvā iva yam  paññattiyā paramatthataḥ a vijjamānāya api paññāpetabbaḥ santāna vasena pavattamānaḥ lokiya lokuttara guṇa sahitaḥ
translated: Or the volition is the speaking, and so there is the state of being spoken of and being spoken to.🔽The five aggregates that are spoken of as “this best of men” are the object condition for the volition that is the condition for the arising of the state of being spoken of and being spoken to.

original: khandhapañcako vutto, so ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo, cetanā paccayuppannāti paccayapaccayuppannabhāvena
analyzed: khandha pañcako vutto saḥ ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ cetanā paccaya uppannā ati paccaya paccaya uppanna bhāvena
translated: This is the interpretation in terms of condition and conditioned.

original: yojanā. Esa nayo tīsu piṭakesu evarūpesu ṭhānesu.🔽“Tassa naravarassā”ti visesanavisesitabbabhāvena yojanā. Naravaro nāma nimantitabbādiko🔽na hoti, atha kho pūjetabbo namassitabbo evāti viseseti. Tassa pūjetabbassa ceva
analyzed: yojanā esa nayaḥ tīsu piṭakesu evarūpesu ṭhānesu  tassa nara varassa ati visesana visesitabba bhāvena yojanā naravaraḥ nāma nimantitabba ādikaḥ  na hoti atha kho pūjetabbaḥ namassitabbaḥ eva ati viseseti tassa pūjetabbassa ca iva
translated: This is the interpretation in terms of the condition and the arising of the conditioned in the three Piṭakas in such passages as this.🔽The interpretation in terms of the distinction and the distinguished is this. The best of men is not one who is to be invited, and so on,🔽but rather one who is to be worshipped and honoured. This is the distinction. The best of men is to be worshipped and honoured.

original: namassitabbassa ca naravarassa sāsanavaranti jaññajanakabhāvena yojanā. Sāsanavaraṃ
analyzed: namassitabbassa ca nara varassa sāsana varan ti jañña janaka bhāvena yojanā sāsana varam
translated: The interpretation in terms of the state of being known and the knower is this. The best of his teachings is the best of men’s teaching.

original: nāma paccekabuddhasāvakabuddharājarājādīnaṃ sāsanavaraṃ na hoti, pūjetabbassa ceva🔽namassitabbassa ca naravarassa tilokasseva sāsanavaranti niyameti.🔽“Vidūhi ñeyya”nti kattukārakakitakiriyābhāvena yojanā. Kattubhāvo heṭṭhā vuttova.
analyzed: nāma paccekabuddha sāvaka buddha rāja rāja ādīnam sāsana varam na hoti pūjetabbassa ca iva  namassitabbassa ca nara varassa ti lokassa iva sāsana varanti niyameti  vidūhi kattu kāraka kita kiriyā bhāvena yojanā kattu bhāvaḥ heṭṭhā vuttaḥ uva
translated: but are worthy of reverence. It is only the Dispensation of the Best of Men, the Three-World-Conqueror, that is worthy of worship.🔽“To be known by the wise” is to be known by the wise who are skilled in the analysis of the categories of action, etc. The category of action has already been explained above.🔽“To be known by the wise” is to be known by the wise who are skilled in the analysis of the categories of action, etc. The category of action has already been explained above.🔽“To be known by the wise” is to be known by the wise who are skilled in the analysis of the categories of action, etc. The category of action has already been explained above.

original: “Vidūhī”ti sattapaññattiyā paramatthato avijjamānāyapi paññāpetabbo santāne pavattamāno🔽sāsanavare sammohadhaṃsakañāṇasahito hadayavatthunissito cittuppādo vutto, so yathārahaṃ
analyzed: vidūhi iti satta paññattiyā paramatthataḥ a vijjamānāya api paññāpetabbaḥ santāne pavattamāno  sāsana vare sammoha dhaṃsaka ñāṇa sahitaḥ hadaya vatthu nissito cittuppādaḥ vutto saḥ yathāraham
translated: “To be known by the wise” is to be known by the wise who are skilled in the analysis of the categories of action, etc. The category of action has already been explained above.🔽“To be known by the wise” is to be known by the wise who are skilled in the analysis of the categories of action, etc. The category of action has already been explained above.🔽“To be known by the wise” is to be known by the wise who are skilled in the analysis of the categories of action, etc. The category of action has already been explained above.🔽“To be known by the wise” is to be known by the wise who are skilled in the analysis of the categories of action, etc. The category of action has already been explained above.

original: hetādhipatisahajātādipaccayena paccayo nipphādako bhave. Ñā-itidhātuyā atthabhūtaṃ
analyzed: he ta adhipati sahajāta ādi paccayena paccayaḥ nipphādakaḥ bhave ñā iti dhātuyāḥ attha bhūtam
translated: “To be known by the wise” is to be known by the wise who are skilled in the analysis of the categories of action, etc. The category of action has already been explained above.🔽“To be known by the wise” is to be known by the wise who are skilled in the analysis of the categories of action, etc. The category of action has already been explained above.🔽“To be known by the wise” is to be known by the wise who are skilled in the analysis of the categories of action, etc. The category of action has already been explained above.

original: ñāṇaṃ paccayuppannaṃ nipphādeyyaṃ bhave, evaṃ paccayapaccayuppannabhāvena yojanā.
analyzed: ñāṇam paccaya uppannam nipphādeyyam bhave evam paccaya paccaya uppanna bhāvena yojanā
translated: “To be known by the wise” is to be known by the wise who are skilled in the analysis of the categories of action, etc. The category of action has already been explained above.🔽“To be known

original: “Ñeyyaṃ sāsanavara”nti visesanavisesyabhāvena yojanā. Sāsanavaraṃ nāma na yena kenaci ñeyyaṃ, atha kho vidūheva saṇhasukhumañāṇena ñeyyaṃ sāsanavaranti viseseti.🔽“Etaṃ sāsanavara”nti visesanavisesyabhāvena yojanā. Sāsanavaraṃ nāma mayā buddhiyaṃ🔽aṭṭhapitaṃ appavattetabbaṃ hoti, mayā idāni nettippakaraṇassa visayabhāvena buddhiyaṃ🔽viparivattamānaṃ ṭhapetabbaṃ pavattetabbaṃ sāsanavaranti viseseti. Etaṃ sāsanavaraṃ
analyzed: ñeyyam sāsanavaranti visesana visesya bhāvena yojanā sāsanavaram nāma na yena kenacid ñeyyam atha kho vidūha iva saṇha sukhuma ñāṇena ñeyyam sāsanavaranti viseseti  etam visesana visesya bhāvena yojanā sāsanavaram nāma mayā  aṭṭhapitam a pavattetabbam hoti mayā idāni netti pakaraṇassa visaya bhāvena  viparivattamānam ṭhapetabbam pavattetabbam sāsana varam ti viseseti etam sāsana varam
translated: “To be known as the best of teachings” : the construction is by way of the distinction and the distinguished. The best of teachings is not to be known by anyone and everyone, but rather it is to be known by one who is wise, by one who has subtle and refined knowledge. Thus the Exalted One distinguishes the best of teachings.🔽“This is the best of teachings” : the construction is by way of the distinction and the distinguished. The best of teachings is that which has been established by me, the Buddha, and which should not be allowed to disappear. Now I must establish and maintain the best of teachings by turning it over in my mind as the subject matter of the Netti-pakaraṇa. Thus the Exalted One distinguishes the best of teachings.

original: nettippakaraṇassa visayanti yojanā kātabbā. Tenāha “etaṃ idāni amhehi vibhajitabbahāranayapaṭṭhānavicāraṇavisayabhūtaṃ
analyzed: yojanā kātabbā tena āha etam idāni amhehi vibhajitabba hāra naya paṭṭhāna vicāraṇa visaya bhūtam
translated: “This is the best of teachings, the subject matter of the Netti-pakaraṇa” : this is the construction. Therefore he says: “This is the Dispensation which is now to be divided by us, the subject matter of the method of analysis of the method of distribution.”

original: sāsana”nti. Iccevaṃ nettiyā paṭhamagāthāya saṅkhepena yojanattho samatto.
analyzed: icc evam nettiyā paṭhama gāthāya saṅkhepena yojana attho samattaḥ
translated: Thus the meaning of the first stanza of the Netti is completed in brief.

original: Tattha yanti aniyamanaravarassa satthuno vācakaṃ payogavantasabbanāmaṃ. Aniyamo ca
analyzed: tattha yanti aniyama nara varassa satthunaḥ vācakam aniyamaḥ ca
translated: Herein, “this” refers to the best of teachings, the speech of the Teacher who is not limited. “Not limited” means

original: pūjananamassanakiriyāya aniyamitattā vutto, na naravarato aññasattassa sambhavatoti.🔽Esa nayo sesāniyatesupi tīsu piṭakesu. Lokiyanti ettha puññāpuññāni, tabbipāko cāti
analyzed: pūjana namassana kiriyāya a niyamita ttā vuttaḥ na nara varataḥ añña sattassa sambhavato ti  esa nayo sesa aniyatesu pi tīsu piṭakesu lokiyanti ettha puñña apuññāni tad vipāko ca ati
translated: because of the non-restriction of the act of worshipping and honouring, not because of the possibility of another being a man’s superior.🔽So too in the case of the other three Piṭakas.🔽Herein, the profitable and unprofitable and their result are the world because they go on revolving ,🔽and because the result of the profitable and unprofitable goes on revolving in the round of existence.

original: loko.Ettha sattanikāye puññāpuññāni lokiyanti pavattanti, tabbipāko ca lokiyati pavattati,🔽iti sattanikāyassa puññāpuññānaṃ, tabbipākassa ca pavattanassa ādhārabhāvato “etthā”tipadena
analyzed: lokoettha satta nikāye puñña apuññāni lokiyanti pavattanti tad bipāko ca lokiyati pavattati  iti satta nikāyassa puñña apuññānam tad vipākassa ca pavattanassa ādhāra bhāvataḥ ettha ati padena
translated: So the round of existence is called the world because it is the basis for the occurrence of the profitable and unprofitable and their result.

original: niddiṭṭho sattanikāyo lokonāma. Pūjayateti viggahavirahitaṃ ākhyātapadaṃ, sakkaccaṃ pūjanaṃ karoti.
analyzed: niddiṭṭhaḥ satta nikāyaḥ lokonāma pūjayata iti viggaha virahitam ākhyāta padam sakkaccam pūjanam karoti
translated: He worships: the word “worships” is a verbal noun in the accusative case. He does the worshipping respectfully.

original: Lokaṃ pālentīti lokapālā, puññāpuññānañceva tabbipākassa ca pavattanādhārattā lokā
analyzed: lokam pālenti iti lokapālā puññā apuññānam ca iva tad bipākassa ca lokā
translated: They guard the world: they are world-guardians because they are the basis for the occurrence of the profitable and unprofitable and their result.

original: ca. Ke te? Cattāro mahārājāno, indayamavaruṇakuverā vā, khattiyacatumahārājasakkasuyāmasantusitasunimmitaparanimmitavasavattimahābrahmādayo
analyzed: ca ke te cattāraḥ mahārājānaḥ inda yama varuṇa kuverāḥ vā khattiya catu mahārāja sakka suyāma santusita sunimmita paranimmita vasavatti mahābrahma ādayaḥ
translated: Who are they? The four Great Kings, or Indra, and the chief of the gods of the Thirty-three, and the chief of the gods of Yāma, and the chief of the gods of Tavatimsa, and the chief of the gods of the Four Kings, and the chief of the gods of the Thirty-three, and the chief of the gods of Yāma, and the chief of the gods of Tavatimsa, and the chief of the gods of the Four Kings, and the chief of the gods of the Thirty-three, and the chief of the gods of Yāma, and the chief of the gods of Tavatimsa, and the chief of the gods of the Four Kings, and the chief of the gods of the Thirty-three, and the chief of the gods of Yāma, and the chief of the gods of Tavatimsa, and the chief of the gods of the Four Kings, and the chief of the gods of the Thirty-three, and the chief of the gods of Yāma, and the chief of the gods of Tavatimsa, and the chief of the gods of the Four Kings, and the chief of the gods of the Thirty-three, and the chief of the gods of Yāma, and the chief of the gods of Tavatimsa, and the chief of the gods of the Four Kings, and the chief of the gods of the Thirty-three, and the chief of the gods of Yāma, and the chief of the gods of Tavatimsa, and the chief of the gods of the Four Kings, and the chief of the gods of the Thirty-three,

original: vā. Pālanañcettha issariyādhipaccena taṃtaṃsattalokassa aññamaññavihesananivāraṇādiāṇāpavattāpanayasaparivāraṭṭhānantarādiniyyādanā,
analyzed: vā pālanam ca ittha issariya ādhipaccena taṃ taṃ satta lokassa aññamañña vihesana nivāraṇa ādi āṇā pavatta apanaya sa parivāra ṭṭhāna antara ādi niyyādanā
translated: and so on. Herein, protection is the warding off of mutual harm, etc., in the case of the various kinds of beings in the world, by means of sovereignty and overlordship, and it is accompanied by the giving of life, etc., as its proximate cause, and so on.

original: saha lokapālehi yo vattatīti salokapālo. Atha vā ye hirottappā lokaṃ pālenti, iti
analyzed: saha lokapālehi yaḥ vattati iti sa lokapālaḥ atha vā ye hirottappāḥ lokam pālenti iti
translated: He who exists together with the world guardians is called “having world guardians” . Or alternatively, it is the world that is called “having world guardians” because it is the world that is protected by the world guardians,

original: pālanato te hirottappā lokapālā. Tenāha bhagavā “dveme, bhikkhave, sukkā dhammā lokaṃ🔽pālentī”ti. Lokapālehi hirottappehi samannāgato loko salokapālo nāma. Hirottappasampanno🔽hi sappuriso loko sakkaccaṃ sadā sabbakālesu pūjayati ceva namassati ca pāpahirijigucchanato,
analyzed: pālanataḥ te hirottappāḥ lokapālā tena āha bhagavā dve me bhikkhave sukkāḥ dhammāḥ lokaṃ  pālenti iti lokapālehi hirottappehi samannāgataḥ loko sa lokapālaḥ nāma hirottappa sampanno  hi sappurisaḥ loko sakkaccam sadā sabba kālesu pūjayati ca iva namassati ca pāpa hiri jigucchanataḥ
translated: who are endowed with shame and moral dread. Hence the Blessed One said: “Bhikkhus, these two bright states protect the world.

original: dhammacchandavantatāya ca.
analyzed: dhamma chandavanta tāya ca
translated: What two? Shame and moral dread” . For people endowed with shame and moral dread are respected and revered by the world at all times, because of their abhorrence of evil and their desire for the good.

original: Aññe pana pūjentā namassantāpi kadāciyeva pūjenti namassanti, na sabbadāti. Sadāti
analyzed: aññe pana pūjentā namassantā api kadāciyeva pūjenti namassanti na sabbadāti sadā
translated: But others are respected and revered only sometimes, not all the time.

original: pūjananamassanakālavācakaviggahavirahitaṃ vikappanāmaṃ, sabbanāmaṃ vā. Namassatīti
analyzed: pūjana namassana kāla vācaka viggaha virahitam vikappa nāmam sabba nāmam vā namassati iti
translated: “Always” is a term for the absence of the distinction of time expressed by the case ending, or it is a term for the whole.🔽He reveres :

original: viggahavirahitaṃ ākhyātapadaṃ, sakkaccaṃ namassanaṃ karoti. Tassetāti ettha tassāti
analyzed: viggaha virahitam ākhyāta padam sakkaccam namassanam karoti ettha tassa ati
translated: and the word “to” is without a case-ending. He does reverence with respect. “To him” : here the word “to him”

original: niyamavācakaṃ payogavantasabbanāmaṃ viggahavirahitameva. Niyamo ca pūjananamassanakiriyāya
analyzed: niyama vācakam viggaha virahitam eva niyamaḥ ca pūjana namassana kiriyāya
translated: is a demonstrative pronoun without a case-ending. And the demonstration is specified by the act of reverence and worship.

original: visesito. Tasmā tassa pūjananamassanakiriyāya niyamitabbassa pūjetabbassa namassitabbassa
analyzed: tasmā tassa pūjana namassana kiriyāya niyamitabbassa pūjetabbassa namassitabbassa
translated: Therefore the meaning “to him who is to be worshipped, to him who is to be revered, to him who is to be honoured”

original: naravarassāti attho yuttova. Sesaniyamesu aññesupi eseva nayo. Etanti ācariyena vibhajitabbahāranayapaṭṭhānavicāraṇavisayabhūtassa
analyzed: nara varassa ti atthaḥ yuttaḥ iva sesa niyamesu aññesu pi esa iva nayaḥ etat ti ācariyena vibhajitabba hāra naya paṭṭhāna vicāraṇa visaya bhūtassa
translated: is appropriate. The same method applies to the other demonstrations. “To that” : the word “to that”

original: sāsanavaraparāmasanaṃ payogavantasabbanāmaṃ viggahavirahitaṃ.
analyzed: sāsana vara parāmasanam payogavanta sabba nāmam viggaha virahitam
translated: is a demonstrative pronoun without a case-ending. It refers to the best of the Dispensation, which is the subject of the teacher’s analysis, the method of exposition, and the consideration of the range .

original: Sāsati etenāti sāsanaṃ, etena navavidhasuttantena, navavidhasuttantasahitena vā varena
analyzed: etena ati sāsanam etena navavidha suttantena navavidha suttanta sahitena vā varena
translated: “By that” : the Dispensation is that by which one is instructed . By this ninefold Thread, or by the best together with the ninefold Thread,

original: sabbena samatthe veneyye diṭṭhadhammikasamparāyikaparamatthehi tividhayānamukhena
analyzed: sabbena samatthe veneyye diṭṭhadhammika samparāyika paramatthehi tividha yāna mukhena
translated: to all disciples who are fit, by the three means of conveyance which are the highest good in this life and the next,

original: yathārahaṃ satte sāsati anusāsati vineti. Iti sāsanānusāsanakiriyānusārena veneyyasattānaṃ🔽jānanapaṭipajjanādhigamassa kāraṇakaraṇattā “etenā”ti padena niddiṭṭhaṃ navavidhasuttantaṃ,
analyzed: yathāraham satte sāsati anusāsati vinā iti iti sāsana anusāsana kiriyā anusārena veneyya sattānam  jānana paṭipajjana adhigamassa kāraṇa karaṇa ttā etena ati padena niddiṭṭham navavidha suttantam
translated: and he teaches and instructs and trains them as they deserve. Thus the nine kinds of Thread, or the whole Blessed One’s True Ideal, together with the nine kinds of Thread, is called “the True Ideal as the act of teaching and instructing” because it is the cause of the act of teaching and instructing, which is the cause of the disciples’ knowing, undertaking, and finding out.

original: navavidhasuttantasahitaṃ vā varaṃ sabbaṃ sāsanaṃ nāma. Navavidhasuttantadesanāya
analyzed: navavidha suttanta sahitam vā varam sabbam sāsanam nāma navavidha suttanta desanāya
translated: The nine kinds of Thread are demonstrated by the words “by this” .

original: hi veneyyānaṃ jānanaṃ purimajānanena pacchimajānanaṃ, jānanena paṭipajjanena pacchimapaṭipajjanena🔽adhigamo, purimādhigamena pacchimādhigamo hoti. Tena vuttaṃ “saddhā sīlaṃ sutaṃ cāgo🔽paññā saddhāya sīlassa sutassa cāgassa paññāyā”ti ca “paṭhamassa jhānassa parikammaṃ
analyzed: hi veneyyānam jānanam purima jānanena pacchima jānanam jānanena paṭipajjanena pacchima paṭipajjanena  adhigamo purima adhigamena pacchima adhigamaḥ hoti tena vuttam saddhā sīlam sutam cāgo  paññā saddhāya sīlassa sutassa cāgassa paññāya ati ca paṭhamassa jhānassa parikammaṃ
translated: For by the teaching of the nine kinds of Thread disciples’ knowing is the prior knowing, their undertaking is the prior undertaking, their finding out is the prior finding out.🔽That is why it was said above “Faith, virtue, learning, generosity, and wisdom are the cause of faith, virtue, learning, generosity, and wisdom” , and “The preliminary work for the first jhana is the cause of the first jhana” , and so on.

original: paṭhamassa jhānassa”tyādi ca. Sāsadhātuyā desanāsaddo ca taṃjanako desanāñāṇasampayuttacittuppādo
analyzed: paṭhamassa jhānassa ti ādi ca desanā saddo ca taṃ janakaḥ desanā ñāṇa sampayutta cittuppādo
translated: And the word “teaching” in the phrase “the True Ideal as the act of teaching and instructing” is the occurrence of a consciousness associated with the knowledge of teaching that causes that.

original: ca mukhyattho, taṃupanissayapaccayā veneyyānaṃ atthajānanapaṭipajjanaadhigamanādi
analyzed: ca mukhya tthaḥ tad upanissaya paccayāḥ veneyyānam attha jānana paṭipajjana adhigamana ādi
translated: and the meaning of “cause” is the meaning of “condition” as the cause of the disciples’ understanding, practice, realization, etc., of the meaning of the teaching.

original: kāraṇūpacārattho, “etenā”ti padena vuttāya sāsanabhūtāya nāmapaññattiyā karaṇasattisaṅkhātā🔽upanissayapaccayasatti phalūpacārattho. Iti-saddopi tameva nāmapaññattiyā upanissayapaccayasattiṃ
analyzed: kāraṇa upacāra atthaḥ etena ati padena vuttāya sāsana bhūtāya nāma paññattiyā karaṇa satti saṅkhātā  upanissaya paccaya satti phala upacāra atthaḥ iti saddaḥ api tam eva nāma paññattiyā upanissaya paccaya sattim
translated: The meaning of “instrument” is the meaning of “condition” as the instrument of the name-group, which is the dispensation and is stated by the word “by this.”🔽The meaning of “fruit” is the meaning of “condition” as the fruit of the instrument of the name-group, which is the condition of the name-group as the basis of the instrument. The word “thus”

original: hetubhāvena parāmasati, tassā sattiyā ādhārabhūtā nāmapaññatti yu-paccayattho. Eseva
analyzed: hetu bhāvena parāmasati tassā sattiyāḥ ādhāra bhūtā nāma paññatti yu paccaya tthaḥ esa eva
translated: also refers to that instrument of the name-group as the condition of the name-group as the basis.

original: nayo tīsu piṭakesu evarūpesu ṭhānesu.🔽Ekantaniyyānaṭṭhena, anaññasādhāraṇaguṇatāya ca uttamaṭṭhena varaṃ uttamaṃ, pariyattisāsanamhi🔽phalaniyyādanato, magganiyyānahetubhāvato ca niyyānaṭṭhena, sāvakādīhi ajaniyattā
analyzed: tīsu piṭakesu evarūpesu ṭhānesu  ekanta niyyāna ṭhena anañña sādhāraṇa guṇatāya ca uttama ṭṭhena varam uttamam pariyatti sāsanamhi  phala niyyādanataḥ magga niyyāna hetu bhāvato ca niyyāna ṭṭhena sāvaka ādīhi
translated: This is the method in the three Piṭakas in such places.🔽The dispensation is “excellent” in the sense of “supreme” because it is the supreme refuge and because it is not shared by others. It is “excellent” in the sense of “supreme” because it is the supreme refuge and because it is not shared by others. In the dispensation of the texts,🔽because it is the outcome of fruition, and because it is the cause of the outcome of the path, it is “the outcome” . It is “excellent” in the sense of “supreme” because it is not shared by disciples, etc.,

original: asādhāraṇaṭṭhena ca uttamaṭṭhena varaṃ, varitabbanti vā varaṃ. Yathāvuttassa sāsanassa
analyzed: asādhāraṇa ṭṭhena ca uttama ṭṭhena varam varitabbanti vā varam yathā vuttassa sāsanassa
translated: and because it is supreme. It is “excellent” in the sense of “to be chosen” .

original: paṇḍitehi abhipatthitasamiddhihetutāya varitabbattā patthetabbattā sāsanavaraṃ nāma,
analyzed: paṇḍitehi abhipatthita samiddhi hetu tāya varitabba ttā patthetabba ttā sāsanavaram nāma
translated: Because it is to be desired, because it is to be sought, since it is the cause for the success that is desired by the wise, it is called the “best of teachings.”🔽Or alternatively, it is a teaching and it is the best, thus it is the best of teachings.

original: yathāvuttaṭṭhena vā sāsanañca taṃ varañcāti sāsanavaraṃ. Ca-saddena sattibhedaṃ,
analyzed: yathāvutta ṭṭhena vā sāsanam ca tam varam ca ati sāsanavaram ca saddena satti bhedam
translated: By the word “and” the sevenfold analysis is shown,

original: taṃ-saddena atthābhedaṃ desseti.
analyzed: tad saddena attha abhedam desseti
translated: by the word “that” the unity of meaning.

original: Vidantīti vidū. Ye paṇḍitā yathāsabhāvato kammakammaphalāni, kusalādibhede ca dhamme
analyzed: vidanti iti ye paṇḍitāḥ yathā sabhāvato kamma kamma phalāni kusala ādi bhede ca dhamme
translated: They are wise because they know. They are wise because they know the kamma, the kamma-result, and the states classed as profitable, etc., according to their true nature.🔽They are called wise because they know thus.

original: vidanti, iti vidanato te paṇḍitā vidū nāma, tehi. Ñātabbanti ñeyyaṃ. Ñā-dhātuyā nippariyāyato🔽ārammaṇikaṃ ñāṇaṃ vuttaṃ, ṭhānūpacārato sāsanavarassa ārammaṇapaccayabhāvo dassito,
analyzed: vidanti iti vidanataḥ te paṇḍitāḥ vidū nāma tehi ñātabbanti ñeyyam ñā dhātuyā  ārammaṇikam ñāṇam vuttam ṭhāna upacārato sāsana varassa ārammaṇa paccaya bhāvaḥ dassito
translated: It is to be known by them: it is knowable.🔽Knowledge is said to be the object-condition in the sense of being the proximate cause. The fact that the best of teachings is the object-condition is shown by the word “in.”

original: iti-saddena ārammaṇapaccayabhāvo parāmasito. Tassa iti-saddena parāmasitabbassa ārammaṇapaccayabhāvassa
analyzed: iti saddena ārammaṇa paccaya bhāvo parāmasito tassa iti saddena parāmasitabbassa ārammaṇa paccaya bhāvassa
translated: By the word “that” the fact that the knowable is the object-condition is referred to.🔽The best of teachings should be regarded as the basis for that fact that is referred to by the word “that” and is the meaning of the case-ending ṇya.

original: ādhāraṃ sāsanavaraṃ ṇya-paccayatthoti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Ñāṇaṃ arahatīti vā ñeyyaṃ, vidūnaṃ
analyzed: ādhāram sāsana varam daṭṭhabbam ñāṇam arahati iti vā ñeyyam vidūnam
translated: Or alternatively, it is knowable because it is worthy of knowledge by the wise.

original: ñāṇaṃ jānanaṃ ārammaṇabhāvena arahatīti attho. Imasmiṃ naye taddhitapadaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.🔽Narati netīti naro. Yo puriso attānaṃ itthīnaṃ uccaṭṭhānaṃ narati neti, iti naranato🔽nayanato so puriso naro nāma. So hi puttabhūtopi mātuyā pituṭṭhāne tiṭṭhati, kaniṭṭhabhātubhūtopi
analyzed: ñāṇam jānanam ārammaṇa bhāvena arahati iti attho imasmin naye taddhita padam daṭṭhabbam  narati neti iti naraḥ yaḥ purisaḥ attānam itthīnam uccaṭṭhānam narati neti iti nara nataḥ  nayanataḥ saḥ purisaḥ naraḥ nāma saḥ hi putta bhūtaḥ api mātuyā pitu ṭṭhāne tiṭṭhati kaniṭṭha bhātu bhūtaḥ api
translated: The meaning is that it is worthy of being known as the object. In this method the word taddhita should be seen.🔽A man is called a naro because he delights in and leads to women.🔽Because he delights in and leads to women, that man is called a naro. For even though he is a son, he stands in the place of a father to his mother, and even though he is a younger brother,

original: jeṭṭhabhaginīnaṃ pituṭṭhāne tiṭṭhati. Atha vā naritabbo netabboti naro. So hi jātakālato
analyzed: jeṭṭha bhaginīnam pitu ṭṭhāne tiṭṭhati atha vā naritabbaḥ netabbaḥ iti naraḥ saḥ hi jāta kālataḥ
translated: he stands in the place of a father to his elder sisters. Or else, he is called a naro because he should be delighted in and led. For from the time of his birth

original: paṭṭhāya yāva attano sabhāvena attānaṃ dhāretuṃ samattho na hoti, tāva parehi netabbo,
analyzed: paṭṭhāya yāva attanaḥ sabhāvena attānam dhāretum samatthaḥ na hoti tāva parehi netabbo
translated: until he is able to support himself by his own nature, he should be led by others,

original: na tathā añño tiracchānādikoti. Ettha pana satthuvisayatāya narati veneyyasatteti
analyzed: na tathā añño tiracchāna ādiko ti ettha pana satthu visaya tāya veneyya sattā iti
translated: and no other animal, etc., is like that. But here the meaning intended is that he delights in and leads to disciples by being the Teacher’s province.

original: naroti attho adhippeto. Satthā hi satte apāyādito sugatiṃ vā maggaphalanibbānaṃ vā
analyzed: narāḥ ti atthaḥ adhippetaḥ satthā hi satte apāyāt itas sugatim vā magga phala nibbānam vā
translated: For the Teacher leads beings from the planes of misery, etc., to a happy destiny, to the path, fruit, and Nibbāna.

original: netīti. Sabbaññutaññāṇādianekaguṇasamannāgatattā varo uttamo, varitabbo patthetabboti
analyzed: na iti iti sabbaññu taññāṇa ādi aneka guṇa samannāgata ttā varaḥ uttamaḥ varitabbo patthetabbo ti
translated: He is a varo because he is endowed with many special qualities such as omniscience, etc. He is to be chosen and desired.

original: vā varo, tilokaggo. Pakatiyā uccaṭṭhānaṭṭho naro guṇuttamena samannāgato varo, naro
analyzed: vā varaḥ tilokaggaḥ pakatiyā ucca ṭṭhāna ṭṭhaḥ naraḥ guṇa uttamena samannāgataḥ varaḥ naraḥ
translated: or a hero, or the best of men, or the best in the three worlds. A man who is endowed with the highest virtue is a hero,

original: ca so varo cāti naravaro. Ca-ta-saddānaṃ atthabhedo vuttova, visesanaparapadasamāsoyaṃ.
analyzed: ca saḥ varo ca ati naravaro attha bhedaḥ vuttaḥ iva visesana para pada samāsaḥ yam
translated: and he is a hero and the best of men, thus he is a hero, the best of men. The meaning of the words “ca” and “varo” has already been explained. This is a compound word in which the last word is distinguished.

original: Yena vuttaṃ “aggapuggalassāti attho”ti. Aññe pana “narānaṃ, naresu vā varoti naravaro”ti
analyzed: yena vuttam agga puggalassa ati attho ti aññe pana narānam naresu vā
translated: It has been said: “The meaning is: the best of men.” But others say: “The best of men is the best among men, or among those in the world of men.”

original: vadanti, taṃ vacanaṃ “aggapuggalassāti attho”ti aṭṭhakathāvacanena virujjhati maññe.
analyzed: vadanti tam vacanam agga puggalassa ati atthaḥ ti aṭṭhakathā vacanena virujjhati maññe
translated: That statement seems to contradict the commentary’s statement that the meaning is: “the best of men.”

original: Tassa naravarassāti. Iccevaṃ nettippakaraṇassa ādigāthāya samāsena ca vacanattho samatto.
analyzed: tassa nara varassa ati icca evam ādi gāthāya samāsena ca vacana atthaḥ samattaḥ
translated: “Of that hero, the best of men.” Thus the meaning of the compound word in the first verse of the Netti is finished.

original: Sarūpattho yojanatthavacanatthānusārena vijānitabbo. Tathāpi visuṃ suṭṭhu jānanatthāya
analyzed: sarūpa tthaḥ yojana attha vacana ttha anusārena vijānitabbaḥ tathā api visum suṭṭhu jānana tthāya
translated: The meaning of the word “ya” should be understood by the method of explanation of the meaning of the word “yojana” and the meaning of the word “vatthu.” Still, in order to understand it clearly,

original: puna vattabbo. “Ya”nti padassa anaññasādhāraṇasabbaññutaññāṇādianekaguṇasampanno
analyzed: puna vattabbaḥ yanti padassa anañña sādhāraṇa sabbaññuta ññāṇa ādi aneka guṇa sampannaḥ
translated: it should be stated again. The meaning of the word “ya” is: he who is endowed with many virtues such as the knowledge of omniscience that is not shared by others,

original: salokapālena lokena pūjetabbo ceva namassitabbo ca sāsanavaradesako tilokaggo sarūpattho.
analyzed: sa lokapālena lokena pūjetabbaḥ ca iva namassitabbaḥ ca sāsana vara desako ti lokaggo sarūpa attho
translated: who is to be worshipped and revered by the world with its gods, who is the leader of the best of teachings, who is the best in the three worlds.

original: “Loko”ti padassa yathāvuttalokapālasahito saddhācāgādisampanno sabbasattaloko sarūpattho.
analyzed: loko ti padassa yathā vutta lokapāla sahitaḥ saddhā cāga ādi sampanno sabba satta loko sarūpa atthaḥ
translated: The word “world” has as its primary meaning the entire world of beings endowed with faith, generosity, etc., together with the world-protectors mentioned above.

original: Lokasaddo ekavacanayuttopi jātisaddattā niravasesato satte saṅgaṇhāti yathā “mahājano”ti.🔽Kāmañcettha lokasaddo “lokavidū”tyādīsu saṅkhārabhājanesupi pavatto, pūjananamassanakiriyāsādhanattā
analyzed: loka saddo ekavacana yuttaḥ pi niravasesataḥ satte saṅgaṇhāti yathā  kāmam ca ittha loka saddaḥ loka vidūti ādīsu saṅkhāra bhājanesu pi pavatto pūjana namassana kiriyā sādhana ttā
translated: Although the word “world” is used in the singular, it includes all beings without exception, because it is a word for a class, just as the word “multitude” does.🔽Although the word “world” is also used for the world of formations, i.e., the physical universe, in such passages as “the knower of the worlds” , it is used here in the sense of the world of beings, because it is the world of beings that is fit to be worshipped and honoured.

original: pana sattalokeva vācakabhāvena pavattoti. Tenāha “pūjanakiriyāyogyabhūtatāvasenā”ti.
analyzed: pana satta lokā iva vācaka bhāvena tena āha pūjana kiriyā yogya bhūta tā vasena ati
translated: Therefore the commentator says that the word “world” is used in the sense of the world of beings “in the sense of fitness to be worshipped.”

original: Pūjayateti ettha pūjanakiriyāya mukhyato pūjanasaṅkhāto pūjentānaṃ cittuppādo sarūpattho,🔽phalūpacārena taṃcittuppādassa ārammaṇapakatūpanissayabhūtā vuttappakārā sabbe buddhaguṇā
analyzed: pūjayata iti ettha pūjana kiriyāya mukhyatas pūjana saṅkhātaḥ pūjentānam cittuppādaḥ sarūpa atthaḥ  phala upacārena tad cittuppādassa ārammaṇa pakatūpanissaya bhūtā vutta ppakārā sabbe buddha guṇā
translated: In the phrase “he is worshipped,” the primary meaning is the mental act of worshipping, i.e., the thought of worshipping that arises in the minds of those who worship.🔽The qualities of the Buddha, which are the object of that thought of worshipping, are the primary meaning by metonymy.

original: sarūpatthā. Te-vibhattipaccayassa pūjanakiriyāsādhako vuttappakāro loko ca sarūpattho,
analyzed: sarūpa tthā te vibhatti paccayassa pūjana kiriyā sādhakaḥ vutta ppakāraḥ loko ca sarūpa ttho
translated: The world, which is the condition for the mental act of worshipping by means of the instrumental case-relation, is the primary meaning by metonymy.

original: evaṃ sati atthabhedābhāvato dvīsu vācakesu ekova vācako vattabbo, kasmā ekasmiṃ atthe
analyzed: evam sati attha bheda abhāvataḥ dvīsu vācakesu ekaḥ iva vācakaḥ vattabbaḥ kasmai ekasmin atthe
translated: If that is so, then because there is no difference in meaning, only one of the two words should be used, why two?

original: dve vācakā vuttāti? Nāyaṃ doso dvinnaṃ vācakānaṃ sāmaññavisesavācakattā. Lokasaddo🔽hi pūjanakiriyāsādhako, aññakiriyāsādhako ca vadatīti sāmaññavācako ca hoti. Pūjayate-saddo
analyzed: dve vācakā vuttā ati na ayam dosaḥ dvinnam vācakānam sāmañña visesa vācaka ttā loka saddo  hi pūjana kiriyā sādhako añña kiriyā sādhako ca vadati iti sāmañña vācako ca hoti pūjayate saddo
translated: If that is so, then, because there is no difference in meaning, only one word should be used for the two meanings. Why are there two words for one meaning? —There is no fault here, because the two words express the general and particular.🔽For the word “world” expresses the act of worshipping and the act of doing something else, so it is a word for the general.

original: lokapūjanaitthipūjanapurisapūjanatiracchānapūjanādikiriyāsādhakañca vadatīti sāmaññavācako.
analyzed: loka pūjana aitthi pūjana purisa pūjana tiracchāna pūjana ādi kiriyā sādhakam ca vadati iti sāmañña vācakaḥ
translated: The word “worships” expresses the act of worshipping the world, the act of worshipping a woman, the act of worshipping a man, the act of worshipping an animal, and so on, so it is a word for the general.

original: Tasmā pūjayate-saddo lokasaddassa sarūpattho, pūjanakiriyāsādhako ca na aññakiriyāsādhakoti🔽niyameti. Lokasaddo ca pūjayatesaddassa sarūpattho pūjanakiriyāsādhako. Loko pana
analyzed: tasmā pūjayate saddo loka saddassa sarūpa ttho pūjana kiriyā sādhako ca na añña kiriyā sādhako ti  niyama iti loka saddo ca pūjayate saddassa sarūpa attho pūjana kiriyā sādhakaḥ
translated: So the word “worships” determines the meaning of the word “world” as having the same form and as expressing the act of worshipping, not the act of doing something else.

original: pūjanakiriyāsādhako itthipurisatiracchānādikoti niyameti. Tīsu piṭakesu aññesupi
analyzed: pūjana kiriyā sādhako itthi purisa tiracchāna ādiko ti niyameti tīsu piṭakesu aññesu pi
translated: And the word “world” determines the meaning of the word “worships” as having the same form and as expressing the act of worshipping. But the world is determined as the act of worshipping, and as a woman, a man, an animal, and so on.

original: evarūpesu ṭhānesu eseva nayo.
analyzed: evarūpesu ṭhānesu esā iva nayo
translated: This is the method in the three Piṭakas and in other such instances.

original: “Salokapālo”ti padassa yathāvuttaseṭṭhalokapālasahagato, pūjananamassanakiriyāsādhako
analyzed: sa lokapālo ti padassa yathā vutta seṭṭha lokapāla sahagato pūjana namassana kiriyā sādhako
translated: The word “world-protectors” has as its primary meaning the group of beings who are the accomplishes of the act of worshipping and paying homage together with the aforementioned excellent world-protectors.

original: ca sattanikāyo sarūpattho. “Sadā”ti padassa rattidivasakālo atītabhagavato dharamānakālo
analyzed: ca satta nikāyaḥ sarūpa atthaḥ padassa ratti divasa kālaḥ atīta bhagavataḥ dharamāna kālaḥ
translated: The word “always” has as its primary meaning the time of night and day, the time of the past Buddha, the time of the present Buddha,

original: tato parakālo abhinīhārato yāva sāsanantaradhānā kālo tato parakālo sarūpattho. So
analyzed: tatas parakālaḥ abhinīhārataḥ yāva kālo tatas parakālo sarūpattho so
translated: the time after that, the time from the making of the aspiration up to the disappearance of the Dispensation, and the time after that.

original: pana anāgatabuddhuppajjanakālo atītasammāsambuddhe idāni pūjayanti namassanti viya
analyzed: pana anāgata buddha uppajjana kālaḥ atīta sammāsambuddhe idāni pūjayanti namassanti viya
translated: But that is the time of the arising of future Buddhas, and it is as if they were worshipping and paying homage to the past Fully Enlightened Ones now.

original: pūjayissati ceva namassissati ca. Namassatīti ettha namassanakiriyāya mukhyato namassanasaṅkhāto🔽cittuppādo sarūpattho, phalūpacārena taṃcittuppādassa ārammaṇapakatūpanissayabhūtā🔽vuttappakārā sabbe buddhaguṇā sarūpattho. Ti-vibhattipaccayassa namassanakiriyāsādhako
analyzed: pūjayissati ca iva namassissati ca namassati iti ettha namassana kiriyāya mukhyatas namassana saṅkhātaḥ  cittuppādo sarūpa atthaḥ phala upacārena tad cittuppādassa ārammaṇa pakatūpanissaya bhūtā  vutta ppakārā sabbe buddha guṇā sarūpa tthaḥ ti vibhatti paccayassa namassana kiriyā sādhako
translated: They will worship and pay homage. In the word “paying homage” the primary meaning is the mental state called “paying homage,” which is the mental state of paying homage.🔽The primary meaning is the aforementioned qualities of the Buddha, which are the object and the decisive support of that mental state, by way of figurative application of the result.🔽The word “world” has as its primary meaning the aforementioned group of beings, which is the accomplisher of the act of paying homage, and the condition for the locative case.

original: yathāvuttasattanikāyo loko ca sarūpattho, atthabhedābhāvepi dvinnaṃ vācakānaṃ pavattabhāvo
analyzed: yathā vutta satta nikāyaḥ loko ca sarūpa atthaḥ attha bheda abhāve pi dvinnam vācakānam pavatta bhāvo
translated: Even though there is no difference in meaning, the two expressions occur in order to show the difference in the words.

original: heṭṭhā vuttova. “Cā”ti padassa idhekacco pūjentopi na namassati, namassantopi na
analyzed: heṭṭhā vuttaḥ uva ca ati padassa idha ekacco pūjentaḥ api na namassati namassantaḥ api na
translated: as stated above. “Cā” means that some people worship but do not pay homage, and some pay homage but do not worship.

original: pūjeti ca, ayaṃ pana sattanikāyo loko pūjayati ceva namassati cāti samuccayattho sarūpattho.
analyzed: pūjā iti ca ayam pana satta nikāyaḥ loko pūjayati ca iva namassati ca ati samuccaya ttho sarūpa ttho
translated: as stated above. “Cā” means that some people worship but do not revere, and some people revere but do not worship, but this world of living beings both worships and reveres. The meaning of “cā” is the meaning of “and.”

original: Tassāti ettha taṃ-saddassa sabbaññutaññāṇādianekaguṇasamannāgato pūjetabbo namassitabbo🔽tilokaggo satthā sarūpattho, chaṭṭhīvibhattiyā janakassa naravarassa jaññena sāsanavarena
analyzed: tassa ti ettha taṃ saddassa sabbaññu taññāṇa ādi aneka guṇa samannāgato pūjetabbaḥ namassitabbaḥ  tilokaggaḥ satthā sarūpa atthaḥ chaṭṭhī vibhattiyā janakassa nara varassa jaññena sāsana varena
translated: “Tassā” means that the Teacher, the Foremost in the World, who is endowed with the many qualities such as omniscient knowledge, is worthy of worship and reverence.🔽The meaning of “tassā” is the meaning of “his.” The connection between the Teacher, the Foremost in the World, who is the father of knowledge and the True Dhamma,

original: sambandho padhānasarūpattho, jaññasāsanavarassa janakena naravarena sambandho apadhānasarūpattho.
analyzed: sambandhaḥ padhāna sarūpa atthaḥ jañña sāsana varassa janakena nara varena sambandhaḥ apadhāna sarūpa atthaḥ
translated: and the Foremost in the World, the father of men, by means of the sixth case ending is the meaning of “padhāna.” The connection between the Foremost in the World, the father of men, and the Teacher, the Foremost in the World, who is the father of knowledge and the True Dhamma, by means of the sixth case ending is the meaning of “apadhāna.”

original: Tīsu piṭakesu evarūpesu aññesupi eseva nayo.🔽“Eta”nti padassa ācariyena vibhajitabbahāranayapaṭṭhānavicāraṇavisayabhūtaṃ sāsanaṃ
analyzed: tīsu piṭakesu evarūpesu aññesu pi esa iva nayo  etat ti padassa ācariyena vibhajitabba hāra naya paṭṭhāna vicāraṇa visaya bhūtam sāsanam
translated: This is the method in the three Piṭakas and in other such cases.🔽“Eta” means the Dispensation, which is the subject of the Teacher’s method of analysis, the method of establishing the method of analysis, and the method of investigation.

original: sarūpattho. “Sāsanavara”nti padassāpi tameva sarūpattho, etaṃ sāsanavaraṃ pariyattipaṭipattipaṭivedhabhedena
analyzed: sarūpa atthaḥ sāsana varanti padassa api tam eva etam sāsana varam pariyatti paṭipatti paṭivedha bhedena
translated: The meaning of “eta” is the meaning of “this.” “Sāsanavara” also means “this,” and the meaning of “sāsanavara” is the meaning of “the Foremost in the Dispensation.” This Foremost in the Dispensation, which is divided into the learning, the practice, and the penetration,

original: tividhampi pariyattisāsanameva sabbasāsanamūlabhūtattā, nettippakaraṇassa visayabhūtattā
analyzed: tividham pi pariyatti sāsanam eva sabba sāsana mūla bhūta ttā visaya bhūta ttā
translated: The three-part is the tradition of the scriptures, which is the root of all the tradition, and is the province of the Guide.

original: ca visesato adhippetaṃ tassa mūlabhūtabhāvato vinayasaṃvaṇṇanādīsu bahūpakārena dassitoti
analyzed: ca visesataḥ adhippetam tassa mūla bhūta bhāvataḥ vinaya saṃvaṇṇanā ādīsu bahu upakārena dassitā ti
translated: It is intended in particular, because it is the root of the other two. It is shown to be of great help in the commentaries on the Vinaya, etc.

original: amhehi na vattabbo. Vadantopi aññaṃ racitabbaṃ racituṃ asamatthova hutvā vadatīti gahitabbo vadeyya.
analyzed: amhehi na vattabbaḥ vadantaḥ api aññam racitabbam racitum asamatthaḥ iva hutvā vadati iti gahitabbaḥ vadeyya
translated: So it should not be said by us. If anyone does say it, he should be understood to be saying it because he is unable to compose anything else.

original: Taṃ pana pariyattisāsanaṃ vimuttirasavasena ekavidhaṃ, dhammavinayavasena duvidhaṃ,
analyzed: tam pana pariyatti sāsanam vimutti rasa vasena ekavidham dhamma vinaya vasena duvidham
translated: But that tradition of the scriptures is of one kind as the plane of deliverance, of two kinds as Dhamma and Discipline,🔽of three kinds as the Vinaya Piṭaka, the Sutta Piṭaka, and the Abhidhamma Piṭaka,

original: vinayapiṭakasuttantapiṭakaabhidhammapiṭakavasena tividhaṃ, āṇādesanāvohāradesanāparamatthadesanāvasena
analyzed: vinaya piṭaka suttanta piṭaka abhidhamma piṭaka vasena tividham āṇā desanā vohāra desanā paramattha desanā vasena
translated: of three kinds as the teaching of injunction, the teaching of exposition, and the teaching of ultimate meaning,

original: tividhaṃ, yathāparādhasāsanāyathānulomasāsanāyathādhammasāsanābhedenapi tividhaṃ,
analyzed: tividham tividham
translated: of three kinds also as the teaching of punishment according to offence, the teaching of instruction according to temperament, and the teaching of the True Idea according to rule,

original: saṃvarāsaṃvarakathādiṭṭhiviniveṭhanakathānāmarūpaparicchedakathābhedenapi tividhaṃ.
analyzed: tividham
translated: and of three kinds also as the talk on restraint and non-restraint, the talk on the removal of views, and the talk on the analysis of mind and bodily form.

original: Ettha ca desanā desakādhīnā, sāsanaṃ sāsitabbāyattaṃ, kathā kathetabbatthāpekkhāti🔽viseso. Dīghanikāyo, majjhimanikāyo, saṃyuttanikāyo, aṅguttaranikāyo, khuddakanikāyoti
analyzed: ettha ca desanā desaka adhīnā sāsanam sāsitabba āyattam kathā kathetabba attha apekkhā ati  visesaḥ dīgha nikāyaḥ majjhima nikāyaḥ saṃyutta nikāyaḥ aṅguttara nikāyo khuddaka nikāyo ti
translated: And here the difference is this. The Teaching is dependent on the country, the Dispensation is dependent on those who are to be trained, and the talk is dependent on the subject to be talked about.🔽It is of five kinds as divided into the Long Collection, the Middle-Length Collection, the Connected Discourses, the Numerical Discourses, and the Minor Collection.

original: nikāyabhedena pana pañcavidhaṃ; suttageyyaveyyākaraṇagāthāudānaitivuttakajātakaabbhutadhammavedallabhedena
analyzed: nikāya bhedena pana pañcavidham sutta geyya veyyākaraṇa gāthā udāna etivuttaka jātaka abbhuta dhamma vedalla bhedena
translated: It is of nine kinds as divided into discourses in prose, mixed prose and verse, expositions, verses, utterances, those with stories, tales of past lives, great stories, and “thus was it said” .

original: pana navavidhaṃ; dhammakkhandhabhedena pana caturāsītidhammakkhandhasahassavidhaṃ;
analyzed: pana navavidham dhammakkhandha bhedena pana caturāsīti dhammakkhandha sahassavidham
translated: It is of eighty-four thousand kinds as divided into the eighty-four thousand divisions of the True Idea.🔽It is of four unmixed kinds as consisting of what is associated with corruption, what is associated with the profitable, what is associated with penetration, and what is associated with the adept.

original: “saṃkilesabhāgiyavāsanābhāgiyanibbedhabhāgiyaasekkhabhāgiyāti amissāni cattāri; saṃkilesabhāgiyavāsanābhāgiyasaṃkilesabhāgiyanibbedha
analyzed: saṃkilesa bhāgiya vāsanā bhāgiya nibbedha bhāgiya asekkha bhāgiyā ati amissāni cattāri saṃkilesa bhāgiya vāsanā bhāgiya saṃkilesa bhāgiya nibbedha
translated: It is of four mixed pairs of two kinds as consisting of what is associated with corruption and what is associated with the profitable, what is associated with corruption and what is associated with penetration, what is associated with corruption and what is associated with the adept, and what is associated with the profitable and what is associated with penetration.

original: bhāgiyasaṃkilesabhāgiyaasekkhabhāgiyavāsanābhāgiyanibbedhabhāgiyāti missakadukāni🔽cattāri; saṃkilesabhāgiyavāsanābhāgiyaasekkhabhāgiyasaṃkilesabhāgiyavāsanā bhāgiyanibbedhabhāgiyāti
analyzed: bhāgiya saṃkilesa bhāgiya asekkha bhāgiya vāsanā bhāgiya nibbedha bhāgiyā ati missaka dukāni 🔽cattāri saṃkilesa bhāgiya vāsanā bhāgiya asekkha bhāgiya saṃkilesa bhāgiya vāsanā bhāgiya nibbedha bhāgiyā ati
