translated: It is of three mixed kinds as consisting of what is associated with corruption, what is associated with the profitable, and what is associated with penetration; what is associated with corruption, what is associated with the profitable, and what is associated with the adept; and what is associated with corruption, what is associated with the profitable, and what is associated with the adept.

original: missakatikāni dve; taṇhāsaṃkilesadiṭṭhisaṃkilesaduccaritasaṃkilesataṇhāvodānabhāgiyadiṭṭhiva-🔽udānabhāgiyaduccaritavodānabhāgiyātichā”ti soḷasannaṃ suttānaṃ bhedena soḷasavidhaṃ;🔽“lokiyalokuttaralokiyalokuttarasattādhiṭṭhānadhammādhiṭṭhānasattadhammādhiṭṭhānañāṇañeyya-🔽ñāṇañeyyadassanabhāvanādassanabhāvanāsakavacanaparavacanasakavacanaparavacana vissajjanīyaavissajjanīyavissajjanīyaavissajjanīyakammavipākakammavipākakusala
analyzed: missakatikāni dve taṇhā saṃkilesa diṭṭhi saṃkilesa duccarita saṃkilesa taṇhā vodāna bhāgiya diṭṭhi va  soḷasannam suttānam bhedena soḷasavidham  lokiya lokuttara lokiya lokuttara satta adhiṭṭhāna dhamma adhiṭṭhāna satta dhamma adhiṭṭhāna ñāṇa ñeyya  ñāṇa ñeyya dassana bhāvanā dassana bhāvanā sakavacana paravacana sakavacana paravacana vissajjanīya a vissajjanīya vissajjanīya a vissajjanīya kamma vipāka kamma vipāka kusala

original: sati paṭipattipaṭivedhasaṅkhātaṃ sāsanadvayampi tammūlakattā visayaṃ hoti pariyāyatoti daṭṭhabbaṃ.🔽“Vidūhī”ti padassa yathāvuttasāsanavarassa saparasantānapavattanapavattāpanādivasena
analyzed: sati paṭipatti paṭivedha saṅkhātam sāsana dvayam pi tad mūlaka ttā visayam hoti pariyāyato ti daṭṭhabbam  vidūhi iti padassa yathāvutta sāsana varassa sa para santāna pavattana pavattāpana ādi vasena
translated: And the two kinds of dispensation consisting in the practice and the penetration of the truth are the province of the verse, in the sense that they are rooted in it, by implication.🔽The word “knower” is the literal meaning of the word “vidū” .🔽The “knower” is a good worldling, a stream-enterer, etc., who is capable of knowing the excellent dispensation as described above, by causing it to occur and to cease in his own and others’ mental continuums, etc.,

original: vijānanasamattho saṇhasukhumañāṇādiguṇasampanno kalyāṇaputhujjanasotāpannādiko puggalo
analyzed: vijānana samatthaḥ saṇha sukhuma ñāṇa ādi guṇa sampanno kalyāṇa puthujjana sotāpanna ādiko puggalo
translated: and who is endowed with the qualities of subtle and refined knowledge, etc.🔽The word “knowable” is the literal meaning of the word “ñeyya” .

original: sarūpattho. “Ñeyya”nti padassa tādisehi vidūhi saṇhasukhumañāṇādinā vijānitabbaṃ
analyzed: sarūpa atthaḥ ñeyya nti padassa tādisehi vidūhi saṇha sukhuma ñāṇa ādinā vijānitabbam
translated: The excellent dispensation is to be known by such knowers by means of subtle and refined knowledge, etc.

original: sāsanavaraṃ sarūpattho. “Naravarassā”ti padassa ekavidhādibhedassa sāsanavarassa
analyzed: sāsana varam sarūpa atthaḥ nara varassa ati padassa ekavidha ādi bhedassa sāsana varassa
translated: The word “best of men” is the literal meaning of the word “naravarassa” .

original: janako anekaguṇasampanno tilokaggo sarūpattho. Iccevaṃ nettiyā ādigāthāya sarūpattho🔽saṅkhepena vijānitabbo.
analyzed: janakaḥ aneka guṇa sampanno ti loka ggo sarūpa attho icc evam nettiyā ādi gāthāya sarūpa atthaḥ  saṅkhepena vijānitabbaḥ
translated: The one who gives birth to the excellent dispensation of the one kind, etc., is endowed with many qualities and is the foremost in the three worlds.🔽Thus the literal meaning of the first verse of the guide line should be known in brief.

original: Evaṃ tassā anusandhyādīnaṃ jānitabbabhāve satipi ajānanto viya pucchitvā dosaṃ āropetvā
analyzed: evam tassāḥ anusandhyā ādīnam jānitabba bhāve a jānantaḥ viya pucchitvā dosam āropetvā
translated: Although the connection, etc., of the verse should be known, the commentator, as if not knowing them, asks a question and attributes a fault to himself.

original: parihāravasenāpi gambhīrādhippāyassa anākulassa visesajānanaṃ bhavissati. Tasmā pucchitvā
analyzed: parihāra vasena api gambhīra adhippāyassa an ākulassa visesa jānanam bhavissati tasmai pucchitvā
translated: and by way of reply he will understand the distinction between the profound and the shallow. Therefore, after asking,

original: dosaṃ ropetvā parihāravasena gambhīrādhippāyaṃ sampiṇḍetvā kathayissaṃ. Amhākācariya
analyzed: dosam ropetvā parihāra vasena gambhīra adhippāyam sampiṇḍetvā kathayissam amhākā cariya
translated: I will make a reply and will explain the profound and the shallow by way of reply.🔽What is the purpose of the teacher’s saying “What the world worships”?

original: kimatthaṃ “yaṃ loko”tyādimāha? Nettippakaraṇaṃ kātuṃ. Evaṃ sati nettippakaraṇabhūtaṃ🔽“soḷasahārā netti”tyādikaṃ eva vattabbaṃ, kasmā taṃ avatvā tato nettippakaraṇato
analyzed: kimattham yam loka uti ādim āha kātum evam sati  eva vattabbam kasmā tam a vatvā tatas netti pakaraṇato
translated: To compose the Netti-Pakaraṇa. If that is so,🔽then he should have said only “The sixteen kinds of guidance are the Netti” and so on, which is the Netti-Pakaraṇa. Why did he not say that, but instead said “What the world worships” and so on, which is different from the Netti-Pakaraṇa?

original: aññaṃ “yaṃ loko pūjayate”tyādimāha. Seyyathāpi samuddaṃ gacchanto himavantaṃ gacchati,
analyzed: aññam yam pūjayata ityādim āha sā iyyathā api samuddam gacchantaḥ himavantam gacchati
translated: Just as one who goes to the ocean goes to the Himalayas,

original: himavantaṃ gacchanto samuddaṃ gacchati, evameva nettippakaraṇaṃ karonto sāsanavaradassanaṃ🔽karotīti? Saccaṃ, tathāpi yassa saṃvaṇṇanaṃ nettippakaraṇaṃ kātukāmo taṃ sāsanavaraṃ
analyzed: himavantam gacchantaḥ samuddam gacchati evam eva netti pakaraṇam karontaḥ sāsana vara dassanam  karoti iti saccam tathā api yassa saṃvaṇṇanam na itthi pakaraṇam kātu kāmaḥ tam sāsana varam
translated: and one who goes to the Himalayas goes to the ocean, so too, one who composes the Netti-Pakaraṇa composes the excellent vision of the Dispensation?🔽That is true, but still, in order to compose the Netti-Pakaraṇa, which is a description of that, he said “What the world worships” and so on, in order to show first that excellent Dispensation. If that is so,

original: paṭhamaṃ dassetuṃ “yaṃ loko”tyādimāha. Evaṃ sati “etaṃ sāsanavara”nti ettakameva
analyzed: paṭhamam dassetum yam loka uti ādim āha evam sati etam ettakam eva
translated: then he should have said only “This is the excellent Dispensation” and so on,

original: vattabbaṃ, kasmā “yaṃ loko”tyādi vuttanti? Taṃ sāsanavaraṃ janakena naravarena niyametvā
analyzed: vattabbam kasmā yam loka utyādi vuttan ti tam sāsana varam janakena nara varena niyametvā
translated: Why is it said thus? It was said thus in order to make the people to praise the excellent teaching of the king.

original: thometuṃ vuttaṃ. Tathāpi “tassa naravarassā”ti ettakameva vattabbaṃ, kasmā “yaṃ loko”tyādi
analyzed: thometum vuttam tathā api tassa nara varassa ati ettakam eva vattabbam kasmā yam loka utyādi
translated: Even so, it is enough to say thus: “Of that king of men” . Why is it said thus?

original: vuttanti? Taṃ janakaṃ naravaraṃ lokapālena lokaseṭṭhena saddhiṃ sabbena lokena pūjanīyanamassanīyabhāvena
analyzed: vuttam ti tam janakam nara varam lokapālena loka seṭṭhena saddhim sabbena lokena pūjanīya namassanīya bhāvena
translated: It was said thus in order to make the people to praise the king who is worthy of being worshipped and respected by the whole world together with the guardian deities of the world, the best of the world.

original: thometuṃ “yaṃ loko”tyādi vuttaṃ. Pūjentāpi vanditvā pūjenti, tasmā “pūjayate”ti ettakameva
analyzed: yam vuttam pūjenta api vanditvā pūjenti tasmā pūjayata iti ettakam eva
translated: Even though they worship, they worship after paying homage to him. Therefore, it is enough to say thus: “He worships” .

original: vattabbanti? Tathāpi keci kesañci pūjāsakkārādīni karontāpi tesaṃ apākaṭaguṇatāya🔽namakkāraṃ na karonti. Evaṃ bhagavato yathābhūtaabbhuggatasaddatāya pana bhagavantaṃ
analyzed: vattabbanti tathā api keci pūjā sakkāra ādīni karontā api tesam apākaṭa guṇa tāya  namakkāram na karonti evam bhagavataḥ yathā bhūta abbhut gata saddatāya pana bhagavantam
translated: Even so, some people, though they do some service of worship and honour to some, do not pay homage to them because of their not being well-known in their virtues.🔽Thus, however, the Blessed One, though he worships the Blessed One after paying homage to him, pays homage to him in order to show that the Blessed One is well-known in his virtues. Therefore, it is said thus: “He pays homage to him” .

original: pūjetvāpi vandatiyevāti dassetuṃ “namassati cā”ti vuttaṃ. Pūjento, namassanto ca
analyzed: pūjetvā api vandatiyā iva iti dassetum namassati ca ati vuttam pūjentaḥ namassantaḥ ca
translated: He worships and pays homage to him.

original: na kadāciyeva, atha kho sabbakālanti dassetuṃ “sadā”ti vuttaṃ. Tādisassa naravarassa
analyzed: na kadāciyeva atha kho sabba kālan ti dassetum sadā iti vuttam tādisassa nara varassa
translated: Such a one, a supreme man,

original: tādisaṃ sāsanavaraṃ saṇhasukhumañāṇasampannehi vidūheva sukhumañāṇeneva ñeyyanti
analyzed: tādisam sāsana varam saṇha sukhuma ñāṇa sampannehi vidūha iva sukhuma ñāṇena iva
translated: Such a supreme teaching is to be known only by the wise, by those who have attained subtle knowledge, by means of their subtle knowledge.

original: sāsanavaraṃ thometuṃ “vidūhi ñeyya”nti vuttaṃ.🔽Ettha ca “pūjayate, namassatī”ti etehi pūjananamassanakiriyāya hetubhūtā sabbaññutaññāṇādayo
analyzed: sāsana varam thometum vidūhi ñeyyan ti vuttam  ettha ca pūjayate namassati iti etehi pūjana namassana kiriyāya hetu bhūtā sabbaññu taññāṇa ādayaḥ
translated: In order to extol the supreme teaching, it is said: “By the wise it is to be known.”🔽And here, by the words “he worships, he honours,” the many worldly and supramundane virtues such as the knowledge of omniscience, which are the causes of the act of worship and honour,

original: aneke lokiyalokuttaraguṇā pakāsitā honti te guṇe āgamma sabbalokassa pūjananamassanacetanāya🔽pavattanato. Tesu hi kiñci sarūpato, kiñci anumānato sāriputtattherādayo anussaranti,
analyzed: aneke lokiya lokuttara guṇā pakāsitāḥ honti te guṇe āgamma sabba lokassa pūjana namassana cetanāya  pavattanato tesu hi kiñci sarūpataḥ kiñci anumānato sāriputta thera ādayaḥ anussaranti
translated: are revealed. Because the intention to worship and honour all the world arises on the basis of those virtues. For some of them, such as the Elder Sāriputta, remember them as they really are;🔽some remember them by inference. They worship and honour them. Therefore it is said: “Remember the Enlightened One.”

original: pūjenti, namassanti. Tena vuttaṃ “anussaretha sambuddha”nti. Ekadesaguṇāpi pūjārahā
analyzed: pūjenti namassanti tena vuttam anussaretha sambuddham ti eka desa guṇā api pūjā rahā
translated: Even one who possesses only a fraction of the virtues is worthy of worship and honour.

original: namassanārahā, kasmā sabbepi guṇā pakāsitāti? Sabbaguṇadassanena bodhisambhārasambharaṇamahākaruṇāyogasaṅkhātahetuñāṇapahāna-
analyzed: namassanā rahā kasmā sabbe api guṇā pakāsitā ati sabba guṇa dassanena bodhi sambhāra sambharaṇa mahā karuṇā yoga saṅkhāta hetu ñāṇa pahāna
translated: Why are all the virtues revealed? Because the seeing of all the virtues is the cause for the accumulation of the requisites for enlightenment and for the practice of great compassion. The virtues are revealed in order to show the cause for the abandonment of ignorance and the acquisition of knowledge.

original: ānubhāvarūpakāyasampattisaṅkhātaphalahitajjhāsayindriya- pākakālāgamanadesanāñāṇasaṅkhātasattu-
analyzed: ānubhāva rūpa kāya sampatti saṅkhāta phala hita jjhā say indriya pāka kāla āgamana desanā ñāṇa saṅkhāta sattu
translated: The greatness of the Buddha’s own welfare and the greatness of his welfare for others are shown by the greatness of his own attainment and the greatness of his attainment for others.🔽The greatness of his own attainment is shown by the greatness of his own welfare and the greatness of his welfare for others.🔽The greatness of his attainment for others is shown by the greatness of his own welfare and the greatness of his welfare for others.

original: pakārasampadāvasena thomanā dassitā. Tena attahitapaṭipatti, parahitapaṭipatti ca🔽nirupakkilesūpagamanāpagamanañca lokasamaññānupapavatti, tadanatidhāvanañca caraṇasampatti,
analyzed: pakāra sampadā avasena thomanā dassitā tena atta hita paṭipatti para hita paṭipatti ca  nirupakkilesu upagamana apagamanañca loka samaññā anupapavatti tad anatidhāvanañca caraṇa sampatti
translated: The greatness of his own welfare is shown by the greatness of his own attainment and the greatness of his attainment for others.🔽The greatness of his welfare for others is shown by the greatness of his own attainment and the greatness of his attainment for others.🔽The greatness of his own attainment is shown by the greatness of his own welfare and the greatness of his welfare for others.🔽The greatness of his attainment for others is shown by the greatness of his own attainment and the greatness of his attainment for others.

original: vijjāsampatti ca attādhipatitā, dhammādhipatitā ca lokanāthaattanāthatā ca pubbakārikataññutā
analyzed: vijjā sampatti ca atta adhipati tā dhamma adhipati tā ca loka nātha atta nātha tā ca pubba kārikataññu tā
translated: The greatness of his own attainment is shown by the greatness of his own welfare and the greatness of his welfare for others.🔽The greatness of his attainment for others is shown by the greatness of his own attainment and the greatness of his attainment for others.🔽The greatness of his own attainment is shown by the greatness of his own welfare and the greatness of his welfare for others.

original: ca aparantapatā, anattantapatā ca buddhakaraṇadhammabuddhabhāvasiddhi ca paratāraṇaattatāraṇañca🔽sattānuggahacittatā, dhammavirattacittatā ca pakāsitā bhavanti. Tena sabbappakārena
analyzed: ca aparantapa tā anattantapa tā ca buddha karaṇa dhamma buddha bhāva siddhi ca paratāraṇa attatāraṇam ca  satta anuggaha citta tā dhamma viratta citta tā ca pakāsitāḥ bhavanti tena sabba ppakārena
translated: The greatness of his attainment for others is shown by the greatness of his own attainment and the greatness of his attainment for others.🔽The greatness of his own attainment is shown by the greatness of his own welfare and the greatness of his welfare for others.🔽The greatness of his attainment for others is shown by the greatness of his own attainment and the greatness of his attainment for others.🔽The greatness of his own attainment is shown by the greatness of his own welfare and the greatness of his welfare for others.🔽The greatness of his attainment for others is shown by the greatness of his own attainment and the greatness of his attainment for others.🔽The greatness of his own attainment is shown by the greatness of his own welfare and the greatness of his welfare for others.🔽The greatness of his attainment for others is shown by the greatness of his own attainment and the greatness of his attainment for others.🔽The greatness of his own attainment is shown by the greatness of his own welfare and the greatness of his welfare for others.🔽The greatness of his attainment for others is shown by the greatness of his own attainment and the greatness of his attainment for others.

original: anuttaradakkhiṇeyyatāuttamapūjanīyanamassanīyabhāvapūjananamassanakiriyāya ca khettaṅgatabhāvaṃ
analyzed: anuttara dakkhiṇeyya tā auttama pūjanīya namassanīya bhāva pūjana namassana kiriyāya ca khettaṅgata bhāvam
translated: The greatness of his own attainment is shown by the greatness of his own welfare and the

original: pakāseti. Tena pūjanakanamassanakānaṃ yathicchitabbapayojanasampatti pakāsitāti sabbaguṇā pakāsitāti.
analyzed: pakāseti tena pūjanaka namassanakānam yathā icchitabba payojana sampatti pakāsitā ati sabba guṇā pakāsitā ati
translated: and so the fulfilment of the purpose of the worship and reverence is shown as desired.

original: Ādikalyāṇatādiguṇasampattiyā varaṃ aggaṃ uttamaṃ, nipuṇañāṇagocaratāya paṇḍitavedanīyañca,
analyzed: ādi kalyāṇa tā ādi guṇa sampattiyāḥ varam aggam uttamam nipuṇa ñāṇa gocara tāya paṇḍita vedanīyam ca
translated: It is the best, the foremost, the highest, and it is to be known by the wise because it is the province of subtle knowledge.

original: tasmā “varaṃ ñeyya”nti vacanehi svākkhātatādayo sabbe dhammaguṇā pakāsitā. Ariyasaccapaṭivedhena🔽samugghātakilesasammohāyeva paramatthato paṇḍitā bālyādisamatikkamanato, tasmā bhāvitalokuttaramaggā,
analyzed: tasmai varam vacanehi su ākkhāta tā ādayaḥ sabbe dhamma guṇā pakāsitāḥ ariya sacca paṭivedhena  samugghāta kilesa sammohāya iva paramatthataḥ paṇḍitāḥ bālya ādi samatikkamanato tasmā bhāvita lokuttara maggāḥ
translated: So all the special qualities of the Dhamma, such as being well proclaimed, are shown by the words “the best to be known.”🔽The wise are those who have eradicated the delusion of defilements in the ultimate sense by penetrating the noble truths, and they are also called “wise” because they have gone beyond such states as foolishness.

original: sacchikatasāmaññaphalā ca puggalā visesato “vidū”ti vuccanti. Te hi yathāvuttasāsanavaraṃ
analyzed: ca puggalāḥ visesataḥ vidu iti vuccanti te hi yathā vutta sāsana varam
translated: So the ariyan disciple, who has the supramundane path in being, and the person who has realized the fruit of asceticism, are called “wise” in particular.

original: aviparītato ñātuṃ, netuñca saparasantāne sakkuṇanti. Tasmā ye suppaṭipannatādayo
analyzed: a viparītataḥ ñātum netum ca sa para santāne tasmai ye suppaṭipanna tā ādayaḥ
translated: For they are able to know and lead others to know the excellent Dispensation as stated above without perversion.

original: anekehi suttapadehi saṃvaṇṇitā, te ariyasaṅghaguṇāpi niravasesato “vidūhī”ti padena
analyzed: anekehi sutta padehi saṃvaṇṇitā te ariya saṅgha guṇā api niravasesataḥ vidūhi iti padena
translated: So the special qualities of the ariyan community, which are praised in many texts as being of such kinds as good practice, are also shown without remainder by the word “wise.”

original: pakāsitāti. Evaṃ nettiyā paṭhamagāthāya “etaṃ sāsanavara”nti padena sāsanattayaṃ
analyzed: pakāsitā ati evam paṭhama gāthāya etam padena
translated: Thus, in the first stanza of the Netti, the three Piṭakas are included by the words “This is the best of the Teacher’s Dispensation.”

original: saṅgaṇhitvā tattha itaresaṃ dvinnaṃ adhigamūpāyabhāvato sabbasāsanamūlabhūtassa,
analyzed: saṅgaṇhitvā tattha itaresam dvinnam adhigama upāya bhāvato sabba sāsana mūla bhūtassa
translated: And then, since the other two are the means to the attainment of the Dispensation, the Dispensation is the root of all the Dispensation,

original: attano nettippakaraṇassa ca visayabhūtassa pariyattisāsanavarassa dassanamukhena
analyzed: attanaḥ ca visaya bhūtassa pariyatti sāsana varassa dassana mukhena
translated: and the Paramattha Piṭaka is the province of the Nettippakarana, the author has shown the special qualities of the Three Jewels by way of the Paramattha Piṭaka,

original: sabbe ratanattayaguṇāpi thomanāvasena nayatova pakāsitā honti. Nayato hi dassitā
analyzed: sabbe thomanā vasena nayataḥ iva pakāsitāḥ honti nayataḥ hi dassitā
translated: and so he has expounded them by way of the Netti. For when the special qualities are shown by way of the Netti,

original: sabbe guṇā niravasesā gahitā bhavanti, na sarūpato. Tenāha bhagavantaṃ ṭhapetvā paññavantānaṃ
analyzed: sabbe guṇāḥ niravasesāḥ gahitāḥ bhavanti na sarūpataḥ tena āha bhagavantam ṭhapetvā paññavantānam
translated: all the special qualities are included without exception, not by their individual essences. Therefore, the Elder Sāriputta, who was foremost among those possessed of wisdom, except for the Blessed One,

original: aggabhūto dhammasenāpatisāriputtattheropi buddhaguṇaparicchedanamanuyutto “apica
analyzed: agga bhūtaḥ dhammasenāpati sāriputta theraḥ api buddha guṇa paricchedanam anuyuttaḥ api ca
translated: and who was devoted to the exposition of the special qualities of the Buddha, said:

original: me dhammanvayo vidito”ti bhagavatāpi –
analyzed: me dhamma anvayaḥ vidito ti bhagavatā api
translated: “Moreover, the method of the Dhamma is known to me.”🔽And the Blessed One said:

original: “Evaṃ acintiyā buddhā, buddhadhammā acintiyā;
analyzed: evam acintiyāḥ buddhāḥ buddha dhammāḥ acintiyāḥ
translated: “Thus the Buddhas are inconceivable, The Buddha-Dhamma is inconceivable;

original: Acintiye pasannānaṃ, vipāko hoti acintiyo”ti. –
analyzed: acintiye pasannānam vipākaḥ hoti acintiya uti
translated: The fruit of faith in the inconceivable Is also inconceivable.”

original: Gāthā vuttā. Tattha buddhadhammāti buddhaguṇā. Amhākaṃ pana yāvajīvaṃ ratanattayaguṇaparidīpane
analyzed: gāthā vuttā tattha buddha dhammā ati buddha guṇāḥ amhākam pana yāvajīvam
translated: The verse is given. Herein, the Buddha’s qualities are the Buddha-qualities. But even though we are zealous in expounding the qualities of the Triple Gem for as long as life lasts,

original: atiussāhantānampi sarūpato nīharitvā dassetuṃ asamatthabhāvo pageva paṇḍitehi veditabboti.
analyzed: ati ussāhantānam pi sarūpataḥ nīharitvā dassetum asamattha bhāvaḥ pagā iva paṇḍitehi veditabbaḥ ti
translated: the fact that we are unable to extract them and show them as they really are should be understood by the wise.

original: Iccevaṃ –
analyzed: iti ca ivam
translated: So in this way:

original: “Yaṃ loko pūjayate, salokapālo sadā namassati ca;
analyzed: yam pūjayate sa lokapālaḥ sadā ca
translated: “The world worships him, the world’s protector, and always pays him homage.

original: Tasseta sāsanavaraṃ, vidūhi ñeyyaṃ naravarassā”ti. –
analyzed: tassa ita sāsana varam vidūhi ñeyyam nara varassa ati
translated: The wise should know that this is the best of his teachings, the best of men.”

original: Niggahitalopavasena vuttāya gāthāya saṅkhepena kathito anusandhyādiko samattoti.
analyzed: niggahita lopa vasena vuttāya gāthāya saṅkhepena kathitaḥ anusandhi ādikaḥ samattaḥ iti
translated: The verse given with the elision of the ligature is explained in brief. The connection, etc., are finished.

original: “Yaṃ loko pūjayate, sa lokapālo sadā namassati ca;
analyzed: yam pūjayate sa lokapālaḥ sadā namassati ca
translated: “The world worships him, the world’s protector, and always pays him homage.

original: Taṃ tassa sāsanavaraṃ, vidūhi ñeyyaṃ naravarassā”ti. –
analyzed: tam tassa sāsana varam vidūhi ñeyyam nara varassa ati
translated: The wise should know that this is the best of his teachings, the best of men.”

original: Gāthaṃ apare paṭhanti. Tassāpi anusandhyattho vuttanayova. Yojanattho pana viseso.
analyzed: gātham apare paṭhanti tassa api anusandhi atthaḥ vutta nayaḥ uva yojana tthaḥ pana visesaḥ
translated: Others recite the verse thus. The meaning of the connection in this case is the same as the method stated. But the interpretation is different.

original: Tattha hi salokapālo loko yassa satthuno naravarassa yaṃ sāsanavaraṃ saṃvaṇṇetabbasahitaṃ,
analyzed: tattha hi sa lokapālaḥ lokaḥ yassa satthunaḥ nara varassa yam sāsana varam saṃvaṇṇetabba sahitam
translated: Herein, the world’s protector is the world’s protector, the best of men, whose best teaching is the teaching together with the praise.

original: saṃvaṇṇetabbaṃ eva vā pūjayate ceva namassati ca, tassa lokapālassa satthuno taṃ
analyzed: saṃvaṇṇetabbam eva vā pūjayate ca iva namassati ca tassa lokapālassa satthuno tam
translated: or he honours and reverences the one who is to be honoured and revered, that Teacher, the Protector of the World,

original: pūjetabbaṃ, namassitabbañca vidūheva viññātabbaṃ, etaṃ sāsanavaraṃ nettippakaraṇassa🔽visayanti gahetabbanti yojanā. Yojanākāropi heṭṭhā vuttanayova.
analyzed: pūjetabbam namassitabbam ca vidūha iva viññātabbam etam sāsana varam netti pakaraṇassa  visayanti gahetabbanti yojanā yojana ākāraḥ api heṭṭhā vutta nayaḥ va
translated: the wise one should understand that this is the best of teachings, the province of the Netti-Pakaraṇa.🔽The method of interpretation is the same as that given above.

original: Viggahatthopi viseso. Imasmiñhi naye lokaṃ pālentīti lokapālā, yathāvuttacatumahārājādayo.
analyzed: viggaha atthaḥ api visesaḥ imasmin hi naye lokam pālenti iti lokapālāḥ yathā vutta catu mahārāja ādayaḥ
translated: The difference in the sense of the word is also (to be found). In this method the Four Great Kings, etc., as stated, are the Protectors of the World, because they protect the world.

original: Tehi lokapālehi sahitaṃ sabbalokaṃ pāleti lokagganāyakattāti lokapāloti bhagavāpi🔽lokapālasaddena vutto. So hi “tassā”ti ettha taṃ-saddena parāmasīyati, tasmā tassa
analyzed: tehi lokapālehi sahitam sabba lokam pāleti lokagga nāyaka ttā ati lokapālaḥ iti bhagavā api  lokapāla saddena vuttaḥ saḥ hi tassa ati ettha taṃ saddena parāmasīyati tasmā tassa
translated: The Blessed One is also called the Protector of the World, because he protects the whole world together with the Protectors of the World, by being the Leader of the world.

original: lokapālassa satthuno naravarassāti attho gahito. Yadi evaṃ lokapālo guṇībhūto apadhāno
analyzed: lokapālassa satthunaḥ nara varassa ati atthaḥ gahitaḥ yadi evam lokapālaḥ guṇībhūtaḥ apadhānaḥ
translated: He is referred to by the word “that” in the passage “tassā” (of that), therefore the meaning “of that Teacher, the Protector of the World, the Best of Men” is taken. If it is so, the Protector of the World is the subordinate,

original: padhānabhūtaṃ lokaṃ visesetvā vinivatto, kathaṃ taṃ-saddena parāmasīyatīti? Lokavisesako
analyzed: padhāna bhūtam lokam visesetvā vinivatto katham taṃsaddena parāmasīyati iti loka visesako
translated: the world is the predominant, and the Protector of the World is distinguished by the world, how is he referred to by the word “that”?

original: samānopi sāsanavarāpekkhatāya janakasāmibhāvena sambandhivisesabhūtattā padhānabhūto🔽viya parāmasīyatīti. Bhagavā sāsanavarassa sāmibhāvena gahito. Kathaṃ sāsanavarassa🔽sāmī bhagavā sāsanavaraṃ pūjayatīti? Na cāyaṃ virodho. Buddhā hi bhagavanto dhammagaruno,
analyzed: samānaḥ api sāsana vara apekkha tāya janaka sāmi bhāvena sambandhi visesa bhūta ttā padhāna bhūtaḥ  viya parāmasīyati iti bhagavā sāsana varassa sāmi bhāvena gahitaḥ katham sāsana varassa  sāmī bhagavā sāsana varam pūjayati iti na ca ayam virodhaḥ buddhāḥ hi bhagavantaḥ dhamma garunaḥ
translated: and although equal, he is the one who is clung to as the most important, as if he were the owner of the Dispensation, because of his being the one who is related to it in the special way of being its owner, which is the most important.🔽The Blessed One is taken as the owner of the Dispensation. How is it that the Blessed One, as the owner of the Dispensation, honours the Dispensation?🔽There is no contradiction here. For the Blessed Buddhas are those who honour the Dhamma,🔽

original: te sabbakālaṃ dhammamapacayamānāva viharantīti. Buddhānañhi dhammagarudhammāpacayamānabhāvo🔽“yaṃnūnāhaṃ…pe… tameva dhammaṃ sakkatvā garuṃ katvā mānetvā pūjetvā upanissāya vihareyya”nti🔽vutto, tasmā lokapālo bhagavā sāsanavaraṃ pūjayatīti daṭṭhabbo. Evaṃ sati lokapālo🔽bhagavā sāsanavaraṃ pūjayatīti attho yutto hotu, kathaṃ lokapālo bhagavā sāsanavaraṃ🔽namassatīti yuttoti? Yuttova “namassatī”ti padassa garukaraṇena tanninnapoṇapabbhāroti
analyzed: te sabbakālam dhammam apacayamānāḥ ava viharanti iti buddhānam hi dhamma garu dhamma apacayamāna bhāvaḥ 🔽yaṃ nūna aham pe tam eva dhammam sakkatvā garum katvā mānetvā pūjetvā upanissāya vihareyyanti 🔽vuttaḥ tasmai lokapālaḥ bhagavā sāsana varam pūjayati iti daṭṭhabbaḥ evam sati lokapālo 🔽bhagavā sāsana varam pūjayati iti atthaḥ yuttaḥ hotu katham lokapālaḥ bhagavā sāsana varam 🔽namassati iti yuttaḥ ti yuttaḥ uva namassati iti padassa garu karaṇena tat ninna poṇa pabbhāro ti
translated: and the Blessed One is the owner of the True Ideal, which is the best thing in the world, and so he is the owner of the True Object, which is the best thing in the world, and so he is the Object, which is the best thing in the world, and so he is the owner of the True Object,

original: atthassāpi labbhanato. Bhagavā hi dhammagarutāya sabbakālaṃ dhammaninnapoṇapabbhārabhāvena
analyzed: atthassa api labbhanataḥ bhagavā hi dhamma garutāya sabbakālam dhamma ninna poṇa pabbhāra bhāvena
translated: because the meaning of the word is also found. For the Blessed One, out of respect for the Dhamma, always abides with a tendency, inclination, and propensity towards the Dhamma.

original: viharatīti. Vuttañhetaṃ “yena sudaṃ niccakappaṃ viharāmī”tiādi. Sesamettha heṭṭhā
analyzed: viharati iti vuttam ha etam yena sudam niccakappam viharāmi itiādi sesam ettha heṭṭhā
translated: It is said: “I always abide in the Dhamma” , etc. The rest here should be understood in the way stated below

original: vuttanayena vā saṃvaṇṇanāsu vuttanayena vā ñātabbanti amhehi na vitthārīyati.🔽Evaṃ paṭhamagāthāya “sāsanavara”nti padena tividhampi sāsanaṃ saṅgaṇhitvā tattha
analyzed: vutta nayena vā saṃvaṇṇanāsu vutta nayena vā ñātabbanti amhehi na vitthārīyati  evam paṭhama gāthāya padena tividham pi sāsanam saṅgaṇhitvā tattha
translated: or in the way stated in the commentaries. We do not elaborate.

original: pariyattisāsanameva attano nettippakaraṇassa visayaṃ niyametvā dassento “dvādasa🔽padāni”tyādimāha. Atha vā paṭhamagāthāya ratanattayathomanena saha nettippakaraṇatāvisayaṃ🔽sāsanavaraṃ ācariyena dassitaṃ, “tassa sāsanavaraṃ kiṃ sabbaṃyeva nettippakaraṇassa
analyzed: pariyatti sāsanam eva attanaḥ netti pakaraṇassa visayam niyametvā dassentaḥ dvādasa  padān ityādim āha atha vā paṭhama gāthāya saha  sāsana varam ācariyena dassitam tassa sāsana varam kim sabbaṃyeva netti pakaraṇassa
translated: Thus, having included the Dispensation in all three senses by the word “best Dispensation” in the first stanza, the teacher, by the words “twelve bases,” etc.,

original: visayaṃ, udāhu pariyattisāsanamevā”ti pucchitabbattā pariyattisāsanabhūtaṃ suttamevāti
analyzed: visayam udāhu pariyatti sāsanam evā ti pucchitabba ttā pariyatti sāsana bhūtam suttam evā ti
translated: limits and shows the subject of his own treatise, namely, the Dispensation as the scriptures. Or else, the teacher has shown the Dispensation as the best subject of the treatise together with the homage in the first stanza. Since it should be asked whether the whole Dispensation is the subject of the treatise or only the Dispensation as the scriptures, he shows that the subject is only the scriptures, which are part of the Dispensation as the scriptures.

original: dassento “dvādasa padāni sutta”ntiādimāha. Tattha “sāsanavara”nti sāmaññena vuttampi
analyzed: dassentaḥ dvādasa padāni suttanti ādim āha tattha sāsanavaran ti sāmaññena vuttam pi
translated: Showing this, he says: “The Thread is twelve terms,” and so on. Herein, although “the best of the Dispensation” is said in general,🔽the meaning is that the Thread of the Scriptures should be taken as “the best of the Dispensation.”

original: pariyattisuttameva sāsanavaranti gahetabbanti attho. “Taṃ pana katividha”nti vattabbattā
analyzed: pariyatti suttam eva sāsana varanti gahetabbanti atthaḥ tam pana katividhanti vattabbattā
translated: Since it is necessary to say “But how many kinds is it? “ ,

original: “dvādasa padānī”ti vuttaṃ, saṅkhepato pabhedena dvādasavidhanti attho. Pabhedato🔽dvādasavidhampi byañjanapadaatthapadato pana duvidhamevāti dassetuṃ “taṃ sabbaṃ byañjanañca
analyzed: dvādasa padāni iti vuttam saṅkhepataḥ pabhedena dvādasavidhanti atthaḥ pabhedato  dvādasavidham pi byañjana pada attha padato pana duvidham evā ti dassetum tam sabbam byañjanam ca
translated: he says “It is twelve terms” , the meaning being that it is of twelve kinds by analysis in brief.🔽And although it is of twelve kinds by analysis, still it is only of two kinds, namely, terms as expression and terms as meaning, in order to show this he says “All that is either expression or meaning” .

original: attho cā”ti vuttaṃ. “Tasmiṃ dvaye ekameva sarūpato nettippakaraṇassa visayanti viññeyyaṃ,
analyzed: atthaḥ ca ati vuttam tasmin dvaye ekam eva sarūpataḥ visayanti viññeyyam
translated: The meaning is that only one of the two should be understood as the province of the Expositor, namely,

original: udāhu ubhaya”nti pucchitabbattā ubhayanti dassetuṃ “taṃ viññeyyaṃ ubhaya”nti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: udāhu ubhayanti pucchitabba ttā ubhayanti dassetum tam viññeyyam ubhayanti vuttam
translated: or both? “ It should be understood as both” is said in order to show that it should be understood as both.

original: Vacanavacanīyabhāvena sambandhe yasmiṃ byañjane, atthe ca “sutta”nti vohāro pavatto,
analyzed: vacana vacanīya bhāvena sambandhe yasmin byañjane atthe ca vohāro pavatto
translated: In the case of the expression and the meaning in which the usage “ Thread “ occurs in the sense of “ that which is woven “ and “ that which is woven upon “ ,

original: taṃ ubhayaṃ sarūpato nettippakaraṇassa visayanti viññeyyanti attho. “Kinti viññeyya”nti
analyzed: tat ubhayam sarūpataḥ viññeyyanti attho kinti viññeyyanti
translated: the meaning is that both should be understood as the province of the Expositor.

original: vattabbattā “ko attho, byañjanaṃ katama”nti vuttaṃ. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – chabyañjanapadachaatthapadabhedena
analyzed: vattabbattā kaḥ atthaḥ byañjanam kataman ti vuttam idam vuttam hoti cha byañjana pada cha attha pada bhedena
translated: “What is the meaning? What is the phrasing?” is said because it should be stated. This is what is meant: The Thread, called the entire body of tradition, which is twofold as phrasing and meaning,

original: dvādasavidhaṃ byañjanapadaatthapadavasena duvidhaṃ sabbapariyattisaṅkhātaṃ suttaṃ
analyzed: dvādasavidham byañjana pada attha pada vasena duvidham sabba pariyatti saṅkhātam suttam
translated: and twelvefold by the analysis of the six phrasings and the six meanings,

original: mama nettippakaraṇassa visayaṃ sāsanavaranti ñātabbaṃ. Sarūpato pucchitvā atthapadaṃ,
analyzed: mama netti pakaraṇassa visayam sāsana varam ti ñātabbam sarūpataḥ pucchitvā attha padam
translated: should be known as the province of my Netti-Treatise, the best of the Dispensation. The meaning-phrase

original: byañjanapadañca sarūpato ñātabbanti.
analyzed: byañjana padam ca sarūpataḥ ñātabbanti
translated: and the phrasing-phrase should be known by their individual essences.

original: Evaṃ paṭhamagāthāya “sāsanavara”nti vuttassa suttassa pariyattibhāvañceva atthapadabyañjanapadabhāvena🔽veditabbattañca dassetvā idāni tassa suttassa pavicayūpāyaṃ nettippakaraṇaṃ padatthavibhāgena
analyzed: evam paṭhama gāthāya sāsana varan ti vuttassa suttassa pariyatti bhāvam ca iva attha pada byañjana pada bhāvena  veditabba ttañca dassetvā idāni tassa suttassa pavicayu upāyam padattha vibhāgena
translated: Having thus shown the fact that the Thread called “the best of the Dispensation” is the tradition and the fact that it should be known as the meaning-phrase and the phrasing-phrase,

original: dassetuṃ “soḷasahārā”tyādimāha. Atha vā dutiyagāthāya nettippakaraṇassa visayaṃ sāsanavaraṃ
analyzed: dassetum soḷasa hāra atyādim āha atha vā dutiya gāthāya visayam sāsanavaram
translated: now in order to show the Netti-Treatise, which is the means of investigating that Thread, by means of the Padatthana, he said “The sixteen Guides” . Or alternatively, having shown the best of the Dispensation, which is the province of the Netti-Treatise, by means of the second stanza,

original: niyametvā dassitaṃ, “netti nāma katamā, katividhā”ti pucchitabbattā nettināma ettikāti
analyzed: niyametvā dassitam netti nāma katamā katividhā ati pucchitabba ttā netti nāma ettikā ati
translated: since it should be asked “What is the Netti? How many kinds is it? “ , the Netti should be known as such and such

original: saṅkhepato dassetuṃ “soḷasahārā”tyādimāha. Tattha tassa sāsanassa suttassa atthapariyeṭṭhi
analyzed: saṅkhepataḥ dassetum tattha tassa sāsanassa suttassa attha pariyeṭṭhi
translated: In order to show them in brief he says “The Guide is the sixteen modes, etc.” Herein, the search for the meaning of the Thread is

original: nettisaṃvaṇṇanā mayā mahākaccāyanena niddiṭṭhā netti nāma soḷasahārasamudāyā pañcanayasamudāyā
analyzed: netti saṃvaṇṇanā mayā mahākaccāyanena niddiṭṭhā netti nāma soḷasa hāra samudāyā pañca naya samudāyā
translated: The commentary on the Guide has been demonstrated by me, the Great Elder. The Guide is called the sixteen modes, the five groups of terms,

original: aṭṭhārasamūlapadasamudāyāti vijānitabbāti.🔽Te hārādayo kenaṭṭhena netti nāma? Veneyyasatte ariyadhammaṃ netīti nettīti evamādi
analyzed: aṭṭhārasa mūla pada samudāyā ati vijānitabbā ati  te hāra ādayo kenaṭṭhena netti nāma veneyya satte ariya dhammam neti iti netti iti evamādi
translated: and the eighteen principal statements. It should be recognized thus.

original: attho saṃvaṇṇanāsu vuttova. Imāya tatiyagāthāyapi “mahākaccānena niddiṭṭhā”ti pāṭho🔽sundaro. “Mahākaccāyanena niddiṭṭhā”ti vā pāṭho, na sundaro. Lakkhaṇañhi mayā heṭṭhā
analyzed: attho saṃvaṇṇanāsu vuttaḥ iva mahākaccānena niddiṭṭhā iti pāṭhaḥ  sundaraḥ mahākaccāyanena niddiṭṭhā iti vā pāṭhaḥ na sundaraḥ lakkhaṇam hi mayā heṭṭhā
translated: In what sense are those modes, etc., called the Guide? It guides the kind of person to be trained in the Noble One’s True Idea, thus it is the Guide. The meaning is stated in the commentaries thus. In this third verse the reading “demonstrated by me, the Great Elder” is good.🔽The reading “demonstrated by the Great Elder” is not good. For the characteristic has been stated by me below.

original: vuttanti. “Soḷasahārādisamudāyā nettī”ti vuttā, te hārā suttassa byañjanavicayo vā
analyzed: vuttam ti soḷasa hāra ādi samudāyā netti iti vuttā te hārā suttassa byañjana vicayaḥ vā
translated: The Guide is stated to be the collection of the sixteen modes, etc. Those modes are either a discrimination of the Thread’s phrasing or

original: honti, atthavicayo vā, nayā ca byañjanavicayo vā honti, atthavicayo vāti vicāraṇāyaṃ
analyzed: honti attha vicayaḥ vā nayā ca byañjana vicayaḥ vā honti attha vicayaḥ vā ati vicāraṇā ayam
translated: a discrimination of its meaning, and the methods are either a discrimination of the phrasing or a discrimination of the meaning. In the investigation

original: sati “ime imassa vicayo”ti niyametvā dassetuṃ “hārā byañjanavicayo”tiādimāha. Tattha
analyzed: sati ime imassa vicayo ti niyametvā dassetum hārāḥ byañjana vicaya uti ādim āha tattha
translated: In order to show that the modes are the analysis of the letter of the sutta and the methods the analysis of the meaning, he says, “The modes are the analysis of the letter of the sutta, and the methods the analysis of the meaning.”

original: hārā suttassa byañjanavicayo honti, na atthavicayo soḷasahārānaṃ mūlapadaniddhāraṇaṃ🔽vajjetvā byañjanamukheneva saṃvaṇṇanābhāvato. Tayo pana nayā suttassa atthavicayo🔽honti, tiṇṇaṃ nayānaṃ mūlapadasaṅkhātaavijjādisabhāvadhammaniddhāraṇamukheneva suttassa
analyzed: hārā suttassa byañjana vicayo honti na attha vicayo mūla pada niddhāraṇam  vajjetvā byañjana mukhena iva saṃvaṇṇanā abhāvato tayo pana nayā suttassa attha vicayo  honti tiṇṇam nayānam mūla pada saṅkhāta avijja ādi sabhāva dhamma niddhāraṇa mukhena iva suttassa
translated: The modes are the analysis of the letter of the sutta, not the analysis of the meaning, because they are a commentary on the sutta by way of the letter, leaving out the determination of the root-word of the sixteen modes.

original: atthasaṃvaṇṇanābhāvatoti.🔽“Taṃ ubhayaṃ sutte saṃvaṇṇanābhāvena kenaci katthaciyeva yojetabbaṃ, udāhu sabbathā🔽sabbattha yojita”nti pucchitabbabhāvato taṃ ubhayaṃ sabbattha suttesu sabbathā yojitanti
analyzed: attha saṃvaṇṇanā bhāvato ti  tat ubhayam sutte saṃvaṇṇanā bhāvena kenaci katthaciyā iva yojetabbam udāhu sabbathā  sabbattha yojitan ti pucchitabba bhāvato tam ubhayam sabbattha suttesu sabbathā yojitan ti
translated: But the three methods are the analysis of the meaning of the sutta, because they are a commentary on the meaning of the sutta by way of the determination of the root-word of the three methods, namely, the dhammas beginning with ignorance.

original: dassetuṃ “ubhayaṃ pariggahīta”nti vuttaṃ. Hārā ceva nayā ca ubhayaṃ suttassa atthaniddhāraṇavasena🔽parito samantato gahitaṃ sabbathā suttesu yojitanti.
analyzed: dassetum ubhayam pariggahītanti vuttam hārā ca iva nayā ca ubhayam suttassa attha niddhāraṇa vasena 🔽paritas samantataḥ gahitam sabbathā suttesu yojitan ti
translated: “Should this pair be applied in some places only by way of commentary on the sutta, or should it be applied everywhere? “ — because it is a question as to whether the pair should be applied everywhere in the suttas. In order to show that the pair is applied everywhere in the suttas, he says, “The pair is included.” The pair, namely, the modes and the methods, is included all round, that is, everywhere, in the suttas by way of the determination of the meaning of the sutta.

original: “Hārādisamudāyabhūtaṃ nettisaṅkhātaṃ suttaṃ kathaṃ saṃvaṇṇetabbaṃ suttaṃ saṃvaṇṇetī”ti
analyzed: hāra ādi samudāya bhūtam netti saṅkhātam suttam katham saṃvaṇṇetabbam suttam saṃvaṇṇeti iti
translated: “How is the Thread called ‘Guide’ to be expounded? The Thread called ‘Guide’ is a collection of necklaces, and it is the Thread that is to be expounded.

original: vattabbabhāvato vuttaṃ “vuccati suttaṃ yathāsutta”nti. Nettisaṅkhātaṃ saṃvaṇṇanāsuttaṃ
analyzed: vattabba bhāvataḥ vuttam vuccati suttam yathāsuttam ti netti saṅkhātam saṃvaṇṇanā suttam
translated: “ ‘The Thread is called “as Thread” ‘ is said because it is what has to be said. The Thread called ‘Guide’ is the Thread of the exposition.

original: saṃvaṇṇetabbasuttānurūpaṃ yathā yena yena desanāhārena vā aññena vā saṃvaṇṇetabbaṃ,
analyzed: saṃvaṇṇetabba sutta anurūpam yathā yena yena desanā āhārena vā aññena vā saṃvaṇṇetabbam
translated: It is expounded in whatever way, by whatever teaching, or by whatever other means, it is to be expounded in conformity with the Thread to be expounded.

original: tena tena vuccati saṃvaṇṇetīti attho. Atha vā “nettisaṅkhātaṃ suttaṃ kittakaṃ saṃvaṇṇetabbaṃ
analyzed: tena tena vuccati saṃvaṇṇeti iti atthaḥ atha vā netti saṅkhātam suttam kittakam saṃvaṇṇetabbam
translated: ‘It is called “as Thread” ‘ is said because it is what has to be said. original: suttaṃ saṃvaṇṇetī”ti vattabbabhāvato vuttaṃ “vuccati suttaṃ yathāsutta”nti. Tattha🔽yathāsuttaṃ yaṃ yaṃ suttaṃ bhagavatā vuttaṃ, taṃ taṃ sabbaṃ suttaṃ nettisaṅkhātaṃ
analyzed: suttam saṃvaṇṇeti iti vattabba bhāvataḥ vuttam vuccati suttam yathāsuttam ti tattha  yathāsuttam yam yam suttam bhagavatā vuttam tam tam sabbam suttam netti saṅkhātam
translated: ‘It is called “as Thread” ‘ is said because it is what has to be said. The Thread called ‘Guide’ is expounded in whatever way, by whatever teaching, or by whatever other means, it is to be expounded in conformity with the Thread to be expounded.

original: suttaṃ vuccati vadati assādādīnavadassanavasena saṃvaṇṇetīti. Tena vuttaṃ “nettinayena🔽hi saṃvaṇṇetuṃ asakkuṇeyyaṃ nāma suttaṃ natthī”ti.

original: “Yaṃ yaṃ bhagavatā desitaṃ suttaṃ nettisaṃvaṇṇanāya saṃvaṇṇitaṃ, sā saṃvaṇṇetabbā
analyzed: yam yam bhagavatā desitam suttam netti saṃvaṇṇanāya saṃvaṇṇitam sā saṃvaṇṇetabbā
translated: “Whatever Thread the Blessed One taught has been commended in the Commentary on the Guide Line, and that is to be commended.

original: desanā ca viññeyyā, udāhu desitabbañcā”ti vattabbabhāvato “yā ceva desanā”tyādimāha.
analyzed: desanā ca viññeyyā udāhu desitabbam ca ati vattabba bhāvataḥ yā ca iva desanā atyādim āha
translated: But is it the teaching that should be known, or is it what is taught in the teaching? ” — since it is proper to ask this, he said “The teaching and what is taught in it” .

original: Yā ceva desanā pāḷi saṃvaṇṇitā, sā ca, tāya desanāya desitaṃ yaṃ dhammajātaṃ, tañca
analyzed: yā ca iva desanā saṃvaṇṇitā sā ca tāya desanāya desitam yam dhamma jātam tat ca
translated: And the teaching in the text that has been commended, and also the idea taught in that teaching,

original: ubhayaṃ vimuttāyatanadesanāsīsena paricayaṃ karontehi ekantena viññeyyaṃ ubhayasseva
analyzed: ubhayam vimutta āyatana desanā sīsena paricayam karontehi ekantena viññeyyam ubhayassa iva

analyzed: anupādisesa parinibbāna pariyosānānam sampattīnam hetu bhāvataḥ tassa ubhayassa vijānane
translated: since both of them are the cause of the attainment of the end in the form of extinction without trace left .

original: sādhetabbe sādhetabbassa vijānanassa hetubhūtā katamā anupubbī”ti pucchitabbabhāvato
analyzed: sādhetabbe sādhetabbassa vijānanassa hetu bhūtā katamā anupubbī iti pucchitabba bhāvato

analyzed: vuttam tatra atyādi tattha tatra vijānane sādhetabbe sutta ādi nava aṅgassa sāsanassa

analyzed: attha pariyesanā attha vicāraṇā hārana yānam ayam anupubbī vijānanassa sādhetabbassa
translated: the search for the meaning of the nine-factored True Idea consisting of the Thread, etc., and the investigation of the meaning, and the method of expounding the nine-factored True Idea consisting of the Thread, etc.,

analyzed: hetu bhūtā anupubbī nāma ati atthaḥ atha vā tassa ubhayassa vijānane sādhetabbe sutta ādi navaṅgassa  sāsanassa attha pariyesanāya attha vicāraṇāya ayam anupubbī vijānanassa sādhetabbassa  hetu bhūtā anupubbī nāma ati atha vā vakkhamānāya hāra naya anupubbiyā navavidha suttanta pariyesanā
translated: The meaning is that it is a successive order that is a cause for the knowing. Or alternatively, in the case of the two kinds of knowing that have to be accomplished, namely, that of the nine-factored Thread beginning with the sutta, and that of the meaning of the Teaching, which has to be sought by the investigation of the meaning, this successive order is a successive order that is a cause for the knowing that has to be accomplished. original: vijānanassa hetubhūtāti veditabbā. Tenākāreneva aṭṭhakathāyaṃ tidhā vuttāti.🔽Saṅgahavārassa atthavibhāvanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vijānanassa hetu bhūtā ati veditabbā tena ākārena iva aṭṭhakathā ayam tidhā vuttā ti  saṅgaha vārassa attha vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The meaning is that it is a successive order that is a cause for the knowing. Or alternatively, in the case of the two kinds of knowing that have to be accomplished, namely, the knowing of the meaning of the Dispensation consisting of the ninefold suttantas beginning with the sutta and so on, and the knowing of the meaning of the ninefold suttantas that have to be accomplished by the search for the meaning and the investigation of the meaning in the case of the two kinds of knowing that have to be accomplished, this is a successive order that is a cause for the knowing that has to be accomplished. Or alternatively, it should be understood as a successive order that is a cause for the knowing that has to be accomplished by the successive order of the method of expounding that is going to be described, namely, the search for the ninefold sutta. That is why it is said in the commentary that it is stated in three ways. The exposition of the meaning of the section on the method of grouping is ended.

original: 2. Uddesavāraatthavibhāvanā🔽1. Evaṃ saṅgahavārena saṅkhepato dassite hārādayo idāni vibhāgena dassetuṃ “tattha🔽katame soḷasa hārā”tiādidesanā āraddhā. Atha vā soḷasahārādisamudāyā netti nāma mayā
analyzed: evam saṅgaha vārena saṅkhepataḥ dassite hāra ādayaḥ idāni vibhāgena dassetum tattha  katame soḷasa hāra ati ādi desanāḥ āraddhāḥ atha vā soḷasa hāra ādi samudāyāḥ nāma mayā
translated: EXPOSITION OF THE MEANING OF THE SECTION ON ENUMERATION

original: mahākaccānena niddiṭṭhāti vuttā, “katame te soḷasa hārā”ti pucchitabbattā vuttaṃ
analyzed: mahākaccānena niddiṭṭhā ati vuttā katame te soḷasa hārā ti pucchitabbattā vuttam
translated: Now, in order to show the method of expounding, etc., which are demonstrated briefly by means of the section on the method of grouping, the teaching beginning with the words “Herein, what are the sixteen methods of expounding?” is begun. Or alternatively, it is said that the Netti, which is a collection of the sixteen methods of expounding, etc., has been demonstrated by me, Mahākaccāna. Since it is necessary to ask, “What are those sixteen methods of expounding?” it is said:

original: “tattha soḷasa hārā”tyādi. Tattha tatthāti tesu soḷasahārādīsu. Desanā hāro, vicayo
analyzed: tattha soḷasa hāra atyādi tattha tattha ati tesu soḷasa hāra ādīsu desanā hāraḥ vicayo
translated: “Therein, the sixteen kinds of Thread are the Thread’s Guide-Line” . Herein, therein is in the case of those sixteen kinds of Thread, etc., The Thread’s Guide-Line is the Thread’s Guide-Line for the exposition of the Thread.

original: hāro…pe… sāmāropano hāroti ime soḷasa hārāti daṭṭhabbā.
analyzed: ime soḷasa hārā ti daṭṭhabbā
translated: “Herein, the sixteen kinds of ‘guide-lines’ are as follows” . Herein, “herein” refers to the sixteen kinds of “guide-lines” beginning with the “guide-line of teaching” . The “guide-line of teaching,” the “guide-line of investigation,” … the “guide-line of superimposition” : these are the sixteen kinds of “guide-lines” that should be seen.

original: Tattha sabbasādhāraṇattā hārapadassa vacanattho paṭhamaṃ vattabbo. Kenaṭṭhena hārāti?🔽Harīyanti etehīti hārā. Etehi saṃvaṇṇanāvisesehi saṃvaṇṇiyesu suttageyyādīsu aññāṇasaṃsayavipallāsā
analyzed: tattha sabba sādhāraṇa ttā hāra padassa vacana atthaḥ paṭhamam vattabbaḥ kenaṭṭhena hārā ti  harīyanti etehi iti hārāḥ etehi saṃvaṇṇanā visesehi saṃvaṇṇiyesu sutta geyya ādīsu aññāṇa saṃsaya vipallāsā
translated: Herein, since the word “guide-line” is common to all, its meaning as a word should be stated first. In what sense are they “guide-lines”?

original: harīyanti, iti aññāṇādiharaṇakāraṇattā “etehī”ti padena niddiṭṭhā saṃvaṇṇanāvisesā
analyzed: harīyanti iti aññāṇa ādi haraṇa kāraṇa ttā etehi iti padena niddiṭṭhā saṃvaṇṇanā visesā
translated: They are “guide-lines” because of the removal of ignorance, etc., by them. In the discourses, verses, etc., that are to be expounded by means of the different kinds of exposition, ignorance, doubt, and wrong views are removed by these different kinds of exposition. Thus the different kinds of exposition indicated by the word “by them” are called “guide-lines” because they are the cause for the removal of ignorance, etc.

original: hārā nāma, hara-dhātuyā ācariyassa vacībhedasaddo, taṃsamuṭṭhāpako cittuppādo ca🔽mukhyattho, veneyyānaṃ saṃvaṇṇetabbasuttassa atthajānanādiñāṇasampayuttacittuppādo
analyzed: hārāḥ nāma hara dhātuyā ācariyassa vacī bheda saddo tad samuṭṭhāpako cittuppādo ca  mukhya tthaḥ veneyyānam saṃvaṇṇetabba suttassa attha jānana ādi ñāṇa sampayutta cittuppādaḥ
translated: The word “guide-line” is a derivative of the verbal root har , which has the primary meaning of the teacher’s utterance and the meaning of the thought that causes it to arise.🔽The meaning of the cause by metonymy is the thought associated with the knowledge of understanding the meaning of the discourse to be expounded to the disciples.

original: kāraṇūpacārattho, tassa upanissayapaccayabhūtānaṃ saṃvaṇṇanāvisesānaṃ upanissayapaccayasatti
analyzed: kāraṇa upacāra atthaḥ tassa upanissaya paccaya bhūtānam saṃvaṇṇanā visesānam upanissaya paccaya satti
translated: The meaning of the cause by metonymy is the power of the condition of the different kinds of exposition that are the condition by way of decisive support for that .

original: phalūpacārattho, iti-saddena sā upanissayapaccayasattiyeva parāmasīyati. Taṃsattisampannā
analyzed: phala upacāra atthaḥ iti saddena sā upanissaya paccaya sattiyā iva parāmasīyati tad satti sampannā
translated: The word “also” refers to the influence of the condition by way of decisive support.🔽The special explanations that are endowed with that influence

original: saṃvaṇṇanāvisesā ṇa-paccayatthā honti. Esa nayo evarūpesu ṭhānesupi. Vitthāro aṭṭhakathāyaṃ vutto eva.🔽Asādhāraṇato pana desīyati etāyāti desanā. Etāya saṃvaṇṇanāya saṃvaṇṇetabbasuttattho
analyzed: saṃvaṇṇanā visesāḥ ṇa paccaya tthāḥ honti esa nayaḥ evarūpesu ṭhānesu pi vitthāraḥ aṭṭhakathāyam vuttaḥ eva  asādhāraṇataḥ pana desīyati etāya ati desanā etāya saṃvaṇṇanāya saṃvaṇṇetabba sutta tthaḥ
translated: are the meanings of the condition by way of decisive support. The same method applies in other such instances. The detail has been given in the commentary.🔽But the teaching is so called because it is taught by means of this, that is, by means of the special explanation. The meaning of the sutta to be explained is taught by means of this explanation.

original: desīyati saṃvaṇṇīyati saṃvaṇṇanānusārena ñāpīyati, iti ñāpanakāraṇattā “etāyā”ti🔽padena niddiṭṭhā visesasaṃvaṇṇanā desanā nāma, na pāḷidesanā, pāḷidesanāya saṃvaṇṇetabbasaṃvaṇṇanābhāvena
analyzed: desīyati saṃvaṇṇīyati saṃvaṇṇanā anusārena ñāpīyati iti ñāpana kāraṇa ttā etāyāti  padena niddiṭṭhā visesa saṃvaṇṇanā desanā nāma na pāḷi desanā pāḷi desanāya saṃvaṇṇetabba saṃvaṇṇanā bhāvena
translated: It is taught, it is explained, it is made known by the method of the explanation. Thus the special explanation indicated by the word “by means of this” is called the teaching because it is the cause of making known.🔽It is not the teaching of the text, but the explanation of the meaning of the sutta called the teaching of the text, because it is the explanation of what is to be explained by the explanation.

original: sahacaraṇato vā desanā. Kiñcāpi aññe hārā desanāpāḷisaṅkhātassa suttassa atthasaṃvaṇṇanābhāvato
analyzed: sahacaraṇataḥ vā desanā kiñcā api aññe hārāḥ desanā pāḷi saṅkhātassa suttassa attha saṃvaṇṇanā bhāvato
translated: Or alternatively, the teaching is so called because it is associated with the teaching. Although the other methods are associated with the teaching of the text,

original: desanāya sahacārino honti, ayaṃ pana hāro yebhuyyena yathārutavaseneva viññāyamānattā
analyzed: desanāya sahacārinaḥ honti ayam pana hāraḥ yebhuyyena yathā ruta vasena iva viññāyamāna ttā
translated: this method is called the teaching because it is understood for the most part by the literal meaning.

original: pāḷidesanāya saha caratīti vattabbataṃ arahati, na tathā pare. Na hi assādādīnavanissaraṇādisandassanalakkhaṇarahitā
analyzed: pāḷidesanāya saha carati iti vattabba tam arahati na tathā pare na hi assāda ādīnava nissaraṇa ādi sandassana lakkhaṇa rahitā
translated: It is proper to say that it is the Thread’s teaching that goes with it, not the other way round. For there is no teaching of a Thread without the demonstration of the advantages, etc., and the escape, etc.,

original: pāḷidesanā atthi, ayañca hāro assādādisandassanalakkhaṇoti.
analyzed: pāḷidesanā atthi ayam ca hāraḥ assāda ādi sandassana lakkhaṇo ti
translated: and this Mode has the demonstration of the advantages, etc., as its distinguishing mark.

original: Viciyanti etenāti vicayo. Etena saṃvaṇṇanāvisesena sutte padapañhādayo viciyanti,
analyzed: viciyanti etena ati vicayaḥ etena saṃvaṇṇanā visesena sutte pada pañha ādayaḥ viciyanti
translated: It is an investigation because it is investigated by this. By this distinguishing description the questions about terms, etc., in the Thread are investigated,

original: iti vicāraṇakāraṇattā so saṃvaṇṇanāviseso vicayo nāma. Katvatthādhikaraṇatthāpi labbhanti.
analyzed: iti vicāraṇa kāraṇa ttā so saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ vicayaḥ nāma labbhanti
translated: and so this distinguishing description is called “investigation” since it is the cause of the investigation. The words “in the sense of the reason for the matter” are also applicable.

original: Saṃvaṇṇetabbasuttena padapañhādivicayanalakkhaṇo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso vicayo hāro.
analyzed: saṃvaṇṇetabba suttena pada pañha ādi vicayana lakkhaṇaḥ saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ vicayaḥ hāro
translated: The Mode of Conveying an Investigation is a distinguishing description that has the distinguishing mark of investigating the questions about terms, etc., by means of the Thread to be investigated.

original: Yuttāyutti vicārīyati etāyāti yutti. Etāya visesasaṃvaṇṇanāya sabbesaṃ hārānaṃ bhūmigocarānaṃ
analyzed: etāya ati etāya visesa saṃvaṇṇanāya sabbesam hārānaṃ bhūmi gocarānaṃ
translated: It is investigated by this, thus it is a reason . By this distinguishing description all the Modes and the spheres of the Modes are investigated,

original: yuttāyutti vicārīyati, iti vicāraṇakāraṇattā “etāyā”ti padena niddiṭṭhā visesasaṃvaṇṇanā
analyzed: vicārīyati iti vicāraṇa kāraṇa ttā etāya iti padena niddiṭṭhā visesa saṃvaṇṇanā
translated: and so this distinguishing description indicated by the words “by this” is called “reason” since it is the cause of the investigation.

original: yutti nāma. Idha uttarapadalopo daṭṭhabbo, yuttiyā vicāraṇā, vicāraṇīyabhāvena sahacaraṇato
analyzed: nāma idha uttara pada lopaḥ daṭṭhabbo yuttiyāḥ vicāraṇā vicāraṇīya bhāvena sahacaraṇato
translated: “Reasoning” is to be regarded as a locative of instrument. Here the last word is dropped. Reasoning is the investigation of a reason. It is a reason because it is associated with the state of being investigated.

original: vā yutti. Sabbahārānaṃ bhūmigocarānaṃ yuttāyuttivicāraṇalakkhaṇo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso yutti hāro.
analyzed: vā sabba hārānam bhūmi gocarānam yutta ayutti vicāraṇa lakkhaṇo saṃvaṇṇanā viseso yutti hāro
translated: As to the “application”: here the last word should be regarded as dropped. The application is the investigation of the application. Or alternatively, the application is the investigation of the application together with the state of being investigated. The application mode is the special method of exposition having the characteristic of the investigation of the application and non-application of all the terms that are the province of the grounds.

original: Padati pavatteti phalaṃ etenāti padaṃ, kāraṇaṃ. Ṭhanti tiṭṭhanti ettha phalāni tadāyattavuttitāyāti🔽ṭhānaṃ, kāraṇaṃ. Padañca taṃ ṭhānañcāti padaṭṭhānaṃ, āsannakāraṇaṃ. Sutte āgatadhammānaṃ🔽padaṭṭhānaṃ vicārīyati etāyāti padaṭṭhānā, visesasaṃvaṇṇanā, vicāraṇalopova, sutte🔽āgatadhammānaṃ padaṭṭhānānaṃ, tesañca padaṭṭhānānaṃ vicāraṇalakkhaṇo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso padaṭṭhāno hāro.🔽Sutte avuttāpi samānalakkhaṇā dhammā lakkhīyanti etena saṃvaṇṇanāvisesenāti lakkhaṇo,
analyzed: pavattā iti phalam etena ati padam kāraṇam ṭhanti tiṭṭhanti ettha phalāni tad āyatta vutti tāya ati 🔽ṭhānam kāraṇam padam ca tam ṭhānam ca ati padaṭṭhānam āsanna kāraṇam sutte āgata dhammānam 🔽padaṭṭhānam vicārīyati etāya ati padaṭṭhānā visesa saṃvaṇṇanā vicāraṇa lopaḥ u va sutte 🔽āgata dhammānam padaṭṭhānānam tesam ca padaṭṭhānānam vicāraṇa lakkhaṇaḥ saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ padaṭṭhānaḥ hāro 🔽sutte a vuttā api samāna lakkhaṇāḥ dhammāḥ lakkhīyanti etena saṃvaṇṇanā visesena ati lakkhaṇaḥ
translated: As to the “root”: the root is the cause. The fruit is caused to occur by it. The root is the cause. The fruits are found there, because they exist in dependence on it.🔽The root is the cause. The root is the cause. The root is the cause. The root is the cause. The root is the cause. original: sutte vuttena dhammena samānalakkhaṇānaṃ dhammānaṃ avuttānampi niddhāraṇalakkhaṇo🔽saṃvaṇṇanāviseso lakkhaṇo hāro.
analyzed: sutte vuttena dhammena samāna lakkhaṇānam dhammānam avuttānam pi niddhāraṇa lakkhaṇaḥ  saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ lakkhaṇaḥ hāro
translated: The Mode Conveying Description is the characteristic of discerning, by means of a Dhamma stated in a Thread, other unstated dhammas that have the same characteristic.

original: Sutte dassiyamānā nibbacanādayo cattāropi viyūhīyanti vibhāgena sampiṇḍīyanti ettha,🔽etena vāti byūho, catunnaṃ nibbacanādīnaṃ byūho catubyūho. Nibbacanādhippāyabyañjanānañceva🔽desanānidānassa ca pubbāparena saddhiṃ sandassanalakkhaṇo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso catubyūho hāro.
analyzed: sutte dassiyamānāḥ nibbacana ādayo cattāro api viyūhīyanti vibhāgena sampiṇḍīyanti ettha  etena vāti byūhaḥ catunnam nibbacana ādīnam byūhaḥ catu byūhaḥ nibbacana adhippāya byañjanānam ca iva  desanā nidānassa ca pubba aparena saddhim sandassana lakkhaṇaḥ saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ catu byūhaḥ hāro
translated: The Mode Conveying a Group is the characteristic of a description that combines and distributes the four kinds of phrasing, namely, phrasing for the purpose of bringing out, phrasing for the purpose of counterac-tion, phrasing for the purpose of neither, and phrasing for the purpose of conversion, which are shown in a Thread.🔽The Mode Conveying a Conversion is the characteristic of a description that demonstrates the phrasing for the purpose of bringing out and the phrasing for the purpose of neither together with the phrasing for the purpose of counteraction and the phrasing for the purpose of conversion, respectively, by means of the prior and subsequent.🔽The Mode Conveying a Conversion is the characteristic of a description that combines and distributes the four kinds of phrasing, namely, phrasing for the purpose of bringing out, phrasing for the purpose of counteraction, phrasing for the purpose of neither, and phrasing for the purpose of conversion.

original: Desanāya gahitadhammena sabhāgā, visabhāgā ca dhammā āvaṭṭīyanti ettha, etena vāti🔽āvaṭṭo, desanāya gahitadhammānaṃ sabhāgavisabhāgadhammavasena āvaṭṭanalakkhaṇo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso āvaṭṭo hāro.
analyzed: desanāya gahita dhammena sabhāgāḥ visabhāgā ca dhammāḥ āvaṭṭīyanti ettha etena vāti 🔽āvaṭṭaḥ desanāya gahita dhammānam sabhāga visabhāga dhamma vasena āvaṭṭana lakkhaṇaḥ saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ āvaṭṭaḥ hāro
translated: The Mode Conveying a Conversion is the characteristic of a description that combines and distributes the four kinds of phrasing, namely, phrasing for the purpose of bringing out, phrasing for the purpose of counteraction, phrasing for the purpose of neither, and phrasing for the purpose of conversion.

original: Asādhāraṇāsādhāraṇānaṃ saṃkilesadhamme, vodānadhamme ca sādhāraṇāsādhāraṇato, padaṭṭhānato, bhūmito ca vibhajanalakkhaṇo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso vibhatti hāro.🔽Sutte niddiṭṭhā dhammā paṭipakkhavasena parivattīyanti iminā, ettha vāti parivatto, sutte niddiṭṭhānaṃ dhammānaṃ paṭipakkhato parivattanalakkhaṇo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso parivattano hāro.🔽Sutte vuttassa ekasseva atthassa vācakaṃ vividhaṃ vacanaṃ ettha saṃvaṇṇanāviseseti
analyzed: asādhāraṇa asādhāraṇānam saṃkilesa dhamme vodāna dhamme ca sādhāraṇa asādhāraṇato padaṭṭhānato bhūmito ca vibhajana lakkhaṇaḥ saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ vibhatti hāro  sutte niddiṭṭhāḥ dhammā paṭipakkha vasena parivattīyanti iminā ettha vā ati parivattaḥ sutte niddiṭṭhānam dhammānam paṭipakkhato parivattana lakkhaṇaḥ saṃvaṇṇanā viseso parivattanaḥ hāro  sutte vuttassa ekassa iva atthassa vācakam vividham vacanam ettha saṃvaṇṇanā viseseti
translated: The mode of Conveying an Analysis is the distinguishing of the special method of exposition that has the characteristic of analysing the ideas of corruption and cleansing that are shared and not shared in common, according to what is shared and not shared in common, according to the proximate cause, and according to the plane.🔽The mode of Conveying a Reversal is the distinguishing of the special method of exposition that has the characteristic of reversing the ideas demonstrated in a Thread by way of their opposites.🔽The mode of Conveying Synonyms is the special method of exposition that is called “the explanation” because it is the explanation of the many terms that are the terms for a single meaning stated in a Thread.

original: vivacanaṃ, vivacanameva vevacanaṃ, sutte vutte ekasmiṃ atthe anekapariyāyasaddayojanālakkhaṇo🔽saṃvaṇṇanāviseso vevacano hāro.
analyzed: vivacanam vivacanam eva vevacanam sutte vutte ekasmin atthe aneka pariyāya sadda yojanā lakkhaṇo 🔽saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ vevacanaḥ hāraḥ
translated: The explanation is a synonym. The mode of Conveying Synonyms is the distinguishing of the special method of exposition that has the characteristic of applying many terms to a single meaning stated in a Thread.

original: Sutte vuttā atthā pakārehi ñāpīyanti iminā, ettha vāti paññatti, ekekassa dhammassa anekāhi paññattīhi paññāpetabbākāralakkhaṇo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso paññatti hāro.🔽Suttāgatā dhammā paṭiccasamuppādādīsu otarīyanti anuppavesīyanti ettha, etena vāti otaraṇo, paṭiccasamuppādādimukhehi suttatthassa otaraṇalakkhaṇo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso otaraṇo hāro.🔽Sutte padapadatthapañhārambhā sodhīyanti samādhīyanti ettha, etena vāti sodhano, sutte padapadatthapañhārambhānaṃ sodhanalakkhaṇo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso sodhano hāro.
analyzed: sutte vuttā atthā pakārehi ñāpīyanti iminā ettha vā ti paññatti ekekassa dhammassa anekāhi paññattīhi paññāpetabba ākāra lakkhaṇaḥ saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ paññatti hāro  sutta āgatāḥ dhammā paṭiccasamuppāda ādīsu otarīyanti anuppavesīyanti ettha etena vāti otaraṇaḥ paṭiccasamuppāda ādi mukhehi sutta atthassa otaraṇa lakkhaṇo saṃvaṇṇanā viseso otaraṇaḥ hāro  sutte pada pada attha pañha ārambhā sodhīyanti samādhīyanti ettha etena vā ati sodhanaḥ sutte pada pada attha pañha ārambhānam sodhana lakkhaṇaḥ saṃvaṇṇanā viseso sodhanaḥ hāro
translated: The meaning stated in the sutta is made known by the modes of teaching, thus this is the Mode of Conveying a Teaching, which is a special mode of teaching having the characteristic of the fact that each state of consciousness must be taught by several modes of teaching.🔽The states of consciousness stated in the sutta enter into and penetrate the dependent origination, etc., thus this is the Mode of Conveying an Entry, which is a special mode of teaching having the characteristic of the entry of the meaning of the sutta by way of the dependent origination, etc.

original: Sāmaññavisesabhūtā dhammā vinā vikappena adhiṭṭhīyanti anuppavattīyanti ettha, etena
analyzed: sāmañña visesa bhūtāḥ dhammāḥ vinā vikappena adhiṭṭhīyanti anuppavattīyanti ettha etena
translated: The questions beginning with the words “What is the sutta? What is the meaning? What is the letter? ” are purified and collected here, thus this is the Mode of Conveying a Purification, which is a special mode of teaching having the characteristic of the purification of the questions beginning with the words “What is the sutta? ”

original: vāti adhiṭṭhāno, suttāgatānaṃ dhammānaṃ avikappanavasena sāmaññavisesaniddhāraṇalakkhaṇo
analyzed: vāti adhiṭṭhāno sutta āgatānam dhammānam a vikappana vasena sāmañña visesa niddhāraṇa lakkhaṇo
translated: The states of consciousness stated in the sutta are resolved upon without distinction, thus this is the Mode of Conveying a Resolution, which is a special mode of teaching having the characteristic of the resolution of the states of consciousness stated in the sutta by way of their general and particular natures.

original: saṃvaṇṇanāviseso adhiṭṭhāno hāro.🔽Yo hetu ceva paccayo ca phalaṃ parikaroti abhisaṅkharoti, iti so hetu ceva paccayo🔽ca parikkhāro, yo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso taṃ parikkhāraṃ hetuñceva paccayañca ācikkhati,🔽iti so saṃvaṇṇanāviseso parikkhāro nāma. Sutte āgatadhammānaṃ parikkhārasaṅkhāte🔽hetupaccaye niddhāretvā saṃvaṇṇanālakkhaṇo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso parikkhāro hāro.🔽Sutte āgatadhammā padaṭṭhānādimukhena samāropīyanti ettha, etena vāti samāropano,🔽sutte āgatadhammānaṃ padaṭṭhānavevacanabhāvapahānasamāropanavicāraṇalakkhaṇo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso
analyzed: saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ adhiṭṭhānaḥ hāro  yaḥ hetu ca iva paccayo ca phalam parikaroti abhisaṅkharoti iti saḥ hetu ca iva paccayo  ca parikkhāro yaḥ saṃvaṇṇanā viseso tam parikkhāram hetuñca iva paccayañca ācikkhati  iti saḥ saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ parikkhāraḥ nāma sutte āgata dhammānam parikkhāra saṅkhāte  hetu paccaye niddhāretvā saṃvaṇṇanā lakkhaṇaḥ saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ parikkhāro hāro  sutte āgata dhammā padaṭṭhāna ādi mukhena ettha etena vā ati samāropanaḥ  sutte āgata dhammānam padaṭṭhāna vevacana bhāva pahāna samāropana vicāraṇa lakkhaṇaḥ saṃvaṇṇanā viseso
translated: The Mode of Conveying a Conversion is a special kind of commendation.🔽The cause and condition that causes the fruit to be prepared and compounded is a cause and a condition that prepares it.🔽The special kind of commendation commends that cause and condition that prepares it as a cause and a condition that prepares it.🔽So that special kind of commendation is called the Mode of Conveying a Conversion.🔽The Mode of Conveying a Conversion is a special kind of commendation that has the characteristic of commendation by discerning the cause and condition that prepares it, which is called the preparation, among the ideas stated in a Thread.🔽🔽The Mode of Conveying a Superimposition is that by means of which ideas stated in a Thread are superimposed here and there by means of a footing, etc., as follows: “This is so because of this.”🔽The Mode of Conveying a Superimposition is a special kind of commendation that has the characteristic of examining the superimposition of a footing and a synonym for ideas stated in a Thread by removing the state of non-footing and non-synonym.

original: samāropano hāro. Bhāvasādhanavasenāpi sabbattha vacanattho vattabboti tassāpi vasena🔽yojetabbanti. Sesaṃ saṃvaṇṇanānusārena ñātabbanti.
analyzed: samāropanaḥ hāraḥ bhāva sādhana vasena api sabbattha vacana atthaḥ vattabbaḥ ti tassa api vasena 🔽yojetabbanti sesam saṃvaṇṇanā anusārena ñātabbanti
