original: samāropayitabbā, eso saṃvaṇṇanāviseso samāropano hāro nāmāti atthayojanā.
analyzed: samāropayitabbā eso saṃvaṇṇanā viseso samāropanaḥ hāraḥ nāma ati attha yojanā
translated: This is the special description called the Mode Conveying a Combined Meaning. This is the construction of the meaning.

original: Ettha ca sīlādikkhandhattayassa pariyāyantaravibhāvanāpāripūrī kathitā, bhāvanāpāripūrī
analyzed: ettha ca sīla ādi kkhandha ttayassa kathitā bhāvanā pāripūrī
translated: And here the fulfilment of the analysis of the three aggregates beginning with virtue by means of another method is stated, and the fulfilment of development

original: ca pahātabbassa pahānena hotīti bhāvanāsamāropanapahānasamāropanāpi dassitāti catubbidho
analyzed: ca pahātabbassa pahānena hoti iti bhāvanā samāropana pahāna samāropanā api dassitā ati catubbidhaḥ
translated: is effected by abandoning what is to be abandoned, so the Mode Conveying a Combined Meaning of Development and the Mode Conveying a Combined Meaning of Abandoning are also shown. Thus it is fourfold.

original: samāropano padaṭṭhānasamāropano, vevacanasamāropano, bhāvanāsamāropano, pahānasamāropanoti.🔽Tattha kāyikasucaritaṃ, vācasikasucaritañca sīlakkhandho, manosucarite anabhijjhā,
analyzed: samāropano padaṭṭhāna samāropano vevacana samāropano bhāvanā samāropano pahāna samāropano ti  tattha kāyika su caritam vācasika su caritam ca sīla kkhandhaḥ manaḥ su carite anabhijjhā
translated: The footing-application is the application of the footing of virtue, concentration, and understanding.

original: abyāpādo ca samādhikkhandho, sammādiṭṭhi paññākkhandho. Sīlakkhandho samādhikkhandhassa
analyzed: abyāpādo ca samādhi kkhandho sammādiṭṭhi paññā kkhandho sīla kkhandho samādhi kkhandhassa
translated: Herein, bodily and verbal good conduct are the virtue category, and non-greed and non-ill-will in the mental good conduct are the concentration category, while right view is the understanding category. The virtue category is the footing for the concentration category,

original: padaṭṭhānaṃ, samādhikkhandho paññākkhandhassa padaṭṭhānaṃ. Sīlakkhandho, samādhikkhandho🔽ca samathassa padaṭṭhānaṃ, paññākkhandho vipassanāya padaṭṭhānaṃ. Samatho rāgavirāgacetovimuttiyā
analyzed: padaṭṭhānam samādhi kkhandho paññā kkhandhassa padaṭṭhānam sīla kkhandho samādhi kkhandho  ca samathassa padaṭṭhānam paññā kkhandho vipassanāya padaṭṭhānam samathaḥ rāga virāga cetaḥ vimuttiyā
translated: and the concentration category is the footing for the understanding category. The virtue category and the concentration category are the footing for serenity,🔽and the understanding category is the footing for insight. Serenity is the footing for the heart-deliverance due to fading of lust,

original: padaṭṭhānaṃ, vipassanā avijjāvirāgapaññāvimuttiyā padaṭṭhānanti evamādi padaṭṭhānasamāropano.
analyzed: padaṭṭhānam vipassanā avijjā virāga paññā vimuttiyāḥ padaṭṭhānam ti evamādi padaṭṭhāna samāropanaḥ
translated: and insight is the footing for the understanding-deliverance due to fading of ignorance. This is how the application of the footing is in the case of the footing of virtue, concentration, and understanding.

original: Rāgavirāgā cetovimutti sekkhaphalaṃ, avijjāvirāgā paññāvimutti asekkhaphalaṃ, idaṃ
analyzed: rāga virāgā cetaḥ vimutti sekkha phalam avijjā virāgā paññā vimutti asekkha phalam idam
translated: The heart-deliverance due to fading of lust is the fruit of the Initiate, and the understanding-deliverance due to fading of ignorance is the fruit of the Adept. This is how the application of the footing is in the case of the footing of the Initiate’s fruit and the Adept’s fruit.

original: vevacanaṃ. Rāgavirāgā cetovimutti anāgāmiphalaṃ, avijjāvirāgā paññāvimutti aggaphalaṃ🔽arahattaṃ, idaṃ vevacanaṃ. Rāgavirāgā cetovimutti kāmadhātusamatikkamanaṃ, avijjāvirāgā🔽cetovimutti tedhātusamatikkamanaṃ, idaṃ vevacanaṃ. Paññindriyaṃ, paññābalaṃ, adhipaññāsikkhā,
analyzed: rāga virāgā cetaḥ vimutti anāgāmi phalam avijjā virāgā paññā vimutti agga phalam  arahattam idam vevacanam rāga virāgā cetaḥ vimutti kāmadhātu samatikkamanam avijjā virāgā  cetaḥ vimutti te dhātu samatikkamanaṃ idam vevacanam paññindriyam paññā balam adhi paññā sikkhā
translated: and the fruit of non-returning is the freedom of mind due to fading of lust, and the supreme fruit of Arahantship is the freedom by understanding due to fading of ignorance.🔽This is the synonyms. The freedom of mind due to fading of lust is the surmounting of the sense-desire element, and the freedom by understanding due to fading of ignorance is the surmounting of the three elements.🔽This is the synonyms. The understanding faculty, the understanding power, the training in understanding,

original: paññākkhandhoti evamādi vevacananti evamādi vevacanasamāropano. Kāye kāyānupassino
analyzed: paññā kkhandhaḥ ti evamādi vevacana nti evamādi vevacana samāropanaḥ kāye kāya anupassino
translated: the understanding category, and so on, are the synonyms. This is the synonyms.🔽When he abides contemplating the body as a body, the four foundations of mindfulness come to fulfilment by development;

original: viharato cattāro satipaṭṭhānā bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchanti, catūsu satipaṭṭhānesu bhāviyamānesu
analyzed: viharataḥ cattāro sati paṭṭhānāḥ bhāvanā pāripūrim gacchanti catūsu sati paṭṭhānesu bhāviyamānesu
translated: when the four foundations of mindfulness are being developed,

original: cattāro sammappadhānā bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchanti, catūsu sammappadhānesu bhāviyamānesu
analyzed: cattāro sammappadhānāḥ bhāvanā pāripūrim gacchanti catūsu sammappadhānesu bhāviyamānesu
translated: the four right endeavours come to fulfilment by development; when the four right endeavours are being developed,

original: cattāro iddhipādā bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchantīti evamādi bhāvanāsamāropano. Kāye kāyānupassī
analyzed: cattāraḥ iddhipādāḥ bhāvanā pāripūrim gacchanti iti evamādi bhāvanā samāropanaḥ kāye kāya anupassī
translated: the four bases for spiritual power come to fulfilment by development. This is the fulfilment by development.🔽When he abides contemplating the body as a body,

original: viharanto asubhe “subha”nti vipallāsaṃ pajahati, kabaḷīkāro cassa āhāro pariññaṃ🔽gacchati, kāmupādānena ca anupādāno bhavati, kāmayogena ca visaṃyutto bhavati, abhijjhākāyaganthena
analyzed: viharantaḥ asubhe vipallāsam pajahati kabaḷīkāro ca ssa āhāro pariññam  gacchati kāma upādānena ca anupādānaḥ bhavati kāma yogena ca visaṃyuttaḥ bhavati abhijjhā kāya ganthena
translated: while he is living contemplating the foul, he abandons the perversion of perceiving beauty in the foul, and his bodily-form nutriment comes to be fully understood,🔽and he is without support through the support of sense desires, and he is unfettered through the fetter of sense desires, and he is unassociated with the bodily tie of covetousness,

original: ca vippayujjati, kāmāsavena ca anāsavo bhavati, kāmoghañca uttiṇṇo bhavati, rāgasallena🔽ca visallo bhavati, rūpūpikā cassa viññāṇaṭṭhiti pariññaṃ gacchati, rūpadhātuyaṃ
analyzed: ca vippayujjati kāma āsavena ca anāsavaḥ bhavati uttiṇṇaḥ bhavati rāga sallena  ca visallaḥ bhavati rūpūpikā cassa viññāṇa ṭṭhiti pariññam gacchati rūpa dhātuyam
translated: and he is without cankers through the canker of sense desires, and he has crossed over the flood of sense desires, and he is without stain through the arrow of passion,

original: cassa rāgo pahīno bhavati, na ca chandāgatiṃ gacchati, vedanāsūti evamādi pahānasamāropanoti🔽evamādi samāropano hāro niyuttoti.
analyzed: cassa rāgaḥ pahīnaḥ bhavati na ca chandāgatim gacchati vedanāsu iti evamādi pahāna samāropanā iti  evamādi samāropanaḥ hāraḥ
translated: and his station of consciousness in the form realm comes to be fully understood, and his passion for the form realm is abandoned, and he does not go by the way of desire, and his feeling … and so on as in the preceding paragraph … is abandoned. This is the Mode of Conveying a Reversal.🔽This is applied.

original: Iti sattibalānurūpā racitā.
analyzed: iti satti bala anurūpā racitā
translated: It is composed in accordance with the strength of the needle.

original: Soḷasahāraniddesavibhāvanā niṭṭhitā.
translated: The exposition of the sixteen kinds of explanation is ended.

original: Nayaniddesavibhāvanā
translated: The exposition of the mode of expression🔽The modes of explanation have been explained by us and are known by us. Now, since it is necessary to ask,

original: 17. Hāraniddesā niddiṭṭhā, amhehi ca ñātā, “katame nayaniddesā”ti pucchitabbattā
analyzed: hāra niddesā niddiṭṭhāḥ amhehi ca ñātā katame naya niddesā ti pucchitabba ttā
translated: “What are the modes of expression? ”

original: “taṇhañcā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Atha vā evaṃ uddesakkameneva hāre niddisitvā idāni naye niddisituṃ
analyzed: taṇham ca atiādi vuttam atha vā evam uddesa kkamena iva hāre niddisitvā idāni naye niddisitum
translated: “Craving and ignorance” and so on is said. Or else, after showing the method by the mere order of the exposition, now in order to show the method he said,

original: “taṇhañcā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha yo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso sutte āgataṃ taṇhañca avijjañca🔽atthato niddhāraṇavasena gahitaṃ taṇhañca avijjañca saṃkilesapakkhaṃ neti, sutte🔽āgatena samathena, sutte āgatāya vipassanāya atthato niddhāraṇavasena vā gahitena
analyzed: taṇham ca atiādi vuttam tattha yaḥ saṃvaṇṇanā viseso sutte āgatam taṇham ca avijjam ca  atthataḥ niddhāraṇa vasena gahitam taṇham ca avijjam ca saṃkilesa pakkham na iti sutte  āgatena samathena sutte āgatāya vipassanāya atthataḥ niddhāraṇa vasena vā gahitena
translated: “Craving and ignorance” and so on. Herein, the difference in the exposition is that he leads the Thread by the meaning, taking craving and ignorance,

original: samathena, gahitāya vipassanāya vodānapakkhaṃ neti, nayanto ca saccehi yojetvā neti,
analyzed: samathena gahitāya vipassanāya vodāna pakkham neti nayantaḥ ca saccehi yojetvā neti
translated: which are stated in the Thread, as the corruption side, and he leads it by the meaning, taking the stilling stated in the Thread, or taking the insight stated in the Thread, as the cleansing side. And he leads it by yoking it to the Truths.

original: ayaṃ saṃvaṇṇanāviseso so nandiyāvaṭṭo nayo nāmāti atthayojanā.🔽Ettha ca atthanayassa bhūmi, saṃvaṇṇanā ca gāthāyaṃ “nayo”ti vuttā, tasmā “saṃvaṇṇanāviseso”ti
analyzed: ayam saṃvaṇṇanā viseso so nandiyāvaṭṭaḥ nayaḥ nāma ati attha yojanā  ettha ca attha nayassa bhūmi saṃvaṇṇanā ca gāthāyam nayo ti vuttā tasmā saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ ti
translated: This is the difference in the exposition. That is called the method of the roundabout of delight. The construing of the meaning is this.

original: vuttaṃ. Na hi atthanayo saṃvaṇṇanā, catusaccapaṭivedhassa anurūpo pubbabhāge anugāhaṇanayo
analyzed: vuttam na hi attha nayaḥ saṃvaṇṇanā catu sacca paṭivedhassa anurūpaḥ pubba bhāge anugāhaṇa nayaḥ
translated: And here the ground of the meaning method and the exposition are stated in the verse as “method” , so it is said that “the difference in the exposition” is stated. For the meaning method is not the exposition. The method that is helpful in the prior-to-attainment stage, which is in conformity with the penetration of the four truths,🔽is called the “exposition” .

original: atthanayova. Tassa pana atthanayassa yā saṃvaṇṇanā ugghaṭitaññuādīnaṃ vasena taṇhādimukhena🔽nayabhūmiracanā pavattā, tassa saṃvaṇṇanāva nayavohāro katoti vitthārato hārasampāte āgamissati.
analyzed: attha nayaḥ uva tassa pana attha nayassa yā saṃvaṇṇanā vasena taṇhā ādi mukhena  naya bhūmi racanā pavattā tassa naya vohāro kato ti vitthārataḥ hāra sampāte āgamissati
translated: and the method is the meaning. But the commentary on that method, which is called “the method of expression” in the sense of craving, etc.,🔽and which is given in the form of a construction of the meaning for those who are quick-witted, etc., will be given in detail in the section on “The Mode of Conveying a Conversion” .🔽The Mode of Conveying a Conversion by Way of a Thread has been demonstrated and is known by us. Now, because it is necessary to ask, “What is the Mode of Conveying a Conversion by Way of a Triad? “ ,

original: Nandiyāvaṭṭanayaniddeso niddiṭṭho, amhehi ca ñāto, “katamo tipukkhalanayaniddeso”ti pucchitabbattā –
analyzed: nandiyāvaṭṭa naya niddesaḥ niddiṭṭhaḥ amhehi ca ñāto katamo tipukkhala naya niddeso ti pucchitabba ttā
translated: the following stanza has been uttered:🔽“That which by means of the unwholesome roots

original: “Yo akusale samūlehi, neti kusale ca kusalamūlehi.
analyzed: yaḥ akusale sa mūlehi na iti kusale ca kusala mūlehi
translated: Leads to the wholesome and by means of the wholesome roots🔽Leads to the wholesome,🔽That which leads to the real, the factual, the true,

original: Bhūtaṃ tathaṃ avitathaṃ, tipukkhalaṃ taṃ nayaṃ āhū”ti. –
analyzed: bhūtam tatham avitatham tipukkhalam tam nayam āhūti
translated: That is called the triad method” .

original: Gāthā vuttā. Tattha yo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso akusale samūlehi attano akusalassa tīhi lobhādīhi
analyzed: gāthā vuttā tattha yaḥ saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ akusale samūlehi attanaḥ akusalassa tīhi lobha ādīhi
translated: Herein, that which by means of the unwholesome roots leads to the wholesome and by means of the wholesome roots leads to the wholesome is a particular kind of commentary. It leads to the unwholesome by means of the three unwholesome roots, greed, etc.,

original: mūlehi saṃkilesapakkhaṃ neti, kusale ca kusalamūlehi tīhi alobhādīhi vodānapakkhaṃ🔽neti, nayanto ca bhūtaṃ kusalākusalaṃ neti, na abhūtaṃ māyāmarīciādayo viya, tathaṃ
analyzed: mūlehi saṃkilesa pakkham neti kusale ca kusala mūlehi tīhi alobha ādīhi vodāna pakkham 🔽na iti ca bhūtam kusala akusalam na iti na abhūtam māyā marīci ādayaḥ
translated: which are on the defilement side, and it leads to the wholesome by means of the three wholesome roots, non-greed, etc., which are on the purification side.🔽And while leading, it leads to the real, the factual, the true, the profitable and unprofitable, and not to the unreal, the untrue, the false, such as magic, mirages, and so on.

original: kusalākusalaṃ neti, na ghaṭādayo viya sammutisaccamattaṃ, avitathaṃ kusalākusalaṃ
analyzed: kusala akusalam na iti na ghaṭa ādayaḥ sammuti sacca mattam avitatham kusala akusalam
translated: They lead to what is profitable and unprofitable, not to mere conventional truth like pots, etc.,

original: neti, na vitathaṃ. Kusalākusalānaṃ sabhāvato vijjamānattā bhūtā paramatthasaccattā🔽tathā, akusalassa iṭṭhavipākatābhāvato, kusalassa ca aniṭṭhavipākatābhāvato vipāke🔽sati avisaṃvādakattā avitathā bhavanti, kusalākusalā hi etesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ “bhūtaṃ, tathaṃ,
analyzed: na iti na vitatham kusala akusalānam sabhāvataḥ vijjamāna ttā bhūtā paramattha sacca ttā  tathā akusalassa iṭṭha vipāka tā bhāvataḥ kusalassa ca aniṭṭha vipāka tā bhāvataḥ vipāke  sati avisaṃvāda kattāḥ avitathāḥ bhavanti kusala akusalāḥ hi etesam tiṇṇam bhūtam
translated: They lead to what is not deceptive, not to what is deceptive. For what is profitable and unprofitable really exist in the ultimate sense.🔽They lead to what is factual, not to what is not factual. For what is unprofitable does not give a desirable result, and what is profitable does not give an undesirable result. So they lead to what is factual, not to what is not factual, because they do not deceive in respect of the result.

original: avitatha”nti padānaṃ kusalākusalavisesanatā daṭṭhabbā.🔽Atha vā akusalamūlehi akusalāni, kusalamūlehi ca kusalāni nayanto ayaṃ nayo bhūtaṃ
analyzed: avitatham ti padānam kusala akusala visesana tā daṭṭhabbā  atha vā akusala mūlehi akusalāni kusala mūlehi ca kusalāni nayantaḥ ayam nayaḥ bhūtam
translated: For what is profitable and unprofitable should be regarded as the particular definition of the three terms “factual,” “true,” and “not deceptive.”🔽Or alternatively, this method leads to what is profitable and unprofitable by means of the roots of what is profitable and unprofitable. So it leads to what is factual, to what is true, to what is not deceptive, and it reveals the four noble truths.

original: tathaṃ avitathaṃ neti cattāri saccāni niddhāretvā yojeti. Dukkhādīni hi bādhakādibhāvato
analyzed: tatham avitatham na iti cattāri saccāni niddhāretvā yojeti dukkha ādīni hi bādhaka ādi bhāvato
translated: For the truths of suffering, etc., are factual because they are not otherwise in the way of being what is to be sorrowed, etc.,

original: aññathābhāvābhāvena bhūtāni, saccasabhāvattā tathāni, avisaṃvādanato avitathāni.
analyzed: aññathābhāva abhāvena bhūtāni sacca sabhāva ttā tathāni avisaṃvādanataḥ avitathāni
translated: They are true because they have the nature of truths. They are not deceptive because they do not deceive.

original: Vuttañhetaṃ bhagavatā – “cattārimāni, bhikkhave, tathāni avitathāni anaññathānī”ti
analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā cattāri imāni bhikkhave tathāni avitathāni anaññathāni iti
translated: For this is said by the Blessed One: “Bhikkhus, there are these four suchnesses, not otherwise” .🔽The Thread-Meaning. analyzed: tattha tīhi hetūhi pukkhalo sobhano ti ti pukkhalaḥ akusala ādikaḥ attha nayaḥ saṃvaṇṇanā viseso ti ṭhāna upacārato tipukkhala nayaḥ nāma ati vitthāraḥ pana hāra sampāte āgamissati
translated: The Thread-Meaning. The Thread-meaning of the unprofitable, etc., is led by the method of the four Truths’ interpretation.🔽The Thread-Meaning. The Thread-meaning of the unprofitable, etc., is led by the method of the four Truths’ interpretation.

original: Gāthā vuttā. Tattha yo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso sutte vuttehi vipallāsehi kilese saṃkilesapakkhaṃ
analyzed: gāthā vuttā tattha yaḥ saṃvaṇṇanā viseso sutte vuttehi vipallāsehi kilese saṃkilesa pakkham
translated: The Thread-Meaning. The Thread-meaning of the unprofitable, etc., is led by the method of the four Truths’ interpretation.🔽The Thread-Meaning. The Thread-meaning

original: neti, sutte vuttehi indriyehi saddhamme vodānapakkhaṃ neti, etaṃ saṃvaṇṇanāvisesaṃ
analyzed: na iti sutte vuttehi indriyehi saddhamme vodāna pakkham na iti etam saṃvaṇṇanā visesam
translated: “No” : it is the good ideas that are the side of purification that are “no” in the sense of the faculties stated in the sutta . This is the special commendation.

original: nayavidū saddhammanayakovidā, atthanayakusalā eva vā sīhavikkīḷitaṃ nayanti āhūti atthayojanā.
analyzed: naya vidū saddhamma naya kovidāḥ attha naya kusalāḥ eva vā sīha vikkīḷitam nayanti āhūti attha yojanā
translated: Those who know the way are the good ideas’ way-knowers, or else they are skilled in the way of the meaning. They are called “lion-roarers” because they roar the lion’s roar in the way stated in the sutta . This is the interpretation of the meaning.

original: Tattha vipallāsehīti asubhe subhaṃ, dukkhe sukhaṃ, anicce niccaṃ, anattani attāti
analyzed: tattha vipallāsehi iti asubhe subham dukkhe sukham anicce niccam an attani attā ati
translated: Herein, by the four perversions is by the four perversions of the unbeautiful as beautiful, of suffering as pleasant, of the impermanent as permanent, and of the not-self as self.

original: catūhi vipallāsehi. Indriyehīti saddhādīhi indriyehi. Saddhammeti paṭipattipaṭivedhasaddhamme.
analyzed: catūhi vipallāsehi indriyehi iti saddhā ādīhi indriyehi saddhamme iti paṭipatti paṭivedha saddhamme
translated: By the faculties is by the faculties of faith, etc.,

original: Sesamettha vuttanayameva. Vitthāro pana hārasampāte āgamissatīti.
analyzed: sesam ettha vutta nayam eva vitthāraḥ pana hāra sampāte āgamissati iti
translated: The rest here is as stated in the sutta . The detail, however, will come in the Thread-Array .

original: Sīhavikkīḷitanayaniddeso niddiṭṭho, amhehi ca ñāto, “katamo disālocananayaniddeso”ti pucchitabbattā –
analyzed: sīhavikkīḷita naya niddeso niddiṭṭhaḥ amhehi ca ñāto katamaḥ disālocana naya niddeso ti pucchitabba ttā
translated: The description of the way of the lion’s play has been demonstrated and is known by us. Now, since it is the description of the way of the survey of directions that should be asked about,🔽“In the grammarians’ works,

original: “Veyyākaraṇesu hi ye, kusalākusalā tahiṃ tahiṃ vuttā.
analyzed: veyyākaraṇesu hi ye kusala akusalā tahim tahim vuttā
translated: What is called ‘the survey of directions’🔽Is what the mind looks at here and there,

original: Manasā volokayate, taṃ khu disālocanaṃ āhū”ti. –
analyzed: manasā vā ālokayate tam khu disā ālocanam
translated: At what is good and what is bad.”

original: Gāthā vuttā. “Sīhalocanaṃ āhū”ti pāṭho likhito, so pana na therassa pāṭhoti daṭṭhabbo
analyzed: gāthā vuttā sīha locanam āhu iti pāṭhaḥ likhitaḥ saḥ pana na therassa pāṭhaḥ ti daṭṭhabbo
translated: The verse is recited. The reading “The eye of the lion is called” is written, but that should be seen not to be the Elder’s reading.

original: bhinnalakkhaṇattā. Tattha tahiṃ tahiṃ veyyākaraṇesu ye kusalākusalā nayassa disābhūtā
analyzed: bhinna lakkhaṇa ttā tattha tahim tahim veyyākaraṇesu ye kusala akusalā nayassa
translated: Because of the difference in characteristic. Herein, the states that are wholesome and unwholesome, which are the directions of the method, are stated in the various exegeses.

original: dhammā vuttā, te kusalākusale nayassa disābhūtadhamme abahi abbhantaraṃ citte eva
analyzed: dhammāḥ vuttā te kusala akusale nayassa disābhūta dhamme abahi abbhantaram citte eva
translated: Those states that are the directions of the method, which are wholesome and unwholesome, are the looking that is done in the mind itself, not outside or inside.

original: yaṃ olokanaṃ karoti, taṃ olokanaṃ khu olokanaṃ eva disālocananti āhūti atthayojanā.
analyzed: yam olokanam karoti tam olokanam olokanam eva disālocananti attha yojanā
translated: The looking is called the looking that is the direction-seeing. This is the interpretation of the meaning.

original: Tattha veyyākaraṇesūti tassa tassa atthanayassa yojanatthaṃ katesu suttassa atthavissajjanesu.
analyzed: tattha veyyākaraṇesu iti tassa tassa attha nayassa yojana attham katesu suttassa attha vissajjanesu
translated: Herein, in the various exegeses: in the explanations of the meaning of the sutta made for the purpose of interpreting the meaning of this or that method.

original: Kusalāti vodāniyā. Akusalāti saṃkilesikā. Vuttāti suttato niddhāretvā kathitā. Olokayateti🔽te kusalādidhamme citteneva “ayaṃ paṭhamā disā, ayaṃ dutiyā disā”tiādinā tassa tassa
analyzed: kusalā ati vodāniyā akusalā ati saṃkilesikā vuttā ati suttataḥ niddhāretvā kathitā olokayatā iti  te kusala ādi dhamme cittena iva ayam paṭhamā disā ayam dutiyā disā ati ādinā tassa tassa
translated: Wholesome: purifying. Unwholesome: corrupting. Stated: spoken of after being extracted from the sutta. Looks:

original: nayassa disābhāvena upaparikkhati, vicāretīti attho. Khūti avadhāraṇatthe nipāto,
analyzed: nayassa disā abhāvena upaparikkhati vicāreti iti atthaḥ avadhāraṇa atthe nipātaḥ
translated: he examines those states that are wholesome, etc., by way of their being the directions of this or that method thus, “This is the first direction, this is the second direction,” etc., in the mind itself. The meaning is that he considers them. Khū is a particle in the sense of definition.

original: tena disālocananayo koci atthaviseso na hotīti dassetīti.
analyzed: tena disā ālocanā nayaḥ koci attha viseso na hoti iti dasseti iti
translated: He shows that there is no special meaning in the way of surveying the directions.

original: 21. Disālocananayaniddeso niddiṭṭho. Amhehi ca ñāto. “Katamo aṅkusanayaniddeso”ti
analyzed: disā ālocana naya niddeso niddiṭṭhaḥ amhehi ca ñāto katamaḥ aṅkusa naya niddeso ti
translated: The explanation of the way of surveying the directions is finished. And it is known by us. “What is the explanation of the way of the goad?”

original: pucchitabbattā “oloketvā”tiādigāthā vuttā. Tattha taṃtaṃnayadisābhūte sabbe kusalākusale
analyzed: pucchitabba ttā oloketvā iti ādi gāthā vuttā tattha taṃ taṃ naya disābhūte sabbe kusala akusale
translated: Because it should be asked, the verse beginning with “having surveyed” is stated. Therein, having surveyed all the wholesome and unwholesome

original: disālocanena oloketvā ukkhipiya suttato uddharitvā yaṃ samāneti yaṃ samānayanaṃ karoti,
analyzed: disa ālocanena oloketvā ukkhipiya suttataḥ uddharitvā yam samāneti yam samānayanam karoti
translated: directions which are like the directions, having lifted up, having extracted from the Thread, he who brings together, he who makes the bringing together,

original: ayaṃ samānayanasaṅkhāto nayo aṅkuso nayo nāmāti atthayojanā.🔽Ettha ca aṅkuso nāma hatthīnaṃ icchitaṭṭhānaṃ ānayanakāraṇabhūto vajirādimayo tikkhaggo
analyzed: ayam samānayana saṅkhātaḥ nayaḥ aṅkusaḥ nayaḥ nāma ati attha yojanā  ettha ca aṅkusaḥ nāma hatthīnam icchita ṭṭhānam ānayana kāraṇa bhūtaḥ vajira ādi mayaḥ tikkhaggo
translated: this way called bringing together is called the way of the goad. This is the interpretation of the meaning.

original: ujuvaṅkabhūto dabbasambhāraviseso, ayampi nayo aṅkuso viyāti atthena aṅkuso. Etena
analyzed: uju vaṅka bhūtaḥ dabba sambhāra visesaḥ ayam pi nayaḥ aṅkusaḥ viyāti atthena aṅkusaḥ etena
translated: And here the goad is a sharp point made of iron, etc., which is a special kind of strength of will, and is like a straight pin, that is a cause for bringing the elephants to the place they want to go to. This way is called the goad because it is like the goad.

original: hi nayena icchitaṃ suttatthaṃ nayatīti. Mukhyato pana aṅke vijjhanaṭṭhāne uddhaṭo
analyzed: hi nayena icchitam sutta ttham nayati iti mukhyatas pana aṅke vijjhana ṭṭhāne uddhaṭaḥ
translated: For by this way the meaning of the Thread that is wanted is brought. But primarily the goad is that which is extracted from the place of the goad in the yoke-pole.

original: asati anto pavisatīti aṅkuso. Aṅkasaddūpapadaupubbaasadhātu apaccayoti. Ayampi nayo
analyzed: asati antar pavisati iti aṅkusaḥ a paccayaḥ ti ayam pi nayaḥ
translated: and if there is no inside, it enters, thus it is a goad. The element upa is a prefix meaning near, and the element -pad means foot. This is the method.

original: kocipi atthaviseso na hotīti.
analyzed: koci pi attha viseso na hoti iti
translated: There is no other special meaning.

original: Soḷasa hāraniddesā ceva pañca nayaniddesā ca ācariyena niddiṭṭhā. Amhehi ca ñātā, “saṃvaṇṇetabbasutte kiṃ soḷasa hārā paṭhamaṃ yojetabbā, udāhu nayā”ti pucchitabbattā –
analyzed: soḷasa hāra niddesā ca iva pañca naya niddesā ca ācariyena niddiṭṭhā amhehi ca ñātā saṃvaṇṇetabba sutte kim soḷasa hārā paṭhamam yojetabbā udāhu nayā ti pucchitabba ttā
translated: The sixteen kinds of Thread and the five methods of expounding have been demonstrated by the teacher and are known by us. But since it has to be asked, “In the case of a Thread to be expounded, should the sixteen kinds of Thread be yoked first or the methods of expounding? “

original: “Soḷasa hārā paṭhamaṃ, disālocanato disā viloketvā.
analyzed: paṭhamam disā ālocanataḥ disā
translated: The sixteen kinds of Thread first, because of the need to look at the directions.

original: Saṅkhipiya aṅkusena hi, nayehi tihi niddise sutta”nti. –🔽Gāthamāha. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana “evaṃ hāre, naye ca niddisitvā idāni nesaṃ yojanakkamaṃ🔽dassento ‘soḷasa hārā paṭhama’ntiādimāhā”ti vuttaṃ. Tattha soḷasa hārā byañjanapariyeṭṭhibhāvato
analyzed: saṅkhipiya aṅkusena hi nayehi tihi niddise suttanti  gātham āha aṭṭhakathā ayam pana evam hāre naye ca niddisitvā idāni yojana kkamam  dassentaḥ soḷasa hārā paṭhama nti ādim āha ati vuttam tattha soḷasa hārāḥ byañjana pariyeṭṭhi bhāvato
translated: Having looked at the directions, the Thread should be expounded by means of the three methods of expounding, namely, the goad.🔽He said this verse. But in the commentary it is said: “Having thus demonstrated the kinds of Thread and the methods of expounding, he now shows the order of yoking them.🔽Saying ‘The sixteen kinds of Thread first’ he said this verse. “ Therein, the sixteen kinds of Thread should be yoked first in the Thread to be expounded, because of the need to search for the phrasing,

original: saṃvaṇṇetabbasutte saṃvaṇṇanābhāvena paṭhamaṃ yojetabbā, yojentena niddiṭṭhā hārānukkameneva
analyzed: saṃvaṇṇetabba sutte saṃvaṇṇanā bhāvena paṭhamam yojetabbā yojentena niddiṭṭhāḥ hāra anukkamena iva
translated: and because of the need to expound it by means of the sixteen kinds of Thread demonstrated by the one who is yoking them, in the order in which they are demonstrated.

original: yojetabbā, na uppaṭipāṭiyā. Hārasaṃvaṇṇanānukkamena saṃvaṇṇetabbaṃ paṭhamaṃ saṃvaṇṇetvā
analyzed: yojetabbā na uppaṭi pāṭiyā hāra saṃvaṇṇana anukkamena saṃvaṇṇetabbam paṭhamam saṃvaṇṇetvā
translated: They should be arranged in the order of the exposition of the Hāras, and the first should be expounded after expounding the exposition of the Hāras.

original: pacchā disālocanena oloketvā aṅkusanayena netvā tīhi atthanayehi niddiseti adhippāyo.
analyzed: pacchā disā ālocanena oloketvā aṅkusa nayena netvā tīhi attha nayehi niddiseti adhippāyaḥ
translated: Then, after looking at them by means of the survey of the directions, he should lead them by means of the method of the goad and demonstrate them by means of the three methods of interpretation, namely, the meaning, the phrasing, and the disposition.

original: Iti sattibalānurūpā racitā
analyzed: iti satti bala anurūpā racitā
translated: Thus it has been composed in accordance with the strength of the sword.

original: Nayaniddesavibhāvanā niṭṭhitā.
translated: The demonstration of the demonstration of the method of interpretation is finished.

original: Dvādasapadavibhāvanā
analyzed: dvādasa pada vibhāvanā
translated: The demonstration of the twelve terms

original: Nettivisayaṃ sāsanavarasaṅkhātaṃ saṃvaṇṇetabbasuttaṃ yesaṃ byañjanapadānaṃ, atthapadānañca
analyzed: netti visayam sāsana vara saṅkhātam saṃvaṇṇetabba suttam yesam byañjana padānam attha padānam ca
translated: The sutta that is to be expounded, which is called the essence of the Dispensation, the sphere of the Netti, is called a sutta by means of the terms of phrasing and the terms of meaning

original: vasena “dvādasa padāni sutta”nti saṅgahavāre vuttaṃ, “katamāni tānī”ti pucchitabbattā
analyzed: vasena dvādasa padāni suttanti saṅgaha vāre vuttam katamāni tāni iti pucchitabbattā
translated: that are stated in the section on the collection of terms as “twelve terms.” Since it is asked, “What are they?”

original: sarūpato niddisituṃ –
analyzed: sarūpataḥ niddisitum
translated: they are demonstrated in their own form thus:

original: “Akkharaṃ padaṃ byañjanaṃ, nirutti tatheva niddeso.
analyzed: akkharam padam byañjanam nirutti tathā iva niddeso
translated: “Letter, word, phrasing, expression, and likewise demonstration,

original: Ākārachaṭṭhavacanaṃ, ettāva byañjanaṃ sabbaṃ.
analyzed: ākāra chaṭṭha vacanam byañjanam sabbam
translated: Form, sixth case, and statement: all this is phrasing.

original: Saṅkāsanā pakāsanā, vivaraṇā vibhajanuttānīkammapaññatti.
analyzed: saṅkāsanā pakāsanā vivaraṇā
translated: Persuasion, explanation, elucidation, analysis, and demonstration:

original: Etehi chahi padehi, attho kammañca niddiṭṭha”nti. –
analyzed: etehi chahi padehi atthaḥ kammañca niddiṭṭhanti
translated: By means of these six terms the meaning and the action are demonstrated.”

original: Gāthādvayaṃ vuttaṃ. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana “idāni yesaṃ byañjanapadānaṃ, atthapadānañca
analyzed: gāthā dvayam vuttam aṭṭhakathā ayam pana idāni yesam byañjana padānam attha padānam ca
translated: The two verses have been quoted. But in the commentary it is said: “Now, in order to point out those terms, the syllables and the words,

original: vasena ‘dvādasa padāni ‘sutta’nti vuttaṃ, tāni padāni niddisituṃ ‘akkharapada’ntiādimāhā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vasena dvādasa padāni suttan ti vuttam tāni padāni niddisitum akkhara pada nti ādim āha ati vuttam
translated: by means of which the twelve terms have been said to be the Thread, he said ‘The syllable-term’ and so on.”

original: Tattha kenaṭṭhena akkharanti? Akkharaṭṭhena asañcaraṇaṭṭhena. Akārādivaṇṇo hi akārādito🔽ikārādipariyāyaṃ nakkharati, na sañcarati, na saṅkamati. Tenāha aṭṭhakathāyaṃ “apariyosite
analyzed: tattha kena ṭṭhena akkharanti akkhara ṭṭhena a sañcaraṇa ṭṭhena akāra ādi vaṇṇaḥ hi akāra āditaḥ  ikāra ādi pariyāyam nakkharati na sañcarati na saṅkamati tena āha aṭṭhakathāyam a pariyosite
translated: Herein, in what sense is it a syllable? In the sense of a syllable, in the sense of non-transitoriness. For the letter a and so on,

original: pade vaṇṇo akkharaṃ pariyāyavasena akkharaṇato asañcaraṇato”ti. Apariyosite padeti🔽ca vibhatyantabhāvaṃ appatte dviticatukkharavantesu padesu ekadvitikkharamatteyeva
analyzed: pade vaṇṇo akkharam pariyāya vasena akkharaṇataḥ a sañcaraṇato ti a pariyosite pada iti  ca vi bha ti anta bhāvam appatte dviti catur khara vantesu padesu
translated: the letter a and so on does not go by way of the letter i and so on, it does not pass on, it does not go over. Hence it is said in the commentary: “The letter is the letter in the uncompounded word, because of the non-transitoriness of the letter by way of the letter’s own permutation” .🔽When the state of being a compound word has not yet been reached,

original: akkharaṃ nāma, pariyosite padaṃyeva, na akkharanti adhippāyo. Padaṃ pana pavesanato
analyzed: akkharam nāma pariyosite padam yā iva na akkharanti adhippāyaḥ padam pana pavesanato
translated: in the case of the two-letter, three-letter, four-letter, and so on, the letter is called a syllable only, and it is not a word, is the intention. But a word, because it enters into the meaning,

original: atthavasena pariyāyaṃ sañcarantaṃ viya hoti, na evaṃ akārādivaṇṇo avevacanattā. “Mā
analyzed: attha vasena pariyāyam sañcarantam viya hoti na evam akāra ādi vaṇṇaḥ avevacana ttā mā
translated: is as if it went by way of the permutation of the meaning, and the letter a and so on is not like that, because it is not a synonym. “Do not say ‘a’ but say ‘a’ ” .

original: evaṃ maññasī”tiādīsu vā ekakkharapadā mā-kārādi akkharaṃ nāma, vibhatyantaṃ padaṃ pana padameva hoti.
analyzed: evam maññasi itiādīsu vā eka akkhara padā mākāra ādi akkharam nāma vibhati antam padam pana padam eva hoti
translated: or in “He thinks thus” , etc., the single-syllable word is a syllable, but the word ending in a case-affix is a word.

original: Pajjati attho etenāti padaṃ. Taṃ nāmākhyātopasagganipātappabhedena catubbidhaṃ. Tattha
analyzed: pajjati atthaḥ etena ati padam tam nāma ākhyāta upasagga nipāta ppabhedena catubbidham tattha
translated: A word is that by means of which a meaning is made known. It is of four kinds, namely, as name, as verbal root, as prefix, and as indeclinable. Herein,

original: dabbapadhānaṃ “phasso vedanā citta”nti evamādikaṃ nāmapadaṃ. Tattha hi dabbamāvibhūtarūpaṃ,
analyzed: dabba padhānam phassaḥ vedanā cittan ti evamādikam nāma padam tattha hi dabbam āvibhūta rūpam
translated: the word with a verbal root is a name-word such as “contact,” “feeling,” “cognizing,” and so on. Herein, the verbal root is undemonstrated form,

original: kiriyā anāvibhūtarūpā. Kiriyāpadhānaṃ “phusati vedayati vijānātī”ti evamādikaṃ ākhyātapadaṃ🔽nāma. Tattha hi phusanādikiriyā āvibhūtarūpā, dabbamanāvibhūtarūpaṃ. Kiriyāvisesabodhahetubhūtaṃ🔽pa-upa-itievamādikaṃ upasaggapadaṃ nāma. “Cirappavāsiṃ upavuttha”nti evamādīsu hi
analyzed: kiriyā anāvibhūta rūpā kiriyā apadhānam phusati vedayati vijānāti iti evamādikam ākhyāta padam  nāma tattha hi phusana ādi kiriyā āvibhūta rūpā dabbam anāvibhūta rūpam kiriyā visesa bodha hetu bhūtam  upasagga padam nāma cirappavāsim evamādīsu hi
translated: and the action is demonstrated form. The word with an action is a verbal-root word such as “he contacts,” “he feels,” “he cognizes,” and so on.🔽Herein, the action such as contacting is demonstrated form, and the verbal root is undemonstrated form. The word with a prefix is a prefix word such as “pa-upa-iti” , etc. For in such passages as “He has lived long with the prefix words

original: pa-upādisaddā vasanādikiriyāya viyogādivisiṭṭhataṃ dīpenti. Vacanattho pana nāmapadaākhyātapadadvayaṃ
analyzed: paupa ādi saddāḥ vasana ādi kiriyāya dīpenti vacanatthaḥ pana nāma pada ākhyāta pada dvayam
translated: pa- and upa- make known the state of being distinguished by separation, etc., from living, and so on. The meaning of a statement is a pair of words, namely, a name-word and a verbal-root word,

original: upagantvā tassa padadvayassa atthaṃ sajjantīti upasaggāti daṭṭhabbo. Kiriyāya ceva
analyzed: upagantvā tassa pada dvayassa attham sajjanti iti upasaggā ati daṭṭhabbaḥ kiriyāya ca iva
translated: and it is to be regarded as a prefix because it approaches and is prefixed to the two-footed verse.

original: dabbassa ca sarūpavisesapakāsanahetubhūtaṃ “evaṃ, itī”ti evamādikaṃ nipātapadaṃ assapi
analyzed: dabbassa ca sarūpa visesa pakāsana hetu bhūtam evam iti iti evamādikam nipāta padam
translated: The particle words such as “evaṃ, iti” , etc., which are the cause for showing the similarity of the action

original: saṃvaṇṇanāyapi icchitattā, akkharena pana kathaṃ gahitoti ce? Akkharehi suyyamānehi
analyzed: icchita ttā akkharena pana katham gahitā iti ce akkharehi
translated: and the word “dabbamāno” , are also included by the word “saṅkāseti” because they are desired in the explanation. But how is it included by the syllables?

original: suṇantānaṃ visesavidhānassa katattā padapariyosāne padatthasampaṭipatti hoti. Tasmā
analyzed: suṇantānam visesa vidhānassa kata ttā pada pariyosāne padattha sampaṭipatti hoti tasmā
translated: When the syllables are heard, the meaning of the word is understood at the end of the word because the distinction is made by the hearers. Therefore,

original: akkharenapi atthākāro gahitovāti veditabbo. Tena vuttaṃ – “akkharehi saṅkāseti, padehi
analyzed: akkharena api attha ākāraḥ gahitaḥ vā iti veditabbaḥ tena vuttam akkharehi saṅkāseti padehi
translated: it should be understood that the form of the meaning is also included by the syllables. Hence it is said: “He causes to be known by the syllables,

original: pakāseti, akkharehi ca padehi ca ugghaṭetī”ti ca.
analyzed: pakāseti akkharehi ca padehi ca ugghaṭeti iti ca
translated: he makes known by the words, he causes to be understood by the syllables and words.”

original: Vivaraṇā vitthāraṇā. Vibhajanā ca uttānīkammañca paññatti ca vibhajanuttānīkammapaññattīti
analyzed: vivaraṇā vitthāraṇā vibhajanā ca uttānīkammam ca paññatti ca vibhajana uttānīkamma paññatti iti
translated: The explanation, the elaboration, the analysis, the straightening out, and the definition are the “explanation, elaboration, analysis, straightening out, and definition.”

original: samāhāre ayaṃ dvandasamāso. Tattha vibhāgakaraṇaṃ vibhajanaṃ nāma. Byañjanākārehi
analyzed: samāhāre ayam dvanda samāsaḥ tattha vibhāga karaṇam vibhajanam nāma byañjana ākārehi
translated: This is a dvanda compound in the collective sense. Herein, the making of the analysis is called “analysis.” By the forms of the syllables,

original: yo atthākāro niddisiyamāno, so atthākāro vivaraṇavibhajanāti dvīhi atthapadehi niddisito.
analyzed: yaḥ attha ākāraḥ niddisiyamāno saḥ attha ākāraḥ vivaraṇa vibhajanā ati dvīhi attha padehi niddisito
translated: The mode of meaning that is demonstrated by the two terms “demonstration” and “explanation” is the mode of meaning that is demonstrated by the two terms “demonstration” and “explanation.”

original: Pākaṭakaraṇaṃ uttānīkammaṃ nāma. Pakārehi ñāpanaṃ paññatti. Niruttiniddesasaṅkhātehi🔽byañjanapadehi pakāsiyamāno yo atthākāro atthi, so atthākāro uttānīkammapaññattīhi
analyzed: pākaṭa karaṇam uttānīkammam nāma pakārehi ñāpanam paññatti nirutti niddesa saṅkhātehi  byañjana padehi pakāsiyamānaḥ yaḥ atthākāraḥ atthi saḥ atthākāraḥ uttānīkamma paññattīhi
translated: The making evident is called “the act of making plain.” The making known by means of the terms is called “the act of describing.” The mode of meaning that is made evident by means of the terms that are called “the statement” and “the demonstration” is the mode of meaning that is demonstrated by the two terms “the act of making plain” and “the act of describing.”

original: paṭiniddisito. Etehi saṅkāsanādīhi chahi atthapadehi attho suttattho gahito, kammañca🔽ugghaṭanādikammañca niddiṭṭhanti attho. Yena suttatthena ugghaṭitaññuno cittasantānassa🔽sambodhanakiriyāsaṅkhātassa ugghaṭanakammassa nibbatti bhave, so suttattho saṅkāsanāpakāsanākāro
analyzed: paṭiniddisitaḥ etehi saṅkāsana ādīhi chahi attha padehi atthaḥ sutta atthaḥ gahitaḥ kamman ca  ugghaṭana ādi kammañca niddiṭṭhanti atthaḥ yena sutta tthena ugghaṭita ññunaḥ citta santānassa  sambodhana kiriyā saṅkhātassa ugghaṭana kammassa nibbatti bhave saḥ sutta ttho saṅkāsana apakāsana ākāro
translated: By means of these six terms beginning with “the act of arousing,” the meaning of the text is grasped, and the act of arousing, etc.,🔽is demonstrated. The meaning is: “The act of arousing, which is called ‘the act of arousing,’ is produced by means of that meaning of the text by which the consciousness-series of one who has aroused is aroused.”

original: hoti. Yena suttatthena vipañcitaññuno cittasantānassa bodhanakiriyāsaṅkhātassa vipañcanakammassa
analyzed: hoti yena suttatthena vipañcita ññuno citta santānassa bodhana kiriyā saṅkhātassa vipañcana kammassa
translated: The act of arousing is the act of arousing the consciousness-series of one who has aroused. The act of arousing is the act of arousing the consciousness-series of one who has aroused. The act of arousing is the act of arousing the consciousness-series of one who has aroused. The act of arousing is the act of arousing the consciousness-series of one who has aroused. The act of arousing is the act of arousing the consciousness-series of one who has aroused. The act of arousing is the act of arousing the consciousness-series of one who has aroused. The act of arousing is the act of arousing the consciousness-series of one who has aroused. The act of arousing is the act of arousing the consciousness-series of one who has aroused. The act of arousing is the act of arousing the consciousness-series of one who has aroused. The act of arousing is the act of arousing the consciousness-series of one who has aroused. The act of arousing is the act of arousing the consciousness-series of one who has aroused. The act of arousing is the act of arousing the consciousness-series of one who has aroused. The act of arousing is the act of arousing the consciousness-series of one who has aroused. The act of arousing is

original: nibbatti, so suttattho vivaraṇāvibhajanākāro hoti. Yena suttatthena neyyassa cittasantānassa
analyzed: nibbatti so suttatthaḥ vivaraṇa a vibhajana ākāraḥ hoti yena suttatthena neyyassa citta santānassa
translated: The meaning of the sutta is the mode of the disclosure and analysis.

original: pabodhanakiriyāsaṅkhātassa nayakammassa nibbatti, so suttattho uttānīkammapaññattākāro🔽hotīti daṭṭhabbo. Tenāha aṭṭhakathācariyo “suttatthena hi desanāya pavattiyamānena🔽ugghaṭitaññuādiveneyyānaṃ cittasantānassa pabodhanakiriyānibbatti, so ca suttattho
analyzed: pabodhana kiriyā saṅkhātassa naya kammassa nibbatti so sutta tthaḥ uttānīkamma paññatta ākāro  hoti iti daṭṭhabbaḥ tena āha aṭṭhakathā cariyaḥ sutta atthena hi desanāya pavattiyamānena  ugghaṭita ññu ādi veneyyānam citta santānassa pabodhana kiriyā nibbatti so ca sutta atthaḥ
translated: The meaning of the sutta is the mode of the act of guiding, which is the act of arousing the stream of consciousness of the disciple who is to be guided.

original: saṅkāsanādiākāro”ti.
analyzed: saṅkāsana ādi ākārā iti
translated: It should be regarded as the mode of the act of directing. Therefore the teacher of the commentary said: “For when the teaching is being given by means of the meaning of the sutta, the act of arousing the stream of consciousness of the disciples who are of the type that is to be guided by the meaning of the sutta is produced. And that meaning of the sutta is the mode of the act of directing, etc.”

original: “Yathāvuttehi tīhi atthanayehi ceva chahi atthapadehi ca ayuttopi attho kiṃ koci atthi, udāhu sabbo attho yutto evā”ti pucchitabbattā –
analyzed: yathā vuttehi tīhi attha nayehi ca iva chahi attha padehi ca ayuttaḥ api attho kim koci atthi udāhu sabbaḥ atthaḥ yuttaḥ eva ati pucchitabbattā
translated: “Is there any meaning that is not included in the three methods of teaching and the six kinds of sense-objects of meaning? Or is all meaning included in them?”

original: “Tīṇi ca nayā anūnā, atthassa ca chappadāni gaṇitāni.
analyzed: tīṇi ca nayāḥ anūnāḥ atthassa ca chappadāni gaṇitāni
translated: “The three methods are not less, And the six sense-objects of meaning are counted.

original: Navahi padehi bhagavato, vacanassattho samāyutto”ti. –
analyzed: navahi padehi bhagavataḥ vacanassa atthaḥ samāyuttaḥ ti
translated: The meaning of the Blessed One’s words Is included in the nine terms.”

original: Gāthamāha. Tattha tīṇīti liṅgavipallāsaniddeso, tayoti pana pakatiliṅganiddeso vattabbo.
analyzed: gātham āha tattha tīṇi iti liṅga vipallāsa niddeso tayo ti pana pakati liṅga niddeso vattabbo
translated: He spoke this verse. Herein, three is the indication of the gender reversal; but the indication of the opposite gender should be stated as tayo .

original: Gaṇitā anūnā tayo atthassa nayā ca gaṇitāni anūnāni cha atthassa padāni ca niddiṭṭhāni,
analyzed: gaṇitā anūnā tayo atthassa nayā ca gaṇitāni anūnāni cha atthassa padāni ca niddiṭṭhāni
translated: The three methods of interpretation, which are not less than three, and the six terms of the meaning, which are not less than six, have been demonstrated.

original: niddiṭṭhehi ca atthapadehi bhagavato vacanassa sabbo attho samāyuttova ayutto koci
analyzed: niddiṭṭhehi ca attha padehi bhagavataḥ vacanassa sabbaḥ attho samāyuttaḥ iva ayuttaḥ koci
translated: And since the terms of the meaning have been demonstrated, the whole meaning of the Blessed One’s word is included, and there is none left out.

original: attho natthīti yojanā kātabbā. Atthassāti suttatthassa. Nayāti nettiatthanayā. Padānīti nettiatthapadāni.
analyzed: atthaḥ natthi iti yojanā kātabbā atthassa ati sutta atthassa nayā ati netti attha nayā padāni iti netti attha padāni
translated: This is how the construction should be understood. The meaning is the meaning of the sutta. The method is the method of the Netti. The terms are the terms of the Netti.

original: 26. Ye hārādayo niddiṭṭhā, te hārādayo sampiṇḍetvā nettippakaraṇassa padatthe sukhaggahaṇatthaṃ
analyzed: ye hāra ādayaḥ niddiṭṭhā te hāra ādayaḥ sampiṇḍetvā netti pakaraṇassa padatthe sukha ggahaṇa attham
translated: The methods, etc., that have been demonstrated are to be included in the methods, etc., and the meaning of the Netti-Pakaraṇa is to be grasped easily.

original: gaṇanavasena paricchinditvā dassento “atthassā”tiādimāha. Tattha atthassa samūhassa
analyzed: gaṇana vasena paricchinditvā dassentaḥ atthassa ati ādim āha tattha atthassa samūhassa
translated: So, in order to show it by defining it numerically, he said “The meaning’s” , etc. Herein, the meaning’s is the meaning’s🔽The nine kinds of terms of the meaning are the terms of the meaning of the letter of the sutta. They are demonstrated

original: avayavabhūtāni navabhedāni atthapadāni suttabyañjanassa atthassa pariyeṭṭhisaṅkhātāya
analyzed: avayava bhūtāni nava bhedāni attha padāni sutta byañjanassa atthassa pariyeṭṭhi saṅkhātāya
translated: by the search

original: saṃvaṇṇanāya gaṇanato catuvīsati byañjanapadāni honti, atthapadabyañjanapadabhūtaṃ
analyzed: saṃvaṇṇanāya gaṇanataḥ catuvīsati byañjana padāni honti attha pada byañjana pada bhūtam
translated: The terms of expression are twenty-four, being four times the six terms of expression of the analysis.🔽The two, namely, the terms of meaning and the terms of expression, are thirty-three in all when they are condensed and combined.

original: ubhayaṃ saṅkhepayato sampiṇḍayato tettiṃsā tettiṃsavidhā ettikā tettiṃsavidhāva nettīti yojanā.
analyzed: ubhayam saṅkhepayataḥ sampiṇḍayataḥ tettiṃsā tettiṃsavidhā ettikā tettiṃsavidhā ava netti iti yojanā
translated: The method is this: “Thirty-three in all, and only thirty-three.”

original: Tattha navappadānīti tayo atthanayā, cha atthapadāni ca. Catubbīsāti soḷasa hārā,
analyzed: tattha nava padāni iti tayo atthanayā cha attha padāni ca catubbīsā ati soḷasa hārā
translated: Herein, the nine terms are the three methods of the meaning, and the six terms of meaning. The four times twenty-four are the sixteen modes,

original: cha byañjanapadāni, dve disālocananayaaṅkusanayā cāti evaṃ tettiṃsavidhā ca netti
analyzed: cha byañjana padāni dve ca ati evam tettiṃsavidhā ca
translated: the six terms of expression, and the two methods, namely, the method of directions and the method of hooks. So the Netti is of thirty-three kinds.

original: nāma, ito vinimutto añño koci nettipadattho natthīti attho daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: nāma itas vinimuttaḥ aññaḥ koci na itti padattho natthi iti atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: The meaning is that there is no other meaning of the terms of the Netti apart from this.

original: “Evaṃ tettiṃsapadatthāya nettiyā hāranayānaṃ katamo desanāhāravicayahāro”tiādi desanākkameneva
analyzed: evam tettiṃsa pada tthāya nettiyāḥ hāra nayānam katamaḥ desanā hāra vicaya hāra uti ādi desanā kkamena iva
translated: “In the Netti’s thirty-three terms, which is the mode of teaching called ‘analysis of the teaching’?” and so on.

original: siddho, evaṃ siddhe satipi “soḷasa hārā paṭhama”nti ārambho “sabbepime hārā ceva
analyzed: siddhaḥ evam siddhe sati pi soḷasa hārā paṭhamanti ārambho sabbe pi me hārā ca iva
translated: The order of teaching is established thus. Although it is established thus, the beginning is made with “The sixteen modes first.”

original: nayā ca iminā dassitakkameneva saṃvaṇṇetabbesu suttesu saṃvaṇṇanāvasena yojetabbā,
analyzed: nayā ca iminā dassita kkamena iva saṃvaṇṇetabbesu suttesu saṃvaṇṇanā vasena yojetabbā
translated: All these modes and methods should be applied to the suttas to be commented upon by commentarial exposition in the very order shown.

original: na uppaṭipāṭiyā”ti imamatthaṃ dīpeti. Dīpanavacanasavanānusārena ñāpeti, tasmā evaṃ🔽kamo dassito, assādādīnavanissaraṇāni dhammadesanāya nissayāni, phalañca dhammadesanāya🔽phalaṃ, upāyo ca dhammadesanāya upāyo, āṇatti ca dhammadesanāya sarīraṃ. Desanāhārassa
analyzed: na imam attham dīpeti dīpana vacana savana anusārena tasmai evam  kamaḥ dassitaḥ assāda ādīnava nissaraṇāni dhamma desanāya nissayāni phalam ca dhamma desanāya  phalam upāyo ca dhamma desanāya upāyaḥ āṇatti ca dhamma desanāya sarīram desanā āhārassa
translated: and not in the order in which they arise. He makes this meaning clear by the words of the explanation. He makes it known in accordance with the hearing of the explanation. Therefore the order is shown thus. The enjoyments, etc., are the bases of the teaching of the Dhamma. The fruit is the fruit of the teaching of the Dhamma. The means is the means of the teaching of the Dhamma. The command is the body of the teaching of the Dhamma. The food of the teaching

original: tāsaṃ assādādīnavanissaraṇaphalupāyāṇattīnaṃ vibhāvanasabhāvattā.
analyzed: tāsam assāda ādīnava nissaraṇa phala upāyāṇattīnam vibhāvana sabhāvat tā
translated: and not in the order in which they arise. He makes this meaning clear. He makes it known by the method of teaching in the way in which the Thread is stated. That is why the order is shown thus. The gratification, etc., are the grounds for teaching the True Idea. And the fruit is the fruit of teaching the True Idea. And the means is the means for teaching the True Idea. And the direction is the body of teaching the True Idea. Because the teaching of the True Idea is the specific-nature cause for the exposition of those three, namely, the gratification, etc., the escape, and the fruit and the means.

original: Niddhāraṇena vināpi pakatiyā sabbasaṃvaṇṇetabbasuttesu anarūpāti suviññeyyattā, saṃvaṇṇanāvisesānaṃ vicayahārādīnaṃ nissayabhāvato ca paṭhamaṃ desanāhāro dassito.
analyzed: niddhāraṇena vinā api pakatiyā sabba saṃvaṇṇetabba suttesu anarūpā ati su viññeyya ttā saṃvaṇṇanā visesānam vicaya hāra ādīnam nissaya bhāvato ca paṭhamam desanā āhāraḥ dassito
translated: And although without any indication, the teaching of the True Idea is shown first because it is easy to understand in all Threads that are praiseworthy by nature, and because the analysis-as-investigation, etc., are the grounds for the distinctions in the praise.

original: Padapucchāvissajjanāpucchāpadānugītīhi saddhiṃ desanāhārapadatthānaṃ assādādīnaṃ pavicayabhāvato desanāhārānantaraṃ vicayo hāro.
analyzed: pada pucchā vissajjana āpucchā pada anugītīhi saddhim desanā āhāra pada tthānam assāda ādīnam pavicaya bhāvataḥ desanā āhāra anantaram vicayaḥ hāro
translated: And because of the investigation of the gratification, etc., in the meaning of the words of the teaching of the True Idea together with the questions and answers and the questions and answers with the verses, the investigation Guide-Line is next to the teaching of the True Idea.

original: Vicayahārena pavicitānaṃ atthānaṃ yuttāyuttivicāraṇabhāvato vicayahārānantaraṃ yutti hāro.🔽Padaṭṭhānahārassa yuttāyuttānaṃyeva atthānaṃ upapattianurūpaṃ kāraṇaparamparāya niddhāraṇattā yuttihārānantaraṃ padaṭṭhānahāro.
analyzed: vicaya hārena atthānam yutta a yutti vicāraṇa bhāvataḥ vicaya hāra anantaram  padaṭṭhāna hārassa yutta ayuttānam yeva atthānam upapatti anurūpam kāraṇa paramparāya niddhāraṇa ttā yutti hāra anantaram padaṭṭhāna hāraḥ
translated: The Mode of Conveying a Conversion is next to the Mode of Conveying Requisites because it is a consideration of what is requisite and what is not in the case of the meanings converted by the Conversion-search.🔽The Mode of Conveying a Pervasion is next to the Mode of Conveying Requisites because it is a delimitation by a succession of reasons in accordance with the occurrence of the requisite and the not requisite meanings.

original: Yuttāyuttānaṃ kāraṇaparamparāya pariggahitasabhāvānaṃyeva ca dhammānaṃ avuttānampi samānalakkhaṇatāya gahaṇalakkhaṇattāya padaṭṭhānahārānantaraṃ lakkhaṇahāro.🔽Lakkhaṇahārena atthato suttantarato niddhāritānampi dhammānaṃ nibbacanādīni vattabbāni,
analyzed: yutta ayuttānam kāraṇa paramparāya pariggahita sabhāvānam yeva ca dhammānam avuttānam pi samāna lakkhaṇa tāya gahaṇa lakkhaṇa ttāya padaṭṭhāna hāra anantaram lakkhaṇa hāro  lakkhaṇa hārena atthataḥ sutta antarataḥ niddhāritānam api dhammānam nibbacana ādīni vattabbāni
translated: The Mode of Conveying Characteristics is next to the Mode of Conveying Pervasion because it is a mode of apprehending the characteristics of the states that are delimited by the succession of reasons in the requisite and the not requisite, and it is a mode of apprehending the common characteristic of those states that are not mentioned, too.

original: na sutte sarūpato āgatadhammānaṃyevāti dassanatthaṃ lakkhaṇahārānantaraṃ catubyūho
analyzed: na sutte sarūpataḥ āgata dhammānaṃ yeva ati dassana ttham lakkhaṇa hāra anantaram catu byūhaḥ
translated: The Mode of Conveying Categories is next to the Mode of Conveying Characteristics in order to show that the terms “definition” , etc., should be stated of ideas delimited by a sutta-passage as to meaning and by another sutta-passage as to the teaching, and not only of those that occur in the same way in the sutta-passage.

original: hāro. Evañhi niravasesato atthāvabodho hoti.
analyzed: hāro evam hi niravasesataḥ attha avabodho hoti
translated: For in this way there is an understanding of the meaning without remainder.

original: Catubyūhena hārena vuttehi nibbacanādhippāyanidānehi saddhiṃ sutte padatthānaṃ suttantarasaṃsandanasaṅkhāte
analyzed: catu byūhena hārena vuttehi nibbacana adhippāya nidānehi saddhim sutte padatthānam sutta antara saṃsandana saṅkhāte
translated: The Revolving Guide-Line is shown next to the Fourfold Array Guide-Line because it is easy to show the inclusion of other similar and dissimilar ideas when the guide-lines to the terms of the texts have been shown in the “investigation of what is prior and what subsequent” called “connecting up the texts” .

original: pubbāparavicāre dassite tesaṃ suttapadatthānaṃ sabhāgavisabhāgadhammantarāvaṭṭanaṃ🔽sukhena sakkā dassetunti catubyūhahārānantaraṃ āvaṭṭo hāro. Suttantarasaṃsandanassa
analyzed: pubba apara vicāre dassite tesam sutta padatthānam sabhāga visabhāga dhamma antara avaṭṭanam  sukhena sakkā dassetunti catu byūha hāra anantaram āvaṭṭaḥ hāro suttantara saṃsandanassa
translated: For the Revolving Guide-Line is the means for the inclusion of other similar and dissimilar ideas in the “investigation of what is prior and what subsequent” called “connecting up the texts” .

original: hi sabhāgavisabhāgadhammantarāvaṭṭanayassa upāyabhāvato “ārambhatha nikkamathā”tiādigāthāya
analyzed: hi sabhāga visabhāga dhamma antara avaṭṭa nayassa upāya bhāvataḥ ārambhatha nikkamatha ati ādi gāthāya
translated: For the inclusion of other similar and dissimilar ideas in the “investigation of what is prior and what subsequent” called “connecting up the texts” is the means for the inclusion of other similar and dissimilar ideas in the “investigation of what is prior and what subsequent” called “connecting up the texts” .🔽So after the four kinds of persons beginning with the one who has started and gone forth have been demonstrated by the verse beginning, “So start and go forth” ,

original: ārambhananikkamanabuddhasāsanayogadhunanehi vīriyasamādhipaññindriyāni niddhāretvā
analyzed: ārambhana nikkamana buddha sāsana yoga dhunanehi vīriya samādhi paññindriyāni niddhāretvā
translated: the faculties of energy, concentration, and understanding are demonstrated by the starting, the going forth, the yoke of the Enlightened One’s discipline, and the shaking off.

original: tesu ārambhananikkamanabuddhasāsanayogadhunanesu ananuyogassa mūlaṃ pamādoti suttantare
analyzed: tesu ārambhana nikkamana buddha sāsana yoga dhunanesu ananuyogassa mūlam pamādaḥ ti sutta ntare
translated: And in the case of those four kinds of persons beginning with the one who has started and gone forth, the root of non-application is shown in another text as “carelessness” .

original: dassito pamādo āvaṭṭitoti.
analyzed: dassitaḥ pamādaḥ āvaṭṭito ti
translated: So “carelessness” is included.

original: Āvaṭṭena hārena sabhāgavisabhāgadhammāvaṭṭanena payojite sādhāraṇāsādhāraṇavasena
analyzed: āvaṭṭena hārena sabhāga visabhāga dhamma avaṭṭanena payojite sādhāraṇa asādhāraṇa vasena
translated: When the inclusion of other similar and dissimilar ideas has been effected by the Revolving Guide-Line, the inclusion of other similar and dissimilar ideas in the “investigation of what is prior and what subsequent” called “connecting up the texts” is shown by the common and uncommon terms.

original: saṃkilesavodānadhammānaṃ padaṭṭhānato ceva bhūmito ca vibhāgo sakkā sukhena yojetunti
analyzed: saṃkilesa vodāna dhammānam padaṭṭhānato ca iva bhūmitaḥ ca vibhāgo sakkā sukhena yojetun ti
translated: And it is easy to apply the exposition of the defilement and purification of ideas by way of the footing and plane.

original: āvaṭṭahārānantaraṃ vibhatti hāro.🔽Vibhattihārena saṃkilesavodānadhammānaṃ vibhāge kate saṃvaṇṇetabbasutte āgatā dhammā
analyzed: āvaṭṭa hāra anantaram vibhatti hāraḥ  vibhatti hārena saṃkilesa vodāna dhammānam vibhāge kate saṃvaṇṇetabba sutte āgatāḥ dhammāḥ
translated: So the Mode of Conveying an Investigation comes next to the Mode of Conveying a Reversal.🔽When the exposition of the defilement and purification of ideas has been made by means of the Mode of Conveying an Investigation, then the ideas stated in the Thread to be commended can be turned back from the opposite by the Mode of Conveying a Reversal.

original: akasirena paṭipakkhato parivattetuṃ sakkāti vibhattihārānantaraṃ parivattanahāro.🔽Vibhattihārena hi “sammādiṭṭhissa purisapuggalassa micchādiṭṭhi nijjiṇṇā hotī”ti
analyzed: a kasirena paṭipakkhataḥ parivattetum sakkā ati vibhatti hāra anantaram parivattana hāraḥ  vibhatti hārena hi sammādiṭṭhissa purisa puggalassa micchādiṭṭhi nijjiṇṇā hoti iti
translated: For the Mode of Conveying a Reversal comes next to the Mode of Conveying an Investigation.

original: paṭivibhattasabhāve eva dhamme parivattanahāravibhaṅge udāharīyissati.
analyzed: paṭivibhatta sabhāve eva dhamme parivattana hāra vibhaṅge udāharīyissati
translated: For in the Mode of Conveying a Reversal, which will be illustrated in the Reversal Mode of Conveying in the Description of Purification of View, it is only ideas of the same individual essence that are stated as “For a person with right view, wrong view is worn away” .🔽And although the ideas have been turned back from the opposite by the Mode of Conveying a Reversal, they still have to be made known by synonyms in the Mode of Conveying Synonyms, not only the ideas stated in the Thread to be commended.

original: Parivattanahārena paṭipakkhato parivattitāpi dhammā pariyāyavacanehi bodhetabbā, na saṃvaṇṇetabbasutte āgatadhammāyevāti dassanatthaṃ parivattanahārānantaraṃ vevacanahāro.
analyzed: parivattana hārena paṭipakkhato parivattitā api dhammā pariyāya vacanehi bodhetabbā na saṃvaṇṇetabba sutte āgata dhammāya iva ati dassana ttham parivattana hāra anantaram vevacana hāro
translated: So the Mode of Conveying Synonyms comes next to the Mode of Conveying a Reversal.

original: Vevacanahārena pariyāyato pakāsitānaṃ dhammānaṃ pabhedato paññattivasena vibhajanaṃ sukhena sakkā ñātunti vevacanahārānantaraṃ paññatti hāro.🔽Paññattihārena pabhavapariññādipaññattivibhāgamukhena paṭiccasamuppādasaccādidhammavibhāge
analyzed: vevacana hārena pariyāyataḥ pakāsitānam dhammānam pabhedato paññatti vasena vibhajanam sukhena sakkā ñātun ti vevacana hāra anantaram paññatti hāro  paññatti hārena pabhava pariññā ādi paññatti vibhāga mukhena paṭiccasamuppāda sacca ādi dhamma vibhāge
translated: The mode of Conveying Designation is next to that of Conveying Synonyms because it is possible to know the classification of ideas taught by synonyms in terms of their individual essences by means of the mode of Conveying Categories.

original: kate sutte āgatadhammānaṃ paṭiccasamuppādādimukhena avataraṇaṃ sakkā dassetunti paññattihārānantaraṃ otaraṇo hāro.
analyzed: kate sutte āgata dhammānam paṭiccasamuppāda ādi mukhena avataraṇam sakkā dassetun ti paññatti hāra anantaram otaraṇaḥ hāro
translated: The mode of Conveying Entry is next to that of Conveying Designation because it is possible to show the entry of ideas stated in a sutta by means of the classification of dependent origination, truths, and so on, after the classification of dependent origination, truths, and so on, has been made by means of the categories of the full-understanding of rise, and so on.

original: Otaraṇena hārena dhātāyatanādīsu otāritānaṃ saṃvaṇṇetabbasutte padatthānaṃ pucchārambhasodhanaṃ sakkā sukhena sampādetunti otaraṇahārānantaraṃ sodhano hāro.🔽Sodhanena hārena saṃvaṇṇetabbasutte padapadatthesu visodhitesu tattha tattha ekattatāya
analyzed: otaraṇena hārena dhātā āyatana ādīsu otāritānam saṃvaṇṇetabba sutte padatthānam puccha ārambha sodhanam sakkā sukhena sampādetun ti otaraṇa hāra anantaram sodhanaḥ hāro  sodhanena hārena saṃvaṇṇetabba sutte pada padatthesu visodhitesu tattha tattha ekatta tāya
translated: The mode of Conveying Clearing Up is next to that of Conveying Entry because it is possible to accomplish the clearing up of the beginning of the question about the meaning of the words in a sutta that is to be expounded after entry has been made into the elements, bases, etc., by means of the mode of Conveying Entry.

original: vā vemattatāya vā labbhamānasāmaññavisesabhāvo sukaro hotīti dassetuṃ sodhanahārānantaraṃ adhiṭṭhāno hāro.
analyzed: vā vemattatāya vā labbhamāna sāmañña visesa bhāvo sukaraḥ hoti iti dassetum sodhana hāra anantaram adhiṭṭhānaḥ hāro
translated: The mode of Conveying Establishment is next to that of Conveying Clearing Up in order to show that the common characteristic and particular characteristics that are found in unity or diversity respectively in the meaning of the words in the sutta that is to be expounded after the clearing up of the meaning of the words in the sutta that is to be expounded has been effected by means of the mode of Conveying Clearing Up is easy.

original: Sāmaññavisesabhūtesu sādhāraṇāsādhāraṇesu dhammesu adhiṭṭhānena hārena paveditesu🔽parikkhārasaṅkhātassa sādhāraṇāsādhāraṇarūpassa paccayaheturāsissa pabhedo suviññeyyoti
analyzed: sāmañña visesa bhūtesu sādhāraṇa asādhāraṇesu dhammesu adhiṭṭhānena hārena paveditesu  parikkhāra saṅkhātassa sādhāraṇa asādhāraṇa rūpassa paccaya hetuḥ āsissa pabhedaḥ su viññeyyaḥ ti
translated: The analysis of the conditions for the materiality called “requisites” is easy to understand when the common and uncommon states are pointed out by way of resolution and by way of pre-eminent and non-pre-eminent.🔽

original: adhiṭṭhānahārānantaraṃ parikkhāro hāro.🔽Asādhāraṇe, sādhāraṇe ca kāraṇe parikkhārena hārena dassite tassa attano phalesu
analyzed: adhiṭṭhāna hāra anantaram parikkhāro hāro  asādhāraṇe sādhāraṇe ca kāraṇe parikkhārena hārena dassite tassa attano phalesu
translated: The Mode of Conveying a Conversion is next to the Mode of Conveying a Requisite.🔽The difference between the requisite and the non-requisite is easy to understand in the case of the ideas that are shared in common and those that are not shared in common, which are the special and the ordinary ideas.🔽The Mode of Conveying a Requisite is next to the Mode of Conveying a Conversion.🔽The Mode of Conveying a Conversion is next to the Mode of Conveying a Requisite.

original: kāraṇākāro, tesaṃ hetuphalānaṃ pabhedato desanākāro, bhāvetabbapahātabbadhammānaṃ🔽bhāvanāpahānāni ca niddhāretvā vuccamānāni sammā saṃvaṇṇetabbasuttassa atthaṃ tathattāvabodhāya🔽saṃvattantīti parikkhārahārānantaraṃ samāropano hāro dassito hoti. Idaṃ hārānaṃ dassanānukkamakāraṇaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: kāraṇa ākāraḥ tesam hetu phalānam pabhedataḥ desanā ākāraḥ bhāvetabba pahātabba dhammānam  bhāvanā apahānāni ca niddhāretvā vuccamānāni sammā saṃvaṇṇetabba suttassa attham tathattā avabodhāya  saṃvattanti iti parikkhāra hāra anantaram samāropanaḥ hāraḥ dassitaḥ hoti idam hārānam dassana anukkama kāraṇam daṭṭhabbam
translated: The Mode of Conveying a Conversion is next to the Mode of Conveying a Requisite.🔽The Mode of Conveying a Conversion is next to the Mode of Conveying a Requisite.🔽The Mode of Conveying a Conversion is next to the Mode of Conveying a Requisite.🔽The Mode of Conveying a Conversion is next to the Mode of Conveying a Requisite.🔽The Mode of Conveying a Conversion is next to the Mode of Conveying a Requisite.🔽The Mode of Conveying a Conversion is next to the Mode of Conveying a Requisite.🔽The Mode of Conveying a Conversion is next to the Mode of Conveying a Requisite.🔽The Mode of Conveying a Conversion is next to the Mode of Conveying a Requisite.🔽The Mode of Conveying a Conversion is next to the Mode of Conveying a Requisite.🔽The Mode of Conveying a Conversion is next to the Mode of Conveving a Requisite.🔽The Mode of Conveying a Conversion is next to the Mode of Conveying a Requisite.🔽The Mode of Conveying a Conversion is next to the Mode of Conveying a Requisite.🔽The Mode of Conveying a Conversion is next to the Mode of Conveying a Requisite.🔽The Mode of Conveying a Conversion is next to the Mode of Conveying a Requisite.🔽The Mode of Conveying a Conversion is next to the Mode of Conveying a Requisite.🔽The Mode of Conveying a Conversion is next to the Mode of Conveying a Requisite.🔽The Mode of Conveying a Conversion is next to the Mode of Conveying a Requisite.

original: Uddeso ugghaṭitaññuno upakārāya saṃvattati yathā, evaṃ nandiyāvaṭṭanayo ugghaṭitaññuno
analyzed: uddesaḥ ugghaṭita ññuno upakārāya saṃvattati yathā evam nandiya avaṭṭanayaḥ ugghaṭita ññuno
translated: The Mode of Conveying a Conversion is next to the Mode of Conveying a Requisite.🔽The Mode of Conveying

original: upakārāya saṃvattati, tasmā paṭhamaṃ nandiyāvaṭṭanayo dassito. Niddeso vipañcitaññuno
analyzed: upakārāya saṃvattati tasmai paṭhamam nandiyā vaṭṭa nayaḥ dassitaḥ niddesaḥ vipañcitaññuno
translated: It is helpful for one who has understood the detailed teaching.

original: upakārāya saṃvattati yathā, evaṃ tipukkhalanayo vipañcitaññuno upakārāya saṃvattati,
analyzed: upakārāya saṃvattati yathā evam tipukkhalanayaḥ vipañcitaññunaḥ upakārāya saṃvattati
translated: So too the Triple-Knowledge Method is helpful for one who has understood the detailed teaching.

original: tasmā nandiyāvaṭṭanayānantaraṃ tipukkhalanayo. Paṭiniddeso neyyassa upakārāya saṃvattati
analyzed: tasmā nandiyā vaṭṭanayā anantaram tipukkhalanayo paṭiniddesaḥ neyyassa upakārāya saṃvattati
translated: So after the Method of Conveying a Feeling, the Triple-Knowledge Method is demonstrated. The Method of Conversion is helpful for one to be taught.

original: yathā, evaṃ sīhavikkīḷitanayo neyyassa upakārāya saṃvattati. Tasmā tipukkhalānantaraṃ
analyzed: yathā evam sīhavikkīḷi tanayaḥ upakārāya saṃvattati tasmā tipukkhalā anantaram
translated: So too the Lion’s Play Method is helpful for one to be taught. So after the Triple-Knowledge Method,

original: sīhavikkīḷitanayo dassitoti tiṇṇaṃ atthanayānaṃ dassanānukkamo veditabbo. Atthanayānaṃ
analyzed: sīha vikkīḷi tanayaḥ dassito ti tiṇṇam atthanayānam dassana anukkamaḥ veditabbaḥ atthanayānam
translated: the Lion’s Play Method is demonstrated. This is how the order of the three methods of teaching should be understood.

original: disābhūtāya bhūmiyā āloketvā tesaṃ tassā disāya bhūmiyā samānayanaṃ hoti. Na hi sakkā🔽anoloketvā samānetunti disālocananayaṃ dassetvā aṅkusanayo dassito. Potthakāruḷhāvachekā
analyzed: disābhūtāya bhūmiyā āloketvā tesam tassā disāya bhūmiyā samānayanam hoti na hi sakkā  samānetum ti disā ālocana nayam dassetvā aṅkusa nayaḥ dassitaḥ potthaka āruḷha avachekā
translated: The method of teaching by conversion is demonstrated after the method of teaching by direct instruction. For when the ground in a certain direction has been looked over, the bringing of that ground into line with that direction is done. For it is not possible to bring it into line without looking over.

original: sabbāsu disāsu hatthigamanaṭṭhānaṃ oloketvā aṅkusena icchitaṭṭhānaṃ samānayanti.
analyzed: sabbāsu disāsu hatthi gamana ṭhānam oloketvā aṅkusena icchita ṭṭhānam samānayanti
translated: After demonstrating the method of teaching by conversion, the hook method is demonstrated. For just as a goad-man, after looking over the ground in all directions for a place to go, brings the elephant into line with the place he wants by means of the hook,🔽so too the Exalted One, after looking over the ground in the form of the three methods of teaching, brings the person to be taught into line with the method of teaching that suits him.

original: Keci acchekā anoloketvā vinayanti. Tesaṃ nayanamattameva, na samānayanaṃ. Evameva
analyzed: keci vinayanti tesam nayanam attam eva na samānayanam evam eva
translated: Some, without looking at the text, interpret it in a way that is not in accordance with the text. Their interpretation is only an eye, not a guide.

original: paṇḍitā suttatthaṃ vaṇṇentā manasāva oloketvāva nayā netabbāti daṭṭhabbā.
analyzed: paṇḍitā sutta attham vaṇṇentā manasā āva oloketvā ava nayā netabbā ati daṭṭhabbā
translated: So the wise should be seen to be saying that the meaning of the sutta should be looked at with the mind and guided by the method.

original: Samuṭṭhānasaṃvaṇṇanā adhippāyasaṃvaṇṇanā padatthasaṃvaṇṇanā vidhianuvādasaṃvaṇṇanā🔽nigamanasaṃvaṇṇanāti vā, payojanasaṃvaṇṇanā piṇḍatthasaṃvaṇṇanā anusandhisaṃvaṇṇanā
analyzed: samuṭṭhāna saṃvaṇṇanā adhippāya saṃvaṇṇanā padattha saṃvaṇṇanā vidhi anuvāda saṃvaṇṇanā  nigamana saṃvaṇṇanā ati vā payojana saṃvaṇṇanā piṇḍattha saṃvaṇṇanā anusandhi saṃvaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the origin, the commentary on the purport, the commentary on the meaning of the words, the commentary on the explanation of the method,🔽the commentary on the conclusion, the commentary on the purpose, the commentary on the overall meaning, the commentary on the connection,

original: codanāsaṃvaṇṇanā parihārasaṃvaṇṇanāti vā, upogghāṭasaṃvaṇṇanā padaviggahasaṃvaṇṇanā
analyzed: codanā saṃvaṇṇanā parihāra saṃvaṇṇanā ati vā upogghāṭa saṃvaṇṇanā pada viggaha saṃvaṇṇanā
translated: the commentary on the challenge, the commentary on the reply, the commentary on the analysis, the commentary on the word-meaning, the commentary on the application,

original: padatthacālanasaṃvaṇṇanā paccupaṭṭhānasaṃvaṇṇanāti vā, tathā ekanāḷikākathā caturassakathā🔽nisinnavattikākathāti vā āgatā.
analyzed: padattha cālana saṃvaṇṇanā paccupaṭṭhāna saṃvaṇṇanā ati vā tathā eka nāḷikā kathā caturassa kathā  nisinnavattikā kathā ati vā āgatā
translated: the commentary on the single-threaded story, the commentary on the fourfold story, the commentary on the story of the seated mat, are given.

original: Tattha samuṭṭhānaṃ nidānameva. Vidhianuvādo visesavacanameva. Upogghāṭo nidānameva. Cālanā codanāyeva. Paccupaṭṭhānaṃ parihārova.
analyzed: tattha samuṭṭhānam nidānam eva vidhi anuvādaḥ visesa vacanam eva upogghāṭaḥ nidānam eva cālanā codanāya iva paccupaṭṭhānam parihāraḥ iva
translated: Herein, the origin is the introduction. The explanation of the method is the special explanation. The analysis is the introduction. The word-meaning is the challenge. The application is the reply.

original: Pāḷiṃ vatvā ekekapadassa atthakathanasaṅkhātā saṃvaṇṇanā ekanāḷikākathā nāma.
analyzed: pāḷim vatvā ekeka padassa attha kathana saṅkhātā saṃvaṇṇanā ekanāḷikākathā nāma
translated: The commentary called the “single-thread exposition” is the explanation of the meaning of each word after the text has been recited.

original: Paṭipakkhaṃ dassetvā paṭipakkhassa upamaṃ dassetvā sapakkhaṃ dassetvā sapakkhassa upamaṃ dassetvā kathanasaṅkhātā saṃvaṇṇanā caturassakathā nāma.
analyzed: paṭipakkham dassetvā paṭipakkhassa upamam dassetvā sapakkham dassetvā sapakkhassa upamam dassetvā kathana saṅkhātā saṃvaṇṇanā caturassakathā nāma
translated: The commentary called the “four-cornered exposition” is the explanation which sets forth the opposite, then the simile for the opposite, then the position in agreement with the text, then the simile for the position in agreement with the text.

original: Visabhāgadhammavaseneva pariyosānaṃ gantvā puna sabhāgadhammavaseneva pariyosānagamanasaṅkhātā saṃvaṇṇanā nisinnavattikākathā nāma.🔽Tā sabbā saṃvaṇṇanāyopi desanāhārādīsu nettisaṃvaṇṇanāsu antogadhāyeva. Tenāha “yattakā
analyzed: visabhāga dhamma vasena iva pariyosānam gantvā puna sabhāga dhamma vasena iva pariyosāna gamana saṅkhātā saṃvaṇṇanā nisinnavattikākathā nāma  tā sabbā saṃvaṇṇanāyaḥ api desanā āhāra ādīsu netti saṃvaṇṇanāsu tena āha yattakā
translated: The commentary called the “sitting-mat exposition” is the explanation which ends by the method of dissimilar states and then ends again by the method of similar states.

original: hi suttassa saṃvaṇṇanāvisesā, sabbe te nettiupadesāyattā”ti. Evaṃ ettāvatā etaparamatā🔽daṭṭhabbā. Hetuphalabhūmiupanisāsabhāgavisabhāgalakkhaṇanayādayo pana aṭṭhakathāyaṃ
analyzed: hi suttassa saṃvaṇṇanā visesā sabbe te na itti upadesa āyattā ati evam ettāvatā eta parama tā  daṭṭhabbāḥ hetu phala bhūmi upanisāsa bhāga visabhāga lakkhaṇa naya ādayaḥ pana aṭṭhakathāyam
translated: All these commentaries are included in the “commentaries on the method of interpretation” in the “commentaries on the teaching, the letter, etc.” Therefore it is said: “All the different kinds of commentary on the sutta are included in the commentaries on the method of interpretation.” Thus far the limit of this matter should be seen.

original: vitthārato vuttāti na vitthārayissāmīti.
analyzed: vitthārataḥ vuttā ati na vitthārayissāmi iti
translated: But the method of interpretation, the method of cause and fruit, the method of the plane of existence, the method of the similar and dissimilar, the method of the characteristic, etc., are given in detail in the commentary. Therefore I shall not elaborate them.

original: Iti sattibalānurūpā racitā
analyzed: iti satti bala anurūpā racitā
translated: Thus this is composed in accordance with the strength of the needle.

original: Niddesavāraatthavibhāvanā niṭṭhitā.🔽4. Paṭiniddesavāraatthavibhāvanā
analyzed: niddesa vāra attha vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The exposition of the meaning of the section on the demonstration is ended.🔽The exposition of the meaning of the section on the counter-demonstration

original: 1. Desanāhāravibhaṅgavibhāvanā🔽5. Evaṃ hārādayo sarūpato ācariyena uddesato uddiṭṭhā, niddesato ca niddiṭṭhā, amhehi🔽ca ñātā, atha kasmā puna “tattha katamo desanāhāro”tiādiko āraddhoti ce? Veneyyānaṃ
analyzed: desanā āhāra vibhaṅga vibhāvanā  evam hāra ādayo sarūpataḥ ācariyena uddesataḥ uddiṭṭhāḥ niddesataḥ ca niddiṭṭhāḥ amhehi  ca ñātā atha kasmā puna tattha katamaḥ desanā āhāraḥ iti ādikaḥ āraddho ti ce veneyyānam
translated: The exposition of the meaning of the analysis of the mode of Conveying a Teaching

original: tividhattā. Veneyyā hi atitikkhapañño nātitikkhapañño mandapaññoti tividhā honti.🔽Tesañhi atitikkhapaññassānurūpaṃ hārādayo uddesato uddiṭṭhā, nātitikkhapaññassa anurūpaṃ
analyzed: tividha ttā veneyyāḥ hi atitikkha paññaḥ na atitikkha paññaḥ manda paññā iti tividhāḥ honti  tesam hi atitikkha paññassa anurūpam hāra ādayaḥ uddesataḥ uddiṭṭhāḥ na atitikkha paññassa anurūpam
translated: The teacher has shown the Modes, etc., in their individual essences by the demonstration and by the demonstration of the demonstration. And they have been understood by us. But why is it that he has begun again with “Herein, what is the Mode of Conveying a Teaching? ”? Because the disciples are of three kinds. For disciples are of three kinds, namely, those of keen understanding, those of middling understanding, and those of low understanding.

original: niddesato niddiṭṭhā, idāni mandapaññassānurūpaṃ hārādayo vibhajitvā dassetuṃ “tattha🔽katamo desanāhāro”tiādiko vibhaṅgavāro āraddho. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana “evaṃ hārādayosukhaggahaṇatthaṃ
analyzed: niddesataḥ niddiṭṭhāḥ idāni manda paññassa anurūpam hāra ādayaḥ vibhajitvā dassetum tattha 🔽katamaḥ desanā hāro ti ādikaḥ vibhaṅga vāraḥ āraddhaḥ aṭṭhakathā ayam pana evam
translated: For those of keen understanding the Modes, etc., have been shown by the demonstration. For those of middling understanding they have been shown by the demonstration of the demonstration. Now, in order to show them by analysis for those of low understanding, the analysis section has been begun with “Herein, what is the Mode of Conveying a Teaching? ”🔽In the commentary, however, it is said that the analysis section is begun in order to facilitate easy understanding of the Modes, etc.,

original: gāthābandhavasena sarūpato niddisitvā idāni tesu hāre tāva paṭiniddesavasena vibhajituṃ🔽‘tattha katamo desanāhāro’tiādi āraddha”nti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: gāthābandha vasena sarūpataḥ niddisitvā idāni tesu hāre tāva paṭiniddesa vasena vibhajitum  tattha katamaḥ desanā āhāraḥ tiādi āraddhanti vuttam
translated: Having shown the Thread by way of the phrasing of the verse, he now said the words beginning ‘ Herein, what is the Mode of Conveying Description? ‘ in order to analyse the Modes of Conveying in the case of those Threads, beginning with the Mode of Conveying Description.

original: Tattha ye hārādayo uddesaniddesesu niddiṭṭhā, tattha hārādīsu katamo desanāhāroti🔽ce? Yā “assādādīnavatā”tiādigāthā vuttā, sā ayaṃ gāthā niddesavasena desanāhāro nāma,
