original: sabbattha gāthāsu vā phalādayo dassetabbā assādādayo viya katthaci niddhāretvāti
analyzed: sabbattha gāthāsu vā phala ādayaḥ dassetabbāḥ assāda ādayaḥ viya katthaci niddhāretvā ati
translated: or in all the verses, as the case may be, just as the enjoyments, etc., are.

original: viseso vijānitabbo. Tenāha aṭṭhakathācariyo “yathā pana…pe… ekato udāharaṇaṃ katanti daṭṭhabba”nti.
analyzed: visesaḥ vijānitabbaḥ tena āha aṭṭhakathā cariyaḥ yathā pana pe ekatas udāharaṇam katan ti daṭṭhabbanti
translated: This is the difference to be understood. That is why the teacher of the commentary says: “But just as … the example is given together, so should it be seen” .

original: 6. Desanāhārassa visayabhūtā assādādayo “idha pāḷidhamme ayaṃ assādo āgato, idha
analyzed: desanā āhārassa visaya bhūtāḥ assāda ādayaḥ idha ayam assādaḥ āgataḥ idha
translated: The enjoyments, etc., which are the province of the teaching, are shown by the teacher in the original text in the way beginning, “Herein, the enjoyment is stated in this clause of the text,

original: pāḷidhamme ayaṃ ādīnavo āgato”tiādinā visesato nidassanavasena sarūpato ācariyena🔽vibhattā, te assādādayo tiṇṇaṃ ugghaṭitaññuādīnaṃ puggalānaṃ sāmaññato bhagavā kiṃ🔽nu kho deseti, udāhu ekassa puggalassa yathālābhaṃ kiṃ nu desetīti anuyogassa sambhavato
analyzed: pāḷi dhamme ayam ādīnavaḥ āgataḥ ti ādinā visesataḥ nidassana vasena sarūpataḥ ācariyena  vibhattā te assāda ādayaḥ tiṇṇam puggalānam sāmaññataḥ bhagavā kim  nu kho deseti udāhu ekassa puggalassa yathālābham kim nu deseti iti anuyogassa sambhavato
translated: the danger in this clause of the text” , by specifically pointing out the enjoyments, etc., in the way beginning with the enjoyments.🔽Those enjoyments, etc., are shown by the Blessed One in general terms to the three kinds of persons, namely, those who are quick to understand, those who understand delayed, and those who are hard to understand, in order to make it possible for them to ask questions, thinking: “What is it that the Blessed One teaches?🔽Or does he teach what he has acquired for himself?

original: imassa puggalassa imaṃ deseti, imassa puggalassa imaṃ desetīti puggalabhedena assādādayo
analyzed: imassa puggalassa imam deseti imassa puggalassa imam deseti iti puggala bhedena assāda ādayaḥ
translated: ” So the enjoyments, etc., should be understood as shown by the Blessed One in general terms to those three kinds of persons in order to make it possible for them to ask questions.

original: vibhajitvā dassetuṃ “tattha bhagavā ugghaṭitaññussā”tiādi āraddhaṃ. Tattha tatthāti🔽tesu assādādīsu. Nissaraṇaṃ ugghaṭitaññussa puggalassa bhagavā deseti, ādīnavañca
analyzed: vibhajitvā dassetum tattha bhagavā āraddham tattha tattha ati  tesu assāda ādīsu nissaraṇam ugghaṭita ññussa puggalassa bhagavā deseti ādīnavañca
translated: The exposition is begun with the words “Herein, the Blessed One taught the escape for the person of quick understanding” . Herein,🔽herein means

original: nissaraṇañca ime dve vipañcitaññussa puggalassa bhagavā deseti, assādañca ādīnavañca🔽nissaraṇañca ime tayo neyyassa puggalassa bhagavā desetīti yojanattho daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: nissaraṇañca ime dve puggalassa bhagavā deseti assādañca ādīnavañca  nissaraṇam ca ime tayo neyyassa puggalassa bhagavā deseti iti yojana atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: among the gratification, etc., The Blessed One taught the escape for the person of quick understanding. And he taught both the unsatisfactoriness and the escape for the person of medium understanding. And he taught the gratification, the unsatisfactoriness, and the escape for the person of dull understanding. This is how the meaning should be understood.

original: Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana “evaṃ assādādayo udāharaṇavasena sarūpato dassetvā idāni tattha puggalavibhāgena desanāvibhāgaṃ dassetuṃ ‘tattha bhagavā’tiādi vutta”nti vuttaṃ.🔽Tattha ugghaṭitaññussāti ugghaṭīyate paṭivijjhīyate, ṭhapīyate vā sappabhedo vitthāro
analyzed: aṭṭhakathā ayam pana evam udāharaṇa vasena sarūpataḥ dassetvā idāni tattha puggala vibhāgena desanā vibhāgam dassetum tattha bhagavā tiādi vuttanti vuttam  tattha ugghaṭita ññussa ati ugghaṭīyate paṭivijjhīyate ṭhapīyate vā sa pabhedaḥ vitthāro
translated: But in the commentary it is said: “Having thus shown the gratification, etc., by way of examples, he now said ‘Herein, the Blessed One’ for the purpose of showing the exposition of the teaching by way of the classification of the persons therein” .🔽Herein, the person of quick understanding: the meaning is unfolded, penetrated, or established, with its divisions and in detail, thus it is unfolded . He knows the unfolded meaning, thus he is one who knows the unfolded ;

original: atthoti ugghaṭito, jānātīti ñū, ugghaṭitaṃ atthaṃ ñū ugghaṭitaññū, uddesamatteneva
analyzed: attho ti ugghaṭitaḥ jānāti iti ñū ugghaṭitam attham ñū ugghaṭita ññū uddesa mattena iva
translated: he is a knower of the mere summary .

original: sappabhedaṃ savitthāraṃ paṭivijjhitabbaṃ atthaṃ paṭivijjhatīti attho. Yo puggalo
analyzed: sa ppabhedam sa vitthāram paṭivijjhitabbam attham paṭivijjhati iti atthaḥ yaḥ puggalaḥ
translated: He penetrates the meaning that is to be penetrated, is the meaning.

original: uddeseneva uddiṭṭhamatteneva atthaṃ ñatvā atthasiddhippatto hoti, so ugghaṭitaññū nāma.
analyzed: uddesena iva uddiṭṭha mattena iva attham ñatvā attha siddhi ppatto hoti saḥ ugghaṭitaññū nāma
translated: The person who, by the mere recitation, by the mere indication, knows the meaning and so reaches the goal, is called one who is “quick-witted” .

original: Vipañcīyate vittharīyate atthoti vipañcito, taṃ jānātīti vipañcitaññū. Yo puggalo niddesena niddiṭṭhamattameva atthaṃ ñatvā atthasiddhippatto, so vipañcitaññū nāma.🔽Paṭiniddesena attho netabbo pāpetabboti neyyo. Yo puggalo paṭiniddesena vā paṭilomena
analyzed: vipañcīyate vittharīyate attho ti vipañcitaḥ tam jānāti iti vipañcitaññū yaḥ puggalaḥ niddesena niddiṭṭha mattam eva attham ñatvā attha siddhi ppatto saḥ vipañcitaññū nāma  paṭiniddesena atthaḥ netabbo pāpetabbaḥ iti neyyaḥ yaḥ puggalo paṭiniddesena vā paṭilomena
translated: The meaning is analyzed, is spread out, thus it is analyzed; he knows that, thus he is one who is “analytically understanding” . The person who, by the mere explanation, by the mere indication, knows the meaning and so reaches the goal, is called one who is “analytically understanding” .

original: vā vibhattaṃ eva atthaṃ ñatvā atthasiddhippatto, so neyyo nāma. Nissaraṇadesanāyeva🔽ugghaṭitaññussa paṭivedhābhisamayo siddho hoti, ādīnavadesanāya ceva nissaraṇadesanāya
analyzed: vā vibhattam eva attham ñatvā attha siddhi ppatto saḥ neyyaḥ nāma nissaraṇa desanāya iva  ugghaṭita ññussa paṭivedha abhisamayaḥ siddhaḥ hoti ādīnava desanāya ca iva nissaraṇa desanāya
translated: The meaning is to be led, is to be brought, by the explanation, thus it is to be led; he knows that, thus he is one who is “led” . The person who, by the explanation, by the opposite,🔽by the analysis, knows the meaning and so reaches the goal, is called one who is “led” . The penetration-comprehension of one who is “quick-witted” is accomplished by the mere teaching of the escape.🔽The penetration-comprehension of one who is “analytically understanding” is accomplished by the teaching of the danger and by the teaching of the escape.

original: ca vipañcitaññussa paṭivedhābhisamayo siddho hoti, assādadesanāya ca ādīnavadesanāya
analyzed: ca paṭivedha abhisamayaḥ siddhaḥ hoti assāda desanāya ca ādīnava desanāya
translated: The penetration-comprehension of one who is “led” is accomplished by the teaching of the gratification and by the teaching of the danger and by the teaching of the escape.

original: ca nissaraṇadesanāya ca neyyassa paṭivedhābhisamayo siddho hotīti adhippāyo idha gahetabbo.
analyzed: ca nissaraṇa desanāya ca neyyassa paṭivedha abhisamayaḥ siddhaḥ hoti iti adhippāyaḥ idha gahetabbo
translated: and the teaching of the escape from them, then the penetration-realization of the meaning is accomplished. This is the intention that should be taken here.

original: Padaparamo panettha paṭivedhābhisamayabhajanābhāvato na gahito. Tasmiñca aggahite
analyzed: pada paramaḥ pana ittha paṭivedha abhisamaya bhajana abhāvataḥ na gahito tasmin ca aggahite
translated: But the ultimate term is not taken here because it is not a basis for penetration-realization. And when that is not taken,

original: assādo, ādīnavo, nissaraṇaṃ, assādādīnavā, assādanissaraṇāni, ādīnavanissaraṇāni,
analyzed: assādaḥ ādīnavaḥ nissaraṇam assāda ādīnavāḥ assāda nissaraṇāni ādīnava nissaraṇāni
translated: the satisfaction, the disadvantage, the escape, the satisfaction and disadvantage, the satisfaction and escape, the disadvantage and escape,

original: assādādīnavanissaraṇāni cāti sattasu paṭṭhānanayesu tatiyachaṭṭhasattamāva gahitā,
analyzed: assāda ādīnava nissaraṇāni ca ati sattasu paṭṭhāna nayesu tatiya chaṭṭha sattamā ava gahitā
translated: and the satisfaction, disadvantage and escape are included in the third, sixth and seventh methods of teaching.

original: avasesā cattāro nayā na gahitā. Veneyyavinayanābhāvato hi gahaṇāgahaṇaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: avasesā cattāro nayāḥ na gahitāḥ veneyya vinayana abhāvataḥ hi gahaṇa a gahaṇam daṭṭhabbaṃ
translated: But the remaining four methods are not included. For the inclusion and non-inclusion should be seen as the taming of the disciples.

original: Veneyyavinayañca veneyyānaṃ santāne ariyamaggassuppādanaṃ, na sāsanavinayanamattaṃ,
analyzed: veneyya vinayam ca veneyyānam santāne ariya maggassa uppādanam na sāsana vinayana mattam
translated: And the taming of the disciples is the arousing of the noble path in the disciples’ continua, not just the taming of the Dispensation.

original: ariyamagguppādanañca yathāvuttehi eva tīhi padaṭṭhānanayehi sijjhatīti itare nayā idha na vuttā.
analyzed: ariya magga uppādanam ca yathā vuttehi eva tīhi padaṭṭhāna nayehi sijjhati iti itare nayāḥ idha na vuttā
translated: And the arousing of the noble path is accomplished by the three methods of teaching stated thus. Therefore the other methods are not stated here.

original: Yasmā pana peṭake –
analyzed: yasmā pana peṭake
translated: But in the Peṭaka it is said:

original: “Tattha katamo assādo ca ādīnavo ca?
analyzed: tattha katamo assādo ca ādīnavaḥ ca
translated: “Herein, what is the satisfaction and the disadvantage?

original: ‘Yāni karoti puriso, tāni passati attani;
analyzed: yāni karoti puriso tāni passati attani
translated: ‘Whatever a man does, he finds it back in himself.

original: Kalyāṇakārī kalyāṇaṃ, pāpakārī ca pāpaka’nti.
analyzed: kalyāṇa kārī kalyāṇam pāpa kārī ca
translated: The doer of good finds happiness, the doer of evil finds suffering.’

original: “Tattha yaṃ kalyāṇakārī kalyāṇaṃ paccanubhoti, ayaṃ assādo. Yaṃ pāpakārī pāpaṃ paccanubhoti, ayaṃ ādīnavo.
analyzed: tattha yam kalyāṇa kārī kalyāṇam paccanubhoti ayam assādaḥ yam pāpa kārī pāpam paccanubhoti ayam ādīnavaḥ
translated: “Herein, the happiness that the doer of good finds is the satisfaction, and the suffering that the doer of evil finds is the danger.

original: “Aṭṭhime, bhikkhave, lokadhammā. Katame aṭṭha? ‘Lābho’tiādi. Tattha lābho yaso sukhaṃ pasaṃsā, ayaṃ assādo. Alābho ayaso dukkhaṃ nindā, ayaṃ ādīnavo.
analyzed: aṭṭhime bhikkhave loka dhammā katame aṭṭha lābha utiādi tattha lābhaḥ yasaḥ sukham pasaṃsā ayam assādaḥ alābhaḥ ayasaḥ dukkham nindā ayam ādīnavaḥ
translated: “There are these eight worldly ideas, bhikkhus. What eight? Gain and loss, fame and disgrace, blame and praise, pleasure and pain. Herein, gain is satisfaction, and loss is danger.

original: “Tattha katamo assādo ca nissaraṇañca?
analyzed: tattha katamaḥ assādaḥ ca nissaraṇañca
translated: “Herein, what is satisfaction and what is the escape?

original: ‘Sukho vipāko puññānaṃ, adhippāyo ca ijjhati;
analyzed: sukhaḥ vipākaḥ puññānaṃ adhippāyo ca ijjhati
translated: ‘The fruit of merit is happiness, and one’s wishes succeed;

original: Khippañca paramaṃ santiṃ, nibbānamadhigacchatī’ti. –
analyzed: khippam ca paramam santim nibbānam adhigacchati iti
translated: And soon one reaches the supreme peace, the destruction of the death-bringing things.’

original: Ayaṃ assādo ca nissaraṇañca.🔽“Dvattiṃsimāni, bhikkhave, mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇāni, yehi samannāgatassa
analyzed: ayam assādaḥ ca nissaraṇañca  dvattiṃsimāni bhikkhave mahā purisassa mahā purisa lakkhaṇāni yehi samannāgatassa
translated: This is satisfaction and this is the escape.

original: mahāpurisassa dveyeva gatiyo bhavanti…pe… vivaṭacchadoti sabbaṃ lakkhaṇasuttaṃ ayaṃ
analyzed: mahāpurisassa dveyeva gatiyaḥ bhavanti pe vivaṭa chado ti sabbam lakkhaṇa suttam ayam
translated: “Bhikkhus, a great man possesses thirty-two marks of a great man. If he lives the home life, he becomes a wheel-turning monarch, a righteous king who rules by the Dhamma, master of the four quarters, all-victorious, who has stabilised his country and possesses the seven treasures.🔽The rest of the Great Man’s marks are as in the Lakkhana Sutta .

original: assādo ca nissaraṇañca.
analyzed: assādaḥ ca nissaraṇañca
translated: and the escape from it.

original: “Tattha katamo ādīnavo ca nissaraṇañca?
analyzed: tattha katamaḥ ādīnavaḥ ca nissaraṇam ca
translated: Herein, what is the Disappointment and the Escape?

original: ‘Bhārā have pañcakkhandhā, bhārahāro ca puggalo;
analyzed: bhārāḥ have pañca kkhandhāḥ bhāra hāraḥ ca puggalo
translated: The five aggregates are a burden, and the man who carries it is a person.

original: Bhārādānaṃ dukhaṃ loke, bhāranikkhepanaṃ sukhaṃ.
analyzed: bhāra ādānam dukham loke bhāra nikkhepanam sukham
translated: Taking up a burden is suffering in the world, and putting down a burden is bliss.

original: ‘Nikkhipitvā garuṃ bhāraṃ, aññaṃ bhāraṃ anādiya;
analyzed: nikkhipitvā garum bhāram aññam bhāram an ādiya
translated: Having put down the heavy burden, not taking up another burden,

original: Samūlaṃ taṇhamabbuyha, nicchāto parinibbuto’ti. –
analyzed: sa mūlam taṇham abbuyha nicchātaḥ parinibbutaḥ ti
translated: Having uprooted craving, he is desireless, and he is fully quenched.

original: Ayaṃ ādīnavo ca nissaraṇañca.
analyzed: ayam ādīnavaḥ ca nissaraṇañca
translated: This is the Disappointment and the Escape.

original: “Tattha katamo assādo ca ādīnavo ca nissaraṇañca?
analyzed: tattha katamaḥ assādaḥ ca ādīnavaḥ ca nissaraṇañca
translated: Herein, what is the Gratification and the Disappointment and the Escape?

original: ‘Kāmā hi citrā madhurā manoramā, virūparūpena mathenti cittaṃ;
analyzed: kāmāḥ hi citrāḥ madhurāḥ manoramāḥ virūpa rūpena mathenti cittam
translated: Sensual desires are various, sweet, and charming, and they delude the mind with their beauty.

original: Tasmā ahaṃ pabbajitomhi rāja, apaṇṇakaṃ sāmaññameva seyyo’ti. –
analyzed: tasmai aham pabbajitaḥ amhi rāja apaṇṇakam sāmaññam eva seyyaḥ ti
translated: Therefore, sire, I have gone forth, for the state of a recluse is the best and is not in vain.🔽This is the Gratification and the Disappointment and the Escape.

original: Ayaṃ assādo ca ādīnavo ca nissaraṇañcā”ti vuttaṃ, tasmā tepi nayā idha niddhāretvā veditabbā. Phalādīsupi ayaṃ nayo labbhatiyeva.
analyzed: ayam assādo ca ādīnavaḥ ca nissaraṇam ca ati vuttam tasmā te pi nayāḥ idha niddhāretvā veditabbā phala ādīsu pi ayam nayo
translated: The method can be applied in the same way to the fruits and so on.

original: Yasmā peṭake – “tattha katamaṃ phalañca upāyo ca? ‘Sīle patiṭṭhāya naro sappañño’ti gāthā, idaṃ phalañca upāyo ca.
analyzed: tattha katamam phalam ca upāyo ca sīle patiṭṭhāya naro sappañño ti gāthā idam phalam ca upāyo ca
translated: In the Peṭaka it is said: “Herein, what is fruit and means? The verse ‘The man of understanding, established well in virtue’ is fruit and means.

original: “Tattha katamaṃ phalañca āṇatti ca?
analyzed: tattha katamam phalam ca āṇatti ca
translated: “Herein, what is fruit and injunction?

original: ‘Sace bhāyatha dukkhassa, sace vo dukkhamappiyaṃ;
analyzed: sace bhāyatha dukkhassa sace vaḥ dukkham appiyam
translated: ‘If you fear suffering, if suffering is unpleasant to you,

original: Mākattha pāpakaṃ kammaṃ, āvi vā yadi vā raho’ti. –
analyzed: mākattha pāpakam kammaṃ vā yadi vā
translated: Do not do wicked action, either in public or in private.’

original: Idaṃ phalañca āṇatti ca.
analyzed: idam phalam ca āṇatti ca
translated: This is fruit and injunction.

original: “Tattha katamo upāyo ca āṇatti ca?
analyzed: tattha katamaḥ upāyaḥ ca āṇatti ca
translated: “Herein, what is means and injunction?

original: ‘Kumbhūpamaṃ kāyamimaṃ viditvā, nagarūpamaṃ cittamidaṃ ṭhapetvā;
analyzed: kumbha upamam kāyam imam viditvā nagara upamam cittam idam ṭhapetvā
translated: ‘Having known this body to be like a jar, having set this mind upon the city,

original: Yodhetha māraṃ paññāvudhena, jitañca rakkhe anivesano siyā’ti. –
analyzed: yodhetha māram paññāvudhena jitañca rakkhe anivesanaḥ siyāti
translated: Fight with Māra with the sword of understanding; having won, guard it, and be homeless.’🔽This is means and injunction.”

original: Ayaṃ upāyo ca āṇatti cā”ti vuttaṃ, tasmā evaṃ phalādīnaṃ dukkhavasenāpi udāharaṇaṃ veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: ayam upāyaḥ ca āṇatti ca ati vuttam tasmai evam phala ādīnam dukkha vasena api udāharaṇam veditabbam
translated: So the illustration of fruit, etc., should be understood as referring to suffering too.

original: “Ugghaṭitaññuādīnaṃ tiṇṇaṃ puggalānaṃ imassa puggalassa imaṃ deseti, imassa puggalassa
analyzed: ugghaṭita ññu ādīnam tiṇṇam puggalānam imassa puggalassa imam deseti imassa puggalassa
translated: “He teaches this to a person of the kind beginning ‘one who is quick-witted’ and so on. To a person of this kind he teaches this.

original: imaṃ desetī”ti yehi puggalehi assādādayo yathārahaṃ ācariyena vibhattā, te puggalā
analyzed: imam deseti iti yehi puggalehi assāda ādayaḥ yathāraham ācariyena vibhattā te puggalā
translated: The Master teaches this.”🔽The persons who are divided by the teacher into the types beginning with the “one of quick understanding” are the persons.

original: yāhi paṭipadāhi bhinnā, tā paṭipadā kittikā bhavanti, tāhi bhinnā puggalā ca kittikāti
analyzed: yāhi paṭipadāhi bhinnā tā paṭipadā kittikāḥ bhavanti tāhi bhinnā puggalā ca kittikā ati
translated: The ways in which they are divided are the ways.

original: vicāraṇāya sambhavato tā paṭipadā, te ca puggalā ettakāti gaṇanato dassetuṃ “tattha
analyzed: vicāraṇāya sambhavataḥ tā paṭipadā te ca puggalāḥ ettakāḥ iti gaṇanataḥ dassetum tattha
translated: The ways are mentioned in order to show how many ways there are and how many persons there are by way of the possibility of the consideration “How many ways are there and how many persons are there?”

original: catasso paṭipadā”tiādi āraddhaṃ.
analyzed: catasso paṭipadā ati ādi āraddham
translated: Herein, there are four ways is said in order to show that there are four ways and four persons.

original: Tattha tatthāti tesu ugghaṭitaññuādīsu puggalesu. Ye puggalā yāhi paṭipadāhi bhinnā,
analyzed: tattha tattha ati tesu ugghaṭita ññu ādīsu puggalesu ye puggalāḥ yāhi paṭipadāhi bhinnā
translated: Herein, “herein” refers to the persons beginning with the “one of quick understanding” who are divided by the ways.

original: tā paṭipadā catasso bhavanti, te ca puggalā cattāroti yojanā kātabbā. Katamā catasso?🔽Dukkhāpaṭipadā dandhābhiññā, dukkhāpaṭipadā khippābhiññā, sukhāpaṭipadā dandhābhiññā,
analyzed: tāḥ paṭipadā catassaḥ bhavanti te ca puggalā cattāro ti yojanā kātabbā katamā catasso  dukkha apaṭipadā dandha abhiñā dukkha apaṭipadā khippa abhiññā sukha apaṭipadā dandha abhiññā
translated: The ways are four and the persons are four should be construed. What are the four?

original: sukhāpaṭipadā khippābhiññā cāti catasso. Katame cattāro? Taṇhācarito mando puggalo,
analyzed: sukhā paṭipadā khippā abhiññā ca ati catasso katame cattāro taṇhā caritaḥ mandaḥ puggalo
translated: The painful way with slow intuition, the painful way with swift intuition, the pleasant way with slow intuition, and the pleasant way with swift intuition. These are the four. What are the four persons? The person of lustful temperament who is of dull intuition,

original: taṇhācarito udatto puggalo, diṭṭhicarito mando puggalo, diṭṭhicarito udatto puggalo cāti cattāro.
analyzed: taṇhā caritaḥ udattaḥ puggalo diṭṭhi caritaḥ mandaḥ puggalo diṭṭhi caritaḥ udatto puggalo ca ati cattāro
translated: The person of lusting temperament is quick-witted, the person of faith-inspired temperament is slow-witted, and the person of speculative-thinking temperament is quick-witted.

original: Paṭipadābhiññāhi kato vibhāgopi paṭipadāhi kato vibhāgo nāma hoti avinābhāvatoti
analyzed: paṭipadā abhiññāhi kataḥ vibhāgaḥ api paṭipadā hi kataḥ vibhāgaḥ nāma hoti avinābhāvato ti
translated: And the classification of the four paths by means of the kinds of direct-knowledge is also called a classification of the paths by means of the kinds of persons because the kinds of direct-knowledge are inseparable from the kinds of persons.

original: manasi katvā “catasso paṭipadābhiññā”ti avatvā “catasso paṭipadā”ti vuttā. Tā panetā
analyzed: manasi katvā catasso paṭipadā abhiññā ti avatvā catasso paṭipadā ati vuttā tā panetā
translated: Bearing this in mind, the Exalted One did not say “four paths and four kinds of direct-knowledge,” but rather “four paths and four kinds of persons.”

original: samathavasenāpi bhinnā, vipassanāvasenāpi bhinnā. Kathaṃ samathavasena? Pathavīkasiṇādīsu🔽sabbapaṭhamaṃ “pathavī pathavī”tiādinā pavattamanasikārato paṭṭhāya yāva jhānassa🔽upacāraṃ uppajjati, tāva pavattā paññā samathabhāvanā “paṭipadā”ti vuccati. Upacārato
analyzed: samatha vasena api bhinnā vipassanā vasena api bhinnā katham samatha vasena pathavī kasiṇa ādīsu  sabba paṭhamam pathavī pathavī iti ādinā pavatta manasikārato paṭṭhāya yāva jhānassa  upacāram uppajjati tāva pavattā paññā samatha bhāvanā paṭipadā iti vuccati upacārato
translated: These four paths are also classified according to serenity and according to insight. How are they classified according to serenity?🔽The understanding that occurs from the time of first giving attention to the earth kasiṇa, etc., with the thought “earth, earth,” until access concentration arises is called “the path of serenity development.”🔽The understanding that occurs from the time of access concentration until absorption concentration arises is called “direct-knowledge.”

original: pana paṭṭhāya yāva appanā, tāva pavattā paññā “abhiññā”ti vuccati heṭṭhimapaññāto🔽adhigatapaññābhāvato.
analyzed: pana paṭṭhāya yāva appanā tāva pavattā paññā abhiññā iti vuccati heṭṭhima paññāto 🔽adhigata paññā bhāvato
translated: The understanding that occurs from the time of absorption concentration until the attainment of the higher wisdom is called “the path of direct-knowledge.”

original: Sā ca paṭipadā kassaci dukkhā kicchā hoti nīvaraṇādipaccanīkadhammasamudācāraggahaṇatāya,
analyzed: sā ca paṭipadā kassaci dukkhā kicchā hoti nīvaraṇa ādi paccanīka dhamma samudācāra ggahaṇa tāya
translated: And that way is difficult and troublesome for some people because of the occurrence of hindrances and other opposing states.

original: kassaci tadabhāvato sukhā akicchā hoti, abhiññāpi kassaci dandhā asīghappavatti hoti
analyzed: kassaci tad abhāvataḥ sukhā akicchā hoti abhiññā api kassaci dandhā a sīgha ppavatti hoti
translated: And that practice is difficult for one who has to grasp the occurrence of the hindrances and other opposing states, and it is easy for one who does not have to do so.

original: avisadañāṇatāya, kassaci khippā sīghappavatti hoti visadañāṇatāyāti.
analyzed: a visada ñāṇa tāya kassaci khippā sīgha ppavatti hoti visada ñāṇa tāya ati
translated: And the direct-knowledge is sluggish for one who has not the kind of understanding that is clear, and it is swift for one who has.

original: Kathaṃ vipassanāvasena? Yo rūpārūpamukhena vipassanaṃ abhinivisanto cattāri mahābhūtāni
analyzed: katham vipassanā vasena yaḥ rūpa arūpa mukhena vipassanam abhinivisanto cattāri mahābhūtāni
translated: How by way of insight? One who is devoted to insight that has material and immaterial things as its object and who discerns the four great entities

original: pariggahetvā upādārūpaṃ pariggaṇhāti, arūpaṃ pariggaṇhāti, rūpārūpaṃ pana pariggaṇhanto
analyzed: pariggahetvā upādā rūpam pariggaṇhāti arūpam pariggaṇhāti rūpa arūpam pana pariggaṇhantaḥ
translated: and discerns the derived materiality, and who discerns materiality and immateriality,

original: dukkhena kasirena kilamanto pariggahaetauṃ sakkoti, tassa dukkhāpaṭipadā nāma hoti.🔽Pariggahitarūpārūpassa vipassanāparivāse maggapātubhāvadandhatāya dandhābhiññā nāma
analyzed: dukkhena kasirena kilamantaḥ pariggaha etaum sakkoti tassa dukkhāpaṭipadā nāma hoti  pariggahita rūpa arūpassa vipassanā parivāse magga pātubhāva dandha tāya dandhābhiññā nāma
translated: but who is unable to discern them because he is exhausted by the difficulty and pain of it, has what is called the difficult way.

original: hoti. Tabbipariyāyena itarā dve honti. Vipassanāvasena pana bhinnāyeva paṭipadābhiññāyo
analyzed: hoti tad bipariyāyena itarā dve honti vipassanā vasena pana bhinnāya iva paṭipadā abhiññāyo
translated: And because the path is manifested sluggishly in one who is discerning materiality and immateriality, his direct-knowledge is called sluggish. The other two are the opposites of these. But the ways and kinds of direct-knowledge are different according to insight.

original: idha daṭṭhabbā abhisamayādhikārattā, aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana “evaṃ yesaṃ puggalānaṃ vasena🔽desanāvibhāgo dassito, te puggale paṭipadāvibhāgena vibhajitvā dassetuṃ ‘catasso
analyzed: idha daṭṭhabbāḥ abhisamaya adhikāra attā aṭṭhakathāyam pana evam yesam puggalānam vasena  desanā vibhāgaḥ dassito te puggale paṭipadā vibhāgena vibhajitvā dassetum catasso
translated: Herein, it is to be seen in this way because of the predominance of penetration. But in the commentary it is said: “The exposition of the teaching has been shown by the method of the four persons.🔽In order to show those four persons by the method of the planes of progress, it is said: ‘There are four planes of progress.

original: paṭipadā’tiādi vutta”nti vuttaṃ. Yojanānayo vuttanayānusāreneva veditabbo.🔽Catūhi paṭipadābhiññāhi cattāro puggalā sabbeva aniyamato vaṭṭadukkhato kiṃ nu kho🔽niyyanti, udāhu “imāya paṭipadābhiññāya ayaṃ puggalo niyyāti, imāya paṭipadābhiññāya
analyzed: paṭipadā tiādi vuttanti vuttam yojanā nayaḥ vutta naya anusārena iva veditabbaḥ  catūhi paṭipadā abhiññāhi cattāro puggalā sabbe iva aniyamataḥ vaṭṭa dukkhataḥ kim nu kho  niyyanti udāhu imāya paṭipadā abhiññāya ayam puggalaḥ niyyāti imāya paṭipadā abhiññāya
translated: Herein, the four kinds of persons are shown by the method of teaching in terms of persons, and in the commentary it is said, “Thus, in order to show those four kinds of persons who have been shown by the method of teaching in terms of persons by means of the method of practice, it is said, ‘There are four kinds of practice’ and so on.” The method of interpretation should be understood by the method stated.

original: ayaṃ puggalo niyyātī”ti niyamato ca niyyātīti vicāraṇāya sambhavato “ayaṃ puggalo🔽imehi nissayehi upanissayapaccayaṃ labhitvā imāya paṭipadābhiññāya vaṭṭadukkhato🔽niyyātī”ti niyametvā dassetuṃ “taṇhācarito mando”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: ayam puggalaḥ niyyāti iti niyamato ca niyyāti iti vicāraṇāya sambhavataḥ ayam puggalo 🔽imehi nissayehi upanissaya paccayam labhitvā imāya paṭipadā abhiññāya vaṭṭa dukkhato 🔽niyyāti iti niyametvā dassetum taṇhā caritaḥ mandaḥ tiādi vuttam
translated: By means of the four kinds of practice and knowledge, all the four kinds of persons are released from the suffering of the round of rebirths, but it is not certain that “by this kind of practice and knowledge this person is released, and by this kind of practice and knowledge that person is released.” In order to show that it is certain that they are released, it is said, “One of greedy temperament, sluggish” and so on.

original: Tattha taṇhācarito mando puggalo satipaṭṭhānehi nissayehi upanissayapaccayaṃ labhitvā
analyzed: tattha taṇhā caritaḥ mandaḥ puggalo sati paṭṭhānehi nissayehi upanissaya paccayam labhitvā
translated: Herein, a person of sluggish sense who is a router-on-the-way 1 goes forth from the suffering of the round by means of the four foundations of mindfulness as the condition by way of decisive support condition,

original: satindriyena satindriyādhikena ariyamaggena dukkhāpaṭipadādandhābhiññāya vaṭṭadukkhato🔽niyyāti, taṇhācarito udatto puggalo jhānehi nissayehi upanissayapaccayaṃ labhitvā
analyzed: sat indriyena sat indriya adhikena ariya maggena dukkha a paṭipadāt andha abhiññāya vaṭṭa dukkhato  niyyāti taṇhā caritaḥ udattaḥ puggalaḥ jhānehi nissayehi upanissaya paccayam labhitvā
translated: and by means of the noble path with the faculty of mindfulness in excess as the condition by way of decisive support condition, and by means of slow direct-knowledge as the condition by way of decisive support condition, and by means of the painful way as the condition by way of decisive support condition.🔽A person of sluggish sense who is a router-on-the-way goes forth from the suffering of the round by means of the four foundations of mindfulness as the condition by way of decisive support condition,

original: samādhindriyena samādhindriyādhikena ariyamaggena dukkhāpaṭipadākhippābhiññāya vaṭṭadukkhato🔽niyyāti, diṭṭhicarito mando puggalo sammappadhānehi nissayehi upanissayapaccayaṃ
analyzed: samādhi indriyena samādhi indriya adhikena ariya maggena dukkha a paṭipadā a khippa abhiññāya vaṭṭa dukkhato  niyyāti diṭṭhi caritaḥ mandaḥ puggalo sammappadhānehi nissayehi upanissaya paccayam
translated: and by means of the noble path with the faculty of concentration in excess as the condition by way of decisive support condition, and by means of swift direct-knowledge as the condition by way of decisive support condition, and by means of the painful way as the condition by way of decisive support condition.🔽A person of sluggish sense who is a router-on-the-way goes forth from the suffering of the round by means of the four right endeavours as the condition by way of decisive support condition,

original: labhitvā vīriyindriyena vīriyindriyādhikena ariyamaggena sukhāpaṭipadādandhābhiññāya🔽vaṭṭadukkhato niyyāti, diṭṭhicarito udatto puggalo saccehi nissayehi upanissayapaccayaṃ
analyzed: labhitvā vīriya indriyena vīriya indriya adhikena ariya maggena sukha ā paṭipadāt andha abhiññāya  vaṭṭa dukkhataḥ niyyāti diṭṭhi caritaḥ udattaḥ puggalo saccehi nissayehi upanissaya paccayam
translated: and by means of the noble path with the faculty of energy in excess as the condition by way of decisive support condition, and by means of slow direct-knowledge as the condition by way of decisive support condition, and by means of the pleasant way as the condition by way of decisive support condition.🔽A person of sluggish sense who is a router-on-the-way goes forth from the suffering of the round by means of the four foundations of mindfulness as the condition by way of decisive support condition,

original: labhitvā paññindriyena paññindriyādhikena ariyamaggena sukhāpaṭipadākhippābhiññāya
analyzed: labhitvā paññindriyena paññindriya adhikena ariya maggena sukha a paṭipadā a khippa abhiññāya
translated: and by means of the noble path with the faculty of understanding in excess as the condition by way of decisive support condition, and by means of swift direct-knowledge as the condition by way of decisive support condition, and by means of the pleasant way as the condition by way of decisive support condition.

original: vaṭṭadukkhato niyyātīti yojanā kātabbā. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana –
analyzed: vaṭṭa dukkhataḥ niyyāti iti yojanā kātabbā aṭṭhakathā ayam pana
translated: But in the Commentary it is said:

original: “Cattāro puggalāti yathāvuttapaṭipadāvibhāgeneva cattāro paṭipannakapuggalā, taṃ pana paṭipadāvibhāgaṃ saddhiṃ hetupāyaphalehi dassetuṃ ‘taṇhācarito’tiādi vutta”nti –
analyzed: cattāro puggalā ti yathā vutta paṭipadā vibhāgena iva cattāro paṭipannaka puggalā tam pana paṭipadā vibhāgam saddhim hetu pāya phalehi dassetum taṇhā carito tiādi vuttanti
translated: “The four persons are the four persons who have entered upon the way, distinguished according to the way stated. But in order to show that distinction of the way together with its cause, means, and fruit, ‘characterized by craving’ is said, and so on” .

original: Vuttaṃ. Tattha taṇhācaritoti taṇhāya nibbattitaṃ caritaṃ etassa puggalassāti taṇhācarito.
analyzed: vuttam tattha taṇhā carito ti taṇhāya nibbattitam caritam etassa puggalassa ati taṇhā carito
translated: Herein, characterized by craving : the character of this person is produced by craving, thus he is characterized by craving.🔽Slow: he is endowed with slowness, with ignorance, thus he is slow, a person with predominance of delusion.

original: Mandoti mandiyāya avijjāya samannāgatoti mando, mohādhikapuggalo. Udattoti udaatto,🔽uḷārapaññoti attho. Uḷāraṃ phalaṃ detīti udo, ko so? Pavicayo, attani nibbattoti
analyzed: mando ti mandiyāya avijjāya samannāgato ti mandaḥ moha adhika puggalo udatto ti udaatto  uḷāra paññoti attho uḷāram phalam deti iti kaḥ so pavicayaḥ attani nibbatto ti
translated: Outstanding: outstanding,

original: atto, udo atto yassa puggalassāti udattoti vacanattho kātabbo.
analyzed: attaḥ udaḥ attaḥ yassa puggalassa ati udattaḥ iti vacana atthaḥ kātabbaḥ
translated: outstanding fruit he gives, thus he is outstanding. Who is that? Investigation. Produced in himself, thus he is outstanding. The meaning of the words should be construed thus: outstanding, self.

original: Paṭhamāya paṭipadāya hetu nāma taṇhācaritatā, mandapaññatā ca, upāyo satindriyaṃ,
analyzed: paṭhamāya paṭipadāya hetu nāma taṇhā carita tā manda pañña tā ca upāyaḥ sati indriyam
translated: The cause of the first way is being characterized by craving and having slow understanding. The means is the faculty of mindfulness.

original: sabbāsampi phalaṃ niyyānameva. Dutiyāya paṭipadāya hetu nāma taṇhācaritatā, udattapaññatā🔽ca, upāyo vīriyindriyaṃ. Tatiyāya paṭipadāya hetu nāma diṭṭhicaritatā, mandapaññatā🔽ca, upāyo samādhindriyaṃ. Catutthiyā paṭipadāya hetu nāma diṭṭhicaritatā, udattapaññatā
analyzed: sabbāsam pi phalam niyyānam eva dutiyāya paṭipadāya hetu nāma taṇhā carita tā udatta pañña tā  ca upāyaḥ vīriya indriyam tatiyāya paṭipadāya hetu nāma diṭṭhi carita tā manda pañña tā  ca upāyaḥ samādhi indriyam catutthiyā paṭipadāya hetu nāma diṭṭhi carita tā udatta pañña tā
translated: and the outcome is the same for all. The cause of the second is the temperament of craving and the faculty of energy,🔽which is the means. The cause of the third is the temperament of views and the faculty of concentration,🔽which is the means. The cause of the fourth is the temperament of views and the faculty of wisdom,🔽which is the means.

original: ca, upāyo paññindriyanti hetupāyaphalāni daṭṭhabbāni.🔽Ettha ca diṭṭhicarito udatto puggalo ugghaṭitaññū nāma, diṭṭhicarito mando ceva taṇhācarito🔽udatto ca vipañcitaññū nāma, taṇhācarito mando puggalo neyyo nāma, tasmā “tattha
analyzed: ca upāyaḥ paññindriyanti hetu pāya phalāni daṭṭhabbāni  ettha ca diṭṭhi caritaḥ udattaḥ puggalo ugghaṭitaññū nāma diṭṭhi caritaḥ mandaḥ ca iva taṇhā carito  udattaḥ ca vipañcitaññū nāma taṇhā caritaḥ mandaḥ puggalo neyyaḥ nāma tasmai tattha
translated: and the outcome is the same for all. The second path’s cause is the state of being of craving-type, and the faculty of energy is the means. The third path’s cause is the state of being of view-type, and the faculty of concentration is the means. The fourth path’s cause is the state of being of view-type, and the faculty of understanding is the means. So the cause, the means, and the outcome should be seen.

original: bhagavā ugghaṭitaññussa puggalassa nissaraṇaṃ desayatī”tiādinā nayena ugghaṭitaññuādiveneyyattayassa
analyzed: bhagavā ugghaṭita ññussa puggalassa nissaraṇam desayati iti ādinā nayena
translated: And here the person of view-type who is keen is called one who “infers by the mark” , and the person of craving-type who is keen is called one who “infers by what is directly perceived” . The person of view-type who is dull and the person of craving-type who is dull are called “led” . So the Blessed One teaches the escape in the way beginning, “Herein, the Blessed One teaches the escape for the person who infers by the mark” , showing the three kinds of disciples to be led, namely, those who infer by the mark, those who infer by what is directly perceived, and those who are led.

original: bhedadassanena nissaraṇaṃ desayati, “ādīnavañca nissaraṇañca desayati, assādañca
analyzed: bheda dassanena nissaraṇam desayati ādīnavam ca nissaraṇam ca desayati assādam ca
translated: He teaches the escape by showing the danger and the escape, and by showing the gratification and the danger.

original: ādīnavañca nissaraṇañca desayatī”ti desanāvibhāgo dassito. “Tattha catasso paṭipadā”tiādinā🔽paṭipadābhedadassanena “taṇhācarito mando puggalo, taṇhācarito udatto puggalo, diṭṭhicarito🔽mando puggalo, diṭṭhicarito udatto puggalo”ti catudhā bhinnaṃ taṇhācaritamandādikaṃ
analyzed: ādīnavañca nissaraṇañca desayati iti desanā vibhāgaḥ dassito tattha catasso paṭipadā ati ādinā  paṭipadā bheda dassanena taṇhā caritaḥ mandaḥ puggalo taṇhā caritaḥ udattaḥ puggalo diṭṭhi carito  mandaḥ puggalo diṭṭhi carito udattaḥ puggalo ti catudhā bhinnam taṇhā carita manda ādikam
translated: “Herein, there are four ways” .

original: puggalacatukkaṃ dassitanti daṭṭhabbaṃ.🔽Idāni catūhi paṭipadābhiññāhi catudhā bhinnaṃ taṇhācaritamandacatukkaṃ atthanayayojanāya
analyzed: puggala catukkam dassitanti daṭṭhabbam  idāni catūhi paṭipada abhiññāhi catudhā bhinnam taṇhā carita manda catukkam attha naya yojanāya
translated: The fourfold classification of persons, namely, the dull and keen in temperament with greed, and the dull and keen in temperament with views, is shown by the demonstration of the different ways.🔽The four persons in the dull-keen temperament should be understood as shown by the demonstration of the different ways.

original: dutiyāya visayaṃ katvā dassetuṃ “ubho taṇhācaritā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha taṇhāya samādhipaṭipakkhattā
analyzed: dutiyāya visayam katvā dassetum ubho taṇhā caritā tiādi vuttam tattha taṇhāya samādhi paṭipakkha ttā
translated: Now, in order to show the four persons in the dull-keen temperament with greed, classified according to the four ways, by means of the second method of interpretation, namely, the method of meaning, the following is said: “Both of the greedy temperament” . Herein, since greed is the opposite of concentration,

original: taṇhācaritā mandaudattā ubho puggalā samathapubbaṅgamāya vipassanāya upanissayaṃ
analyzed: taṇhā caritā mandaudattā ubho puggalā samatha pubbaṅgamāya vipassanāya upanissayam
translated: both the dull and the keen in temperament with greed, having obtained the support of insight preceded by serenity,

original: labhitvā rāgavirāgāya maggapaññāya niyyanti cetovimuttiyā sekkhaphalabhāvāya. Sammādiṭṭhisahiteneva
analyzed: labhitvā rāga virāgāya magga paññāya niyyanti cetaḥ vimuttiyā sekkha phala bhāvāya sammādiṭṭhi sahitena iva
translated: go forth by the path to the fruit of the trainer’s excellence in the deliverance of mind, which is the fading away of greed.

original: sammāsamādhinā niyyānaṃ bhavati, na sammāsamādhinā eva, tasmā diṭṭhicaritā mandaudattā
analyzed: sammāsamādhinā niyyānam bhavati na sammāsamādhinā eva tasmai diṭṭhi caritā mandaudattā
translated: and the escape is by means of right concentration, not by means of wrong concentration.🔽That is why those of lustful temperament and those of faithless temperament

original: ubho puggalā vipassanāpubbaṅgamena samathena avijjāvirāgāya maggapaññāya niyyanti
analyzed: ubho puggalā vipassanā pubbaṅgamena samathena avijjā virāgāya magga paññāya niyyanti
translated: and the outlet is by means of right concentration, not by means of right view, therefore the two kinds of persons who are of faith and of views go forth by means of the path of seeing that has concentration as its proximate cause to the fading of ignorance.🔽They go forth to the state of the fruition of arahatship, which is deliverance by means of understanding.

original: paññāvimuttiyā asekkhaphalabhāvāyāti cattāropi puggalā duvidhāyeva bhavantīti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: paññā vimuttiyāḥ asekkha phala bhāvāya ati cattāro api puggalāḥ duvidhāya iva bhavanti iti vuttam hoti
translated: So it is said that the four kinds of persons are of two kinds only.

original: Rāgavirāgāyāti rañjatīti rāgo, so virajjati etāyāti virāgā, rāgassa virāgā rāgavirāgā,🔽tāya rāgavirāgāya. Cetoti cittappabhedena ca samādhi vuccati yathā “cittaṃ paññañca🔽bhāvaya”nti. Paṭippassaddhivasena paṭipakkhato vimuccatīti vimutti, cetasā cittena
analyzed: rāga virāgāya ati rañjati iti rāgaḥ saḥ virajjati virāgā rāgassa virāgā rāga virāgā  tāya rāga virāgāya ceto ti citta ppabhedena ca samādhi vuccati yathā cittam paññam ca  bhāvayanti paṭippassaddhi vasena paṭipakkhataḥ vimuccati iti vimutti cetasā cittena
translated: To the fading of lust: it lusts, thus it is lust . It fades, thus it is fading . To the fading of lust is to the fading of lust .

original: samādhinā vimuccatīti cetovimutti, ceto eva vā vimutti cetovimutti, anāgāmiphalasamādhi.
analyzed: samādhinā vimuccati iti cetaḥ vimutti cetaḥ eva vā vimutti cetaḥ vimutti anāgāmi phala samādhi
translated: The mind is called concentration by way of the division of the mind, as in the passage: “One should develop the mind and understanding” . It is deliverance because it is liberated from opposition by way of the subsidence of opposition. The mind is deliverance, thus it is deliverance of mind . Or: the mind is itself deliverance, thus it is deliverance of mind . It is the concentration that is the fruit of non-return.

original: Anāgāmipuggalo hi samādhismiṃ paripūrakāritāya cetovimuttiyā niyyāti. Avijjāvirāgāyāti
analyzed: anāgāmi puggalaḥ hi samādhismim paripūra kāritāya cetaḥ vimuttiyā niyyāti avijjā virāgāya ati
translated: For the non-returner goes forth by means of the deliverance of mind, which is perfected in concentration, to the fading of ignorance.

original: avindiyaṃ kāyaduccaritādiṃ vindatīti avijjā, vindiyaṃ vā kāyasucaritādiṃ na vindatīti
analyzed: kāya duccarita ādim vindati iti avijjā vā kāya su carita ādim na vindati iti
translated: “It is ignorance because it does not find what is to be found, namely, bodily good conduct, etc., or it finds what is not to be found, namely, bodily misconduct, and so on.🔽It is ignorance in the sense of non-penetration. “It is the fading away of ignorance” : the fading away of ignorance is the fading away of ignorance.

original: avijjā niruttinayena. Virajjati etāyāti virāgā, avijjāya virāgā avijjāvirāgā, tāya🔽avijjāvirāgāya. Pakārehi jānātīti paññā, vimuccatīti vimutti, paññāya vimuccatīti
analyzed: avijjā nirutti nayena virajjati etāya ati virāgāḥ avijjāya virāgāḥ avijja avirāgā tāya  avijjā virāgāya pakārehi jānāti iti paññā vimuccati iti vimutti paññāya vimuccati iti
translated: “By that” : by that fading away of ignorance.

original: paññāvimutti, paññā eva vā vimutti paññāvimutti, arahattaphalapaññā, tāya paññāvimuttiyā.
analyzed: paññā vimutti paññā eva vā vimutti paññā vimutti arahatta phala paññā tāya paññā vimuttiyā
translated: “It is understanding” : it is understanding because one understands by means of the path. “It is liberation” : it is liberation because one is liberated from the defilements by means of the path. Or alternatively, it is understanding and it is liberation, thus it is understanding and liberation. It is the understanding that is the fruit of arahantship. “By that understanding and liberation” : by that understanding and liberation.

original: “Tesu katame puggalā kena atthanayena hātabbā”ti vattabbato “tattha ye samathapubbaṅgamāhī”tiādi🔽vuttaṃ. Tattha tatthāti tesu “ubho taṇhācaritā”tiādinā vibhattesu puggalesu ye ubho
analyzed: tesu katame puggalā kena attha nayena hātabbā ati vattabbataḥ tattha ye  vuttam tattha tattha ati tesu ubho taṇhā caritā ti ādinā vibhattesu puggalesu ye ubho
translated: “Which persons should be led by which method?” In order to show this, he said, “Therein, those who are of the type that begins with serenity” , etc.🔽Therein, among the persons classified by the above method into “both of whom are of the type that begins with serenity” , etc., those who are of the type that begins with serenity and ends with wisdom are of the type that begins with serenity and ends with wisdom.

original: taṇhācaritā mandaudattā puggalā samatha…pe… niyyanti, te ubho taṇhācaritā mandaudattā🔽puggalā nandiyāvaṭṭena nayena hātabbā gametabbā netabbā. Ye ubho diṭṭhicaritā mandaudattā
analyzed: taṇhā caritā mandaudattā puggalā samathape niyyanti te ubho taṇhā caritā mandaudattā 🔽puggalāḥ nandiyāvaṭṭena nayena hātabbāḥ gametabbāḥ netabbāḥ ye ubho diṭṭhi caritā mandaudattā
translated: Those who are of the type that begins with wisdom and ends with serenity are of the type that begins with wisdom and ends with serenity.🔽Those who are of the type that begins with serenity and ends with serenity are of the type that begins with serenity and ends with serenity.🔽Those who are of the type that begins with wisdom and ends with wisdom are of the type that begins with wisdom and ends with wisdom.

original: puggalā vipassanā…pe… samathena niyyanti, te ubho diṭṭhicaritā mandaudattā puggalā🔽sīhavikkīḷitena nayena hātabbā gametabbā netabbāti attho.🔽7. “Tattha catasso paṭipadā”tiādinā desanāhārena dukkhāpaṭipadābhedena taṇhācaritamandādibhedo
analyzed: puggalā vipassanāpe samathena niyyanti te ubho diṭṭhi caritā mandaudattā puggalā  sīha vikkīḷitena nayena hātabbā gametabbā netabbā ati attho  tattha catasso paṭipadā ati ādinā desanā āhārena dukkha apaṭipadā bhedena taṇhā carita manda ādi bhedo
translated: The meaning is that they are to be trained, to be led, to be guided by the method of the lion’s play.🔽Herein, the person of the type that is sluggish in both ways is distinguished by the method of instruction called the lion’s play.🔽The person of the type that is sluggish in both ways is distinguished by the method of instruction called the lion’s play.🔽The person of the type that is sluggish in both ways is distinguished by the method of instruction called the lion’s play.

original: puggalo vibhatto, amhehi ca ñāto, “tassa vibhattānantaraṃ svāyaṃ desanāhāro kattha
analyzed: puggalaḥ vibhattaḥ amhehi ca ñāto tassa vibhattā anantaram svāyam desanā āhāro kattha
translated: The person of the type that is sluggish in both ways is distinguished by the method of instruction called the lion’s play.

original: saṃvaṇṇetabbe dhamme kenaci ākārena sambhavatī”ti pucchitabbabhāvato “svāyaṃ hāro🔽kattha sambhavatī”tiādimāha. Navamakkhaṇasampannassa satthā yaṃ dhammaṃ deseti, tasmiṃ
analyzed: saṃvaṇṇetabbe dhamme kenaci ākārena sambhavati iti pucchitabba bhāvataḥ su ayam hāro  kattha sambhavati itiādim āha navama kkhaṇa sampannassa satthā yam dhammam deseti tasmin
translated: The person of the type that is sluggish in both ways is distinguished by the method of instruction called the lion’s play.🔽The person of the type that is sluggish in both ways is distinguished by the method of instruction called the lion’s play.🔽The person of the type that is sluggish in both ways is distinguished by the method of instruction called the lion’s play.🔽The person of the type that is sluggish in both ways is distinguished by the method of instruction called the lion’s play.🔽The person of the type that is sluggish in both ways is distinguished by the method of instruction called the lion’s play.🔽The person of the type that is sluggish in both ways is distinguished by the method of instruction called the lion’s play.🔽The person of the type that is sluggish in both ways is distinguished by the method of instruction called the lion’s play.🔽The person of the type that is sluggish in both ways is distinguished by the method of instruction called the lion’s play.🔽The person of the type that is sluggish in both ways is distinguished by the method of instruction called the lion’s play.🔽The person of the type that is sluggish in both ways is distinguished by the method of instruction called the lion’s play.

original: saṃvaṇṇetabbe dhamme yā vīmaṃsādikā sutamayādikā tisso paññā vibhattā, tāhi paññāhi
analyzed: saṃvaṇṇetabbe dhamme yā vīmaṃsā ādikā suta maya ādikā tisso paññā vibhattā tāhi paññāhi
translated: The person of the type that is sluggish in both ways is distinguished by the method of instruction called the lion’s play.🔽The person of the type that is sluggish in both ways is distinguished by the method of instruction called the lion’s play.🔽The person of the type that is sluggish in both ways is distinguished by the method of instruction called the lion’s play.

original: ye ugghaṭitaññuādayo tayo puggalā vibhattā, iti vibhattākārena ayaṃ desanāhāro satthārā🔽desetabbe dhamme sambhavatīti daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: ye puggalāḥ vibhattāḥ iti vibhatta ākārena ayam desanā āhāro satthārā 🔽desetabbe dhamme sambhavati iti daṭṭhabbaḥ
translated: The person of the type that is sluggish in both ways is

original: Tattha svāyaṃ hāroti desanāhārena paṭipadāvibhāgena veneyyapuggalavibhāgo dassito,
analyzed: tattha desanā hāro ti desanā hārena paṭipadā vibhāgena veneyya puggala vibhāgaḥ dassito
translated: Herein, this is the exposition of the person to be trained by means of the nutriment of the Teaching and the nutriment of the Path:

original: so ayaṃ desanāhāro. Kattha sambhavatīti kattha saṃvaṇṇetabbe dhamme saṃvaṇṇanābhāvena
analyzed: saḥ ayam desanā āhāro kattha sambhavati iti kattha saṃvaṇṇetabbe dhamme saṃvaṇṇanā bhāvena
translated: This is the nutriment of the Teaching. Where does it originate? Where does it occur? In what is praiseworthy, in what is blameless, in what is to be approved, in what is to be undertaken, in what is to be developed, in what is to be realized.

original: sambhavatīti. Yassāti yo so veneyyo paccantajādīhi aṭṭhahi akkhaṇehi vimutto, savanadhāraṇādīhi
analyzed: sambhavati iti yassa ati yo so veneyyaḥ paccanta ja ādīhi aṭṭhahi akkhaṇehi vimuttaḥ savana dhāraṇa ādīhi
translated: Who? The person to be trained who is free from the eight inopportune births among the recluses and brahmans of the border regions, and who is endowed with the attainments of hearing, memorizing, etc.

original: ca sampattīhi samannāgato, tassa veneyyassa. Satthāti sadevakaṃ lokaṃ sāsati anusāsatīti
analyzed: ca sampattīhi samannāgato tassa veneyyassa satthā ati sa devakam lokam sāsati anusāsati iti
translated: The Teacher is the one who teaches, instructs, and trains the world with its gods.

original: satthā. Dhammanti desitaṃ saṃvaṇṇetabbaṃ dhammaṃ. Desayatīti saṅkhepanayavitthāranayehi
analyzed: satthā dhammanti desitam saṃvaṇṇetabbam dhammam desayati iti saṅkhepa naya vitthāra nayehi
translated: The Dhamma is the praiseworthy Dhamma that is to be taught. He teaches it by means of the method of brief statements and the method of detailed explanations.

original: bhāsati. Aññataroti bhagavato sāvakesu evaṃ dhammaṃ desetuṃ samattho sāvako. Garuṭṭhāniyoti
analyzed: bhāsati aññataro ti bhagavataḥ sāvakesu evam dhammam desetum samatthaḥ sāvakaḥ garuṭṭhāniyaḥ ti
translated: One of the disciples is a disciple who is able to teach the Dhamma in this way among the Blessed One's disciples.

original: gāravassa ṭhānabhūtehi sīlasutacāgādiguṇavisesehi yutto mānito saddahitabbavacano.
analyzed: gāravassa ṭhāna bhūtehi sīla suta cāga ādi guṇa visesehi yuttaḥ mānitaḥ saddahitabba vacano
translated: The venerable one is endowed with the special qualities of virtue, learning, generosity, etc., which are the basis for respect, and is honored and believed in.

original: Sabrahmacārīti samaṃ, saha vā brahmaṃ satthusāsanaṃ carati paṭipajjatīti sabrahmacārī.
analyzed: sabrahmacārī iti samam saha vā brahmam satthu sāsanam carati paṭipajjati iti sabrahmacārī
translated: A fellow celibate is one who practices or trains in the same training as the Buddha’s dispensation.

original: Saddhaṃ labhati “yo satthā dhammaṃ deseti, so satthā sammāsambuddho hotī”ti satthari,🔽“svākkhāto vatāyaṃ dhammo sāttho sabyañjano ekantaparipuṇṇo ekantaparisuddho atthāvaho
analyzed: saddham labhati yaḥ satthā dhammaṃ deseti so satthā sammāsambuddhaḥ hoti iti satthari  su ākkhātaḥ vata ayam dhammo sa atthaḥ sa byañjanaḥ ekanta paripuṇṇaḥ ekanta parisuddhaḥ attha āvaho
translated: He gains faith in the Teacher, thinking, “The Teacher who teaches the Dhamma is a Fully Enlightened One.”

original: hitāvaho sukhāvaho jhānamaggaphalanibbattako, amhehi ca saddahitabbo”ti desite dhamme🔽ca acalasaddhaṃ labhati, saddahanaṃ attano santāne punappunaṃ uppādeti. Tathā “yo🔽sāvako dhammaṃ deseti, so sāvako saṅkhepato vā vitthārato vā dhammaṃ desetuṃ samattho🔽vata garuṭṭhāniyo sabrahmacārī mānito saddahitabbavacano”ti desake sāvake ca “tādisena
analyzed: hita āvahaḥ sukha āvahaḥ jhāna magga phala nibbattakaḥ amhehi ca saddahitabbaḥ iti desite dhamme  ca acala saddham labhati sat dahanam attanaḥ santāne punappunam uppādeti tathā yaḥ  sāvakaḥ dhammam deseti saḥ sāvakaḥ saṅkhepataḥ vā vitthārataḥ vā dhammam desetum samatthaḥ  vata garuṭṭhāniyaḥ sabrahmacārī mānitaḥ saddahitabba vacanā iti desake sāvake ca tādisena
translated: He gains unshakable faith in the Dhamma taught by the Teacher, thinking, “This Dhamma is well proclaimed by the Blessed One, visible here and now, not delayed , inviting of inspection, onward-leading, and directly experienceable by the wise.”🔽He gains unshakable faith in the disciples of the Teacher, thinking, “The disciples of the Blessed One who have entered on the way are practising the good way, practising the straight way, practising the true way, practising the proper way; they are the Teacher’s genuine disciples.”

original: sāvakena desito yo dhammo, so dhammo sāttho sabyañjano ekantaparipuṇṇo ekantaparisuddho
analyzed: sāvakena desitaḥ yaḥ dhammo saḥ dhammo sa attho sa byañjanaḥ ekanta paripuṇṇaḥ ekanta parisuddho
translated: He gains unshakable faith in the Dhamma taught by the disciples, thinking, “The Dhamma taught by the disciples of the Blessed One is well proclaimed by them, visible here and now, not delayed, inviting of inspection, onward-leading, and directly experienceable by the wise.”

original: atthāvaho hitāvaho sukhāvaho jhānamaggaphalanibbattako, amhehi ca saddahitabbo”ti
analyzed: attha āvahaḥ hita āvahaḥ sukha āvahaḥ jhāna magga phala nibbattakaḥ amhehi ca saddahitabbo ti
translated: He is the one who brings about welfare, the one who brings about benefit, the one who brings about bliss, the one who produces jhāna, path, and fruit. He is to be believed by us.”

original: sāvakena desitadhamme ca saddhaṃ saddahanaṃ attano santāne punappunaṃ uppādetīti attho.
analyzed: sāvakena desita dhamme ca saddham saddahanam attano santāne punappunam uppādeti iti attho
translated: The meaning is that he generates in his own continuity again and again the faith that is faith in the Dhamma taught by the Master and by the disciple.

original: Tatthāti tasmiṃ saddahitabbe satthārā desitadhamme ceva sāvakena desitadhamme ca
analyzed: tattha ati tasmin saddahitabbe satthārā desita dhamme ca iva sāvakena desita dhamme ca
translated: Herein, in the Dhamma taught by the Master and by the disciple that is to be believed,

original: saddahantassa veneyyassa yā vīmaṃsā, vīmaṃsantassa yā ussāhanā, ussahantassa yā tulanā,🔽tulayantassa yā upaparikkhā, sā ayaṃ vīmaṃsādikā paññā saddhānusārena pavattanato
analyzed: saddahantassa veneyyassa yā vīmaṃsā vīmaṃsantassa yā ussāhanā ussahantassa yā tulanā  tulayantassa yā upaparikkhā sā ayam vīmaṃsā ādikā paññā saddhā anusārena pavattanato
translated: the investigation of a disciple who has faith is his inquiry, his exertion, his comparison,🔽his investigation. The wisdom consisting in investigation, etc., is called wisdom derived from what is heard because it occurs in one who is a follower by way of faith.

original: sutamayī paññā nāma. Tattha vīmaṃsanaṃ vimaṃsā, pāḷiyā, pāḷiatthassa ca vīmaṃsā.
analyzed: suta mayī paññā nāma tattha vīmaṃsanam vimaṃsā pāḷiyā pāḷi atthassa ca vīmaṃsā
translated: Herein, investigation is the investigation of the text and the meaning of the text.🔽Or else, investigation is the investigation of the word by the word, of the meaning by the meaning.

original: Vīmaṃsatīti vā vīmaṃsā, padaṃ padantarena, padatthaṃ padatthantarena vicāraṇakā paññā.
analyzed: vīmaṃsati iti vā vīmaṃsā padam pada antarena padattham padattha antarena vicāraṇakā paññā
translated: The wisdom that investigates is the wisdom that examines the word by another word, the meaning by another meaning.

original: Yathā cettha, evaṃ ussāhanādīsupi bhāvasādhanakattusādhanāni kātabbāni. Ussāhanā
analyzed: yathā ca ittha evam ussāhana ādīsu pi bhāva sādhana kattu sādhanāni kātabbāni ussāhanā
translated: Just as here, so too in the case of exertion, etc., the fourfold method of explanation should be applied: Exertion is

original: ca ussāhena upatthambhikā dhammassa dhāraṇaparicayasādhikā paññā ca, na vīriyaṃ,🔽ettha ca yā sutamatteyeva pavattā, vīmaṃsādibhāvaṃ appattā nivattā, sā sutamayī paññā
analyzed: ca ussāhena upatthambhikā dhammassa dhāraṇa paricaya sādhikā paññā ca na vīriyam  ettha ca yā vīmaṃsā ādi bhāvam appattā nivattā sā suta mayī paññā
translated: and understanding that is a support by way of zeal, which is conducive to the retention and comprehension of the True Idea, is not energy.🔽And here, that which occurs only in what is heard, which does not reach the state of investigation, etc., and turns back, is understanding consisting in what is heard.

original: na hoti. Yā ca sutvā vīmaṃsitvā ussāhanādibhāvaṃ appattā nivattā, yā ca sutvā vīmaṃsitvā🔽ussahitvā tulanādibhāvaṃ appattā nivattā, yā ca sutvā vīmaṃsitvā ussahitvā tulayitvā
analyzed: na hoti yā ca sutvā vīmaṃsitvā ussāhana ādi bhāvam appattā nivattā yā ca sutvā vīmaṃsitvā  ussahitvā tulana ādi bhāvam appattā nivattā yā ca sutvā vīmaṃsitvā ussahitvā tulayitvā
translated: And that which, after hearing, does not reach the state of investigation, and turns back,🔽and that which, after hearing and investigating, does not reach the state of zeal, and turns back,

original: upaparikkhanabhāvaṃ appattā nivattā, sāpi paññā na sutamayī paññā hotīti daṭṭhabbā.
analyzed: upaparikkhana bhāvam appattā nivattā sā api paññā na suta mayī paññā hoti iti daṭṭhabbā
translated: and that which, after hearing, investigating, and exerting zeal, does not reach the state of weighing, and turns back, should be regarded as not being understanding consisting in what is heard.

original: Yā pana sutvā saddahantassa vīmaṃsā, vīmaṃsantassa ussāhanā, ussahantassa tulanā,
analyzed: yā pana sutvā saddahantassa vīmaṃsā vīmaṃsantassa ussāhanā ussahantassa tulanā
translated: But that which, after hearing, is investigation in one who has confidence, zeal in one who investigates, weighing in one who has zeal,

original: tulayantassa upaparikkhā hoti, ayaṃ sutamayī paññā nāma hotīti daṭṭhabbā.
analyzed: tulayantassa upaparikkhā hoti ayam suta mayī paññā nāma hoti iti daṭṭhabbā
translated: and close investigation in one who weighs, should be regarded as understanding consisting in what is heard.🔽Understanding consisting in what is heard has been analysed by the teacher and is known by us.

original: Sutamayī paññā ācariyena vibhattā, amhehi ca ñātā, “katamā cintāmayī paññā”ti vattabbabhāvato
analyzed: suta mayī paññā ācariyena vibhattā amhehi ca ñātā katamā cintā mayī paññā iti vattabba bhāvato
translated: “What is understanding consisting in cogitation?” should be said.

original: sutamayiyā paññāya vibhajanānantaraṃ cintāmayiṃ paññaṃ vibhajituṃ “tathā sutena nissayenā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: suta mayiyā paññāya vibhajana anantaram cintā mayim paññam vibhajitum tathā sutena nissayena ati ādim āha
translated: After the exposition of understanding consisting in what is heard, he now said “In suchwise with the heard as the proximate cause” in order to give the exposition of understanding consisting in cogitation.

original: Tattha sutanti suyyate pariyattidhammoti suto, savanaṃ pariyattidhammassāti vā sutaṃ,
analyzed: tattha sutam ti suyyate pariyatti dhammo ti sutaḥ savanam pariyatti dhammassa ati vā sutam
translated: Herein, the heard is what is heard, that is, the True Idea as text, or else the hearing, that is, the aural consciousness, is the heard.🔽Both are the heard. The meaning is that it is the proximate cause, the support.

original: duvidhampi sutaṃ. Nissayena upanissāyāti attho. Itthambhūtalakkhaṇe cetaṃ “sutena
analyzed: duvidham pi sutam nissayena upanissāya ati attho ittham bhūta lakkhaṇe ca itam sutena
translated: In the sense of the state of being such it is the heard as the proximate cause, which is the instrumental case.

original: nissayenā”ti karaṇavacanaṃ. Ettha pana “idaṃ pāṇātipātādiviramanaṃ sīlanaṭṭhena sīlaṃ,
analyzed: nissayena iti karaṇa vacanam ettha pana idam pāṇātipāta ādi viramanam sīlana ṭṭhena sīlam
translated: Herein, however, the investigation of the individual essences of the various ideas such as this abstention from killing breathing things, etc., is virtue in the sense of composing ,

original: ayaṃ ekaggatā samādahanaṭṭhena samādhi, imāni bhūtupādāni ruppanaṭṭhena rūpāni, ime
analyzed: ayaṃ ekagga tā samādahana ṭṭhena samādhi imāni bhūtupādāni ruppana ṭṭhena rūpāni ime
translated: this unification is concentration in the sense of concentrating , these are materiality in the sense of being molested ,

original: phassādayo namanaṭṭhena nāmāni, ime rūpādayo pañca dhammā rāsaṭṭhena khandhā”ti tesaṃ
analyzed: phassa ādayaḥ namana ṭṭhena nāmāni ime rūpa ādayo pañca dhammā rāsaṭṭhena khandhā ti tesam
translated: these are mentality in the sense of being bent , these are the five categories in the sense of being a heap , is called investigation.

original: tesaṃ dhammānaṃ pīḷanādisabhāvassa vīmaṃsanābhūtā paññā vīmaṃsā nāma. Tesaṃyeva sīlasamādhiādīnaṃ
analyzed: tesam dhammānam pīḷana ādi sabhāvassa vīmaṃsanā bhūtā paññā vīmaṃsā nāma tesam yeva sīla samādhi ādīnam
translated: And the investigation of the individual essences of those same ideas such as virtue, concentration, etc.,

original: sīlati patiṭṭhahati etthāti sīlantiādivacanatthaṃ pucchitvā sabhāgalakkhaṇarasapaccupaṭṭhānapadaṭṭhānānaṃ
analyzed: patiṭṭhahati ettha ati sīlanti ādi vacana attham pucchitvā sabhāga lakkhaṇa rasa paccupaṭṭhāna padaṭṭhānānam
translated: “The meaning of the words ‘morality’ (sīla), etc., is asked for.🔽

original: tuletvā viya gahaṇapaññā tulanaṃ nāma. Tesaṃyeva sīlasamādhiādīnaṃ dhammānaṃ sabhāvalakkhaṇaṃ
analyzed: tuletvā viya gahaṇa paññā tulanam nāma tesam yeva sīla samādhi ādīnam dhammānam sabhāva lakkhaṇam
translated: “It is a footing for virtue” : thus it is virtue . . . ” : having asked for the meaning of the words in this way, the understanding that apprehends them as if by weighing their respective characteristics, properties, manifestations, and proximate causes is called “weighing.”

original: avijahitvā aniccatādukkhatādinamanaruppanādisappaccayasaṅkhatādiākāre vitakketvā
analyzed: a vijahitvā anicca tā dukkha tā ādi namana ruppana ādi sappaccaya saṅkha tā ādi ākāre vitakketvā
translated: The understanding that is called “examining” should be seen as the understanding that, without omitting the individual essence of such ideas as virtue, concentration, etc., considers them in the aspect of their conditionality, etc., as impermanent, painful, and not-self.

original: upaparikkhaṇapaññā eva upaparikkhā nāmāti visesato daṭṭhabbo. Sutadhammassa dhāraṇaparicayavasena🔽pavattanato sutamayī paññā ussāhanā jātā viya na cintāmayī paññā cintitassa dhāraṇaparicayavasena
analyzed: upaparikkhaṇa paññā eva upaparikkhā nāma ati visesataḥ daṭṭhabbo suta dhammassa dhāraṇa paricaya vasena  pavattanato suta mayī paññā ussāhanā jātā viya na cintā mayī paññā cintitassa dhāraṇa paricaya vasena
translated: Because it occurs by way of retention and repetition of the ideas heard, understanding consisting in what is heard is like a stimulus.

original: appavattanatoti “ussāhanā”ti na vuttaṃ.
analyzed: appavattanato ti ussāhanā ati na vuttam
translated: But because understanding consisting in cogitation does not occur by way of retention and repetition of what is thought out, it is not called a “stimulus.”🔽The two kinds of understanding consisting in what is heard and in cogitation have been expounded by the teacher and have been understood by us.

original: Sutamayī paññā ceva cintāmayī paññā ca ācariyena vibhattā, amhehi ca ñātā, “katamā
analyzed: suta mayī paññā ca iva cintā mayī paññā ca ācariyena vibhattā amhehi ca ñātā katamā
translated: But what is understanding consisting in keeping in being?

original: bhāvanāmayī paññā”ti vattabbabhāvato kāraṇabhūtānaṃ dvinnaṃ sutamayicintāmayipaññānaṃ
analyzed: bhāvanā mayī paññā ati vattabba bhāvataḥ kāraṇa bhūtānam dvinnam suta mayi cintā mayi paññānam
translated: The reason why this question should be asked is that the two kinds of understanding consisting in what is heard and in cogitation are the cause of the kind consisting in keeping in being.

original: dassanānantaraṃ phalabhūtaṃ bhāvanāmayiṃ paññaṃ vibhajanto “imāhi dvīhī”tiādimāha.
analyzed: dassana anantaram phala bhūtam bhāvanā mayim paññam vibhajantaḥ imāhi dvīhi iti ādim āha
translated: He now analyses the understanding consisting in development, which is the fruit of seeing, in the words beginning with “With these two kinds of understanding” .

original: Tattha imāhi dvīhi paññāhīti sutamayicintāmayipaññāhi kāraṇabhūtāhi. Sutamayipaññāya
analyzed: tattha imāhi dvīhi paññāhi iti suta mayi cintā mayi paññāhi kāraṇa bhūtāhi suta mayi paññāya
translated: Herein, with these two kinds of understanding means with the two kinds of understanding consisting in learning and in keeping in mind as cause.

original: vā cintāmayipaññāya vā ubhayattha vā ṭhitoyeva yogāvacaro vipassanaṃ ārabhatīti.🔽Manasikārasampayuttassāti rūpārūpesu pariggahādivasena saṅkhāresu aniccatādivasena🔽manasikārena sammā pakārehi yuttappayuttassa. Diṭṭhivisuddhikaṅkhāvitaraṇavisuddhimaggāmaggañāṇadassanavisuddhi-
analyzed: vā cintāmayi paññāya vā ubhayattha vā ṭhitaḥ yā iva yogāvacaraḥ vipassanam ārabhati iti  manasikāra sampayuttassa ati rūpa arūpesu pariggaha ādi vasena saṅkhāresu anicca tā ādi vasena  manasikārena sammā pakārehi yutta ppayuttassa diṭṭhi visuddhi kaṅkhā vitaraṇa visuddhi magga amagga ñāṇa dassana visuddhi
translated: For it is only a devotee who is established in either the understanding consisting in learning or the understanding consisting in keeping in mind that begins insight.🔽With right reflection associated with attention means with right reflection associated with attention in the way beginning “impermanence, etc., in formations by defining them as ‘material and immaterial,’ etc.”

original: paṭipadāñāṇadassanavisuddhisampādanena vipassanaṃ ussukkantassa yogāvacarassa santāne
analyzed: paṭipad āñāṇa dassana visuddhi sampādanena vipassanam ussukkantassa yogāvacarassa santāne
translated: For it is only a devotee who is intent on insight by accomplishing the purification of view, the purification by overcoming doubt, the path-seeing path, and the knowledge of the way, in his own continuity

original: ñāṇadassanavisuddhisaṅkhātaṃ yaṃ ariyamaggañāṇaṃ nibbānārammaṇadassanabhūmiyaṃ vā
analyzed: ñāṇa dassana visuddhi saṅkhātam yam ariya magga ñāṇam nibbāna ārammaṇa dassana bhūmiyam vā
translated: that has the noble path knowledge called purification by knowledge and vision, in the plane of seeing that has Nibbāna as its object.

original: bhāvanābhūmiyaṃ vā uppajjati, ayaṃ bhāvanāmayī paññāti attho daṭṭhabbo. Yadipi paṭhamamaggañāṇaṃ🔽paṭhamaṃ nibbānadassanato “dassana”nti vuttaṃ, bhāvanāvasena pana pavattanato “bhāvanāmayī
analyzed: bhāvanā bhūmiyam vā uppajjati ayam bhāvanā mayī paññā ti atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo yadi api paṭhama magga ñāṇam  paṭhamam nibbāna dassanataḥ dassananti vuttam bhāvanā vasena pana pavattanataḥ bhāvanā mayī
translated: Or it arises on the plane of development: this is the meaning to be seen.

original: paññā”ti veditabbaṃ. Dassanabhūmīti paṭhamamaggaphalāni, sesāni “bhāvanābhūmī”ti vuccanti.
analyzed: paññā iti veditabbam dassana bhūmī ti paṭhama magga phalāni sesāni bhāvanā bhūmī iti vuccanti
translated: Although the first path knowledge is called “seeing” because it is the first seeing of Nibbāna, still it should be understood as “understanding consisting in what is heard” since it occurs by way of development. The first path and fruition are called “the plane of seeing,” while the rest are called “the plane of development.”

original: 8. Amhākācariya tumhehi “yassa satthā vā”tiādinā sutamayipaññādikā vibhattā, evaṃ
analyzed: tumhehi yassa satthā vāti ādinā suta mayi paññā ādikā vibhattā evam
translated: Our teachers have analyzed understanding consisting in what is heard, etc., as “For one who has a teacher” , etc.

original: sati sutena vinā cintāmayī paññā nāma na bhaveyya, mahābodhisattānaṃ pana sutena🔽vinā cintāmayī paññā hotvevāti codanaṃ manasi katvā tasmiṃ saṅgahetvā pakārantarena🔽vibhajituṃ “paratoghosā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: sati sutena vinā cintā mayī paññā nāma na bhaveyya mahā bodhisattānam pana sutena  vinā cintā mayī paññā hotvā iva ati codanam manasi katvā tasmin saṅgahetvā pakāra antarena  vibhajitum paratoghosāti ādim āha
translated: But if that is so, then understanding consisting in cogitation would not exist without learning, and yet the great bodhisattvas have understanding consisting in cogitation without learning.

original: Tattha paratoghosāti parato pavatto desanāghoso paccayo etissāti paratoghosā. Paccattasamuṭṭhitāti
analyzed: tattha paratoghosā ati paratas pavattaḥ desanā ghoso paccayaḥ etissa ati paratoghosā paccatta samuṭṭhitā ati
translated: Bearing in mind this objection, he has introduced the analysis in the next section, beginning with the words “Cogitation that has arisen by itself” , in order to show that there is such a thing as understanding consisting in cogitation without learning.

original: pati visuṃ attaniyeva samuṭṭhitā. Yonisomanasikārāti tesaṃ tesaṃ cintetabbānaṃ rūpādīnaṃ
analyzed: pati visum samuṭṭhitā yoniso manasikārā ti tesam tesam cintetabbānam rūpa ādīnam
translated: and the other is arisen in oneself. Proper attention: to the various things that should be reflected upon, such as the material form, etc.

original: dhammānaṃ ruppananamanādisabhāvapariggaṇhanādinā upāyena pavattamanasikārā cintāmayī🔽paññā nāma, iminā sāvakāpi sāmaññato gahitā, tathāpi ugghaṭitaññuādīnaṃyeva vuttattā🔽sāvakā idha gahitā, tasmā purimanayo yuttataro. Paratoti dhammadesakato pavattena🔽dhammadesanāghosena hetunā yaṃ ñāṇaṃ uppajjati, paccattasamuṭṭhitena, yonisomanasikārena🔽ca hetunā yaṃ ñāṇaṃ uppajjati, ayaṃ bhāvanāvasena pavattanato bhāvanāmayī paññā nāma,
analyzed: dhammānam ruppana namana ādi sabhāva pariggaṇhana ādinā upāyena pavatta manasikārā cintā mayī  paññā nāma iminā sāvakā api sāmaññataḥ gahitā tathā api vutta ttā  sāvakāḥ idha gahitā tasmā purima nayaḥ yuttataro paratas ti dhamma desakato pavattena  dhamma desanā ghosena hetunā yam ñāṇam uppajjati paccatta samuṭṭhitena yoniso manasikārena  ca hetunā yam ñāṇam uppajjati ayam bhāvanā vasena pavattanataḥ bhāvanā mayī paññā nāma
translated: and the other is arisen by itself. “By wise attention” is the understanding arisen by thinking, which is the attention occurring by way of the method of discerning the individual essences of the various things to be thought about, such as form, etc., beginning with the contemplation of the repulsiveness of the body. By this, disciples are also included in the sense of being similar to the Enlightened One. Nevertheless, only those of the three types beginning with the “one who attains Nibbāna early” are mentioned here.

original: iminā sāvakāpi sāmaññato gahitā, tathāpi ugghaṭitaññuādīnaṃyeva vuttattā sāvakā idha🔽gahitā, tasmā purimanayo yuttataro. Paratoti dhammadesakato pavattena dhammadesanāghosena
analyzed: iminā sāvakā api sāmaññataḥ gahitā tathā api vutta ttā sāvakā idha 🔽gahitā tasmā purima nayaḥ yuttataro parato ti dhamma desakato pavattena dhamma desanā ghosena
translated: Therefore the former method is more appropriate. “By what is heard” is the understanding arisen by learning, which is the knowledge that arises by way of the sound of the teaching of the Dhamma as uttered by another. “By wise attention” is the understanding arisen by pondering, which is the knowledge that arises by way of the sound of the teaching of the Dhamma as uttered by oneself. “By wise attention” is the understanding arisen by pondering, which is the knowledge that arises by way of the sound of the teaching of the Dhamma as uttered by oneself. “By wise attention” is the understanding arisen by pondering, which is the knowledge that arises by way of the sound of the teaching of the Dhamma as uttered by oneself. “By wise attention” is the understanding arisen by pondering, which is the knowledge that arises by way of the sound of the teaching of the Dhamma as uttered by oneself. “By wise attention” is the understanding arisen by pondering, which is the knowledge that arises by way of the sound of the teaching of the Dhamma as uttered by oneself. “By wise attention” is the understanding arisen by pondering, which is the knowledge that arises by way of the sound of the teaching of the Dhamma as uttered by oneself. “By wise attention” is the understanding arisen by pondering, which is the knowledge that arises by way of the sound of the teaching of the Dhamma as uttered by oneself. “By wise attention” is the understanding arisen by pondering, which is the knowledge that arises by way of the sound of the teaching of the Dhamma as uttered by oneself. “By wise attention” is the understanding arisen by pondering, which is the knowledge that arises by way of the sound of the teaching of the Dhamma as uttered by oneself. “By wise attention” is the understanding arisen by pondering, which is the knowledge that arises by way of the sound of the teaching of the Dhamma as uttered by oneself. “By wise attention” is the understanding arisen by pondering,

original: hetunā yaṃ ñāṇaṃ uppajjati, paccattasamuṭṭhitena, yonisomanasikārena ca hetunā yaṃ
analyzed: hetunā yam ñāṇam uppajjati paccatta samuṭṭhitena yoniso manasikārena ca hetunā yam
translated: Knowledge that arises through a cause, through a condition, through a reason, through a cause that is a condition arisen from oneself, and through a cause that is a reason consisting in right reflection,

original: ñāṇaṃ uppajjati, ayaṃ bhāvanāvasena pavattanato bhāvanāmayī paññā nāmāti vibhajitvā
analyzed: ñāṇam uppajjati ayam bhāvanā vasena pavattanataḥ bhāvanā mayī paññā nāma ati vibhajitvā
translated: is called wisdom born of development, because it occurs by way of development.🔽It should be known by the wise,

original: paṇḍitehi ñeyyāti vitthārena gambhīratthaṃ ñātuṃ icchantehi “evaṃ paṭipadāvibhāgenā”tiādinā🔽aṭṭhakathāvacanena jānitabbo.
analyzed: paṇḍitehi ñeyyā ati vitthārena gambhīra attham ñātum icchantehi evam paṭipadā vibhāgena ati ādinā  aṭṭhakathā vacanena jānitabbaḥ
translated: who wish to know the deep meaning in detail, by means of the statement of the commentary beginning with “By the analysis of the way.”

original: Sutamayipaññādikā tisso paññā ācariyena nānānayehi vibhattā, amhehi ca ñātā, “tāsu
analyzed: suta mayi paññā ādikā tissaḥ paññā ācariyena nānā nayehi vibhattā amhehi ca ñātā tāsu
translated: The three kinds of wisdom, beginning with that born of learning, have been analyzed by the teacher in various ways and have been understood by us.

original: yassa ekā vā dve vā paññā atthi, so puggalo konāmo, yassa ekāpi natthi, so puggalo🔽konāmo”ti pucchitabbabhāvato yassa ayaṃ paññā, imā vā atthi, so puggalo itthannāmo,🔽yassa natthi, so puggalo itthannāmoti paṭipadāpaññāppabhedena puggalaṃ vibhajituṃ
analyzed: yassa ekā vā dve vā paññā atthi so puggalo konāmaḥ yassa ekā api na atthi so puggalo  konāmaḥ ti pucchitabba bhāvataḥ yassa ayam paññā imā vā atthi so puggalo itthannāmo  yassa na atthi so puggalo itthannāmaḥ ti paṭipadā paññā appabhedena puggalam vibhajitum
translated: “Now, what is the name of the person who has one or two of these kinds of wisdom?🔽What is the name of the person who has none of them?”

original: “yassa imā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: yassa imā itiādi vuttam
translated: In order to answer these questions, the following is stated in order to analyze the person by way of the kinds of wisdom, namely,🔽“The person who has this or that kind of wisdom is so-and-so;🔽the person who has none of them is such-and-such.”

original: Tattha yassa atitikkhapaññassa sutamayī paññā ceva cintāmayī paññā ca imā dve paññā
analyzed: tattha yassa a titikkha paññassa suta mayī paññā ca iva cintā mayī paññā ca imā dve paññā
translated: Herein, one whose understanding is very keen has both the understanding that comes from what is heard and the understanding that comes from cogitation.

original: atthi, ayaṃ atitikkhapañño uddesamatteneva jānanato ugghaṭitaññū nāma. Yassa nātitikkhapaññassa
analyzed: atthi ayam a titikkha paññaḥ uddesa mattena iva jānanataḥ ugghaṭitaññū nāma yassa na a titikkha paññassa
translated: This one is of very keen understanding. Because he knows by mere indication, he is called “one who knows after hearing” . One whose understanding is not very keen

original: uddesaniddesehi sutamayī paññā atthi, cintāmayī paññā natthi, ayaṃ nātitikkhapañño
analyzed: uddesa niddesehi suta mayī paññā atthi cintā mayī paññā natthi ayam na a titikkha pañño
translated: has the understanding that comes from what is heard by means of the indication and the description, but he has not the understanding that comes from cogitation. This one is of not very keen understanding.

original: uddesaniddesehi jānanato vipañcitaññū nāma. Yassa mandapaññassa uddesaniddesehi neva
analyzed: uddesa niddesehi jānanataḥ vipañcitaññū nāma yassa manda paññassa uddesa niddesehi na iva
translated: Because he knows by means of the indication and the description, he is called “one who knows after pondering” . One whose understanding is sluggish has neither

original: sutamayī paññā atthi, na cintāmayī paññā ca, ayaṃ mandapañño uddesaniddesapaṭiniddesehi
analyzed: suta mayī paññā atthi na cintā mayī paññā ca ayam manda paññaḥ uddesa niddesa paṭiniddesehi
translated: the understanding that comes from what is heard by means of the indication and the description nor the understanding that comes from cogitation. This one is of sluggish understanding.

original: jānanato niravasesavitthāradesanāya netabbato neyyo nāmāti. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana “idāni
analyzed: jānanataḥ niravasesa vitthāra desanāya netabbataḥ neyyaḥ nāma ati aṭṭhakathā ayam pana idāni
translated: Because he knows by means of the indication, the description, and the counter description, and because he has to be led by a detailed exposition without omission, he is called “one to be led” . But in the Commentary it is said:

original: yadatthaṃ imā paññā uddhaṭā, tameva veneyyapuggalavibhāgaṃ yojetvā dassetuṃ ‘yassā’tiādi🔽vutta”ntiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: yad attham imā paññā uddhaṭā tam eva veneyya puggala vibhāgam yojetvā dassetum yassa ati ādi 🔽vuttam tiādi vuttam
translated: “Now, in order to show the division of the kinds of disciples for the purpose for which these kinds of understanding have been brought out, it is said: ‘One whose understanding is keen’ and so on” .

original: 9. “Tattha bhagavā ugghaṭitaññussā”tiādinā desanaṃ vibhāveti, “tattha catasso paṭipadā”tiādinā
analyzed: tattha bhagavā ugghaṭita ññussa ati ādinā desanam vibhāveti tattha catasso paṭipadā ati ādinā
