translated: “Herein, the Blessed One analyses the teaching with the words ‘Herein, the four ways of entry are the four noble truths’ and so on,🔽and with the words ‘Herein, the four kinds of generation of the body are the four noble truths’ and so on,🔽and with the words ‘Herein, the four kinds of generation of suffering are the four noble truths’ and so on,

original: paṭipadāvibhāgehi, “svāyaṃ hāro”tiādinā ñāṇavibhāgehi ca desanābhājanaṃ veneyyattayaṃ🔽ācariyena vibhattaṃ, amhehi ca ñātaṃ, “yāya desanāpāḷiyā desanāhāraṃ yojetuṃ pubbe
analyzed: paṭipadā vibhāgehi svāyam hāroti ādinā ñāṇa vibhāgehi ca desanā bhājanam  ācariyena vibhattam amhehi ca ñātam yāya desanā pāḷiyā desanā āhāram yojetum pubbe
translated: and with the words ‘Herein, the four kinds of generation of the world are the four noble truths’ and so on,🔽and with the words ‘Herein, the four kinds of generation of the world’s origination are the four noble truths’ and so on,🔽and with the words ‘Herein, the four kinds of generation of the world’s cessation are the four noble truths’ and so on,🔽and with the words ‘Herein, the four kinds of generation of the world’s cessation’s path are the four noble truths’ and so on,🔽and with the words ‘Herein, the four kinds of generation of the world’s cessation’s path are the four noble truths’ and so on,

original: ‘dhammaṃ vo, bhikkhave, desessāmī’tiādinā desanāhārassa visayabhāvena yā pāḷidesanā🔽nikkhittā, sā pāḷidesanā desanāhārena niddhāritesu assādādīsu atthesu kimatthaṃ desayatī”ti🔽pucchitabbattā “imaṃ atthaṃ desayatī”ti niyametvā dassetuṃ “sāyaṃ dhammadesanā”tiādi āraddhaṃ.
analyzed: dhammam vaḥ bhikkhave desessāmi iti ādinā desanā āhārassa visaya bhāvena yā pāḷidesanā  nikkhittā sā pāḷidesanā desanā āhārena niddhāritesu assāda ādīsu atthesu kimattham desayati iti  pucchitabba ttā imam attham desayati iti niyametvā dassetum sāyam dhamma desanā ti ādi āraddham
translated: and with the words ‘Herein, the four kinds of generation of the world’s cessation’s path are the four noble truths’ and so on,🔽and with the words ‘Herein, the four kinds of generation of the world’s cessation’s path are the four noble truths’ and so on,🔽and with the words ‘Herein, the four kinds of generation of the world’s cessation’s path are the four noble truths’ and so on,🔽and with the words ‘Herein, the four kinds of generation of the world’s cessation’s path are the four noble truths’ and so on,

original: Tattha sāyaṃ dhammadesanāti yā dhammadesanā ādikalyāṇādikā pubbe desanāhārassa visayabhāvena
analyzed: tattha sāyam dhamma desanā ti yā dhamma desanā ādi kalyāṇa ādikā pubbe desanā āhārassa visaya bhāvena
translated: and with the words ‘Herein, the four kinds of generation of the world’s cessation’s path are the four noble truths’ and so on,🔽and with the words ‘Herein, the four kinds of generation of the world’s cessation’s path are the four noble truths’ and so on,🔽and with the words ‘Herein, the four kinds of generation of the world’s cessation’s path are the four noble truths’ and so on,🔽and with the words ‘Herein, the four kinds of generation of the world’s cessation’s path are the four noble truths’ and so on,🔽and with the words ‘Herein,

original: nikkhittā, sāyaṃ dhammadesanā assādādīsu kimatthaṃ desayatīti kathetukāmatāya pucchati,
analyzed: nikkhittā sāyam dhamma desanā assāda ādīsu kimattham desayati iti kathetu kāma tāya pucchati
translated: He asks this in order to show his desire to speak about the purpose of the teaching of the benefits, etc.

original: pucchitvā “cattāri saccāni desayatī”ti vissajjeti, tāni sarūpato dassetuṃ “dukkhaṃ🔽samudayaṃ nirodhaṃ magga”nti vuttaṃ. Pavattipavattakanivattinivattanupāyabhāvena
analyzed: pucchitvā cattāri saccāni desayati iti vissajjeti tāni sarūpataḥ dassetum dukkham  samudayam nirodham magganti vuttam pavatti pavattaka nivatti nivattana upāya bhāvena
translated: Having asked, he answers, “She teaches the four truths.” In order to show them in their individual forms, he says, “Suffering,

original: aviparītabhāvato “saccānī”ti vuttāni.
analyzed: aviparīta bhāvato saccāni iti vuttāni
translated: Origin, Cessation, Path.” They are called “truths” because they are not the opposite of the way things are, since they are the means for the occurrence of occurrence, the cessation of cessation, and the turning back of turning back.

original: Yassaṃ desanāyaṃ saccāni desanāhārena niddhāritāni, sā desanā cattāri saccāni desayatīti🔽yuttaṃ hotu. Yassaṃ desanāyaṃ assādādayo niddhāritā, sā desanā cattāri saccāni desayatīti
analyzed: desanā ayam saccāni desanā āhārena niddhāritāni sā desanā cattāri saccāni desayati iti  yuttam hotu desanā ayam niddhāritā sā desanā cattāri saccāni desayati iti
translated: The teaching in which the truths are discerned by the method of teaching is called “the teaching that teaches the four truths.”🔽But it is not possible to say that the teaching in which the benefits, etc., are discerned is the teaching that teaches the four truths.

original: na sakkā vattuṃ. Heṭṭhā ca assādādayo niddhāritā, tasmā “assādādayo”tipi vattabbanti
analyzed: na sakkā vattum heṭṭhā ca assāda ādayaḥ niddhāritā tasmai vattabbanti
translated: And since the benefits, etc., are discerned below, it should be said that they are also discerned in the teaching that teaches the four truths.

original: codanaṃ manasi katvā “ādīnavo phalañca dukkha”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Desanāhārena saṃvaṇṇanānayena
analyzed: codanam manasi katvā ādīnavaḥ phalam ca dukkham ti ādi vuttam desanā āhārena saṃvaṇṇanā nayena
translated: Having considered this objection, he says, “The disadvantage and the fruit are suffering,” etc.

original: desanāyaṃ niddhārito ādīnavo ceva phalañca dukkhasaccaṃ hoti, assādo samudayasaccaṃ,🔽nissaraṇaṃ nirodhasaccaṃ, upāyo ceva āṇatti ca maggasaccaṃ hoti, tasmā “cattāri saccāni
analyzed: desanā ayam niddhārito ādīnavaḥ ca iva phalam ca dukkha saccam hoti assādaḥ samudaya saccam  nissaraṇam nirodha saccam upāyaḥ ca iva āṇatti ca magga saccam hoti tasmā cattāri saccāni
translated: The danger and the fruit in the teaching are the truth of suffering. The gratification is the truth of origin.

original: desayatī”ti vattabbamevāti.
analyzed: desayati iti vattabbam eva ati
translated: The escape is the truth of cessation. The means and the injunction are the truth of the path. Therefore it should be said that he teaches the four truths.

original: Taṇhāvajjā tebhūmakadhammā dukkhaṃ, te ca aniccādīhi pīḷitattā ādīnavāyeva. Phalanti🔽desanāya phalaṃ lokiyaṃ, na lokuttaraṃ, tasmā dukkhanti vattabbameva. Assādoti taṇhāssādassa
analyzed: taṇhā vajjāḥ tebhūmaka dhammāḥ dukkham te ca anicca ādīhi pīḷita ttā ādīnavāya iva phalanti  desanāya phalam lokiyam na lokuttaram tasmā dukkhanti vattabbam eva assādaḥ ti taṇhā assādassa
translated: The craving and the states of the three planes are suffering. And since they are oppressed by impermanence, etc., they are also a danger.

original: gahitattā “assādo samudayo”ti ca vattabbaṃ. Assādekadeso dukkhameva, assādekadeso🔽dukkhañceva samudayo ca. Saha vipassanāya ariyamaggo ca bhagavato āṇatti ca desanāya
analyzed: gahita ttā assādaḥ samudayaḥ ti ca vattabbam assāda eka desaḥ dukkham eva assāda eka desaḥ  dukkham ca iva samudayaḥ ca saha vipassanāya ariya maggo ca bhagavato āṇatti ca desanāya
translated: The fruit of the teaching is mundane, not supramundane. Therefore it should be said that it is suffering. Since the gratification of craving is included, it should be said that the gratification is origin. A part of the gratification is suffering. A part of the gratification is both suffering and origin.

original: phalādhigamassa upāyabhāvato “upāyo, āṇatti ca maggo”ti vuttaṃ, nissaraṇekadesopi
analyzed: phala adhigamassa upāya bhāvataḥ upāyaḥ āṇatti ca maggo ti vuttam nissaraṇa eka desaḥ api
translated: The noble path together with insight and the Exalted One’s injunction are the means and the injunction of the attainment of the fruit of the teaching. Therefore it is said that they are the path. A part of the escape is the truth of cessation.

original: maggoti daṭṭhabbo. “Imāni cattāri saccāni yā desanā visesato desayati, katamā sā”ti🔽pucchitabbattā visesaṃ niyametvā dassetuṃ “imāni cattāri saccāni idaṃ dhammacakka”nti
analyzed: maggaḥ ti daṭṭhabbo imāni cattāri saccāni yā desanā visesataḥ desayati katamā sā ati  pucchitabba ttā visesam niyametvā dassetum imāni cattāri saccāni idam dhammacakkan ti
translated: The wheel should be seen as the path. “These four truths are taught in particular by which teaching?”

original: vuttaṃ. Idaṃ vuccamānaṃ dhammacakkaṃ imāni cattāri saccāni visesato desayatīti yojanā kātabbā.
analyzed: vuttam idam vuccamānam dhammacakkam imāni cattāri saccāni visesataḥ desayati iti yojanā kātabbā
translated: In order to show this by specifying the distinction, it is said, “These four truths are the Dhamma Wheel.” The interpretation should be made thus: “This Dhamma Wheel, which is being spoken of, teaches in particular these four truths.”

original: “Yā desanā imāni cattāri saccāni visesato desayati, tassā desanāya dhammacakkabhāvaṃ🔽kiṃ bhagavā āhā”ti vattabbabhāvato “yathāha bhagavā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha “jātipi
analyzed: yā desanā imāni cattāri saccāni visesataḥ desayati tassā desanāya dhamma cakka bhāvam  kim bhagavā āha iti vattabba bhāvataḥ yathā āha bhagavā ati ādi vuttam tattha
translated: “The Dhamma Wheel, which teaches in particular these four truths,🔽is it the Dhamma Wheel according to the Blessed One?”

original: dukkhā”tiādivacanato taṇhāvajjaṃ jātiādikaṃ tebhūmakadhammajātaṃ dukkhassa adhiṭṭhānabhāvena,🔽dukkhadukkhādibhāvena ca “dukkha”nti vuttaṃ. Meti mayā pavattitanti yojanā. Bhikkhaveti
analyzed: dukkha ati ādi vacanato taṇhā vajjam jāti ādikam tebhūmaka dhamma jātam dukkhassa adhiṭṭhāna bhāvena  dukkha dukkha ādi bhāvena ca dukkhanti vuttam mā iti mayā pavattitanti yojanā bhikkhave ti
translated: In order to show this, it is said, “As the Blessed One said,” etc. Herein, because of the words, “Birth is suffering,” etc., the blame for craving, which is birth, etc., the three planes of existence, is said to be “suffering” in the sense of being the basis for suffering,

original: savane ussāhaṃ janetuṃ ālapati. Bārāṇasiyanti bārāṇasīnagarassa avidūre. Isipataneti
analyzed: savane ussāham janetum ālapati bārāṇasiyanti bārāṇasī nagarassa avidūre isipatane ti
translated: and in the sense of being suffering as suffering, etc. The interpretation is: “I have set rolling.” Bhikkhus: he addresses them in order to arouse enthusiasm for listening. At Bārāṇasī: not far from the city of Bārāṇasī. At the Deer Park in Isipatana:

original: sīlakkhandhādīnaṃ isanato gavesanato “isī”ti voharitānaṃ paccekabuddhānaṃ patanaṭṭhāne.
analyzed: sīla kkhandha ādīnam isanataḥ gavesanataḥ isī iti voharitānam paccekabuddhānam patana ṭṭhāne
translated: In the place where the Paccekabuddhas fell, who were called “seers” because they were searching for the knowledge of the aggregates of virtue, etc.

original: Migadāyeti migānaṃ abhayadānaṭṭhāne kārite assameva.🔽Anuttaranti uttaritarābhāvena anuttaraṃ anatisayaṃ. Dhammacakkanti satipaṭṭhānādike
analyzed: miga dāya iti migānam abhaya dāna ṭhāne kārite assam eva  anuttaranti uttaritara abhāvena anuttaram anatisayam dhammacakkam ti sati paṭṭhāna ādike
translated: In the Deer Park, which was a place where deer were given protection, in the place that was made into a hermitage.

original: sabhāvadhāraṇādinā atthena dhammo ceva pavattanaṭṭhena cakkañcāti dhammacakkaṃ. Appaṭivattiyanti🔽appaṭisedhanīyaṃ. Kasmā? Janakassa bhagavato dhammissarattā sammāsambuddhattā, jaññassa
analyzed: sabhā avadhāraṇa ādinā atthena dhammo ca iva pavattana ṭṭhena cakkam ca ati dhammacakkam appaṭivattiyanti  a paṭisedhanīyam kasmā janakassa bhagavataḥ dhammissarattā sammāsambuddha ttā jaññassa
translated: Unsurpassed: unsurpassed because there is nothing higher, nothing greater. Wheel of Dhamma: the wheel of the Dhamma is so called because it is the Dhamma in the sense of what should be borne in mind, etc., and it is a wheel in the sense of rolling on.

original: ca anuttarattā koṇḍaññādīnañceva aṭṭhārasabrahmakoṭiyā ca catusaccapaṭivedhasādhanato🔽ca. “Kena appaṭivattiya”nti pucchitabbattā “samaṇena vā”tiādimāha. Tattha samaṇenāti
analyzed: ca anuttara ttā koṇḍañña ādīnam ca iva aṭṭhārasa brahmakoṭiyā ca catu sacca paṭivedha sādhanato  ca kena appaṭivattiyanti pucchitabbattā samaṇena vā tiādim āha tattha samaṇena ati
translated: Not to be rolled back: not to be rolled back again. Why not? Because the Lord, the people’s Teacher, is the Enlightened One, and because the knowledge of Koṇḍañña and the others and of the eighteen koṭis of Brahmās is unsurpassed, and because they had penetrated the four truths.

original: pabbajjamattūpagatena. Brāhmaṇenāti jātibrāhmaṇena. Paramatthānañhi samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ
analyzed: pabbajja mattūpagatena brāhmaṇena ati jāti brāhmaṇena
translated: Since it has to be asked “By whom is it not to be rolled back?” he said “By an ascetic or brahmin or anyone in the world,” etc. Herein, by an ascetic: by one who has merely gone forth. By a brahmin: by one who is a brahmin by birth. For the highest meaning of “ascetic” and “brahmin” is this:

original: paṭisedhane cittuppādānuppajjanampi natthi. Devenāti chakāmāvacaradevena. Brahmunāti
analyzed: paṭisedhane citta uppāda an uppajjanam pi natthi devena ati cha kāmāvacara devena brahmunā ati
translated: There is no arising of a thought of denial. Devas: the six kinds of sense-sphere deities. Brahmas:

original: rūpabrahmā gahitā. “Samaṇena vā …pe… brahmunā”ti ettakameva avatvā“kenacī”ti vuttavacanena
analyzed: rūpa brahmā samaṇena vā brahmunā ati ettakam eva vutta vacanena
translated: the form-sphere Brahmas are included. Without specifying “by an ascetic or brahmin or Mara or Brahma or by anyone in the world” he says “by anyone.”

original: avasesakhattiyagahapatiparisajanā saṅgahitā. Tasmā khattiyabrāhmaṇagahapatisamaṇacātumahārājikatāvatiṃsamārabrahmaparisā
analyzed: avasesa khattiya gahapati parisa janā saṅgahitā khattiya brāhmaṇa gahapati samaṇa cātumahārājika tāvatiṃsa māra brahma parisā
translated: The rest of the assembly of nobles, brahmins, householders, ascetics, the Four Great Kings, the Thirty-three Gods, Mara, and Brahma

original: aṭṭhavidhāpi paṭisedhetuṃ asamatthāyevāti veditabbā. Lokasminti sattasamūhe dhammacakkādhāre.
analyzed: aṭṭhavidhā api paṭisedhetum a samatthāya iva ati veditabbā lokasmin ti satta samūhe dhamma cakka ādhāre
translated: should be understood as incapable of denying. In the world: in the community of beings, in the support for the setting in motion of the Wheel of the Dhamma.

original: “Dvādasa padāni sutta”nti gāthānurūpaṃ dhammacakkasutte padāni vibhajanto “tattha🔽aparimāṇā”tiādimāha. Tattha tatthāti dhammacakkadesanāyaṃ. “Aparimāṇā akkharā aparimāṇā
analyzed: dvādasa padāni suttanti gāthā anurūpam dhammacakka sutte padāni vibhajantaḥ tattha  aparimāṇā iti ādim āha tattha tattha ati dhammacakka desanāyam aparimāṇā akkharā aparimāṇā
translated: “The sutta has twelve factors” . Analyzing the factors in the Dhammacakkappavattana Sutta according to the verse, he says “Herein,

original: padā”ti avatvā “aparimāṇā padā aparimāṇā akkharā”ti uppaṭipāṭivacanehi yebhuyyena
analyzed: padā ati avatvā aparimāṇā padā aparimāṇā akkharā ti uppaṭi pāṭivacanehi yebhuyyena
translated: “Herein” means in the teaching of the Wheel of the Dhamma. Without specifying “incalculable syllables and incalculable words” he says “incalculable words and incalculable syllables” by reversing the order.

original: padasaṅgahitānīti dasseti. Padā, akkharā, byañjanāti ca liṅgavipallāsānīti daṭṭhabbāni.
analyzed: pada saṅgahitāni iti dasseti padāḥ akkharāḥ ca liṅga vipallāsāni iti daṭṭhabbāni
translated: he shows that they are included in the words. The words “words,” “syllables,” and “phonemes” should be regarded as having the gender of the word “type.”

original: Etasseva atthassāti vattabbākārassa catusaccasaṅkhātassa atthasseva saṅkāsanā pakāsanā🔽pakāsanākāro paññattākāroti ākāravantaākārasambandhe sāmivacanaṃ. Saṅkāsanākāroti
analyzed: etassa iva atthassa ati vattabba ākārassa catu sacca saṅkhātassa atthassa iva saṅkāsanā pakāsanā  pakāsana ākāro paññatta ākāro ti ākāravantaḥ ākāra sambandhe sāmi vacanam saṅkāsana ākāro ti
translated: The “indicating” of the meaning that should be expressed, which is the four truths, is the “making known” of it.

original: ca saṅkāsanīyassa atthassa ākāro. Esa nayo sesesupi. Itipīti iti iminā pakārenapi,
analyzed: ca saṅkāsanīyassa atthassa ākāraḥ esa nayaḥ sesesu pi iti pi iti iti iminā pakārena pi
translated: The “making known” is the “mode of expression.” The instrumental case in “mode of expression” is a case of the instrumental of instrument. The “indicating” is the “mode” of the meaning that should be indicated. The same method applies to the rest.

original: iminā pakārenapi idaṃ jātiādikaṃ dukkhaṃ ariyasaccanti veditabbaṃ.🔽Ayanti kāmataṇhādibhedā ayaṃ taṇhā. Dukkhasamudayoti dukkhanibbattanassa hetubhāvato🔽dukkhasamudayo. Ayanti sabbasaṅkhatato nissaṭā ayaṃ asaṅkhatā dhātu. Dukkhanirodhoti
analyzed: iminā pakārena api idam jāti ādikam dukkham ariya saccan ti veditabbam  ayanti kāma taṇhā ādi bhedāḥ ayam taṇhā dukkha samudayaḥ ti dukkha nibbattanassa hetu bhāvato  dukkha samudayaḥ ayanti sabba saṅkhatataḥ nissaṭā ayam asaṅkhatā dhātu dukkha nirodho ti
translated: “In this way too”: in this way, by this method, this aging, etc., should be understood as the noble truth of suffering.🔽“This craving,” which is of the nature of sense desire, etc., is “the origin of suffering” because it is the cause of the production of suffering.🔽“This element,” which is free from all formations, is “the cessation of suffering” because it is the condition for the cessation of suffering, which is classified as aging, etc.

original: jātiādippabhedassa dukkhassa anuppādananirodhapaccayattā dukkhanirodho. Ayanti sammādiṭṭhādiko
analyzed: jāti ādi ppabhedassa dukkhassa an uppādana nirodha paccaya ttā dukkha nirodhaḥ ayanti sammādiṭṭha ādiko
translated: “This,” which is right view, etc.,

original: aṭṭhaṅgiko ariyo maggo. Dukkhanirodhabhūtaṃ nibbānaṃ ārammaṇakaraṇavasena gatattā,
analyzed: aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ ariyaḥ maggaḥ dukkha nirodha bhūtam nibbānam ārammaṇa karaṇa vasena gata ttā
translated: The Noble Eightfold Path. Nibbāna, which is the state of cessation of suffering, is the way leading to the cessation of suffering because it is reached by making that the object,

original: dukkhanirodhappattiyā paṭipadābhāvato ca dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā. Sesaṃ vuttanayameva.🔽“Tattha aparimāṇā”tiādinā byañjanapadaatthapadāni vibhajitvā tesaṃ aññamaññaṃ visayivisayabhāvena
analyzed: dukkha nirodha ppattiyā paṭipadā abhāvato ca dukkha nirodha gāminī paṭipadā sesam vutta nayam eva  tattha aparimāṇa ati ādinā byañjana pada attha padāni vibhajitvā tesam aññam aññam visayi visaya bhāvena
translated: and because it is the practice for the attainment of the cessation of suffering. The rest is as already stated.

original: sambandhabhāvaṃ dassetuṃ “tattha bhagavā akkharehi saṅkāsetī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Atha vā
analyzed: sambandha bhāvam dassetum tattha bhagavā akkharehi saṅkāseti itiādi vuttam atha vā
translated: “Herein, the Blessed One teaches by means of the syllables” is said in order to show the state of being related by way of the object and the subject of the words of the text and the words of the commentary, having divided them by means of the words “herein, the Blessed One teaches by means of the syllables, etc.”🔽Or else,

original: bhagavā kiṃ sāmaññehi akkharādīhi saṅkāseti vā pakāseti vā, udāhu yathārahaṃ saṅkāseti
analyzed: bhagavā kim sāmaññehi akkhara ādīhi saṅkāseti vā pakāseti vā udāhu yathāraham saṅkāseti
translated: does the Blessed One teach by means of the syllables, etc., in the manner of a heretic, or does he teach in the manner of one who is worthy?

original: pakāsetītiādivicāraṇāya sambhavato visayavisayibhāvena sambandhabhāvaṃ niyametvā
analyzed: sambhavataḥ visaya visayi bhāvena sambandha bhāvam niyametvā
translated: In order to show by way of the state of being related by way of the object and the subject, having determined the state of being related by way of the possibility of the consideration,

original: dassetuṃ “tattha bhagavā akkharehi saṅkāsetī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha “akkharehi saṅkāsetī”ti
analyzed: dassetum tattha bhagavā akkharehi saṅkāseti itiādi vuttam tattha akkharehi saṅkāseti iti
translated: “Herein, the Blessed One teaches by means of the syllables” is said. Herein, “he teaches by means of the syllables” means

original: kasmā evaṃ vuttaṃ, nanu “dukkhasacca”ntiādīsu padeneva dukkhasaccatthattādiko saṅkāsitabboti?
analyzed: kasmai evam vuttam nanu dukkha sacca nti ādīsu padena iva dukkha sacca atthattā ādiko saṅkāsitabbaḥ ti
translated: Why is it said thus? Has not the meaning of the truth of suffering, etc., to be discerned by means of the word itself in the passage, “The truth of suffering,” etc.?

original: Saccaṃ, padāvayavassa pana akkharassa gahaṇamukheneva akkharasamudāyassapi padassa
analyzed: saccam pada avayavassa pana akkharassa gahaṇa mukhena iva akkhara samudāyassa api padassa
translated: It is true, but the word is grasped by the method of grasping the syllable, a component of the word.

original: gahaṇaṃ hoti, pade gahite ca dukkhasaccatthādikāvabodho hotveva, evaṃ sati padeneva
analyzed: gahaṇam hoti pade gahite ca dukkha saccattha ādika avabodhaḥ hotvā iva evam sati padena iva
translated: And when the word is grasped, the understanding of the meaning of the truth of suffering, etc., comes about. If that is so, since it is accomplished by means of the word itself, the syllable should not be grasped separately.

original: sijjhanato akkharo visuṃ na gahetabboti? Na, dukkhasaccatthādikāvabodhassa visesuppattibhāvato.
analyzed: sijjhanataḥ akkharaḥ visum na gahetabbaḥ iti na dukkha saccattha ādika avabodhassa visesuppatti bhāvato
translated: No, because the arising of a distinction in the understanding of the meaning of the truth of suffering, etc., comes about.

original: Du-iti akkharena hi anekupaddavādhiṭṭhānabhāvena kucchitattho gahito, kha-iti akkharena
analyzed: akkharena hi aneka paddava adhiṭṭhāna bhāvena kucchi tatthaḥ gahitaḥ akkharena
translated: For by the syllable du- the meaning of “full of misery” is grasped by way of the basis of the many calamities . By the syllable kha-🔽the meaning of “empty” comes about by way of the absence of the state of being permanent, beautiful, pleasurable, and self .

original: dhuvasubhasukhattabhāvavirahena tucchatthoti evamādikāvabodhassa visesuppatti bhavati.
analyzed: dhuva subha sukhatta bhāva virahena tuccha tthaḥ ti evam ādikā avabodhassa bhavati
translated: Thus the arising of a distinction in the understanding of the meaning of “empty” comes about.🔽Therefore it is said: “The arising of a distinction in the grasping of the meaning of the word comes about.”

original: Tena vuttaṃ “padatthagahaṇassa visesādhānaṃ jāyatī”ti. Padapariyosāne vākyapariyosānābhāvato
analyzed: tena vuttam padattha gahaṇassa visesa ādhānam jāyati iti pada pariyosāne vākya pariyosāna abhāvato
translated: Or, since there is no end to the sentence at the end of the word,

original: akkharehi saṃkhittena dīpiyamāno attho padehi pakāsitovāti vuttaṃ “padehi pakāsetī”ti.🔽Vākyapariyosāne pana saṅkāsito pakāsito attho vivarito vivaṭo katovāti vuttaṃ. “Byañjanehi
analyzed: akkharehi saṃkhittena dīpiyamānaḥ attho padehi pakāsito vā ati vuttam padehi pakāseti iti  vākya pariyosāne pana saṅkāsitaḥ pakāsitaḥ atthaḥ vivaritaḥ vivaṭaḥ kato vā ti vuttam byañjanehi
translated: The meaning that is indicated in brief by syllables is made clear by words.🔽At the end of the sentence, the meaning that is indicated, made clear, is opened up, disclosed.

original: vivaratī”ti. Pakārehi ca vākyabhede kate so attho vibhatto nāmāti vuttaṃ “ākārehi
analyzed: vivarati iti pakārehi ca vākya bhede kate saḥ atthaḥ vibhattaḥ nāma ati vuttam ākārehi
translated: By the analysis of the sentence into its component parts, that meaning is said to be “analysed”.

original: vibhajatī”ti. Vākyāvayavānaṃ padānaṃ paccekaṃ nibbacanavibhāge kate so attho pākaṭo
analyzed: vibhajati iti vākya avayavānam padānam paccekam nibbacana vibhāge kate saḥ atthaḥ pākaṭaḥ
translated: When the component parts of the sentence, the words, are individually defined and analysed, that meaning is made clear.

original: katovāti vuttaṃ “niruttīhi uttānīkarotī”ti. Katanibbacanehi vākyāvayavehi vitthāravasena
analyzed: katova ati vuttam niruttīhi uttānīkaroti iti kata nibbacanehi vākya avayavehi vitthāra vasena
translated: By the definitions, the component parts of the sentence are taught in detail without remainder.

original: niravasesato desitehi veneyyasattānaṃ citte parisamantato tosanaṃ hoti, paññātejanañcāti
analyzed: niravasesataḥ desitehi veneyya sattānam citte parisamantataḥ tosanam hoti paññā tejanam ca ati
translated: The minds of the beings to be trained are satisfied all around and their wisdom is kindled.

original: āha “niddesehi paññapetī”ti.
analyzed: āha niddesehi paññapeti iti
translated: Therefore it is said: “By the expositions he makes known.”

original: “Bhagavā akkharehi saṅkāsetī”tiādīsu “bhagavā evā”ti vā “akkharehi evā”ti vā avadhāraṇe
analyzed: bhagavā akkharehi saṅkāseti itiādīsu bhagavā eva ati vā akkharehi eva ati vā avadhāraṇe
translated: In the passages beginning “The Blessed One indicates in brief by syllables,” the words “only the Blessed One” and “only by syllables” are restrictive.

original: yojite “sāvako na saṅkāseti, padādīhi na saṅkāsetī”ti attho bhaveyya, sāvako ca saṅkāseti,🔽padādīhi ca saṅkāseti. Kattha avadhāraṇaṃ yojetabbanti ce? “Bhagavā akkharehi saṅkāsetiyevā”ti
analyzed: yojite sāvakaḥ na saṅkāseti pada ādīhi na saṅkāseti iti atthaḥ bhaveyya sāvakaḥ ca saṅkāseti  pada ādīhi ca saṅkāseti kattha avadhāraṇam yojetabban ti ce bhagavā akkharehi
translated: If the word “only” were inserted, the meaning would be that the disciple does not misrepresent by the words, etc., and the Blessed One does misrepresent by the words, etc.🔽But the disciple misrepresents and the Blessed One misrepresents by the words, etc. Where should the word “only” be inserted?

original: avadhāraṇaṃ yojetabbaṃ. Evañhi sati sāvakena saṅkāsito vā padādīhi saṅkāsito vā attho
analyzed: avadhāraṇam yojetabbam evam hi sati sāvakena saṅkāsitaḥ vā pada ādīhi saṅkāsitaḥ vā atthaḥ
translated: It should be inserted after “the Blessed One misrepresents by the syllables.” For if it is inserted in this way, then the meaning misrepresented by the disciple and the meaning misrepresented by the words, etc.,

original: saṅgahito hoti. Atthapadānañca akkharādinānāvisayatā siddhā hoti. Tena ekānusandhike🔽sutte chaḷeva atthapadāni niddhāretabbāni, anekānusandhike sutte anusandhibhedena
analyzed: saṅgahitaḥ hoti attha padānam ca akkhara ādi nānā visaya tā siddhā hoti tena eka anusandhike  sutte chaḷ eva attha padāni niddhāretabbāni aneka anusandhike sutte anusandhi bhedena
translated: are included. And the different spheres of the words, etc., are established. Therefore, in a sutta with a single sequel,

original: visuṃ visuṃ cha cha atthapadāni niddhāretabbāni.
analyzed: visum visum cha cha attha padāni niddhāretabbāni
translated: only the six kinds of meaning should be extracted; in a sutta with several sequels, the six kinds of meaning should be extracted separately for each sequel.

original: “Chasu byañjanapadesu katamena byañjanapadena katamaṃ kiccaṃ sādhetī”ti pucchitabbattā
analyzed: chasu byañjana padesu katamena byañjana padena katamam kiccam sādheti iti pucchitabba ttā
translated: Since it is necessary to ask, “By which of the six kinds of words is which of the six kinds of functions accomplished?”

original: “iminā idaṃ kiccaṃ, iminā idaṃ kiccaṃ sādhetī”ti niyametvā dassetuṃ “tattha bhagavā
analyzed: iminā idam kiccam iminā idam kiccam sādheti iti niyametvā dassetum tattha bhagavā
translated: in order to show by specifying, “This function is accomplished by this, and that function is accomplished by that,” it is said:

original: akkharehi ca padehi ca ugghaṭetī”tiādimāha. Tattha tatthāti akkharādīsu byañjanapadesu.
analyzed: akkharehi ca padehi ca ugghaṭeti iti ādim āha tattha tattha ati akkhara ādīsu byañjana padesu
translated: Herein, in each case means in the case of the syllables, etc., as the letter, the word, and so on.

original: Ugghaṭetīti ugghaṭanakiccaṃ sādhetīti attho. Kiñcāpi desanāva ugghaṭanakiccaṃ sādheti,
analyzed: ugghaṭeti iti ugghaṭana kiccam sādheti iti attho kiñcā api ugghaṭana kiccam sādheti
translated: It is the one that accomplishes the function of revealing: the meaning is that it accomplishes the function of revealing. And although it is the teaching that accomplishes the function of revealing,

original: bhagavā pana desanājanakattā ugghaṭanakiccaṃ sādhetīti vuccati. Sesesupi evamattho daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: bhagavā pana desanā janaka ttā ugghaṭana kiccam sādheti iti vuccati sesesu pi evamatthaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: nevertheless it is said that the Blessed One accomplishes the function of revealing because he is the originator of the teaching. The meaning should be regarded in this way in each case.

original: “Ugghaṭanakiccasādhikā desanāyeva kiṃ vipañcanavitthāraṇakiccasādhikā desanājanakattā,🔽udāhu visuṃ visuṃ kiccasādhikā aññā”ti pucchitabbabhāvato visuṃ visuṃ kiccasādhikā🔽aññā desanāti niyametvā dassetuṃ “tattha ugghaṭanā ādī”tiādimāha. Atha vā “katamā
analyzed: ugghaṭana kicca sādhikā desanāya iva kim vipañcana vitthāraṇa kicca sādhikā desanā janaka ttā  udāhu visum visum kicca sādhikā aññā ati pucchitabba bhāvataḥ visum visum kicca sādhikā  aññā desanā ti niyametvā dassetum tattha ugghaṭanā ādi iti ādim āha atha vā katamā
translated: “Is the teaching that accomplishes the function of revealing the same as the teaching that accomplishes the function of analysing and expounding, because it is the originator of the teaching,🔽or is it a different teaching that accomplishes each function?” Since it is necessary to ask this question, it is stated in order to determine that it is a different teaching that accomplishes each function.🔽“Herein, revealing is the first” is said. Or alternatively, since it is necessary to ask, “What is revealing? What is analysing? What is expounding? ”

original: ugghaṭanā, katamā vipañcanā, katamā vitthāraṇā”ti pucchitabbattā vuttaṃ “tattha ugghaṭanā
analyzed: ugghaṭanā katamā vipañcanā katamā vitthāraṇā ti pucchitabbattā vuttam tattha ugghaṭanā
translated: it is said, “Herein, revealing is the first” in order to show that it is a different teaching that accomplishes each function.

original: ādī”tiādi. Tattha tatthāti ugghaṭanādikiccasādhikāsu desanāsu. Ugghaṭanāti ugghaṭanakiccasādhikā
analyzed: ādi itiādi tattha tattha ati ugghaṭana ādi kicca sādhikāsu desanāsu ugghaṭanā ati ugghaṭana kicca sādhikā
translated: “Therein” means in the teachings that accomplish the functions of revealing, etc. “Revealing” means

original: desanā ādidesanā hoti. Vipañcanāti vipañcanakiccasādhikā desanā majjhedesanā hoti.
analyzed: desanā ādi desanā hoti vipañcanā ati vipañcana kicca sādhikā desanā majjhedesanā hoti
translated: the teaching that accomplishes the function of revealing is the introductory teaching. “Expounding” means the teaching that accomplishes the function of expounding is the middle teaching.

original: Vitthāraṇāti vitthāraṇakiccasādhikā desanā pariyosānadesanā hotīti attho daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: vitthāraṇā ati vitthāraṇa kicca sādhikā desanā pariyosāna desanā hoti iti atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: “Elaborating” means the teaching that accomplishes the function of elaborating is the concluding teaching. This is the meaning that should be seen.

original: “Ugghaṭiyanto uddisiyamāno pariyattiatthabhūto dhammavinayo katamaṃ puggalaṃ vineti,🔽vipañciyanto niddisiyamāno pariyattiatthabhūto dhammavinayo katamaṃ puggalaṃ vineti,
analyzed: ugghaṭiyantaḥ uddisiyamānaḥ pariyatti attha bhūtaḥ dhamma vinayaḥ katamam puggalam vineti  vipañciyantaḥ niddisiyamānaḥ pariyatti attha bhūtaḥ dhamma vinayaḥ katamam puggalam vinā iti
translated: “When revealing, when being taught, when the Dhamma and Discipline become the meaning of the scriptures, which person does it discipline?🔽When expounding, when being shown, when the Dhamma and Discipline become the meaning of the scriptures, which person does it discipline?

original: vitthāriyanto paṭiniddisiyamāno pariyattiatthabhūto dhammavinayo katamaṃ puggalaṃ
analyzed: vitthāriyantaḥ paṭiniddisiyamānaḥ pariyatti attha bhūtaḥ dhamma vinayaḥ katamam puggalam
translated: When elaborating, when being demonstrated, when the Dhamma and Discipline become the meaning of the scriptures, which person does it discipline?”

original: vinetī”ti pucchitabbattā “soyaṃ dhammavinayo”tiādimāha. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana “evaṃ
analyzed: vineti iti pucchitabba ttā saḥ yam dhamma vinayaḥ ti ādim āha aṭṭhakathā ayam pana evam
translated: Because this must be asked, he says “This Dhamma and Discipline,” etc. But in the commentary,

original: ‘akkharehi saṅkāsetī’tiādīnaṃ channaṃ byañjanapadānaṃ byāpāraṃ dassetvā idāni atthapadānaṃ
analyzed: akkharehi saṅkāseti iti ādīnam channam byañjana padānam byāpāram dassetvā idāni attha padānam
translated: after showing the activity of the six terms beginning with “he teaches by means of the syllables,” now, with regard to the terms of meaning,

original: byāpāraṃ dassetuṃ ‘soyaṃ dhammavinayo’tiādi vutta”nti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: byāpāram dassetum saḥ yam dhamma vinaya uti ādi vuttanti vuttam
translated: “To show the function, ‘This Dhamma and Discipline’ is said.”

original: Tattha ugghaṭiyanto uddisiyamāno uddesapariyattiatthabhūto so ayaṃ dhammavinayo ugghaṭitaññupuggalaṃ🔽vineti, tena ugghaṭitaññuno puggalassa vinayanena naṃ ugghaṭiyantaṃ uddisiyamānaṃ
analyzed: tattha ugghaṭiyantaḥ uddisiyamānaḥ uddesa pariyatti attha bhūto so ayam dhamma vinayaḥ ugghaṭita ññu puggalam  vineti tena ugghaṭita ññunaḥ puggalassa vinayanena nam ugghaṭiyantam uddisiyamānam
translated: Herein, when one is being instructed, the Dhamma and Discipline is that which has the meaning of the recitation-transmission. It trains the person who understands by what is heard.

original: uddesapariyattiatthabhūtaṃ vinayaṃ “ādikalyāṇo”ti āhu. Vipañciyanto niddisiyamāno
analyzed: uddesa pariyatti attha bhūtam vinayam ādikalyāṇo ti āhu vipañciyantaḥ niddisiyamāno
translated: By the training of the person who understands by what is heard, when he is being instructed, when he is being taught, the Discipline which has the meaning of the recitation-transmission is said to be “good in the beginning.”

original: niddesapariyattiatthabhūto so ayaṃ dhammavinayo vipañcitaññupuggalaṃ vineti, tena🔽vipañcitaññupuggalassa vinayanena naṃ vipañciyantaṃ niddisiyamānaṃ niddesapariyattiatthabhūtaṃ
analyzed: niddesa pariyatti attha bhūtaḥ saḥ ayam dhamma vinayaḥ vipañcitaññu puggalam vineti tena  vipañcita ññu puggalassa vinayanena nam vipañciyantam niddisiyamānam niddesa pariyatti attha bhūtam
translated: When one is being shown, the Dhamma and Discipline is that which has the meaning of the teaching-transmission. It trains the person who understands by what is broken up.

original: vinayaṃ “majjhekalyāṇo”ti āhu. Vitthāriyanto paṭiniddisiyamāno paṭiniddesapariyattiatthabhūto
analyzed: vinayam majjhekalyāṇo ti āhu vitthāriyantaḥ paṭiniddisiyamāno paṭiniddesa pariyatti attha bhūto
translated: By the training of the person who understands by what is broken up, when he is being shown, when he is being taught, the Discipline which has the meaning of the teaching-transmission is said to be “good in the middle.”🔽When one is being shown in detail, the Dhamma and Discipline is that which has the meaning of the counter-teaching-transmission. It trains the person who is led. It generates training in the person who is led.

original: so ayaṃ dhammavinayo neyyaṃ puggalaṃ vineti vinayanaṃ janeti, tena neyyassa puggalassa
analyzed: so ayam dhamma vinayaḥ neyyam puggalam vineti vinayanam janeti tena neyyassa puggalassa
translated: By the training of the person who is led,

original: vinayanena naṃ vitthāriyantaṃ paṭiniddisiyamānaṃ paṭiniddesapariyattiatthabhūtaṃ
analyzed: vinayanena nam vitthāriyantam paṭiniddisiyamānam paṭiniddesa pariyatti attha bhūtam
translated: The Vinaya is called “good in the end” because it is the Vinaya that is taught in detail and demonstrated in the text on the demonstration of the Monastic Law, which is the purpose of the recitation section.

original: vinayaṃ “pariyosānakalyāṇo”ti āhūti yojanatthoti daṭṭhabbo.🔽Atha vā “akkharehi saṅkāsetī”tiādinā channaṃ padānaṃ byāpāro dassito, evaṃ sati attho
analyzed: vinayam pariyosāna kalyāṇo ti āhu iti yojana attho ti daṭṭhabbo  atha vā akkharehi saṅkāseti iti ādinā channam padānam byāpāraḥ dassitaḥ evam sati attho
translated: The meaning of “good in the end” should be understood in this way.🔽Or else, the six terms beginning with “he teaches with the syllables” show the meaning of the Monastic Law.🔽But if that is so, then the meaning is not demonstrated,

original: nibyāpāro siyā, attho ca nippariyāyato sabyāpāroyevāti codanaṃ manasi katvā āha “soyaṃ🔽dhammavinayo”tiādi. Etena atthoyeva mukhyato veneyyattayassa vinayanakiccaṃ sādheti,
analyzed: nibyāpāraḥ siyā attho ca nippariyāyato codanam manasi katvā āha saḥ ayam  dhamma vinaya uti ādi etena mukhyatas vinayana kiccam sādha iti
translated: and the meaning is not demonstrated because it is not literal. After considering this criticism, he said, “This Dhamma and Vinaya,” and so on.🔽With this he shows that the meaning is the principal factor in accomplishing the function of the Monastic Law for the three kinds of disciples.

original: atthavācako pana saddo ṭhānūpacārato veneyyattayassa vinayanakiccaṃ sādhetīti dasseti.
analyzed: attha vācakaḥ pana saddo ṭhāna upacārataḥ vinayana kiccam sādheti iti dasseti
translated: But the word that expresses the meaning accomplishes the function of the Monastic Law for the three kinds of disciples by means of the usage of the terms.

original: Padaparamassa pana saccappaṭivedhassa patiṭṭhānābhāvato so idha na vutto. Sekkhaggahaṇena
analyzed: pada paramassa pana sacca ppaṭivedhassa patiṭṭhāna abhāvato so idha na vutto sekkha ggahaṇena
translated: But since the highest degree of the word is not a basis, it is not mentioned here.

original: vā kalyāṇaputhujjanassa viya neyyaggahaṇena padaparamassa puggalassāpi gahaṇaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: vā kalyāṇa puthujjanassa viya neyya gahaṇena pada paramassa puggalassa api gahaṇam daṭṭhabbam
translated: Or else, just as the good ordinary person is included by the term “trainee”, so too the person who has reached the highest degree of the word should be understood as included by the term “disciple”.

original: Akkharehītiādīsu karaṇatthe karaṇavacanaṃ, na hetvatthe. Akkharādīnañhi ugghaṭanādīni🔽payojanāniyeva honti, na ugghaṭanādīnaṃ akkharādīni payojanānīti “annena vasatī”tiādīsu
analyzed: akkharehi itiādīsu karaṇa atthe karaṇa vacanam na hetu atthe akkhara ādīnam hi ugghaṭana ādīni  honti na ugghaṭana ādīnam akkhara ādīni payojanāni iti annena vasati itiādīsu
translated: In the phrases beginning “by means of syllables” , the instrumental case is used in the sense of instrument, not in the sense of cause. For the purposes of the syllables, etc., are the revealing, etc.,

original: viya na hetuattho gahetabbo. Tattha hi annena hetunā vasati, vasanena hetunā annaṃ
analyzed: viya na hetu atthaḥ gahetabbaḥ tattha hi annena hetunā vasati vasanena hetunā annam
translated: and not vice versa. Therefore the meaning of cause should not be taken here as it is in such passages as “He lives by means of food” .

original: laddhanti vasanakiriyāya phalaṃ vasanakiriyāya hetubhāvena gahitaṃ. “Ajjhesanena🔽vasatī”tiādīsupi eseva nayo. Tenāha “yadatthā ca kiriyā, so hetū”ti. Tattha yadatthāti🔽so annādiko attho yassā vasanādikiriyāyāti yadatthā, vasanādikiriyā, so annādiko
analyzed: vasana kiriyāya phalam vasana kiriyāya hetu bhāvena gahitam ajjhesanena  vasati iti ādīsu pi esā iva tena āha yad atthā ca kiriyā saḥ hetu iti tattha yad atthā ati  saḥ annādikaḥ atthaḥ yassā vasana ādi kiriyāya ati yad atthā vasana ādi kiriyā saḥ annādikaḥ
translated: For there the meaning is that he lives by means of food as cause, and that he obtains food by means of living as cause. The living is taken as the fruit and as the cause of the living.🔽The same method applies in the passages beginning “He lives by means of invitation” .

original: attho tassā vasanādikiriyāya hetūti attho veditabbo.
analyzed: atthaḥ tassāḥ vasana ādi kiriyāya hetu uti atthaḥ veditabbo
translated: Therefore it is said: “The instrument is the cause of that for whose sake it is an instrument” . Herein, that for whose sake is an instrument is that for whose sake an instrument is used. The instrument is the cause of that for whose sake it is an instrument. The meaning should be understood thus.

original: 10. “Tattha aparimāṇā padā”tiādinā “dhammaṃ vo bhikkhave desessāmī”ti uddiṭṭhāya
analyzed: tattha aparimāṇā padāti ādinā dhammam vaḥ bhikkhave desessāmi iti uddiṭṭhāya
translated: “Therein, the words are immeasurable” .

original: pāḷiyā dvādasapadasampattisaṅkhātaṃ tividhakalyāṇataṃ dassetvā idāni chaatthapadachabyañjanapadabhedena
analyzed: pāḷiyā dvādasa pada sampatti saṅkhātam tividha kalyāṇatam dassetvā idāni cha attha pada cha byañjana pada bhedena
translated: Having shown the threefold goodness called the perfection of the twelve factors in the text, now, by way of the six factors and the four factors of expression,

original: sampattisaṅkhātaṃ atthapadabyañjanapadakalyāṇataṃ dassento “tattha chappadāni attho”tiādimāha.🔽Atha vā “dvādasa padāni sutta”nti vuttānurūpaṃ “tattha aparimāṇā”tiādinā “dhammaṃ🔽vo bhikkhave desessāmī”ti uddiṭṭhāya pāḷiyā dvādasapadatā dassetvā “ādikalyāṇaṃ majjhekalyāṇaṃ🔽pariyosānakalyāṇa”nti vuttānurūpaṃ “tattha bhagavā akkharehi cā”tiādinā tassā pāḷiyā🔽tividhakalyāṇatā dassitā, dassetvā idāni “sātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddha”nti
analyzed: sampatti saṅkhātam attha pada byañjana pada kalyāṇatam dassentaḥ tattha chappadāni attha uti ādim āha  atha vā dvādasa padāni suttanti vutta anurūpam tattha aparimāṇa ati ādinā dhammam  vaḥ bhikkhave desessāmi iti uddiṭṭhāya pāḷiyā dvādasa pada tā dassetvā ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam  pariyosāna kalyāṇan ti vutta anurūpam tattha bhagavā akkharehi ca ati ādinā tassā pāḷiyā  tividha kalyāṇa tā dassitā dassetvā idāni sa attham sa byañjanam kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddhanti
translated: Having shown the threefold goodness called the “perfection of the twelve terms” in the text, he now says “Therein, the six terms are the meaning” in order to show the perfection of the text and the perfection of the phrasing, which are called the “perfection of the six terms and the perfection of the seven phrases.”

original: vuttānurūpaṃ tassā pāḷiyā chaatthapadabyañjanapadasampannataṃ dassetuṃ “tattha chappadāni
analyzed: vutta anurūpam tassā pāḷiyā cha attha pada byañjana pada sampanna tam dassetum tattha cha padāni
translated: Or else, in accordance with the statement “The sutta has twelve terms,” he has shown the perfection of the twelve terms by the passage beginning “Therein, the Dhamma is immeasurable,” which corresponds to the text quoted in the uddesa as “I shall expound the Dhamma to you, bhikkhus.” Having shown the threefold goodness of that text by the passage beginning “Therein, the Blessed One is good in the beginning,” which corresponds to the statement “good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end,” he now says “Therein, the Blessed One is good in the phrasing” in order to show the perfection of the six terms and the perfection of the seven phrases in that text, which correspond to the statement “of the good meaning, of the good phrasing, complete, pure,

original: attho”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha tatthāti tissaṃ desanāhāravisayasaṅkhātāyaṃ pāḷiyaṃ chappadāni
analyzed: attha utiādi vuttam tattha tattha ati tissam desanā āhāra visaya saṅkhātāyam pāḷiyam cha padāni
translated: “Meaning” and so on are said. Herein, “therein” means in this text, which is called the teaching, the food, and the domain.🔽There are six terms.

original: attho. Katamāni chappadāni? Saṅkāsanā, pakāsanā, vivaraṇā, vibhajanā, uttānīkammaṃ,
analyzed: atthaḥ katamāni chappadāni saṅkāsanā pakāsanā vivaraṇā vibhajanā uttānīkammam
translated: What are the six terms? Persuading, expounding, explaining, analyzing, revealing,

original: paññatti imāni chappadāni. Attho yassa atthi tasmā sātthaṃ. Tatthāti tissaṃ desanāhāravisayasaṅkhātāyaṃ
analyzed: imāni chappadāni atthaḥ yassa atthi tasmā sa attham tattha ati tissam desanā āhāra visaya saṅkhātā ayam
translated: and defining are the six terms. It has meaning, therefore it is meaningful. “Therein” means in this text, which is called the teaching, the food, and the domain.

original: pāḷiyaṃ chappadāni byañjanaṃ. Katamāni chappadāni? Akkharaṃ, padaṃ, byañjanaṃ, ākāro,
analyzed: pāḷiyam chappadāni byañjanam katamāni chappadāni akkharam padam byañjanam ākāraḥ
translated: There are six terms. What are the six terms? Syllable, word, term, form,

original: nirutti, niddeso imāni chappadāni. Byañjanaṃ yassa atthīti sabyañjananti yojanā kātabbā.
analyzed: nirutti niddesaḥ imāni chappadāni byañjanam yassa atthi iti sabyañjana nti yojanā kātabbā
translated: pronunciation, and description are the six terms. It has terms, therefore it is termed.

original: Tenāti tassā pāḷiyā tividhakalyāṇachaatthapadasampannachabyañjanapadasampannaṭṭhena,
analyzed: tena ati tassā pāḷiyā tividha kalyāṇa cha attha pada sampanna cha byañjana pada sampanna ṭṭhena
translated: “Therefore” means because of the text’s possession of the six terms that are good in three ways and the six terms that are good in meaning.🔽The Blessed One said: “Monks, I will teach you the Dhamma that is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with its own meaning, with its own phrasing,

original: “dhammaṃ vo, bhikkhave…pe… suddha”nti bhagavā āhāti attho.
analyzed: dhammam vaḥ bhikkhave pe suddhanti bhagavā āha ati attho
translated: “Entire” is said.

original: Kevalasaddassa sakalādiatthavācakattā adhippetatthaṃ niyametvā dassetuṃ “kevalanti
analyzed: kevala saddassa sakala ādi attha vācaka ttā adhippeta ttham niyametvā dassetum kevalam ti
translated: Since the word “entire” expresses the meaning of “all” and so on, the intended meaning is determined and shown.

original: lokuttaraṃ na missaṃ lokiyehi dhammehī”ti vuttaṃ. Paripuṇṇanti adhippetatthe ekopi
analyzed: lokuttaram na missam lokiyehi dhammehi iti vuttam paripuṇṇam ti adhippeta tthe ekaḥ api
translated: “Supramundane, not mixed with mundane states.”

original: attho ūno natthi, vācakasaddesupi anatthako ekopi saddo adhiko natthīti paripuṇṇaṃ
analyzed: atthaḥ ūnaḥ natthi vācaka saddesu pi anatthakaḥ ekaḥ api saddaḥ adhikaḥ natthi iti paripuṇṇam
translated: Complete: there is not a single meaning intended that is deficient, nor is there a single word that is superfluous.

original: anūnaṃ anatirekaṃ. Parisuddhanti saddadosaatthadosādivirahato vā parisuddhaṃ, rāgādimalavirahato🔽vā pariyodātānaṃ uttarimanussadhammavisesānaṃ upaṭṭhitaṭṭhānattā parisuddhaṃ pariyodātaṃ.🔽Niggataṃ malaṃ etassa dhammassāti nimmalaṃ. Saddadosādivirahato vā rāgādivirahato
analyzed: anūnam anatirekam sadda dosa attha dosa ādi virahataḥ vā parisuddham rāga ādi mala virahataḥ  vā pariyodātānam uttari manussa dhamma visesānam upaṭṭhita ṭṭhāna ttā parisuddham pariyodātam  niggatam malam etassa dhammassa ati nimmalam sadda dosa ādi virahataḥ vā rāga ādi virahataḥ
translated: Pure: either it is pure because it is free from the faults of words and faults of meaning, or it is pure because it is cleansed of the stains of greed, etc.,🔽and it is bright because it is the basis for the special qualities of the higher than human state.🔽Stainless: the stain of this Dhamma has gone, or it is stainless because it is free from the faults of words, etc., or because it is free from greed, etc.

original: vā sabbamalehi apagataṃ pari samantato odātanti pariyodātaṃ. Upaṭṭhitanti upatiṭṭhanti🔽ettha sabbavisesāti upaṭṭhitaṃ yathā “padakkanta”nti. Padakkantaṃ padakkantaṭṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: vā sabba malehi apagatam pari samantataḥ odātam ti pariyodātam upaṭṭhitam ti upatiṭṭhanti  ettha sabba visesā ti upaṭṭhitam yathā padakkantam ti padakkantam padakkanta ṭṭhānam
translated: It is bright because it is completely cleansed of all stains.

original: Visisanti manussadhammehīti visesā, sabbe visesā sabbavisesā, sabbato vā visesāti
analyzed: visisanti manussa dhammehi iti visesā sabbe visesā sabba visesā sabbatas vā visesā ati
translated: Established: it is established because all the special qualities are established in it, just as “the place of the lotus” is called padmaka because lotuses are there.

original: sabbavisesā, uttarimanussadhammā. Tesaṃ sabbavisesānaṃ upaṭṭhitanti yojanā. Idanti
analyzed: sabba visesāḥ uttari manussa dhammāḥ tesam sabba visesānam upaṭṭhitanti yojanā idam ti
translated: and all the special qualities are the highest state of a human being. The meaning is that they are present in all the special qualities. This is the meaning of ‘in this’.

original: sikkhattayasaṅgahaṃ sāsanabrahmacariyaṃ. Tathāgatassa sammāsambuddhassa padanti tathāgatapadaṃ.
analyzed: sikkhattaya saṅgaham sāsana brahmacariyam tathāgatassa sammāsambuddhassa padanti tathāgata padam
translated: The Dispensation’s spiritual life is included in the three trainings. The ‘state of the Tathāgata’ is the state of the Tathāgata, the Perfectly Enlightened One.🔽‘State’ is the sphere of defilement, either by way of practice or by way of teaching.

original: Padanti ca paṭipattigamanena vā desanāgamanena vā kilesaggahaṇaṃ. Ottharitvā gamanaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: ca paṭipatti gamanena vā desanā gamanena vā kilesa ggahaṇam ottharitvā gamana ṭhānam
translated: It is said that it is the place of going after having crossed over.

original: itipi vuccati pavuccati, tathāgatena gocarāsevanena vā bhāvanāsevanena vā nisevitaṃ
analyzed: iti pi vuccati tathāgatena gocara asevanena vā bhāvanā sevanena vā nisevitam
translated: It is said that it is the spiritual life that has been frequented by the Tathāgata by way of the range of activity or by way of development.

original: bhajitaṃ itipi vuccati, tathāgatassa mahāvajirañāṇasabbaññutaññāṇadantehi ārañjitaṃ
analyzed: bhajitam iti pi vuccati tathāgatassa mahā vaji rañāṇa sabbaññu taññāṇa dantehi ārañjitam
translated: It is said that it is the place that has been frequented by the Tathāgata by way of the Tathāgata’s great diamond knowledge of omniscience.

original: ārañjitaṭṭhānaṃ itipi vuccati, ato tathāgatapadādibhāvena vattabbabhāvato etaṃ sāsanabrahmacariyaṃ
analyzed: ārañjita ṭṭhānam vuccati atas tathāgata pada ādi bhāvena vattabba bhāvataḥ etam sāsana brahmacariyam
translated: Therefore, because of the fact that it should be spoken of as the state of the Tathāgata, etc.,

original: iti paññāyati. Brahmacariyanti brahmuno sabbasattuttamassa bhagavato cariyaṃ, brahmaṃ
analyzed: iti paññāyati brahmacariyanti brahmunaḥ sabba sattuttamassa bhagavataḥ cariyam brahmaṃ
translated: this Dispensation’s spiritual life is known in this way. The spiritual life is the practice of the Blessed One, the Supreme One of all beings,

original: vā sabbaseṭṭhaṃ cariyaṃ brahmacariyaṃ. Paññāyatīti yathāvuttehi pakārehi ñāyatīti attho veditabbo.
analyzed: vā sabbaseṭṭham cariyam brahmacariyam paññāyati iti yathā vuttehi pakārehi ñāyati iti atthaḥ veditabbaḥ
translated: The meaning of the word “is known” should be understood as “is known by means of the aforesaid modes.”

original: “Imassa sikkhattayassa saṅgahassa sāsanassa paripuṇṇabhāvaparisuddhabhāvasaṅkhātaṃ
analyzed: imassa sikkhattayassa saṅgahassa sāsanassa paripuṇṇa bhāva parisuddha bhāva saṅkhātam
translated: The state of being a Tathāgata, which is called the state of being fulfilled and the state of being purified of the three trainings, the three baskets, and the dispensation,

original: tathāgatapadabhāvaṃ!Tathāgatapadabhāvaṃ, tathāgatanisevitabhāvaṃ, tathāgataārañjitabhāvaṃ,
analyzed: tathāgata pada bhāvam tathāgata pada bhāvam tathāgata nisevita bhāvam tathāgata ārañjita bhāvam
translated: the state of being frequented by Tathāgatas, the state of being adorned by Tathāgatas,

original: tehi pakārehi ñāpitabhāvaṃ kathaṃ mayaṃ nikkaṅkhā jānissāmā”ti vattabbato “tenāha
analyzed: tehi pakārehi ñāpita bhāvam katham mayam nikkaṅkhāḥ jānissāma iti vattabbataḥ tena āha
translated: the state of being proclaimed by means of those modes—how shall we know it without doubt?”

original: bhagavā”tiādi vuttaṃ, tabbhāvadīpakena bhagavatā vuttena vacanena tumhehi nikkaṅkhehi
analyzed: bhagavā iti ādi vuttam tad bhāva dīpakena bhagavatā vuttena vacanena tumhehi nikkaṅkhehi
translated: Therefore, in order to say this, the words “Therefore the Blessed One said” are stated. By means of the words spoken by the Blessed One, who illuminates this state, you should know it without doubt.

original: jānitabboti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: jānitabbaḥ iti vuttam hoti
translated: This is what is said.

original: Yadi bhagavā akkharehi ca padehi ca ugghaṭeti, byañjanehi ca ākārehi ca vipañcayati,
analyzed: yadi bhagavā akkharehi ca padehi ca ugghaṭeti byañjanehi ca ākārehi ca vipañcayati
translated: If the Blessed One illuminates by means of syllables and words, explains by means of phonemes and modes,

original: niruttīhi ca niddesehi ca vitthāreti, evaṃ sati ācariyena racitena desanāhārena payojanaṃ
analyzed: niruttīhi ca niddesehi ca vitthāreti evam sati ācariyena racitena desanā āhārena payojanam
translated: and expands by means of metrical feet and definitions, then, in that case, there is a purpose for the teacher’s composition and teaching of the Dhamma.

original: na bhavati, desanāhārena na vinā bhagavato desanāyameva atthasijjhanatoti codanaṃ🔽manasi katvā “kesaṃ ayaṃ dhammadesanā”ti pucchitvā “yogīna”nti āha. Tattha yogīnanti
analyzed: na bhavati desanā āhārena na vinā bhagavataḥ desanā ayam eva codanam  manasi katvā ayam dhamma desanā ti pucchitvā yogīnam ti āha tattha yogīnam ti
translated: and there is no such thing, since the Blessed One’s teaching is only successful when it is accompanied by the teaching as nutriment.”

original: yujjanti catusaccakammaṭṭhānabhāvanāyanti yogino, tesaṃ yogīnaṃ. Tena mayā racitena
analyzed: yujjanti catu sacca kammaṭṭhāna bhāvanāyanti yogino tesam yogīnam tena mayā racitena
translated: After considering this objection, he asked, “To whom is this teaching given?” and was told, “To meditators.” Herein, meditators are those who are devoted to the development of the meditation subject of the Four Noble Truths. To them, to meditators.

original: desanāhārena saṃvaṇṇitā ayaṃ vuttappakārā bhagavato desanā ugghaṭanādikiccaṃ sādhetīti
analyzed: desanā āhārena saṃvaṇṇitā ayam vutta ppakārā bhagavataḥ desanā ugghaṭana ādi kiccam sādheti iti
translated: By me, by the Elder, this teaching as nutriment, which is composed in this way, is commended. It is successful in accomplishing the function of revealing, etc., of the Blessed One’s teaching.

original: desanāhāro yogīnaṃ sātthakoyevāti daṭṭhabbo. “Desanāhārassa assādādidesanāhārabhāvo
analyzed: desanā āhāraḥ yogīnam daṭṭhabbaḥ desanā āhārassa assāda ādi desanā āhāra bhāvo
translated: So the teaching as nutriment should be regarded as useful to meditators.

original: kena amhehi jānitabbo saddahitabbo”ti vattabbattā “tenāha āyasmā…pe… desanāhāro”ti🔽vuttaṃ. Tattha tena assādādidesanāhārabhāvena āyasmā mahākaccāno “assādādīnavatā…pe…
analyzed: kena amhehi jānitabbo saddahitabbo ti vattabbattā tena āha āyasmāpe desanāhāraḥ ti  vuttam tattha tena assāda ādi desanā āhāra bhāvena āyasmā mahākaccāno
translated: “By what means should the teaching as nutriment be known and believed by us?”—in order to show this, the words “Therefore the venerable elder” are said.

original: desanāhāro”ti yaṃ vacanaṃ āha, tena vacanena tumhehi desanāhārassa yogīnaṃ assādādidesanāhārabhāvo
analyzed: desanā āhāraḥ iti yam vacanam āha tena vacanena tumhehi desanā hārassa yogīnam assāda ādi desanā āhāra bhāvaḥ
translated: Herein, by this means, by the teaching as nutriment consisting in gratification, etc., the venerable elder Mahā Kaccāna spoke the words “The teaching as nutriment is to be understood as consisting in gratification, danger, and escape in the case of the five constituents of the body … in the case of the six internal sense bases” .🔽By that statement of his, the teaching as nutriment consisting in gratification, etc., should be known by you.

original: jānitabbo saddahitabboti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: jānitabbaḥ saddahitabbaḥ iti vuttam hoti
translated: “It should be known, it should be believed”: what is meant is, “it should be known, it should be believed in.”

original: “Kiṃ pana ettāvatā desanāhāro paripuṇṇo, añño niyutto natthī”ti pucchitabbattā “niyutto🔽desanāhāro”ti vuttaṃ. Tattha yassaṃ desanāyaṃ assādādayo yena desanāhārena niddhāritā,
analyzed: kim pana ettāvatā desanā āhāraḥ paripuṇṇaḥ aññaḥ niyutto natthi iti pucchitabbattā niyuttaḥ  desanā āhāraḥ ti vuttam tattha assāda ādayaḥ yena desanā āhārena niddhāritā
translated: “But is the nutriment of teaching fulfilled by that much? Is there no other nutriment of teaching implied?”—because of the question, “The nutriment of teaching implied,”🔽is said. Herein, the nutriment of teaching should be regarded as the nutriment of teaching by means of which the taste, etc., of the teaching are discerned.

original: tassaṃ desanāyaṃ so desanāhāro niddhāretvā yojitoti attho daṭṭhabboti.
analyzed: desanā ayam saḥ desanā āhāraḥ niddhāretvā yojitaḥ iti atthaḥ daṭṭhabbaḥ ti
translated: The meaning is that the nutriment of teaching is applied by the teacher after discerning the taste, etc., of the teaching.

original: Iti desanāhāravibhaṅge sattibalānurūpā racitā
analyzed: iti desanā āhāra vibhaṅge satti bala anurūpā racitā
translated: So the nutriment of teaching is composed in accordance with the strength of the knife.

original: Vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The exposition is ended.

original: Paṇḍitehi pana aṭṭhakathāṭīkānusārena gambhīrattho vitthārato vibhajitvā gahetabboti.
analyzed: paṇḍitehi pana aṭṭhakathā ṭīkā anusārena gambhīra atthaḥ vitthārataḥ vibhajitvā gahetabbaḥ ti
translated: But the deep meaning should be taken in detail by the wise in accordance with the commentaries and subcommentaries.

original: 2. Vicayahāravibhaṅgavibhāvanā🔽11. Yena yena saṃvaṇṇanāvisesabhūtena desanāhāravibhaṅgena assādādayo suttatthā ācariyena
analyzed: vicaya hāra vibhaṅga vibhāvanā  yena yena saṃvaṇṇanā visesa bhūtena desanā āhāra vibhaṅgena assāda ādayaḥ sutta tthāḥ ācariyena
translated: The exposition of the nutriment of investigation

original: vibhattā, so saṃvaṇṇanāvisesabhūto desanāhāravibhaṅgo paripuṇṇo, “katamo vicayo hāro”ti
analyzed: vibhattā so saṃvaṇṇanā visesa bhūtaḥ desanā hāra vibhaṅgaḥ paripuṇṇaḥ katamaḥ vicayaḥ hāraḥ ti
translated: . The nutriment of teaching, which is a special kind of exposition, by means of which the teacher has discerned the meaning of the sutta, the taste, etc., is fulfilled. “What is the nutriment of investigation?”

original: pucchitabbattā “tattha katamo vicayo hāro”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha tatthāti tesu niddiṭṭhesu
analyzed: pucchitabba ttā tattha katamaḥ vicayaḥ hāraḥ ti ādi vuttam tattha tattha ati tesu niddiṭṭhesu
translated: “What is the investigation method?” is said because it is to be asked. Therein, there, in those sixteen methods of teaching, etc., which have been shown,

original: soḷasasu desanāhārādīsu hāresu katamo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso vicayo hāro vicayahāravibhaṅgo
analyzed: soḷasasu desanā hāra ādīsu hāresu katamaḥ saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ vicayaḥ hāraḥ vicaya hāra vibhaṅgo
translated: what is the investigation method, the investigation method analysis?

original: nāmāti pucchati. “Yaṃ pucchitañca vissajjitañcā”tiādiniddesagāthāya idāni mayā vuccamāno
analyzed: nāma ati pucchati yam pucchitam ca vissajjitam ca ati ādi niddesa gāthāya idāni mayā vuccamānaḥ
translated: “What is asked and what is answered” and so on. Now, what is being said by me

original: “ayaṃ vicayo hāro kiṃ vicinatī”tiādiko saṃvaṇṇanāviseso vicayahāravibhaṅgo nāmāti yojanā.
analyzed: ayam vicayaḥ hāro kim vicinati iti ādiko saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ vicaya hāra vibhaṅgaḥ nāma ati yojanā
translated: is the investigation method analysis, which is the special explanation.

original: “Ayaṃ vicayo hāro kiṃ vicinatī”ti iminā yo vicayo vicinitabbo, taṃ vicayaṃ vicinitabbaṃ
analyzed: ayam vicayaḥ hāro kim vicinati iti iminā yaḥ vicayaḥ vicinitabbo tam vicayam vicinitabbam
translated: “What is investigated by the investigation method?” is asked in order to show the investigation that is to be investigated by the investigation method.

original: pucchati, tasmā vicinitabbaṃ visayaṃ visuṃ visuṃ niyametvā dassetuṃ “padaṃ vicinati,
analyzed: pucchati tasmai vicinitabbam visayam visum visum niyametvā dassetum padam vicinati
translated: Therefore, in order to show the object of investigation separately and individually, it is said: “It investigates the term,

original: pañhaṃ vicinatī”tiādi vuttaṃ. “Kiṃ vicayo padavicayo”tiādiṃ avatvā “kiṃ vicinati,
analyzed: pañham vicinati itiādi vuttam kim vicayo pada vicayo ti ādim avatvā kim vicinati
translated: it investigates the question” and so on. Without saying “What is the investigation of the term, the investigation of the question” and so on,

original: padaṃ vicinatī”tiādivacanena vicayasaddassa kattusādhanatthaṃ dasseti. Tattha padaṃ
analyzed: padam vicinati iti ādi vacanena vicaya saddassa kattu sādhanattham dasseti tattha padam
translated: by saying “What is investigated, the term is investigated” and so on, he shows the meaning of the word “investigation” as the agent. Therein, the term,

original: vicinatīti navavidhassa suttantassa sabbaṃ padaṃ yāva nigamanā nāmapadādijātisaddādiitthiliṅgādiākārantādipaṭhamavibhatyantādiekavacanādivasena
analyzed: vicinati iti navavidhassa suttantassa sabbam padam yāva nigamanāḥ nāma pada ādi jāti sadda ādi itthi liṅga ādi ākāra anta ādi paṭhama vibhati anta ādi ekavacana ādi vasena
translated: He investigates the Thread: he investigates the whole of the nine-factored Thread by means of the words, the name-member, the syllable-member, the feminine-gender member, etc., the case-ending member, the singular-number member, etc.,

original: vicinati. Pañhaṃ vicinatīti adiṭṭhajotanādisattādhiṭṭhānādisammutivisayādiatītavisayādivasena🔽vicinati. Vissajjanaṃ vicinatīti ekaṃsabyākaraṇavissajjanādisāvasesabyākaraṇavissajjanādi
analyzed: vicinati pañham vicinati iti adiṭṭha jotana ādi satta adhiṭṭhāna ādi sammuti visaya ādi atīta visaya ādi vasena  vicinati vissajjanam vicinati iti ekaṃsa byākaraṇa vissajjana ādi sa avasesa byākaraṇa vissajjana ādi
translated: He investigates the question: he investigates by means of the unperceived-sign, etc., the seven-factored footing, etc., the province of the True Idea, etc., the past province, etc.,

original: sauttarabyākaraṇa vissajjanādi lokiyabyākaraṇavissajjanādivasena vicinati. Pubbāparaṃ
analyzed: sauttara byākaraṇa vissajjana ādi lokiya byākaraṇa vissajjana ādi vasena vicinati pubba aparam
translated: He investigates the answer: he investigates by means of the answer that is a one-sided explanation, etc., the answer that is a non-exhaustive explanation, etc., the answer that is a further description, etc., the answer that is a mundane explanation, etc.,

original: vicinatīti pubbena aparaṃ saṃsanditvā vicinati. Assādaṃ vicinatīti assādakataṇhādiassādetabbasukhādivasena🔽vicinati. Ādīnavaṃ vicinatīti dukkhadukkhavipariṇāmadukkhasaṅkhāradukkhavasena vā
analyzed: vicinati iti pubbena aparam saṃsanditvā vicinati assādam vicinati iti assādaka taṇhā ādi assādetabba sukha ādi vasena  vicinati ādīnavam vicinati iti dukkha dukkha vipariṇāma dukkha saṅkhāra dukkha vasena vā
translated: He investigates the sequence: he investigates by connecting the former with the latter. He investigates the gratification: he investigates by means of the gratification consisting in the craving for gratification, etc., the pleasure to be gratified in, etc.,🔽He investigates the danger: he investigates by means of the painfulness of pain, the painfulness of change, and the painfulness of formations, or else by means of the kinds of corruption beginning with what is unloved and ending with what has an end, etc.,

original: aniṭṭhānubhavanādiādiantavantatādisaṃkilesabhāgiyādivasena vā vicinati. Nissaraṇaṃ
analyzed: vā vicinati nissaraṇam
translated: He investigates the escape: he investigates by means of the escape from the kinds of corruption beginning with what is unloved and ending with what has an end, etc.,

original: vicinatīti maggavasena vā nibbānavasena vā maggassa vā āgamavasena, nibbānassa asaṅkhatadhātuādipariyāyavasena🔽vā vicinati. Phalaṃ vicinatīti dhammacaraṇassa duggatigamanābhāvena vā maccutaraṇādinā
analyzed: vicinati iti magga vasena vā nibbāna vasena vā maggassa vā āgama vasena nibbānassa asaṅkhata dhātu ādi pariyāya vasena  vā vicinati phalam vicinati iti dhamma caraṇassa duggati gamana abhāvena vā maccu taraṇa ādinā
translated: He investigates by way of the path, by way of Nibbāna, or by way of the path’s approach to Nibbāna.🔽Or he investigates the fruit by way of the non-occurrence of the disciple’s going to a bad destination, or by way of his crossing over the flood, etc.,

original: vā desanāya phalaṃ, desanānusārena caraṇassa phalaṃ vicinati. Upāyaṃ vicinatīti aniccānupassanādivasena
analyzed: vā desanāya phalam desanā anusārena caraṇassa phalam vicinati upāyam vicinati iti anicca anupassanā ādi vasena
translated: or by way of the fruit of the disciple’s practice as the teaching, or by way of the fruit of the teaching as the disciple’s practice.🔽He investigates the means by way of the contemplation of impermanence, etc.,

original: pavattananibbidāñāṇādivasena vā saddhāsativasena vā visuddhiyā upāyaṃ vicinati. Āṇattiṃ
analyzed: pavattana nibbidā ñāṇa ādi vasena vā saddhā sati vasena vā visuddhiyāḥ upāyam vicinati āṇattim
translated: or by way of the knowledge of dispassion that arises by means of the contemplation of impermanence, etc., or by way of the means to purification as faith and mindfulness.

original: vicinatīti pāpaparivajjanāṇattivasena vā lokassa suññatāpekkhanāṇattivasena vā vicinati.🔽Anugītiṃ vicinatīti vuttānugītivasena vā vuccamānānugītivasena vā anurūpaṃ gītiṃ
analyzed: vicinati iti pāpa parivajja nāṇatti vasena vā lokassa suññatā apekkha nāṇatti vasena vā vicinati  anugītim vicinati iti vutta anugīti vasena vā vuccamāna anugīti vasena vā anurūpam gītim
translated: He investigates the injunction by way of the injunction to avoid evil, or by way of the injunction to look upon the world as empty.🔽He investigates the verse by way of the verse already spoken, or by way of the verse being spoken, or by way of the verse to be spoken.

original: vicinati. Sabbe nava suttante vicinatīti suttageyyādike nava sutte āhaccavacanavasena
analyzed: vicinati sabbe nava suttante vicinati iti sutta geyya ādike nava sutte āhacca vacana vasena
translated: He investigates all the nine kinds of scriptures by way of the nine scriptures, namely, the Discourses in prose, in prose and verse, etc., by way of the nine scriptures beginning with the Discourses in prose.

original: vā anusandhivacanavasena vā nītatthavacanavasena vā neyyatthavacanavasena vā saṃkilesabhāgiyādivasena vā vicinati.
analyzed: vā anusandhi vacana vasena vā nīta attha vacana vasena vā neyyattha vacana vasena vā saṃkilesa bhāgiya ādi vasena vā vicinati
translated: or by way of the words of the Thread, or by way of the words of the Thread’s meaning, or by way of the words of the Thread’s purport, or by way of the categories of corruption, etc.

original: Kiñcāpi padavicayo paṭhamaṃ vibhatto, suttassa pana anupadaṃ vicinitabbatāya atibhāriyo,
analyzed: kiñca api pada vicayaḥ paṭhamam vibhattaḥ suttassa pana anupadam vicinitabba tāya ati bhāriyaḥ
translated: Though the investigation of terms is first analysed, still it is too heavy to investigate in the wake of the Thread,

original: na sukaro padavicayoti taṃ aggahetvā pañhāvicayavissajjanavicaye tāva vibhajanto
analyzed: na sukaro pada vicayo ti tam aggahetvā pañhāvicaya vissajjana vicaye tāva vibhajanto
translated: and it is not easy to investigate terms, so leaving that aside, he now analyses the investigation of questions and the investigation of the answer to questions,

original: “yathā kiṃ bhave”tiādimāha. Tattha yathā kiṃ bhaveti yena pakārena so pañhāvicayo
analyzed: yathā kim bhava iti ādim āha tattha yathā kim bhava iti yena pakārena so pañhāvicayo
translated: saying “How is it in what way? ” Herein, how is it in what way? is to be construed as the kind of what way in which that investigation of questions

original: pavattetabbo, taṃ pakārajātaṃ kīdisaṃ bhaveyyāti attho daṭṭhabbo. Āyasmā ajito pārāyane
analyzed: tam pakāra jātam kīdisam bhaveyya ati atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo āyasmai ajitaḥ pārāyane
translated: is to be conducted. The meaning is that the kind of what way it is to be seen as is this. The venerable Ajita

original: bhagavantaṃ pañhaṃ yathā yena pakārena pucchati, tathā tena pakārena pañhāvicayo
analyzed: bhagavantam pañham yathā yena pakārena pucchati tathā tena pakārena pañhāvicayaḥ
translated: in the Pārāyanavagga asked the Blessed One a question in such a way that he asked it in a certain way, and so the meaning is that the investigation of questions

original: pavattetabboti attho. Tattha āyasmāti piyavacanaṃ. Ajitoti bāvarībrāhmaṇassa paricārakabhūtānaṃ
analyzed: pavattetabbo ti atthaḥ tattha āyasmā iti piya vacanam ajitaḥ iti bāvarī brāhmaṇassa paricāraka bhūtānam
translated: is to be conducted in that way. Herein, venerable is a term of affection. Ajita: he was a clansman of the Bāvari brahmin’s family.

original: soḷasannaṃ aññataro ajito. Pārāyaneti pāraṃ nibbānaṃ ayati gacchati etenāti pārāyanaṃ,
analyzed: soḷasannam aññataraḥ a jitaḥ pārāyana iti pāram nibbānam ayati gacchati etena ati pārāyanam
translated: one of the sixteen is Ajita. Pārāyana means that by which one goes to the further shore , Nibbana.

original: ajitasuttādisoḷasasuttassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
analyzed: ajita sutta ādi soḷasa suttassa itam adhivacanam
translated: This is a designation for the sixteen Suttas beginning with the Ajita Sutta.

original: “Kenassu nivuto loko, (iccāyasmā ajito,)
analyzed: kenassu nivutaḥ lokaḥ iccā ayasmai ajitaḥ
translated: “By what is the world covered over? (Thus, venerable sir, Ajita)

original: Kenassu nappakāsati;
analyzed: na ppakāsati
translated: By what does it not shine?

original: Kissābhilepanaṃ brūsi, kiṃ su tassa mahabbhaya”nti. –
analyzed: kissa abhilepanam brūsi kim su tassa
translated: What do you call its smear? What is its great fear?”

original: Gāthāya “kena dhammena loko ariyavajjo satto nivuto paṭicchādito, iti āyasmā ajito
analyzed: gāthāya kena dhammena lokaḥ ariya vajjaḥ satto nivutaḥ paṭicchāditaḥ iti āyasmai ajito
translated: In the stanza, “By what state is the world covered over, concealed, hidden, thus, venerable sir, Ajita

original: pucchati. Kena hetunā yathāvuttaloko nappakāsati, assa yathāvuttalokassa kiṃ abhilepanaṃ
analyzed: pucchati kena hetunā yathāvutta lokaḥ na ppakāsati assa yathāvutta lokassa kim abhilepanam
translated: asks. By what cause does the world not shine as described? What is the smear of the world as described?

original: iti tvaṃ brūsi, tassa yathāvuttalokassa kiṃ mahabbhayanti tvaṃ brūsīti pucchatī”ti attho.
analyzed: iti tvam brūsi tassa yathāvutta lokassa kim mahabbhayanti tvam brūsi iti pucchati iti atthaḥ
translated: What do you call it? What is its great fear? Thus, you call it, asks.

original: Iti iminā pabhedena cattāri imāni gāthāpādapadāni pucchitāni pucchāvasena vuttāni,
analyzed: iti iminā pabhedena cattāri imāni gāthā pāda padāni pucchitāni pucchā vasena vuttāni
translated: Thus, by this division, these four lines of the stanza are asked. They are stated by way of the question,

original: pucchitatthadīpakāni vā, padhānavasena pana so “eko pañho”ti mato, yadipi catunnaṃ
analyzed: pucchi tattha dīpakāni vā padhāna vasena pana saḥ ekaḥ pañho ti mataḥ yadi api
translated: or they are illuminating the meaning of the question. By way of the pre-eminence, however, that is considered “one question” , although it is four.

original: padānaṃ pucchanavasena pavattattā catubbidhoti vattabbo, ñātuṃ pana icchitassa ekasseva
analyzed: padānam pucchana vasena pavatta ttā catubbidhaḥ iti vattabbaḥ ñātum pana icchitassa ekassa iva
translated: It should be said to be fourfold because it occurs by way of asking about the four terms, but it is said to be “one question” because of the possibility of one meaning alone being desired to be known.

original: atthassa sambhavato “eko pañho”ti vuttaṃ. “Kāraṇaṃ vadehī”ti vattabbattā kāraṇamāha🔽“ekavatthupariggahā”ti. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – “yadipi nivāraṇāpakāsanābhilepanamahabbhayasaṅkhātā
analyzed: atthassa sambhavataḥ ekaḥ pañhaḥ iti vuttam kāraṇam vadehi iti vattabbattā kāraṇam āha  eka vatthu pariggahā ti idam vuttam hoti yadi api nivāraṇa apakāsana abhilepana mahat bhaya saṅkhātā
translated: Since it is necessary to say “state a reason,” he states a reason,🔽“because of the inclusion of one subject-matter.” This is what is said: “Although four meanings, namely, the four called obstruction, concealment, boasting, and great fear,

original: cattāro atthā pucchāyaṃ gahitā, ekassa pana abhidheyyatthassa gahaṇato ‘eko pañho’ti
analyzed: cattāro atthā pucchāyam gahitāḥ ekassa pana abhidheyya tthassa gahaṇato ekaḥ pañho ti
translated: are included in the question, still it is said to be ‘one question’ because of the inclusion of one name-meaning.”

original: padhānavasena gahitoti daṭṭhabbo”ti. “Ekavatthupariggahaṇaṃ kathaṃ amhehi saddahitabba”nti
analyzed: padhāna vasena gahitoti daṭṭhabbo ti eka vatthu pariggahaṇam katham amhehi saddahitabban ti
translated: It should be regarded as included by way of the endeavour. “How can we believe the inclusion of one subject-matter?”

original: vattabbabhāvato “evañhi āhā”ti vuttaṃ. Evaṃ ekavatthupariggahaṇeneva bhagavā hi yasmā
analyzed: vattabba bhāvataḥ evam hi āha iti vuttam evam eka vatthu pariggahaṇena iva bhagavā hi yasmā
translated: Since it is necessary to say this, it is said “thus he said.” Thus, because the Blessed One said it by way of the inclusion of one subject-matter,

original: āha, iti tasmā ekavatthupariggahaṇaṃ tumhehi saddahitabbanti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: āha iti tasmai eka vatthu pariggahaṇam tumhehi saddahitabbam ti vuttam hoti
translated: therefore it is said that the inclusion of one subject-matter should be believed by you.

original: “Kenassu nivuto loko”ti iminā lokādhiṭṭhānaṃ paṭicchādanaṃ pucchati, na nānādhammādhiṭṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: iminā loka adhiṭṭhānam paṭicchādanam pucchati na nānā dhamma adhiṭṭhānam
translated: By “By what is the world shut in?” he asks about the concealment which is based on the world, not on the various ideas.

original: “Kenassu nappakāsatī”ti iminā lokasseva appakāsanaṃ pucchati, na nānāsabhāvadhammassa.🔽“Kissābhilepanaṃ brūsī”ti iminā lokasseva abhilepanaṃ pucchati, na nānāsabhāvadhammassa.
analyzed: na ppakāsati iti iminā lokassa iva appakāsanam pucchati na nānā sabhāva dhammassa  kissa abhilepanam brūsi iti iminā lokassa iva abhilepanam pucchati na nānā sabhāva dhammassa
translated: “What is the world’s besmirchment?”: he asks about the world’s besmirchment, not about the besmirchedness of the various dhammas.

original: “Kiṃ su tassa mahabbhaya”nti iminā tasseva lokassa mahabbhayaṃ pucchati, na nānāsabhāvadhammassa.
analyzed: kim su tassa mahabbhayanti iminā tassa iva lokassa mahabbhayam pucchati na nānā sabhāva dhammassa
translated: “What is the world’s great fear?”: he asks about the world’s great fear, not about the fearful dhammas.

original: Tasmā “kenassu nivuto loko”tiādipañho ekādhiṭṭhānanānādhiṭṭhānesu ekādhiṭṭhāno, dhammādhiṭṭhānasattādhiṭṭhānesu
analyzed: tasmā nivutaḥ loko ti ādi pañho eka adhiṭṭhāna nānā adhiṭṭhānesu eka adhiṭṭhānaḥ dhamma adhiṭṭhāna satta adhiṭṭhānesu
translated: Therefore the question “By what is the world covered?” is one of single reference among those of single and multiple references,

original: sattādhiṭṭhāno, adiṭṭhajotanādīsu adiṭṭhajotanāpañhotiādinā yathāsambhavaṃ vicinitabboti adhippāyo.🔽“Pañhassa yo loko ‘adhiṭṭhāno’ti gahito, so loko tividho”ti vattabbabhāvato “loko
analyzed: satta adhiṭṭhānaḥ adiṭṭha jotana ādīsu adiṭṭha jotanā pañhaḥ ti ādinā yathāsambhavam vicinitabbaḥ ti adhippāyaḥ  pañhassa yaḥ lokaḥ adhiṭṭhāno ti gahito so loko tividhaḥ ti vattabba bhāvataḥ loko
translated: and it is a question of reference to beings among those of reference to dhammas and beings.🔽“The world that is the reference of the question is threefold” is said in order to show that the world that is the reference of the question is threefold.🔽Herein, the world is threefold,

original: tividho”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha tayo vidhā etassa lokassāti tividho. Kilissati rāgādivasena
analyzed: tividhaḥ tiādi vuttam tattha tayo vidhāḥ etassa lokassa ati tividhaḥ kilissati rāga ādi vasena
translated: it is defiled by lust, etc.,

original: kāmāvacarasattoti kileso, kileso ca so loko cāti kilesaloko, kāmāvacarasatto. So
analyzed: kāma avacara satto ti kileso kileso ca saḥ loko ca ati kilesa loko kāma avacara satto so
translated: “A being of the sense-sphere” is a defilement, and that defilement is the world, thus it is the defilement-world, a being of the sense-sphere.

original: hi rāgādikilesabahulatāya kilesalokoti. Bhavati jhānābhiññāhi buddhīhīti bhavo, bhavo🔽ca so loko cāti bhavaloko, rūpāvacarasatto. So hi jhānādibuddhīhi bhavatīti. Indriyena
analyzed: hi rāga ādi kilesa bahula tāya kilesa loko ti bhavati jhāna abhiññāhi buddhīhi iti bhavaḥ bhavaḥ  ca saḥ lokaḥ ca ati bhava lokaḥ rūpāvacara satto saḥ hi jhāna ādi buddhīhi bhavati iti indriyena
translated: For he is called the defilement-world because of the abundance of defilements such as lust, etc. “He is by means of jhāna and direct-knowledge and by means of understanding” is becoming,

original: samannāgatoti indriyo, indriyo ca so loko cāti indriyaloko, arūpāvacarasatto. So
analyzed: samannāgato ti indriyaḥ indriyo ca saḥ loko ca ati indriya loko arūpāvacara satto so
translated: and that becoming is the world, thus it is the becoming-world, a being of the fine-material sphere. For he is called becoming because of jhāna, etc., and understanding. “Endowed with faculties” is a faculty, and that faculty is the world, thus it is the faculty-world, a being of the immaterial sphere.

original: hi āneñjasamādhibahulatāya visuddhindriyo hotīti lokasamaññā pariyāpannadhammavasena
analyzed: hi āneñja samādhi bahula tāya visuddhi indriyaḥ hoti iti loka samaññā pariyāpanna dhamma vasena
translated: For he is called a pure faculty because of the abundance of imperturbable concentration. The designation of the world occurs by way of the dhammas included in the world,

original: pavattā, tasmā ariyā na gahitāti.🔽“Kenassu nivuto loko”tiādigāthāya pucchāvicayo hāro ācariyena vibhatto, amhehi ca
analyzed: pavattā tasmai ariyā na gahitā ati  nivutaḥ lokaḥ iti ādi gāthāya pucchā vicayaḥ hāro ācariyena vibhattaḥ amhehi ca
translated: therefore the noble ones are not included.🔽The teacher has analyzed the mode of questioning and investigating in the verse beginning, “By what is the world shut in?” and we have understood it.

original: ñāto, “vissajjanāvicayo hāro kattha vissajjanāya vibhatto”ti pucchitabbattā “tattha
analyzed: ñātaḥ vissajjanā vicayaḥ hāro kattha vissajjanāya vibhatto ti pucchitabba ttā tattha
translated: Now, since it is necessary to ask, “Where has the mode of answering and investigating been analyzed?” he says, “Herein,
