translated: The formations that are formed together with craving, conceit, and views, or that are supported by them, are called “the proliferation.”

original: ca papañcā nāma. Santāne appahīnaṭṭhena anusayā taṇhā sattānaṃ tiṭṭhanahetuttā ṭhitī🔽nāma. Pavattamānāya taṇhāya yaṃ pariyuṭṭhānañca chattiṃsataṇhāya jāliniyā yāni vicaritāni
analyzed: ca papañcā nāma santāne a pahīna ṭṭhena anusayā taṇhā sattānam tiṭṭhana hetuttā ṭhitī  nāma pavattamānāya taṇhāya yam pariyuṭṭhānam ca chattiṃsa taṇhāya jāliniyā yāni vicaritāni
translated: The latent tendencies that are not yet abandoned in the continuum are called “the abiding,” because they are the cause for beings to abide.

original: ca vuttāni, idaṃ sabbaṃ attano ādhāraṃ puggalaṃ bandhanaṭṭhena sandānasadisattā sandānaṃ
analyzed: ca vuttāni idam sabbam attanaḥ ādhāram puggalam bandhana ṭṭhena sandāna sadisa ttā sandānam
translated: The clinging that occurs together with craving, and the wanderings that are mentioned as the thirty-six modes of craving, are called “the yoke,” because they yoke one to one’s own support, the person, in the manner of a yoke.

original: nāma. Moho attano ādhārassa puggalassa nibbānanagarappavesanassa paṭisedhakattā palighasadisattā
analyzed: nāma mohaḥ attanaḥ ādhārassa puggalassa nibbāna nagara ppavesanassa paṭisedhaka ttā paligha sadisa ttā
translated: Delusion is called “the hindrance,” because it hinders one’s own support, the person, from entering the city of Nibbāna, and because it is like a hindrance.

original: paligho nāma. “Yassa papañcādayo natthi, so kiṃ vītivatto”ti pucchitabbattā “ye cā”tiādi
analyzed: palighaḥ nāma yassa pa pañca ādayo na atthi so kim vītivatto ti pucchitabba ttā ye ca atiādi
translated: “But who is it that has no proliferation, etc.? ”—because this must be asked, the text says “whoever is free from craving, conceit, and views.”

original: vuttaṃ. Ye vuttappakārā papañcā saṅkhārā, yā ca vuttappakārā ṭhiti, yaṃ vuttappakāraṃ🔽sandānañca, yaṃ vuttappakāraṃ palighañca natthīti vuttā, sabbaṃ etaṃ papañcādikaṃ
analyzed: vuttam ye vutta pakārā papañcā saṅkhārāḥ yā ca vutta ppakārā ṭhiti yam vutta ppakāram  sandānam ca yam vutta ppakāram paligham ca na atthi iti vuttā sabbam etam papañca ādikam
translated: is said. The formations which are the kinds of elaboration mentioned, and the continuance which is the kind mentioned,🔽and the bond and the bar which are the kinds mentioned, are not, it is said. All this beginning with elaboration🔽

original: yo muni samatikkanto, ayaṃ muni “nittaṇho”ti vuccatīti daṭṭhabbo.🔽28. “Yassa papañcātiādigāthāyaṃ ye papañcādayo vuttā, tesu taṇhāmānadiṭṭhihetukā🔽saṅkhārā kadā katividhaṃ phalaṃ denti, taṃsaṅkhārasampayuttā taṇhā kadā katividhaṃ🔽phalaṃ detī”ti pucchitabbattā “tattha pariyuṭṭhānasaṅkhārā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha tatthāti🔽tesu papañcasaṅkhārādīsu. Pariyuṭṭhānasaṅkhārāti vītikkamavasena pavattā pariyuṭṭhānā
analyzed: yaḥ muni samatikkantaḥ ayam muni nittaṇhaḥ ti vuccati iti daṭṭhabbo  yassa papañca ati ādi gāthā ayam ye papañca ādayaḥ vuttā tesu taṇhā māna diṭṭhi hetukā  saṅkhārā kadā katividham phalam denti tad saṅkhāra sampayuttā taṇhā kadā katividham  phalam deti iti pucchitabba ttā tattha pariyuṭṭhāna saṅkhāra ati ādi vuttam tattha tattha ati  tesu papañca saṅkhāra ādīsu pariyuṭṭhāna saṅkhārā ati vītikkama vasena pavattā pariyuṭṭhānā
translated: This has been said. The “formations” are the kinds of “constructing” stated. The “stationing” is the kind stated. The “binding” is the kind stated. The “bar” is the kind stated. All this beginning with “constructing” is said to be “not” . The sage who has gone beyond all this is called “the one without desire” .

original: akusalasaṅkhārā cetanā. Diṭṭhadhammavedanīyādīti diṭṭhe passitabbe dhamme attabhāve
analyzed: akusala saṅkhārā cetanā diṭṭha dhamma vedanīya ādi iti diṭṭhe passitabbe dhamme atta bhāve
translated: In the stanza beginning “When there is constructing” , the formations, etc., are stated. In regard to them, it should be asked: “When do the formations that are the cause of craving, conceit, and views give their fruit in how many ways? When do the craving associated with those formations give its fruit in how many ways?” In order to answer this, it is said: “Herein, the formations of clinging” , and so on. Herein, there means in regard to those formations of constructing, etc. The formations of clinging are the formations of clinging that occur by way of transgression. They are unwholesome volitions. In this very life, etc. In this very life, in the visible state of being, in the present existence.

original: vedanīyaṃ phalaṃ detīti diṭṭhadhammavedanīyā, diṭṭhe dhamme phalaṃ vedetīti vā diṭṭhadhammavedanīyā.
analyzed: vedanīyam phalam deti iti diṭṭha dhamma vedanīyā diṭṭhe dhamme phalam vedeti iti vā diṭṭha dhamma vedanīyā
translated: It gives fruit to be felt means that it gives fruit to be felt here and now. Or alternatively, it gives fruit to be felt in the visible here and now means that it gives fruit to be felt in the visible here and now.

original: Kā sā? Apadussanīyādīsu atidussanādivasena pavattā paṭhamajavanacetanā. Upapajje
analyzed: kā sā apadussanīya ādīsu atidussana ādi vasena pavattā paṭhama javana cetanā upapajje
translated: What is it? It is the first impulsion-cetanā-in the case of the first three kinds of action, namely, the action of extreme severity, etc., among the actions of extreme severity, etc., which are given in the way beginning, “When he is severe, etc., he is not to be served” .

original: phalaṃ vedetīti upapajjavedanīyā, sattamajavanacetanā. Aparāpariyāye attabhāve phalaṃ
analyzed: phalam veda iti upapajja vedanīyā sattama javana cetanā apara apariyāye atta bhāve phalam
translated: It gives fruit to be felt after rebirth means that it gives fruit to be felt in the next existence. It is the seventh impulsion-cetanā-in the case of the first three kinds of action.

original: vedetīti aparāpariyāyavedanīyā, majjhe pavattā pañca javanacetanā. Tiphaladānavasena
analyzed: vedeti iti apara apariyāya vedanīyā majjhe pavattā pañca javana cetanā ti phala dāna vasena
translated: It gives fruit to be felt in some subsequent existence means that it gives fruit to be felt in some subsequent existence other than the next. It is the five impulsions-cetanā-that occur in the middle.🔽It is the formations that give the three kinds of fruit in this way that are threefold.

original: tividhā saṅkhārā. Evaṃ imāya tividhāya saṅkhāracetanāya sampayuttā tividhā taṇhā
analyzed: tividhā saṅkhārāḥ evam imāya tividhāya saṅkhāra cetanāya sampayuttā tividhā taṇhā
translated: And the craving associated with these three kinds of formations

original: tividhaṃ phalaṃ diṭṭhe vā dhamme attabhāve, upapajje vā anantarabhave, apare vā pariyāye
analyzed: tividham phalam diṭṭhe vā dhamme atta bhāve upapajje vā anantara bhave apare vā pariyāye
translated: gives the three kinds of fruit in the visible here and now, in the next existence, or in some subsequent existence.

original: bhave deti nibbattetīti evaṃ phalanibbattakasaṅkhāraṃ vā taṃsampayuttaṃ taṇhaṃ vā bhagavā āha.
analyzed: bhave deti nibbatteti iti evam phala nibbattaka saṅkhāram vā tad sampayuttam taṇham vā bhagavā āha
translated: Thus the Blessed One said that the formations that give the fruit or the craving associated with them give it.

original: “Yāya desanāya, gāthāya vā phalanibbattakaṃ saṅkhāraṃ āha, sā desanā, gāthā vā katamena🔽desanābhūtena vā aparena yujjatī”ti pucchitabbattā “yaṃ lobhapakataṃ kammaṃ karotī”tiādi🔽vuttaṃ. Yā “yassa…pe… loko”ti desanā ca yā “yaṃ lobhapakataṃ kammaṃ…pe… apare vā🔽pariyāye”ti desanā ca vuttā, bhagavato idaṃ desanādvayaṃ aññamaññaṃ pubbāparena pubbaṃ
analyzed: yāya desanāya gāthāya vā phala nibbattakam saṅkhāram āha sā desanā gāthā vā katamena  desanā bhūtena vā aparena yujjati iti pucchitabba ttā yam lobha pakatam kammam karoti itiādi  vuttam yā yassape desanā ca yā yam lobha pakatam apare vā  pariyāya iti desanā ca vuttā bhagavataḥ idam desanā dvayam aññam aññam pubba aparena pubbam
translated: “By what teaching or stanza is the formation that produces the fruit stated? That teaching or stanza is to be asked about as to how it is appropriate by what other teaching-state. ” Therefore, “Whatever action is done by one affected by greed” and so on is stated. The teaching stated as “The world is led by what? … The world is set in motion by what? … The world is bound by what? … The world is freed by what? … The world is defiled by what? … The world is purified by what? … The world is caused to revolve by what? … The world is led by what? … The world is set in motion by what? … The world is bound by what? … The world is freed by what? … The world is defiled by what? … The world is purified by what? … The world is caused to revolve by what? … The world is led by what? … The world is set in motion by what? … The world is bound by what? … The world is freed by what? … The world is defiled by what? … The world is purified by what? … The world is caused to revolve by what? … The world is led by what? … The world is set in motion by what? … The world is bound by what? … The world is freed by what? … The world is defiled by what? … The world is purified by what? … The world is caused to revolve by what? … The world is led by what? … The world is set in motion by what? … The world is bound by what? … The world is freed by what? … The world is defiled by what? … The world is purified by what? … The world is caused to revolve by what? … The world is led by what? … The world is set in motion by what? … The world is bound by what? … The world is freed by what? … The world is defiled by what? … The world is purified by what? … The world is caused to revolve by what? … The world is led by what? … The world is set in motion by what? … The world is bound by what? … The world is freed by what? … The world is defiled by what? … The world is purified by what? … The world is caused to revolve by what? … The world is led by what? … The world is set in motion by what? … The world is bound by

original: aparena aparaṃ pubbena yujjati yujjanaṃ eti sameti, yathā gaṅgodakaṃ yamunodakena,🔽yamunodakampi gaṅgodakena saṃsandati sameti. “Yassa…pe… loko”ti desanā “yaṃ lobhapakataṃ…pe…🔽pariyāye”ti desanāya saṃsandati sameti, “yaṃ lobhapakataṃ…pe… pariyāye”ti desanāpi🔽“yassa…pe… loko”ti desanāya saṃsandati sametīti attho gahetabbo. “Kathaṃ yujjatī”ti
analyzed: aparena aparam pubbena yujjati yujjanam eti sameti yathā gaṅgā udakam yamunā udakena 🔽yamunā udakam pi gaṅgā udakena saṃsandati sameti desanā yam 🔽pariyāya iti desanāya saṃsandati sameti yam lobha pakataṃpe pariyāya iti desanā api 🔽desanāya saṃsandati sameti iti atthaḥ gahetabbaḥ katham yujjati iti

original: pucchitabbattā “tattha pariyuṭṭhāna”ntiādi vuttaṃ, diṭṭhadhammavedanīyādiphalattayanibbattakaṭṭhena
analyzed: pucchitabba ttā tattha pariyuṭṭhāna ntiādi vuttam diṭṭha dhamma vedanīya ādi phalattaya nibbattaka ṭṭhena
translated: “Herein, obsession” is said because it is to be asked about. It is said that it is appropriate as the producer of the three kinds of fruit, namely, to be experienced here and now, and so on.

original: yujjatīti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: yujjati iti vuttam hoti
translated: What is meant is that it is appropriate.

original: Yaṃ yaṃ suttaṃ bhagavatā desitaṃ pubbāparena yujjati, taṃ taṃ suttampi nīharitvā
analyzed: yam yam suttam bhagavatā desitam pubba aparena yujjati tam tam suttam api nīharitvā
translated: Any sutta taught by the Blessed One that is appropriate in the sequence of the earlier and later should be brought in and

original: pubbāparasaṃsandanaṃ dassetuṃ “yathāhā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Saṃsandanākāro vuttanayānusārena🔽gahetabbo. Tatthāti tesu pariyuṭṭhānasaṅkhārataṇhāvicaritesu. Pariyuṭṭhānanti rūpārammaṇādīni
analyzed: pubba apara saṃsandanam dassetum yathā āha atiādi vuttam saṃsandana ākāraḥ vutta naya anusārena  gahetabbaḥ tattha ati tesu pariyuṭṭhāna saṅkhāra taṇhā vicaritesu pariyuṭṭhānam ti rūpa ārammaṇa ādīni
translated: shown to be connected in sequence. “As follows” is said to show this. The way of connecting should be understood according to the method stated.

original: ayonisomanasikārena ārabbha sattasantāne pavattaṃ taṇhācaritaṃ. Paṭisaṅkhānabalenāti🔽asubhāniccādidassanabalena tadaṅgappahānavasena pahātabbaṃ. Saṅkhārāti dassanapahātabbā
analyzed: a yoniso manasikārena ārabbha satta santāne pavattam taṇhā caritam paṭisaṅkhāna balena ati  asubha anicca ādi dassana balena tad aṅga ppahāna vasena pahātabbam saṅkhārā ati dassana pahātabbā
translated: Herein, “obsession” is the occurrence of the mode of craving in the continuum of beings in regard to visible-data objects, etc., by means of unwise attention.🔽It is to be abandoned by the power of reflection, that is, by the power of seeing foulness, impermanence, etc., and by the abandoning of its associated states. “Determinations” are determinations to be abandoned by seeing.

original: saṅkhārā. Dassanabalenāti dassanasaṅkhātapaṭhamamaggañāṇabalena pahātabbā. Chattiṃsa
analyzed: saṅkhārāḥ dassana balena ati dassana saṅkhāta paṭhama magga ñāṇa balena pahātabbā chattiṃsa
translated: They are to be abandoned by the power of seeing, that is, by the power of the knowledge of the first path, which is the seeing of the four truths. Thirty-six.

original: taṇhāvicaritānīti dassanena pahātabbataṇhāvicaritehi avasesāni chattiṃsa taṇhāvicaritāni.
analyzed: taṇhā vicaritāni iti dassanena pahātabba taṇhā vicaritehi avasesāni chattiṃsa taṇhā vicaritāni
translated: “The thirty-six kinds of craving that occur in the sense-desire element” are the thirty-six kinds of craving that occur in the sense-desire element and that are abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: Niggatā taṇhā yassa so nittaṇho, nittaṇhassa bhāvo nittaṇhatā, kā sā? Saupādisesā nibbānadhātu.
analyzed: niggatā taṇhā yassa saḥ nittaṇhaḥ nittaṇhassa bhāvaḥ nittaṇha tā kā sā saupādisesā nibbāna dhātu
translated: “The state of being free from craving” is the state of being free from craving. The state of being free from craving is the state of being free from craving. What is that? It is the element of Nibbāna that still has a substrate of clinging left in it.

original: Papañcasaṅkhārābhinandanattayaṃ yadipi atthato ekaṃ samānaṃ, desanāya pana padakkharādīhi viseso atthīti dassetuṃ “apicā”tiādi vuttaṃ.🔽“Yoyaṃ pubbāparasandhi ācariyena vibhatto, soyaṃ katividho”ti pucchitabbattā “so
analyzed: papañca saṅkhāra abhinandana ttayam yadi api atthataḥ ekam samānam desanāya pana pada kkhara ādīhi visesaḥ atthi iti dassetum api ca ātiādi vuttam  yaḥ ayam pubba apara sandhi ācariyena vibhatto saḥ yam katividhaḥ ti pucchitabba ttā so
translated: Although the three kinds of delight in proliferations are the same in meaning, there is a difference in their verbal expression. In order to show this, the expression “and also” is used.

original: cāyaṃ pubbāparo sandhī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana vuttaṃ – “na kevalaṃ suttantarasaṃsandanameva
analyzed: ca ayam pubba aparaḥ sandhi iti ādi vuttam aṭṭhakathāyam pana vuttam na kevalam sutta antara saṃsandanam eva
translated: Since it should be asked: “This continuity from the beginning to the end that has been analyzed by the teacher, how many kinds is it?,” it is said: “And this continuity from the beginning to the end.” But it is said in the commentary: “Not only the continuity from the beginning to the end of the suttas,

original: pubbāparasandhi, atha kho aññopi atthīti dassetuṃ ‘so cāya’ntiādi vutta”nti. Tattha
analyzed: pubba apara sandhi atha kho aññaḥ api atthi iti dassetum so ca āyanti ādi vuttan ti tattha
translated: but also there is another. In order to show this, ‘and this’ is said.” Herein,

original: atthasandhīti kiriyākārakādivasena atthassa atthena sandhi. Padasandhīti nāmapadādikassa
analyzed: attha sandhi iti kiriyā kāraka ādi vasena atthassa atthena sandhi pada sandhi iti nāma pada ādikassa
translated: “The continuity of meaning” is the continuity of meaning by meaning through such things as action and its result. The continuity of words is the continuity of words through such things as nouns and verbs.

original: nāmapadādikantarena sandhi. Desanāsandhīti vuttappakārassa desanantarassa vuttappakārena
analyzed: nāma pada ādika antarena sandhi desanāsandhi iti vutta ppakārassa desanantarassa vutta ppakārena
translated: The ‘link of teaching’ is the link between the teaching stated in the way already described and the teaching stated in the same way.

original: desanantarena sandhi. Niddesasandhīti niddesantarassa niddesantarena sandhi.
analyzed: desanantarena sandhi niddesa sandhi iti niddesa antarassa niddesa antarena sandhi
translated: The ‘link of demonstration’ is the link between one demonstration and another.

original: Sandhi ca nāma atthādayo muñcitvā añño sabhāvadhammo nāma natthi, atthādīnañca chaatthapadādīsu avarodhanato “atthasandhi chappadānī”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: sandhi ca nāma attha ādayaḥ muñcitvā aññaḥ sabhāva dhammo nāma natthi attha ādīnam ca cha attha pada ādīsu avarodhanato attha sandhi cha ppadāni itiādi vuttaṃ
translated: And a ‘link’ is not a separate entity apart from the meaning, etc., that are linked; but it is said that ‘the link of meaning is the six bases of meaning’ and so on, because the meaning, etc., are included in the six bases of meaning, etc.

original: Atthasandhibyañjanasandhayo ācariyena vibhattā, amhehi ca ñātā, “katamā desanāsandhī”ti
analyzed: attha sandhi byañjana sandhayaḥ ācariyena vibhattā amhehi ca ñātā katamā desanā sandhī iti
translated: The ‘link of meaning’ and the ‘link of phrasing’ have been explained by the teacher and are known by us. But since it has to be asked what the ‘link of teaching’ is,🔽‘The link of teaching is not the earth’ is said. Herein, the meditator does not meditate

original: pucchitabbattā “desanāsandhi na ca pathavi”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha na ca pathaviṃ nissāya🔽jhāyati jhāyī jhāyati cāti ettha jhāyī jhānasamaṅgī puggalo pathaviṃ nissāya ālambitvā
analyzed: pucchitabba ttā desanā sandhi na ca pathavi ntiādi vuttam tattha na ca pathavim nissāya  jhāyati jhāyī jhāyati ca ati ettha jhāyī jhāna samaṅgī puggalo pathavim nissāya ālambitvā
translated: relying on the earth. But he does meditate🔽relying on the deathless.🔽The meditator who possesses jhāna does not meditate relying on the earth, taking it as the object of concentration,

original: na ca jhāyati, sabbasaṅkhāranissaṭaṃ pana nibbānaṃ nissāya ālambitvā phalasamāpattiṃ
analyzed: na ca jhāyati sabba saṅkhāra nissaṭam pana nibbānam nissāya ālambitvā phala samāpattim
translated: but he does meditate relying on the deathless, taking Nibbāna as the object of concentration, and he does so by entering upon the fruition attainment of the path.

original: jhāyati samāpajjati evāti attho daṭṭhabbo. Na ca āpantiādīsupi esa nayo yojetabbo.
analyzed: jhāyati samāpajjati eva ati atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo na ca āpanti ādīsu pi esa nayaḥ yojetabbo
translated: and the meaning should be regarded as “he meditates, he attains.” And this method should be applied to the other instances beginning with “not-breathing.”

original: Phalasamāpattisamaṅgī puggalo hi pathavīādayo muñcitvā nibbānameva ārabbha phalasamāpattiṃ
analyzed: phala samāpatti samaṅgī puggalaḥ hi pathavī ādayaḥ muñcitvā nibbānam eva ārabbha phala samāpattim
translated: For the person who possesses the attainment of fruition, when he has left out earth, etc., and has made Nibbāna his object, he attains the fruition attainment.

original: samāpajjatīti. Ettha ca pathavīādīhi mahābhūtehi kāmabhavarūpabhavā gahitā rūpapaṭibaddhavuttitāya.
analyzed: samāpajjati iti ettha ca pathavī ādīhi mahābhūtehi kāma bhava rūpa bhavāḥ gahitāḥ rūpa paṭibaddha vutti tāya
translated: And here the three kinds of becoming, that is to say, sensual-desire becoming, fine-material becoming, and immaterial becoming, are included by the great primaries, earth, etc., because their occurrence is bound up with materiality.

original: Ākāsānañcāyatanādīhipi arūpabhavo gahito, bhavattayaṃ vajjetvā ca jhāyatīti adhippāyo.🔽Yadi pathavīādayo nissāya na jhāyī jhāyati ca, evaṃ sati idhalokasaṅkhātaṃ sattasantānaṃ
analyzed: arūpa bhavaḥ gahitaḥ bhavattayam vajjetvā ca jhāyati iti adhippāyaḥ  yadi pathavī ādayaḥ nissāya na jhāyī jhāyati ca evam sati idha loka saṅkhātam satta santānam
translated: And immaterial becoming is included by the base consisting of boundless space, and so on. The intention is that he meditates by leaving out the three kinds of becoming.

original: vā paralokasaṅkhātaṃ sattasantānaṃ vā anindriyasantānaṃ vā nissāya jhāyī jhāyatīti
analyzed: vā para loka saṅkhātam satta santānam vā anindriya santānam vā nissāya jhāyī jhāyati iti
translated: If he does not meditate by depending on earth, etc., and yet he meditates, then it might be supposed that he meditates by depending on a continuity of being in this world called “the next world,” or by depending on a continuity of being in the next world called “this world,” or by depending on a continuity of being without faculties.

original: āsaṅkanīyattā taṃ pariharanto “na ca imaṃ loka”ntiādimāha. Tattha imaṃ lokanti idhalokasaṅkhāto
analyzed: tam pariharantaḥ na ca imam loka nti ādim āha tattha imam loka nti idha loka saṅkhāto
translated: So, in order to avoid that supposition, he said, “Nor does he meditate depending on this world” . Herein, this world is the continuity of being called “this world” .

original: diṭṭho attabhāvo sattasantāno vutto, tasmiṃ nissāya na jhāyati jhāyī jhāyati ca.🔽Paralokanti idhalokato añño bhavantarasaṅkhāto sattasantāno vutto, tasmiṃ nissāya
analyzed: diṭṭhaḥ atta bhāvaḥ satta santānaḥ vutto tasmin nissāya na jhāyati jhāyī jhāyati ca  paralokam ti idhalokataḥ aññaḥ bhavantara saṅkhāto satta santānaḥ vutto tasmin nissāya
translated: The “self” is a continuity of aggregates of existence. The meditator does not meditate depending on that, and yet he does meditate.

original: na ca jhāyati jhāyī jhāyati ca.
analyzed: na ca jhāyati jhāyī jhāyati ca
translated: The “other world” is a continuity of aggregates of existence in another becoming, other than this one. The meditator does not meditate depending on that, and yet he does meditate.

original: Yamidaṃ ubhayantiādīsu idaṃ ubhayaṃ idhalokaparalokadvayaṃ antarena vajjetvā yaṃ
analyzed: yam idam ubhayanti ādīsu idam ubhayam idha loka para loka dvayam antarena yam
translated: The “both” is the pair consisting of this world and the other world. The meditator does not meditate depending on that, and yet he does meditate.

original: rūpāyatanaṃ diṭṭhaṃ, taṃ rūpāyatanampi. Yaṃ saddāyatanaṃ sutaṃ, taṃ saddāyatanampi.🔽Yaṃ gandhāyatanarasāyatanaphoṭṭhabbāyatanaṃ mutaṃ, taṃ gandhāyatanarasāyatanaphoṭṭhabbāyatanampi.
analyzed: rūpa āyatanam diṭṭham tam rūpa āyatanam pi yam sadda āyatanam sutam tam sadda āyatanam pi  yam gandha āyatana rasa āyatana phoṭṭhabba āyatanam mutam tam gandha āyatana rasa āyatana phoṭṭhabba āyatanam pi
translated: The “visible-data base” is the visible-data base that is seen. The “sound base” is the sound base that is heard.🔽The “odour base,” etc., is the odour base, the flavour base, and the tangible-data base that are sensed.

original: Yaṃ āpodhātu ākāsadhātu lakkhaṇarūpaṃ ojāsaṅkhātaṃ dhammāyatanekadesarūpaṃ viññātaṃ,
analyzed: yam āpodhātu ākāsadhātu lakkhaṇa rūpam ojā saṅkhātam dhammāyatana eka desa rūpam viññātam
translated: The “water element,” etc., is the water element, the fire element, the air element, the space element, the consciousness element, and the “nutriment as physical basis” that is cognized.

original: taṃ āpodhātādikaṃ dhammāyatanekadesarūpampi. Yaṃ vatthu pariyesitaṃ vā apariyesitaṃ
analyzed: tam āpodhāta ādikam dhamma āyatana eka desa rūpam pi yam vatthu pariyesitam vā a pariyesitam
translated: The “physical basis” is the physical basis that is sought or not sought.

original: vā santike pattaṃ, taṃ vatthumpi. Yaṃ vatthu pattaṃ vā appattaṃ vā pariyesitaṃ pariyesanārahaṃ🔽sundaraṃ, taṃ vatthumpi. Yaṃ vatthu vitakkitaṃ vitakkanavasena ālambitabbaṃ, taṃ
analyzed: vā santike pattam tam vatthum pi yam vatthu pattam vā appattam vā pariyesitam pariyesana araham  sundaram tam vatthum pi yam vatthu vitakkitam vitakkana vasena ālambitabbam tam
translated: The site where the object is sought, whether it is the bowl or not, and is worth seeking, is the site of the object.🔽The site where the object is reflected upon, is the site of the object.

original: vatthumpi. Yaṃ vatthu vicāritaṃ anumajjanavasena ālambitabbaṃ, taṃ vatthumpi. Yaṃ
analyzed: vatthum pi yam vatthu vicāritam anumajjana vasena ālambitabbam tam vatthum pi yam
translated: The site where the object is investigated, is the site of the object.

original: vatthu manasā citteneva anucintitaṃ anucintanavasena ālambitabbaṃ, taṃ vatthumpi
analyzed: vatthu manasā cittena iva anucintitam anucintana vasena ālambitabbam tam vatthum pi
translated: The site where the object is mentally considered, is the site of the object.

original: nissāya na jhāyati jhāyī jhāyati cāti yojanā kātabbā.
analyzed: nissāya na jhāyati jhāyī jhāyati ca ati yojanā kātabbā
translated: The interpretation is: “The meditator does not meditate by depending on the site where the bowl is, etc., but the meditator meditates by depending on the site where the bowl is, etc.”

original: Ettha diṭṭhādikaṃ bahiddhārūpameva gahetabbaṃ anindriyabaddharūpassa adhippetattā.
analyzed: ettha diṭṭha ādikam bahiddhā rūpam eva gahetabbam anindriya baddha rūpassa adhippeta ttā
translated: Herein, only external visible data, etc., should be taken, since it is matter not bound up with the faculties that is intended.

original: Tenāha aṭṭhakathācariyo – “tadubhayavinimutto anindriyabaddho rūpasantāno”ti. “Yadi
analyzed: tena āha aṭṭhakathā cariyaḥ tad ubhaya vinimuttaḥ an indriya baddhaḥ yadi
translated: Hence the teacher of the commentary says: “The matter-group not included in either of the two, not bound up with the faculties” .

original: jhāyī puggalo yathāvutte pathavīādayo nissāya na jhāyati jhāyī jhāyati ca, evaṃ sati
analyzed: jhāyī puggalaḥ yathā vutte pathavī ādayaḥ nissāya na jhāyati jhāyī jhāyati ca evam sati
translated: If the meditator does not meditate by depending on the earth kasiṇa, etc., as described, but the meditator meditates by depending on the earth kasiṇa, etc.,🔽then,

original: ayaṃ jhāyī puggalo idaṃ nāma nissāya jhāyatīti loke kenaci ñāyati kiṃ, udāhu na ñāyatī”ti
analyzed: ayam jhāyī puggalaḥ idam nāma nissāya jhāyati iti loke kenaci ñāyati kim udāhu na ñāyati iti
translated: “Is this meditator known to anyone in the world as meditating supported by such and such? ”

original: pucchitabbattā na ñāyatīti dassetuṃ “ayaṃ sadevake loke”tiādimāha. Tattha phalasamāpattijhānena🔽jhāyanto ayaṃ khīṇāsavapuggalo sadevake loke…pe… sadevamanussāya pajāya yattha katthacipi
analyzed: pucchitabba ttā na ñāyati iti dassetum ayam sa devake loke iti ādim āha tattha phala samāpatti jhānena  jhāyantaḥ ayam khīṇāsava puggalo sa devake lokepe sa deva manussāya pajāya yattha katthacipi
translated: In order to show that he is not known, the Master said: “In this world with its gods, etc.” Herein, he meditates by means of the jhāna that is a fruit and the jhāna of the attainment .🔽This person of destroyed taints meditates with a mind that is independent of anything in the world with its gods, etc.,

original: anissitena cittena jhāyatīti sadevake loke…pe… sadevamanussāya pajāya kenaci na ñāyatīti
analyzed: a nissitena cittena jhāyati iti sa devake lokepe sa deva manussāya pajāya kenaci na ñāyati iti
translated: anywhere at all. In the world with its gods, etc., he is not known by anyone as meditating.

original: attho gahetabbo. Tena vuttaṃ –
analyzed: atthaḥ gahetabbaḥ tena vuttam
translated: This is the meaning to be understood. Hence it was said:

original: “Namo te purisājañña, namo te purisuttama;
analyzed: namaḥ te purisājañña namaḥ te purisuttama
translated: “Homage to you, O Visionary of Man, homage to you, O Best of Men,

original: Yassa te nābhijānāma, kiṃ tvaṃ nissāya jhāyasī”ti. ;🔽“Kenaci aviññāyabhāvo kena suttena vibhāvetabbo”ti pucchitabbattā iminā godhikasuttena
analyzed: yassa te na abhijānāma kim tvam nissāya jhāyasi iti  kenaci a viññāya bhāvo kena suttena vibhāvetabbaḥ ti pucchitabbattā iminā godhika suttena
translated: We do not know by what you meditate, supported by what you meditate.”🔽In order to show that the fact that he is not known by anyone should be illustrated by a sutta, the Master said: “Just as Mara, the Evil One, etc.”

original: vibhāvetabboti dassetuṃ “yathā māro pāpimā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana “idāni
analyzed: vibhāvetabbaḥ ti dassetum yathā māro pāpimā tiādi vuttam aṭṭhakathāyam pana idāni
translated: In the Commentary, however, it is said: “Now,

original: khīṇāsavacittassa katthacipi anissitabhāvaṃ godhikasuttena vakkalisuttena ca vibhāvetuṃ🔽‘yathā māro’tiādi vutta”nti vuttaṃ. Tattha dānādipuññakārake, puññe vā māreti nivāretīti
analyzed: khīṇāsava cittassa katthacipi anissita bhāvam godhika suttena vakkali suttena ca vibhāvetum  yathā māra uti ādi vuttanti vuttam tattha dāna ādi puñña kārake puññe vā māreti nivāreti iti
translated: The state of non-dependence of one whose mind is free from cankers is elucidated by the story of Godhika and by the story of Vakkali.

original: māro, attahitaparahite māretīti vā māro. Pāpacittuppādavantatāya pāpimā. Pubbattabhāve
analyzed: māraḥ atta hita para hite māreti iti vā māraḥ pāpa cittuppādavanta tāya pāpimā pubbattabhāve
translated: “As Mara” and so on is said. Herein, he is Mara because he kills merit, or he kills what is beneficial to self and to others. He is a wicked one because he generates wicked thoughts.

original: godhassa ghātakattā “godhiko”ti laddhanāmassa parinibbāyantassa kulaputtassa parinibbānato
analyzed: godhassa ghātaka ttā godhiko ti laddha nāmassa parinibbāyantassa kula puttassa parinibbānato
translated: In a previous existence he was a butcher of cows, and he got the name “Godhika” because of his slaughter of cows. After the clansman’s attainment of final Nibbana,

original: uddhaṃ paṭisandhādi viññāṇaṃ samanvesanto na jānāti na passati. “Paracittajānanako
analyzed: uddham paṭisandhā ādi viññāṇam samanvesantaḥ na jānāti na passati para citta jānanako
translated: Mara, searching for the consciousness of the rebirth-linking that occurred after the death, did not know or see it.

original: māro kasmā na jānātī”ti vattabbattā “so hī”tiādi vuttaṃ. So godhiko hi yasmā papañcātīto,
analyzed: māro kasmā na jānāti iti vattabbattā so hi itiādi vuttam saḥ godhikaḥ hi yasmā papañca atītaḥ
translated: Since it may be asked: “How is it that Mara, who knows the minds of others, does not know? ” it is said: “For he was beyond conceptual elaboration.”

original: tasmā taṇhāpahānena diṭṭhinissayopi assa godhikassa yasmā natthi, tasmā ca na jānātīti.
analyzed: tasmā taṇhā apahānena diṭṭhi nissayaḥ api assa godhikassa yasmā natthi tasmā ca na jānāti iti
translated: For that Godhika was beyond conceptual elaboration, and therefore, because he had abandoned craving, he had no dependence on views either. Therefore, too, he did not know.

original: “Godhikasutteneva vibhāvetabbo”ti pucchitabbattā “yathā cā”tiādi vuttaṃ. “Godhikasuttavakkalisuttehi
analyzed: godhikasuttena iva vibhāvetabbaḥ ti pucchitabba ttā yathā ca atiādi vuttam godhikasutta vakkalisuttehi
translated: “As to how it is to be known that he is not attached to the attainment of cessation, which is without trace left, by the same method as he is not attached to the attainment of cessation with trace left, this is to be done by the method stated in the Godhika Sutta” .

original: anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā anissitabhāvo vibhāvito, evaṃ sati saupādisesanibbānadhātuyā🔽anissitabhāvo kena viññāyatīti attho bhaveyyā”ti vattabbattā tadāpi na viññāyatiyevāti
analyzed: anupādisesāya nibbāna dhātuyāḥ anissita bhāvaḥ vibhāvitaḥ evam sati saupādisesa nibbāna dhātuyāḥ  anissita bhāvaḥ kena viññāyati iti atthaḥ bhaveyya ti vattabbattā tadā api na viññāyati yeva ati
translated: “As to how it is to be known that he is not attached to the attainment of cessation with trace left, by the method stated in the Godhika Sutta and the Vakkali Sutta, so too, as to how it is to be known that he is not attached to the attainment of cessation without trace left, by the method stated in the Godhika Sutta and the Vakkali Sutta, this is to be done by the method stated in the Godhika Sutta” .🔽“As to how it is to be known that he is not attached to the attainment of cessation without trace left, by the method stated in the Godhika Sutta and the Vakkali Sutta, so too, as to how it is to be known that he is not attached to the attainment of cessation with trace left, by the method stated in the Godhika Sutta and the Vakkali Sutta, this is to be done by the method stated in the Godhika Sutta” .

original: dassetuṃ “sadevakena lokenā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha saupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā phalasamāpattijhānena🔽jhāyamānā ime khīṇāsavā katthaci anissitacittā jhāyantīti sadevakena lokena na ñāyanti🔽samārakena…pe… sadevamanussāya na ñāyantīti yojanā kātabbā. Anissitacittā na ñāyantīti
analyzed: dassetum sa devakena lokena atiādi vuttam tattha sa aupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā phala samāpatti jhānena  jhāyamānāḥ ime khīṇāsavā katthaci a nissita cittāḥ jhāyanti iti sa devakena lokena na ñāyanti  sa mārakenape sa deva manussāya na ñāyanti iti yojanā kātabbā anissita cittāḥ na ñāyanti iti
translated: “As to how it is to be known that he is not attached to the attainment of cessation with trace left, by the method stated in the Godhika Sutta and the Vakkali Sutta, so too, as to how it is to be known that he is not attached to the attainment of cessation without trace left, by the method stated in the Godhika Sutta and the Vakkali Sutta, this is to be done by the method stated in the Godhika Sutta” .🔽“As to how it is to be known that he is not attached to the attainment of cessation with trace left, by the method stated in the Godhika Sutta and the Vakkali Sutta, so too, as to how it is to be known that he is not attached to the attainment of cessation without trace left, by the method stated in the Godhika Sutta and the Vakkali Sutta, this is to be done by the method stated in the Godhika Sutta” .

original: ettha hi na-kāro ca “jhāyamānā”ti pade na sambandhitabbo “na jhāyamānā”ti atthassa
analyzed: ettha hi nakāraḥ ca jhāyamānā iti pade na sambandhitabbaḥ na jhāyamānā iti atthassa
translated: “As to how it is to be known that he is not attached to the attainment of cessation without trace left, by the method stated in the Godhika Sutta and the Vakkali Sutta, so too, as to how it is to be

original: sambhavato. “Na ñāyantī”ti pana sambandhitabbo heṭṭhā aṭṭhakathāyaṃ eva “loke kenacipi🔽na ñāyatī”ti vuttattā. Ayaṃ desanāsandhīti godhikasuttavakkalisuttānaṃ aññamaññaṃ🔽atthavasena saṃsandanā niddhāritā viya “na ca pathaviṃ nissāyā”tiādidesanāya ca “na🔽ca imaṃ loka”ntiādidesanāya ca yāya desanāya atthavasena saṃsandanā niddhāritā, tāya
analyzed: sambhavataḥ na ñāyanti iti pana sambandhitabbaḥ heṭṭhā aṭṭhakathā ayam eva loke kenacipi  na ñāyati iti vutta ttā ayam desanā sandhi iti godhikasutta vakkalisuttānam aññamaññam  attha vasena saṃsandanā niddhāritāḥ viya na ca pathavim nissāya ati ādi desanāya ca na  ca imam ca yāya desanāya attha vasena saṃsandanā niddhāritā tāya
translated: “Not known by anyone in the world” is to be construed with “not known” above. This is the connection between the teachings. The connection between the teachings of the Godhika Sutta and the Vakkali Sutta is as if it were pointed out: “The meaning of the one is the meaning of the other.” The connection between the teaching beginning, “Not depending on the earth” and the teaching beginning, “Not on this world” is as if it were pointed out: “The meaning of the one is the meaning of the other.”

original: desanāya yattha katthaci yaṃ kiñci nissāya jhāyī na jhāyati, nibbānaṃ nissāya jhāyī🔽jhāyatīti atthavasena niddhāritā, ayaṃ saṃsandanā desanāsandhi nāmāti attho gahetabbo.
analyzed: desanāya yattha katthaci yam kiñci nissāya jhāyī na jhāyati nibbānam nissāya jhāyī  jhāyati iti attha vasena niddhāritā ayam saṃsandanā desanā sandhi nāma ati atthaḥ gahetabbo
translated: “From the possible” . But “not known” should be construed with the following passage in the commentary below, which explains: “not known by anyone in the world” . This is the “connection of teaching” . The connection of meaning between the Godhika Sutta and the Vakkali Sutta is as if demonstrated by the words “and not depending on the earth” and so on in the former sutta and the words “and not on this world” and so on in the latter sutta. The meaning of the former sutta is demonstrated by the words “and not depending on anything” and so on in the latter sutta. The meaning of the latter sutta is demonstrated by the words “and not depending on anything” and so on in the former sutta. The meditator does not meditate depending on anything in any way. The meditator meditates depending on Nibbāna. This is the “connection of teaching” .

original: Desanāsandhi ācariyena vibhattā, amhehi ca ñātā, “katamā niddesasandhī”ti pucchitabbattā
analyzed: desanā sandhi ācariyena vibhattā amhehi ca ñātā katamā niddesa sandhi iti pucchitabbattā
translated: The connection of teaching has been demonstrated by the teacher and understood by us. Since the question “What is the connection of indication?” should be asked,

original: “tattha katamā niddesasandhīti nissitacittā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha tatthāti tesu catūsu
analyzed: tattha katamā niddesa sandhi iti nissita citta atiādi vuttam tattha tattha ati tesu catūsu
translated: “Herein, what is the connection of indication? ‘With a mind that is dependent’ ” and so on is said. Herein, “herein” refers to the four

original: atthasandhibyañjanasandhidesanāsandhiniddesasandhīsu yā sandhi “niddesasandhī”ti
analyzed: attha sandhi byañjana sandhi desanā sandhi niddesa sandhīsu yā sandhi niddesa sandhī iti
translated: He asks the question, “What is the meaning of the word ‘dependent’ in the phrase ‘dependent origination’?”🔽The meaning is this: “The dependent origination that is stated in the four ways as the meaning-connected, the phrasing-connected, the teaching-connected, and the explanation-connected,

original: uddiṭṭhā, sā niddesato katamāti pucchatīti attho. Nissitacittāti taṇhādiṭṭhisahajātavasena
analyzed: uddiṭṭhā sā niddesato katamā ati pucchati iti attho nissita cittā ti taṇhā diṭṭhi sahajāta vasena
translated: among these four kinds of dependent origination, the explanation-connected dependent origination is stated in the phrase ‘dependent origination.’ What is the meaning of the word ‘explanation’ in the phrase ‘explanation-connected dependent origination’?”

original: vā upanissayavasena vā nissitaṃ cittaṃ yesaṃ puthujjanānanti nissitacittā, puthujjanā
analyzed: vā upanissaya vasena vā nissitam cittam yesam puthujjanānam ti nissita cittā puthujjanā
translated: Those who have a dependent mind are called “those who have a dependent mind.” They are ordinary people who have a mind that is dependent through being accompanied by craving and views,

original: puggalā niddisitabbā imāya desanāya puggalādhiṭṭhānattā. Yadi desanā dhammādhiṭṭhānā,
analyzed: puggalāḥ niddisitabbāḥ imāya desanāya puggala adhiṭṭhāna ttā yadi desanā dhamma adhiṭṭhānā
translated: or through being a condition by the way of decisive support. They are ordinary people, individuals who are to be shown by this teaching, because this teaching is based on individuals.

original: evaṃ sati nissitaṃ cittaṃ ettha suttappadesesu desitanti nissitacittā nissitacittajānanatthāya🔽desitā suttappadesā. Anissitaṃ cittaṃ yesaṃ ariyapuggalānanti anissitacittā, ariyapuggalā
analyzed: evam sati nissitam cittam ettha sutta ppadesesu desitan ti nissita cittāḥ nissita citta jānana tthāya  desitā sutta ppadesā anissitam cittam yesam ariya puggalānam anissita cittāḥ ariya puggalā
translated: If the teaching is based on dhammas, then the dependent mind is taught in the passages of the suttas. Therefore, those who have a dependent mind are the passages of the suttas that are taught for the purpose of knowing the dependent mind.

original: niddisitabbā imāya desanāya puggalādhiṭṭhānattā. Dhammādhiṭṭhānāya pana anissitaṃ
analyzed: niddisitabbā imāya desanāya puggala adhiṭṭhāna ttā dhamma adhiṭṭhānāya pana anissitam
translated: Those who have an independent mind are called “those who have an independent mind.” They are noble individuals who are to be shown by this teaching, because this teaching is based on individuals. But if the teaching is based on dhammas, then the independent mind is taught in the passages of the suttas.🔽Therefore, those who have an independent mind are the passages of the suttas that are taught for the purpose of knowing the independent mind.

original: cittaṃ yattha suttappadesesu desitanti anissitacittā, anissitacittajānanatthāya desitā suttappadesā.
analyzed: cittam yattha sutta ppadesesu desitanti anissita cittā anissita citta jānana thāya desitā sutta ppadesā
translated: “The mind that is taught in the passages of the suttas” is the unattached mind. The passages of the suttas are taught for the purpose of knowing the unattached mind.

original: “Nissitacittā kena niddesena niddisitabbā, anissitacittā kena niddesena niddisitabbā”ti
analyzed: nissita cittā kena niddesena niddisitabbā anissita cittā kena niddesena niddisitabbā ati
translated: “By what description should the attached mind be described? By what description should the unattached mind be described?”

original: pucchitabbattā “nissitacittā akusalapakkhena niddisitabbā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Akusalapakkhena
analyzed: pucchitabba ttā nissita cittā akusala pakkhena niddisitabbā atiādi vuttam akusala pakkhena
translated: Because this must be asked, it is said: “The attached mind should be described by the description of the unprofitable side.”

original: niddesena niddisitabbā. Kusalapakkhenātiādīsupi esa nayo yojetabbo. Akusalapakkhasāmaññakusalapakkhasāmaññehi
analyzed: niddesena niddisitabbā kusala pakkhena ati ādīsu pi esa nayaḥ yojetabbaḥ akusala pakkha sāmañña kusala pakkha sāmaññehi
translated: It should be described by the description of the unprofitable side. The same method should be applied in the case of the profitable side, etc.

original: dassetvā akusalavisesakusalavisesehi dassetuṃ “nissitacittā saṃkilesenā”tiādi vuttaṃ.🔽Ayaṃ niddesasandhīti akusalapakkhādikassa purimaniddesassa saṃkilesādikena pacchimena
analyzed: dassetvā akusala visesa kusala visesehi dassetum nissita cittā saṃkilesena ātiādi vuttam  ayam niddesa sandhi iti akusala pakkha ādikassa purima niddesassa saṃkilesa ādikena pacchimena
translated: Having shown it by the common characteristics of the unprofitable side and the profitable side, in order to show it by the specific characteristics of the unprofitable and the profitable, it is said: “The attached mind by defilement” and so on.🔽This is the “link of description” : after showing the attached mind by the common characteristics of the unprofitable side, etc., in order to show it by the specific characteristics of the unprofitable and the profitable, the latter description by defilement, etc.,

original: niddesena nissitacittavasena ayaṃ saṃsandanā ca niddesasandhi nāma. Kusalapakkhādikassa
analyzed: niddesena nissita citta vasena ayam saṃsandanā ca niddesa sandhi nāma kusala pakkha ādikassa
translated: is linked to the former description by the unprofitable side, etc. This is called the “link of description.”🔽After showing the unattached mind by the common characteristics of the profitable side, etc., in order to show it by the specific characteristics of the profitable and the unprofitable, the latter description by purification, etc.,🔽is linked to the former description by the profitable side, etc.

original: purimassa niddesassa vodānādikena pacchimena niddesena anissitacittavasena ayaṃ saṃsandanā
analyzed: purimassa niddesassa vodāna ādikena pacchimena niddesena anissita citta vasena ayam saṃsandanā
translated: The linking of the first description with the second, which begins with “purification,” is by way of the mind that is independent.

original: ca niddesasandhi nāmāti vibhajitvā veditabbā.
analyzed: ca niddesa sandhi nāma ati vibhajitvā veditabbā
translated: The connection of the first description with the second description beginning with “purification” should be understood as follows:

original: “Catubyūhahārassa neruttamadhippāyanidānapubbāparasandhippabhedena ceva atthabyañjanasandhiniddesasandhidesanāsandhippabhedena
analyzed: catu byūha hārassa neruttama adhippāya nidāna pubba apara sandhi ppabhedena ca iva attha byañjana sandhi niddesa sandhi desanā sandhi ppabhedena
translated: The first description is the description of the fourfold arrangement, and the second description is the description of the connection of meaning and phrasing.

original: ca vibhajitabbabhāvo kena amhehi jānitabbo saddahitabbo”ti vattabbabhāvato “tenāhā”tiādi
analyzed: ca vibhajitabba bhāvaḥ kena amhehi jānitabbaḥ saddahitabbaḥ iti vattabba bhāvataḥ tena āha atiādi
translated: “By whom should the fact that the fourfold arrangement is to be analyzed in this way be known and believed?”—because this question should be asked, the words “Therefore it was said” are stated.

original: vuttaṃ. Tattha tena tathā vibhajitabbabhāvena āyasmā mahākaccāno “neruttamadhippāyo”tiādikaṃ
analyzed: vuttam tattha tena tathā vibhajitabba bhāvena āyasmā mahākaccānaḥ
translated: Herein, the venerable elder Mahākaccāna said the words beginning with “The chief purport of the utterance” in order to show that the fourfold arrangement is to be analyzed in this way.

original: yaṃ vacanaṃ āha, tena vacanena tumhehi catubyūhahārassa tathā vibhajitabbabhāvo jānitabbo🔽saddahitabboti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: yam vacanam āha tena vacanena tumhehi catu byūha hārassa tathā vibhajitabba bhāvaḥ jānitabbaḥ  saddahitabbaḥ iti vuttam hoti
translated: By that statement it is said that by you the fact that the fourfold arrangement is to be analyzed in this way should be known and believed.

original: “Ettāvatā ca catubyūhahāro paripuṇṇo, añño niyutto natthī”ti vattabbattā “niyutto
analyzed: ettāvatā ca catu byūha hāraḥ paripuṇṇaḥ aññaḥ niyutto natthi iti vattabbattā niyuttaḥ
translated: “And by this much the fourfold arrangement is fulfilled; there is no other arrangement to be made.”—because this should be said, the words “The arrangement” are stated.

original: catubyūho hāro”ti vuttaṃ. Tattha yassaṃ yassaṃ pāḷiyaṃ yo yo catubbidho, so so catubyūhahāro🔽ca yathālābhavasena yojito, tassaṃ tassaṃ pāḷiyaṃ so so catubbidho catubyūhahāro
analyzed: catu byūhaḥ hāraḥ ti vuttam tattha yassam yassam pāḷiyam yaḥ yaḥ catubbidhaḥ saḥ so catu byūha hāro  ca yathā lābha vasena yojitaḥ tassam tassam pāḷiyam saḥ saḥ catubbidhaḥ catu byūha hāro
translated: Herein, the fourfold Guide-Line that is stated in each instance is the fourfold Array Guide-Line🔽in each instance, and it is applied according to the way in which it is found.

original: tathā niddhāretvā yutto yojitoti attho daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: tathā niddhāretvā yuttaḥ yojitaḥ iti atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: So the meaning should be regarded as follows: “The fourfold Array Guide-Line is extracted and applied in each instance in the way stated.”

original: Iti catubyūhahāravibhaṅge sattibalānurūpā racitā
analyzed: iti catu byūha hāra vibhaṅge satti bala anurūpā racitā
translated: Thus the fourfold Array Guide-Line is composed in accordance with the strength of the knife.

original: Vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The analysis is ended.

original: Paṇḍitehi pana aṭṭhakathāṭīkānusārena gambhīrattho vitthārato vibhajitvā gahetabboti.
analyzed: paṇḍitehi pana aṭṭhakathā ṭīkā anusārena gambhīra atthaḥ vitthārataḥ vibhajitvā gahetabbaḥ ti
translated: But it should be taken in detail with deep meaning by the wise in accordance with the Commentary and Subcommentary.

original: 7. Āvaṭṭahāravibhaṅgavibhāvanā
analyzed: āvaṭṭa hāra vibhaṅga vibhāvanā
translated: The analysis of the Revolving Guide-Line

original: 29. Yena yena saṃvaṇṇanāvisesabhūtena catubyūhahāravibhaṅgena neruttādayo vibhattā,🔽so…pe… catubyūhahāravibhaṅgo paripuṇṇo, “katamo āvaṭṭo hāravibhaṅgo”ti pucchitabbattā
analyzed: yena yena saṃvaṇṇanā visesa bhūtena catu byūha hāra vibhaṅgena nerutta ādayaḥ vibhattā  catu byūha hāra vibhaṅgo paripuṇṇo katamaḥ āvaṭṭaḥ hāra vibhaṅgo ti pucchitabba ttā
translated: By means of which fourfold Array Guide-Line, which is a particular kind of commentary, Nerutta and the others were analysed,🔽that fourfold Array Guide-Line is completed. “What is the Revolving Guide-Line?” should be asked.

original: tattha katamo āvaṭṭo hāro”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha tatthāti tesu niddiṭṭhesu soḷasasu
analyzed: tattha katamaḥ āvaṭṭaḥ hāro ti ādi vuttam tattha tattha ati tesu niddiṭṭhesu soḷasasu
translated: So “Herein, what is the Revolving Guide-Line?” is said. Herein, there is the fourfold Array Guide-Line stated in each instance.

original: desanāhārādīsu katamo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso āvaṭṭo hāro āvaṭṭahāravibhaṅgo nāmāti pucchati.
analyzed: desanā hāra ādīsu katamaḥ saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ āvaṭṭaḥ hāraḥ āvaṭṭa hāra vibhaṅgaḥ nāma ati pucchati
translated: What is the special kind of exposition called the Mode of Conveying a Reversal?🔽The special kind of exposition that I am now going to give, beginning with the words “Now, when the words ‘in a single context’ are stated” is called the Mode of Conveying a Reversal.

original: “Ekamhi padaṭṭhāne”ntiādiniddesassa idāni mayā vuccamāno “ārambhathā”tiādiko vitthārasaṃvaṇṇanāviseso
analyzed: ekamhi padaṭṭhāne nti ādi niddesassa idāni mayā vuccamānaḥ vitthāra saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ
translated: “Therein, when the teaching is in a single context,🔽he seeks the rest of the context that is not taught, and having sought it, he reverses it in the opposite way.”

original: āvaṭṭahāravibhaṅgo nāmāti gahito. “Tattha desanāyaṃ ekasmiṃ padaṭṭhāne desanāruḷhe
analyzed: āvaṭṭahāra vibhaṅgaḥ nāma ati gahitaḥ tattha desanā ayam ekasmim padaṭṭhāne desanā āruḷhe
translated: “Now, when the words ‘in a single context’ are stated,

original: sesakaṃ padaṭṭhānaṃ pariyesati, pariyesitvā kathaṃ paṭipakkhe āvaṭṭetī”ti vattabbattā –
analyzed: sesakam padaṭṭhānam pariyesati pariyesitvā katham paṭipakkhe āvaṭṭeti iti vattabbattā
translated: he seeks the rest of the context that is not taught, and having sought it, he reverses it in the opposite way.”🔽“Now, when the words ‘in a single context’ are stated,🔽he seeks the rest of the context that is not taught, and having sought it, he reverses it in the opposite way.”🔽“Now, when the words ‘in a single context’ are stated,🔽he seeks the rest of the context that is not taught, and having sought it, he reverses it in the opposite way.”

original: “Ārambhatha nikkamatha, yuñjatha buddhasāsane;
analyzed: ārambhatha nikkamatha yuñjatha buddha sāsane
translated: “Now, when the words ‘in a single context’ are stated,

original: Dhunātha maccuno senaṃ, naḷāgāraṃva kuñjaro”ti. –
analyzed: dhunātha maccunaḥ senam
translated: he seeks the rest of the context that is not taught, and having sought it, he reverses it in the opposite way.”🔽“Now, when the words ‘in a single context’ are stated,🔽he seeks the rest of the context that is not taught, and having sought it, he reverses it in the opposite way.”🔽“Now, when the words ‘in a single context’ are stated,

original: Gāthā vuttā. Idha gāthāyaṃ ekasmiṃ padaṭṭhāne desanāruḷhe sesakaṃ padaṭṭhānaṃ pariyesatīti vuttaṃ hoti. Gāthāttho pana aṭṭhakathāyaṃ vutto.🔽“Ārambhathā’tiādigāthāyaṃ katarasmiṃ padaṭṭhāne desanāruḷhe katamaṃ sesakaṃ padaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: gāthā vuttā idha gāthāyam ekasmin padaṭṭhāne desanā āruḷhe sesakam padaṭṭhānam pariyesati iti vuttam hoti gāthā atthaḥ pana aṭṭhakathāyam vutto 🔽katarasmim padaṭṭhāne desanā āruḷhe katamam sesakam padaṭṭhānam
translated: he seeks the rest of the context that is not taught, and having sought it, he reverses it in the opposite way.”

original: pariyesatī”ti vattabbattā “ārambhatha nikkamathāti vīriyassa padaṭṭhāna”ntiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: pariyesati iti vattabbattā ārambhatha nikkamatha ati vīriyassa padaṭṭhāna ntiādi vuttam
translated: “One should seek the basis for energy” is said, and so it is said: “Begin, strive, etc., is the basis for energy.”

original: Tattha “vīriyassa padaṭṭhāna”nti sāmaññavasena vuttampi ārambhadhātusaṅkhātaṃ vīriyaṃ
analyzed: tattha vīriyassa padaṭṭhānam ti sāmañña vasena vuttam pi ārambha dhātu saṅkhātam vīriyam
translated: Herein, “the basis for energy” is said in a general way, but the energy called the “beginning”🔽is the basis for the energy called “striving,” and the energy called “striving” is the basis for the energy called “endeavour,”

original: nikkamadhātusaṅkhātassa vīriyassa padaṭṭhānaṃ, nikkamadhātusaṅkhātaṃ vīriyaṃ parakkamadhātusaṅkhātassa
analyzed: nikkama dhātu saṅkhātassa vīriyassa padaṭṭhānam nikkama dhātu saṅkhātam vīriyam parakkama dhātu saṅkhātassa
translated: and the energy called “endeavour” is the basis for the energy accompanied by the development of serenity, etc.,🔽and so it should be taken as “one should seek.” The energy accompanied by the development of serenity, etc.,

original: vīriyassa padaṭṭhānaṃ, parakkamadhātusaṅkhātaṃ vīriyaṃ samathabhāvanāsahitassa vīriyassa
analyzed: vīriyassa padaṭṭhānam parakkama dhātu saṅkhātam vīriyam samatha bhāvanā sahitassa vīriyassa
translated: which is said by the words “apply yourselves,” is the basis for the high-born concentration said by the words “in the Dispensation of the Buddha,”🔽and the rest of the basis, which is not mentioned in the text, should be sought.🔽The energy accompanied by the development of serenity, etc.,

original: padaṭṭhānantiādinā pariyesitabbanti gahetabbaṃ. “Yuñjathā”ti iminā vuttaṃ samathabhāvanāsahitaṃ
analyzed: padaṭṭhāna nti ādinā pariyesitabbanti gahetabbam yuñjatha iti iminā vuttam samatha bhāvanā sahitam
translated: which is said by the words “apply yourselves,” is the basis for the high-born concentration said by the words “in the Dispensation of the Buddha,”🔽and the rest of the basis, which is not mentioned in the text, should be sought.🔽The energy accompanied by the development of serenity, etc.,

original: vīriyaṃ “buddhasāsane”ti iminā vuttassa mahaggatasamādhissa padaṭṭhānaṃ, desanāruḷhaṃ
analyzed: vīriyam buddha sāsane ti iminā vuttassa mahaggata samādhissa padaṭṭhānam desanā ruḷham
translated: which is said by the words “apply yourselves,” is the basis for the high-born concentration said by the words “in the Dispensation of the Buddha,”

original: sukhādikaṃ sesakampi padaṭṭhānaṃ pariyesitabbaṃ. “Dhunātha maccuno sena”nti padena
analyzed: sukha ādikam sesakam pi padaṭṭhānam pariyesitabbam dhunātha maccunaḥ senan ti padena
translated: and the rest of the basis, which is not mentioned in the text, should be sought.

original: gahitaṃ vipassanāsahitaṃ vīriyaṃ kilesadhunane samatthāya paññāya padaṭṭhānaṃ, desanāruḷhaṃ
analyzed: gahitam vipassanā sahitam vīriyam kilesa dhunane samatthāya paññāya padaṭṭhānam desanā ruḷham
translated: The energy accompanied by insight is the footing for the understanding that is able to crush the defilements.

original: samādhiādikaṃ sesakampi padaṭṭhānaṃ pariyesitabbaṃ.
analyzed: samādhi ādikam sesakam pi padaṭṭhānam pariyesitabbam
translated: The rest beginning with concentration should be sought as the teaching.

original: “Yadi ‘ārambhathā’tiādikaṃ vuttaṃ vīriyaṃ sāmaññabhūtānaṃ vīriyasamādhipaññānaṃyeva
analyzed: yadi vuttam vīriyam sāmañña bhūtānam vīriya samādhi paññānam yeva
translated: “If the energy spoken of in the passage beginning ‘Begin! Strive!’ is the footing only for the energy, concentration and understanding that are common to all three vehicles,🔽then how can it lead to the ending of the round of rebirths by cutting its root?”

original: padaṭṭhānaṃ siyā, evaṃ sati kathaṃ vaṭṭamūlaṃ chinditvā vivaṭṭaṃ pāpessantī”ti vattabbattā
analyzed: padaṭṭhānam siyā evam sati katham vaṭṭa mūlam chinditvā vivaṭṭam pāpessanti iti vattabbattā
translated: In order to answer this question,

original: puna “ārambhatha nikkamathāti vīriyindriyassa padaṭṭhāna”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Ādhipaccakiccatāya
analyzed: punar ārambhatha nikkamatha ati vīriya indriyassa padaṭṭhāna ntiādi vuttam ādhi pacca kiccatāya
translated: the passage beginning “Begin! Strive! is the footing for the faculty of energy” is stated.

original: yuttassāpi vīriyādhikassa padaṭṭhānattā ārabhantā yogāvacarapuggalā vaṭṭamūlaṃ chinditvā🔽vivaṭṭaṃ pāpentīti vuttaṃ hoti. “Ārambhathā”tiādikā pana yasmā vīriyārambhavatthuādidesanā
analyzed: yuttassa api vīriya adhikassa padaṭṭhāna ttāḥ ārabhantā yogāvacara puggalāḥ vaṭṭa mūlam chinditvā  vivaṭṭam pāpenti iti vuttam hoti ārambhatha ati ādikā pana yasmā vīriya ārambha vatthu ādi desanā
translated: Although energy is the footing for the faculty of concentration, which is the root of the round of rebirths,🔽it is said that those who begin and strive cut the root of the round of rebirths and lead to its ending because it is the footing for the energy that is the predominant factor in the act of cutting the root.🔽But since the teaching in the passage beginning “Begin! Strive!” is the subject of the beginning of energy, etc.,

original: hoti, tasmā ārambhavatthuādīniyeva saṃvaṇṇitāni padaṭṭhānanti codanaṃ manasi katvā
analyzed: hoti tasmai codanam manasi katvā
translated: the subject of the beginning of energy, etc., are commended as the footing.

original: āha “imāni padaṭṭhānāni desanā”ti. “Ārambhathā”tiādikā yathāvuttapadaṭṭhānāni desanā
analyzed: āha imāni padaṭṭhānāni desanā ati yathā vutta padaṭṭhānāni desanā
translated: He said: “The bases are the teaching.” The teaching beginning with “Make an effort” is the bases as already stated,

original: hoti, na vīriyārambhavatthuādīni, tasmā padaṭṭhānaṃyeva saṃvaṇṇitanti daṭṭhabbaṃ.🔽Evaṃ “ārambhathā”tiādidesanāya padaṭṭhānavasena attho vibhatto, amhehi ca ñāto, “kathaṃ🔽tassāyeva desanāya paṭipakkhavasena attho vibhajitabbo”ti vattabbattā “ayuñjantānaṃ
analyzed: hoti na vīriya ārambha vatthu ādīni tasmā padaṭṭhānaṃ yeva saṃvaṇṇitan ti daṭṭhabbam  evam padaṭṭhāna vasena atthaḥ vibhattaḥ amhehi ca ñātaḥ katham  tassāya eva desanāya paṭipakkha vasena atthaḥ vibhajitabbaḥ iti vattabba ttā ayuñjantānam
translated: not the grounds for the arising of energy, etc., and so on. So it should be understood that only the bases are commended.

original: vā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha yoge bhāvanāyaṃ ayuñjantānaṃ sattānaṃ aparipakkañāṇānaṃ yoge🔽yogahetu vāsanābhāgiyavasena āyatiṃ jānanatthāya “ārambhathā”tiādidesanā āraddhā.
analyzed: vā ti ādi vuttam tattha yoge bhāvanāyam ayuñjantānam sattānam aparipakka ñāṇānam yoge
translated: The meaning of the teaching beginning with “Make an effort” has been analysed by way of the bases and is known to us. Now, in order to show how the meaning of that same teaching should be analysed by way of its opposite, it is said: “For those who do not make an effort,” and so on. Herein, the teaching beginning with “Make an effort” was begun for the purpose of knowing in the future by way of the cause of union, the cause of energy, the cause of non-remorse, the cause of delight, the cause of rapture, the cause of tranquillity, the cause of happiness, the cause of concentration, the cause of knowledge, and the cause of insight, for those beings whose knowledge is not yet ripe and who do not make an effort in the practice of meditation.

original: Yuñjantānaṃ paripakkañāṇānaṃ sattānaṃ ārambhe ārambhahetu diṭṭheva dhamme parijānanatthāya🔽“ārambhathā”tiādidesanā āraddhā.
analyzed: yuñjantānam paripakka ñāṇānam sattānam ārambhe ārambha hetu diṭṭhe iva dhamme parijānana tthāya 🔽āraddhā
translated: The teaching beginning with “Make an effort” was begun for the purpose of knowing in this very life by way of the cause of union, the cause of energy, the cause of non-remorse, the cause of delight, the cause of rapture, the cause of tranquillity, the cause of happiness, the cause of concentration, the cause of knowledge, and the cause of insight, for those beings whose knowledge is already ripe and who make an effort.

original: Tattha tesu yuñjantāyuñjantesu paripakkāparipakkañāṇesu ye aparipakkañāṇā sattā na🔽yuñjanti, te aparipakkañāṇā sattā pamādamūlakā hutvā yoge bhāvanāyaṃ yena pamādena
analyzed: tattha tesu yuñjanta a yuñjantesu paripakka a paripakka ñāṇesu ye a paripakka ñāṇāḥ sattāḥ na  yuñjanti te a paripakka ñāṇā sattā pamāda mūlakā hutvā yoge yena pamādena
translated: Herein, as to those who are and are not devoted to meditation, and whose knowledge is and is not ripe, those beings whose knowledge is not ripe

original: na yuñjanti, so pamādo taṇhāmūlako pamādo, avijjāmūlako pamādoti dubbidho hoti. Tattha
analyzed: na yuñjanti saḥ pamādaḥ taṇhā mūlako pamādaḥ avijjā mūlako pamādaḥ ti dubbidhaḥ hoti tattha
translated: are not devoted to meditation. They are devoted to meditation owing to negligence. The negligence by which they are not devoted to meditation is negligence rooted in craving and negligence rooted in ignorance. It is hard to see.

original: tasmiṃ dubbidhe pamāde aññāṇena nivuto avijjāmūlako satto yena pamādena ñeyyaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: tasmin dubbidhe pamāde aññāṇena nivutaḥ avijjā mūlakaḥ satto yena pamādena ñeyya ṭṭhānam
translated: Herein, the being whose negligence is hard to see is obscured by ignorance. He is negligent by which negligence he does not understand the object of knowledge thus:

original: “ime uppādavayadhammā pañcakkhandhā ñeyyaṭṭhānaṃ nāmā”ti nappajānāti, ayaṃ aññāṇahetuko🔽pamādo avijjāmūlako pamādā nāma. Yo pamādo taṇhāmūlako, so pamādo tividho anuppannānaṃ🔽bhogānaṃ uppādāya pariyesanto taṇhiko satto yaṃ pamādaṃ āpajjati, ayaṃ pamādo ca,
analyzed: ime uppāda vaya dhammā pañca kkhandhāḥ ñeyya ṭṭhānam nāma ati na ppajānāti ayam aññāṇa hetuko  pamādaḥ avijjā mūlako pamādāḥ nāma yo pamādo taṇhā mūlako so pamādaḥ tividhaḥ anuppannānam  bhogānam uppādāya pariyesantaḥ taṇhikaḥ satto yam pamādam āpajjati ayam pamādaḥ ca
translated: “The five aggregates as objects of clinging, which are subject to arising and falling, are called the object of knowledge.” This negligence rooted in ignorance is due to unknowing.🔽The negligence rooted in craving is threefold. The being who is greedy for gain not yet arisen seeks it. The negligence he falls into is negligence due to craving.

original: uppannānaṃ bhogānaṃ ṭhitatthāya rakkhanto taṇhiko satto ārakkhanimittaṃ yaṃ pamādaṃ
analyzed: uppannānam bhogānam ṭhita tthāya rakkhantaḥ taṇhikaḥ satto ārakkha nimittam yam pamādam
translated: The being who is greedy for gain already arisen guards it. The negligence he falls into is negligence due to craving.

original: āpajjati, ayaṃ pamādo ca, ṭhitaṃ bhogaṃ paribhuñjanto taṇhiko satto paribhoganimittaṃ
analyzed: āpajjati ayam pamādaḥ ca ṭhitam bhogam paribhuñjantaḥ taṇhikaḥ sattaḥ paribhoga nimittam
translated: and the being who is greedy for the enjoyment of the wealth he has already got and who falls into negligence in the way stated is negligent in the enjoyment of the wealth he has already got.

original: yaṃ pamādaṃ āpajjati, ayaṃ pamādo cāti tividho hoti. Iti loke ayaṃ pamādo catubbidho
analyzed: yam pamādam āpajjati ayam pamādaḥ ca ati tividhaḥ hoti iti loke ayam pamādaḥ catubbidho
translated: This is the three-fold negligence. So this negligence is fourfold in the world.

original: avijjāpadaṭṭhāno ekavidho pamādo, taṇhāpadaṭṭhāno tividho pamādoti catubbidho hoti.
analyzed: avijjā padaṭṭhāno ekavidhaḥ pamādo taṇhā padaṭṭhāno tividhaḥ pamādo ti catubbidhaḥ hoti
translated: This negligence is of one kind as having ignorance for its footing and it is fourfold as having craving for its footing.

original: Tattha tāsu avijjātaṇhāsu nāmakāyo phassādināmasamūho avijjāya padaṭṭhānaṃ, rūpakāyo
analyzed: tattha tāsu avijjā taṇhāsu nāma kāyaḥ phassa ādi nāma samūhaḥ avijjāya padaṭṭhānam rūpa kāyo
translated: Herein, the mental body, which is a collection of such things as contact, is the footing for ignorance,

original: pathavīādirūpasamūho taṇhāya padaṭṭhānaṃ hoti. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – ārambhadhātunikkamadhātusaṅkhātassa
analyzed: pathavī ādi rūpa samūhaḥ taṇhāya padaṭṭhānam hoti idam vuttam hoti ārambha dhātu nikkama dhātu saṅkhātassa
translated: and the material body, which is a collection of such things as earth, is the footing for craving. This is what is meant:

original: vīriyassa paṭipakkho catubbidho pamādo niddhāretabbo, niddhāretvā ekavidhassa pamādassa
analyzed: vīriyassa paṭipakkho catubbidhaḥ pamādaḥ niddhāretabbaḥ niddhāretvā ekavidhassa pamādassa
translated: the fourfold negligence, which is the opposite of the energy called the “departure element” and the “effort element,”🔽should be defined. After defining it, the negligence of one kind should be defined as having ignorance for its footing

original: avijjā padaṭṭhānaṃ, tividhassa pamādassa taṇhā padaṭṭhānaṃ. Avijjāya nāmakāyo padaṭṭhānaṃ,
analyzed: avijjā padaṭṭhānam tividhassa pamādassa taṇhā padaṭṭhānam avijjāya nāmakāyo padaṭṭhānam
translated: and the negligence of three kinds as having craving for its footing. The mental body is the footing for ignorance,

original: taṇhāya rūpakāyo padaṭṭhānanti paṭipakkhe āvaṭṭetvā padaṭṭhānaṃ pariyesitabbanti.
analyzed: taṇhāya rūpa kāyaḥ padaṭṭhānanti paṭipakkhe āvaṭṭetvā padaṭṭhānam pariyesitabbanti
translated: The form body is the footing for craving. The opposite should be brought in and the footing sought for.

original: “Kasmā nāmakāyo avijjāya padaṭṭhānaṃ bhavati, rūpakāyo taṇhāya padaṭṭhānaṃ bhavatī”ti
analyzed: kasmā nāma kāyaḥ avijjāya padaṭṭhānam bhavati rūpa kāyaḥ taṇhāya padaṭṭhānam bhavati iti
translated: Why is the name body the footing for ignorance and the form body the footing for craving?

original: pucchitabbattā “taṃ kissa hetū”ti pucchitvā “rūpīsu bhavesu ajjhosānaṃ, arūpīsu sammoho”ti🔽vuttaṃ. Rūpīsu bhavesu rūpadhammesu ahaṃmamādivasena ajjhosānaṃ taṇhābhiniveso sattesu
analyzed: pucchitabba ttā tam kissa hetu uti pucchitvā rūpīsu bhavesu ajjhosānam arūpīsu sammoho ti  vuttam rūpīsu bhavesu rūpa dhammesu ahaṃ mama ādi vasena ajjhosānam taṇhā abhinivesaḥ sattesu
translated: Because this question has to be asked, the question “Why is that?” is asked.🔽The answer is given in the words “Clinging to the kinds of becoming consisting of form, and confusion about the formless.”

original: patiṭṭhito yasmā hoti, tasmā rūpakāyo taṇhāya padaṭṭhānaṃ bhavati. Anamatagge hi
analyzed: patiṭṭhitaḥ yasmai hoti tasmai rūpa kāyaḥ taṇhāya padaṭṭhānam bhavati a nama tagge hi
translated: Clinging to the kinds of becoming consisting of form, that is, to the form states, by taking them as “I” and “mine,” is the establishment of craving in beings.

original: saṃsāre itthipurisā aññamaññarūpābhirāmā bhavanti. Arūpīsu phassādīsu sukhumabhāvato🔽sammoho sattesu patiṭṭhito yasmā hoti, tasmā nāmakāyo avijjāya padaṭṭhānaṃ bhavatīti
analyzed: saṃsāre itthi purisāḥ aññam añña rūpa abhirāmāḥ bhavanti arūpīsu phassa ādīsu sukhuma bhāvataḥ  sammohaḥ sattesu patiṭṭhitaḥ yasmai hoti tasmai nāma kāyaḥ avijjāya padaṭṭhānam bhavati iti
translated: Since that is so, the form body is the footing for craving. For in the round of rebirths without discernible beginning, men and women delight in each other’s forms.🔽Confusion about the formless, that is, about contact, etc., which are subtle states, is the establishment of ignorance in beings.

original: yojanā kātabbā. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – rūpakāyanāmakāyesu ārammaṇakaraṇavasena taṇhāya
analyzed: yojanā kātabbā idam vuttam hoti rūpa kāya nāmakāyesu ārammaṇa karaṇa vasena taṇhāya
translated: Since that is so, the name body is the footing for ignorance. This is how the construction should be understood. This is what is being said: by making the form body and the name body its object, craving

original: ca avijjāya ca uppajjanato rūpakāyo taṇhāya padaṭṭhānaṃ, nāmakāyo avijjāya padaṭṭhānanti nīharitabbāvāti.
analyzed: ca avijjāya ca uppajjanataḥ rūpa kāyo taṇhāya padaṭṭhānam nāma kāyo avijjāya padaṭṭhānam ti nīharitabba āvā ati
translated: and because the material body arises with craving and the mental body with ignorance, the material body is the footing for craving and the mental body the footing for ignorance.

original: “Katamo rūpakāyo, katamo nāmakāyo”ti pucchitabbattā “tattha rūpakāyo rūpakkhandho,
analyzed: katamaḥ rūpa kāyaḥ katamaḥ nāma kāyaḥ ti pucchitabba ttā tattha rūpa kāyaḥ rūpa kkhandho
translated: “What is the material body? What is the mental body?” because this question has to be asked, “Herein, the material body is the material form aggregate,

original: nāmakāyo cattāro arūpino khandhā”ti vuttaṃ. Tattha tesu rūpakāyanāmakāyesu rūpakāyo
analyzed: nāmakāyo cattāro arūpino khandhā ti vuttam tattha tesu rūpa kāya nāmakāyesu rūpa kāyo
translated: the mental body is the four immaterial aggregates” is said. Herein, of these material body and mental body, the material body

original: rūpasamūho nāma rūpakkhandho hoti, nāmakāyo nāmasamūho nāma cattāro arūpino khandhāti.🔽Ime pañcakkhandhā avijjātaṇhānaṃ ārammaṇattā saupādānā bhaveyyuṃ, “katamena upādānena🔽saupādānā bhavantī”ti pucchitabbattā tatheva pucchitvā vissajjetuṃ “ime pañcakkhandhā
analyzed: rūpa samūhaḥ nāma rūpa kkhandho hoti nāma kāyaḥ nāma samūhaḥ nāma cattāro arūpino khandhā ti  ime pañca kkhandhāḥ avijjā taṇhānam ārammaṇa ttā sa upādānāḥ bhaveyyum katamena upādānena  sa aupādānāḥ bhavanti iti pucchitabba ttā tathā iva pucchitvā vissajjetum ime pañca kkhandhāḥ
translated: is the material form aggregate, which is a collection of materiality. The mental body is the four immaterial aggregates, which is a collection of mentality.🔽These five aggregates would be with-clinging because they are the object of craving and ignorance. “By what kind of clinging

original: katamena upādānena saupādānā? Taṇhāya ca avijjāya cā”ti vuttaṃ. Tattha upādānabhūtāya
analyzed: katamena upādānena sā aupādānā taṇhāya ca avijjāya ca ati vuttam tattha upādāna bhūtāya
translated: are they with-clinging?” because this question has to be asked, it is asked in the same way and the answer is given thus: “By what kind of clinging are these five aggregates with-clinging? By craving and by ignorance.” Herein, by what kind of clinging

original: taṇhāya ca upādānabhūtāya avijjāya ca ime pañcakkhandhā saupādānā nāma bhavantīti yojanā kātabbā.
analyzed: taṇhāya ca upādāna bhūtāya avijjāya ca ime pañca kkhandhāḥ sa aupādānāḥ nāma bhavanti iti yojanā kātabbā
translated: The five aggregates with clinging should be construed as follows: “With craving and ignorance as the state of clinging, the five aggregates are called those with clinging.”

original: “Kittakāni upādānāni taṇhā nāma bhavanti, kittakāni upādānāni avijjā nāma bhavantī”ti
analyzed: kittakāni upādānāni taṇhāḥ nāma bhavanti kittakāni upādānāni avijjāḥ nāma bhavanti iti
translated: “How many kinds of clinging are called craving, and how many are called ignorance?”

original: pucchitabbattā “tattha taṇhā dve”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tatthāti tāsu taṇhāavijjāsu. Kāmupādānañca
analyzed: pucchitabba ttā tattha taṇhā dve iti ādi vuttam tattha ati tāsu taṇhā avijjāsu kāma upādānam ca
translated: Because this question must be asked, “Therein, craving is twofold,” etc., is said. Therein means among those craving and ignorance. The two kinds of clinging, namely, clinging to sense pleasures

original: sīlabbatupādānañca dve upādānāni taṇhā nāma bhavanti. Taṇhāvasena hi “mama sīlaṃ,🔽mama vata”nti parāmasanaṃ bhavati. Diṭṭhupādānañca attavādupādānañca dve upādānāni
analyzed: dve upādānāni taṇhā nāma bhavanti taṇhā vasena hi mama sīlam  mama vatanti parāmasanam bhavati diṭṭh upādānam ca atta vāda upādānam ca dve upādānāni
translated: and clinging to rules and observances, are called craving. For it is through craving that one clings, thinking, “My virtue,🔽my observances.” The two kinds of clinging, namely, clinging to views and clinging to a doctrine of self, are called ignorance.

original: avijjā nāma bhavanti. Avijjāvasena hi sassatadiṭṭhi ceva ahaṃmamādidiṭṭhi ca bhavanti.
analyzed: avijjāḥ nāma bhavanti avijjā vasena hi sassata diṭṭhi ca iva ahaṃmamādi diṭṭhi ca bhavanti
translated: For it is through ignorance that the eternalist view and the view of self and property arise.

original: “Imehi catūhi upādānehi saupādānakkhandhā catūsu saccesu kittakaṃ saccaṃ nāmā”ti
analyzed: imehi catūhi upādānehi sa aupādānakkhandhā catūsu saccesu kittakam saccam nāma ati
translated: “How many of the aggregates with clinging are called the four noble truths, with these four kinds of clinging?”

original: pucchitabbattā “imehī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Ye lokiyakkhandhā saupādānā khandhā bhavanti,
analyzed: pucchitabba ttā imehi itiādi vuttam ye lokiya khandhāḥ sa aupādānāḥ khandhāḥ bhavanti
translated: Because this question must be asked, “With these,” etc., is said. The aggregates with clinging that are mundane aggregates

original: upādānena hi upādānānipi bhavanti, idaṃ saupādānakkhandhapañcakaṃ dukkhaṃ dukkhasaccaṃ
analyzed: upādānena hi upādānāni api bhavanti idam sa upādāna khandha pañcakam dukkham dukkha saccaṃ
translated: For the five aggregates with clinging are suffering, the Truth of Suffering,

original: nāma. Yāni cattāri upādānāni dukkhakāraṇāni bhavanti, ayaṃ upādānacatukko samudayo🔽samudayasaccaṃ nāma bhavati. Pañcakkhandhāti saupādānā pañcakkhandhā dukkhavatthubhāvato
analyzed: nāma yāni cattāri upādānāni dukkha kāraṇāni bhavanti ayam upādāna catukkaḥ samudayaḥ  samudaya saccam nāma bhavati pañca kkhandhā ati sa upādānā pañca kkhandhā dukkha vatthu bhāvato
translated: because they are the basis for suffering. The four kinds of clinging are the origin of suffering, the Truth of Origin,

original: dukkhaṃ. Tesanti saupādānānaṃ pañcakkhandhānaṃ. Dhammaṃ desetīti “ārambhathā”tiādikaṃ
analyzed: dukkham tesanti sa upādānānam pañcakkhandhānam dhammam deseti iti
translated: because they are the cause of suffering. The five aggregates with clinging are suffering because they are the basis for suffering.

original: dhammaṃ veneyyānurūpaṃ bhagavā deseti. Sāmaññena pubbe vuttampi atthavasena visesaṃ
analyzed: dhammam veneyya anurūpam bhagavā deseti sāmaññena pubbe vuttam pi attha vasena visesam
translated: “The Dhamma”: the Dhamma taught by the Blessed One in accordance with the disciples’ capacity, beginning with the words, “Come, bhikkhus, ”🔽in order to show the difference in meaning, although the words are the same as those in the previous section.🔽The first two truths have been explained by the teacher in terms of the beginning and the opposite of negligence. We have understood

original: dassetuṃ puna “dukkhassa pariññāya, samudayassa pahānāyā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: dassetum puna dukkhassa pariññāya samudayassa pahānāya ati vuttam
translated: that. Now, in order to show how the other two truths are to be explained, he says, “For the full understanding of suffering, for the abandoning of the origin,”🔽and so on.

original: 30. Ārambhapaṭipakkhabhūtapamādavasena purimasaccadvayaṃ ācariyena niddhāritaṃ, amhehi
analyzed: ārambha paṭipakkha bhūta pamāda vasena purima sacca dvayam ācariyena niddhāritam amhehi
translated: The first two truths have been explained by the teacher in terms of the beginning and the opposite of negligence. We have understood

original: ca ñātaṃ, “itarasaccadvayaṃ kathaṃ niddhāritabba”nti vattabbattā taṃ dvayampi pamādamukheneva
analyzed: ca ñātam itara sacca dvayam katham niddhāritabban ti vattabba ttā tam dvayam pi pamāda mukhena iva
translated: that. Now, in order to show how the other two truths are to be explained, he says, “For the full understanding of suffering, for the abandoning of the origin,”🔽and so on.

original: niddhāritabbanti dassetuṃ “tattha yo tividho”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha tatthāti tesu taṇhāmūlakaavijjāmūlakesu
analyzed: niddhāritabbanti dassetum tattha yaḥ tividhaḥ tiādi vuttam tattha tattha ati tesu taṇhā mūlaka avijjā mūlakesu
translated: In order to show how it is to be demonstrated, the following is said: “Herein, the three kinds of negligence are to be understood as the three kinds of negligence rooted in craving and the three kinds of negligence rooted in ignorance.🔽Herein, ‘herein’ refers to those kinds of negligence rooted in craving and those rooted in ignorance.🔽‘That’ refers to the three kinds of negligence rooted in craving.

original: pamādesu. Tassāti tividhassa taṇhāmūlakassa pamādassa. Sampaṭivedhenāti assādādīnaṃ
analyzed: pamādesu tassa ati tividhassa taṇhā mūlakassa pamādassa sampaṭivedhena ati assāda ādīnam
translated: ‘By full-understanding’ refers to full-understanding of the gratification, etc., in them.🔽‘By guarding’ refers to the guarding of one’s own mind.

original: parijānanena. Rakkhaṇāti attacittassa rakkhaṇasaṅkhātā. Paṭisaṃharaṇāti “tassā”ti🔽iminā vuttassa pamādassa paṭipakkhabhūtena appamādānanuyogena saṃharaṇā yā khepanā🔽atthi, ayaṃ pamādassa paṭipakkhabhūtena appamādānuyogena pavattā khepanasaṅkhātā
analyzed: parijānanena rakkhaṇā ati atta cittassa rakkhaṇa saṅkhātā paṭisaṃharaṇā ati tassa ati  iminā vuttassa pamādassa paṭipakkha bhūtena appamāda ananuyogena saṃharaṇā yā khepanā  atthi ayam pamādassa paṭipakkha bhūtena appamāda anuyogena pavattā khepana saṅkhātā
translated: ‘By abandoning’ refers to the casting out of that negligence spoken of in the passage ‘That negligence of his is abandoned in him’ .🔽This is called ‘concentration’ because it is the casting out of negligence by the practice of heedfulness, which is the opposite of negligence.

original: bhāvanā samatho nāmāti pamādassa paṭipakkhamukhena puna āvaṭṭetvā samatho niddhāritoti.🔽“So samatho kathaṃ kena upāyena bhavatī”ti pucchitabbattā tathā pucchitvā upāyaṃ
analyzed: bhāvanā samathaḥ nāma ati pamādassa paṭipakkha mukhena puna āvaṭṭetvā samathaḥ niddhārito ti  saḥ samathaḥ katham kena upāyena bhavati iti pucchitabbattā tathā pucchitvā upāyam
translated: Thus concentration is demonstrated by a return to the opposite of negligence.🔽Since it has to be asked how and by what means that concentration comes about, the following is said in order to show the means:🔽‘How? By what means? By the means of the abandoning of the three kinds of negligence rooted in craving and the three kinds of negligence rooted in ignorance.

original: dassetuṃ “so katha”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha kathanti kena upāyena. “Kāmentīti kāmā,
analyzed: dassetum saḥ katham tiādi vuttam tattha katham ti kena upāyena kāmenti iti kāmā
translated: ‘Kāma’ is kāma.

original: kāmīyantīti vā kāmā”ti vuttānaṃ dvinnaṃ kāmānaṃ paṭicca uppajjamānaṃ assādañca, “appassādā
analyzed: kāmīyanti iti vā kāmā ati vuttānam dvinnam kāmānam paṭicca uppajjamānam assādam ca appassādā
translated: and the gratification that arises in dependence on the two kinds of sensual desires mentioned as “sensual desires” and “longing for sensual desires” is the gratification of sensual desires.

original: kāmā bahudukkhā”tiādi vacanato appassādanīyānaṃ kāmānaṃ paṭicca uppajjamānaṃ ādīnavañca.🔽Kāmānanti ca kammatthe sāmivacanaṃ. Tena vuttaṃ –“kāme paṭiccā”ti. “Kāmānametaṃ nissaraṇaṃ,
analyzed: kāmāḥ bahu dukkhā ti ādi vacanataḥ appassādanīyānam kāmānam paṭicca uppajjamānam ādīnavañca  kāmānam ti ca kammatthe sāmi vacanam tena vuttam kāme paṭicca ati kāmānam etam nissaraṇam
translated: And the danger that arises in dependence on the sensual desires described as “sensual desires are of little gratification and much suffering” is the danger of sensual desires.🔽And “sensual desires” is a possessive determinative in the sense of object. That is why it is said, “in dependence on sensual desires.”🔽And the first jhāna is intended here as the escape from sensual desires in the sense of the escape from sensual desires described as “The escape from sensual desires is this, namely, renunciation” .🔽The word “escape” is analyzed as follows: the prefix vi is a prefix in the sense of “apart,”

original: yadidaṃ nekkhamma”nti vacanato nissaraṇanti idha paṭhamajjhānaṃ adhippetaṃ. Vokāranti
