analyzed: nibbedhabhāgiya suttam yojetabbam itara dvayam pi suttam yathāsambhavam yojetabbam
translated: The other two Threads should be construed as appropriate.

original: Etena ñāṇassa bhūmīnaṃ suttatthānaṃ bahuvidhattaṃ dasseti.🔽34. Vāsanābhāgiyasuttādīsu vuttā dhammā vāsanābhāgiyanibbedhabhāgiyabhāvehi ācariyena🔽vibhattā, amhehi ca ñātā, “kathaṃ saṃkilesabhāgiyaasekkhābhāgiyabhāvehi asādhāraṇāsādhāraṇabhāvehi
analyzed: etena ñāṇassa bhūmīnam sutta tthānam bahuvidha ttam dasseti  vāsanā bhāgiya sutta ādīsu vuttā dhammā vāsanā bhāgiya nibbedha bhāgiya bhāvehi ācariyena  vibhattā amhehi ca ñātā katham saṃkilesa bhāgiya asekkhā bhāgiya bhāvehi asādhāraṇa asādhāraṇa bhāvehi
translated: By this he shows the variety of the planes of the knowledge and the sources of the Threads.

original: vibhajitabbā”ti pucchitabbattā “tattha katame dhammā sādhāraṇā”tiādi āraddhaṃ. Aṭṭhakathāya pana –
analyzed: vibhajitabbā ti pucchitabba ttā tattha katame dhammā sādhāraṇā ti ādi āraddham aṭṭhakathāya pana
translated: The ideas stated in the Thread Dealing with the Remnants of Warrantedness, etc., have been analysed by the teacher as to the state of the remnants of warrantedness and the state of penetration, and we have understood them. Now, as to the question “How are they to be analysed as to the state of defilement and the state of the adept and as to the state of what is shared in common and the state of what is not shared in common? “ , the answer is begun thus “ Herein, what ideas are shared in common? “ . But in the commentary

original: “Evaṃ vāsanābhāgiyanibbedhabhāgiyabhāvehi dhamme ekadesena vibhajitvā idāni tesaṃ🔽kilesabhāgiyaasekkhabhāgiyabhāvehi sādhāraṇāsādhāraṇabhāvehi vibhajituṃ ‘tattha katame
analyzed: evam vāsanā bhāgiya nibbedha bhāgiya bhāvehi dhamme ekadesena vibhajitvā idāni tesam  kilesa bhāgiya asekkha bhāgiya bhāvehi sādhāraṇa asādhāraṇa bhāvehi vibhajitum tattha katame
translated: “Having thus divided the states by way of the factors of the category of residues and the category of penetration, he now divides them by way of the factors of the category of defilement and the category of the disciple in higher training, and by way of the factors that are common to and not common to both.🔽“Herein, what are the states that are common to the category of defilement and the category of the disciple in higher training?

original: dhammā sādhāraṇā’tiādi āraddha”nti –
analyzed: dhammā sādhāraṇa ati ādi āraddhanti
translated: “Having thus divided the ideas by way of the category of the profitable, etc., and by way of the category of the Nibbana-penetrable, etc., he now begins the section dealing with the question of what is common and what is not common to them by way of the category of defilement, etc., with the words ‘Herein, what ideas are common? ‘”

original: Vuttaṃ. Tattha tatthāti ye dhammā sutte vuttā vibhattihārena vibhajitabbā, tesu dhammesu
analyzed: vuttam tattha tattha ati ye dhammā sutte vuttāḥ vibhatti hārena vibhajitabbā tesu dhammesu
translated: This is said. Herein, herein: in those ideas stated in the sutta that are to be divided by the method of division.

original: katame dhammā sādhāraṇāti pucchati, dve dhammā sādhāraṇāti vissajjeti. Te dve dhamme🔽sarūpato dassetuṃ “nāmasādhāraṇā, vatthusādhāraṇā cā”ti vuttaṃ. Tattha nāmasādhāraṇāti
analyzed: katame dhammā sādhāraṇā ati pucchati dve dhammā sādhāraṇā ati vissajja iti te dve dhamme  sarūpataḥ dassetum nāma sādhāraṇā vatthu sādhāraṇā ca ati vuttam tattha nāma sādhāraṇā ti
translated: What ideas are common? He asks. Two ideas are common, he replies.🔽In order to show those two ideas in their individual essences it is said: common by name, and common by object.

original: nāmena nāmapaññattiyā sādhāraṇā samānā, “kusalā”ti nāmena ekavīsati cittuppādā samānā,
analyzed: nāmena nāma paññattiyā sādhāraṇā samānā kusalā ati nāmena ekavīsati cittuppādā samānā
translated: Herein, common by name: being common by name, that is, by the description of the name, “Twenty-one kinds of consciousness are common by the name ‘ profitable ‘,

original: “akusalā”tyādināmena dvādasa cittuppādā samānā, kusalādināmapaññattivacanena vacanīyā
analyzed: akusala ati ādi nāmena dvādasa cittuppādā samānā kusala ādi nāma paññatti vacanena vacanīyā
translated: and twelve kinds of consciousness are common by the name ‘ unprofitable ‘, etc.,🔽and they are called ‘ common by the name ‘ profitable ‘, etc., by the statement of the description of the name ‘ profitable ‘, etc.

original: atthā kusalādināmasādhāraṇāti vuttā. Tena ṭīkāyaṃ –
analyzed: atthā kusala ādi nāma sādhāraṇā iti vuttā tena ṭīkā ayam
translated: So in the commentary it is said:

original: “Nāmaṃ nāmapaññatti, taṃmukheneva saddato tadatthāvagamo. Saddena ca sāmaññarūpeneva
analyzed: nāmam nāma paññatti tad mukhena iva saddataḥ tad attha avagamo saddena ca sāmañña rūpena iva
translated: “Name is the expression by name. The meaning is understood by way of the sound. And by the sound the meaning is apprehended as the common characteristic of the state of being a monk,

original: tathārūpassa atthassa gahaṇaṃ, na visesarūpena. Tasmā saddavacanīyā atthā sādhāraṇarūpanāmāyattagahaṇīyatāya
analyzed: tathārūpassa atthassa gahaṇam na visesa rūpena tasmā sadda vacanīyāḥ atthā sādhāraṇa rūpa nāma āyatta gahaṇīya tāya
translated: not as the specific characteristic. Therefore the meanings that are expressed by the sound are called ‘common to name’ because they are apprehended by way of the common characteristic of name.🔽They are called ‘common to sound’

original: nāmasādhāraṇā vuttā”ti –
analyzed: nāma sādhāraṇā vuttā ati
translated: because they are apprehended by way of the common characteristic of sound.”

original: Vuttaṃ. Vatthusādhāraṇāti patiṭṭhānabhūtena vatthunā sādhāraṇā. Yasmiṃ patiṭṭhānabhūte
analyzed: vuttam vatthu sādhāraṇā ati patiṭṭhāna bhūtena vatthunā sādhāraṇā yasmin patiṭṭhāna bhūte
translated: “Common to the physical basis” means common to the physical basis that is the foundation. In whatever physical basis

original: santāne vā cittuppādādimhi vā ye dhammā pavattanti, te dhammā tena santānena vā vatthunā🔽tena cittuppādādinā vā sādhāraṇā samānāti attho. Ekasantāne patitattā phusanādisabhāvato
analyzed: santāne vā cittuppāda ādimhi vā ye dhammā pavattanti te dhammā tena santānena vā vatthunā  tena cittuppāda ādinā vā sādhāraṇā samānā ati attho eka santāne patita ttā phusana ādi sabhāvato
translated: or in whatever continuum or in whatever occurrence of consciousness, etc., the states occur, those states are common to that continuum or to that physical basis🔽or to that occurrence of consciousness, etc. The meaning is that they are the same. Although they are different in the sense of being the object of the act of touching, etc.,

original: bhinnāpi vatthusādhāraṇā samānavatthukāyeva bhavantīti vibhattihārena vibhajitvāti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: bhinnā api vatthu sādhāraṇā samāna vatthukāya iva bhavanti iti vibhatti hārena vibhajitvā iti vuttam hoti
translated: they are called “common to the physical basis” and “having a common physical basis” because they are included in one continuum. The meaning is that they are the same. “They are called ‘common to the physical basis’ because they are included in one continuum. They are called ‘having a common physical basis’ because they are the same in the sense of being the object of the act of touching, etc.”

original: “Kiṃ nāmasādhāraṇavatthusādhāraṇāyeva vibhajitabbā, aññaṃ vibhajitabbaṃ natthī”ti
analyzed: kim nāma sādhāraṇa vatthu sādhāraṇāya iva vibhajitabbā aññam vibhajitabbam na atthi iti
translated: “Should only those common to name and those common to the physical basis be distinguished? Is there nothing else to be distinguished?”

original: pucchitabbattā “yaṃ vā panā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Nāmasādhāraṇavatthusādhāraṇehi aññaṃ yaṃ
analyzed: pucchitabba ttā yam vā pana atiādi vuttam nāma sādhāraṇa vatthu sādhāraṇehi aññam yam
translated: “Or any other” is said because it is to be asked: “What is it?”🔽Any other kind of state that is shared in common by name, by object, by function, by condition, by opposite, etc.,

original: vā pana kiccasādhāraṇapaccayasādhāraṇapaṭipakkhādisādhāraṇampi dhammajātaṃ evaṃjātiyaṃ
analyzed: vā pana kicca sādhāraṇa paccaya sādhāraṇa paṭipakkha ādi sādhāraṇam pi dhamma jātam evaṃjātiyam
translated: is shared in common in a kind that is shared in common in a class.

original: sādhāraṇajātiyaṃ, tampi sabbaṃ vicayahārena vicinitvā yuttihārena gavesitvā yuttaṃ🔽sādhāraṇaṃ vibhattihārena vibhajitabbanti adhippāyo. “Tesu nāmasādhāraṇādīsu katame
analyzed: sādhāraṇa jātiyam tam pi sabbam vicaya hārena vicinitvā yutti hārena gavesitvā yuttam  sādhāraṇam vibhatti hārena vibhajitabbanti adhippāyaḥ tesu nāma sādhāraṇa ādīsu katame
translated: All that is to be analysed by the method of analysis, to be sought by the method of seeking, and what is suitable🔽is to be distinguished by the method of distinguishing what is shared in common. This is the purport.🔽“Among those shared in common by name, etc., which are shared in common by name, which are shared in common by object?”🔽Because it is to be asked, “Among those shared in common by name, etc., which are shared in common by name, which are shared in common by object?”

original: nāmasādhāraṇā, katame vatthusādhāraṇā”ti pucchitabbattā “micchattaniyatānaṃ sattāna”ntiādi🔽vuttaṃ. Mātughātakādīnaṃ channaṃ micchattaniyatakammakarānaṃ sattānañca duggatiahetukasugatiahetukaduhetukatihetukānaṃ
analyzed: nāma sādhāraṇā katame vatthu sādhāraṇā ati pucchitabba ttā micchatta niyatānam satta an tiādi  vuttam mātughātaka ādīnam channam micchatta niyata kamma karānam sattānam ca duggati ahetuka sugati ahetuka duhetuka ti hetukānam
translated: “The beings whose destiny is determined by wrong action” is said.

original: catunnaṃ puthujjanānaṃ aniyatakammakarānaṃ sattānañca santāne pavattā dassanapahātabbā
analyzed: catunnam puthujjanānam aniyata kamma karānam sattānam ca santāne pavattā dassana pahātabbā
translated: And the beings whose destiny is determined by wrong action, namely, the six beings who perform the ten kinds of wrong action, and the four kinds of ordinary beings who perform undetermined action, namely, those whose destiny is due to bad action, those whose destiny is due to good action, those whose destiny is due to both, and those whose destiny is due to neither,🔽are shared in common by name in the continuity of those beings who are to be abandoned by seeing.

original: kilesā dassanapahātabbanāmasādhāraṇā samānā bhavanti sakkāyadiṭṭhivicikicchāsīlabbataparāmasanavasena🔽bhinnasabhāvānampi dassanapahātabbanāmanātivattanato. Vuttappakārānaṃ niyatāniyatasattānaṃ
analyzed: kilesāḥ dassana pahātabba nāma sādhāraṇāḥ samānāḥ bhavanti sakkāya diṭṭhi vicikicchā sīlabbata parāmasana vasena  bhinna sabhāvānam pi dassana pahātabba nāmanā ativattanataḥ vutta ppakārānam niyata aniyata sattānam
translated: The defilements to be abandoned by seeing, though different in individual essence, are the same in being the name “to be abandoned by seeing,” since they do not exceed the name “to be abandoned by seeing.”

original: dassanapahātabbānaṃ kilesānaṃ patiṭṭhānavatthubhāvato vatthusādhāraṇā ca samānavatthukāti🔽attho. Puthujjanassa duggatiahetukādicatubbidhasattassa, sotāpannassa ca santāne🔽pavattā kāmarāgabyāpādā kilesā kāmarāgabyāpādanāmasādhāraṇā samānā bhavanti sakadāgāmimaggappahātabbaanāgāmimaggappahātabbavasena
analyzed: dassana pahātabbānam kilesānam patiṭṭhāna vatthu bhāvataḥ vatthu sādhāraṇā ca samāna vatthukā ti  atthaḥ puthujjanassa duggati ahetuka ādi catubbidha sattassa sotāpannassa ca santāne  pavattā kāma rāga byāpādā kilesā kāma rāga byāpāda nāma sādhāraṇā samānāḥ bhavanti sakadāgāmi magga ppahātabba anāgāmi magga ppahātabba vasena
translated: And they are the same in being the object of the same thing, since they are the support for the things that are the same in being the object of the same thing, namely, the defilements to be abandoned by seeing, which are of fixed or unfixed occurrence in the various beings already mentioned.

original: bhinnasabhāvānampi kāmarāgabyāpādanāmanātivattanato. Vuttappakārassa puthujjanassa,
analyzed: bhinna sabhāvānam pi kāma rāga byāpāda nāmanā ativattanataḥ vutta ppakārassa puthujjanassa
translated: The defilements of lust and ill will that occur in the continuum of a worldling of the four kinds already mentioned and of a stream-enterer are the same in being the name “lust and ill will,” though different in individual essence, since they do not exceed the name “lust and ill will.”

original: sotāpannassa ca kāmarāgabyāpādānaṃ patiṭṭhānavatthubhāvato vatthusādhāraṇā samānavatthukāti
analyzed: sotāpannassa ca kāma rāga byāpādānam patiṭṭhāna vatthu bhāvataḥ vatthu sādhāraṇā samāna vatthukā ti
translated: And they are the same in being the object of the same thing, since they are the support for the lust and ill will of the worldling and the stream-enterer already mentioned.

original: attho ca gahetabbo. Puthujjanassa, anāgāmissa ca santāne pavattā uddhaṃbhāgiyā saṃyojanā
analyzed: attho ca gahetabbo puthujjanassa anāgāmissa ca santāne pavattā uddhaṃbhāgiyā saṃyojanā
translated: and the meaning should be taken thus. The fetters that occur in the continuity of a worldling and a non-returner

original: uddhambhāgiyanāmasādhāraṇā samānā bhavanti rūparāgādivasena bhinnasabhāvānampi uddhaṃbhāgiyanāmanātivattanato.
analyzed: uddhaṃbhāgiya nāma sādhāraṇāḥ samānāḥ bhavanti rūpa rāga ādi vasena uddhaṃbhāgiya nāmanā ativattanataḥ
translated: are called “higher fetters” in common, though they are of different natures as divided into greed for the fine-material and immaterial, etc., because they do not exceed the name “higher fetters.”

original: Puthujjanassa, anāgāmissa ca uddhaṃbhāgiyānaṃ patiṭṭhānavatthubhāvato vatthusādhāraṇā🔽samānavatthukāti attho ca gahetabbo. Tena vuttaṃ ṭīkāyaṃ – “dassanapahātabbānañhi
analyzed: puthujjanassa anāgāmissa ca uddhaṃbhāgiyānam patiṭṭhāna vatthu bhāvataḥ vatthu sādhāraṇā  samāna vatthukā ti atthaḥ ca gahetabbaḥ tena vuttam ṭīkāyam dassana pahātabbānam hi
translated: And they are called “common in the sense of a basis” because they are the basis for the higher fetters in the continuity of a worldling and a non-returner.

original: yathā micchattaniyatasattā pavattiṭṭhānaṃ, evaṃ aniyatāpī”ti vuttaṃ. Saṅkhepato pana🔽saṃkilesapakkhe pahānekaṭṭhā kilesā nāmasādhāraṇā honti, sahajekaṭṭhā kilesā vatthusādhāraṇāti daṭṭhabbā.
analyzed: yathā micchatta niyata sattā pavatti ṭṭhānam evam aniyatā api iti vuttam saṅkhepato pana  saṃkilesa pakkhe pahāna ikaṭṭhāḥ kilesāḥ nāma sādhāraṇāḥ honti sahajā ikaṭṭhāḥ kilesāḥ vatthu sādhāraṇā ti daṭṭhabbā
translated: The meaning should be taken thus: “They are common in the sense of having the same basis.” Hence it is said in the commentary: “For just as the wrongnesses that are fixed are the occurrence-basis for the worldling, so too are the unfixed” . In brief,🔽however, it should be understood that in the case of defilements that are common in the sense of name, the defilements are common in the sense of object in the case of those that are common in the sense of object.

original: Saṃkilesapakkhe sādhāraṇā ācariyena vibhattā, amhehi ca ñātā, “kathaṃ vodānapakkhe
analyzed: saṃkilesa pakkhe sādhāraṇā ācariyena vibhattā amhehi ca ñātā katham vodāna pakkhe
translated: The defilements that are common in the sense of object in the case of the defilements that are common in the sense of name have been explained by the teacher and are known by us. “But how are the defilements that are common in the sense of object in the case of the defilements that are common in the sense of object in the case of the defilements that are common in the sense of name? ”

original: sādhāraṇā vibhattā”ti pucchitabbattā “yaṃ kiñci ariyasāvako”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha
analyzed: sādhāraṇā vibhattā ti pucchitabba ttā yam kiñci ariya sāvaka iti ādi vuttam tattha
translated: “Whatsoever is shared and analyzed” is said in order to ask about it. Herein,

original: yaṃ kiñcīti sāmaññavasena vuttā paṭhamajjhānasamāpattiādikā lokiyā samāpattiyeva
analyzed: yam kiñci iti sāmañña vasena vuttā paṭhamajjhāna samāpatti ādikā lokiyā samāpattiyā iva
translated: “Whatsoever” is said by way of a general statement. It refers to the attainment of the first jhāna and so on, which is only mundane attainment.

original: gahitā. Ariyasāvakoti ariyassa bhagavato sāvako ariyasāvakoti vattabbo, jhānalābhī
analyzed: gahitā ariya sāvako ti ariyassa bhagavataḥ sāvakaḥ ariya sāvakaḥ iti vattabbaḥ jhāna lābhī
translated: “Ariya disciple” is one who is a disciple of the Noble One, the Blessed One. He is called an ariya disciple. He is one who has attained jhāna,

original: ca phalaṭṭho ca puggalo, na maggaṭṭho. Maggaṭṭho hi lokiyaṃ yaṃ kiñci samāpattiṃ
analyzed: ca phala ṭṭho ca puggalo na magga ṭṭhaḥ magga ṭṭhaḥ hi lokiyam yam kiñci samāpattim
translated: one who has reached fruition, not one who has reached the path. For one who has reached the path does not attain any mundane attainment whatsoever.

original: na samāpajjati. Sabbā sā lokiyasamāpatti rūpāvacarā arūpāvacarā dibbavihāro brahmavihāro
analyzed: na samāpajjati sabbā sā lokiya samāpatti rūpāvacarā arūpāvacarā dibba vihāraḥ brahmavihāraḥ
translated: All that mundane attainment is of the form realm, of the formless realm, a divine abiding, a brahma-abiding,

original: paṭhamajjhānasamāpattīti evamādīhi pariyāyehi sādhāraṇā taṃsamaṅgīhi vītarāgāvītarāgehi
analyzed: paṭhama jhāna samāpatti iti evamādīhi pariyāyehi sādhāraṇā tad samaṅgīhi vīta rāga a vīta rāgehi
translated: the attainment of the first jhāna, and so on. By these and other synonyms it is shared. It is shared by those with and without lust,

original: sādhāraṇā lokiyasamāpattināmanātivattanato ca vītarāgāvītarāgehi samāpajjitabbato
analyzed: sādhāraṇāḥ lokiya samāpatti nāma na ativattanataḥ ca vīta rāga a vīta rāgehi samāpajjitabbato
translated: by those who have and have not overcome lust, because it is not beyond the scope of mundane attainment, and because it must be attained by those with and without lust.

original: ca. “Ariyasāvako ca lokiyaṃ samāpattiṃ samāpajjanto odhiso odhiso samāpajjati, evaṃ
analyzed: ca ariya sāvakaḥ ca lokiyam samāpattim samāpajjantaḥ odhisaḥ odhisaḥ samāpajjati evam
translated: “When the ariya disciple attains mundane attainment, he attains it by way of a specific condition. Thus

original: sati kathaṃ vītarāgehi sādhāraṇāti saddahitabbā”ti vattabbattā “sādhāraṇā hi dhammā”tiādi🔽vuttaṃ. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana – “kathaṃ te odhiso gahitā, atha odhiso gahetabbā, kathaṃ
analyzed: sati katham vīta rāgehi sādhāraṇā ati saddahitabbā ati vattabba ttā sādhāraṇāḥ hi dhamma atiādi  vuttam aṭṭhakathāyam pana katham te odhisaḥ gahitā atha odhisaḥ gahetabbā katham
translated: “How can it be shared by those free from lust?”—in order to show that it can, he said “For states are shared,” etc.

original: sādhāraṇāti anuyogaṃ manasi katvā taṃ visodhento āha – ‘sādhāraṇā hi dhammā evaṃ🔽aññamañña’ntiādī”ti vuttaṃ.🔽Tattha evaṃ vītarāgāvītarāgehi odhiso odhiso samāpajjitabbā dhammā paraṃ paraṃ pacchā
analyzed: anuyogam manasi katvā tam visodhentaḥ āha sādhāraṇāḥ hi dhammāḥ evam  aññam añña ntiādi iti vuttam  tattha evam vīta rāga avīta rāgehi odhisas odhisas samāpajjitabbāḥ dhammāḥ param param pacchā
translated: But in the commentary it is said: “How are they taken as specific? Are they to be taken as specific? How are they shared? ”—considering this questioning, he, purifying it, said “For states are shared,” etc.

original: pacchā pavattiyamānaṃ dhammajātaṃ sakaṃ sakaṃ pubbe pubbe jātaṃ “lokiyasamāpattī”ti
analyzed: pacchā pavattiyamānam dhamma jātam sakam sakam pubbe pubbe jātam lokiya samāpatti iti
translated: Herein, “For states are shared by those free from lust and not free from lust, taken as specific, one after the other, in the occurrence of the kind of states that occur one after the other, the kind that has arisen before each one, are called ‘ mundane attainments ’.

original: nāmaṃ niyatavisayaṃ aññamaññaṃ hutvā hi yasmā nātivattanti, tasmā sādhāraṇāti saddahitabbā
analyzed: nāmam niyata visayam aññam aññam hutvā hi yasmai na ativattanti tasmai sādhāraṇā ati saddahitabbā
translated: They do not exceed their own specific province, which is fixed, since they are mutually related. Therefore it can be believed that they are shared.

original: gahetabbāti attho. “Paraṃ paraṃ samāpajjanto kathaṃ nātivattatī”ti vattabbattā nātivattanaṃ
analyzed: gahetabbā ti attho param param samāpajjanto katham na ativattati iti vattabbattā na ativattanam
translated: The meaning is that they are to be taken as shared. In order to show that “one who enters upon one after the other does not exceed ,” he said “They do not exceed their own specific province,” etc.

original: pākaṭaṃ kātuṃ “yopī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Yo ariyasāvako vā avītarāgo vā. Imehi lokiyasamāpattidhammehi
analyzed: pākaṭam kātum yaḥ pi itiādi vuttam yaḥ ariya sāvakaḥ vā a vīta rāgaḥ vā imehi lokiya samāpatti dhammehi
translated: Endowed with these states that are ideas of the supramundane jhānas,

original: samannāgato, so ariyasāvako vā avītarāgo vā paraṃ paraṃ samāpajjantopi taṃ dhammaṃ🔽lokiyaṃ samāpattidhammaṃ nātivattati, aññaṃ upagantvā nātikkamatīti attho. Yehi lokiyasamāpattidhammehi
analyzed: samannāgataḥ saḥ ariya sāvako vā a vīta rāgaḥ vā param param samāpajjantaḥ api tam dhammaṃ  lokiyam samāpatti dhammam na ativattati aññam upagantvā na atikkamati iti atthaḥ yehi lokiya samāpatti dhammehi
translated: that noble disciple or one not yet without lust, though he enters upon and dwells in the further and further supramundane jhānas,🔽does not overstep that state that is an idea of the supramundane jhānas; the meaning is that he does not go beyond it by taking up another.

original: samannāgato, ime lokiyasamāpatti dhammā sādhāraṇāvāti daṭṭhabbā.
analyzed: ime lokiya samāpatti dhammā daṭṭhabbā
translated: The states that are ideas of the supramundane jhānas with which he is endowed should be regarded as common to him.

original: “Vāsanābhāgiyādisuttesu vuttā ye dhammā iminā vibhattihārena vibhattā, yesu dhammesu🔽katame dhammā asādhāraṇā”ti pucchitabbattā “tattha katame dhammā asādhāraṇā”tiādi
analyzed: vāsanābhāgiya ādi suttesu vuttāḥ ye dhammāḥ iminā vibhatti hārena vibhattā yesu dhammesu  katame dhammāḥ asādhāraṇā iti pucchitabbattā tattha katame dhammāḥ asādhāraṇā atiādi
translated: “The states stated in the Suttas on the subject of the kinds of states partaking of penetration that are analysed by this method of analysis,🔽in which states are the states not common? “🔽Because it is necessary to ask this question, “Herein, in which states are the states not common? “ is said.

original: vuttaṃ. Tattha tesu vibhajitabbesu dhammesu katame dhammā asādhāraṇāti pucchati,
analyzed: vuttam tattha tesu vibhajitabbesu dhammesu katame dhammāḥ asādhāraṇāḥ ti pucchati
translated: Herein, he asks, “In which states that are to be analysed are the states not common? “

original: pucchitvā yāva desanaṃ upādāya asādhāraṇā dhammā gavesitabbā, “sekkhāsekkhā”ti vā
analyzed: pucchitvā yāva desanam upādāya asādhāraṇāḥ dhammāḥ gavesitabbā sekkhā asekkhā ati vā
translated: Having asked, he should seek out the states not common by way of teaching, “The learner’s and the unlearner’s” or

original: gavesitabbā, “bhabbābhabbā”ti vā gavesitabbā. Atha vā yāva “sekkhāsekkhā bhabbābhabbā”ti
analyzed: gavesitabbāḥ bhabba abhabbā ati vā gavesitabbāḥ atha vā yāva sekkhā asekkhāḥ bhabba abhabbā ati
translated: Or else, as long as the teaching is stated as “learners and those beyond learning, capable and incapable,”

original: desanā vuttā, tāva desanaṃ upādāya asādhāraṇā gavesitabbā. Kathaṃ gavesitabbā? Ariyesu
analyzed: desanā vuttā tāva desanam upādāya asādhāraṇā gavesitabbā katham gavesitabbā ariyesu
translated: the teaching should be taken as the basis and the unshared should be sought. How should they be sought? Among the noble ones,

original: sekkhāsekkhadhammavasena “sekkhā”ti nāmaṃ asekkhena asādhāraṇaṃ, “asekkhā”ti nāmaṃ
analyzed: sekkha asekkha dhamma vasena sekkhā ati nāmam asekkhena asādhāraṇam asekkhā ati nāmam
translated: the name “learner” is not shared by the one beyond learning, in terms of the Dhamma of learners and those beyond learning. The name🔽“one beyond learning” is not shared by the learner.

original: sekkhena asādhāraṇanti vā, anariyesu “bhabbā”ti nāmaṃ abhabbena asādhāraṇaṃ, “abhabbā”ti
analyzed: sekkhena asādhāraṇanti vā anariyesu bhabbā ati nāmam abhabbena asādhāraṇam abhabbā ati
translated: Or else, among the ignoble, the name “capable” is not shared by the incapable, and the name “incapable”

original: nāmaṃ bhabbena asādhāraṇanti vā gavesitabbā. Kāmarāgabyāpādā saṃyojanā appahīnattā
analyzed: nāmam bhabbena asādhāraṇanti vā gavesitabbā kāma rāga byāpādā saṃyojanā a pahīna ttā
translated: is not shared by the capable. They should be sought in this way. Because the fetters of sensual lust and ill will have not been abandoned,

original: anusayabhāvena uppajjanārahattā aṭṭhamakassa sotāpattimaggaṭṭhassa ca sotāpannassa
analyzed: anusaya bhāvena uppajjana araha ttā aṭṭhamakassa sotāpatti magga ṭṭhassa ca sotāpannassa
translated: they arise by way of latent tendencies in the eighth person, the one established in the path of stream-entry, and in the stream-enterer

original: phalaṭṭhassa ca sādhāraṇā bhavanti, dhammatā dhammasabhāvo asādhāraṇo. Idaṃ vuttaṃ
analyzed: phala ṭṭhassa ca sādhāraṇāḥ bhavanti dhamma tā dhamma sabhāvaḥ asādhāraṇaḥ idam vuttam
translated: established in the fruit. The nature, the essential state of things, is not shared. This is what is meant.

original: hoti – “aṭṭhamakassa sotāpattimaggaṭṭhatā sotāpannassa asādhāraṇā, sotāpannassa sotāpannaphalaṭṭhatā
analyzed: hoti aṭṭhamakassa sotāpatti magga ṭṭha tā sotāpannassa asādhāraṇā sotāpannassa sotāpanna phala ṭṭha tā
translated: The state of being the eighth person established in the path of stream-entry is not shared by the stream-enterer. The state of being a stream-enterer established in the fruit of stream-entry is not shared by the eighth person.

original: ca aṭṭhamakassa sotāpattimaggaṭṭhassa asādhāraṇā. Aṭṭhamakassa vā pahīyamānakilesatā
analyzed: ca aṭṭhamakassa sotāpatti magga ṭṭhassa asādhāraṇā aṭṭhamakassa vā pahīyamāna kilesa tā
translated: and the state of the eighth-stage man who is on the path of Stream-Entry are not shared. Or the state of the eighth-stage man’s defilements being given up

original: sotāpannassa asādhāraṇā, sotāpannassa pahīnakilesatā ca aṭṭhamakassa asādhāraṇā”ti.🔽Uddhambhāgiyā saṃyojanā appahīnattā anusayabhāvena uppajjanārahattā aṭṭhamakassa
analyzed: sotāpannassa asādhāraṇā sotāpannassa pahīna kilesa tā ca aṭṭhamakassa asādhāraṇā ati  uddhambhāgiyā saṃyojanā appahīna ttā anusaya bhāvena uppajjana araha ttā aṭṭhamakassa
translated: is not shared by the Stream-Enterer, and the Stream-Enterer’s state of defilements being given up is not shared by the eighth-stage man. “

original: maggaṭṭhabhāvena aṭṭhamakasadisassa anāgāmimaggaṭṭhassa ca anāgāmissa phalaṭṭhassa
analyzed: magga ṭṭha bhāvena aṭṭhamaka sadisassa anāgāmi magga ṭṭhassa ca anāgāmissa phala ṭṭhassa
translated: Because the fetters pertaining to the higher realms have not been given up, they arise in the form of underlying tendencies. The state of the eighth-stage man who is on the path of Non-Return and the state of the Non-Returner who is on the fruit of Non-Return

original: ca sādhāraṇā, dhammatā dhammasabhāvo asādhāraṇā. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – “aṭṭhamakassa🔽anāgāmimaggaṭṭhatā anāgāmissa phalaṭṭhassa asādhāraṇā, anāgāmissa anāgāmiphalaṭṭhatā
analyzed: ca sādhāraṇā dhamma tā dhamma sabhāvaḥ asādhāraṇā idam vuttam hoti aṭṭhamakassa  anāgāmi magga ṭṭha tā anāgāmissa phala ṭṭhassa asādhāraṇā anāgāmissa anāgāmi phala ṭṭha tā
translated: are shared. The nature of things, the specific nature of things, is not shared. This is what is meant:🔽the state of the eighth-stage man who is on the path of Non-Return is not shared by the Non-Returner who is on the fruit of Non-Return, and the Non-Returner’s state of being on the fruit of Non-Return

original: ca aṭṭhamakassa asādhāraṇā. Aṭṭhamakassa vā pahīyamānakilesatā anāgāmissa asādhāraṇā,
analyzed: ca aṭṭhamakassa asādhāraṇā aṭṭhamakassa vā pahīyamāna kilesa tā anāgāmissa asādhāraṇā
translated: is not shared by the eighth-stage man. Or the eighth-stage man’s state of defilements being given up is not shared by the Non-Returner,

original: anāgāmissa phalaṭṭhassa pahīnakilesatā ca aṭṭhamakassa asādhāraṇā”ti. “Maggaṭṭhatā
analyzed: anāgāmissa phala ṭṭhassa pahīna kilesa tā ca aṭṭhamakassa asādhāraṇā ati magga ṭṭha tā
translated: and the Non-Returner’s state of defilements being given up is not shared by the eighth-stage man. “ The state of being on the path

original: phalaṭṭhatāya asādhāraṇā, phalaṭṭhatā ca maggaṭṭhatāya asādhāraṇā”tipi vattuṃ vaṭṭati.
analyzed: phala ṭṭha tāya asādhāraṇā phala ṭṭha tā ca magga ṭṭha tāya asādhāraṇā atipi vattum vaṭṭati
translated: and the state of fruit is not common to the state of path.

original: Sabbesaṃ sattannaṃ sekkhānaṃ puggalānaṃ nāmaṃ “sekkhā”ti nāmaṃ sādhāraṇaṃ. Dhammatā
analyzed: sabbesam sattannam sekkhānam puggalānam nāmam sekkhā ati nāmam sādhāraṇam dhamma tā
translated: The name “learners” is common to all seven kinds of persons who are learners.

original: asādhāraṇāti catunnaṃ maggaṭṭhānaṃ taṃtaṃmaggaṭṭhatā aññamaññaṃ maggaṭṭhānaṃ asādhāraṇā.🔽Heṭṭhimaphalattayaṭṭhānañca asādhāraṇā, heṭṭhimaphalattayaṭṭhānaṃ taṃtaṃphalaṭṭhatā
analyzed: asādhāraṇā ati catunnam magga ṭṭhānam aññam aññam magga ṭṭhānam asādhāraṇā  heṭṭhima phala ttaya ṭṭhānam ca asādhāraṇā heṭṭhima phala ttaya ṭṭhānam taṃ taṃ phalaṭṭha tā
translated: The state of path is not common to the states of path.🔽And the state of fruit is not common to the states of fruit.

original: ca aññamaññaṃ phalaṭṭhānaṃ asādhāraṇā, catunnaṃ maggaṭṭhānañca asādhāraṇāti attho.🔽“Sekkhānaṃ taṃtaṃmaggaṭṭhatā taṃtaṃphalaṭṭhatāya asādhāraṇā, taṃtaṃphalaṭṭhatā ca
analyzed: ca aññam aññam phala ṭṭhānam asādhāraṇā catunnam magga ṭṭhānañca asādhāraṇā ati attho  sekkhānam taṃtaṃmagga ṭṭha tā taṃtaṃphala ṭṭha tāya asādhāraṇā taṃtaṃphala ṭṭha tā ca
translated: The meaning is that the state of path is not common to the four states of path, and the state of fruit is not common to the three states of fruit.

original: taṃtaṃmaggaṭṭhatāya asādhāraṇā”ti vattumpi vaṭṭati. Sabbesaṃ paṭipannakānanti phalatthāya
analyzed: asādhāraṇā iti vattum pi vaṭṭati sabbesam paṭipannakānam ti phala tthāya
translated: It is also allowable to say: “The state of each path is not common to the state of each fruit, and the state of each fruit is not common to the state of each path.”

original: paṭipajjantīti paṭipannakā, tesaṃ maggasamaṅgīnaṃ catunnaṃ puggalānaṃ nāmaṃ “paṭipannakā”ti
analyzed: paṭipajjanti iti paṭipannakā tesam magga samaṅgīnam catunnam puggalānam nāmam paṭipannakā ati
translated: All those who are practising for the fruit: they are practising for the fruit, these four persons who possess the path, the name “those who are practising for the fruit” is common to them.

original: nāmaṃ sādhāraṇaṃ, dhammatā taṃtaṃmaggaṭṭhatā asādhāraṇā. Sabbesaṃ sekkhānaṃ sattannaṃ🔽puggalānaṃ sekkhānaṃ sīlaṃ sādhāraṇaṃ, dhammatā taṃtaṃmaggaṭṭhaphalaṭṭhatā asādhāraṇāti.
analyzed: nāmam sādhāraṇam dhamma tā taṃ taṃ magga ṭṭha tā asādhāraṇā sabbesam sekkhānam  puggalānam sekkhānam sīlam sādhāraṇam dhamma tā taṃ taṃ magga aṭṭha phala ṭṭha tā asādhāraṇā ati
translated: But the state of being a given path- possessor or fruit- possessor is not common.

original: Vāsanābhāgiyasaṃkilesabhāgiyasuttesu vuttā dassanenapahātabbādayo ceva nibbedhabhāgiyaasekkhabhāgiyasuttesu🔽vuttā sekkhādayo ca dhammā sādhāraṇāsādhāraṇabhedena vibhattihārena vibhajitabbāti
analyzed: vāsanā bhāgiya saṃkilesa bhāgiya suttesu vuttāḥ dassanena apahātabba ādayaḥ ca iva nibbedha bhāgiya asekkha bhāgiya suttesu  vuttā sekkha ādayaḥ ca dhammā sādhāraṇa asādhāraṇa bhedena vibhatti hārena vibhajitabbā ati
translated: The ideas stated in the “Contaminants” and “Ideas Conducive to the Decisive- Support” Suttas as to be abandoned by seeing, etc., and the trainers, etc., stated in the “Decisive-Support” and “Adept” Suttas, should be analysed by the method of common and uncommon in the way stated.

original: adhippāyo veditabbo.🔽“Aṭṭhamakassā”tiādinā ariyesu puggalesu asādhāraṇā ācariyena vibhattā, amhehi ca
analyzed: adhippāyaḥ veditabbaḥ  aṭṭhamakassa ati ādinā ariyesu puggalesu asādhāraṇāḥ ācariyena vibhattāḥ amhehi ca
translated: This is the purport.🔽The Master has analysed the uncommon ideas among the eight noble persons, and we have understood them. But he has not analysed the uncommon ideas among the ignoble persons. So the question arises, “How are they to be analysed?”

original: ñātā, “kathaṃ anariyesu asādhāraṇā vibhattā”ti pucchitabbattā ariyesu vuttanayānusārena🔽anariyesupi vibhajitvā gavesitabbāti dassetuṃ “evaṃ visesānupassinā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: ñātā katham anariyesu asādhāraṇā vibhattā ati ariyesu vutta naya anusārena 🔽anariyesu pi vibhajitvā gavesitabbā ti dassetum evam visesa anupassinā tiādi vuttam
translated: The Master has analysed the uncommon ideas among the eight noble persons, and we have understood them. But he has not analysed the uncommon ideas among the ignoble persons. So the question arises, “How are they to be analysed?”🔽The Master has analysed the uncommon ideas among the eight noble persons, and we have understood them. But he has not analysed the uncommon ideas among the ignoble persons. So the question arises, “How are they to be analysed?”🔽The Master has analysed the uncommon ideas among the eight noble persons, and we have understood them. But he has not analysed the uncommon ideas among the ignoble persons. So the question arises, “How are they to be analysed?”🔽The Master has analysed the uncommon ideas among the eight noble persons, and we have understood them. But he has not analysed the uncommon ideas among the ignoble persons. So the question arises, “How are they to be analysed?”

original: Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana – “evaṃ ‘aṭṭhamakassā’tiādinā ariyapuggalesu asādhāraṇadhammaṃ
analyzed: aṭṭhakathāyam pana evam aṭṭhamakassa ati ādinā ariya puggalesu asādhāraṇa dhammam
translated: But in the commentary it is said: “Having thus shown the special quality not common to the ariyan persons by the words ‘of the eighth,’

original: dassetvā itaresu nayadassanatthaṃ ‘evaṃ visesānupassinā’tiādi vutta”nti vuttaṃ. Evaṃ🔽ariyesu vuttanayānusārena bhabbābhabbesu anariyesu visesānupassinā asādhāraṇato visesaṃ
analyzed: dassetvā itaresu naya dassana attham evam visesa anupassinā atiādi vuttanti vuttam evam  ariyesu vutta naya anusārena bhabba abhabbesu anariyesu visesa anupassinā asādhāraṇataḥ visesam
translated: etc., it is said ‘by one who sees distinctions’ in order to show the method in the case of the others.”

original: asādhāraṇaṃ anupassinā gavesakena paṇḍitena bhabbābhabbesupi hīnukkaṭṭhamajjhimaṃ
analyzed: asādhāraṇam anupassinā gavesakena paṇḍitena bhabba abhabbesu pi hīna ukkaṭṭha majjhimam
translated: Thus, by the method stated in the case of the ariyan persons, the wise one who seeks, who sees distinctions, who sees the special quality not common to the others, should seek the distinctions in the case of the non- ariyan persons who are able and unable, taking the low, the superior, and the middling.

original: upādāya gavesitabbaṃ. Kathaṃ? Mātughātādivasena pavattānaṃ paṭighasampayuttadiṭṭhisampayuttasattamajavanacittuppādānaṃ🔽micchattaniyatānaṃ taṃsamaṅgīnaṃ vā tathāpavattā paṭhamajavanacittupādādayo aniyatā
analyzed: upādāya gavesitabbam katham mātughāta ādi vasena pavattānam paṭigha sampayutta diṭṭhi sampayutta sattama javana citta uppādānam  vā aniyatā
translated: How? The seven impulsions of consciousness associated with false view and associated with resentment that occur by way of the mother’s murder, etc.,

original: dhammā paṭighasampayuttādibhāvena sādhāraṇā, micchattaniyatā dhammā ekacittuppādattā
analyzed: dhammā paṭigha sampayutta ādi bhāvena sādhāraṇāḥ micchatta niyatāḥ dhammāḥ eka citta uppādattā
translated: are indeterminate dhammas that are common in the sense of being shared by the determinates of wrong view and by those that occur in the same way and are associated with them. The determinates of wrong view and the first impulsions of consciousness, etc.,🔽that occur in the same way are common in the sense of being shared by the impulsions associated with resentment, etc., in the way stated.

original: asādhāraṇā. Yathā hi cittaṃ “cittasaṃsaṭṭha”nti na vattabbaṃ, evaṃ micchattaniyatāpi
analyzed: asādhāraṇā yathā hi cittam citta saṃsaṭṭhanti na vattabbam evam micchatta niyatā api
translated: They are not shared. Just as consciousness cannot be called “associated with consciousness,” so too

original: “micchattaniyatasādhāraṇā”ti na vattabbā. Micchattaniyatesupi niyatamicchādiṭṭhikānaṃ
analyzed: micchat ta niyata sādhāraṇā ati na vattabbā micchat ta niyatesu pi niyata micchādiṭṭhikānam
translated: those that are fixed by wrong view cannot be called “shared by those fixed by wrong view.”🔽But in the case of those that are fixed by wrong view, the states associated with wrong view that arise in the seventh impulsions of those who are fixed by wrong view as to wrong view,

original: diṭṭhisampayuttasattamajavanacittuppādasamaṅgīnaṃ aniyatā diṭṭhisampayuttapaṭhamajavanacittuppādādayo
analyzed: diṭṭhi sampayutta sattama javana cittuppāda samaṅgīnam aniyatāḥ diṭṭhi sampayutta paṭhama javana cittuppāda ādayaḥ
translated: and the states associated with wrong view that arise in the first impulsions of those who are not so fixed, are shared by being associated with wrong view, etc.

original: dhammā diṭṭhisampayuttādibhāvena sādhāraṇā, niyatamicchādiṭṭhi ekacittuppādasamaṅgībhāvato
analyzed: dhammā diṭṭhi sampayutta ādi bhāvena sādhāraṇāḥ niyatam icchā diṭṭhi eka cittuppāda samaṅgībhāvato
translated: But the wrong view that is fixed by wrong view is not shared, because it is included in a single consciousness.

original: asādhāraṇā. Tenāha aṭṭhakathācariyo –
analyzed: asādhāraṇā tena āha aṭṭhakathā cariyaḥ
translated: Therefore the teachers of the commentaries say:

original: “Micchattaniyatānaṃ aniyatā dhammā sādhāraṇa, micchattaniyatā dhammā asādhāraṇā.
analyzed: aniyatāḥ dhammāḥ sādhāraṇa micchat ta niyatāḥ dhammāḥ asādhāraṇā
translated: “The states that are not fixed are shared by those that are fixed by wrong view. The states that are fixed by wrong view are not shared.

original: Micchattaniyatesupi niyatamicchādiṭṭhikānaṃ aniyatā dhammā sādhāraṇā, niyatamicchādiṭṭhi
analyzed: micchatta niyatesu pi niyata micchādiṭṭhikānam aniyatāḥ dhammāḥ sādhāraṇāḥ niyatam icchādiṭṭhi
translated: But in the case of those that are fixed by wrong view, the states that are not fixed are shared by those who are fixed by wrong view as to wrong view. The wrong view that is fixed by wrong view

original: asādhāraṇāti iminā nayena visesānupassinā veditabbā”ti.
analyzed: asādhāraṇā ati iminā nayena visesa anupassinā veditabbā ati
translated: is not shared. They should be understood in this way by one who sees the distinction.”

original: Tattha “iminā nayenā”ti iminā micchattaniyatānaṃ uppajjituṃ bhabbā aniyatā dhammā
analyzed: tattha iminā nayena ati iminā micchatta niyatānam uppajjitum bhabbāḥ aniyatāḥ dhammāḥ
translated: Herein, by this method: by this method of the possible and impossible, the possible and impossible should be discerned in the case of the unfixed ideas that are possible and those that are impossible to arise in the case of the fixed ideas.

original: sādhāraṇā, uppajjituṃ abhabbā aniyatā dhammā asādhāraṇāti gahitā. Tena vuttaṃ “bhabbābhabbā”ti.
analyzed: sādhāraṇāḥ uppajjitum abhabbāḥ aniyatāḥ dhammāḥ asādhāraṇā ati gahitā tena vuttam bhabba abhabbā ti
translated: So it is said that “possible and impossible” should be discerned.

original: Tathā hīnassa hīno hīnabhāvena sādhāraṇo, majjhimukkaṭṭhā asādhāraṇā. Majjhimassa🔽majjhimo sādhāraṇo, hīnukkaṭṭhā asādhāraṇā. Ukkaṭṭhassa ukkaṭṭho ukkaṭṭhabhāvena
analyzed: tathā hīnassa hīnaḥ hīna bhāvena sādhāraṇaḥ majjhima ukkaṭṭhāḥ asādhāraṇāḥ majjhimassa  majjhimaḥ sādhāraṇaḥ hīnukkaṭṭhāḥ asādhāraṇāḥ ukkaṭṭhassa ukkaṭṭhaḥ ukkaṭṭha bhāvena
translated: For it is the inferior that is shared in common by the inferior in the sense of inferiority; the medium and superior are not shared in common.🔽It is the medium that is shared in common by the medium; the inferior and the superior are not shared in common.🔽It is the superior that is shared in common by the superior in the sense of superiority; the inferior and the medium are not shared in common.

original: sādhāraṇo, hīnamajjhimā asādhāraṇātipi gavesitabbā. Tenāha – “hīnukkaṭṭhamajjhimaṃ
analyzed: sādhāraṇaḥ hīna majjhimā asādhāraṇā atipi gavesitabbā tena āha hīna ukkaṭṭha majjhimam
translated: So it should be sought by means of the inferior, the medium, and the superior. That is why it was said above: “by means of the inferior, the medium, and the superior” .🔽Herein, the ideas that are shared in common and those that are not shared in common were shown by the method of analysis in the various ways beginning with “Herein, what are the ideas that are shared in common?”

original: upādāya gavesitabba”nti.🔽“Tattha katame dhammā sādhāraṇā”tiādinā nānāvidhena vibhattihāranayena dhammā vibhajitvā
analyzed: upādāya gavesitabbanti  tattha katame dhammā sādhāraṇa ati ādinā nānāvidhena vibhatti hāra nayena dhammā vibhajitvā
translated: and we have understood them.

original: dassitā, amhehi ca ñātā, “kathaṃ bhūmipadaṭṭhānāni vibhattihāranayena vibhajitvā
analyzed: dassitā amhehi ca ñātā katham bhūmi padaṭṭhānāni vibhatti hāra nayena vibhajitvā
translated: “How are the bases for the ideas that are shared in common and those that are not shared in common shown by the method of analysis in the various ways beginning with ‘Herein, what are the ideas that are shared in common?’”

original: dassitānī”ti pucchitabbabhāvato dhammavibhajanānantaraṃ bhūmipadaṭṭhānāni vibhajitvā
analyzed: dassitāni iti pucchitabba bhāvataḥ dhamma vibhajana anantaram bhūmi padaṭṭhānāni vibhajitvā
translated: “The grounds for the seeing” are the grounds for the seeing of the first path.

original: dassento “dassanabhūmī”tiādimāha. Tattha dassanabhūmīti dassanaṃ bhavati ettha paṭhamamaggeti🔽dassanabhūmi, sotāpattimaggo. Niyāmāvakkantiyāti niyamanaṃ niyāmo, ko so? Sampattaniyāmo,🔽avakkanaṃ avakkanti, sotāpattiphalaṃ, niyāmassa avakkanti niyāmāvakkanti, tāya. Dassanabhūmināmako
analyzed: dassentaḥ dassana bhūmi itiādim āha tattha dassana bhūmi iti dassanam bhavati ettha paṭhama magga iti  dassana bhūmi sotāpatti maggo niyāma avakkantiyā ati niyamanam niyāmo kaḥ so sampatta niyāmo  avakkanam avakkanti sotāpatti phalam niyāmassa avakkanti niyāma avakkanti tāya dassana bhūmi nāmako
translated: The “ground for the seeing” is the first path.🔽“The entry into the certainty” is the entry into the certainty of the fruit of stream-entry.

original: sotāpattimaggo niyāmāvakkantināmakassa sotāpattiphalassa pattiyā padaṭṭhānaṃ. Paṭhamamaggasamaṅgī
analyzed: sotāpatti maggaḥ niyāma avakkanti nāmakassa sotāpatti phalassa pattiyā padaṭṭhānam paṭhama magga samaṅgī
translated: The “ground for the seeing” is the first path, which is the ground for the attainment of the fruit of stream-entry, which is called “the entry into the certainty.”

original: puggalo hi niyāmaṃ okkamanto nāma, phalasamaṅgī pana niyāmaṃ okkanto nāma hoti, tasmā
analyzed: puggalaḥ hi niyāmam okkamantaḥ nāma phala samaṅgī pana niyāmam okkantaḥ nāma hoti tasmā
translated: The person who possesses the first path is called “one who enters into the certainty,” and the person who possesses the fruit is called “one who has entered into the certainty.”

original: niyāmāvakkantisaddena paṭhamaphaluppatti gahitā. Bhāvanābhūmīti uparimaggattayaṃ.
analyzed: niyāma avakkanti saddena paṭhama phala uppatti gahitā bhāvanā bhūmī iti upari magga ttayam
translated: Therefore, the attainment of the first fruit is included by the word “entry into the certainty.”🔽The “ground for the development” is the three higher paths.

original: Uttarikānanti tassa tassa maggassa uparipavattānaṃ taṃtaṃphalānaṃ pattiyā padaṭṭhānanti
analyzed: uttarikānam ti tassa tassa maggassa upari pavattānam taṃ taṃ phalānam pattiyā padaṭṭhānam ti
translated: The “higher” are those that occur above each path and are the footing for the attainment of each fruit.

original: paccekaṃ yojetabbaṃ.🔽Dukkhā paṭipadā dandhābhiññā mandapaññassa uppajjanato samathaṃ āvahantī hutvā samathassa
analyzed: paccekam yojetabbam  dukkhā paṭipadā dandha abhiññā manda paññassa uppajjanataḥ samatham āvahantī hutvā samathassa
translated: They should be construed in each case.🔽The painful-to-the-slow-to-cognize path is a footing for serenity because it leads to serenity since it arises in one of sluggish intellectual faculties.

original: padaṭṭhānaṃ hoti, sukhāpaṭipadā khippābhiññā ñāṇādhikassa uppajjanato vipassanāvahantī
analyzed: padaṭṭhānam hoti sukhā paṭipadā khippā abhiññā ñāṇa adhikassa uppajjanataḥ vipassanā āvahantī
translated: The pleasant-to-the-quick-to-cognize path is a footing for insight because it leads to insight since it arises in one of keen intellectual faculties.

original: hutvā vipassanāya padaṭṭhānaṃ, avasesā dve paṭipadāpi nātipaññassa uppajjanato samathassa
analyzed: hutvā vipassanāya padaṭṭhānam avasesā dve paṭipadā api na ati paññassa uppajjanato samathassa
translated: The remaining two paths should be taken as a footing for serenity since they arise in one of sluggish intellectual faculties.

original: padaṭṭhānanti gahetabbā. Tena aṭṭhakathāyaṃ vuttaṃ – “itarā pana tissopi paṭipadā🔽samathaṃ āvahantī”tiādi. Dānamayaṃ puññakiriyavatthu sayameva ekantena dhammassavanassa
analyzed: padaṭṭhānam ti gahetabbā tena aṭṭhakathāyam vuttam itarā pana tissaḥ api paṭipadā  samatham āvahanti itiādi dāna mayam puñña kiriya vatthu sayam eva ekantena dhammassavanassa
translated: That is why it is said in the Paṭisambhidā: “But the other three paths lead to serenity” , etc.

original: padaṭṭhānaṃ na hoti, vandanayācanapañhāpucchanādayopi padaṭṭhānaṃ honti, tasmā tehi
analyzed: padaṭṭhānam na hoti vandana yācana pañhā pucchana ādayaḥ pi padaṭṭhānam honti tasmā tehi
translated: The giving of gifts is not a footing for hearing the True Idea by itself alone; but paying homage, supplicating, asking questions, etc., are also a footing for it.

original: kāraṇehi sādhāraṇaṃ hutvā paratoghosassa padaṭṭhānaṃ hoti, paratoghoso ca dhammassavanapañhāvissajjanādivasena
analyzed: kāraṇehi sādhāraṇam hutvā paratoghosassa padaṭṭhānam hoti paratoghoso ca dhamma ssavana pañhā vissajjana ādi vasena
translated: and the hearing of the Teaching, answering of questions, etc.,

original: pavatto. Dātabbavatthupariccajanavandanayācanakālesu hi yebhuyyena dhammaṃ desenti,
analyzed: pavattaḥ dātabba vatthu pariccajana vandana yācana kālesu hi yebhuyyena dhammam desenti
translated: are the occasion for the arising of understanding consisting in cogitation. For they usually teach the Dhamma when they are giving a gift, when they are observing sīla, when they are making an offering, when they are paying homage, when they are asking for something,

original: pañhāpucchanādikālesu ca vissajjenti, paṭipucchasākacchādīni vā karonti. Sīlamayaṃ🔽puññakiriyavatthu pāmojjapītipassaddhisukhasamādhīhi padaṭṭhānabhāvena sādhāraṇaṃ
analyzed: pañhāpucchana ādi kālesu ca vissajjenti paṭipuccha sākaccha ādīni vā karonti sīla mayam  puñña kiriya vatthu pāmojja pīti passaddhi sukha samādhīhi padaṭṭhāna bhāvena sādhāraṇam
translated: and they answer questions, etc., when they are asked a question, etc., or they converse, etc., when they are conversing, etc.🔽The basis for the arising of understanding consisting in cogitation is the virtue aggregate, which is shared with the other three aggregates,

original: hutvā cintāmayiyā paññāya padaṭṭhānaṃ hoti. Sīlavantassa hi sīlaṃ paccavekkhantassa
analyzed: hutvā cintā mayiyā paññāya padaṭṭhānam hoti sīlavantassa hi sīlam paccavekkhantassa
translated: by way of the factors of joy, happiness, tranquillity, and concentration. For when the virtuous man reviews his virtue,

original: pāmojjādayo honti, samāhito ca dhammacintane samattho hoti.🔽Bhāvanāmayaṃ puññakiriyavatthūti purimā purimā samathabhāvanā ceva vipassanābhāvanā
analyzed: pāmojja ādayaḥ honti samāhito ca dhamma cintane samattho hoti  bhāvanā mayam puñña kiriya vatthu uti purimā purimā samatha bhāvanā ca iva vipassanā bhāvanā
translated: he experiences joy, etc., and he is capable of concentrating in order to think about the Dhamma.🔽The basis for the arising of understanding consisting in keeping in being is the four foundations of mindfulness, which are shared with the other three aggregates,

original: ca puññakiriyavatthudānasīlādīhi kāraṇehi sādhāraṇaṃ hutvā bhāvanāmayiyā paññāya
analyzed: ca puñña kiriya vatthu dāna sīla ādīhi kāraṇehi sādhāraṇam hutvā bhāvanā mayiyā paññāya
translated: by way of the factors of serenity and insight.

original: pacchimāya pacchimāya samathabhāvanāya ceva vipassanābhāvanāya ca padaṭṭhānaṃ. Tena🔽vuttaṃ aṭṭhakathāyaṃ – “sādhāraṇanti na bījaṃ viya aṅkurassa, dassanabhūmiādayo viya
analyzed: pacchimāya pacchimāya samatha bhāvanāya ca iva vipassanā bhāvanāya ca padaṭṭhānam tena  vuttam aṭṭhakathāyam sādhāraṇan ti na bījam viya aṅkurassa dassana bhūmi ādayaḥ viya
translated: It is the footing for the development of serenity and insight in the latter and the latter.🔽Hence it is said in the commentary: “It is not a seed for a sprout, nor is it a footing for the entry into the certainty of rightness, etc., as are the plane of seeing, etc., but it is a footing in common with other causes.”

original: niyāmāvakkantiādīnaṃ āveṇikaṃ, atha kho sādhāraṇaṃ tadaññakāraṇehipī”ti. “Dānamayasīlamayabhāvanāmayapuññakiriyavatthūnaṃ
analyzed: āveṇikam atha kho sādhāraṇam dāna maya sīla maya bhāvanā maya puñña kiriya vatthūnam
translated: The teacher has shown that the footing for the three bases for making merit consisting in giving, virtue, and meditation,

original: paratoghosacintāmayibhāvanāmayipaññānaṃ padaṭṭhānabhāvo ācariyena vibhatto, evaṃ🔽sati tesaṃ dānamayādīnaṃ yathākkamaṃ pariyattibāhusaccakammaṭṭhānānuyogamaggasammādiṭṭhīnaṃ🔽padaṭṭhānabhāvo na bhaveyyā”ti vattabbattā tathāpavattaṃ padaṭṭhānabhāvampi dassetuṃ
analyzed: paratoghosa cintā mayi bhāvanā mayi paññānam padaṭṭhāna bhāvaḥ ācariyena vibhattaḥ evam  sati tesam dāna maya ādīnam yathākkamam pariyatti bāhu sacca kammaṭṭhāna anuyoga magga sammādiṭṭhīnam  padaṭṭhāna bhāvaḥ na bhaveyya iti vattabbattā tathā pavattam padaṭṭhāna bhāvam pi dassetum
translated: and for the three kinds of understanding consisting in learning, in virtue, and in meditation, is the same.🔽But if that is so, then the footing for the three bases for making merit consisting in giving, etc., would not be the same as the footing for the learning sign, the meditation subject, the path, and right view, respectively.

original: “dānamayaṃ puññakiriyavatthu parato ca ghosassa sutamayiyā ca paññāyā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: dāna mayam puñña kiriya vatthu paratas ca ghosassa suta mayiyā ca paññāya atiādi vuttam
translated: So in order to show that the footing is the same in this way, too, it is said: “The basis consisting in giving is the footing for understanding consisting in what is heard and for understanding consisting in cogitation,” and so on.

original: Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana –
analyzed: aṭṭhakathā ayam pana
translated: But in the commentary it is said:

original: “Idāni yasmā dānaṃ, sīlaṃ, lokiyabhāvanā ca na kevalaṃ yathāvuttaparatoghosādīnaṃyeva,
analyzed: idāni yasmai dānam sīlam lokiya bhāvanā ca na kevalam
translated: “Now, since giving, virtue, and mundane development are not only conditions for the kind of faith that is due to another’s utterance, etc., as already stated,

original: atha kho yathākkamaṃ pariyattibāhusaccakammaṭṭhānānuyogamaggasammādiṭṭhīnampi paccayā
analyzed: atha kho yathākkamam pariyatti bāhu sacca kammaṭṭhāna anuyoga magga sammādiṭṭhīnam pi paccayā
translated: but also for the faith due to hearsay, etc., respectively, in one who is possessed of the scriptures, in one who is devoted to the meditation subject, and in one who has entered upon the way by undertaking the training precepts,

original: honti, tasmā tampi nayaṃ dassetuṃ puna ‘dānamaya’ntiādinā desanaṃ vaḍḍhesī”ti –🔽Vuttaṃ. Tattha dānamayapuññakiriyavatthuno paratoghosassa sādhāraṇapadaṭṭhānabhāvo
analyzed: honti tasmā tam pi nayam dassetum puna dānamayanti ādinā desanam vaḍḍhesi iti  vuttam tattha dāna maya puñña kiriya vatthuno paratoghosassa sādhāraṇa padaṭṭhāna bhāvo
translated: the Blessed One extended the teaching by adding the words ‘due to giving,’ etc., in order to show that method” .🔽Herein, the fact that the faith due to another’s utterance is the common footing for the requisites of enlightenment beginning with giving in the case of the requisites of enlightenment consisting in giving should be understood in the way already stated .

original: heṭṭhā vuttanayena ñātabbo. Dānaṃ pana datvā desanaṃ sutvā sutānusārena vitthāretvā🔽cintentassa pavattamānāya sutamayiyā paññāya vandanayācanādīhi sādhāraṇaṃ hutvā padaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: heṭṭhā vutta nayena ñātabbaḥ dānam pana datvā desanam sutvā suta anusārena vitthāretvā  cintentassa pavattamānāya suta mayiyā paññāya vandana yācana ādīhi sādhāraṇam hutvā padaṭṭhānam
translated: But when one has given a gift and heard the teaching, and then, after extending the subject by reviewing it in the way in which it was heard,🔽he develops the faith due to seeing empirically, then that faith is the common footing for the requisites of enlightenment beginning with giving in the case of the requisites of enlightenment consisting in virtue.

original: hoti. Sīlamayapuññakiriyavatthunopi cintāmayiyā paññāya sādhāraṇapadaṭṭhānabhāvo
analyzed: hoti sīla maya puñña kiriya vatthunā api cintā mayiyā paññāya sādhāraṇa padaṭṭhāna bhāvo
translated: The fact that the faith due to seeing empirically is the common footing for the requisites of enlightenment beginning with giving in the case of the requisites of enlightenment consisting in virtue has already been stated .

original: vuttoyeva. Parisuddhasīlaṃ pana nissāya “jhānaṃ nibbattessāmi, maggaphalaṃ nibbattessāmī”tiādinā
analyzed: vuttaḥ yā iva parisuddha sīlam pana nissāya jhānam nibbattessāmi magga phalam nibbattessāmi itiādinā
translated: But when one has purified his virtue and then resolves thus, “I shall arouse jhāna,” or “I shall arouse the path,” or “I shall arouse the fruition” ,

original: paccavekkhantassa pavattamānassa yonisomanasikārassa pāmojjādīhi sādhāraṇaṃ hutvā🔽padaṭṭhānaṃ hoti. Bhāvanāmayapuññakiriyavatthuno bhāvanāmayiyā paññāya sādhāraṇapadaṭṭhānabhāvopi
analyzed: paccavekkhantassa pavattamānassa yoniso manasikārassa pāmojja ādīhi sādhāraṇam hutvā  padaṭṭhānam hoti bhāvanā maya puñña kiriya vatthunaḥ bhāvanā mayiyā paññāya sādhāraṇa padaṭṭhāna bhāvaḥ api
translated: and it is the footing for the joy, etc., that occur in one who is reviewing.🔽The footing common to the understanding consisting in what is heard and the understanding consisting in cogitation is stated too.🔽But insight, which occurs either with jhāna as its footing or else with the state of maturity of the insight as its footing, is the footing for right view, etc., common to the purification of virtue, etc.

original: vuttoyeva. Samathabhāvanāsaṅkhātaṃ pana jhānaṃ pādakaṃ katvā vā paripākaṃ vipassanābhāvaṃyeva🔽vā nissāya pavattamānāya sammādiṭṭhiyā parisuddhasīlādīhi sādhāraṇaṃ hutvā padaṭṭhānaṃ hoti.🔽Dānamayapuññakiriyavatthuādīnaṃ paratoghosādīnaṃ padaṭṭhānabhāvo punappunaṃ ācariyena🔽vibhatto, amhehi ca ñāto, “patirūpadesavāsādayopi imesaṃ dhammānaṃ padaṭṭhānānīti
analyzed: samatha bhāvanā saṅkhātam pana jhānam pādakam katvā vā paripākam vipassanā bhāvam yeva  vā nissāya pavattamānāya sammādiṭṭhiyā parisuddha sīla ādīhi sādhāraṇam hutvā padaṭṭhānam hoti  dāna maya puñña kiriya vatthu ādīnam paratas ghosa ādīnam padaṭṭhāna bhāvaḥ punappunam ācariyena  vibhattaḥ amhehi ca ñātaḥ pati rūpa desa vāsa ādayaḥ pi imesam dhammānam padaṭṭhānāni iti
translated: The footing of the requisites of enlightenment, etc., has been analyzed by the teacher and is known to us.

original: yathā vibhajitabbā, amhehi ca viññātabbā, tathā vibhajitvā dassethā”ti vattabbattā
analyzed: yathā vibhajitabbā amhehi ca viññātabbā tathā vibhajitvā dassetha ati vattabbattā
translated: “But please show us how the footing of the requisites of enlightenment, etc., should be analyzed as to virtue, etc., and how it should be shown as to place, etc., since it is to be analyzed and shown thus: ‘The requisites of enlightenment have virtue as their footing, etc.,’ and since it is to be analyzed and shown thus: ‘The requisites of enlightenment have the enlightenment factors as their footing, etc.,’ and since it is to be analyzed and shown thus: ‘The enlightenment factors have the jhāna as their footing, etc.,’ and since it is to be analyzed and shown thus: ‘The jhāna has virtue as its footing, etc.,’ and since it is to be analyzed and shown thus: ‘The jhāna has the faculties as its footing, etc.,’ and since it is to be analyzed and shown thus: ‘The faculties have virtue as their footing, etc.,’ and since it is to be analyzed and shown thus: ‘The faculties have the powers as their footing, etc.,’ and since it is to be analyzed and shown thus: ‘The powers have virtue as their footing, etc.,’ and since it is to be analyzed and shown thus: ‘The powers have the enlightenment factors as their footing, etc.,’ and since it is to be analyzed and shown thus: ‘The enlightenment factors have the jhāna as their footing, etc.,’ and since it is to be analyzed and shown thus: ‘The jhāna has virtue as its footing, etc.,’ and since it is to be analyzed and shown thus: ‘The jhāna has the faculties as its footing, etc.,’ and since it is to be analyzed and shown thus: ‘The faculties have virtue as their footing, etc.,’ and since it is to be analyzed and shown thus: ‘The faculties have the powers as their footing, etc.,’ and since it is to be analyzed and shown thus

original: tepi vibhajitvā dassetuṃ “patirūpadesavāso”tiādimāha. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana “tathā patirūpadesavāsādayo
analyzed: te api vibhajitvā dassetum pati rūpa desa vāsa iti ādim āha aṭṭhakathā ayam pana tathā pati rūpa desa vāsa ādayo
translated: But in the commentary it is said: “In order to show the method by which living in a suitable locality, etc.,

original: kāyavivekacittavivekādīnaṃ kāraṇaṃ hontīti imaṃ nayaṃ dassetuṃ ‘patirūpadesavāso’tiādimāhā”ti
analyzed: kāya viveka citta viveka ādīnam kāraṇam honti iti imam nayam dassetum patiḥ upadesa vāsā iti ādim āha ati
translated: are a condition for bodily seclusion, mental seclusion, and so on, he said ‘Living in a suitable locality,’ and so on” .

original: vuttaṃ. Patirūpadesaṃ nissāya vasantassa kāyavivekacittavivekavaḍḍhanato, samādhivaḍḍhanato
analyzed: vuttam pati rūpa desam nissāya vasantassa kāya viveka citta viveka vaḍḍhanataḥ samādhi vaḍḍhanataḥ
translated: Because one who lives in a suitable locality increases bodily seclusion and mental seclusion and increases concentration,🔽living in a suitable locality is the proximate cause for bodily seclusion and for access concentration and absorption concentration,

original: ca patirūpadesavāso kāyacittavivekassa ca upacārasamādhiappanāsamādhissa ca sīlādīhi
analyzed: ca patiḥ upadesa vāso kāya citta vivekassa ca upacāra samādhi appanā samādhissa ca sīla ādīhi
translated: and it is common to virtue, etc.,

original: sādhāraṇaṃ hutvā padaṭṭhānaṃ. Sappurisūpanissayoti sappurisasantāne pavatto payirupāsato
analyzed: sādhāraṇam hutvā padaṭṭhānam sappurisa upanissayo ti sappurisa santāne pavatto payirupāsato
translated: “Relying on true men”: confidence that is to be relied on by one who frequents them, occurring in the continuity of one who frequents true men.

original: ālambitabbo pasādo, tato vā upanissayaṃ labhitvā payirupāsantānaṃ santāne pavatto
analyzed: ālambitabbaḥ pasādaḥ tatas vā upanissayam labhitvā payirupāsantānam santāne pavatto
translated: Or the previous confidence occurring in the continuity of those who, having obtained the support of that confidence, continue to frequent them,

original: pubbapasādo yathāvidho sappurisūpanissayo payirupāsantassa saddhāsampannassa ratanattaye
analyzed: pubba pasādaḥ yathāvidhaḥ sappurisa upanissayo payirupāsantassa saddhā sampannassa rata nattaye
translated: is the kind of reliance on true men that is a proximate cause for one who has faith, who is endowed with faith, and who frequents them in the Three Jewels.

original: tiṇṇaṃ aveccappasādānaṃ ratanattayaguṇādīhi sādhāraṇaṃ hutvā padaṭṭhānaṃ, samathassa🔽labhananimittadāyakaṃ sappurisaṃ payirupāsitvā tena dinnanaye ṭhatvā pavattetabbassa🔽samathassa sappurisūpanissayo sīlapāmojjapītādīhi sādhāraṇaṃ hutvā padaṭṭhānaṃ. Attasammāpaṇihitassa🔽pāpajigucchādīnaṃ sambhavato attasammāpaṇidhānaṃ jātivayādipaccavekkhaṇena sādhāraṇaṃ
analyzed: tiṇṇam avecca ppasādānam rata nattaya guṇa ādīhi sādhāraṇam hutvā padaṭṭhānam samathassa  labhana nimitta dāyakam sappurisam payis upāsitvā tena dinna naye ṭhatvā pavattetabbassa  samathassa sappurisa upanissayo sīla pāmojja pīta ādīhi sādhāraṇam hutvā padaṭṭhānam atta sammāpaṇihitassa  pāpa jigucchā ādīnam sambhavataḥ atta sammāpaṇidhānam jāti vaya ādi paccavekkhaṇena sādhāraṇam
translated: The three kinds of perfect confidence are the footing for virtue, etc., in so far as they are shared in common by virtue, etc., and the three jewels, which are the object of the three kinds of perfect confidence.🔽The good person is the footing for virtue, etc., in so far as they are shared in common by virtue, etc., and the right way of practice that should be undertaken by one who has approached a good person and received his instruction.🔽Right direction of endeavour is the footing for virtue, etc., in so far as they are shared in common by virtue, etc., and shame, since shame is possible in one who has rightly directed his endeavour.

original: hutvā hiriyā ca padaṭṭhānaṃ, attasammāpaṇihitassa nibbidādīnaṃ sambhavato sīlādīhi🔽sādhāraṇaṃ hutvā vipassanāya ca padaṭṭhānaṃ.🔽Tadaṅgādivasena akusalapariccāgo nibbidāñāṇādīhi sādhāraṇaṃ hutvā kusalavīmaṃsāya
analyzed: hutvā hiriyā ca padaṭṭhānam atta sammāpaṇihitassa nibbida ādīnam sambhavataḥ sīla ādīhi  sādhāraṇam hutvā vipassanāya ca padaṭṭhānam  tad aṅga ādi vasena akusala pariccāgaḥ nibbidā ñāṇa ādīhi sādhāraṇam hutvā kusala vīmaṃsāya
translated: Right direction of endeavour is the footing for insight, in so far as it is shared in common by insight and shame, since insight is possible in one who has rightly directed his endeavour.🔽The renunciation of unprofitable things by means of the constituent parts, etc., is the footing for the knowledge of dispassion, etc., in so far as it is shared in common by the knowledge of dispassion, etc., and skill in distinguishing what is and what is not the path.

original: paṭisaṅkhānupassanāya paññāya ca ariyamaggasamādhindriyassa ca padaṭṭhānaṃ. Dhammasvākkhātatā
analyzed: paṭisaṅkhā anupassanāya paññāya ca ariya magga samādhi indriyassa ca padaṭṭhānam dhamma su ākkhāta tā
translated: The well-proclaimedness of the True Idea is the footing for the concentration and faith faculties of the noble path, in so far as it is shared in common by the concentration and faith faculties and skill in distinguishing what is and what is not the path.

original: svākkhātadhammassavanānusārena pavattakusalamūlakā lokiyalokuttarasampatti kusalamūlaropanā
analyzed: svākkhāta dhamma ssavana anusārena pavatta kusala mūlakā lokiya lokuttara sampatti kusala mūla ropanā
translated: The planting of the roots of good in the form of mundane and supramundane perfections, which is brought about by the influence of listening to the well-expounded Dhamma.

original: nāma, tāya ca tathāvidhakusalamūlakāya phalasamāpattiyā ca padaṭṭhānaṃ. Saṅghasuppaṭipannatā
analyzed: nāma tāya ca tathāvidha kusala mūlakāya phala samāpattiyā ca padaṭṭhānam saṅgha su paṭipanna tā
translated: The “roots of good” are the roots of good that occur with the hearing of the well-proclaimed Dhamma as their instigation. They are the instigation for the acquisition of mundane and supramundane excellence. And they are the footing for the attainment of the fruit of the roots of good of that kind.

original: saṅghasuṭṭhutāya saṅghassa upaṭṭhākānaṃ suṭṭhubhāvāya sappatissavāya vacanasampaṭicchanabhāvāya🔽padaṭṭhānaṃ. Satthusampadā satthari ceva dhammādīsu ca guṇaajānanatāya appasannānañca🔽pasādāya pasannānañca appamattakapasādānañca bhiyyobhāvāya vaḍḍhanāya padaṭṭhānaṃ.🔽Appaṭihatapātimokkhatā saṅghamajjhe vā parisamajjhe vā dummaṅkūnaṃ dummukhānaṃ dussīlānaṃ
analyzed: saṅgha suṭṭhu tāya saṅghassa upaṭṭhākānam suṭṭhu bhāvāya sa patissavāya vacana sampaṭicchana bhāvāya  padaṭṭhānam satthu sampadā satthari ca iva dhamma ādīsu ca guṇa a jānana tāya appasannānam ca  pasādāya pasannānam ca appamattaka pasādānam ca bhiyyobhāvāya vaḍḍhanāya padaṭṭhānam  a paṭihata pātimokkha tā saṅgha majjhe vā parisamajjhe vā dummaṅkūnam dummukhānam dussīlānam
translated: The “well-practisedness of the Community” is the footing for the well-practisedness of those who attend on the Community, for their being well-behaved, for their being obedient, and for their being willing.🔽The “perfection of the Master” is the footing for the knowledge of the Master’s special qualities and of the special qualities of the True Idea, etc., for the confidence of those who have no confidence, and for the increase and growth of the confidence of those who have confidence but in small measure.

original: puggalānaṃ niggahāya, pesalānaṃ pātimokkhasaṃvarādisīlasampannānaṃ puggalānaṃ phāsuvihārāya
analyzed: puggalānam niggahāya pesalānam pātimokkha saṃvara ādi sīla sampannānam puggalānam phāsu vihārāya
translated: The “unbroken moral discipline” is for the restraint of bad, unskilled people who are ill-disposed and ill-tempered, and for the ease of good, skilled people who are well-disposed and well-tempered and who are endowed with moral discipline consisting in restraint in the Community’s rules, etc.

original: ca padaṭṭhānaṃ hoti. Honto pana yathānurūpehi aññehi kāraṇehi sādhāraṇaṃ hutvā hotīti veditabbo.
analyzed: ca padaṭṭhānam hoti hontaḥ pana yathā anurūpehi aññehi kāraṇehi sādhāraṇam hutvā hoti iti veditabbo
translated: and it is the basis for the state of being. But the state of being is to be understood as common to other reasons in accordance with the circumstances.

original: “Vāsanābhāgiyasuttādīsu vuttadhammabhūmipadaṭṭhānānaṃ vibhattihārena vibhajitabbabhāvo
translated: The method of distribution of the states of consciousness and consciousness-concomitants, etc., mentioned in the “Discourse on the Categories of the Bases of Purification” and the rest,

original: amhehi kena jānitabbo saddahitabbo”ti pucchitabbattā “tenāhā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tassattho
analyzed: amhehi kena jānitabbaḥ saddahitabbaḥ iti pucchitabba ttā tena āha atiādi vuttam tassa atthaḥ
translated: should be known and believed by us through what? Because of the question, “Through what?” the reply is given, “Therefore he said.” The meaning of that is

original: vuttanayānusārena veditabbo.🔽“Ettāvatā ca vibhattihāro paripuṇṇo, añño niyutto natthī”ti vattabbattā “niyutto
analyzed: vutta naya anusārena veditabbo  ettāvatā ca vibhatti hāraḥ paripuṇṇaḥ aññaḥ niyutto natthi iti vattabbattā niyuttaḥ
translated: to be understood in the way already stated.

original: vibhattihāro”ti vuttaṃ. Yattha yattha sutte ye ye dhammādayo vuttā, tattha tattha
analyzed: vibhatti hāraḥ iti vuttam yattha yattha sutte ye ye dhamma ādayaḥ vuttā tattha tattha
translated: Because it should be said that “the method of distribution is complete up to here, and there is no other method of distribution to be applied,” the words “the method of distribution” are stated. Wherever in the suttas the states, etc., are mentioned,

original: sutte vuttesu tesu tesu dhammādīsu yathālābhavasena yo yo vibhattihāro yojito, so
analyzed: sutte vuttesu tesu tesu dhamma ādīsu yathā lābha vasena yaḥ yaḥ vibhatti hāraḥ yojitaḥ so
translated: in those states, etc., mentioned in the suttas, the method of distribution that is applied in accordance with the circumstances,

original: so vibhattihāro niddhāretvā yutto yojitoti attho daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: so vibhatti hāraḥ niddhāretvā yuttaḥ yojitaḥ iti atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: that method of distribution should be understood as extracted and applied.

original: Iti vibhattihāravibhaṅge sattibalānurūpā racitā
analyzed: iti vibhatti hāra vibhaṅge satti bala anurūpā racitā
translated: Thus the method of distribution has been composed in accordance with the strength of the saw.

original: Vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The exposition is finished.

original: Paṇḍitehi pana aṭṭhakathāṭīkānusāreneva gambhīrattho vitthārato vibhajitvā gahetabboti.
analyzed: paṇḍitehi pana aṭṭhakathā ṭīkā anusārena iva gambhīra atthaḥ vitthārataḥ vibhajitvā gahetabbaḥ ti
translated: But it should be taken in detail with its deep meaning analyzed by the wise in accordance with the commentaries and subcommentaries.

original: 9. Parivattanahāravibhaṅgavibhāvanā🔽35. Yena yena saṃvaṇṇāvisesabhūtena vibhattihāravibhaṅgena sutte vuttā dhammādayo
analyzed: parivattana hāra vibhaṅga vibhāvanā  yena yena saṃvaṇṇā visesa bhūtena vibhatti hāra vibhaṅgena sutte vuttāḥ dhamma ādayaḥ
translated: The Mode Conveying a Conversion🔽The mode of teaching called “conversion” is the mode of teaching by which the things stated in the sutta are converted into a mode of teaching that is a conversion.🔽The mode of teaching called “conversion” is the mode of teaching by which the things stated in the sutta are converted into a mode of teaching that is a conversion.🔽The mode of teaching called “conversion” is the mode of teaching by which the things stated in the sutta are converted into a mode of teaching that is a conversion.

original: vibhattā, so saṃvaṇṇāvisesabhūto vibhaṅgo paripuṇṇo, “katamo parivattanahāravibhaṅgo”ti
analyzed: vibhattā so saṃvaṇṇā visesa bhūtaḥ vibhaṅgo paripuṇṇaḥ katamo parivattana hāra vibhaṅgo ti
translated: The mode of teaching called “conversion” is the mode of teaching by which the things stated in the sutta are converted into a mode of teaching that is a conversion.

original: pucchitabbattā “tattha katamo parivattano hāro”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha tatthāti tesu
analyzed: pucchitabba ttā tattha katamo parivattanaḥ hāraḥ tiādi vuttam tattha tattha ati tesu
translated: The mode of teaching called “conversion” is the mode of teaching by which the things stated in the sutta are converted into a mode of teaching that is a conversion.🔽The mode of teaching called “conversion” is the mode of teaching by which the things stated in the sutta are converted into a mode of teaching that is a conversion.🔽The mode of teaching called “conversion” is the mode of teaching by which the things stated in the sutta are converted into a mode of teaching that is a conversion.🔽The mode of teaching called “conversion” is the mode of teaching by which the things stated in the sutta are converted into a mode of teaching that is a conversion.

original: niddiṭṭhesu soḷasasu desanāhārādīsu katamo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso parivattano hāro parivattanahāravibhaṅgo
analyzed: niddiṭṭhesu soḷasasu desanā hāra ādīsu katamaḥ saṃvaṇṇanā viseso parivattanaḥ hāro parivattana hāra vibhaṅgo
translated: The mode of teaching called “conversion” is the mode of teaching by which the things stated in the sutta are converted into a mode of teaching that is a conversion.

original: nāmāti pucchati. “Kusalākusale dhamme”tiādiniddesassa idāni mayā vuccamāno “sammādiṭṭhissa
analyzed: nāma ati pucchati kusala akusale dhamma iti ādi niddesassa idāni mayā vuccamāno sammādiṭṭhissa
translated: The mode of teaching called “conversion” is the mode of teaching by which the things stated in the sutta are converted into a mode of teaching that is a conversion.🔽The mode of teaching called “conversion” is the mode of teaching by which the things stated in the sutta are converted into a mode of teaching that is a conversion.🔽The mode of teaching called “conversion” is the mode of teaching by which the things stated in the sutta are converted into a mode of teaching that is a conversion.🔽The mode of teaching called “conversion” is the mode of teaching by which the things stated in the sutta are converted into a mode of teaching that is a conversion.

original: purisapuggalassā”tiādiko vitthārasaṃvaṇṇanāviseso parivattano hāro parivattanahāravibhaṅgo🔽nāmāti attho gahetabbo.
analyzed: 🔽nāma ati atthaḥ gahetabbo
translated: The mode of teaching called “conversion” is the mode of teaching by which the things stated in the sutta

original: “Saṃvaṇṇiyamāne sutte niddiṭṭhassa katamassa bhāvitabbassa kusalassa katamo paṭipakkho,
analyzed: saṃvaṇṇiyamāne sutte niddiṭṭhassa katamassa bhāvitabbassa kusalassa katamaḥ paṭipakkho
translated: “When a sutta is being expounded, what is the opposite of the profitable to be developed that is demonstrated?

original: kathaṃ parivattetabbo”ti pucchitabbattā imassa bhāvitabbassa kusalassa ayaṃ paṭipakkho,
analyzed: katham parivattetabbaḥ iti pucchitabba ttā imassa bhāvitabbassa kusalassa ayam paṭipakkho
translated: How is it to be turned about? ”

original: evaṃ pahātabbabhāvavasena parivattetabboti dassento “sammādiṭṭhissa purisapuggalassā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: evam pahātabba bhāva vasena parivattetabbaḥ iti dassentaḥ sammādiṭṭhissa purisa puggalassa ati ādim āha
translated: In order to answer this question, he said “In the case of a person with right view” and so on, showing that this is the opposite of the profitable to be developed and that it is to be turned about by abandoning.

original: Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana –
analyzed: aṭṭhakathā ayam pana
translated: But in the commentary it is said:

original: “Tattha yasmā saṃvaṇṇiyamāne sutte yathāniddiṭṭhānaṃ kusalākusaladhammānaṃ paṭipakkhabhūte
analyzed: tattha yasmā saṃvaṇṇiyamāne sutte yathā niddiṭṭhānam kusala akusala dhammānam paṭipakkha bhūte
translated: “Herein, since the unprofitable and profitable ideas that are demonstrated in the sutta being expounded are the opposites of the unprofitable and profitable ideas respectively,

original: akusalakusaladhamme pahātabbabhāvādivasena niddhāraṇaṃ paṭipakkhato parivattanaṃ,
analyzed: akusala kusala dhamme pahātabba bhāva ādi vasena niddhāraṇam paṭipakkhato parivattanam
translated: the demonstration of the unprofitable and profitable ideas by way of what is to be abandoned, etc., is the turning about from the opposite.

original: tasmā ‘sammādiṭṭhissa purisapuggalassa micchādiṭṭhi nijjiṇṇā bhavatī’tiādi āraddha”nti –
analyzed: tasmā sammādiṭṭhissa purisa puggalassa micchādiṭṭhi nijjiṇṇā bhavati itiādi āraddhanti
translated: So it is said ‘In the case of a person with right view, wrong view is discarded’ and so on.

original: Vuttaṃ. Pahāyakassa hi dhammassa pahātabbabhāvavasena niddhāraṇaṃ, pahātabbassa ca
analyzed: vuttam pahāyakassa hi dhammassa pahātabba bhāva vasena niddhāraṇam pahātabbassa ca
translated: For the demonstration of what is to be abandoned is by way of what is to be abandoned, and the demonstration of what is to be abandoned is by way of what is to be abandoned.

original: dhammassa pahāyakabhāvavasena niddhāraṇaṃ paṭipakkhato parivattanaṃ nāma hoti. Tattha
analyzed: dhammassa pahāyaka bhāva vasena niddhāraṇam paṭipakkhato parivattanam nāma hoti tattha
translated: The definition by way of the abandoning of the Dhamma is called the “reversal from the opposite.” Therein,

original: sammādiṭṭhissāti sammā sundarā pasatthā diṭṭhi yassa puggalassāti sammādiṭṭhi. Puggalapadaṭṭhānā
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhissa ati sammā sundarā pasatthā diṭṭhi yassa puggalassa ati sammādiṭṭhi puggala padaṭṭhānā
translated: “Of right view”: Right view is that which is right, good, and praiseworthy. The person who has right view is called “one of right view.”

original: hi ayaṃ desanā. Tena vuttaṃ “purisapuggalassā”ti. Sā pana sammādiṭṭhi kammakammaphalādisaddahanavasena
analyzed: hi ayam desanā tena vuttam purisa puggalassa ati sā pana sammādiṭṭhi kamma kamma phala ādi saddahana vasena
translated: This teaching is based on the person. Therefore it is said: “of a person.” But that right view is included without exception, whether it occurs by way of belief in kamma, kamma-result, etc.,

original: vā aniccādivipassanāvasena vā maggasammādassanavasena vā pavattā niravasesāva gahitā.
analyzed: vā anicca ādi vipassanā vasena vā magga sammādassana vasena vā pavattā niravasesā ava gahitā
translated: by way of insight into impermanence, etc., or by way of the path and right view.

original: “Yāya bhāvitāya sammādiṭṭhiyā pahātabbā micchādiṭṭhi nijjiṇṇā bhavati, yadi kevalā
analyzed: yāya bhāvitāya sammādiṭṭhiyā pahātabbā micchādiṭṭhi nijjiṇṇā bhavati yadi kevalā
translated: “By which right view that is developed, wrong view is worn away”: if only wrong view were worn away,

original: micchādiṭṭhiyeva nijjiṇṇā bhavati, evaṃ sati tadavasesā akusalā dhammā ajiṇṇā
analyzed: micchādiṭṭhiyā iva nijjiṇṇā bhavati evam sati tad avasesāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ ajiṇṇā
translated: then the unwholesome states that remain would not be worn away.

original: Bhaveyyu”nti vattabbattā “ye cassa micchādiṭṭhipaccayā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Micchādiṭṭhipaccayā
analyzed: bhaveyyun ti vattabbattā ye ca ssa micchādiṭṭhi paccayā tiādi vuttam micchādiṭṭhi paccayā
translated: In order to show this, it is said: “With the support of wrong view” and so on. With the support of wrong view,

original: aneke pāpakā akusalāyeva dhammā ca uppajjeyyuṃ uppajjanārahā bhaveyyuṃ, te ca akusalā
analyzed: aneke pāpakā akusalāya iva dhammā ca uppajjeyyuṃ uppajjana arahāḥ bhaveyyuṃ te ca akusalā
translated: and many evil, unwholesome states would arise that are fit to arise, and those unwholesome states

original: dhammā assa sammādiṭṭhisampannassa purisapuggalassa nijjiṇṇā pahātabbārahā anuppajjanasabhāvā
analyzed: dhammā assa sammādiṭṭhi sampannassa purisa puggalassa nijjiṇṇā pahātabba arahāḥ an uppajjana sabhāvā
translated: would be exhausted in one who has right view, and would be fit to be abandoned, and would be of the nature of not arising.

original: honti. Tenāha bhagavā – “upādānanirodhā bhavanirodho”ti.
analyzed: honti tena āha bhagavā upādāna nirodhāḥ bhava nirodhā iti
translated: Therefore the Blessed One said: “With the cessation of attachment there is cessation of being.”

original: “Yadi sammādiṭṭhissa purisapuggalassa micchādiṭṭhi, tappaccayā akusaladhammāyeva
analyzed: yadi sammādiṭṭhissa purisa puggalassa micchādiṭṭhi tad paccayā akusala dhammāya eva
translated: “If for one who has right view, wrong view is exhausted, and unwholesome states that have wrong view as condition are exhausted,

original: nijjiṇṇā bhavanti, evaṃ sati sammādiṭṭhipaccayā kusalā dhammā na sambhaveyyu”nti
analyzed: nijjiṇṇāḥ bhavanti evam sati sammādiṭṭhi paccayā kusalāḥ dhammā na sambhaveyyun ti
translated: then in that case wholesome states that have right view as condition would not come to be.”

original: vattabbattā “sammādiṭṭhipaccayā cā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Assa sammādiṭṭhisampannassa purisapuggalassa🔽uppajjanārahā sammādiṭṭhipaccayā aneke kusalā samathavipassanā vā bodhipakkhiyā vā
analyzed: vattabbattā sammādiṭṭhi paccayā ca atiādi vuttam assa sammādiṭṭhi sampannassa purisa puggalassa  uppajjana arahā sammādiṭṭhi paccayā aneke kusalā samatha vipassanā vā bodhi pakkhiyā vā
translated: Because this should be said, “And with right view as condition” and so on is said. For one who has right view,

original: dhammā sambhavanti, uppannā ca te dhammā assa sammādiṭṭhisampannassa purisapuggalassa
