analyzed: dhammā sambhavanti uppannā ca te dhammā assa sammā diṭṭhi sampannassa purisa puggalassa
translated: many wholesome states that are fit to arise, that have right view as condition, come to be, such as the serenity and insight of the path or the factors of enlightenment. And those states that have arisen,🔽for one who has right view, are not exhausted.

original: santāne punappunaṃ pavattanavasena bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchanti.
analyzed: santāne punappunam pavattana vasena bhāvanā pāripūrim gacchanti
translated: and they reach fulfilment of development by occurring again and again in the continuity.

original: Sammādiṭṭhiyā paṭipakkhānaṃ micchādiṭṭhiyā, tappaccayānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ parivattanabhāvo🔽ācariyena vibhatto, amhehi ca ñāto, “sammāsaṅkappassa dhammassa paṭipakkho dhammo
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhiyā paṭipakkhānam micchādiṭṭhiyā tad paccayānam akusalānam dhammānam parivattana bhāvaḥ  ācariyena vibhattaḥ amhehi ca ñātaḥ sammāsaṅkappassa dhammassa paṭipakkhaḥ dhammaḥ
translated: The teacher has explained the way in which the unprofitable ideas that are opposed to right view and that have right view’s opposite for their condition,

original: kathaṃ parivattetabbo”ti vattabbattā “sammāsaṅkappassa purisapuggalassā”tiādi vuttaṃ.🔽Yojanattha ādayo vuttanayānusārena veditabbā. Sammā sundarā pasatthā vācā yassa puggalassāti
analyzed: katham parivattetabbaḥ iti vattabbattā sammāsaṅkappassa purisa puggalassa atiādi vuttam  yojana atthe ādayaḥ vutta naya anusārena veditabbā sammā sundarā pasatthā vācā yassa puggalassa ati
translated: and we have understood it. Now, the question is ‘How is the idea that is the opposite of right thought to be turned about? ‘, and so the answer is given in the way beginning ‘In the case of a person with right thought’ .🔽The meanings of the words should be understood in the way already stated. He who has right speech, that is, speech that is good, lovely, and praiseworthy, is a person with right speech.

original: sammāvāco, tassa sammāvācassa. “Purisapuggalassā”tiādīnaṃ atthopi vuttanayena veditabbo.🔽Ayaṃ pana visesatthosammā aviparītato vimuttiñāṇadassanaṃ yassa puggalassāti sammāvimuttiñāṇadassano,
analyzed: tassa sammāvācassa purisa puggalassa ati ādīnam atthaḥ api vutta nayena veditabbaḥ  ayam pana visesa ttho sammā aviparītataḥ vimutti ñāṇa dassanam yassa puggalassa ati sammāvimutti ñāṇa dassano
translated: The meaning of the words ‘in the case of a person with right speech’ and so on should be understood in the way already stated.🔽But this is the special meaning here: he who has right knowledge and vision of deliverance, that is, of the kind already stated, is a person with right knowledge and vision of deliverance.

original: tassa sammāvimuttiñāṇadassanassa paccavekkhaṇañāṇadassanasampannassa purisapuggalassa
analyzed: tassa sammāvimutti ñāṇa dassanassa paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇa dassana sampannassa purisa puggalassa
translated: In the case of a person with right knowledge and vision of deliverance, who is thus perfected in knowledge and vision,

original: “avimuttāva samānā vimuttā maya”nti micchābhinivesavasena pavattaṃ micchāvimuttiñāṇadassanaṃ
analyzed: a vimuttāḥ ava samānāḥ vimuttāḥ micchā abhinivesa vasena pavattam micchāvimutti ñāṇa dassanam
translated: Wrong view of deliverance is the view that occurs by way of misapprehension, as follows: “We are not delivered, yet we are delivered.”

original: nijjiṇṇaṃ vigataṃ bhavati. “Ye cassā”tiādīnaṃ anusandhyādiko vuttanayānusārena veditabbo.
analyzed: nijjiṇṇam vigatam bhavati ye ca ssa ati ādīnam anusandhi ādikaḥ vutta naya anusārena veditabbaḥ
translated: It is discarded and abandoned. The rest of the passage should be understood in the same way as stated above.

original: 36. “Sammādiṭṭhissātiādinā sammādiṭṭhiādīnaṃ kusalānaṃ paṭipakkhā micchādiṭṭhādikāyeva
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhissa atiādinā sammādiṭṭhi ādīnam kusalānam paṭipakkhāḥ micchādiṭṭha ādikāya eva
translated: “Wrong view, etc.,” etc. Wrong view, etc., are the unwholesome opposites of right view, etc.

original: akusalā pahātabbabhāvena parivattetabbā”ti pucchitabbattā pāṇātipātāveramaṇiādīnaṃ
analyzed: akusalā pahātabba bhāvena parivattetabbā ati pucchitabba ttā pāṇātipāta averamaṇi ādīnam
translated: They should be turned away from by being abandoned.

original: kusalānaṃ paṭipakkhā pāṇātipātādikāpi akusalā pahātabbabhāvena parivattetabbāti dassetuṃ🔽“yassa vā pāṇātipātā paṭiviratassā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana “evaṃ sammādiṭṭhiādimukhena
analyzed: kusalānam paṭipakkhā pāṇātipāta ādikā api akusalā pahātabba bhāvena parivattetabbā ti dassetuṃ  yassa vā pāṇātipātā paṭiviratassa atiādi vuttam aṭṭhakathāyam pana evam sammādiṭṭhi ādi mukhena
translated: “The abstention from killing living beings, etc.,” etc. The abstention from killing living beings, etc., are the wholesome opposites of killing living beings, etc.🔽They should be turned away from by being abandoned.🔽In the commentary, however, the following explanation is given: “Having shown wrong view, etc., by way of right view, etc.,

original: micchādiṭṭhiādiṃ dassetvā puna pāṇātipātaadinnādānakāmesumicchācārādito veramaṇiyādīhi
analyzed: micchādiṭṭhi ādim dassetvā puna veramaṇiya ādīhi
translated: he now shows the abstention from killing living beings, etc., by way of the abstention from killing living beings, etc.,

original: pāṇātipātādīnaṃ parivattanaṃ dassetuṃ ‘yassā’tiādi āraddha”nti vuttaṃ. Tadaṅgādivasenapahīno
analyzed: pāṇa atipāta ādīnam parivattanam dassetum yassa ati ādi āraddhanti vuttam tad aṅga ādi vasena apahīnaḥ
translated: is abandoned by means of the factors, etc.,

original: hoti. Kālavādissāti vaditabbakāle vaditabbaṃ vadati sīlenāti kālavādī, tassa.
analyzed: hoti kāla vādissa ati vaditabba kāle vaditabbam vadati sīlena ati kāla vādī tassa
translated: is a speaker of the time, and he is a speaker of what is to be spoken at the time when it is to be spoken.🔽“They should be reversed in the way stated” .

original: “Yathāvuttappakāreneva parivattetabbā”ti pucchitabbattā aññena pakārenapi parivattetabbāti
analyzed: yathā vutta ppakārena iva parivattetabbā ati pucchitabbattā aññena pakārena api parivattetabbā ati
translated: In order to show that they can be reversed in another way as well, since they can be asked about,

original: dassetuṃ “ye ca kho kecī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana “ye ca kho kecītiādinā
analyzed: dassetum ye ca kho keci itiādi vuttam aṭṭhakathāyam pana ye ca kho keci iti ādinā
translated: “And whatever” is said. But in the commentary it is said:

original: sammādiṭṭhiādimukheneva micchādiṭṭhiādīhi eva parivattanaṃ pakārantarena dassetī”ti
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhi ādi mukhena iva micchādiṭṭhi ādīhi eva parivattanam pakāra antarena dasseti iti
translated: “By means of right view, etc., he shows the reversal by means of wrong view, etc., in another way,🔽saying ‘And whatever’ .

original: vuttaṃ. Tattha keci micchādiṭṭhikamicchāsaṅkappādikāyeva puggalā paresaṃ ariyānaṃ
analyzed: vuttam tattha keci micchādiṭṭhika micchāsaṅkappa ādikāya iva puggalā paresam ariyānam
translated: Herein, some people who are of wrong view, wrong thinking, etc., only censure the Noble Ones’

original: ariyaṃ aṭṭhaṅgikaṃ maggaṃ garahanti. Sandiṭṭhikā sandiṭṭhe niyuttā, sahadhammikā
analyzed: ariyam aṭṭhaṅgikam maggam garahanti sandiṭṭhikā sandiṭṭhe niyuttā sahadhammikā
translated: Noble Eightfold Path. They are seen in the visible world, they are bound to the visible world. They are in accordance with the True Idea,

original: saha dhammena kāraṇena ye vattanti sahadhammikā. Gārayhā garahitabbākāre yuttā. Vādā
analyzed: saha dhammena kāraṇena ye vattanti sahadhammikāḥ gārayhāḥ garahitabba ākāre yuttāḥ vādāḥ
translated: they are in accordance with the True Idea as a reason. They are in accordance with what is to be censured, they are bound to what is to be censured.

original: ca anuvādā ca vādānuvādā, te bhavanto sammādiṭṭhiñca dhammaṃ garahanti. Tena garahaṇena.
analyzed: ca anuvādā ca vāda anuvādā te bhavantaḥ sammādiṭṭhim ca dhammam garahanti tena garahaṇena
translated: and the censure of the right view, and the censure of the right view’s teaching. Because of that censure,

original: Pujjā pūjitabbā ca na bhavanti, pāsaṃsā pasaṃsitabbā ca na bhavanti. Evantiādīsu🔽sammāsaṅkappaṃ vā sammāvācādikaṃ vā visuṃ visuṃ sammāsaṅkappañca te bhavanto dhammaṃ🔽garahanti. Tena hi ye micchāsaṅkappikā, te bhavanto na pujjā ca pāsaṃsā ca…pe… sammāvimuttiñca🔽te bhavanto dhammaṃ garahanti. Tena hi ye micchādiṭṭhivācikā, te bhavanto na pujjā🔽ca pāsaṃsā ca. Sammāvimuttiñāṇadassanañca te bhavanto dhammaṃ garahanti. Tena hi
analyzed: pujjā pūjitabbā ca na bhavanti pāsaṃsā pasaṃsitabbā ca na bhavanti evanti ādīsu  sammā saṅkappam vā sammā vācā ādikam vā visum visum sammā saṅkappam ca te bhavantaḥ dhammaṃ  garahanti tena hi ye micchāsaṅkappikā te bhavantaḥ na pujjā ca pāsaṃsā cape sammāvimuttiñca  te bhavantaḥ dhammam garahanti tena hi ye micchādiṭṭhi vācikā te bhavantaḥ na pujjā  ca pāsaṃsā ca sammāvimutti ñāṇa dassanañca te bhavantaḥ dhammam garahanti tena hi
translated: they are not worshipped, and they are not worthy of worship, they are not praised, and they are not worthy of praise. In the words beginning with ‘thus’,

analyzed: ye micchāvimuttikā te bhavantaḥ na pujjā ca pāsaṃsā ca sammāvimutti ñāṇa dassanañca 🔽te bhavantaḥ dhammam garahanti tena hi ye micchāvimutti ñāṇa dassanikā te bhavantaḥ
translated: they censure the right intention, and the right speech, etc., separately, saying: ‘This right intention, and this right speech, and this right action, and this right livelihood, and this right effort, and this right mindfulness, and this right concentration, and this right knowledge, and this right freedom, and this right view, and this right view’s teaching, and this right intention, this right effort, and this right mindfulness

original: na pujjā ca pāsaṃsā cāti yojanā kātabbā. “Micchāvimuttiñāṇadassanā”tipi pāṭho atthi.
analyzed: na pujjā ca pāsaṃsā ca ati yojanā kātabbā micchā vimutti ñāṇa dassanā ti pi pāṭhaḥ atthi
translated: There is also the reading “micchāvimuttiñāṇadassanā” .

original: “Ariyamaggasammādiṭṭhādīnaṃ garahavaseneva micchādiṭṭhādayo ca parivattetabbā, nāvasesānaṃ🔽pasaṃsāvasenā”ti vattabbattā kāmādīnaṃ pasaṃsāvasenapi kāmānaṃ paṭipakkhā veramaṇiyādayopi
analyzed: ariya magga sammādiṭṭha ādīnam garaha vasena iva micchādiṭṭha ādayaḥ ca parivattetabbāḥ na avasesānam  pasaṃsā vasena ati vattabba ttā kāma ādīnam pasaṃsā vasena api kāmānam paṭipakkhāḥ veramaṇiya ādayaḥ api
translated: “The wrong views, etc., should be construed with the words ‘blame’ and ‘fault’ in the case of the right view, etc., of the noble path,🔽but not with the words ‘praise’ and ‘virtue’ in the case of the rest.

original: parivattetabbāti dassetuṃ “ye ca kho keci evamāhaṃsū”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha bhuñjitabbā🔽kāmā, paribhuñjitabbā kāmā, āsevitabbā kāmā, nisevitabbā kāmāti ettha kāmīyanteti🔽kāmāti kammasādhanavasena vatthukāmā gahitā, nātipaṇītā kāmā bhuñjitabbā, atipaṇītā🔽kāmā pari samantato bhuñjitabbā. Atipaṇītatarā kāmā ā bhuso sevitabbā, niyatā sevitabbā.
analyzed: parivattetabbā ti dassetum ye ca kho keci evam āhaṃsu itiādi vuttam tattha bhuñjitabbā  kāmā paribhuñjitabbā kāmā āsevitabbā kāmā nisevitabbā kāmā ati ettha kāmīyantā iti  kāmā ati kamma sādhana vasena vatthu kāmā gahitā na ati paṇītā kāmā bhuñjitabbā ati paṇītā  kāmā pari samantataḥ bhuñjitabbā atipaṇītatarā kāmā ā bhuso sevitabbā niyatā sevitabbā
translated: In order to show that the words ‘praise’ and ‘virtue’ should be construed with the words ‘sense desires,’ etc., the text says: ‘There were some who said: “Sense desires should be enjoyed, sense desires should be indulged in, sense desires should be resorted to, sense desires should be pursued.” ’🔽Herein, sense desires are enjoyed means🔽sense desires are used up. Sense desires should be indulged in means sense desires should be indulged in all round. Sense desires should be resorted to means sense desires should be resorted to much. Sense desires should be pursued means sense desires should be pursued much.

original: Bhāvayitabbā kāmā, bahulīkātabbā kāmāti ettha pana kāmentīti kāmāti kattusādhanavasena
analyzed: bhāvayitabbā kāmā bahulīkātabbā kāmā ti ettha pana kāmenti iti kāmā ati kattu sādhana vasena
translated: Sense desires should be developed means sense desires should be made to occur. Sense desires should be made much means sense desires should be made much.

original: kilesakāmā gahitā, punappunaṃ uppādanavasena bhāvayitabbā vaḍḍhāpetabbā pavattetabbā
analyzed: kilesa kāmā gahitā punappunam uppādana vasena bhāvayitabbā vaḍḍhāpetabbā pavattetabbā
translated: Sensual desires as defilements are meant. They are to be developed, increased, and extended by being aroused again and again.

original: kilesakāmā, bahūnaṃ punappunaṃ uppādanavasena kātabbā vaḍḍhāpetabbā kilesakāmāti
analyzed: kilesa kāmā bahūnam punappunam uppādana vasena kātabbā vaḍḍhāpetabbā kilesa kāmā ati
translated: Sensual desires as defilements are to be done, increased, and extended by being aroused again and again in many ways.

original: ye ca kāmavasikā puthujjanā keci evamāhaṃsu tesaṃ kāmavasikānaṃ puthujjanānaṃ kesañci
analyzed: ye ca kāma vasikā puthujjanā tesam kāma vasikānam puthujjanānam kesaṃcid
translated: Some ordinary people who are subject to lust say this:

original: tādisehi kāmehi veramaṇī kusalacetanā paṭipakkhavasena adhammo asevitabbo nāma āpajjeyyāti
analyzed: tādisehi kāmehi veramaṇī kusala cetanā paṭipakkha vasena adhammaḥ asevitabbaḥ nāma āpajjeyya ati
translated: “One should not cultivate the unwholesome volition called abstinence from such sensual desires as a counter-state.”

original: adhippāyo gahetabbo.
analyzed: adhippāyaḥ gahetabbaḥ
translated: This is the intended meaning that should be grasped.

original: Antadvayavasena parivattanaṃ dassetuṃ “ye vā pana kecī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Attakilamathānuyogo
analyzed: anta dvaya vasena parivattanam dassetum ye vā pana keci itiādi vuttam atta kilamatha anuyogaḥ
translated: In order to show the turning away from the two extremes, the text says: “Or some say: ‘Any kind of self-mortification,’ etc. Self-mortification

original: dhammoti niyyānikoti ye vā pana pañcātapādipaṭipannakā tatthiyā evamāhaṃsu, tesaṃ
analyzed: dhammoti niyyānikoti ye vā pana pañca ātapa ādi paṭipannakā tatthiyāḥ evam āhaṃsu tesam
translated: is the Dhamma that leads to emancipation. Or some ascetics and brahmins who practice the five heats say this:

original: pañcātapādipaṭipannakānaṃ niyyāniko dhammo majjhimāpaṭipadāsaṅkhāto vipassanāsahito
analyzed: pañca ātapa ādi paṭipannakānam niyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ majjhimā paṭipadā saṅkhātaḥ vipassanā sahitaḥ
translated: “The Dhamma that leads to emancipation for those who practice the five heats is the middle way called the path of practice, which is accompanied by insight.

original: ariyamaggo adhammo aniyyāniko abhāvetabbo nāma āpajjeyyāti. Sukhadukkhavasenapi parivattanaṃ🔽dassetuṃ “ye ca kho”tiādi vuttaṃ. “Pāpaṃ nijjarāpessāmā”ti attahiṃsanādivasena paṭipannakānaṃ
analyzed: ariya maggaḥ adhammaḥ aniyyānikaḥ a bhāvetabbaḥ nāma āpajjeyya ati sukha dukkha vasena api parivattanam  dassetum ye ca kho tiādi vuttam pāpam nijjarāpessāma ati atta hiṃsana ādi vasena paṭipannakānam
translated: … the noble path would be an unprofitable state not to be developed.🔽The turning by way of pleasure and pain is shown by “And those who say” .

original: pavatto sarīratāpano dukkho dhammo niyyānikoti.
analyzed: pavattaḥ sarīra tāpanaḥ dukkhaḥ dhammo niyyānikaḥ ti
translated: The bodily pain that occurs in those who practice by way of self-mortification, etc., is a painful state that is profitable.

original: Ye ca tathāpaṭipannakā keci evamāhaṃsu, tesaṃ tathāpaṭipannakānaṃ anavajjapaccayaparibhogavasena pavatto sarīradukkhūpasamo sukho dhammo adhammo appavattetabbo āpajjeyyāti.
analyzed: ye ca tathāpaṭipannakā keci evam āhaṃsu tesam tathāpaṭipannakānam anavajja paccaya paribhoga vasena pavattaḥ sarīra dukkha upasamaḥ sukhaḥ dhammaḥ adhammo a pavattetabbo āpajjeyya ati
translated: And those who say that those who practice in this way are practicing the way to purity, and that the bodily pain that occurs in them through their use of blameless requisites is a pleasant state that is unprofitable.

original: Antadvayādivasena parivattanaṃ ācariyena vibhattaṃ, amhehi ca ñātaṃ, “kathaṃ asubhasaññādivasena🔽parivattetabbo”ti pucchitabbattā evaṃ asubhasaññādivasena subhasaññādikā parivattetabbāti
analyzed: anta dvaya ādi vasena parivattanam ācariyena vibhattam amhehi ca ñātam katham asubha saññā ādi vasena  parivattetabbaḥ ti pucchitabba ttā evam asubha saññā ādi vasena subha saññā ādikā parivattetabbā ti
translated: The turning by way of the two extremes, etc., has been analyzed by the teacher and is known to us. Since it should be asked, “How is the turning by way of the perception of foulness, etc.,🔽to be shown?” the following is stated to show the turning by way of the perception of foulness, etc., of the perception of beauty, etc.: “Or alternatively, it can be shown thus.”

original: dassetuṃ “yathā vā panā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana “idāni asubhasaññādimukhena
analyzed: dassetum yathā vā pana atiādi vuttam aṭṭhakathāyam pana idāni asubha saññā ādi mukhena
translated: But in the commentary it is said: “Now, by way of the perception of foulness, etc.,

original: subhasaññādiparivattanaṃ dassetuṃ ‘yathā vā panā’tiādi vutta”nti vuttaṃ. Sabbasaṅkhāresūti🔽tebhūmakasaṅkhāresu. Āraddhavipassakassa hi tebhūmakā dhammā kilesāsucipaggharaṇakattā
analyzed: subha saññā ādi parivattanam dassetum yathā vā pana atiādi vuttanti vuttam sabba saṅkhāresu  tebhūmaka saṅkhāresu āraddha vipassakassa hi tebhūmakāḥ dhammā kilesa asuci paggharaṇaka ttā
translated: In all formations :

original: asubhato upaṭṭhahanti.🔽“Yadi sarūpatoyeva imesaṃ ime paṭipakkhāti aparivattetabbā siyuṃ, evaṃ sati niravasesā
analyzed: asubhataḥ upaṭṭhahanti  yadi sarūpataḥ yā iva imesam ime siyum evam sati niravasesā
translated: in the formations of the three planes. For when a man has begun insight, things in the three planes appear to him as foul because they are the source of defilements and impurities.

original: ca paṭipakkhā na sakkā parivattetuṃ, kathaṃ sakkā parivattetu”nti vattabbattā parivattanalakkhaṇaṃ
analyzed: ca paṭipakkhā na sakkā parivattetum katham sakkā parivattetum ti vattabba ttā parivattana lakkhaṇam
translated: “If these were to appear as their opposites only by their individual essences, then they would have to be turned about in that way. But if that were so, then it would be impossible to turn about all the opposites without remainder. So how is it done? ”

original: dassento “yaṃ yaṃ vā panā”tiādimāha. Tattha kusalaṃ vā akusalaṃ vā yaṃ yaṃ dhammaṃ
analyzed: dassentaḥ yam yam vā pana ati ādim āha tattha kusalam vā akusalam vā yam yam dhammaṃ
translated: In order to show the characteristic of turning about, he said “Or else, whatever” . Herein, whatever profitable or unprofitable state

original: parivattetukāmo ācariyo cittena rocayati diṭṭhiyā upagacchati, kusalassa vā akusalassa
analyzed: parivattetu kāmaḥ ācariyaḥ cittena rocayati diṭṭhiyā upagacchati kusalassa vā akusalassa
translated: the teacher wishes to turn about, he delights in it with his mind and he assents to it with his view. The opposite of that profitable or unprofitable state

original: vā tassa tassa rucikassa upagatassa dhammassa yo paṭipakkho, so paṭipakkhadhammo
analyzed: vā tassa tassa rucikassa upagatassa dhammassa yaḥ paṭipakkho so paṭipakkha dhammo
translated: in which he delights and to which he assents is the opposite state.

original: asaddhammo assa dhammassa aniṭṭhato paccanīkato ajjhāpanno pariññāto. Iṭṭhaṃ vā aniṭṭhaṃ
analyzed: asat dhammaḥ assa dhammassa aniṭṭhataḥ paccanīkataḥ ajjhāpannaḥ pariññātaḥ iṭṭham vā aniṭṭham
translated: and the unliked is the opposite of the liked.

original: vā yaṃ yaṃ dhammaṃ parivattetukāmo ācariyo cittena rocayati diṭṭhiyā upagacchati,
analyzed: vā yam yam dhammam parivattetu kāmaḥ ācariyaḥ cittena rocayati diṭṭhiyā upagacchati
translated: When the teacher wants to exchange any liked or unliked idea, he approves it mentally and accepts it by view.

original: iṭṭhassa vā aniṭṭhassa vā tassa tassa rucikassa dhammassa yo paṭipakkho, so paṭipakkhadhammo
analyzed: iṭṭhassa vā aniṭṭhassa vā tassa tassa rucikassa dhammassa yaḥ paṭipakkhaḥ so paṭipakkha dhammo
translated: The opposite of the liked or unliked idea that he approves is the opposite idea.

original: assa dhammassa aniṭṭhato paccanīkadhammato ajjhāpanno pariññāto bhavatīti parivattetukāmena🔽icchitabbadhammānurūpapaṭipakkhavasena parivattanaṃ kātabbanti parivattane paṭipakkhalakkhaṇaṃ
analyzed: assa dhammassa an iṭṭhataḥ paccanīka dhammataḥ ajjhāpanno pariññātaḥ bhavati iti parivattetu kāmena  icchitabba dhamma anurūpa paṭipakkha vasena parivattanam kātabban ti parivattane paṭipakkha lakkhaṇam
translated: When he wants to exchange it, the opposite idea is understood as the opposite of the unliked idea.🔽So the characteristic of the opposite is stated in the exchange as follows: “The exchange should be made by the opposite of the idea that is wanted.”

original: vuttaṃ. Tena aṭṭhakathāyaṃ vuttaṃ – “paṭipakkhassa lakkhaṇaṃ vibhāvetī”ti.
analyzed: vuttam tena aṭṭhakathāyam vuttam paṭipakkhassa lakkhaṇam vibhāveti iti
translated: Hence it is said in the commentary: “He shows the characteristic of the opposite” .

original: “Evaṃ vuttappakāraṃ parivattanaṃ amhehi kathaṃ saddahitabba”nti vattabbatā “tenāhā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: evam vutta ppakāram parivattanam amhehi katham saddahitabbam ti vattabba tā tena āha atiādi vuttam
translated: “How can we believe that such an exchange is possible?”—to answer this he says “tenāha” , etc.

original: “Ettāvatā parivatto hāro paripuṇṇo, añño niyutto natthī”ti vattabbattā “niyutto parivattano🔽hāro”ti vuttaṃ. Yasmiṃ sutte kusalākusale niddiṭṭhe paṭipakkhavasena nīharitvā yathāsambhavaṃ
analyzed: ettāvatā parivattaḥ hāro paripuṇṇaḥ aññaḥ niyutto natthi iti vattabbattā niyuttaḥ parivattano  hāraḥ iti vuttam yasmin sutte kusala akusale niddiṭṭhe paṭipakkha vasena nīharitvā yathāsambhavam
translated: In a Thread in which profitable and unprofitable ideas are demonstrated, the Mode of Conveying a Reversal is added by the method of the opposite of the opposite of the profitable and unprofitable ideas respectively.

original: yo yo parivattano hāro niyutto, tasmiṃ sutte niddiṭṭhe paṭipakkhavasena nīharitvā🔽so so parivattano hāro niyutto niddhāretvā yutto yojitoti attho gahetabboti.🔽Iti parivattanahāravibhaṅge sattibalānurūpā racitā🔽Vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā.🔽Paṇḍitehi pana aṭṭhakathāṭīkānusārena gambhīrattho vitthārato vibhajitvā gahetabboti.🔽10. Vevacanahāravibhaṅgavibhāvanā
analyzed: yaḥ yaḥ parivattano hāro niyuttaḥ tasmin sutte niddiṭṭhe paṭipakkha vasena nīharitvā  saḥ so parivattano hāraḥ niyuttaḥ niddhāretvā yuttaḥ yojitaḥ iti atthaḥ gahetabbaḥ ti  iti parivattana hāra vibhaṅge satti bala anurūpā racitā  vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā  paṇḍitehi pana aṭṭhakathā ṭīkā anusārena gambhīra atthaḥ vitthārataḥ vibhajitvā gahetabbaḥ ti  vevacana hāra vibhaṅga vibhāvanā
translated: In a Thread in which the profitable and unprofitable ideas are demonstrated, the Mode of Conveying a Reversal is added by the method of the opposite of the opposite of the profitable and unprofitable ideas respectively.

original: 37. Yena yena saṃvaṇṇanāvisesabhūtena pavattanahāravibhaṅgena parivattetabbā suttatthā
analyzed: yena yena saṃvaṇṇanā visesa bhūtena pavattana hāra vibhaṅgena parivattetabbā suttatthā

original: vibhattā, so saṃvaṇṇanāvisesabhūto parivattanahāravibhaṅgo paripuṇṇo, “katamo vevacanahāravibhaṅgo”ti🔽pucchitabbattā “tattha katamo vevacano hāro”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha tatthāti tesu niddiṭṭhesu🔽soḷasasu desanāhārādīsu katamo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso vevacano hāro vevacanahāravibhaṅgo
analyzed: vibhattā saḥ saṃvaṇṇanā visesa bhūto parivattana hāra vibhaṅgo paripuṇṇaḥ katamaḥ vevacana hāra vibhaṅgo ti  pucchitabba ttā tattha katamaḥ vevacanaḥ hāraḥ iti ādi vuttam tattha tattha ati tesu niddiṭṭhesu  soḷasasu desanā hāra ādīsu katamaḥ saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ vevacanaḥ hāraḥ vevacana hāra vibhaṅgo
translated: The analysis of the mode of Conveying a Conversion, which is a special kind of commendation, is completed. “ What is the analysis of the mode of Conveying Synonyms? “

original: nāmāti pucchati. “Vevacanāni bahūnī”tiādiniddesassa idāni mayā vuccamāno “ekaṃ bhagavā🔽dhamma”ntiādiko vitthārasaṃvaṇṇanāviseso vevacano hāro vevacanahāravibhaṅgo nāmāti🔽attho gahetabbo. “Yāni vevacanāni niddhāritāni, katamāni tāni vevacanānī”ti pucchitabbattā
analyzed: nāma ati pucchati vevacanāni bahūni iti ādi niddesassa idāni mayā vuccamānaḥ ekam bhagavā  dhamma nti ādikaḥ vitthāra saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ vevacanaḥ hāraḥ vevacana hāra vibhaṅgaḥ nāma ati  atthaḥ gahetabbaḥ yāni vevacanāni niddhāritāni katamāni tāni vevacanāni iti pucchitabba ttā
translated: Since it is the mode of Conveying Synonyms that is to be asked about, “ What is the mode of Conveving Synonyms? “ is said. Herein, in those sixteen modes of Conveying, the Teaching, etc., mentioned above, what is the special kind of commendation that is the mode of Conveying Synonyms, the analysis of the mode of Conveying Synonyms? He asks this. The meaning to be understood is that the special kind of commendation that is the mode of Conveying Synonyms, the analysis of the mode of Conveying Synonyms, is the one that I am now going to give in the detailed commendation beginning with “ The Blessed One has taught one idea “ .

original: “yathā eka”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Ekaṃ viññātabbaṃ dhammaṃ sabhāvadhammaṃ paññāpetabbaṃ vā
analyzed: yathā eka ntiādi vuttam ekam viññātabbam dhammam sabhāva dhammam paññāpetabbam vā
translated: Since it is the synonyms that have been demonstrated that are to be asked about, “ What are the synonyms? “ is said. The meaning to be understood is that the synonyms are the one idea, the one thing to be known, the one thing to be demonstrated, the one thing to be realized, the one thing to be experienced, the one thing to be attained, the one thing to be fully awakened to, the one thing to be made to stand out, the one thing to be penetrated, the one thing to be directly known, the one thing to be fully understood, the one thing to be seen, the one thing to be realized, the one thing to be attained, the one thing to be fully awakened to, the one thing to be made to stand out, the one thing to be penetrated, the one thing to be directly known, the one thing to be fully understood, the one thing to be seen, the one thing to be realized, the one thing to be attained, the one thing to be fully awakened to, the one thing to be made to stand out, the one thing to be penetrated, the one thing to be directly known, the one thing to be fully understood, the one thing to be seen, the one thing to be realized, the one thing to be attained, the one thing to be fully awakened to, the one thing to be made to stand out, the one thing to be penetrated, the one thing to be directly known, the one thing to be fully understood, the one thing to be seen, the one thing to be realized, the one thing to be attained, the one

original: dhammaṃ aññamaññehi yathā yehi pakārehi ceva vevacanehi ca bhagavā niddisati, tathāpakārāni🔽vevacanāni viññātabbānīti attho. “Tāni vevacanāni kinti bhagavā āhā”ti vattabbattā
analyzed: dhammam aññamaññehi yathā yehi pakārehi ca iva vevacanehi ca bhagavā niddisati tathā apakārāni  vevacanāni viññātabbāni iti atthaḥ tāni vevacanāni kinti bhagavā āha ati vattabbattā
translated: The meaning is that the synonyms should be known in the various ways in which the Blessed One shows a state by means of synonyms and by means of the various ways of phrasing.🔽“How does the Blessed One show them?”

original: “yathāha bhagavā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Yathā yaṃyaṃpakārāni vevacanāni –
analyzed: yathā āha bhagavān iti ādi vuttam yathā yaṃ yaṃ pakārāni vevacanāni
translated: “As the Blessed One has said” is said in order to reply to that. The meaning is that the synonyms should be known in the various ways in which the Blessed One has shown them.

original: “Āsā ca pihā ca abhinandanā ca, anekadhātūsu sarā patiṭṭhitā;
analyzed: āsā ca pihā ca abhinandanā ca aneka dhātūsu sarā patiṭṭhitā
translated: “Hope, longing, and delight, with craving for many a state,

original: Aññāṇamūlappabhavā pajappitā, sabbā mayā byantikatā samūlikā”ti. –
analyzed: aññāṇa mūla ppabhavā pajappitā sabbā mayā byantika tā sa mūlikā ati
translated: Rooted in ignorance, the conceit ‘I am,’ all this I have destroyed” .

original: Bhagavā āha, taṃtaṃpakārāni vevacanāni viññātabbānīti attho.
analyzed: bhagavā āha taṃ taṃ pakārāni vevacanāni viññātabbāni iti atthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the synonyms should be known in the various ways in which the Blessed One has said this.

original: Ekasseva dhammassa anekehi pariyāyabhūtehi vevacanehi niddisane phalaṃ aṭṭhakathāyaṃ🔽bahudhā vuttaṃ, tasmā amhehi na dassitaṃ. “Katamā āsā, katamā pihādī”ti pucchitabbattā
analyzed: ekassa iva dhammassa anekehi pariyāya bhūtehi vevacanehi niddisane phalam aṭṭhakathāyam  bahudhā vuttam tasmai amhehi na dassitam katamā āsā katamā pihā ādi iti pucchitabbattā
translated: The fruit of showing a single state by means of many synonyms, which are different in phrasing, has been stated in the commentary in many ways,🔽and so we have not demonstrated it here.🔽“What is hope? What is longing, and so on?”

original: “āsā nāma vuccatī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Yā bhavissassa atthassa āsīsanā avassaṃ āgamissatīti
analyzed: āsā nāma vuccati itiādi vuttam yā bhavissassa atthassa āsīsanā avassam āgamissati iti
translated: “Hope is said to be” is said in order to reply to that. The meaning is that hope is the state of hoping for the existence of an object that is not present, thinking “It will come.”

original: yā āsā assa āsīsantassa puggalassa uppajjati, tassa āsīsanā “āsā nāmā”ti vuccati.
analyzed: yā āsā assa āsīsantassa puggalassa uppajjati tassa āsīsanā āsā nāma ati vuccati
translated: The desire that arises in the person who desires, who is desirous, is called “desire.”

original: Vattamānassa yā patthanā assa patthayantassa uppajjati, seyyataraṃ vā aññaṃ disvā
analyzed: vattamānassa yā patthanā assa patthayantassa uppajjati seyyataram vai aññam disvā
translated: The aspiration that arises in the person who aspires, who is aspiring, seeing something better,

original: “ediso ahaṃ bhaveyya”nti yā pihā assa pihayantassa uppajjati, sā patthanā “pihā nāmā”ti🔽vuccati. Anāgatatthaṃ ārabbha pavattā taṇhā “āsā”ti vuccati, anāgatapaccuppannatthaṃ
analyzed: edisaḥ aham bhaveyyanti yā pihā assa pihayantassa uppajjati sā patthanā pihā nāma ati  vuccati anāgata ttham ārabbha pavattā taṇhā āsa ati vuccati anāgata paccuppanna ttham
translated: “May I be like this” — the longing that arises in the person who longs, who is longing, is called “longing.”🔽Craving that occurs in relation to a future object is called “desire,” craving that occurs in relation to a future or present object is called “longing.” Thus, because of the identity of craving, a single state is called

original: ārabbha pavattā taṇhā “pihā”ti vuccati, tathāpi taṇhābhāvena ekattā eko dhammova🔽atthassa icchitassa nipphatti atthanipphatti, paṭipāleti etāya taṇhāyāti paṭipālanā,🔽atthanipphattiyā paṭipālanāti atthanipphattipaṭipālanā. Yā taṇhā assa pālayantassa
analyzed: ārabbha pavattā taṇhā pihā ati vuccati tathā api taṇhā bhāvena ekattā ekaḥ dhammaḥ uva  atthassa icchitassa nipphatti attha nipphatti paṭipāleti etāya taṇhāya ati paṭipālanā  attha nipphattiyā paṭipālanā ati attha nipphatti paṭipālanā yā taṇhā assa pālayantassa
translated: “desire” and “longing.”🔽The fulfilment of the desired object is the fulfilment of the object. It is maintained by this craving, thus it is maintenance.

original: puggalassa uppajjati, sā taṇhā “abhinandanā”ti vuccati.
analyzed: puggalassa uppajjati sā taṇhā abhinandanā ati vuccati
translated: The maintenance of the fulfilment of the object is the maintenance of the fulfilment of the object. The craving that arises in the person who maintains, who is maintaining, is called “approval.”

original: “Yā atthanipphatti taṇhāya paṭipāletabbā, katamā sā atthanipphattī”ti pucchitabbattā
analyzed: yā attha nipphatti taṇhāya paṭipāletabbā katamā sā attha nipphattī iti pucchitabba ttā
translated: “What is the fulfilment of the purpose that craving must maintain? ”

original: taṃ atthanipphattiṃ sattato vā saṅkhārato vā vibhajitvā dassento “piyaṃ vā ñātiṃ,🔽piyaṃ vā dhamma”ntiādimāha. Tattha “ñāti”nti iminā mittabandhavādayopi gahitā. Dhammaṃ
analyzed: tam attha nipphattim sattataḥ vā saṅkhārataḥ vā vibhajitvā dassentaḥ piyam vā ñātim  piyam vā dhammam ti ādim āha tattha ñātin ti iminā mitta bandha vādayaḥ api gahitāḥ dhammam
translated: In order to answer this question, he shows the fulfilment of the purpose by dividing it into the person and the formations.🔽“A loved relative” and so on. Herein, by “relative” he includes friends and kinsmen.

original: pana piyarūpārammaṇādikaṃ chabbidhampi yāya taṇhāya taṇhiko abhinandati, sā taṇhā🔽“abhinandanā nāmā”ti vuccati. Paṭikkūlaṃ ñātiṃ vā dhammaṃ vā vipallāsavasena appaṭikkūlaṃ🔽ñātiṃ vā dhammaṃ vā sabhāvavasena appaṭikkūlato yāya taṇhāya taṇhiko abhinandati,
analyzed: pana piya rūpa ārammaṇa ādikam chabbidham pi yāya taṇhāya taṇhikaḥ abhinandati sā taṇhā  abhinandanā nāma ati vuccati paṭikkūlam ñātim vā dhammam vā vipallāsa vasena a paṭikkūlam  ñātim vā dhammam vā sabhāva vasena a paṭikkūlataḥ yāya taṇhāya taṇhikaḥ abhinandati
translated: “Dhamma” is the six kinds of objects that are loved, such as visible forms.🔽The craving by means of which the one who craves delights in them is called “delight.”🔽A loved relative or loved dhamma that is repulsive is not repulsive by virtue of perversion.

original: sā taṇhā vā “abhinandanā nāmā”ti vuccatīti yojetvā attho gahetabbo.
analyzed: sā taṇhā vā abhinandanā nāma ati vuccati iti yojetvā atthaḥ gahetabbo
translated: The craving by means of which the one who craves delights in a loved relative or loved dhamma that is not repulsive by virtue of its own-nature is called “delight.”🔽The meaning should be understood by combining the two passages thus.

original: “Yāsu anekāsu dhātūsu vuttappakārā taṇhā ‘sarā’ti bhagavatā vuttā, katamā tā dhātuyo”ti pucchitabbattā tā dhātuyo sarūpato dassetuṃ “cakkhudhātū”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: yāsu anekāsu dhātūsu vutta ppakārā taṇhā sarā ati bhagavatā vuttā katamā tāḥ dhātuyo ti pucchitabba ttā tāḥ dhātuyo sarūpataḥ dassetum cakkhu dhātu utiādi vuttaṃ
translated: In order to show the elements in their true nature, the following is stated: “The eye element, etc.”

original: “Tāsu dhātūsu katamāya dhātuyā katamā sarā patiṭṭhitā pavattā”ti pucchitabbattā imāya
analyzed: tāsu dhātūsu katamāya dhātuyā katamā sarā patiṭṭhitā pavattā ati pucchitabbattā imāya
translated: “In regard to these elements, in which element is which craving established and occurring?”

original: dhātuyā ayaṃ sarā patiṭṭhitā pavattāti niyametvā dassetuṃ “sarāti keci rūpādhimuttā”tiādi
analyzed: dhātuyā ayam sarā patiṭṭhitā pavattā ati niyametvā dassetum sarā iti keci rūpa adhimuttā atiādi
translated: In order to show this by way of determining that “in this element this craving is established and occurring,” the following is stated: “Some are attached to form, etc.”

original: vuttaṃ. Tattha kecīti sarāsaṅkhātāya rūpataṇhāya taṇhikā puggalā. Rūpādhimuttāti
analyzed: vuttam tattha keci iti sarā saṅkhātāya rūpa taṇhāya taṇhikāḥ puggalāḥ rūpa adhimuttā ati
translated: Herein, some means persons who are craving-experiencers called ‘cravings.’ Attached to form means

original: rūpadhātusaṅkhāte ārammaṇe adhimuttā ajjhositā. Iminā padena rūpataṇhāsaṅkhātā sarā🔽rūpadhātuyā patiṭṭhitā pavattāti gahitā, “keci saddādhimuttā”tiādīhipi saddataṇhāsaṅkhātādayo
analyzed: rūpa dhātu saṅkhāte ārammaṇe adhimuttā ajjhositā iminā padena rūpa taṇhā saṅkhātā sarā  rūpa dhātuyā patiṭṭhitā pavattā ati gahitā keci sadda adhimuttā ati ādīhi pi sadda taṇhā saṅkhāta ādayaḥ
translated: attached to the object called the form element, i.e., clung to. By this phrase, the craving called ‘craving’🔽is taken as established and occurring in the form element. By the phrases “some are attached to sound, etc.,” the cravings called ‘craving for sound,’ etc.,

original: sarā saddadhātuyādīsu patiṭṭhitā pavattā sarāva gahitā. Keci dhammādhimuttāti ettha
analyzed: sarā sadda dhātuyā ādīsu patiṭṭhitā pavattā sarā ava gahitā keci dhamma adhimuttā ati ettha
translated: are taken as established and occurring in the sound element, etc. Some are attached to mental objects means

original: dhammaggahaṇena cakkhudhātusotadhātughānadhātujivhādhātukāyadhātusattaviññāṇadhātudhammadhātuyo
analyzed: dhamma ggahaṇena cakkhu dhātu sotadhātu ghānadhātu jivhā dhātu kāya dhātu satta viññāṇa dhātu dhammadhātuyo
translated: By the inclusion of the ideas, the eye-base, ear-base, nose-base, tongue-base, body-base, mind-base, idea-base, and the seven consciousness-bases are included.

original: gahitā, tasmā aṭṭhārasa dhātuyo patiṭṭhānabhāvena gahitāpi chabbidhāva gahitāti daṭṭhabbā.
analyzed: gahitā tasmai aṭṭhārasa dhātuyaḥ patiṭṭhāna bhāvena gahitā api chabbidhā ava gahitā iti daṭṭhabbā
translated: Therefore, although the eighteen elements are included as the bases, they should be regarded as included in the sixfold way.

original: “Rūpādhimuttādīsu kittakāni padāni taṇhāpakkhe taṇhāya vevacanā”ti pucchitabbattā
analyzed: rūpa adhimutta ādīsu kittakāni padāni taṇhā pakkhe taṇhāya vevacanā ti pucchitabbattā
translated: Since it is necessary to ask: “In the case of those who are devoted to form, etc., how many terms in the craving section are synonyms for craving? “

original: etādisāni ettakāni padāni taṇhāpakkhe taṇhāvevacanānīti niyametvā dassetuṃ “tattha🔽yāni cha gehasitānī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tatthāti tesu chasu rūpādīsu. Cha gehasitāni domanassānīti
analyzed: etādisāni ettakāni padāni taṇhā pakkhe taṇhā vevacanāni iti niyametvā dassetum tattha  yāni cha geha sitāni itiādi vuttam tattha ati tesu chasu rūpa ādīsu cha geha sitāni domanassāni iti
translated: in order to show by specifying that there are that many terms in the craving section that are synonyms for craving, it is said: “Herein,

original: chasu rūpādīsu pavattaṃ taṇhāpemaṃ nissāya pavattāni cha domanassāni. Esa nayo sesesupi.
analyzed: chasu rūpa ādīsu pavattam taṇhā pemam nissāya pavattāni cha domanassāni esa nayo sesesu pi
translated: the six kinds of grief that are based on the household life” . Herein means among those six kinds of form, etc. The six kinds of grief that are based on the household life are the six kinds of grief that occur in dependence on the craving and the love that occur in the six kinds of form, etc. The same method applies in the case of the other terms.

original: “Cha upekkhā gehasitāpi bhagavatā vuttā, kasmā na gahitā”ti vattabbattā “yā cha upekkhā
analyzed: cha upekkhāḥ gehasitā api bhagavatā vuttā kasmā na gahitā ati vattabbattā yā cha upekkhā
translated: Since it is necessary to ask: “The six kinds of equanimity that are based on the household life are mentioned by the Blessed One. Why are they not included? “

original: gehasitā, ayaṃ diṭṭhipakkho”ti vuttaṃ, diṭṭhipakkhattā na gahitāti attho.
analyzed: gehasitā ayam diṭṭhi pakkho ti vuttam diṭṭhi pakkha ttā na gahitā iti attho
translated: it is said: “The six kinds of equanimity that are based on the household life are the view-group” . The meaning is: they are not included because they belong to the view-group.

original: 38. “Kathaṃ vuttappakārā taṇhā eva gahitā”ti vattabbattā “sāyeva patthanākārenā”tiādi🔽vuttaṃ. Sā vuttappakārā eva taṇhā patthanākārena pavattanato āsādipariyāyena vuttā,🔽rūpādiārammaṇadhammesu nandanato “dhammanandī”ti pariyāyena vuttā, rūpādiārammaṇadhammesu
analyzed: katham vutta ppakārā taṇhā eva gahitā ati vattabbattā sāya iva patthanā ākārena atiādi  vuttam sā vutta ppakārā eva taṇhā patthanā ākārena pavattanataḥ āsa ādi pariyāyena vuttā  rūpa ādi ārammaṇa dhammesu nandanataḥ dhamma nandī iti pariyāyena vuttā rūpa ādi ārammaṇa dhammesu
translated: “How is craving itself referred to in these various ways?” In order to answer this he said, “It is craving itself that is referred to in these various ways as ‘longing,’ etc.” Craving itself, which has the aforesaid characteristics, is referred to in the first way as “longing” because it occurs in the mode of longing.🔽It is referred to in the second way as “delight in thoughts” because it delights in the states of consciousness that occur with respect to visible forms, etc.,

original: gilitvā pariniṭṭhapeti viya ajjhosāya tiṭṭhanato “dhammajjhosāna”nti pariyāyena vuttā,
analyzed: gilitvā pariniṭṭhapeti viya ajjhosāya tiṭṭhanataḥ dhamma ajjhosānam ti pariyāyena vuttā
translated: and in the third way as “clinging to thoughts” because it stands as if swallowing and holding fast to the states of consciousness that occur with respect to visible forms, etc.

original: tasmā taṇhāya vevacanāni honti.🔽Taṇhāya vevacanāni ācariyena niddiṭṭhāni, amhehi ca ñātāni, “katamāni cittassa vevacanānī”ti🔽pucchitabbattā “cittaṃ mano”tiādi vuttaṃ. “Ārammaṇaṃ cintetīti cittaṃ. Manati jānātīti
analyzed: tasmā taṇhāya vevacanāni honti  taṇhāya vevacanāni ācariyena niddiṭṭhāni amhehi ca ñātāni katamāni cittassa vevacanāni iti  pucchitabba ttā cittam manaḥ tiādi vuttam ārammaṇam cinteti iti cittam manati jānāti iti
translated: Therefore these are synonyms for craving.

original: mano. Vijānātīti viññāṇa”ntiādinā attho pakaraṇesu vuttova, tasmā amhehi na vitthārito.
analyzed: manaḥ vijānāti iti viññāṇam ti ādinā attho pakaraṇesu vuttaḥ iva tasmai amhehi na vitthārito
translated: The teacher has pointed out the synonyms for craving and we have understood them. Now, in order to ask about the synonyms for consciousness, he said, “Consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and consciousness, mind, and

original: Vevacanāniyeva imāni imassa vevacanānīti ettakāniyeva kathayissāma. “Paññindriyaṃ
analyzed: vevacanāniyā iva imāni imassa vevacanāni iti ettakāniyā iva kathayissāma paññindriyam
translated: We shall confine ourselves to the mere synonyms, saying “These are the synonyms for that.”🔽“The understanding faculty,

original: paññābala”ntiādīni paññāvevacanāni.
translated: the understanding power” are synonyms for understanding.🔽“The Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha” are synonyms for the Buddha.

original: “Arahaṃ sammāsambuddho”tiādīni buddhassa vevacanāni. “Tāni kattha desitānī”ti pucchitabbattā
analyzed: araham sammāsambuddhaḥ ti ādīni buddhassa vevacanāni tāni kattha desitāni iti pucchitabbattā
translated: Since it is necessary to ask “Where were they taught?”

original: “yathā ca buddhānussatiyaṃ vutta”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Buddhānussatidesanāyaṃ yathā ca yaṃyaṃpakāraṃ🔽vevacanaṃ bhagavatā “itipi so bhagavā arahaṃ…pe… bhagavato”ti vuttaṃ, etaṃpakāraṃ
analyzed: yathā ca buddha anussatiyam vutta ntiādi vuttam buddha anussati desanāyam yathā ca yaṃ yaṃ pakāram  vevacanam bhagavatā saḥ bhagavā arahaṃpe bhagavataḥ ti vuttam etaṃpakāram
translated: it is said “And as in the recollection of the Buddha” and so on.

original: vevacanaṃ buddhānussatiyā vevacanaṃ buddhassa vevacananti daṭṭhabbaṃ. “Yathā ca dhammānussatiyaṃ
analyzed: vevacanam buddha anussatiyāḥ vevacanam buddhassa vevacananti daṭṭhabbam yathā ca dhamma anussatiyam
translated: In the teaching of the recollection of the Buddha, the Blessed One said “He is such and such a Blessed One, Worthy One, Perfect Sambuddha” and so on, and this is the way in which the synonyms are to be understood.

original: vutta”ntiādīsupi evameva yojanā kātabbā.
analyzed: vutta nti ādīsu pi evam eva yojanā kātabbā
translated: In the same way the application should be made in the case of the recollection of the Dhamma and so on.

original: “Tenāhā”tiādyānusandhyādiattho ceva “niyutto vevacano hāro”tiānusandhyādiattho ca vuttanayānusārena veditabbo.
analyzed: tena āha atiādi anusandhyā ādi attho ca iva niyutto vevacanaḥ hāro iti ānusandhyā ādi attho ca vutta naya anusārena veditabbo
translated: The meaning of the connection in the case of “Therefore it was said” and so on should be understood in the way already stated as “The Mode of Conveying Synonyms is discerned.”

original: Iti vevacanahāravibhaṅge sattibalānurūpā racitā
analyzed: iti vevacana hāra vibhaṅge satti bala anurūpā racitā
translated: Thus the Mode of Conveying Synonyms has been elucidated in the way appropriate to the three kinds of Thread.

original: Vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The exposition is finished.

original: Paṇḍitehi pana aṭṭhakathāṭīkānusārena gambhīrattho vitthārato vibhajitvā gahetabboti.🔽11. Paññattihāravibhaṅgavibhāvanā🔽39. Yena yena saṃvaṇṇanāvisesabhūtena vibhaṅgena vevacanāni vibhattāni, so saṃvaṇṇanāvisesabhūto
analyzed: paṇḍitehi pana aṭṭhakathā ṭīkā anusārena gambhīra atthaḥ vitthārataḥ vibhajitvā gahetabbaḥ ti  paññatti hāra vibhaṅga vibhāvanā  yena yena saṃvaṇṇanā visesa bhūtena vibhaṅgena vevacanāni vibhattāni so saṃvaṇṇanā visesa bhūtaḥ
translated: But it should be taken in detail with the help of the commentaries and subcommentaries by the wise, who will get its deep meaning.🔽The exposition of the mode of exposition called “Enumeration”🔽The mode of exposition called “Enumeration” is the complete exposition of the synonyms by means of the particular kind of exposition called “Enumeration.”

original: vibhaṅgo paripuṇṇo, “katamo paññattihāravibhaṅgo”ti pucchitabbattā “tattha katamo
analyzed: vibhaṅgo paripuṇṇo katamo paññatti hāra vibhaṅgo ti pucchitabba ttā tattha katamo
translated: Since it is necessary to ask, “What is the mode of exposition called ‘Enumeration’?”

original: paññattihāro”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha tatthāti tesu niddiṭṭhesu soḷasasu desanāhārādīsu
analyzed: paññatti hāraḥ tiādi vuttam tattha tattha ati tesu niddiṭṭhesu soḷasasu desanā āhāra ādīsu
translated: the text states, “Herein, what is the mode of exposition called ‘Enumeration’?” Herein, there means among the sixteen kinds of teaching, etc., shown above.

original: katamo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso paññattihāro paññattihāravibhaṅgo nāmāti pucchati. “Ekaṃ🔽bhagavā dhammaṃ paññattīhi vividhāhi desetī”tiādiniddesassa idāni mayā vuccamāno
analyzed: katamaḥ saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ paññatti hāro paññatti hāra vibhaṅgaḥ nāma ati pucchati ekam  bhagavā dhammam paññattīhi vividhāhi deseti iti ādi niddesassa idāni mayā vuccamāno
translated: What is the particular kind of exposition called “Enumeration”? What is called the mode of exposition called “Enumeration”? He asks this.🔽The particular kind of exposition called “Enumeration” should be taken as follows: “The Blessed One teaches the one idea by means of the various enumerations” .

original: “yā pakatikathāya desanā”tiādiko vitthārasaṃvaṇṇanāviseso paññattihāro paññattihāravibhaṅgo nāmāti gahetabbo.
analyzed: yā pakati kathāya desanā ati ādikaḥ vitthāra saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ paññatti hāro paññatti hāra vibhaṅgaḥ nāma ati gahetabbo
translated: The detailed exposition called “Enumeration” that I am now giving is the mode of exposition called “Enumeration.”

original: “Yāhi vividhāhi paññattīhi ekaṃ dhammaṃ bhagavā deseti, katamā tā vividhā paññattiyo”ti
analyzed: yāhi vividhāhi paññattīhi ekam dhammam bhagavā deseti katamā tā vividhā paññattiyā ti
translated: “When the Blessed One teaches a single idea by means of various descriptions, what are those various descriptions?”

original: pucchitabbattā “yā pakatikathāyā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha pakatikathāyāti assādādipadatthavisesaṃ🔽aniddhāretvā atthasabhāvena pavattāya kathāya sādhukaṃ manasikāradhammakathāya yā
analyzed: pucchitabba ttā yā pakati kathāya atiādi vuttam tattha pakati kathāya ati assāda ādi padattha visesam  a niddhāretvā attha sabhāvena pavattāya kathāya sādhukam manasikāra dhamma kathāya yā
translated: Because it is necessary to ask, “What is the description in ordinary speech?” is said. Therein, in ordinary speech means without determining a particular meaning such as the meaning of enjoyment, etc.,🔽in speech that occurs by way of the nature of the meaning, in the teaching of the Dhamma that is well attended to,

original: desanā yathādhippetamatthaṃ veneyyasantāne nikkhipati patiṭṭhapeti pakārena ñāpeti,🔽tasmā nikkhepapaññatti, tāya paññattiyā dhammaṃ desetīti attho. “Yā paññatti ‘pakatikathāya
analyzed: desanā yathā adhippetam attham veneyya santāne nikkhipati patiṭṭhapeti pakārena ñāpeti  tasmā nikkhepa paññatti tāya paññattiyā dhammam deseti iti atthaḥ yā paññatti pakati kathāya
translated: the teaching that deposits, that establishes, that makes known in detail, the meaning intended in the mental continuum of the disciple,

original: desanā’ti vuttā, katamā sā”ti pucchitabbattā tathā pucchitvā vitthārato dassetuṃ🔽“kā ca pakatikathāya desanā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana –“iti ‘pakatikathāya
analyzed: desanā ati vuttā katamā sā ati pucchitabba ttā tathā pucchitvā vitthārataḥ dassetuṃ  kā ca pakati kathāya desanā ti ādi vuttam aṭṭhakathāyam pana iti pakati kathāya
translated: therefore it is the description of depositing. The meaning is: he teaches the Dhamma by means of that description. “What is the teaching that is called the description in ordinary speech?” Because it is necessary to ask, having asked in that way,

original: desanā’ti saṅkhepena vuttamatthaṃ vitthārena vibhajituṃ ‘kā ca pakatikathāya desanā’ti
analyzed: desanā iti saṅkhepena vuttam attham vitthārena vibhajitum kā ca pakati kathāya desanā iti
translated: in order to show in detail, “What is the teaching in ordinary speech?” is said. But in the commentary: “Having thus summarized the meaning of the teaching in ordinary speech, in order to analyze it in detail, ‘What is the teaching in ordinary speech?’

original: pucchitvā ‘cattāri saccānī’tiādimāhā”ti vuttaṃ. Tattha desanādesetabbassa bhedabhāvepi
analyzed: pucchitvā cattāri saccāni iti ādim āha ati vuttam tattha desanā desetabbassa bheda bhāve pi
translated: and after questioning him, he said, ‘The Four Noble Truths.’“🔽Herein, although the teaching is a division of what should be taught,

original: abhedopacārena “desanā cattāri saccānī”ti vuttaṃ, catunnaṃ saccānaṃ paññatti desanā nāmāti attho.
analyzed: abheda upacārena desanā cattāri saccāni iti vuttam catunnam saccānam paññatti desanā nāma ati attho
translated: it is called “the Four Noble Truths” by a figurative use of the word “truth” in the sense of “the teaching of the Four Noble Truths is the teaching.”🔽The meaning is that the teaching is the designation of the Four Noble Truths.

original: “Kathaṃ taṃ saccapaññattiṃ bhagavā āhā”ti pucchitabbattā “yathā bhagavā āhā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: katham tam sacca paññattim bhagavā āha iti pucchitabbattā yathā bhagavā āha iti vuttam
translated: “How did the Blessed One teach that truth-designation?” is said because it should be asked how it should be known.🔽In the way, by the method, in which the Blessed One taught whatever designation,

original: Yathā yena pakārena bhagavā yaṃ yaṃ paññattiṃ āha, tathā tena pakārena sā paññatti
analyzed: yathā yena pakārena bhagavā yam yam paññattim āha tathā tena pakārena sā paññatti
translated: in that way, by that method, that designation should be known.

original: jānitabbā. “Idaṃ dukkha”nti yaṃ paññattiṃ bhagavā āha, ayaṃ “idaṃ dukkha”nti paññatti
analyzed: jānitabbā idam dukkhanti yam paññattim bhagavā āha ayam idam dukkhanti paññatti
translated: “This is suffering” is the designation the Blessed One taught. This is the designation “this is suffering.”

original: pañcannaṃ khandhānaṃ nikkhepapaññatti, channaṃ dhātūnaṃ nikkhepapaññatti, aṭṭhārasannaṃ
analyzed: pañcannam khandhānam nikkhepa paññatti channam dhātūnam nikkhepa paññatti aṭṭhārasannam
translated: It is the designation of the five aggregates, the designation of the six elements, the designation of the eighteen🔽elements, the designation of the twelve sense bases, the designation of the ten

original: dhātūnaṃ nikkhepapaññatti, dvādasannaṃ āyatanānaṃ nikkhepapaññatti, dasannaṃ indriyānaṃ
analyzed: dhātūnam nikkhepa paññatti dvādasannam āyatanānam nikkhepa paññatti dasannam indriyānam
translated: faculties,

original: nikkhepapaññattīti yojanā kātabbā. Khandhadhātuāyatanindriyāni ca lokiyāneva. Pīḷanasaṅkhatasantāpavipariṇāmatthatāsāmaññena
analyzed: nikkhepa paññatti iti yojanā kātabbā khandha dhātu āyatana indriyāni ca lokiyān eva pīḷana saṅkhata santāpa vipariṇāma attha tā sāmaññena
translated: The interpretation should be made as “the definition of the term ‘aggregate’ is the issuing forth.” The aggregates, bases, elements, and faculties are all mundane.

original: ekattaṃ upanetvā “idaṃ dukkha”nti vuttā. Dasannaṃ indriyānanti cakkhusotaghānajivhākāyaitthipurisajīvitamanavedanindriyānaṃ🔽dasannaṃ. Anubhavanalakkhaṇena ekalakkhaṇattā vedanindriyaṃ ekanti gahitaṃ, saddhindriyādīni
analyzed: ekattam upanetvā idam dukkhanti vuttā dasannam indriyānaṃ cakkhu sota ghāna jivhā kāya etthi purisa jīvita mana vedanī indriyānaṃ  anubhavana lakkhaṇena eka lakkhaṇa ttā vedanindriyam gahitam saddhindriya ādīni
translated: The construction is to be understood as “the definition of the term ‘out-going’ ” . The aggregates, bases, and elements are all mundane. They are brought together under the unity of the word “suffering” because they are alike in being suffering in the sense of affliction, in the sense of change, and in the sense of the suffering of the formations. “The ten faculties”: the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, femininity, masculinity, life, mind, and pleasure faculties.

original: pana maggapariyāpannattā na gahitāni.🔽Kabaḷīkāreti ṭhānūpacārena voharite ojāsaṅkhāte āhāre, rāgo ariyamaggena appahātabbattā🔽anusayavasena, āsāvasena vā patthanāvasena vā atthi nandī. Atthi taṇhāti etthāpi
analyzed: pana magga pariyāpanna ttā na gahitāni  kabaḷīkāra iti ṭhāna upacārena voharite ojā saṅkhāte āhāre rāgaḥ ariya maggena a pahātabba ttā  anusaya vasena āsā vasena vā patthanā vasena vā atthi nandī atthi taṇhā ati ettha api
translated: “The one faculty”: the faculty of feeling is taken as one because it has the single characteristic of experiencing. But the faith faculty, etc., are not taken because they are included in the path.🔽“The faculty of nutriment”: this is the nutriment consisting of gross or fine physical food, which is called “nutriment” because it is a condition for the maintenance of beings. Craving is present in the form of latent tendency because it is not abandoned by the noble path.

original: eseva nayo. Patiṭṭhitaṃ viruḷhanti paṭisandhiākaḍḍhanasamatthatāpattiyā patiṭṭhitattā
analyzed: esa iva nayaḥ patiṭṭhitam viruḍhanti paṭisandhi ākaḍḍhana samattha tā āpattiyā patiṭṭhita ttā
translated: Or it is present in the form of aspiration because of the presence of desire. “Delight” and “craving” are also to be understood in the same way. “Established, grown up”: established because of the attainment of the ability to draw along rebirth-linking.

original: patiṭṭhitañceva viruḷhañcāti gahetabbaṃ. Saṅkhārānanti punabbhavanibbattakassa bhavassa
analyzed: patiṭṭhitam ca iva viruḷham ca ati gahetabbam saṅkhārānanti punabbhava nibbattakassa bhavassa
translated: and “established” and “grown” should be taken as well. “Formations”: formations that are the cause for the arising of the becoming that produces renewed existence.

original: abhinibbattihetukānaṃ saṅkhārānaṃ. Jātijarāmaraṇanti abhinibbattanalakkhaṇā jāti,
analyzed: abhinibbatti hetukānam saṅkhārānam jāti jarā maraṇanti abhinibbattana lakkhaṇā jāti
translated: “Birth, aging, and death”: Birth has the characteristic of generation;🔽it is not mere arising, but rather the generation of what is born. Aging has the characteristic of maturing;🔽it is not mere continuity, but rather the maturing of what is born. Death has the characteristic of dissolution;

original: na uppādova, paripākalakkhaṇā jarā, na ṭhitiyeva, bhedanalakkhaṇaṃ maraṇaṃ, na bhaṅgameva.
analyzed: na uppādo uva paripāka lakkhaṇā jarā na ṭhitiyā iva bhedana lakkhaṇam maraṇam na bhaṅgam eva
translated: it is not mere breakup, but rather the dissolution of what is born and what has aged.

original: Tena vuttaṃ “sasokaṃ sadaraṃ saupāyāsa”nti.
analyzed: tena vuttam sa sokam sa daram sa upāyāsanti
translated: Hence it is said: “with sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair” .🔽“Bhikkhus, if there were no nutriment of edible food, would the clinging of beings to the four kinds of nutriment be discerned here? “🔽“Bhikkhus, if there were no nutriment of contact …

original: “Phasse ce, bhikkhave, āhāre…pe… manosañcetanāya ce, bhikkhave, āhāre…pe… viññāṇe🔽ce, bhikkhave, āhāre atthi rāgo…pe… vadāmī”ti ayaṃ paññatti dukkhassa ca samudayassa
analyzed: phasse ce bhikkhave āhāra īpe manaḥ sañcetanāya ce bhikkhave āhāra īpe viññāṇe  ce bhikkhave āhāre atthi rāga upe vadāmi iti ayam paññatti dukkhassa ca samudayassa
translated: of mental volition … of consciousness, would the clinging of beings to the four kinds of nutriment be discerned here? “🔽“Bhikkhus, if there were no nutriment of edible food, would the origination of the origination of the world be discerned? “🔽“Bhikkhus, if there were no nutriment of contact …

original: ca pabhavassa paññāpanato pabhavapaññatti nāma.
analyzed: ca pabhavassa paññāpanato pabhava paññatti nāma
translated: of mental volition … of consciousness, would the origination of the origination of the world be discerned? “🔽“Bhikkhus, if there were no nutriment of edible food, would the cessation of the cessation of the world be discerned? “🔽“Bhikkhus, if there were no nutriment of contact …🔽of mental volition … of consciousness, would the cessation of the cessation of the world be discerned? “

original: Vaṭṭavasena paññattibhedo ācariyena vibhatto, amhehi ca ñāto, “kathaṃ vivaṭṭavasena
analyzed: vaṭṭa vasena paññatti bhedaḥ ācariyena vibhattaḥ amhehi ca ñāto katham vivaṭṭa vasena
translated: “Bhikkhus, if there were no nutriment of edible food, would the passing away of the passing away of the world be discerned? “🔽“Bhikkhus, if there were no nutriment of contact …🔽of mental volition … of consciousness, would the passing away of the passing away of the world be discerned? “

original: paññattibhedo vibhatto”ti vattabbattā “kabaḷīkāre ce, bhikkhave, āhāre natthi rāgo”tiādi
analyzed: paññatti bhedaḥ vibhattaḥ ti vattabbattā kabaḷīkāre ce bhikkhave āhāre natthi rāgaḥ ti ādi
translated: “Bhikkhus, if there were no nutriment of edible food, would the arising of the arising of the world be discerned? “🔽“Bhikkhus, if there were no nutriment of contact …🔽of mental volition … of consciousness, would the arising of the arising of the world be discerned? “🔽“Bhikkhus, if there were no nutriment of edible food, would the appearance of the appearance of

original: vuttaṃ. “Kabaḷīkāre…pe… anupāyāsanti vadāmī”ti ayaṃ paññatti dukkhassa pariññāya
analyzed: vuttam vadāmi iti ayam paññatti dukkhassa pariññāya
translated: This is called “the description of the known” because it describes the full understanding of suffering,🔽because it describes the abandoning of the origin,

original: ca paññāpanato pariññāpaññatti nāma, samudayassa pahānassa ca paññāpanato pahānapaññatti🔽nāma, maggassa bhāvanāya ca paññāpanato bhāvanāpaññatti nāma, nirodhassa sacchikiriyāya
analyzed: ca paññāpanato pariññā paññatti nāma samudayassa pahānassa ca paññāpanato pahāna paññatti  nāma maggassa bhāvanāya ca paññāpanataḥ bhāvanā paññatti nāma nirodhassa sacchikiriyāya
translated: because it describes the realization of cessation,

original: ca paññāpanato sacchikiriyāpaññatti nāma.🔽40. Vivaṭṭavasena paññattibhedo ācariyena vibhatto, amhehi ca ñāto, “kathaṃ sammasanavasena
analyzed: ca paññāpanataḥ sacchikiriyā paññatti nāma  vivaṭṭa vasena paññatti bhedaḥ ācariyena vibhattaḥ amhehi ca ñātaḥ katham sammasana vasena
translated: and because it describes the development of the path.

original: paññattibhedo vibhatto”ti vattabbattā “samādhiṃ, bhikkhave, bhāvethā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: paññatti bhedaḥ vibhattaḥ ti vattabbattā samādhim bhikkhave bhāvetha atiādi vuttam
translated: The teacher has analysed the description of the known by way of the revolution of the basis, and we have understood it. Now, in order to show the analysis of the description of the known by way of the method of combination, the following is said:

original: “Samādhiṃ, bhikkhave, bhāvetha…pe… yathābhūtaṃ pajānātī”ti ayaṃ paññatti maggassa
analyzed: samādhim bhikkhave bhāvethape yathābhūtam pajānāti iti ayam paññatti maggassa
translated: “Bhikkhus, develop concentration. … he understands as it really is … “ .🔽This is called “the description of the known” because it describes the development of the path,

original: bhāvanāya ca paññāpanato bhāvanāpaññatti nāma, dukkhassa pariññāya ca paññāpanato
analyzed: bhāvanāya ca paññāpanataḥ bhāvanā paññatti nāma dukkhassa pariññāya ca paññāpanataḥ
translated: and because it describes the full understanding of suffering,

original: pariññāpaññatti nāma, samudayassa pahānassa ca paññāpanato pahānapaññatti nāma, nirodhassa
analyzed: pariññā paññatti nāma samudayassa pahānassa ca paññāpanato pahāna paññatti nāma nirodhassa
translated: The definition of full understanding is so called because it defines the abandoning of origin. The definition of abandoning is so called because it defines cessation as peaceful, etc.,

original: sacchikiriyāya ca paññāpanato sacchikiriyāpaññatti nāma.🔽Sammasanavasena paññattibhedo ācariyena vibhatto, amhehi ca ñāto, “kathaṃ upādānakkhandhavasena🔽paññattibhedo vibhatto”ti vattabbattā “rūpaṃ, rādha, vikirathā”tiādi vuttaṃ. “Rūpaṃ,
analyzed: sacchikiriyāya ca paññāpanataḥ sacchikiriyāpaññatti nāma  sammasana vasena paññatti bhedaḥ ācariyena vibhattaḥ amhehi ca ñātaḥ katham upādāna kkhandha vasena  paññatti bhedaḥ vibhattaḥ ti vattabbattā rūpam vikiratha atiādi vuttam rūpam
translated: Ascertainment-description is so called because it describes the abandoning of origin. Abandonment-description is so called because it describes the realization of cessation. Realization-description is so called because it describes the realization of cessation.

original: rādha, vikiratha…pe… nibbāna”nti ayaṃ paññatti taṇhāsaṅkhātassa rodhassa nirodhassa🔽ca paññāpanato nirodhapaññatti nāma, assādassa nibbidāya ca paññāpanato nibbidāpaññatti🔽nāma, dukkhassa pariññāya ca paññāpanato pariññāpaññatti nāma, samudayassa pahānassa
analyzed: nibbānam ti ayam paññatti taṇhā saṅkhātassa rodhassa nirodhassa  ca paññāpanataḥ nirodha paññatti nāma assādassa nibbidāya ca paññāpanataḥ nibbidā paññatti  nāma dukkhassa pariññāya ca paññāpanato pariññā paññatti nāma samudayassa pahānassa
translated: The teacher has analysed the description of the three kinds of description according to the method of entry into the three kinds of description, and we have understood it. Now, in order to show the analysis of the description of the three kinds of description according to the method of entry into the five aggregates as objects of clinging, it is said: “Rādha, break down material form … Nibbana.”

original: ca paññāpanato pahānapaññatti nāma, maggassa bhāvanāya ca paññāpanato bhāvanāpaññatti
analyzed: ca paññāpanataḥ pahāna paññatti nāma maggassa bhāvanāya ca paññāpanataḥ bhāvanā paññatti
translated: This description is called cessation-description because it describes the cessation of the obstruction called craving and the cessation of obstruction. It is called disenchantment-description because it describes the disenchantment with gratification. It is called ascertainment-description because it describes the full understanding of suffering. It is called abandonment-description because it describes the abandoning of origin. It is called development-description because it describes the development of the path.

original: nāma, nirodhassa sacchikiriyāya ca paññāpanato sacchikiriyāpaññatti nāma.
analyzed: nāma nirodhassa sacchikiriyāya ca paññāpanato sacchikiriyā paññatti nāma
translated: and of the realization of cessation, is called the description of realization.

original: “Rūpavedanāsaññāsaṅkhāraviññāṇāni vikiranto viddhaṃsento vikīḷaniyaṃ karonto paññāya
analyzed: rūpa vedanā saññā saṅkhāra viññāṇāni vikirantaḥ viddhaṃsentaḥ vikīḷaniyam karontaḥ paññāya
translated: When he is dispersing, destroying, and demolishing material form, feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness,

original: taṇhākkhayāya paṭipajjanto kiṃ pajānātī”ti pucchitabbattā “so ‘idaṃ dukkha’nti yathābhūtaṃ🔽pajānātī”tiādi vuttaṃ. “So ‘idaṃ dukkha’nti yathābhūtaṃ pajānātīti…pe… nirodhagāminipaṭipadāti
analyzed: taṇhā kkhayāya paṭipajjantaḥ kim pajānāti iti pucchitabbattā saḥ idam dukkhanti yathābhūtam  pajānāti itiādi vuttam saḥ idam dukkhan ti yathābhūtam pajānāti itipe nirodha gāmini paṭipadā ti
translated: and is practising for the purpose of destroying craving, what does he know?🔽Because of the need to ask this question, it is said: ‘He knows as it really is: “These are the taints”, …🔽He knows as it really is: “These is the origin of the taints”, …🔽He knows as it really is: “These is the cessation of the taints”, …

original: yathābhūtaṃ pajānātī”ti ayaṃ paññatti saccānaṃ paṭivedhassa paññāpanato paṭivedhapaññatti🔽nāma, dassanabhūmiyā nikkhepassa ca paññāpanato nikkhepapaññatti nāma, maggassa bhāvanāya
analyzed: yathābhūtam pajānāti iti ayaṃ paññatti saccānam paṭivedhassa paññāpanataḥ paṭivedha paññatti  nāma dassanabhūmiyā nikkhepassa ca paññāpanataḥ nikkhepa paññatti nāma maggassa bhāvanāya
translated: He knows as it really is: “This is the way leading to the cessation of the taints”.’🔽This is called the description of penetration of the truths,🔽because it describes the penetration of the truths. It is called the description of the setting out,🔽because it describes the setting out on the plane of seeing. It is called the description of development,🔽because it describes the development of the path. It is called the description of realization,

original: ca paññāpanato bhāvanāpaññatti nāma, sotāpattiphalassa sacchikiriyāya ca paññāpanato
analyzed: ca paññāpanataḥ bhāvanā paññatti nāma sotāpatti phalassa sacchikiriyāya ca paññāpanato
translated: because it describes the realization of the fruit of stream-entry.

original: sacchikiriyāpaññatti nāma. “So ‘ime āsavā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti…pe… ‘āsavā asesaṃ
analyzed: nāma sacchikiriyāpaññatti nāma saḥ ime āsavā ati yathābhūtam pajānāti pe āsavāḥ asesam
translated: ‘He knows as it really is: “These are the taints”, …

original: nirujjhantī’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānātī”ti ayaṃ paññatti khayeñāṇassa uppādassa ca paññāpanato
analyzed: nirujjhanti iti yathābhūtam pajānāti iti ayam paññatti khaya ñāṇassa uppādassa ca paññāpanato
translated: he knows, as it really is, that they are ceasing.’ This is called the description of the arising of the knowledge of destruction.

original: uppādapaññatti nāma, anuppādeñāṇassa okāsassa ca paññāpanato okāsapaññatti nāma,
analyzed: uppāda paññatti nāma anuppāda ñāṇassa okāsassa ca paññāpanato okāsa paññatti nāma
translated: The description of non-arising is the description of the opportunity for the knowledge of non-arising.🔽The description of development is the description of the development of the path.

original: maggassa bhāvanāya ca paññāpanato bhāvanāpaññatti nāma, dukkhassa pariññāya ca paññāpanato🔽pariññāpaññatti nāma, samudayassa pahānassa ca paññāpanato pahānapaññatti nāma, vīriyindriyassa
analyzed: maggassa bhāvanāya ca paññāpanataḥ bhāvanā paññatti nāma dukkhassa pariññāya ca paññāpanataḥ  pariññā paññatti nāma samudayassa pahānassa ca paññāpanataḥ pahāna paññatti nāma vīriya indriyassa
translated: The description of full understanding is the description of the full understanding of suffering.🔽The description of abandoning is the description of the abandoning of the origin. The description of exerting energy is the description of the exertion of the energy faculty.

original: ārambhassa ca paññāpanato ārambhapaññatti nāma, āsāṭikānaṃ āhaṭanāya ca paññāpanato🔽āhaṭanāpaññatti nāma, bhāvanābhūmiyā nikkhepassa ca paññāpanato nikkhepapaññatti🔽nāma, pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ abhinighātassa ca paññāpanato abhinighātapaññatti nāma.
analyzed: ārambhassa ca paññāpanato ārambha paññatti nāma āsāṭikānaṃ āhaṭanāya ca paññāpanato  āhaṭanā paññatti nāma bhāvanā bhūmiyā nikkhepassa ca paññāpanataḥ nikkhepa paññatti  nāma pāpakānam akusalānam dhammānam abhinighātassa ca paññāpanataḥ abhinighāta paññatti nāma
translated: The description of uprooting is the description of the uprooting of the cankers. The description of the state of development is the description of the state of development of the jhana factors.🔽The description of the state of full understanding is the description of the state of full understanding of the truths. The description of the state of abandoning is the description of the state of abandoning of the defilements.🔽The description of the state of development is the description of the state of development of the path. The description of the state of the fruit is the description of the state of the four fruits of asceticism.

original: 41. Vaṭṭavasena vā vivaṭṭavasena vā dhammasammasanavasena vā upādānakkhandhavasena
analyzed: vaṭṭa vasena vā vivaṭṭa vasena vā dhamma sammasana vasena vā upādāna kkhandha vasena
translated: The description of the state of the cankers is the description of the state of the cankers. The description of the state of the exhaustion of the cankers is the description of the state of the exhaustion of the cankers.🔽The description of the state of the cankers is the description of the state of the cankers. The description of the state of the exhaustion of the cankers is the description of the state of the exhaustion of the cankers.🔽The description of the state of the cankers is the description of the state of the cankers. The description of the state of the exhaustion of the cankers is the description of the state of the exhaustion of the cankers.🔽The description of the state of the cankers is the description of the state of the cankers. The description of the state of the exhaustion of the cankers is the description of the state of the exhaustion of the cankers.🔽The description of the state of the cankers is the description of the state of the cankers. The description of the state of the exhaustion of the cankers is the description of the state of the exhaustion of the cankers.🔽The description of the state of the cankers is the description of the state of the cankers. The description of the state of the exhaustion of the cankers is the description of the state of

original: vā pajānanavasena vā saccesu nānāvidho paññattibhedo ācariyena vibhatto, amhehi ca
analyzed: vā pajānana vasena vā saccesu nānāvidhaḥ paññatti bhedaḥ ācariyena vibhattaḥ amhehi ca
translated: or by way of the various kinds of discernment in regard to the Truths, has been analysed by the Teacher and by us,

original: ñāto, “kathaṃ teparivaṭṭavasena saccesu paññattibhedo vibhatto”ti vattabbattā teparivaṭṭavasena
analyzed: ñāto katham te parivaṭṭa vasena saccesu paññatti bhedaḥ vibhatto ti vattabba ttā te parivaṭṭa vasena
translated: Or else the teacher has already analysed the various kinds of determinations in the four truths according to the way in which they are known, and we have understood that. Now it is asked: “How has the teacher analysed the various kinds of determinations in the four truths according to the way in which they revolve? ”

original: saccesu paññattibhedaṃ dassetuṃ “idaṃ dukkhanti me, bhikkhave”tiādi āraddhaṃ. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ🔽pana – “evaṃ vaṭṭavivaṭṭamukhena sammasanaupādānakkhandhamukheneva saccesu paññattivibhāgaṃ
analyzed: saccesu paññatti bhedam dassetum idam dukkhan ti me bhikkhave tiādi āraddham aṭṭhakathāyam  pana evam vaṭṭa vivaṭṭa mukhena sammasana upādāna kkhandha mukhena iva saccesu paññatti vibhāgam
translated: So in order to show the various kinds of determinations in the four truths according to the way in which they revolve, the following was begun: “‘This is suffering,’ bhikkhus, was said by me” .

original: dassetvā idāni teparivaṭṭavasena dassetuṃ ‘idaṃ dukkhanti me bhikkhave’tiādi āraddha”nti🔽vuttaṃ. Tattha pubbe parijānanato paṭṭhāya. Ananussutesūti parijānanavasena ananussutesu
analyzed: dassetvā idāni te parivaṭṭa vasena dassetum idam dukkhanti me bhikkhava iti ādi āraddhanti  vuttam tattha pubbe parijānanato paṭṭhāya ananussutesu iti parijānana vasena ananussutesu
translated: But in the Commentary it is said: “Having thus shown the analysis of the determinations in the four truths by way of the revolution and the non-revolution of the round, now in order to show it by way of the way in which they revolve, the following was begun: ‘“This is suffering,’ bhikkhus, was said by me” .

original: catūsu saccadhammesu. Cakkhunti paṭhamaṃ nibbānadassanaṭṭhena cakkhu nāma. Yathāsabhāvato
analyzed: catūsu sacca dhammesu cakkhunti paṭhamam nibbāna dassana ṭṭhena cakkhu nāma yathā sabhāvato
translated: Herein, from the time of previous full-understanding. In what has not been heard: in the four truths as yet unheard by way of full-understanding. Eye: what is called “eye” in the sense of first seeing extinction. According to its individual essence.

original: kiccaparijānanaṭṭhena sacchikiriyaparijānanaṭṭhena ñāṇaṃ nāma. Yathāsabhāvato kiccaparijānanādīnaṃ
analyzed: kicca parijānana ṭhena sacchikiriya parijānana ṭhena ñāṇam nāma yathā sabhāvato kicca parijānana ādīnam
translated: and as the act of fully understanding the function of knowing is called “full understanding as the act of knowing.”🔽As the act of penetrating and understanding the function of knowing things according to their specific nature is called “understanding,”

original: paṭivijjhitvā pajānanaṭṭhena paññā nāma. Tathā viditakaraṇaṭṭhena vijjā nāma. Ālokobhāsakaraṇaṭṭhena
analyzed: paṭivijjhitvā pajānana ṭṭhena paññā nāma tathā vidita karaṇa ṭṭhena vijjā nāma āloka ubhāsa karaṇa ṭṭhena
translated: as the act of making known is called “clear vision,”🔽as the act of illuminating is called “light,”🔽all this beginning with the eye is a synonym for understanding.

original: āloko nāma. Idaṃ cakkhādikaṃ sabbaṃ paññāvevacanameva. “Idaṃ dukkhanti me bhikkhave…pe…
analyzed: ālokaḥ nāma idam cakkha ādikam sabbam paññā vevacanam eva idam dukkham ti me bhikkhave pe
translated: “Bhikkhus, that ‘This is suffering’ …

original: udapādī”ti ayaṃ paññatti saccānaṃ desanāya paññāpanato desanāpaññatti nāma, sutamayiyā
analyzed: udapādi iti ayam paññatti saccānam desanāya paññāpanataḥ desanā paññatti nāma suta mayiyā
translated: arose in me” is called “the teaching of the truths as teaching” because it teaches the truths.🔽It is called “the teaching of the setting forth as setting forth” because it sets forth the setting forth that is due to the understanding consisting in what is heard.

original: paññāya nikkhepassa ca paññāpanato nikkhepapaññatti nāma, anaññātaññassāmītindriyassa🔽sacchikiriyāya ca paññāpanato sacchikiriyāpaññatti nāma, dhammacakkassa pavattanāya
analyzed: paññāya nikkhepassa ca paññāpanato nikkhepa paññatti nāma  sacchikiriyāya ca paññāpanataḥ sacchikiriyāpaññatti nāma dhammacakkassa pavattanāya
translated: It is called “the teaching of full understanding as full understanding” because it teaches the faculty “I am possessed of what is to be fully understood” .

original: ca paññāpanato pavattanāpaññatti nāma.
analyzed: ca paññāpanataḥ pavattanāpaññatti nāma
translated: It is called “the teaching of setting in motion as setting in motion” because it teaches the setting in motion of the wheel of the Dhamma.

original: “Taṃ kho panidaṃ dukkhaṃ pariññeyyaṃ…pe… udapādī”ti ayaṃ paññatti maggassa bhāvanāya
analyzed: tam kho panidam dukkham pariññeyyam pe udapādi iti ayam paññatti maggassa bhāvanāya
translated: “But this suffering is to be fully understood” …

original: paññāpanato bhāvanāpaññatti nāma, cintāmayiyā paññāya nikkhepassa ca paññāpanato
analyzed: paññāpanataḥ bhāvanā paññatti nāma cintā mayiyā paññāya nikkhepassa ca paññāpanato
translated: As to announcing, announcing of development is so called because of announcing of the development-type of understanding.🔽As to announcing of the setting forth, it is so called because of announcing of the setting forth by the understanding consisting in what is reasoned.

original: nikkhepapaññatti nāma, aññindriyassa sacchikiriyāya ca paññāpanato sacchikiriyāpaññatti nāma.
analyzed: nikkhepa paññatti nāma aññindriyassa sacchikiriyāya ca paññāpanato sacchikiriyāpaññatti nāma
translated: As to announcing of realization, it is so called because of announcing of the realization of the eye of understanding.

original: “Taṃ kho panidaṃ dukkhaṃ pariññātaṃ…pe… udapādī”ti ayaṃ paññatti maggassa bhāvanāya🔽paññāpanato bhāvanāpaññatti nāma, bhāvanāmayiyā paññāya nikkhepassa ca paññāpanato🔽nikkhepapaññatti nāma, aññātāvino indriyassa sacchikiriyāya ca paññāpanato sacchikiriyāpaññatti
analyzed: tam kho panidam dukkham udapādi iti ayam paññatti maggassa bhāvanāya  paññāpanataḥ bhāvanā paññatti nāma bhāvanā mayiyā paññāya nikkhepassa ca paññāpanato  nikkhepa paññatti nāma aññātāvino indriyassa sacchikiriyāya ca paññāpanato sacchikiriyā paññatti
translated: “This suffering, which has been fully understood by me … has appeared” . This announcing is announcing of development of the path.🔽As to announcing of the setting forth, it is so called because of announcing of the setting forth by the understanding consisting in what is reasoned.🔽As to announcing of realization, it is so called because of announcing of the realization of the eye of understanding of one who has understanding.

original: nāma, dhammacakkassa pavattanāya ca paññāpanato pavattanāpaññatti nāma.
analyzed: nāma dhammacakkassa pavattanāya ca paññāpanato pavattanā paññatti nāma
translated: As to announcing of revolution, it is so called because of announcing of the revolution of the wheel of the True Idea.

original: Teparivaṭṭavasena saccesu nānāvidho paññattibhedo ācariyena vibhatto, amhehi ca ñāto,
analyzed: saccesu nānāvidhaḥ paññatti bhedaḥ ācariyena vibhattaḥ amhehi ca ñāto
translated: The teacher has analysed the various kinds of announcing in the four Truths by way of the three revolutions, and we have understood it.

original: “kathaṃ kusalākusalādivasena desitadhammassa paññattibhedo vibhatto”ti vattabbattā
analyzed: katham kusala akusala ādi vasena desita dhammassa paññatti bhedaḥ vibhattaḥ ti vattabbattā
