translated: Now, it being said “How has the teacher analysed the various kinds of announcing of the ideas taught by way of the profitable, unprofitable, and so on? ”

original: “tulamatulañca sambhava”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Atha vā dhammacakkasutte paññattibhedo ācariyena🔽vibhatto, amhehi ca ñāto, “tulamatulañcātiādigāthāya kathaṃ paññattibhedo vibhatto”ti
analyzed: tulam atulam ca sambhavanti ādi vuttam atha vā dhammacakka sutte paññatti bhedaḥ ācariyena  vibhattaḥ amhehi ca tulam atulam ca ati ādi gāthāya katham paññatti bhedaḥ vibhatto ti
translated: Or alternatively, the teacher has already analyzed the classification of ideas in the Dhammacakkappavattana Sutta,🔽and we have already understood that, so it is said “The comparable and the incomparable” and so on in order to show how the classification of ideas is analyzed in the verse beginning “The comparable and the incomparable.”

original: vattabbattā “tulamatulañcā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tulīyati paricchijjīyatīti tulaṃ, kāmāvacarakammaṃ,
analyzed: vattabba ttā tulam atulam ca atiādi vuttam tulīyati paricchijjīyati iti tulam kāmāvacara kammaṃ
translated: The comparable is what is measured, what is delimited, namely, sense-desire-world kamma.

original: natthi tulaṃ sadisaṃ aññaṃ lokiyakammaṃ assa mahaggatakammassāti atulaṃ, rūpārūpāvacarakammaṃ.
analyzed: natthi tulam sadisam aññam lokiya kammam assa mahaggata kammassa ati atulam rūpa arūpa avacara kammaṃ
translated: The incomparable is what has no equal in the world, namely, the great profitable kamma of the fine-material and immaterial worlds.🔽Becoming is what becomes again by means of this kamma, that is to say, rebirth-linking.

original: Punabbhavaṃ sambhavati etena saṅkhārenāti sambhavo, taṃ sambhavaṃ. Punabbhavaṃ saṅkharotīti
analyzed: punabbhavam sambhavati etena saṅkhārena ati sambhavaḥ tam sambhavam punabbhavam saṅkharoti iti
translated: The becoming-formation is what forms becoming.🔽The internally pleased is what is pleased internally by means of insight.

original: bhavasaṅkhāro. Ajjhatte vipassanāvasena ramatīti ajjhattarato. Samathavasena samādhiyatīti
analyzed: bhava saṅkhāraḥ ajjhatte vipassanā vasena ramati iti ajjhattarataḥ samatha vasena samādhiyati iti
translated: The concentrated is what is concentrated by means of serenity.🔽The self-becoming is what becomes in oneself.

original: samāhito. Attani sambhavatīti attasambhavo, taṃ attasambhavaṃ. Muni sambuddho sambhavaṃ
analyzed: samāhitaḥ attani sambhavati iti atta sambhavaḥ tam atta sambhavam muni sambuddhaḥ sambhavam
translated: The sage is the Enlightened One.

original: bhavasaṅkhāraṃ tulañca atulañca avassaji, ajjhattarato samāhito kavacaṃ abhindi iva,
analyzed: bhava saṅkhāram tulam ca atulam ca avassaji ajjhattaratas samāhitaḥ kavacam iva
translated: He cast off the formation of being, the comparable and the incomparable, delighting in himself, concentrated, as one who breaks a fortress.

original: evaṃ attasambhavaṃ abhindi padālayīti yojanā kātabbā. Atha vā muni sambuddho “pañcakkhandhā
analyzed: evam atta sambhavam abhindi padālayi iti yojanā kātabbā atha vā muni sambuddhaḥ pañca kkhandhā
translated: Thus he broke his own becoming, he crushed it. The construction should be understood thus. Or alternatively, the sage, the Enlightened One,

original: aniccā dukkhā anattā vipariṇāmadhammā, nibbānaṃ pana niccaṃ sukhaṃ asaṅkhataṃ avipariṇāmadhamma”nti
analyzed: aniccāḥ dukkhāḥ anattāḥ vipariṇāma dhammāḥ nibbānam pana niccam sukham asaṅkhatam a vipariṇāma dhammanti
translated: pondering over the five aggregates, which are impermanent, painful, not self, subject to change,

original: tulaṃ tulayanto atulaṃ nibbānaṃ disvā sambhavaṃ bhavasaṅkhāraṃ ariyamaggena avassaji.
analyzed: tulam tulayantaḥ atulam nibbānam disvā sambhavam bhava saṅkhāram ariya maggena avassaji
translated: and seeing the incomparable Nibbāna, which is permanent, pleasant, self, not subject to change, cast off the formation of being by the noble path.

original: Kathaṃ avassaji? So hi muni vipassanāvasena ajjhattarato ca hutvā, samathavasena
analyzed: katham saḥ hi muni vipassanā vasena ajjhattaratas ca hutvā samatha vasena
translated: How did he cast it off? He, the sage, delighting in himself by way of insight,

original: upacārappanāsu samāhito ca hutvā kavacaṃ abhindi iva, evaṃ attasambhavaṃ attani sañjātaṃ
analyzed: upacāra ppanāsu ca hutvā kavacam iva evam atta sambhavam attani sañjātam
translated: and concentrated by way of serenity, in the access and absorption attainments, as one who breaks a fortress, thus he broke his own becoming, he crushed it, which arose in himself,

original: kilesaṃ abhindi padālayi, kilesābhāvena kammañca jahīti gāthāttho gahetabbo.
analyzed: kilesam abhindi padālayi kilesa abhāvena kamman ca jahi iti gāthā atthaḥ gahetabbo
translated: and by way of the absence of defilements he cast off kamma. This is how the meaning of the verse should be grasped.

original: “Tulamatulañca sambhava”nti paññatti sabbadhammānaṃ abhiññāya paññāpanato abhiññāpaññatti
analyzed: tulam atulam ca sambhavanti paññatti sabba dhammānam abhiññāya paññāpanataḥ abhiññā paññatti
translated: The expression “the comparable and the incomparable, his becoming” is a designation of all dhammas by way of direct knowledge, because of the designation by way of direct knowledge.

original: nāma, dhammapaṭisambhidāya nikkhepassa ca paññāpanato nikkhepapaññatti nāma, “bhavasaṅkhāramavassaji
analyzed: nāma dhamma paṭisambhidāya nikkhepassa ca paññāpanataḥ nikkhepa paññatti nāma bhava saṅkhāra mavassaji
translated: is called a ‘definition by means of a statement of the meaning’,

original: munī”ti paññatti samudayassa pariccāgassa ca paññāpanato pariccāgapaññatti nāma,
analyzed: muni iti paññatti samudayassa pariccāgassa ca paññāpanato pariccāga paññatti nāma
translated: is called a ‘definition by means of a statement of the abandoning of the idea of becoming’,

original: dukkhassa pariññāya ca paññāpanato pariññāpaññatti nāma, “ajjhattarato samāhito”ti🔽paññatti kāyagatāya satiyā bhāvanāya ca paññāpanato bhāvanāpaññatti nāma, cittekaggatāya
analyzed: dukkhassa pariññāya ca paññāpanato pariññāpaññatti nāma ajjhattaratas samāhito ti  paññatti kāya gatāya satiyāḥ bhāvanāya ca paññāpanataḥ bhāvanā paññatti nāma citta ekagga tāya
translated: is called a ‘definition by means of a statement of the full understanding of suffering’,🔽is called a ‘definition by means of a statement of the development of mindfulness occupied with the body’,

original: ṭhitiyā ca paññāpanato ṭhitipaññatti nāma, “abhindi kavacamivattasambhava”nti paññatti
analyzed: ṭhitiyāḥ ca paññāpanataḥ ṭhitipaññatti nāma paññatti
translated: is called a ‘definition by means of a statement of the steadiness of one-pointedness of mind’,🔽is called a ‘definition by means of a statement of the dispassion of the mind’,

original: cittassa abhinibbidāya ca paññāpanato abhinibbidāpaññatti nāma, sabbaññutāya upādānassa
analyzed: cittassa abhinibbidāya ca paññāpanataḥ abhinibbidā paññatti nāma sabbaññu tāya upādānassa
translated: is called a ‘definition by means of a statement of the relinquishing of all’,

original: ca paññāpanato upādānapaññatti nāma, avijjāṇḍakosānaṃ padālanāya ca paññāpanato padālapaññatti
analyzed: ca paññāpanataḥ upādāna paññatti nāma avijjāṇḍakosānam padālanāya ca paññāpanataḥ padāla paññatti
translated: is called a ‘definition by means of a statement of the crushing of the egg-shell of ignorance’,

original: nāma, “yathāvutto paññattippabhedo kena saddahitabbo”ti vattabbattā “tenāhā”tiādi
analyzed: nāma yathā vutto paññatti ppabhedo kena saddahitabbaḥ iti vattabbattā tena āha atiādi
translated: “Therefore he said” is said in order to show this.

original: vuttaṃ. Tathāvuttassa paññattippabhedassa sambhavato bhagavā yaṃ “tulamatula”ntiādigāthamāha,
analyzed: vuttam tathā vuttassa paññatti ppabhedassa sambhavataḥ bhagavā yam tulam atulam iti ādi gātham āha
translated: Since the analysis of the teaching of names as stated is possible, the Blessed One said the stanza beginning with “Tulamatulañca.”

original: tathāsambhavato yathāvuttāya gāthāya yathāvutto paññattippabhedo saddahitabboti.
analyzed: tathā sambhavataḥ yathā vuttāya gāthāya yathā vuttaḥ paññatti ppabhedaḥ saddahitabbaḥ iti
translated: Since the possibility of the analysis of the teaching of names as stated is thus, the analysis of the teaching of names as stated is to be believed by means of the stanza as stated.

original: “Tulamatulañcā”tiādigāthāyaṃ paññattippabhedo ācariyena vibhatto, amhehi ca ñāto.
analyzed: tulam atulam ca ati ādi gāthā ayam paññatti ppabhedaḥ ācariyena vibhattaḥ amhehi ca ñāto
translated: In the stanza beginning with “Tulamatulañca,” the analysis of the teaching of names has been analysed by the teacher and is known to us.

original: ‘Yo dukkhamaddakkhi yatonidānaṃ, kāmesu so jantu kathaṃ nameyya;
analyzed: yaḥ dukkham addakkhi yatonidānam kāmesu saḥ jantu katham nameyya
translated: “One who sees suffering and its source, how could such a person bow to sense desires?

original: Kāmā hi loke saṅgoti ñatvā, tesaṃ satīmā vinayāya sikkhe’ti. –🔽Gāthāyaṃ pana kathaṃ paññattibhedo vibhatto”ti vattabbattā “yo dukkhamaddakkhī”tiādi
analyzed: kāmāḥ hi loke saṅgā iti ñatvā tesam satī imā vinayāya sikkha iti  gāthā ayam pana katham paññatti bhedaḥ vibhattaḥ ti vattabba ttā yaḥ dukkham addakkhi itiādi
translated: Knowing that sense desires in the world are a snare, he should train with mindfulness to remove them.”🔽But in order to show how the analysis of the teaching of names is analysed in the stanza beginning with “Yo dukkhamaddakkhi,”

original: vuttaṃ. Yo āraddhavipassako jantu yatonidānaṃ sabbaṃ tebhūmakaṃ hetuphalaṃ dukkhaṃ
analyzed: vuttam yaḥ āraddha vipassakaḥ jantu yatonidānam sabbam tebhūmakam hetu phalam dukkham
translated: “Yo dukkhamaddakkhī” is said. A person who has begun insight sees suffering and its source, all the result and cause in the three planes of becoming,

original: addakkhi, so āraddhavipassako jantu kāmesu kathaṃ nameyya nametuṃ nārahati. Kāmā
analyzed: addakkhi saḥ āraddha vipassakaḥ jantu kāmesu katham nameyya nametum na ārahati kāmā
translated: He saw how a person who has begun insight could not possibly bow down to sensual desires.

original: loke “saṅgo”ti hi yasmā passitabbā, tasmā nametuṃ nārahati, iti etaṃ dukkhabhāvaṃ
analyzed: loke saṅgā iti hi yasmā passitabbā tasmā nametum na arahati iti etam dukkha bhāvam
translated: Because sensual desires should be seen in the world as “bonds,” therefore he could not possibly bow down to them.🔽Having thus known their state of suffering and their state of cause of suffering,

original: dukkhahetubhāvaṃ ñatvā tesaṃ kāmānaṃ vinayāya vūpasamāya satimā kāyagatāsatisampanno
analyzed: dukkha hetu bhāvam ñatvā tesam kāmānam vinayāya vūpasamāya satimā kāya gata asati sampannaḥ
translated: he was mindful, possessed of mindfulness occupied with the body, for the purpose of their restraint and allaying.

original: tīṇi sikkhāni sikkhe sikkheyyāti gāthāttho saṅkhepena viññātabbo. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana
analyzed: tīṇi sikkhāni sikkhe sikkheyya iti gāthā atthaḥ saṅkhepena viññātabbaḥ aṭṭhakathā ayam pana
translated: He should train, train in the three trainings. This is the meaning of the verse in brief. But in the commentary

original: vitthārena saṃvaṇṇito.🔽“Yo dukkha”nti paññatti dukkhassa vevacanassa ca pariññāya ca paññāpanato vevacanapaññatti,🔽pariññāpaññatti ca hoti. “Yatonidāna”nti paññatti samudayassa pabhavassa ca pahānassa
analyzed: vitthārena saṃvaṇṇitaḥ  yaḥ dukkhanti paññatti dukkhassa vevacanassa ca pariññāya ca paññāpanataḥ vevacana paññatti  pariññā paññatti ca hoti yatonidāna nti paññatti samudayassa pabhavassa ca pahānassa
translated: it is expounded in detail.🔽The description “He who is suffering” is a description of synonyms and of full understanding, because it describes synonyms for suffering and its full understanding.🔽The description “From which source” is a description of origination and of source and of abandoning, because it describes the origination of suffering, its source, and its abandoning. The description “He saw”

original: ca paññāpanato pabhavapaññatti ceva pahānapaññatti ca hoti. “Addakkhī”ti paññatti
analyzed: ca paññāpanataḥ pabhava paññatti ca iva pahāna paññatti ca hoti addakkhi iti paññatti
translated: is a description of the seen, because it describes what was seen by him.

original: ñāṇacakkhussa vevacanassa ca paṭivedhassa ca paññāpanato vevacanapaññatti ceva paṭivedhapaññatti
analyzed: ñāṇa cakkhussa vevacanassa ca paṭivedhassa ca paññāpanataḥ vevacana paññatti ca iva paṭivedha paññatti
translated: is a description of synonyms and a description of penetration.

original: ca hoti. “Kāmesu so jantu kathaṃ nameyyā”ti paññatti kāmataṇhāya vevacanassa ca anabhinivisassa🔽ca paññāpanato vevacanapaññatti ceva anabhinivesapaññatti ca hoti. “Kāmā hi loke
analyzed: ca hoti kāmesu saḥ jantu katham nameyya ati paññatti kāma taṇhāya vevacanassa ca an abhinivisassa  ca paññāpanataḥ vevacana paññatti ca iva anabhinivesa paññatti ca hoti kāmāḥ hi loke
translated: The description “How could a man incline to sensual desires?” is a description of synonyms and a description of non-adherence🔽to sense desires, since it describes the synonyms of sense desire and non-adherence to sense desires.🔽The description “For sensual desires in the world”

original: saṅgoti ñatvā”ti paññatti kāmānaṃ paccatthikato dassanassa ca paññāpanato dassanapaññatti🔽nāma. Kāmā hi anatthajānanato paccatthikasadisā.
analyzed: saṅgo ti ñatvā ati paññatti kāmānam paccatthikataḥ dassanassa ca paññāpanataḥ dassana paññatti  nāma kāmāḥ hi anattha jānanataḥ paccatthika sadisā
translated: is a description of seeing, since it describes the seeing of sensual desires as an enemy.🔽For sensual desires are like an enemy because of the knowledge of their harmfulness.🔽Since it is necessary to ask “What sort are they that cause harm? “ , the passage beginning “For sensual desires in the world” is stated.

original: “Kīdisā hutvā anatthajanakā”ti pucchitabbattā “kāmā hī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Kāmā rāgaggiādīhi🔽antodayhanato aṅgārakāsūpamā ca, pūtibhāvāpajjanato maṃsapesūpamā ca, bahi aññena
analyzed: kīdisāḥ hutvā anattha janakā ati pucchitabbattā kāmāḥ hi itiādi vuttam kāmāḥ rāga aggi ādīhi  anta udayhanataḥ aṅgārakāsu upamā ca pūti bhāva āpajjanataḥ ca bahi aññena
translated: Sensual desires are like a charcoal pit because they burn internally with the fire of lust, etc.,🔽like a piece of meat because they lead to putrefaction, like a burning mass of fire and embers because they are burned externally by another,

original: dayhanato pāvakakappā jalitaggikkhandhūpamā ca, patiṭṭhānābhāvato papātūpamā ca,
analyzed: dayhanataḥ pāvaka kappā jalitaggi khandhu upamā ca patiṭṭhāna abhāvataḥ papātu upamā ca
translated: like a precipice because they have no footing,

original: visasadisehi dosādīhi parahiṃsanato uragopamā ca. “Tesaṃ satīmā”ti paññatti pahānāya
analyzed: visa sadisehi dosa ādīhi para hiṃsanataḥ uraga upamā ca tesam paññatti pahānāya
translated: And it is like a snake because of the harming of others through the various kinds of poison beginning with hate. “Mindful” is a designation for the abandoning of the hindrances.

original: apacayassa ca paññāpanato apacayapaññatti nāma, kāyagatāya satiyā nikkhepassa ca
analyzed: apacayassa ca paññāpanato apacaya paññatti nāma kāya gatāya satiyā nikkhepassa ca
translated: “Decrease” is a designation for the decrease of the hindrances. “Casting out” is a designation for the casting out of the hindrances.

original: paññāpanato nikkhepapaññatti nāma, maggassa bhāvanāya ca paññāpanato bhāvanāpaññatti🔽nāma. “Vinayāya sikkhe”ti paññattirāgavinayassa dosavinayassa mohavinayassa paṭivedhassa
analyzed: paññāpanataḥ nikkhepa paññatti nāma maggassa bhāvanāya ca paññāpanataḥ bhāvanā paññatti  nāma vinayāya sikkha iti paññatti rāga vinayassa dosa vinayassa moha vinayassa paṭivedhassa
translated: “Development” is a designation for the development of the path. “Training” is a designation for the penetration of the training.

original: ca paññāpanato paṭivedhapaññatti nāma. “Jantū”ti paññatti yogissa vevacanassa ca
analyzed: ca paññāpanato paṭivedha paññatti nāma jantu uti paññatti yogissa vevacanassa ca
translated: “Penetration” is a designation for the penetration of the abandoning of lust, hate, and delusion. “Creature” is a designation for the synonyms of the word “creature.”

original: paññāpanato vevacanapaññatti nāma.
analyzed: paññāpanataḥ vevacana paññatti nāma
translated: “Synonyms” is a designation for the synonyms of the word “creature.”

original: “Jantūti sāmaññasattavācako saddo kasmā yogivācakoti viññātabbo”ti vattabbattā “yadā🔽hī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Yogī yadā yasmiṃ kāle kāmā saṅgoti pajānāti, tadā tasmiṃ kāle so
analyzed: jantu uti sāmañña satta vācako saddo kasmā yogi vācako ti viññātabbaḥ iti vattabbattā yadā 🔽hi itiādi vuttam yogī yadā yasmin kāle kāmā saṅgā iti pajānāti tadā tasmin kāle saḥ
translated: “Why should the word ‘creature’ be understood as a word for a meditator?” In order to answer this question, the following is said.

original: yogī kāmānaṃ anuppādāya kusale dhamme kāyagatāsatiādīhi uppādayati, so kusale dhamme
analyzed: yogī kāmānam an uppādāya kusale dhamme kāya gata asati ādīhi uppādayati saḥ kusale dhamme
translated: The meditator generates profitable ideas by means of the mindfulness occupied with the body, etc., for the purpose of preventing the unprofitable from arising.

original: uppādento yogī anuppannānaṃ kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ uppādāya vāyamati kusalavīriyaṃ karoti,
analyzed: uppādentaḥ yogī anuppannānam kusalānam dhammānam uppādāya vā āyamati kusala vīriyam karoti
translated: When he generates profitable ideas, the meditator makes an effort for the arising of unarisen profitable ideas, he makes a profitable effort.

original: tasmā yogīvācako jantusaddoti viññātabbo. “Jantū”ti ayaṃ paññatti appattassa kusalassa
analyzed: tasmā yogī vācakaḥ jantu saddo ti viññātabbaḥ jantu iti ayam paññatti appattassa kusalassa
translated: So the word “creature” should be understood to be a designation for the meditator.

original: jhānadhammādikassa pattiyā vāyāmassa ca paññāpanato vāyāmapaññatti nāma, oramattikāya🔽asantuṭṭhiyā nikkhepassa ca paññāpanato nikkhepapaññatti nāma. “So anuppannānaṃ kusalānaṃ
analyzed: jhāna dhamma ādikassa pattiyāḥ vāyāmassa ca paññāpanataḥ vāyāmapaññatti nāma oramattikāya  asantuṭṭhiyāḥ nikkhepassa ca paññāpanato nikkhepa paññatti nāma so anuppannānam kusalānam
translated: The word “creature” is a designation for the effort to attain profitable ideas not yet attained, such as the jhāna ideas, etc.,🔽and for the effort to abandon discontent and to abandon the unfruitful.

original: dhammānaṃ uppādāya vāyamatī”ti ayaṃ paññatti vāyāmapaññatti, “hetuso uppannānaṃ kusalānaṃ
analyzed: dhammānam uppādāya vāyamati iti ayam paññatti vāyāma paññatti hetuso uppannānam kusalānam
translated: The phrase “he makes an effort for the arising of unarisen profitable ideas” is a designation for the effort designation.

original: dhammānaṃ ṭhitiyā vāyamatīti paññatti katamā paññattī”ti pucchitabbattā “tattha so
analyzed: dhammānam ṭhitiyā vāyamati iti paññatti katamā paññatti iti pucchitabbattā tattha so
translated: The phrase “he makes an effort for the maintenance of arisen profitable ideas” is a designation for what designation?

original: uppannāna”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha tasmiṃ “anuppannāna”ntiādimhi. “So uppannānaṃ kusalānaṃ
analyzed: uppannāna nti ādi vuttam tattha tasmin anuppannāna nti ādimhi saḥ uppannānam kusalānam
translated: This is how the question should be put. So “therein” is said in order to show that it is in the phrase “he makes an effort for the arising of unarisen profitable ideas” that the effort designation is to be understood.🔽The phrase “he makes an effort for the maintenance of arisen profitable ideas” is a designation for the maintenance designation.

original: dhammānaṃ ṭhitiyā vāyamatī”ti ayaṃ paññatti bhāvanāya appamādassa ca paññāpanato
analyzed: dhammānam ṭhitiyā vā āyamati iti ayam paññatti bhāvanāya appamādassa ca paññāpanato
translated: “He strives for the endurance of dhammas” is the intimation of non-negligence,🔽because it intimates non-negligence in development.

original: appamādapaññatti nāma, vīriyindriyassa nikkhepassa ca paññāpanato nikkhepapaññatti🔽nāma, kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ ārakkhassa ca paññāpanato ārakkhapaññatti nāma, adhicittasikkhāya
analyzed: appamāda paññatti nāma vīriya indriyassa nikkhepassa ca paññāpanataḥ nikkhepa paññatti  nāma kusalānam dhammānam ārakkhassa ca paññāpanataḥ ārakkha paññatti nāma adhi citta sikkhāya
translated: “He strives for the relinquishment of the faculty of energy” is the intimation of relinquishment,🔽because it intimates the relinquishment of the faculty of energy.🔽“He strives for the protection of profitable dhammas” is the intimation of protection,🔽because it intimates the protection of profitable dhammas.🔽“He strives for the endurance of the training in the higher cognizance” is the intimation of endurance,🔽because it intimates the endurance of the training in the higher cognizance.

original: ṭhitiyā ca paññāpanato ṭhitipaññatti nāma. “Kena yathāvuttappakāro paññattippabhedo
analyzed: ṭhitiyāḥ ca paññāpanataḥ ṭhiti paññatti nāma kena yathā vutta ppakāraḥ paññatti ppabhedaḥ
translated: “By what is this classification of intimation stated in the way already quoted to be trusted?”

original: saddahitabbo”ti vattabbattā “tenāhā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: saddahitabbaḥ iti vattabbattā tena āha atiādi vuttam
translated: “Therefore he said” is said.

original: “Yo dukkhamaddakkhi yatonidāna”ntiādigāthāya paññattippabhedo ācariyena vibhatto, amhehi ca ñāto.
analyzed: yaḥ dukkham addakkhi yatonidāna nti ādi gāthāya paññatti pabhedaḥ ācariyena vibhattaḥ amhehi ca ñātaḥ
translated: The classification of intimation has been analysed by the teacher in the stanza beginning “He who has seen suffering and its origin too” , and we have understood it.🔽The world is bound by delusion,

original: “Mohasambandhano loko, bhabbarūpova dissati;
analyzed: moha sambandhanaḥ lokaḥ bhabba rūpaḥ uva dissati
translated: It seems as if it were a thing of power;🔽The fool is fettered by assuming,

original: Upadhibandhano bālo, tamasā parivārito;
analyzed: upadhi bandhanaḥ bālaḥ tamasā parivāritaḥ
translated: Surrounded by the darkness of delusion;🔽It seems as if he were without glory,

original: Assirī viya khāyati, passato natthi kiñcananti. –
analyzed: assirī viya khāyati passataḥ natthi kiñcananti
translated: But when he sees, there is nothing at all.

original: Gāthāyaṃ pana kathaṃ paññattippabhedo vibhatto”ti vattabbattā “mohasambandhano”tiādi
analyzed: gāthā ayam pana katham paññatti ppabhedaḥ vibhatto ti vattabba ttā moha sambandhana utiādi
translated: But since it has to be said how the exposition by way of the rule is distributed in the verse, therefore it is said beginning with “The world is seen as if it were able” .🔽Herein, the world is seen as if it were able is seen by fools who are not seers as if it were able, as if it were of the kind that is able, though it is not able.🔽The world is bound by the fetter of delusion is bound by the fetter of the fetters that have delusion as their source.

original: vuttaṃ. Tattha mohasambandhanoti mohahetukehi saṃyojanehi sambandho. Lokoti appahīnasaṃyojano🔽sattaloko. Bhabbarūpova dissatīti abhabbopi attā bhabbarūpova bhabbajātiko viya bālānaṃ
analyzed: vuttam tattha moha sambandhanaḥ ti moha hetukehi saṃyojanehi sambandhaḥ loko ti appahīna saṃyojano  satta lokaḥ bhabba rūpaḥ iva dissati iti abhabbaḥ api attā bhabba rūpaḥ iva bhabba jātikaḥ viya bālānam
translated: The world is bound by the fetter of delusion is bound by the fetter of the fetters that have delusion as their source.🔽The world is bound by the fetter of delusion is bound by the fetter of the fetters that have delusion as their source.🔽The world is bound by the fetter of delusion is bound by the fetter of the fetters that have delusion as their source.🔽The world is bound by the fetter of delusion is bound by the fetter of the fetters that have delusion as their source.🔽The world is bound by the fetter of delusion is bound by the fetter of the fetters that have delusion as their source.🔽The world is bound by the fetter of delusion is bound by the fetter of the fetters that have delusion as their source.🔽The world is bound by the fetter of delusion is bound by the fetter of the fetters that have delusion as their source.🔽The world is bound by the fetter of delusion is bound by the fetter of the fetters that have delusion as their source.🔽The world is bound by the fetter of delusion is bound by the fetter of the fetters that have delusion as their source.🔽The world is bound by the fetter of delusion is bound by the fetter of the fetters that have delusion as their source.

original: avipassakānaṃ dissati. Upadhibandhanoti kilesūpadhīhi bandhitabbo. Yu-paccayo hi
analyzed: a vipassakānam dissati upadhi bandhanaḥ ti kilesu upadhīhi bandhitabbaḥ yu paccayaḥ hi
translated: The world is bound by the fetter of delusion is bound by the fetter of the fetters that have delusion as their source.

original: kammatthe vihito. Upadhīsu vā kilesānaṃ bandhanaṃ yassa bālassāti upadhibandhano.🔽Dve avaḍḍhiyo lāti gaṇhātīti bālo. Tamasā sammohena parivārito paṭicchādito paṇḍitānaṃ
analyzed: kammatthe vihitaḥ upadhīsu vā kilesānam bandhanam yassa bālassa ati upadhibandhano  dve avaḍḍhiyaḥ lāti gaṇhāti iti bālo tamasā sammohena parivāritaḥ paṭicchāditaḥ paṇḍitānam
translated: The world is bound by the fetter of delusion is bound by the fetter of the fetters that have delusion as their source.🔽The world is bound by the fetter of delusion is bound by the fetter of the fetters that have delusion as their source.🔽The world is bound by the fetter of delusion is bound by the fetter of the fetters that have delusion as their source.

original: vipassakānaṃ assirī viya sirīvirahito viya khāyati upaṭṭhāti. Passato paññācakkhunā🔽passantassa paṇḍitassa kiñcanaṃ natthīti saṅkhepattho daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: vipassakānam assirī viya sirī virahitaḥ viya khāyati upaṭṭhāti passataḥ paññā cakkhunā 🔽passantassa paṇḍitassa kiñcanam natthi iti saṅkhepa atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: The world is bound by the fet

original: “Mohasambandhano loko”ti paññatti mohasīsena gahitānaṃ vipallāsānaṃ desanāya paññāpanato
analyzed: moha sambandhanaḥ loko ti paññatti moha sīsena gahitānam vipallāsānam desanāya paññāpanato
translated: “The world is bound by delusion” is a description by way of the teaching of the perversions that are taken by way of the delusion faculty.

original: desanāpaññatti nāma. “Bhabbarūpova dissatī”ti paññatti lokassa viparītassa viparītākārena🔽upaṭṭhahantassa paññāpanato viparītapaññatti nāma. “Upadhibandhano bālo”ti paññatti🔽pāpakānaṃ icchāvacarānaṃ pabhavassa paññāpanato pabhavapaññatti nāma. “Upadhibandhano🔽bālo”ti paññatti pariyuṭṭhānānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ bandhanakiccassa paññāpanato
analyzed: desanā paññatti nāma bhabba rūpaḥ uva dissati iti paññatti lokassa viparītassa viparīta ākārena  upaṭṭhahantassa paññāpanataḥ viparītapaññatti nāma upadhi bandhanaḥ bālaḥ iti paññatti  pāpakānam icchāvacarānam pabhavassa paññāpanataḥ pabhavapaññatti nāma upadhi bandhano  bālaḥ ti paññatti pariyuṭṭhānānam akusalānam dhammānam bandhana kiccassa paññāpanato
translated: “It appears as if it were able” is a description of the world that appears in a perverted way to one who is perverted.🔽“The fool is bound by clinging” is a description of the origin of evil desires.🔽“The fool is bound by clinging” is a description of the function of the fetters of unwholesome states.

original: kiccapaññatti nāma. “Upadhibandhano bālo”ti paññatti kilesānaṃ bandhanabalamūhanabalānaṃ
analyzed: kiccapaññatti nāma upadhi bandhanaḥ bālaḥ ti paññatti kilesānam bandhana bala mūhana balānam
translated: “The fool is bound by clinging” is a description of the power of defilements that are the power of bondage and the power of delusion.

original: paññāpanato balapaññatti nāma. “Upadhibandhano bālo”ti paññatti saṅkhārānaṃ viruhanāya
analyzed: paññāpanataḥ bala paññatti nāma upadhi bandhanaḥ bālaḥ iti paññatti saṅkhārānam viruhanāya
translated: “The fool is bound by clinging” is a description of the growth of formations.

original: paññāpanato viruhanāpaññatti nāma. “Tamasā parivārito”ti paññatti avijjandhakārassa
analyzed: paññāpanataḥ viruhanāpaññatti nāma tamasā parivārito ti paññatti avijjandhakārassa
translated: “He is surrounded by darkness” is a description of the darkness of ignorance.

original: desanāya paññāpanato desanāpaññatti nāma, avijjandhakārassa vevacanassa ca paññāpanato🔽vevacanapaññatti nāma. “Assirī viya khāyatī”ti paññatti dibbacakkhussa dassanakiriyāya
analyzed: desanāya paññāpanataḥ desanā paññatti nāma avijja andhakārassa vevacanassa ca paññāpanato  vevacana paññatti nāma assirī viya khāyati iti paññatti dibba cakkhussa dassana kiriyāya
translated: The description of the description of the synonyms is the description of the synonyms for the darkness of ignorance.🔽The description of the description of the seeing is the description of the function of seeing with the divine eye.

original: paññāpanato dassanapaññatti nāma. “Assirī viya khāyatī”ti paññatti paññācakkhussa🔽nikkhepassa paññāpanato nikkhepapaññatti nāma. “Passato natthi kiñcana”nti paññatti
analyzed: paññāpanato dassana paññatti nāma assirī viya khāyati iti paññatti paññācakkhussa  nikkhepassa paññāpanato nikkhepa paññatti nāma passataḥ natthi kiñcananti paññatti
translated: The description of the description of the casting out is the description of the casting out of the wisdom eye.

original: sattānaṃ ariyānaṃ paṭivedhassa paññāpanato paṭivedhapaññatti nāma.
analyzed: sattānam ariyānam paṭivedhassa paññāpanato paṭivedha paññatti nāma
translated: The description of the description of the penetration is the description of the penetration of the noble ones.

original: “Katamaṃ kiñcana”nti pucchitabbattā “rāgo kiñcana”ntiādi vuttaṃ. “Yathāvutto paññattippabhedo
analyzed: katamam kiñcananti pucchitabba ttā rāgaḥ kiñcana ntiādi vuttam yathā vuttaḥ paññatti ppabhedo
translated: Because it should be asked “What is the something?” it is said “craving is the something,” and so on.

original: kathaṃ amhehi saddahitabbo”ti vattabbattā “tenāhā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Yathāvuttassa paññattippabhedassa
analyzed: katham amhehi saddahitabbaḥ iti vattabbattā tena āha atiādi vuttam yathā vuttassa paññatti ppabhedassa
translated: Because it should be said “How can we believe the description of the description that has been stated?” it is said “Therefore he said,” and so on.🔽Because the description of the description that has been stated

original: sambhavato bhagavā yaṃ “mohasambandhano”tiādimāha, tathāsambhavato tāya gāthāya yathāvutto
analyzed: sambhavataḥ bhagavā yam tāya gāthāya yathā vuttaḥ
translated: is possible, the Blessed One said “The bond of delusion,” and so on. Because it is possible in that way, by that verse the description of the description🔽that has been stated

original: paññattippabhedo gāthānusārena saddahitabbo.
analyzed: paññatti ppabhedaḥ gāthā anusārena saddahitabbo
translated: The analysis of the term should be accepted on the authority of the verse.

original: “Mohasambandhano loko”tiādigāthāya paññattippabhedo ācariyena vibhatto, amhehi ca
analyzed: moha sambandhanaḥ loka uti ādi gāthāya paññatti pabhedaḥ ācariyena vibhattaḥ amhehi ca
translated: The analysis of the term “world” in the verse “The world is bound by the bond of lust” has been given by the teacher and is known to us.

original: ñāto, “atthi, bhikkhave, ajāta’ntiādipāṭhassa paññattippabhedo kathaṃ vibhatto”ti
analyzed: ñātaḥ atthi bhikkhave ajāta nti ādi pāṭhassa paññatti ppabhedaḥ katham vibhatto ti
translated: But how has the analysis of the term “exists” in the passage “Bhikkhus, there exists the unborn, the unbecome, the unmade, the unformed” been given?🔽If he were to ask this, the Master would reply with the passage beginning, “Bhikkhus, there exists.”

original: pucchitabbattā “atthi bhikkhave”tiādipāḷimāha. “Sā pana pāḷi kimatthaṃ bhagavatā🔽vuttā”ti ce puccheyya? Paramatthato avijjamānattā nibbānaṃ natthi, tasmā “atthi nibbāna”nti🔽vacanaṃ sasavisāṇavacanaṃ viya anatthaṃ, vohāramattametanti vadantānaṃ micchāvādaṃ
analyzed: pucchitabba ttā atthi bhikkhave iti ādi pāḷim āha sā pana pāḷi kimattham bhagavatā  vuttā iti ce puccheyya paramatthataḥ a vijjamāna ttā nibbānam na atthi tasmai atthi nibbānanti  vacanam viya anattham vohāra mattam etat ti vadantānam micchāvādam
translated: But if he were to ask, “What is the meaning of this passage spoken by the Blessed One?”

original: bhañjituṃ bhagavatā vuttāti daṭṭhabbā.
analyzed: bhañjitum bhagavatā vuttā iti daṭṭhabbā
translated: then he should be told that the Blessed One spoke it in order to refute the wrong view of those who say that Nibbāna does not exist, since it does not exist in the ultimate sense, and that the statement that Nibbāna exists is as meaningless as the statement that the hare’s horn exists, and is a mere figure of speech.

original: Kutocipi ajātattā abhūtattā ajātaṃ abhūtaṃ. Paccayehi akatattā akataṃ. Saṅkhatābhāvato
analyzed: kutocipi a jāta ttā a bhūta ttā a jātam a bhūtam paccayehi a kata ttā a katam saṅkhata abhāvato
translated: It is unborn because it is not born from any source, unbecome because it does not become by change of state, unmade because it is not made by kamma or action, unformed because it is not formed by conditions.🔽Nibbāna exists as the unconditioned.

original: asaṅkhataṃ nibbānaṃ atthi. Etaṃ ajātādikaṃ nibbānaṃ no ce abhavissa, evaṃ sati nissaraṇaṃ
analyzed: asaṅkhatam nibbānam atthi etam ajāta ādikam nibbānam no ce abhavissa evam sati nissaraṇam
translated: If this unborn, etc., Nibbāna did not exist, then there would be no escape from the born, etc., that is, from the formed, conditioned, made, and become.

original: na paññāyetha, nibbānassa ca ariyamaggaphalānaṃ ārammaṇattā, maggaphalānañca kilesānaṃ🔽samucchindanato paṭippassambhanato, samucchindanena ca tividhassa vaṭṭassa apavaṭṭanato
analyzed: na paññāyetha nibbānassa ca ariya magga phalānaṃ ārammaṇa ttā magga phalānaṃ ca kilesānaṃ  samucchindanato paṭippassambhanato samucchindanena ca tividhassa vaṭṭassa apavaṭṭanato
translated: and because Nibbāna is the object of the noble paths and fruits, and because the paths and fruits are the means of abandoning defilements,

original: ajātādikaṃ nibbānaṃ atthiyevāti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: ajāta ādikam nibbānam atthiyā iva āti daṭṭhabbam
translated: and because they are the means of completely tranquillizing them, and because the abandoning is the means of preventing the occurrence of the round of rebirths in the three planes,🔽it must be regarded as existing.

original: “Atthi, bhikkhave, ajātaṃ…pe… asaṅkhata”nti ayaṃ paññatti nibbānassa desanāpaññatti🔽ca nibbānassa vevacanapaññatti ca hoti. “Nayidha jātassa…pe… paññāyethā”ti ayaṃ paññatti
analyzed: atthi bhikkhave asaṅkhatanti ayam paññatti nibbānassa desanā paññatti  ca nibbānassa vevacana paññatti ca hoti na yidha jātassape paññāyetha ati ayam paññatti
translated: The description “Bhikkhus, there is an unborn, an unbecome, an unmade, an unformed” is a description of Nibbāna as a teaching,

original: saṅkhatassa vevacanapaññatti ca saṅkhatassa upanayanapaññatti ca hoti. “Yasmā ca…pe…
analyzed: saṅkhatassa vevacana paññatti ca saṅkhatassa upanayana paññatti ca hoti yasmai cape
translated: and it is also a description of Nibbāna as a designation and as a synonym. The description “Here, bhikkhus, for the born, become, made, formed …” is a description of the formed as a synonym and as a reference to the formed.

original: asaṅkhata”nti ayaṃ paññatti nibbānassa vevacanapaññatti ca nibbānassa jotanāpaññatti
analyzed: asaṅkhatanti ayam paññatti nibbānassa vevacana paññatti ca nibbānassa jotanā paññatti
translated: The description “Bhikkhus, there is an unborn … unmade, unformed” is a description of Nibbāna as a synonym and as a definition.

original: ca hoti. “Yasmā jātassa…pe… paññāyatī”ti ayaṃ paññatti nibbānassa vevacanapaññatti
analyzed: ca hoti yasmai jātassape paññāyati iti ayam paññatti nibbānassa vevacana paññatti
translated: The description “Here, bhikkhus, for the born, become, made, formed …” is a description of Nibbāna as a synonym and as a definition.

original: ca maggassa saṃsārato niyyānikapaññatti ca nissaraṇapaññatti ca hotīti paññattiviseso🔽paṇḍitehi niddhāretvā gahetabbo.
analyzed: ca maggassa saṃsārataḥ niyyānika paññatti ca nissaraṇa paññatti ca hoti iti paññatti viseso  paṇḍitehi niddhāretvā gahetabbaḥ
translated: and the description of the path as “leading out from the round of rebirths” and as “the escape” is the difference in description.🔽This is how the exposition should be understood as to difference in description.

original: “Yathāvutto nibbānassa paññattippabhedo kena saddahitabbo”ti vattabbattā “tenāha
analyzed: yathā vuttaḥ nibbānassa paññatti ppabhedaḥ kena saddahitabbaḥ iti vattabbattā tena āha
translated: “By whom is the exposition of Nibbāna as described to be believed in?”🔽Since this must be said, “Therefore the Blessed One said” is stated.

original: bhagavā”tiādi vuttaṃ. “Tenāha āyasmā”tiādyānusandhyādiattho ceva “niyutto paññattihāro”ti🔽anusandhyādiattho ca vuttanayānusārena veditabbo.
analyzed: bhagavā itiādi vuttam tena āha ca iva niyutto paññatti hāro ti  anusandhi ādi attho ca vutta naya anusārena veditabbo
translated: The meaning of “the Blessed One said” and so on is the same as that of “the venerable one said” and so on.🔽The meaning of “the exposition of description is applied” is the same as that of “the exposition of description is demonstrated.”🔽It should be understood in the way already stated.

original: Iti paññattihāravibhaṅge sattibalānurūpā racitā
analyzed: iti paññatti hāra vibhaṅge satti bala anurūpā racitā
translated: So the exposition of the mode of Conveying Description is composed in accordance with the force of the similes.

original: Vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The exposition is ended.

original: Paṇḍitehi pana aṭṭhakathāṭīkānusārena gambhīrattho vitthārato vibhajitvā gahetabboti.
analyzed: paṇḍitehi pana aṭṭhakathā ṭīkā anusārena gambhīra atthaḥ vitthārataḥ vibhajitvā gahetabbaḥ ti
translated: But it should be understood in detail by the wise in accordance with the commentaries and subcommentaries, which give its deep meaning.

original: 12. Otaraṇahāravibhaṅgavibhāvanā
analyzed: otaraṇa hāra vibhaṅga vibhāvanā
translated: The exposition of the mode of Conveying Entry

original: 42. Yena yena saṃvaṇṇanāvisesabhūtena paññattihāravibhaṅgena paññattiyo vibhattā,
analyzed: yena yena saṃvaṇṇanā visesa bhūtena paññatti hāra vibhaṅgena paññattiyaḥ vibhattā
translated: By means of which particular exposition of description the descriptions have been demonstrated,

original: so saṃvaṇṇanāvisesabhūto vibhaṅgo paripuṇṇo, “katamo otaraṇo hāravibhaṅgo”ti pucchitabbattā
analyzed: so saṃvaṇṇanā visesa bhūtaḥ vibhaṅgo paripuṇṇaḥ katamaḥ otaraṇaḥ hāra vibhaṅgo ti pucchitabba ttā
translated: that particular exposition is complete. Since it has to be asked “What is the mode of Conveying Entry? ”

original: “tattha katamo otaraṇo hāro”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha tatthāti tesu niddiṭṭhesu soḷasasu
analyzed: tattha katamaḥ otaraṇaḥ hāraḥ ti ādi vuttam tattha tattha ati tesu niddiṭṭhesu soḷasasu
translated: “What is the Mode of Conveying Entry?” and so on is said. Herein, in those sixteen kinds of teaching, etc., mentioned there,

original: desanāhārādīsu katamo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso otaraṇo hāro otaraṇahāravibhaṅgo nāmāti pucchati.
analyzed: desanā hāra ādīsu katamaḥ saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ otaraṇaḥ hāro otaraṇa hāra vibhaṅgaḥ nāma ati pucchati
translated: which is the different kind of commendation called “the mode of conveying entry”? He asks for an analysis of the mode of conveying entry.

original: “Yo ca paṭiccuppādo”tiādiniddesassa idāni mayā vuccamāno “uddhaṃ adho sabbadhi vippamutto”tiādiko
analyzed: yaḥ ca paṭiccuppādaḥ ti ādi niddesassa idāni mayā vuccamānaḥ uddham adhas sabbadhi vippamuttaḥ iti ādiko
translated: “And what is the dependent origination” and so on is the demonstration. The different kind of commendation that I am now giving, beginning with “Free from the near and far, all-pervading” is

original: vitthārasaṃvaṇṇanāviseso otaraṇo hāro otaraṇahāravibhaṅgo nāmāti gahetabbo.🔽Tattha pāṭhe “katame paṭiccasamuppādādayo niddhāretvā katamehi niddhāritehi dhammehi
analyzed: vitthāra saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ otaraṇaḥ hāro otaraṇa hāra vibhaṅgaḥ nāma ati gahetabbo  tattha pāṭhe katame paṭiccasamuppāda ādayaḥ niddhāretvā katamehi niddhāritehi dhammehi
translated: the mode of conveying entry called the analysis of the mode of conveying entry.

original: otaratī”ti pucchitabbattā imasmiṃ pāṭhe ime paṭiccasamuppādādayo niddhāretvā imehi
analyzed: otarati iti pucchitabba ttā imasmin pāṭhe ime paṭiccasamuppāda ādayaḥ niddhāretvā imehi
translated: Herein, since it is necessary to ask, “What are the dependent originations, etc., to be entered upon? What are the dhammas to be entered upon by means of which one enters upon them?” in order to show that it is by means of these dependent originations, etc., in this text that one enters upon these dhammas to be entered upon,

original: niddhāritehi dhammehi otaratīti dassetuṃ “uddhaṃ adho sabbadhi vippamutto”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: niddhāritehi dhammehi otarati iti dassetum uddham adhas sabbadhi vippamuttaḥ itiādi vuttaṃ
translated: “Free from the near and far, all-pervading” and so on is said.

original: Tattha uddhanti kāmadhātuto uddhaṃ uparibhāge pavattāya rūpadhātuarūpadhātuyā. Adhoti
analyzed: tattha kāmadhātutaḥ uddham upari bhāge pavattāya rūpadhātu arūpadhātuyā adhoti
translated: Herein, “upward” is in the form and formless worlds that occur above the sense sphere. “Downward” is in the sense sphere.

original: rūpadhātuto heṭṭhābhāge pavattāya kāmadhātuyā. Sabbadhīti sabbasmiṃ kāmarūpaarūpadhātumhi.🔽Vippamuttoti paṭisandhivasena appavattanato vippamutto asekkho. Ayaṃ sekkho dassanamaggena🔽sakkāyadiṭṭhiyā samugghātattā “ahaṃ asmī”ti anānupassī viharati. Evaṃ sekkhāya vimuttiyā🔽ceva asekkhāya vimuttiyā ca sekkho ceva asekkho ca atiṇṇapubbaṃ oghaṃ apunabbhavāya
analyzed: rūpadhātutaḥ heṭṭhā bhāge pavattāya kāmadhātuyā sabbadhi iti sabbasmim kāma rūpa arūpa dhātumhi  vippamuttaḥ ti paṭisandhi vasena appavattanataḥ vippamuttaḥ asekkhaḥ ayam sekkhaḥ dassana maggena  sakkāya diṭṭhiyā samugghāta ttā aham asmi iti anānupassī viharati evam sekkhāya vimuttiyā  ca iva asekkhāya vimuttiyā ca sekkhaḥ ca iva asekkhaḥ ca atiṇṇa pubbam ogham apunabbhavāya
translated: in the sense-desire element that occurs in the lower part below the fine-material-sphere element. In all ways: in all the sense-desire element, the fine-material element, and the immaterial element.🔽Liberated: liberated by non-returning, i.e. by not taking rebirth by way of rebirth-linking. This is the trainee.

original: vimutto udatārīti gāthāttho gahetabbo.🔽Tasmiṃ gāthāpāṭhe “katame niddhāretvā katamehi otaratī”ti pucchitabbattā “uddhanti
analyzed: vimuttaḥ udatāri iti gāthā atthaḥ gahetabbo  tasmin gāthā pāṭhe katame niddhāretvā katamehi otarati iti pucchitabbattā uddhanti
translated: By the path of seeing he is liberated from the view of individuality. Thus he dwells contemplating not “I am” in the sense of individuality. In this way the meaning of the verse should be understood as follows: The trainee and the adept, who have not previously crossed the flood, cross the flood by means of the trainee’s deliverance and the adept’s deliverance, respectively, and are liberated from the flood for the sake of non-rebirth.

original: rūpadhātū”tiādi vuttaṃ. Uddhanti manussalokato uddhaṃ cātumahārājikādayopi gahitāti
analyzed: rūpa dhātu utiādi vuttam uddhanti manussa lokataḥ uddham cātumahārājika ādayaḥ api gahitā ti
translated: In the recitation of this verse, the question “Having lifted out what, does one descend by means of what?” is asked. Therefore, “The fine-material element is lifted out” is stated. “Lifted out” means lifted out from the human world. The four divine abodes, etc., are also included.

original: atthasambhavato taṃ nivattetuṃ “rūpadhātu arūpadhātū”ti vuttaṃ. Adhoti manussabhavato
analyzed: attha sambhavataḥ tam nivattetum rūpa dhātu a rūpa dhātu iti vuttam adhas ti manussa bhavataḥ
translated: Since the meaning is possible, in order to exclude that, “The fine-material element, the immaterial element” is stated. Below means below the human state.

original: adho cattāro apāyabhūmiyo ca gahitāti atthasambhavato taṃ nivattetuṃ “kāmadhātū”ti🔽vuttaṃ. Sabbadhīti catubhūmiketi atthasambhavato “tedhātuke”ti vuttaṃ. Ayaṃ asekkhā🔽vimuttīti vimuttassa asekkhassa yā virāgatā atthi, ayampi virāgatā asekkhaphalavimutti.🔽“Uddhaṃ adho sabbadhi vippamutto”ti pāṭhe vuttappakārā ayaṃ asekkhā vimutti niddhāritāti🔽attho. Niddhāritāya asekkhāya vimuttiyā yāni saddhādipañcindriyāni niddhāritāni,
analyzed: adho cattāraḥ apāya bhūmiyaḥ ca gahitā ati attha sambhavataḥ tam nivattetum kāmadhātu uti  vuttam sabbadhi iti catu bhūmikā iti attha sambhavato tedhātukā iti vuttam ayam asekkhā  vimutti iti vimuttassa asekkhassa yā virāga tā atthi ayam pi virāga tā asekkha phala vimutti  uddham adhas sabbadhi vippamuttaḥ iti pāṭhe vutta ppakārā ayam asekkhā vimutti niddhāritā ati  atthaḥ niddhāritāya asekkhāya vimuttiyā yāni saddhā ādi pañca indriyāni niddhāritāni
translated: This is the interpretation of the word “in the three elements.”

original: tāniyeva asekkhāni pañcindriyāni bhavanti. Ayaṃ vuttappakārā otaraṇā indriyehi vimuttiyā🔽otaraṇā nāma pavesanā nāma.🔽Tāniyeva asekkhāni pañcindriyāni vijjāya upakārakattā, paññāpadaṭṭhānattā vā vijjā
analyzed: tāni yeva asekkhāni pañcindriyāni bhavanti ayam vutta ppakārā otaraṇā indriyehi vimuttiyā 🔽otaraṇā nāma pavesanā nāma 🔽tāni yeva asekkhāni pañca indriyāni vijjāya upakāraka ttā paññā padaṭṭhāna ttā vā vijjā

original: bhavanti. Vijjuppādā tādisāya vijjāya uppādā uppādahetuto avijjānirodho avijjāya
analyzed: bhavanti vijjuppādā tādisāya vijjāya uppādāḥ uppāda hetutaḥ avijjā nirodhaḥ avijjāya
translated: and so on. With the arising of such knowledge as this, ignorance ceases, and with the cessation of ignorance, formations cease, and so on.

original: nirodho hoti…pe… dukkhakkhandhassa nirodho hoti, ayaṃ vuttappakārā otaraṇā paṭiccasamuppādehi otaraṇā nāma.
analyzed: nirodhaḥ hoti pe dukkha kkhandhassa nirodhaḥ hoti ayam vutta ppakārā otaraṇā paṭiccasamuppādehi otaraṇā nāma
translated: This is the kind of descent that is called “descent in the dependent origination.”

original: Tāniyeva asekkhāni pañcindriyāni tīhi khandhehi saṅgahitāni saddhāvīriyehi sīlasambhavato, satiyā ca paññānuvattakattā. Sesā vuttanayānusārena veditabbā.
analyzed: tāni yeva asekkhāni pañca indriyāni tīhi khandhehi saṅgahitāni saddhā vīriyehi sīla sambhavato satiyā ca paññā anuvattaka ttā sesā vutta naya anusārena veditabbā
translated: The five faculties of the adept are included in the three aggregates, namely, in the feeling aggregate, the perception aggregate, and the formations aggregate, because virtue is a condition for faith and energy, and because mindfulness follows after understanding. The rest should be understood in the way already stated.

original: “Uddhaṃ adho sabbadhi vippamutto”ti pāṭhe niddhāretvā otaraṇā ācariyena vibhattā,🔽amhehi ca ñātā, “ayaṃ ahasmīti anānupassī”ti pāṭhe “katame niddhāretvā katamehi otaraṇehi
analyzed: uddham adhas sabbadhi vippamuttaḥ iti pāṭhe niddhāretvā otaraṇā ācariyena vibhattā  amhehi ca ñātā ayam aham asmi iti anānupassī iti pāṭhe katame niddhāretvā katamehi otaraṇehi
translated: The descent in the passage “Freed from below, freed from above, freed without exception” has been explained by the teacher,🔽and it has been understood by us. But in the passage “Not perceiving ‘I am’ ” it should be asked: “What is it that is to be descended to? What are the descents?

original: otaratī”ti vattabbattā “ayaṃ ahasmīti anānupassīti ayaṃ sakkāyadiṭṭhiyā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: otarati iti vattabbattā ayam aham asmi iti anānupassī iti ayam sakkāyadiṭṭhiyā tiādi vuttaṃ
translated: ” and so it is said: “Not perceiving ‘I am’ is identity view” and so on.

original: Yo ayaṃ sekkho “ahamasmī”ti nānupassī, tassa sekkhassa sakkāyadiṭṭhiyā yo samugghāto
analyzed: yaḥ ayam sekkhaḥ aham asmi iti na anupassī tassa sekkhassa sakkāyadiṭṭhiyā yaḥ samugghāto
translated: The adept who does not perceive “I am” has eradicated identity view,

original: atthi, yā samugghātasaṅkhātā samugghātavimutti sekkhā vimutti hoti, tassā sekkhāya🔽vimuttiyā yāni saddhādipañcindriyāni niddhāritāni, tāniyeva sekkhāni pañcindriyāni
analyzed: atthi yā samugghāta saṅkhātā samugghāta vimutti sekkhā vimutti hoti tassā sekkhāya  vimuttiyāḥ yāni saddhā ādi pañca indriyāni niddhāritāni tāniyeva sekkhāni pañca indriyāni
translated: There is the kind of emancipation called “emancipation by suppression” which is the emancipation of the trainers. The five faculties beginning with faith which are stated in the case of that emancipation of the trainers

original: bhavanti. Ayaṃ vuttappakārā otaraṇā indriyehi otaraṇā nāma. Sesā vuttanayānusārena veditabbā.🔽43. “Uddhaṃ adho”tiādigāthāyaṃ otaraṇā ācariyena vibhattā, amhehi ca ñātā, “nissitassa🔽calita”ntiādipāṭhe “katame niddhāretvā katamehi otaratī”ti pucchitabbattā “nissitassa🔽calitaṃ, anissitassa calitaṃ natthī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Nissitassa puggalassa calitaṃ calanaṃ
analyzed: bhavanti ayam vutta ppakārā otaraṇā indriyehi otaraṇā nāma sesā vutta naya anusārena veditabbā  uddham adhas ti ādi gāthāyam otaraṇā ācariyena vibhattā amhehi ca ñātā nissitassa  calita nti ādi pāṭhe katame niddhāretvā katamehi otarati iti pucchitabba ttā nissitassa  calitam anissitassa calitam natthi itiādi vuttam nissitassa puggalassa calitam calanam
translated: are the five faculties of the trainers. This is the kind of entry called entry by way of the faculties. The rest should be understood according to the method stated.🔽The entry in the stanza beginning “Above, below” has been explained by the teacher and is known by us. In the passage beginning “Of one who is attached, there is wavering,” since it should be asked “Which does he suppress and by which does he enter?” it is said: “Of one who is attached, there is wavering; of one who is unattached, there is no wavering.”

original: atthi, anissitassa puggalassa calitaṃ calanaṃ natthi. Calite calane asati passaddhi
analyzed: atthi anissitassa puggalassa calitam calanam natthi calite calane asati passaddhi
translated: For one who is attached, there is wavering, vacillation; for one who is unattached, there is no wavering, no vacillation. When there is no wavering, vacillation, there is tranquillity.

original: bhavati, passaddhiyā sati vijjamānāya nati na hoti, natiyā asati avijjamānāya āgatigati
analyzed: bhavati passaddhiyā sati vijjamānāya nati na hoti natiyā asati a vijjamānāya āgati gati
translated: When tranquillity exists, there is no bending. When there is no bending, no existing, there is no coming and going.

original: na hoti, āgatigatiyā asati avijjamānāya cutūpapāto na hoti, cutūpapāte asati avijjamāne🔽idha chasu ajjhattikāyatanesu attānaṃ neva passati, huraṃ vā chasu bāhirāyatanesu
analyzed: na hoti āgati gatiyā asati a vijjamānāya cutūpapātaḥ na hoti cutūpapāte asati a vijjamāne  idha chasu ajjhattika āyatanesu attānam na iva passati huram vā chasu bāhira āyatanesu
translated: When there is no coming and going, no decease and reappearance,🔽then here in the six internal bases he does not see self, nor in the six external bases,

original: attānaṃ na passati, ubhayaṃ antarena vajjetvā phassādisamudāyesu dhammesu attānaṃ
analyzed: attānam na passati ubhayam antarena vajjetvā phassa ādi samudāyesu dhammesu attānam
translated: nor in the combination of the two, nor apart from the combination.

original: na passati, esova paṭiccasamuppādo “avijjānirodhā”tiādiko dukkhassa anto avasānaṃ karotīti attho.
analyzed: na passati esaḥ uva paṭiccasamuppādaḥ avijjā nirodhā ti ādiko dukkhassa antaḥ avasānam karoti iti attho
translated: This dependent origination itself is the end of suffering.

original: Nissitassa calitanti ettha “nissayo katividho”ti pucchitabbattā “nissitassa calitanti
analyzed: nissitassa calitanti ettha nissayo katividhaḥ ti pucchitabbattā nissitassa calitanti
translated: “For one who is dependent, there is wavering”: since it is necessary to ask, “How many kinds of dependence are there?”🔽the answer is given: “Dependence is of two kinds.”

original: nissayo nāmā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tatthāti tesu duvidhesu taṇhānissayadiṭṭhinissayesu yā
analyzed: nissayaḥ nāma atiādi vuttam tattha ati tesu duvidhesu taṇhā nissaya diṭṭhi nissayesu yā
translated: Among these two kinds, dependence through craving and dependence through views,

original: cetanā rattassa puggalassa niddhāritā, ayaṃ cetanādhammo taṇhānissayo nāma. Yā cetanā
analyzed: cetanā rattassa puggalassa niddhāritā ayam cetanā dhammaḥ taṇhā nissayaḥ nāma yā cetanā
translated: the volition that is ascribed to a person who is lustful is a state of volition called dependence through craving. The volition

original: mūḷhassa puggalassa niddhāritā. Ayaṃ cetanādhammo diṭṭhinissayo nāma. Sā duvidhā
analyzed: mūḷhassa puggalassa niddhāritā ayam cetanā dhammo diṭṭhi nissayaḥ nāma sā duvidhā
translated: that is ascribed to a person who is deluded is a state of volition called dependence through views. This is twofold:

original: cetanā pana saṅkhārā nāma. Saṅkhārapaccayā viññāṇaṃ…pe… sabbo paṭiccasamuppādo niddhārito.
analyzed: cetanā pana saṅkhārāḥ nāma saṅkhāra paccayā viññāṇam pe sabbo paṭiccasamuppādo niddhārito
translated: But volition is called formations. With formations as condition, consciousness … down to … this whole mass of suffering.

original: Ayaṃ vuttappakārā otaraṇā paṭiccasamuppādehi otaraṇā nāma.
analyzed: ayam vutta ppakārā otaraṇā paṭiccasamuppādehi otaraṇā nāma
translated: This is called descent into the dependent origination in the way already stated.

original: Tatthāti tasmiṃ taṇhānissayadiṭṭhinissaye yā vedanā rattassa puggalassa niddhāritā,
analyzed: tattha ati tasmin taṇhā nissaya diṭṭhi nissaye yā vedanā rattassa puggalassa niddhāritā
translated: “Therein”: in the craving and in the view, the feeling that is stated in the case of the person who is “addicted”

original: ayaṃ sukhā vedanā. Yā cetanā sammūḷhassa puggalassa niddhāritā, ayaṃ adukkhamasukhā🔽vedanā. Yebhuyyena sesā vuttanayānusārena veditabbā.
analyzed: ayam sukhā vedanā yā cetanā sammūḷhassa puggalassa niddhāritā ayam adukkhamasukhā  vedanā yebhuyyena sesā vutta naya anusārena veditabbā
translated: is pleasant feeling. The volition that is stated in the case of the person who is “deluded” is neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling.🔽The rest can be understood by the method stated.

original: 44. “Nissitassa calita”ntiādipāṭhe otaraṇā ācariyena vibhattā, amhehi ca ñātā.
analyzed: nissitassa calita nti ādi pāṭhe otaraṇā ācariyena vibhattā amhehi ca ñātā
translated: The descent in the passage beginning, “When he is dependent, he wavers” has been analysed by the teacher and is known by us.

original: “Ye keci sokā paridevitā vā…pe…
analyzed: ye keci sokā paridevitā vāpe
translated: “Whatever grief and sorrow there is,

original: Piyaṃ na kayirātha kuhiñci loke”ti. –
analyzed: piyam na kayirātha kuhiñci lokā iti
translated: Let him not make it in the world anywhere” .🔽In the passage beginning, “Whatever grief and sorrow there is” ,

original: Gāthāpāṭhe “katame niddhāretvā katamehi otaratī”ti pucchitabbattā “ye keci sokā”tiādi
analyzed: gāthā pāṭhe katame niddhāretvā katamehi otarati iti ye keci soka ati ādi
translated: the question “Having descended on what, by what does he descend?” has to be asked.

original: vuttaṃ. Ye keci sokā vā yā kāci paridevitā vā anekarūpā yā kāci dukkhā vā lokasmiṃ
analyzed: vuttam ye keci sokā vā yā kāci paridevitā vā aneka rūpā yā kāci dukkhā vā lokasmiṃ
translated: Whatever grief there is, whatever sorrow, whatever suffering, whatever grief and sorrow and suffering there is in the world,

original: sambhavanti. Ete sokādayo piyaṃ paṭicca pabhavanti, piye asante ete sokādayo na bhavanti.
analyzed: sambhavanti ete soka ādayaḥ piyam paṭicca pabhavanti piye asante ete soka ādayaḥ na bhavanti
translated: and so on. These sorrows and so on occur with the loved one as condition. When the loved one is absent, these sorrows and so on do not occur.

original: Tasmā piye asante sokādīnaṃ abhāvato yesaṃ vītasokānaṃ kuhiñci lokepi natthi, te
analyzed: tasmā piye asante soka ādīnam abhāvataḥ yesam vīta sokānam kuhiñci loke pi natthi te
translated: Therefore, since there is no sorrow and so on when the loved one is absent,🔽those who are free from sorrow are happy in any world.

original: vītasokā sukhino bhavanti. Tasmā vītasokānaṃ sukhasampannattā asokaṃ virajaṃ patthayāno
analyzed: sukhinaḥ bhavanti tasmai vīta sokānam sukha sampanna ttā asokam virajam patthayānaḥ
translated: Therefore, since those who are free from sorrow are endowed with happiness, the one who seeks the sorrowless, dustless state

original: sappuriso kuhiñci loke piyaṃ na kayirāthāti gāthāttho.
analyzed: sappuriso kuhiñci loke piyam na gāthā attho
translated: should not make a loved one anywhere in the world. This is the meaning of the verse.

original: “Ye keci sokā paridevitā vā, dukkhā ca lokasmimanekarūpā piyaṃ paṭicca pabhavanti ete”ti ettha pāṭhe yā vedanā niddhāritā, ayaṃ dukkhā vedanā. Sesā vuttanayānusārena veditabbā.🔽“Ye keci sokā”tiādigāthāpāṭhe otaraṇā ācariyena vibhattā, amhehi ca ñātā, “kāmaṃ
analyzed: ye keci paridevitā vā dukkhā ca lokasmim aneka rūpā piyam paṭicca pabhavanti ete iti ettha pāṭhe yā vedanā niddhāritā ayam dukkhā vedanā sesā vutta naya anusārena veditabbā  ye keci sokāti ādi gāthā pāṭhe ācariyena vibhattā amhehi ca kāmam
translated: In the reading “Whatever sorrows and lamentations, and whatever sufferings in the world have many forms, all these occur with the loved one as condition,” the feeling that is discerned is painful feeling. The rest should be understood in the way already stated.🔽The teacher has analyzed and we have understood the entry in the reading of the verse beginning, “Whatever sorrows and lamentations.”

original: kāmayamānassā”tiādigāthāpāṭhe “katame niddhāretvā katamehi otaratī”ti vattabbattā
analyzed: kāmayamānassa ati ādi gāthā pāṭhe katame niddhāretvā katamehi otarati iti vattabbattā
translated: Now, in the reading of the verse beginning, “When one who desires desires,” it should be asked: “Having discerned which, by which does one enter?”

original: “kāmaṃ kāmayamānassā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tassaṃ gāthāyaṃ attho heṭṭhā vuttova.🔽Tatthāti tasmiṃ “pītimano hotī”ti pāṭhe yā pītimanatā vuttā niddhāritā, ayaṃ pītimanatā
analyzed: kāmam kāmayamānassa atiādi vuttam tassam gāthāyam attho heṭṭhā vuttaḥ eva  tattha ati tasmin pītimanaḥ hoti iti pāṭhe yā pītimana tā vuttā niddhāritā ayam pītimana tā
translated: “One who desires what is desirable” , etc., is said. The meaning of this verse is stated below.🔽“There” : in the reading “he is full of joy” , the joyfulness stated is the joyfulness

original: anunayo hoti. “Sallaviddhova ruppatī”ti pāṭhe yaṃ ruppanaṃ āha, idaṃ ruppanaṃ paṭighaṃ
analyzed: anunayaḥ hoti salla viddhaḥ uva ruppati iti pāṭhe yam ruppanam āha idam ruppanam paṭigham
translated: which is affection. In the reading “he suffers as one pierced with a dart” , the suffering stated is the suffering which is resentment.

original: hoti, anunayo ca paṭighañca niddhāritāti attho.🔽“Anunaye ca paṭighe ca niddhārite katamo dhammo niddhārito”ti vattabbattā “anunayo🔽paṭighañca pana taṇhāpakkho”ti vuttaṃ. Taṇhāpakkhoti taṇhāpakkhattā taṇhā niddhāritā.🔽“Anunayo taṇhāpakkho hotu, paṭighaṃ pana taṇhāpakkhaṃ na siyā”ti ce vadeyya? Paṭighassa
analyzed: hoti anunayaḥ ca paṭighañca niddhāritā ati attho  anunaye ca paṭighe ca niddhārite katamaḥ dhammaḥ niddhārito ti vattabbattā anunayaḥ  paṭigham ca pana taṇhā pakkhaḥ ti vuttam taṇhā pakkhaḥ ti taṇhā pakkha ttā taṇhā niddhāritā  anunayaḥ taṇhā pakkhaḥ hotu paṭigham pana taṇhā pakkham na siyā ti ce vadeyya paṭighassa
translated: The meaning is that affection and resentment are stated.🔽“When affection and resentment are stated, what is the state stated?” In order to answer this question, “Affection and resentment are on the side of craving” is said. “On the side of craving” : because of being on the side of craving, craving is stated.

original: attasinehavasena pavattanato paṭighampi taṇhāpakkhaṃ hoti. “Taṇhāya niddhāritāya
analyzed: atta sineha vasena pavattanataḥ paṭigham pi taṇhā pakkham hoti taṇhāya niddhāritāya
translated: “Let affection be on the side of craving, but let resentment not be on the side of craving” , one might say. Because of occurring by way of attachment to self, resentment also is on the side of craving. “When craving is stated,

original: katamo niddhārito”ti vattabbattā “taṇhāya ca panā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Dasannaṃ rūpāyatanānaṃ
analyzed: katamaḥ niddhārito ti vattabbattā taṇhāya ca pana atiādi vuttam dasannam rūpa āyatanānam

analyzed: taṇhāya padaṭṭhāna ttā dasa rūpāni āyatanāni niddhāritāni ayam vutta ppakārā otaraṇā  āyatanehi otaraṇā nāma sutte āgatā paṭiccasamuppāda ādayaḥ tena saṃvaṇṇanā visesena
translated: The ten bases consisting of the ten kinds of form are interpreted by the method of interpretation of the bases. This is the method of interpretation🔽called interpretation by the bases. translated: So the analysis of the Mode of Conveying a Reiteration has been composed in accordance with the needle and thread.

analyzed: vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The analysis is ended.

analyzed: āyasmai ajitaḥ iti ādikaḥ vitthāra saṃvaṇṇanā viseso sodhanahāravibhaṅgaḥ nāma ati gahetabbo

original: “Kathaṃ tattha pañhe sodhano hāro viññātabbo”ti vattabbattā “yathā āyasmā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: katham tattha pañhe sodhanaḥ hāro viññātabbo ti vattabbattā yathā āyasma itiādi vuttam
translated: “How is the Mode of Conveying a Clearing Up of Questions to be known here?” — in order to answer that, “As to the venerable one” is said.

original: Yathā yena pakārena āyasmā ajito pārāyane bhagavantaṃ pañhaṃ pucchati, tathā tena🔽pakārena vissajjitamhi pañhe ayaṃ sodhano hāro viññātabboti. “Niyametvā vibhajehī”ti
analyzed: yathā yena pakārena bhagavantam pañham pucchati tathā tena  pakārena vissajjitamhi pañhe ayam sodhanaḥ hāro viññātabbo ti niyametvā vibhajehi iti
translated: As to the venerable Ajita’s asking the Blessed One a question in the Parayana in such a way,🔽in such a way is the Mode of Conveying a Clearing Up of Questions to be known in the answer to the question.

original: vattabbattā niyametvā vibhajituṃ “kenassū”tiādi vuttaṃ. Gāthāttho vuttova.
analyzed: vattabba ttā niyametvā vibhajitum kenassu itiādi vuttam gāthā atthaḥ vuttaḥ uva
translated: “Having defined, analyse” is said. In order to answer that, “By what is the world covered over?” is said. The meaning of the verse is stated.🔽“By what is the world covered over?

original: “Kenassu nivuto loko, kenassu nappakāsati;
analyzed: kenassu nivutaḥ lokaḥ kenassu na ppakāsati
translated: By what is it not lit up?🔽What do you say is its smear?

original: Kissābhilepanaṃ brūsi, kiṃsu tassa mahabbhaya”nti. –
analyzed: kissa abhilepanam brūsi kiṃsu tassa mahabbhayanti
translated: What is its great fear?”

original: Pucchāvasena pavattagāthāyañca –
analyzed: pucchā vasena
translated: And in the verse that occurs in the way of the question:

original: “Avijjāya nivuto loko, (ajitāti bhagavā,)
analyzed: avijjāya nivutaḥ lokaḥ bhagavā
translated: “The world is covered over by ignorance, (Ajita, said the Blessed One,)

original: Vivicchā pamādā nappakāsati;
analyzed: vivicchā pamādā na ppakāsati
translated: It is not lit up by seclusion and heedlessness.

original: Jappābhilepanaṃ brūmi, dukkhamassa mahabbhaya”nti. –
analyzed: jappa abhilepanam brūmi dukkham assa mahat bhayanti
translated: I say that talk is its smear, suffering is its great fear”

original: Vissajjanavasena pavattagāthāyañcāti imāsu dvīsu gāthāsu “kenassu nivuto loko”ti
analyzed: vissajjana vasena pavatta gāthāyan ca ati imāsu dvīsu gāthāsu
translated: And in the verse that occurs in the way of the answer: in these two verses “By what is the world covered over?”

original: iminā padena pañhe pucchite “avijjāya nivuto loko”ti iminā padena bhagavā “kenassu
analyzed: iminā padena pañhe pucchite avijjāya nivutaḥ iminā padena bhagavā
translated: When the question was asked with this word, the Fortunate One with this word “The world is enveloped in ignorance” (said): “By what

original: nivuto loko”ti padaṃ tadatthe aññāṇasaṃsayādimalānaṃ apanayanena sodheti. Tadatthe🔽hi vissajjite aññāṇasaṃsayādīnaṃ abhāvato attho sodhito nāma, atthe ca sodhite padampi
analyzed: nivutaḥ loko ti padam tad atthe aññāṇa saṃsaya ādi malānam apanayanena sodha iti tad atthe  hi vissajjite aññāṇa saṃsaya ādīnam abhāvataḥ atthaḥ sodhitaḥ nāma atthe ca sodhite padam pi
translated: When the question is asked with this line, the Blessed One purifies the line “The world is enveloped in darkness” by removing the stains of ignorance, doubt, etc., about the meaning of the line “By what is the world enveloped?”

original: sodhitaṃyeva. Tenāha aṭṭhakathāyaṃ – “tadatthassa vissajjanato”ti, ṭīkāyañca “tabbisayaaññāṇasaṃsayādimalāpanayanena🔽sodhetī”ti vuttaṃ. No ca ārambhanti pucchituṃ ārabhitabbaṃ sabbagāthāpadaṃ, gāthātthaṃ
analyzed: sodhitam yeva tena āha aṭṭhakathā ayam tad atthassa vissajjanato ti ṭīkāyam ca tad visaya aññāṇa saṃsaya ādi mala apanayanena  sodheti iti vuttam no ca pucchitum ārabhitabbam sabba gāthā padam gāthā attham
translated: For when the meaning is stated, the meaning is said to be purified because of the absence of ignorance, doubt, etc., about the meaning. And when the meaning is purified, the line is purified too. Hence it is said in the commentary: “because the meaning is stated” . And in the subcommentary: “he purifies by removing the stains of ignorance, doubt, etc., about the meaning” .

original: vā, ñātuṃ icchitassa sabbassa atthassa vissajjanavasena apariyositattā bhagavā “avijjāya
analyzed: vā ñātum icchitassa sabbassa atthassa vissajjana vasena a pariyosita ttā bhagavā avijjāya
translated: But he does not purify the whole line of the verse, or the meaning of the verse, by simply saying “The world is enveloped in darkness” because he has not yet completed the answering of the question by stating the meaning of the whole verse, which he wishes to make known.

original: nivuto loko”ti ettakeneva padena sodheti. Sesesupi esa nayo.
analyzed: nivutaḥ loko ti ettakena iva padena sodheti sesesu pi esa nayo
translated: The same method applies in the rest of the stanzas.

original: “Kiṃsu tassa mahabbhaya”nti iminā padena pañhe pucchite “dukkhamassa mahabbhaya”nti padena bhagavatā ārambho ñātuṃ icchito attho suddho sodhito hoti. Sesagāthāsupi eseva nayo.🔽Yattha pañhe evaṃ niravasesavissajjanavasena ārambho suddho sodhito bhavati, so pañho🔽vissajjito sodhito bhavati. Yattha pañhe evaṃ niravasesavissajjanavasena ārambho
analyzed: kim su tassa mahabbhayanti iminā padena pañhe pucchite dukkham assa mahabbhayanti padena bhagavatā ārambhaḥ ñātum icchitaḥ atthaḥ suddhaḥ sodhitaḥ hoti sesa gāthāsu pi esa eva nayo  yattha pañhe evam niravasesa vissajjana vasena ārambhaḥ suddhaḥ sodhitaḥ bhavati saḥ pañho  vissajjitaḥ sodhitaḥ bhavati yattha pañhe evam niravasesa vissajjana vasena ārambhaḥ
translated: “What is his great fear?” By this question the meaning intended to be known by the Blessed One, namely, “His suffering is his great fear,” is purified and cleansed by the word. The same method applies to the rest of the stanzas.🔽A question is answered and cleansed when the meaning intended to be known by the Blessed One is purified and cleansed by the answer given without remainder.

original: yāva asuddho asodhito bhavati, tāva so pañho vissajjito sodhito na bhavatīti yojanā.🔽“Tenāhā”tiādyānusandhyādyattho ceva “niyutto sodhano hāro”ti anusandhyādyattho ca🔽vuttanayānusārena veditabbo.
analyzed: yāva asuddhaḥ a sodhitaḥ bhavati tāva saḥ pañhaḥ vissajjitaḥ sodhitaḥ na bhavati iti yojanā  tena āha ati ādya anusandhyā ādi attho ca iva niyuttaḥ sodhanaḥ ca  vutta naya anusārena veditabbo
translated: A question is not answered and cleansed until the meaning intended to be known by the Blessed One is purified and cleansed by the answer given without remainder.🔽The meaning of the phrase “Therefore he said” and so on is to be understood according to the method stated.

original: Iti sodhanahāravibhaṅge sattibalānurūpā racitā
analyzed: iti sodhana hāra vibhaṅge satti bala anurūpā racitā
translated: The explanation of the Mode of Conveying Cleansing is composed in accordance with the measure of the razor.

original: Vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The exposition is finished.

original: Paṇḍitehi pana aṭṭhakathāṭīkānusārena gambhīrattho vitthārato vibhajitvā gahetabboti.
analyzed: paṇḍitehi pana aṭṭhakathā ṭīkā anusārena gambhīra atthaḥ vitthārataḥ vibhajitvā gahetabbaḥ ti
translated: But the profound meaning should be taken in detail by the wise in accordance with the commentaries and subcommentaries.

original: 14. Adhiṭṭhānahāravibhaṅgavibhāvanā🔽46. Yena yena saṃvaṇṇanāvisesabhūtena vibhaṅgena pañhādayo sodhitā, so saṃvaṇṇanāvisesabhūto🔽paripuṇṇo, “katamo adhiṭṭhānahāravibhaṅgo”ti pucchitabbattā “tattha katamo adhiṭṭhāno🔽hāro”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha tatthāti tesu niddiṭṭhesu soḷasasu desanāhārādīsu katamo
analyzed: adhiṭṭhāna hāra vibhaṅga vibhāvanā  yena yena saṃvaṇṇanā visesa bhūtena vibhaṅgena pañha ādayo sodhitā so saṃvaṇṇanā visesa bhūto  paripuṇṇo katamaḥ adhiṭṭhāna hāra vibhaṅgo ti pucchitabba ttā tattha katamaḥ adhiṭṭhāno  hāra utiādi vuttam tattha tattha ati tesu niddiṭṭhesu soḷasasu desanā āhāra ādīsu katamaḥ
translated: 14. The exposition of the mode of Conveying a Definition

original: saṃvaṇṇanāviseso paṭiniddesato adhiṭṭhāno hāro adhiṭṭhānahāravibhaṅgo nāmāti pucchati.🔽“Ekattatāya dhammā, yepi ca vemattatāya niddiṭṭhā”tiādiniddesassa idāni mayā vuccamāno
analyzed: saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ paṭiniddesataḥ adhiṭṭhānaḥ hāraḥ adhiṭṭhāna hāra vibhaṅgaḥ nāma ati pucchati  ekatta tāya dhammāḥ ye pi ca vematta tāya niddiṭṭhā ati ādi niddesassa idāni mayā vuccamāno
translated: By means of which particular kind of exposition the questions and so on are cleared up, that particular kind of exposition is complete. “ What is the Mode of Conveying a Definition? “ is asked, and so “ Herein, what is the Mode of Conveying a Definition? “ is said. Herein, “ there “ refers to those sixteen kinds of Conveyings of Ideas, etc., demonstrated above. “ What is the particular kind of exposition? “ he asks. “ The Mode of Conveying a Definition is called the Exposition of the Mode of Conveying a Definition “.

original: “ye tattha niddiṭṭhā, tathā te dhārayitabbā”tiādiko vitthārasaṃvaṇṇanāviseso adhiṭṭhānahāravibhaṅgo nāmāti gahetabbo.
analyzed: ye tattha niddiṭṭhā tathā te dhārayitabbā ati ādikaḥ vitthāra saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ adhiṭṭhāna hāra vibhaṅgaḥ nāma ati gahetabbaḥ
translated: “ The ideas that are demonstrated in the Thread as unity and as diversity “ , etc., is the demonstration. Now the particular kind of exposition that I am about to give, namely “ Those that are demonstrated there should be borne in mind in this way “ , etc., is the Mode of Conveying a Definition called the Exposition of the Mode of Conveying a Definition.

original: “Ye dhammā suttesu ekattatāya ca vemattatāya ca niddiṭṭhā, te dhammā kiṃ pana tatheva
analyzed: ye dhammā suttesu ekatta tāya ca vematta tāya ca niddiṭṭhā te dhammā kim pana tathā iva
translated: “ The ideas that are demonstrated in the Threads as unity and as diversity, are they to be borne in mind just as they are demonstrated there?

original: dhārayitabbā, udāhu aññathāpi vikappayitabbā”ti pucchitabbattā “ye tatthā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: dhārayitabbāḥ udāhu aññathā api vikappayitabbā ti pucchitabba ttā ye tattha atiādi vuttam
translated: The passage beginning with the words “Those things” is stated in order to answer this question.

original: Tattha tesu suttantesu ye dukkhasaccādayo dhammā ekattatāya ca vemattatāya ca niddiṭṭhā,
analyzed: tattha tesu suttantesu ye dukkha sacca ādayaḥ dhammāḥ ekatta tāya ca vematta tāya ca niddiṭṭhā
translated: Herein, those things such as the truth of suffering, etc., which are demonstrated as being both the same and different in those texts,

original: te dukkhasaccādayo dhammā tathā ekattatāya ca vemattatāya ca dhārayitabbā upalakkhitabbā,
analyzed: te dukkha sacca ādayaḥ dhammā tathā ekatta tāya ca vematta tāya ca dhārayitabbā upalakkhitabbā
translated: those things such as the truth of suffering, etc., are to be borne in mind as they are stated, as being both the same and different,

original: na aññathā vikappayitabbā.
analyzed: na aññathā vikappayitabbā
translated: and not otherwise, after being analysed.

original: “Sāmaññakappanāya vohārabhāvena anavaṭṭhānato katamā ekattatā, katamā vemattatā”ti
analyzed: sāmañña kappanāya vohāra bhāvena anavaṭṭhānato katamā ekatta tā katamā vematta tā ati
translated: “In what way are they the same? In what way are they different?”🔽The passage beginning with the words “As suffering” is stated in order to answer this question.

original: pucchitabbattā “dukkhanti ekattatā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Dukkhanti jātiādivisesamanapekkhitvā
analyzed: pucchitabba ttā dukkhanti ekatta tā ātiādi vuttam dukkhanti jāti ādi visesam an apekkhitvā
translated: As suffering, without making any distinction of the various kinds of suffering such as that due to birth, etc.,

original: yā dukkhasāmaññatā vuttā, sā ayaṃ dukkhasāmaññatā dukkhassa ekattatā nāma. “Tattha
analyzed: yā dukkha sāmañña tā vuttā sā ayam dukkha sāmañña tā dukkhassa ekatta tā nāma tattha
translated: the general characteristic of suffering is stated. This general characteristic of suffering is called the sameness of suffering.

original: katamaṃ dukkha”nti pucchitā “jāti dukkhā, jarā dukkhā…pe... viññāṇaṃ dukkha”nti jātiādivisesamapekkhitvā
analyzed: katamam dukkhanti pucchitā jāti dukkhā jarā viññāṇam dukkhanti jāti ādi visesam apekkhitvā
translated: “What, then, is suffering?” When this is asked, the various kinds of suffering such as that due to birth, etc., are distinguished and it is said: “Birth is suffering, ageing is suffering … consciousness is suffering.”

original: yā dukkhavisesatā vuttā, sā ayaṃ dukkhavisesatā dukkhassa vemattatā nāma. Tatthāti
analyzed: yā dukkha visesa tā vuttā sā ayam dukkha visesa tā dukkhassa vematta tā nāma tattha ati
translated: The specific-dukkha-ness stated is the diversity of dukkha.🔽Therein:

original: ye dukkhādayo dhammā sutte vuttā, tattha tesu dukkhādīsu atthesu.
analyzed: ye dukkha ādayaḥ dhammā sutte vuttā tattha tesu dukkha ādīsu atthesu
translated: in the case of the ideas of dukkha, etc., stated in the sutta, in the case of the meanings of dukkha, etc.

original: Dukkhasamudayoti “taṇhā ponobhavikā”ti visesamanapekkhitvā yā samudayasāmaññatā vuttā,
analyzed: dukkha samudayaḥ ti taṇhā ponobhavikā ati visesam an apekkhitvā yā samudaya sāmañña tā vuttā
translated: Origination is stated in the general way without any distinction being made as to “ craving that is subject to cankers and is liable to augmentation “ ,

original: sā ayaṃ samudayasāmaññatā samudayassa ekattatā nāma. “Tattha katamo samudayo”ti pucchitvā
analyzed: sā ayam samudaya sāmañña tā samudayassa ekatta tā nāma tattha katamo samudayaḥ ti pucchitvā
translated: and this general origination-ness is the singleness of origination. “ What is origination? “

original: “yāyaṃ taṇhā…pe… vibhavataṇhā”ti visesaṃ apekkhitvā yā samudayavisesatā vuttā, sā
analyzed: yā ayam vibhava taṇhā ti visesam apekkhitvā yā samudaya visesa tā vuttā sā
translated: is asked, and then the specific-origination-ness stated with reference to the distinction as to “ craving for sense desires, craving for becoming, craving for non-becoming “ ,

original: ayaṃ samudayavisesatā samudayassa vemattatā nāma.🔽Dukkhanirodhoti “tassāyeva taṇhāya asesavirāganirodho”ti visesamanapekkhitvā yā nirodhasāmaññatā
analyzed: ayam samudaya visesa tā samudayassa vematta tā nāma  dukkha nirodho ti tassāya eva taṇhāya asesa virāga nirodho ti visesam an apekkhitvā yā nirodha sāmañña tā
translated: is the diversity of origination.🔽Cessation is stated in the general way without any distinction being made as to “ the complete fading and cessation without remainder of that same craving “ ,

original: vuttā, sā ayaṃ nirodhasāmaññatā nirodhassa ekattatā nāma. “Tattha katamo dukkhanirodho”ti
analyzed: vuttā sā ayam nirodha sāmañña tā nirodhassa ekatta tā nāma tattha katamaḥ dukkha nirodho ti
translated: and this general cessation-ness is the singleness of cessation. “ What is the cessation of dukkha? “

original: pucchitvā “yo tassāyeva taṇhāya asesavirāganirodho cāgo paṭinissaggo mutti anālayo”ti
analyzed: pucchitvā yaḥ tassāya eva taṇhāya asesa virāga nirodho cāgo paṭinissaggo mutti anālayo ti
translated: and then, after asking, “What is the complete fading away and cessation of that craving, its forsaking and abandoning, liberation from it, detachment from it?”

original: visesamapekkhitvā yā nirodhavisesatā vuttā, sā ayaṃ nirodhavisesatā nirodhassa vemattatā nāma.
analyzed: visesam apekkhitvā yā nirodha visesa tā vuttā sā ayam nirodha visesa tā nirodhassa vematta tā nāma
translated: he said, “The cessation of that craving is the cessation of suffering,” and so on. The difference in cessation that he stated by looking for a difference is called the diversity of cessation.

original: Dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadāti? Paṭipadāti sammādiṭṭhiādivisesamanapekkhitvā yā nirodhagāminipaṭipadāsāmaññatā
analyzed: dukkha nirodha gāminī paṭipadā āti paṭipadā ati sammādiṭṭhi ādi visesam an apekkhitvā yā nirodha gāmini paṭipadā sāmañña tā
translated: “The way leading to the cessation of suffering”: after not looking for a difference in the way leading to cessation, he said, “The way leading to the cessation of suffering is simply this Noble Eightfold Path, that is, right view … right concentration.”

original: vuttā, sā ayaṃ nirodhagāminipaṭipadāsāmaññatā maggassa ekattatā nāma. “Tattha katamā
analyzed: vuttā sā ayam nirodha gāmini paṭipadā sāmañña tā maggassa ekatta tā nāma tattha katamā
translated: The similarity of the way leading to cessation that he stated is called the singleness of the path.

original: dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā”ti pucchitvā “ayameva ariyo…pe… sammāsamādhī”ti sammādiṭṭhiādivisesamapekkhitvā
analyzed: dukkha nirodha gāminī paṭipadā ati pucchitvā ayam eva ariya upe sammāsamādhī iti sammādiṭṭhi ādi visesam apekkhitvā
translated: “What is the way leading to the cessation of suffering?” and then, after looking for a difference in the way leading to the cessation of suffering, he said, “The way leading to the cessation of suffering is simply this Noble Eightfold Path, that is, right view … right concentration.”

original: yā visesadukkhanirodhagāminipaṭipadatā vuttā, sā ayaṃ visesadukkhanirodhagāminipaṭipadatā🔽maggassa vemattatā nāma.
analyzed: yā visesa dukkha nirodha gāmini paṭipada tā vuttā sā ayam visesa dukkha nirodha gāmini paṭipada tā  maggassa vemattatā nāma
translated: The difference in the way leading to the cessation of suffering that he stated is called the diversity of the path.🔽“The path”: after not looking for a difference in the path leading to hell, etc., he said, “The path is simply this Noble Eightfold Path, that is, right view … right concentration.”

original: Maggoti nirayagāmimaggādivisesamanapekkhitvā yā sāmaññamaggatā vuttā, sā ayaṃ sāmaññamaggatā
analyzed: maggo ti niraya gāmi magga ādi visesam an apekkhitvā yā sāmañña magga tā vuttā sā ayam sāmañña magga tā
translated: The similarity of the path that he stated is called the singleness of the path.
