original: maggassa ekattatā nāma. “Tattha katamo maggo”ti pucchitvā “nirayagāmī maggo…pe… nibbānagāmī🔽maggo”ti nirayagāmimaggādivisesaṃ apekkhitvā yā visesamaggatā vuttā, sā ayaṃ visesamaggatā
analyzed: maggassa ekatta tā nāma tattha katamaḥ maggo ti pucchitvā niraya gāmī magga upe nibbāna gāmī  maggo ti niraya gāmi magga ādi visesam apekkhitvā yā visesa magga tā vuttā sā ayam visesa magga tā
translated: The one-pointedness of the path is this: when asked, “What is the path?” and the answer is given, “The path leading to hell … the path leading to Nibbāna,” the one-pointedness of the path is stated by the distinction of the various paths leading to hell, etc.

original: maggassa vemattatā nāma.🔽Nirodhoti paṭisaṅkhānirodhādivisesaṃ anapekkhitvā yā sāmaññanirodhatā vuttā, sā ayaṃ
analyzed: maggassa vemattatā nāma  nirodhaḥ ti paṭisaṅkhā nirodha ādi visesam an apekkhitvā yā sāmañña nirodha tā vuttā sā ayam
translated: The diversity of the path is this: when asked, “What is the path?” and the answer is given, “The path leading to hell … the path leading to Nibbāna,” the diversity of the path is stated by the distinction of the various paths leading to hell, etc.

original: sāmaññanirodhatā nirodhassa ekattatā nāma. “Tattha katamo nirodho”ti pucchitvā “paṭisaṅkhānirodho…pe…🔽sabbakilesanirodho”ti paṭisaṅkhānirodhādivisesaṃ apekkhitvā yā visesanirodhatā vuttā,
analyzed: sāmañña nirodha tā nirodhassa ekatta tā nāma tattha katamaḥ nirodho ti pucchitvā  sabba kilesa nirodhaḥ ti paṭisaṅkhā nirodha ādi visesam apekkhitvā yā visesa nirodha tā vuttā
translated: The one-pointedness of cessation is this: when asked, “What is cessation?” and the answer is given, “The cessation through deliberation … the cessation not through deliberation,” the one-pointedness of cessation is stated by the distinction of the various cessations through deliberation, etc.

original: sā ayaṃ visesanirodhatā nirodhassa vemattatā nāma.
analyzed: sā ayam visesa nirodha tā nirodhassa vematta tā nāma
translated: The diversity of cessation is this: when asked, “What is cessation?” and the answer is given, “The cessation through deliberation … the cessation not through deliberation,” the diversity of cessation is stated by the distinction of the various cessations through deliberation, etc.

original: Rūpanti cātumahābhūtikādivisesamanapekkhitvā yā sāmaññarūpatā vuttā, sā ayaṃ sāmaññarūpatā
analyzed: rūpam ti cātumahābhūtika ādi visesam an apekkhitvā yā sāmañña rūpa tā vuttā sā ayam sāmañña rūpa tā
translated: The one-pointedness of form is this: when asked, “What is form?” and the answer is given, “The four great entities and the form derived from the four great entities,” the one-pointedness of form is stated by the distinction of the various forms derived from the four great entities.

original: rūpassa ekattatā nāma. “Tattha katamaṃ rūpa”nti pucchitvā “cātumahābhūtikaṃ…pe… vāyodhātuyā
analyzed: rūpassa ekatta tā nāma tattha katamam rūpanti pucchitvā cātumahābhūtikaṃpe vāyodhātuyā
translated: “Herein, what is materiality? It is the four great entities and the materiality derived by clinging from the four great entities” , and so on, and “the consciousness element is detached from materiality” .

original: cittaṃ virājetī”ti cātumahābhūtikādivisesamapekkhitvā yā visesarūpatā vuttā, sā ayaṃ
analyzed: cittam virājeti iti cātumahābhūtika ādi visesam apekkhitvā yā visesa rūpa tā vuttā sā ayam
translated: The particular materiality stated in this way, after looking for the particularities of the four great entities, etc., is

original: visesarūpatā rūpassa vemattatā nāma.🔽48. Avijjāti dukkheaññāṇādivisesamanapekkhitvā yā avijjāsāmaññatā vuttā, sā ayaṃ🔽avijjāsāmaññatā avijjāya ekattatā nāma. “Tattha katamā avijjā”ti pucchitvā “dukkhe🔽aññāṇaṃ, dukkhasamudaye aññāṇaṃ…pe… avijjālaṅghī moho akusalamūla”nti dukkheaññāṇādivisesamapekkhitvā🔽yā avijjāvisesatā vuttā, sā ayaṃ avijjāvisesatā avijjāya vemattatā nāma.
analyzed: visesa rūpa tā rūpassa vematta tā nāma  avijjā ti dukkha aññāṇa ādi visesam an apekkhitvā yā avijjā sāmañña tā vuttā sā ayam  avijjā sāmañña tā avijjāya ekatta tā nāma tattha katamā avijjā ti pucchitvā dukkhe  aññāṇam dukkha samudaye avijjā laṅghī moho akusala mūlan ti dukkheaññāṇa ādi visesam apekkhitvā  yā avijjā visesa tā vuttā sā ayam avijjā visesa tā avijjāya vematta tā nāma
translated: this particular materiality called the variety of materiality.

original: Vijjāti dukkheñāṇādivisesamanapekkhitvā yā vijjāsāmaññatā vuttā, sā ayaṃ vijjāsāmaññatā
analyzed: vijjā ti dukkha īñāṇa ādi visesam an apekkhitvā yā vijjā sāmañña tā vuttā sā ayam vijjā sāmañña tā
translated: “Herein, what is ignorance? It is unknowing of suffering, unknowing of the origin of suffering, unknowing of the cessation of suffering, unknowing of the way leading to the cessation of suffering; it is delusion about the Noble Truth of suffering, delusion about the Noble Truth of the origin of suffering, delusion about the Noble Truth of the cessation of suffering, delusion about the Noble Truth of the way leading to the cessation of suffering; it is perversion of understanding about the Noble Truth of suffering, perversion of understanding about the Noble Truth of the origin of suffering, perversion of understanding about the Noble Truth of the cessation of suffering, perversion of understanding about the Noble Truth of the way leading to the cessation of suffering; it is perversion of mind about the Noble Truth of suffering, perversion of mind about the Noble Truth of the origin of suffering, perversion of mind about the Noble Truth of the cessation of suffering, perversion of mind about the Noble Truth of the way leading to the cessation of suffering; it is the root of the unprofitable, delusion, bewilderment, mental darkness, mental blindness, mental obtuseness, lack of understanding, lack of penetration, lack of knowledge, lack of insight, lack of vision, lack of wisdom, lack of full understanding, lack of light, lack of intelligence, lack of lucidity, lack of full comprehension, lack of the torch of knowledge, lack of the radiance of knowledge, lack of the flame of knowledge, lack of the peak of knowledge, lack of the summit of knowledge, lack of the ultimate of knowledge, lack of the supreme of knowledge, lack of the unsurpassed of knowledge, lack of the incomparable of knowledge, lack of the unsurpassed knowledge, lack of the incomparable knowledge, lack of the unsurpassed seeing, lack of the incomparable seeing, lack of the unsurpassed look, lack of the incomparable look, lack of the unsurpassed view, lack of the incomparable view, lack of the unsurpassed investigation, lack of the incomparable investigation, lack of the unsurpassed search, lack of the incomparable search, lack of the unsurpassed research, lack of the incomparable research, lack of the

original: vijjāya ekattatā nāma. “Tattha katamā vijjā”ti pucchitvā “dukkhe ñāṇaṃ, dukkhasamudaye
analyzed: vijjāya ekatta tā nāma tattha katamā vijjā ti pucchitvā dukkhe ñāṇam dukkha samudaye
translated: “Unity through knowledge” means: “Herein, what is knowledge?” Having asked, “Knowledge of suffering, knowledge of the origin of suffering,

original: ñāṇaṃ…pe… dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo maggaṅgaṃ maggapariyāpanna”nti dukkheñāṇādivisesamapekkhitvā
analyzed: dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅgaḥ maggaṅgam magga pariyāpannanti dukkha īñāṇa ādi visesam apekkhitvā
translated: ‘Unification of cognizance through knowledge’ is the unification of cognizance through the various kinds of knowledge. ‘What is knowledge?’ is asked. ‘Knowledge of suffering, knowledge of the origin of suffering … … the investigation-of-states enlightenment factor that is the path is included in the path’ .

original: yā vijjāvisesatā vuttā, sā ayaṃ vijjāvisesatā vijjāya vemattatā nāma.🔽Samāpattīti saññāsamāpatyādivisesaṃ anapekkhitvā yā sāmaññasamāpattitā vuttā, sā
analyzed: yā vijjā visesa tā vuttā sā ayam vijjā visesa tā vijjāya vematta tā nāma  samāpatti iti saññā samāpati ādi visesam an apekkhitvā yā sāmañña samāpatti tā vuttā sā
translated: So the ‘unification of cognizance through knowledge’ is said with reference to the various kinds of knowledge.🔽‘Attainment’ is said with reference to the commonness of attainment without reference to the various kinds of attainment such as the attainment of the perception of a lump, and so on.

original: sāmaññasamāpattitā samāpattiyā ekattatā nāma. “Tattha katamā samāpattī”ti pucchitvā
analyzed: sāmañña samāpatti tā samāpattiyāḥ ekatta tā nāma tattha katamā samāpattī iti pucchitvā
translated: ‘What is attainment?’ is asked.

original: “saññāsamāpatti asaññāsamāpatti…pe… nirodhasamāpattī”ti saññāsamāpatyādivisesaṃ apekkhitvā
analyzed: saññā samāpatti asaññā samāpatti pe nirodha samāpatti iti saññā samāpati ādi visesam apekkhitvā
translated: ‘The attainment of perception, the attainment of the absence of perception, … … the attainment of cessation’ .

original: yā visesasamāpattitā vuttā, sā ayaṃ visesasamāpattitā samāpattiyā vemattatā nāma.
analyzed: yā visesa samāpatti tā vuttā sā ayam visesa samāpatti tā samāpattiyāḥ vematta tā nāma
translated: So the ‘unification of cognizance through attainment’ is said with reference to the various kinds of attainment.

original: Jhāyīti sekkhajhāyīādivisesaṃ anapekkhitvā yā jhāyīsāmaññatā vuttā, sā jhāyīsāmaññatā
analyzed: jhāyī iti sekkha jhāyī ādi visesam an apekkhitvā yā jhāyī sāmañña tā vuttā sā jhāyī sāmañña tā
translated: ‘One who attains’ is said with reference to the commonness of one who attains without reference to the various kinds of trainers, and so on.

original: jhāyino ekattatā nāma. “Tattha katamo jhāyī”ti pucchitvā “atthi sekkho jhāyī, atthi
analyzed: jhāyino ekatta tā nāma tattha katamaḥ jhāyī iti pucchitvā atthi sekkhaḥ jhāyī atthi
translated: and the diversity of meditators is called the diversity of the one-pointedness of those who are meditators.

original: asekkho jhāyī…pe… paññuttaro jhāyī”ti sekkhajhāyīasekkhajhāyīādivisesamapekkhitvā🔽yā jhāyīvisesatā vuttā, sā ayaṃ jhāyīvisesatā jhāyino vemattatā nāma.🔽Samādhīti saraṇasamādhyādivisesamanapekkhitvā yā samādhisāmaññatā vuttā, sā ayaṃ🔽samādhisāmaññatā samādhino ekattatā nāma. “Tattha katamo samādhī”ti pucchitvā “saraṇo🔽samādhi, araṇo samādhi…pe… micchāsamādhi, sammāsamādhī”ti saraṇasamādhyādivisesamapekkhitvā
analyzed: asekkhaḥ jhāyīpe paññuttaraḥ jhāyī ti sekkha jhāyī asekkha jhāyī ādi visesam apekkhitvā  yā jhāyī visesa tā vuttā sā ayam jhāyī visesa tā jhāyinaḥ vematta tā nāma  samādhi iti saraṇa samādhi ādi visesam an apekkhitvā yā samādhi sāmañña tā vuttā sā ayam  samādhi sāmañña tā samādhino ekatta tā nāma tattha katamo samādhi iti pucchitvā saraṇaḥ  samādhi micchāsamādhi sammāsamādhi iti saraṇa samādhi ādi visesam apekkhitvā
translated: When it is asked, “What is a meditator?” and it is said, “There is a meditator who is a trainee, there is a meditator who is one beyond training … there is a meditator who is more distinguished in wisdom,” then the distinction of meditators is called the diversity of the one-pointedness of those who are meditators.🔽When it is said that concentration is the same in all, this is done without reference to the distinction of concentration as the concentration of one who is a refuge, etc. This sameness of concentration is called the unity of the one-pointedness of those who are concentrated.

original: yā samādhivisesatā vuttā, sā ayaṃ samādhivisesatā samādhino vemattatā nāma.🔽Paṭipadāti āgāḷhapaṭipadādivisesamanapekkhitvā yā paṭipadāsāmaññatā vuttā, ayaṃ paṭipadāsāmaññatā
analyzed: yā samādhi visesa tā vuttā sā ayam samādhi visesa tā samādhinaḥ vematta tā nāma 🔽paṭipadā ti āgāḷha paṭipadā ādi visesam an apekkhitvā yā paṭipadā sāmañña tā vuttā ayam paṭipadā sāmañña tā
translated: When it is asked, “What is concentration?” and it is said that “there is concentration that is a refuge, there is concentration that is not a refuge … there is wrong concentration, there is right concentration,” then the distinction of concentration is called the diversity of the one-pointedness of those who are concentrated.🔽When it is said that the way is the same in all, this is done without reference to the distinction of the way as the difficult way, etc. This sameness of the way is called the unity of the one-pointedness of those who are on the way.

original: paṭipadāya ekattatā nāma. “Tattha katamā paṭipadā”ti pucchitvā “āgāḷhapaṭipadā, nijjhāmapaṭipadā…pe…
analyzed: paṭipadāya ekatta tā nāma tattha katamā paṭipadā ti pucchitvā āgāḷha paṭipadā nijjhāma paṭipadā pe
translated: “Herein, what is the way?” “The way that is difficult and painful, the way that is easy and painful …

original: sukhā paṭipadā khippābhiññā”ti āgāḷhapaṭipadādivisesamapekkhitvā yā paṭipadāvisesatā
analyzed: sukhā paṭipadā khippa abhiññā ti āgāḷha paṭipadā ādi visesam apekkhitvā yā paṭipadā visesa tā
translated: the way that is easy and pleasant, and the way that is difficult and pleasant.”

original: vuttā, sā ayaṃ paṭipadāvisesatā paṭipadāya vemattatā nāma.🔽Kāyoti nāmakāyādivisesamanapekkhitvā yā kāyasāmaññatā vuttā, sā ayaṃ kāyasāmaññatā
analyzed: vuttā sā ayam paṭipadā visesa tā paṭipadāya vematta tā nāma  kāyaḥ ti nāma kāya ādi visesam an apekkhitvā yā kāya sāmañña tā vuttā sā ayam kāya sāmañña tā
translated: The difference in the way is the variety of the way.🔽“Herein, what is the body?” “The body consisting of the groups of consciousness, the body consisting of the groups of materiality, …🔽the body consisting of the groups of mental data.”

original: kāyassa ekattatā nāma. “Tattha katamo kāyo”ti pucchitvā “nāmakāyo rūpakāyo…pe… ayaṃ
analyzed: kāyassa ekatta tā nāma tattha katamo kāyo ti pucchitvā nāma kāyaḥ ayaṃ
translated: The difference in the body is the variety of the body.🔽The unity of the body is the same as the unity of the material body.

original: nāmakāyo”ti nāmakāyādivisesamapekkhitvā yā kāyavisesatā vuttā, sā ayaṃ kāyavisesatā
analyzed: nāma kāyaḥ ti nāma kāya ādi visesam apekkhitvā yā kāya visesa tā vuttā sā ayam kāya visesa tā
translated: The variety of the body is the same as the variety of the material body.🔽The difference in the body is the same as the variety of the body.🔽The difference in the body is the same as the variety of the body.🔽The difference in the body is the same as the variety of the body.🔽The difference in the body is the same as the variety of the body.🔽The difference in the body is the same as the variety of the body.🔽The difference in the body is the same as the variety of the body.🔽The difference in the body is the same as the variety of the body.🔽The difference in the body is the same as the variety of the body.🔽The difference in the body is the same as the variety of the body.🔽The difference in the body is the same as the variety of the body.🔽The difference in the body is the same as the variety of the body.🔽The difference in the body is the same as the variety of the body.🔽The difference in the body is the same as the variety of the body.🔽The difference in the body is the same as the variety of the body.🔽The difference in the body is the same as the variety of the body.🔽The difference in the body is the same as the variety of the body.🔽The difference in the body is the same as the variety of the body.🔽The difference in the body is the same as the variety of the body.🔽The difference in the body is the same as the variety of the body.🔽The difference in the body is the same as the variety of the body.

original: kāyassa vemattatā nāmāti yojanā kātabbā. Padatthādiko viseso aṭṭhakathāyaṃ vitthārato vutto.
analyzed: kāyassa vematta tā nāma ati yojanā kātabbā padattha ādikaḥ visesaḥ aṭṭhakathāyam vitthārataḥ vuttaḥ
translated: The difference in the body is the same as the variety of the body.

original: Vuttappakārassa dukkhasamudayādikassa dhammassa ekattatādilakkhaṇaṃ nigamanavasena
analyzed: vutta ppakārassa dukkha samudaya ādikassa dhammassa ekatta tā ādi lakkhaṇam nigamana vasena
translated: The difference in the body is the same as the variety of

original: dassetuṃ “evaṃ yo dhammo”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha evanti iminā mayā vuttena “dukkhanti
analyzed: dassetum evam yaḥ dhammaḥ ti ādi vuttam tattha evam ti iminā mayā vuttena dukkham ti
translated: “Thus, whatever state” is said in order to show this. Herein, thus: by the words “Suffering”

original: ekattatā. Tattha katamaṃ dukkhaṃ? Jāti dukkhā, jarā dukkhā”tiādivacanena. Yo dhammoti🔽yo koci jātijarābyādhyādivisesadhammo. Yassa dhammassāti tato jātiādivisesadhammato
analyzed: ekatta tā tattha katamam dukkham jāti dukkhā jarā dukkhā ati ādi vacanena yaḥ dhammaḥ ti  yaḥ koci jāti jarā byādhi ādi visesa dhammaḥ yassa dhammassa ati tatas jāti ādi visesa dhammato
translated: is the same. Herein, what is suffering? Birth is suffering, aging is suffering” and so on. Whatever state:🔽whatever state distinguished by birth, aging, disease, and so on. Of whatever state:

original: aññassa jarādivisesadhammassa. Samānabhāvoti jātiādivisesadhammena jarādivisesadhammassa🔽dukkhabhāvena samānabhāvo. Tassa dhammassāti jarādivisesadhammassa. Ekattatāyāti
analyzed: aññassa jarā ādi visesa dhammassa samāna bhāvaḥ ti jāti ādi visesa dhammena jarā ādi visesa dhammassa  dukkha bhāvena samāna bhāvaḥ tassa dhammassa ati jarā ādi visesa dhammassa ekatta tāya ati
translated: of another state distinguished by aging, and so on, other than the state distinguished by birth, and so on. The same nature: the same nature as the state distinguished by aging, and so on,🔽by the nature of suffering. Of that state: of the state distinguished by aging, and so on. The same:

original: dukkhasamudayatādisamānatāya dukkhasamudayādibhāvānaṃ ekībhāvena. Ekībhavatīti jātiādivisesabhedena
analyzed: dukkha samudaya tā ādi samāna tāya dukkha samudaya ādi bhāvānam ekībhāvena ekībhavati iti jāti ādi visesa bhedena
translated: by the sameness of the nature of suffering, the nature of origination, and so on, by the unity of the states of suffering, origination, and so on. It becomes one: although it is not one by the distinction of the states distinguished by birth, and so on,

original: anekopi “dukkhasamudayo”tiādinā ekasaddābhidheyyatāya ekībhavati. Yena yena vā pana
analyzed: anekaḥ api dukkha samudayaḥ ti ādinā eka sadda abhidheyya tāya ekībhavati yena yena vā pana
translated: it becomes one by the single verbal expression “origin of suffering” and so on. By whatever:🔽by the sameness of the nature of suffering, and so on.

original: vilakkhaṇo, tena tena vemattaṃ gacchati. Yassa jātiādidhammassa yena yena abhinibbattanaparipācanādisabhāvena🔽yo jātiādidhammo jarādidhammena vilakkhaṇo visadiso hoti, tassa jātiādidhammassa
analyzed: vilakkhaṇaḥ tena tena vemattam gacchati yassa jāti ādi dhammassa yena yena abhinibbattana paripācana ādi sabhāvena  yaḥ jāti ādi dhammaḥ jarā ādi dhammena vilakkhaṇaḥ visadisaḥ hoti tassa jāti ādi dhammassa
translated: The state of birth, etc., of that state of birth, etc., which is of such a nature as to be originated, matured, etc.,🔽is different from the state of ageing, etc., and is not similar to it.

original: tena tena abhinibbattanaparipācanādisabhāvena so jātiādidhammo jarādidhammena vemattataṃ
analyzed: tena tena abhinibbattana paripācana ādi sabhāvena saḥ jāti ādi dhammaḥ jarā ādi dhammena vemattatam
translated: That state of birth, etc., of that state of birth, etc., which is of such a nature as to be originated, matured, etc.,

original: visadisattaṃ gacchati, dukkhasamudayādibhāvena samānopi jātiādidhammo jarādidhammassa
analyzed: visadisa ttam gacchati dukkha samudaya ādi bhāvena samānaḥ api jāti ādi dhammaḥ jarā ādi dhammassa
translated: is different from the state of ageing, etc., and is not similar to it,

original: visiṭṭhataṃ gacchatīti attho daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: gacchati iti atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: and so it is different from it. The meaning should be regarded in this way.

original: Dukkhasamudayādidhammassa ekattavemattatā ācariyena vibhattā, amhehi ca ñātā, “tāya
analyzed: dukkha samudaya ādi dhammassa ekatta vematta tā ācariyena vibhattā amhehi ca ñātā tāya
translated: The teacher has shown the sameness and difference of the states of suffering, origin, etc., and we have understood it.

original: ekattavemattatāya kattha pucchite sati adhiṭṭhānaṃ vīmaṃsitabba”nti pucchitabbattā
analyzed: ekatta vemattatāya kattha pucchite sati adhiṭṭhānam vīmaṃsitabbanti pucchitabba ttā
translated: Now, when it is asked, “In what is the establishment of the answer to be sought when the question is asked thus, ‘In what way are they the same and in what way are they different?’”

original: suttādike pucchite sati vīmaṃsitabbanti dassetuṃ “evaṃ sutte vā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha
analyzed: sutta ādike pucchite sati vīmaṃsitabbanti dassetum evam sutte vā itiādi vuttam tattha
translated: in order to show that it is to be sought in the answer to the question about the suttas, etc., it is said, “In the case of the suttas, etc.,”

original: evaṃ iminā vuttappakārena sutte vā pucchite, veyyākaraṇe vā pucchite, gāthāyaṃ vā🔽pucchitāyaṃ sati adhiṭṭhānaṃ vīmaṃsitabbaṃ. “Kiṃ vīmaṃsitabba”nti puccheyya “ekattatāya
analyzed: evam iminā vutta ppakārena sutte vā pucchite veyyākaraṇe vā pucchite gāthāyam vā  pucchitā ayam sati adhiṭṭhānam vīmaṃsitabbam kim vīmaṃsitabban ti puccheyya ekatta tāya
translated: So when there is a question in a sutta, or a question in an explanatory passage, or a question in a verse,

original: pucchati kiṃ, udāhu vemattatāya pucchati ki”nti vīmaṃsitabbanti yojanā. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ🔽pana – “idāni tāva ekattavemattatāvisaye niyojetvā dassetuṃ ‘sutte vā veyyākaraṇe
analyzed: pucchati kim udāhu vemattatāya pucchati kinti vīmaṃsitabbanti yojanā aṭṭhakathā ayam  pana idāni tāva ekatta vematta tā visaye niyojetvā dassetum sutte vā veyyākaraṇe
translated: then the method of determining the question should be investigated. “What should be investigated?” he might ask. “Is it asked in terms of unity or is it asked in terms of diversity?” This is the construction. But in the commentary

original: vā’tiādi vutta”nti vuttaṃ. “Kathaṃ pucchitaṃ, kathaṃ vissajjitabba”nti vattabbattā🔽“yadi ekattatāyā”tiādi vuttaṃ. “Tenāhā”tiādyānusandhyādiko ca “niyutto adhiṭṭhāno
analyzed: vā ati ādi vuttanti vuttam katham pucchitam katham vissajjitabbam ti vattabbattā  yadi ekatta tāya atiādi vuttam ca niyuttaḥ adhiṭṭhāno
translated: it is said: “Now, in order to show by assigning to the domain of unity and diversity, ‘in a sutta or in an explanatory passage’ and so on is said.” Since it should be said, “How is it asked? How is it answered?”

original: hāro”ti imassa anusandhyādiko ca vuttanayānusārena veditabbo.
analyzed: hāro ti imassa anusandhi ādikaḥ ca vutta naya anusārena veditabbo
translated: “If in terms of unity” and so on is said. “Therefore he said” and so on is the sequence, and so on. And this is to be understood according to the method stated in the following way: “The method of determining the question is assigned.”

original: Iti adhiṭṭhānahāravibhaṅge sattibalānurūpā racitā
analyzed: iti adhiṭṭhāna hāra vibhaṅge satti bala anurūpā racitā
translated: Thus the elucidation of the method of determining the question is composed in accordance with the strength of the knife.

original: Vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The elucidation is finished.

original: Paṇḍitehi pana aṭṭhakathāṭīkānusārena gambhīrattho vitthārato vibhajitvā gahetabboti.
analyzed: paṇḍitehi pana aṭṭhakathā ṭīkā anusārena gambhīra atthaḥ vitthārataḥ vibhajitvā gahetabbaḥ ti
translated: But it should be taken in detail with its deep meaning analyzed by the wise in accordance with the commentaries and subcommentaries.

original: 15. Parikkhārahāravibhaṅgavibhāvanā
analyzed: parikkhāra hāra vibhaṅga vibhāvanā
translated: The Mode Conveying Requisites and Food

original: 49. Yena yena saṃvaṇṇanāvisesabhūtena vibhaṅgena dukkhasaccādīnaṃ ekattatādayo vibhattā,
analyzed: yena yena saṃvaṇṇanā visesa bhūtena vibhaṅgena dukkha sacca ādīnam ekatta tā ādayaḥ vibhattā
translated: By means of which particular mode of teaching the unity, etc., of the truths of suffering, etc., are analyzed,

original: so saṃvaṇṇanāvisesabhūto paripuṇṇo, “katamo parikkhārahāravibhaṅgo nāmā”ti pucchitabbattā
analyzed: so saṃvaṇṇanā visesa bhūto paripuṇṇo katamaḥ parikkhārahāravibhaṅgaḥ nāma ati pucchitabbattā
translated: that particular mode of teaching is complete. “What is called the mode conveying requisites and food?”🔽Since this must be asked,

original: “tattha katamo parikkhāro hāro”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha tatthāti tesu niddiṭṭhesu soḷasasu
analyzed: tattha katamaḥ parikkhāro hāro ti ādi vuttam tattha tattha ati tesu niddiṭṭhesu soḷasasu
translated: “Herein, what is the mode of requisites?” and so on is said. Herein, herein in those sixteen

original: desanāhārādīsu katamo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso parikkhāro hāro parikkhārahāravibhaṅgo nāmāti
analyzed: desanā hāra ādīsu katamaḥ saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ parikkhāro hāro parikkhāra hāra vibhaṅgaḥ nāma ati
translated: teachings on food, etc., demonstrated there, what is the particular mode of teaching called the mode conveying requisites and food?

original: pucchati. “Ye dhammā yaṃ dhammaṃ janayantī”tiādiniddesassa idāni mayā vuccamāno “yo
analyzed: pucchati ye dhammā yam dhammam janayanti iti ādi niddesassa idāni mayā vuccamānaḥ yaḥ
translated: This is the question. “The requisites of a state are those states that give it their own nature” is the answer now given to the question,

original: dhammo yaṃ dhammaṃ janayati, tassa so parikkhāro”tiādiko parikkhārabhūtassa hetuno
analyzed: dhammaḥ yam dhammam janayati tassa so parikkhāraḥ iti ādiko parikkhāra bhūtassa hetuno
translated: which is the mode of teaching called the mode conveying requisites and food.

original: ceva paccayassa ca vitthārasaṃvaṇṇanāviseso parikkhāravibhaṅgo nāma.
analyzed: ca iva paccayassa ca vitthāra saṃvaṇṇanā viseso parikkhāravibhaṅgaḥ nāma
translated: The difference in the detailed explanation of the condition and the conditioned is called the “analysis of the requisites.”

original: “Katamo saṃvaṇṇetabbo parikkhāro”ti pucchitabbattā “yo dhammo”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha
analyzed: katamaḥ saṃvaṇṇetabbo parikkhāro ti pucchitabba ttā yaḥ dhammaḥ tiādi vuttam tattha
translated: “What is the requisite that should be expounded?” Since this must be asked, “The state that is a condition” and so on is said. Therein,

original: yo hetupaccayappakāro dhammo yaṃ phalabhūtaṃ dhammaṃ janayati janeti, tassa phaladhammassa
analyzed: yaḥ hetu paccaya ppakāraḥ dhammaḥ yam phala bhūtam dhammam janayati janeti tassa phala dhammassa
translated: the state that is a condition by way of cause generates, produces, the state that is the effect.

original: so hetupaccayappakāro dhammo parikkhāro nāma. “Kiṃlakkhaṇo parikkhāro”ti pucchitabbattā
analyzed: saḥ hetu paccaya ppakāraḥ dhammaḥ parikkhāraḥ nāma kiṃlakkhaṇaḥ parikkhāraḥ ti pucchitabba ttā
translated: That state that is a condition by way of cause is called the requisite of the state that is the effect. Since it must be asked, “What is the characteristic of the requisite?”

original: tathā pucchitvā lakkhaṇavisesaṃ dassetuṃ “kiṃlakkhaṇo”tiādi vuttaṃ. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ
analyzed: tathā pucchitvā lakkhaṇa visesam dassetum kiṃlakkhaṇa itiādi vuttam aṭṭhakathāyam
translated: having asked thus, in order to show the difference in the characteristic, “What is the characteristic of the requisite?” and so on is said. But in the commentary

original: pana – “tattha ‘yo dhammo yaṃ dhammaṃ janayati, tassa so parikkhāro’ti saṅkhepato
analyzed: pana tattha yaḥ dhammaḥ yam dhammam janayati tassa so parikkhāro ti saṅkhepato
translated: it is said: “Therein, ‘The state that is a condition for a state is its requisite’ is the characteristic of the requisite in brief.

original: parikkhāralakkhaṇaṃ vatvā taṃ vibhāgena dassetuṃ ‘kiṃlakkhaṇo’tiādi vutta”nti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: parikkhāra lakkhaṇam vatvā tam vibhāgena dassetum kiṃlakkhaṇa utiādi vuttanti vuttam
translated: Having stated that, in order to show that by way of analysis, ‘What is the characteristic of the requisite?’ and so on is said.”

original: “Kittakā dhammā janayantī”ti pucchitabbattā “dve dhammā janayanti hetu ca paccayo
analyzed: kittakāḥ dhammāḥ janayanti iti pucchitabbattā dve dhammā janayanti hetu ca paccayo
translated: Since it must be asked, “How many states generate?” “Two states generate: cause and condition” is said.

original: cā”ti vuttaṃ. “Hetupi kāraṇaṃ, paccayopi kāraṇaṃ, tasmā kāraṇāyeva kena lakkhaṇena🔽dvidhā vuttā”ti vattabbattā “tattha kiṃlakkhaṇo”tiādi vuttaṃ. Janitabbaphalato aññehi🔽phalehi asādhāraṇalakkhaṇo hetu, sabbaphalehi sādhāraṇalakkhaṇo paccayo, iminā visesalakkhaṇena
analyzed: ca ati vuttam hetu pi kāraṇam paccayaḥ pi kāraṇam tasmā kāraṇāya iva kena lakkhaṇena  dvidhā vuttā iti vattabbattā tattha kiṃlakkhaṇā tiādi vuttam janitabba phalataḥ aññehi  phalehi asādhāraṇa lakkhaṇaḥ hetu sabba phalehi sādhāraṇa lakkhaṇaḥ paccayaḥ iminā visesa lakkhaṇena
translated: “Why is it so?”🔽“Cause” is a reason, and “condition” is also a reason. So why is it said in two ways by a distinguishing mark of reason?

original: dvidhā vattabbāti attho. “Sādhāraṇāsādhāraṇaviseso kīdiso bhave”ti pucchitabbattā🔽“yathā kiṃ bhave”ti pucchitvā “yathā aṅkurassā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Yathā yo sādhāraṇāsādhāraṇaviseso
analyzed: dvidhā vattabbā ti atthaḥ sādhāraṇa asādhāraṇa visesaḥ kīdisaḥ bhaveti pucchitabba ttā  yathā kim bhavā iti pucchitvā yathā aṅkurassa atiādi vuttam yathā yaḥ sādhāraṇa asādhāraṇa viseso
translated: “What is the distinguishing mark of each?” is said in order to show this. The cause has a distinguishing mark that is not shared by other fruits that are to be generated. The condition has a distinguishing mark that is shared by all fruits. The meaning is that it is to be said in two ways by this distinguishing mark.🔽“What is the distinguishing mark of the shared and the unshared?” is asked in order to show this.

original: atthi, tathā so sādhāraṇāsādhāraṇaviseso kiṃ viya bhaveti attho. Aṅkurassa nibbattiyā
analyzed: atthi tathā saḥ sādhāraṇa asādhāraṇa visesaḥ kim viya bhaveti atthaḥ aṅkurassa nibbattiyā
translated: “What is it like?” is asked in order to show this. “It is like the seed of a sprout” is said, and so on. The meaning is: What is the shared and unshared distinguishing mark like?

original: bījaṃ asādhāraṇaṃ yathā, tathā hetu phalassa nibbattiyā asādhāraṇo bhave. Pathavī
analyzed: bījam asādhāraṇam yathā tathā hetu phalassa nibbattiyā asādhāraṇaḥ bhave pathavī
translated: As the seed is unshared in the generation of a sprout, so the cause is unshared in the generation of a fruit. The earth🔽is shared.

original: ca āpo ca aṅkurassa nibbattiyā sādhāraṇā bhavanti yathā, tathā paccayo phalassa nibbattiyā
analyzed: ca āpaḥ ca aṅkurassa nibbattiyā sādhāraṇāḥ bhavanti yathā tathā paccayaḥ phalassa nibbattiyā
translated: As the earth and water are common to the production of the sprout, so the condition is common to the production of the fruit.

original: sādhāraṇo bhave. Sabbaphalassa paccayattā aṅkurassa bījaṃ asādhāraṇaṃ janakaṃ hetu.
analyzed: sādhāraṇaḥ bhave sabba phalassa paccaya ttā aṅkurassa bījam asādhāraṇam janakam hetu
translated: The seed is the uncommon producer, the cause, of the sprout, because it is the condition for all the fruit.

original: “Kathaṃ pathavī, āpo ca sādhāraṇā janakāti saddahitabbā”ti pucchitabbattā “aṅkurassa
analyzed: katham pathavī āpaḥ ca sādhāraṇāḥ janakāḥ ati saddahitabbā ati pucchitabba ttā aṅkurassa
translated: “How is it to be believed that the earth and water are common producers?”—in order to ask this, it is said: “The seed is the cause of the sprout, etc.”

original: hī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Samaṃ samānaṃ phalaṃ bhavāpetīti sabhāvo, ko so? Bījaṃ hetuyeva.
analyzed: hi itiādi vuttam samam samānam phalam bhava apeti iti sa bhāvaḥ saḥ bījam hetuyā iva
translated: The nature is the same, the seed is the cause only, which brings about the same fruit.

original: “Kiṃ hetupaccayānaṃ viseso bījaṅkuropamāyeva dassetabbo, udāhu aññūpamāyapi dassetabbo”ti
analyzed: kim hetu paccayānam visesaḥ bīja aṅkura upamāya iva dassetabbaḥ udāhu aññūpamāya api dassetabbaḥ ti
translated: “Should the distinction between cause and condition be shown by the simile of the seed and the sprout only, or should it be shown by other similes also?”

original: vattabbattā aññāya upamāyapi visesaṃ dassetuṃ “yathā vā panā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Imāya
analyzed: vattabba ttā aññāya upamāya api visesam dassetum yathā vā pana iti ādi vuttam imāya
translated: in order to say this, it is said: “Or, just as, etc.”

original: upamāyapi hetupaccayānaṃ viseso vijānitabboti adhippāyo.
analyzed: upamāya api hetu paccayānam visesaḥ vijānitabbaḥ ti adhippāyaḥ
translated: The intention is that by this simile also the distinction between cause and condition should be understood.

original: Bījaṅkurādīsu bāhiresu parikkhārabhūtānaṃ hetupaccayānaṃ viseso ācariyena vibhatto,
analyzed: bīja aṅkura ādīsu bāhiresu parikkhāra bhūtānam hetu paccayānam visesaḥ ācariyena vibhatto
translated: The distinction between the cause and condition which are external requisites, such as the seed and the sprout, etc., has been analysed by the teacher,

original: amhehi ca ñāto, “kathaṃ ajjhattikesu vibhatto”ti pucchitabbattā “ayañhi saṃsāro”tiādi🔽vuttaṃ. Atha vā “bāhiresu parikkhārabhūto hetupaccayo yutto hotu, kathaṃ ajjhattikesu🔽yutto”ti vattabbattā “ayañhi saṃsāro”tiādi vuttaṃ. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana – “evaṃ bāhiraṃ
analyzed: amhehi ca ñāto katham ajjhattikesu vibhattaḥ ti ayam hi saṃsāra utiādi  vuttam atha vā bāhiresu parikkhāra bhūtaḥ hetu paccayaḥ yuttaḥ hotu katham ajjhattikesu  yuttaḥ ti vattabbattā ayam hi saṃsāraḥ tiādi vuttam aṭṭhakathā ayam pana evam bāhiram
translated: and we have understood the external analysis of conditions. Now we ask, “How is it analyzed internally?” Therefore it is said, “This round of births and deaths.”🔽Or alternatively, “Let the external analysis of conditions be appropriate as a condition in the way of a requisite. How is it appropriate internally?” Therefore it is said, “This round of births and deaths.”

original: hetupaccayavibhāgaṃ dassetvā idāni ajjhattikaṃ dassetuṃ ‘ayañhi saṃsāro’tiādi vutta”nti🔽vuttaṃ. Hetupaccayehi saha saṃsāro bhavatīti sahetupaccayo. Ayaṃ saṃsāro hi yasmā
analyzed: hetu paccaya vibhāgam dassetvā idāni ajjhattikam dassetum ayam hi saṃsāra itiādi vuttanti  vuttam hetu paccayehi saha saṃsāraḥ bhavati iti sa hetu paccayaḥ ayam saṃsāraḥ hi yasmā
translated: But in the Commentary it is said: “Having thus shown the external analysis of conditions, he now said ‘This round of births and deaths’ in order to show the internal analysis.”🔽The round of births and deaths is with conditions, thus it is sahetupaccayo . This round of births and deaths is to be seen as a condition internally in the way of a requisite,

original: sahetupaccayo hutvā nibbatto, tasmā ajjhattikepi parikkhārabhūto hetupaccayo yuttoyevāti
analyzed: sa hetu paccayaḥ hutvā nibbattaḥ tasmai ajjhattike pi parikkhāra bhūtaḥ hetu paccayaḥ yuttaḥ yeva ati
translated: since it is produced as a condition with conditions.

original: daṭṭhabboti adhippāyo.
analyzed: daṭṭhabbaḥ iti adhippāyaḥ
translated: This is the purport.

original: So imassa saṃsārassa sahetupaccayattaṃ yadi bhagavatā vuttaṃ, evaṃ sati amhehi saddahitabbaṃ,
analyzed: so imassa saṃsārassa sa hetu paccayattam yadi bhagavatā vuttam evam sati amhehi saddahitabbam
translated: If the Blessed One said that this round of births and deaths is a condition with conditions, then we must believe it.

original: “kathaṃ saddahitabba”nti vattabbattā “evañhī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Evanti iminā avijjādinā🔽hetupaccayena sabbo paṭiccasamuppādo saṃsāroti nibbattoti bhagavatā saṃsārassa sahetupaccayattaṃ🔽vuttaṃ, tasmā saddahitabbaṃ. Avijjādayo saṅkhārādīnaṃ paccayo hotu, “katamo avijjāya🔽hetū”ti pucchitabbattā “iti avijjā avijjāya hetū”ti vuttaṃ. “Katamo avijjāya paccayo”ti
analyzed: katham saddahitabbam ti vattabbattā evañhi itiādi vuttam evam ti iminā avijja ādinā  hetu paccayena sabbaḥ paṭiccasamuppādaḥ saṃsāro ti nibbattaḥ ti bhagavatā saṃsārassa sa hetu paccaya ttam  vuttam tasmā saddahitabbam avijjā ādayo saṅkhāra ādīnam paccayaḥ hotu katamaḥ avijjāya  hetū ti pucchitabba ttā iti avijjā avijjāya hetū iti vuttam katamaḥ avijjāya paccayaḥ ti
translated: “How is it to be believed?” Since this is so, “Thus” is said, etc. By this word “thus” the Blessed One has said that the whole Dependent Origination with ignorance, etc., as its cause and condition, is produced as the round of rebirths. Therefore it is to be believed. Let ignorance be a condition for formations, etc. Since it is necessary to ask, “What is the cause of ignorance?” it is said, “Thus ignorance has ignorance as its cause.” Since it is necessary to ask, “What is the condition for ignorance?”🔽

original: pucchitabbattā “ayoniso manasikāro paccayo”ti vuttaṃ. “Katamā avijjā katamāya avijjāya🔽hetū”ti pucchitabbattā “purimikā avijjā pacchimikāya avijjāya hetū”ti vuttaṃ. “Katamā🔽purimikā avijjā katamā pacchimikā avijjā”ti pucchitabbattā “tatthā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: pucchitabba ttā ayonisaḥ manasikāraḥ paccayaḥ ti vuttam katamā avijjā katamāya avijjāya 🔽hetū ti pucchitabba ttā purimikā avijjā pacchimikāya avijjāya hetū ti vuttam katamā 🔽purimikā avijjā katamā pacchimikā avijjā ti pucchitabbattā tattha atiādi vuttam
translated: “How is it to be believed?” Since this must be said, “Thus it is” is said. By this “thus” the Blessed One said that the whole dependent origination, with ignorance as its cause and condition, is born as the round of rebirths. Therefore it is to be believed. Let ignorance be a condition for formations, etc. Since it must be asked, “What is the cause of ignorance?” it is said, “Thus ignorance is the cause of ignorance.” Since it must be asked, “What is the condition of ignorance?” it is said, “Inappropriate attention is the condition.” Since it must be asked, “What is ignorance? What is the cause of what ignorance?” it is said, “Previous ignorance is the cause of subsequent ignorance.” Since it must be asked, “What is previous ignorance? What is subsequent ignorance?” it is said, “Herein,” etc.

original: “Avijjāpariyuṭṭhānassa hetubhūto purimo avijjānusayo samanantarova kiṃ, udāhu paramparahetupi
analyzed: avijjā pariyuṭṭhānassa hetu bhūtaḥ purimaḥ avijjā anusayo samanantaraḥ uva kim udāhu
translated: “Is the former underlying tendency to ignorance, which is the cause of the envelopment of ignorance, only an immediately preceding condition, or is it also a indirect cause? ”

original: hotī”ti pucchitabbattā “bījaṅkuro viyā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Bījaṅkuroti bījānaṃ aṅkuroti
analyzed: hoti iti pucchitabbattā bījaṅkuraḥ viya itiādi vuttam bījaṅkuroti bījānam aṅkuroti
translated: The answer is given in the words “like the seed and the sprout.” The seed’s sprout is the sprout of the seed.

original: bījaṅkuro, bījānaṃ samanantarahetutāya aṅkuro nibbattati viya. Yattha rukkhādike🔽yaṃ phalaṃ nibbattati, tasmiṃ rukkhādike nibbattassa assa phalassa idaṃ bījaṃ pana
analyzed: bījaṅkuraḥ bījānam samanantara hetutāya aṅkuraḥ nibbattati viya yattha rukkha ādike  yam phalam nibbattati tasmin rukkha ādike nibbattassa assa phalassa idam bījam pana
translated: Just as the sprout is produced by the seed as an immediately preceding condition,

original: paramparahetutāya hetubhūtaṃ bhavati.
analyzed: parampara hetutāya hetu bhūtam bhavati
translated: so the fruit is produced by the tree, etc., in which it grows. But the seed of that fruit is the cause of the tree, etc., in which it grows, by being a indirect cause.

original: “Bījaṃ pana ekaṃyeva hoti, kathaṃ dvidhā vattabba”nti vattabbattā “duvidho hī”tiādi
analyzed: bījam pana ekam yā iva hoti katham dvidhā vattabbanti vattabba ttā duvidhaḥ hi itiādi
translated: “But the seed is only one. How can it be said to be twofold?”

original: vuttaṃ, samanantarakālaparamparakālabhedena hetupi duvidho hotiyevāti attho. Bījabhūto
analyzed: vuttam samanantara kāla parampara kāla bhedena duvidhaḥ attho bīja bhūto
translated: The answer is given in the words “The seed is twofold.” The meaning is that the cause is also twofold by way of the distinction of the immediately preceding moment and the indirect cause.

original: hetu duvidho yathā, evaṃ avijjāya hetubhūto avijjānusayopi samanantarahetu ca paramparahetu
analyzed: hetu duvidhaḥ yathā evam avijjāya hetu bhūtaḥ avijja anusayaḥ api samanantara hetu ca parampara hetu
translated: Just as the seed as cause is twofold, so the underlying tendency to ignorance, which is the cause of ignorance, is also twofold: the immediately preceding cause and the indirect cause.

original: cāti kālabhedena duvidho bhavati, samanantaro avijjānusayo samanantarassa avijjāpariyuṭṭhānassa🔽samanantarahetu hoti. Purimataro avijjānusayo pacchimatarassa avijjāpariyuṭṭhānassa🔽paramparahetu hoti. Iti bījabhūto asādhāraṇo hetu, pathavīāpādiko sādhāraṇo paccayoti
analyzed: ca ati kāla bhedena duvidhaḥ bhavati samanantaraḥ avijjā anusayo samanantarassa avijjā pariyuṭṭhānassa  samanantara hetu hoti purimataraḥ avijjā anusayo pacchimatarassa avijjā pariyuṭṭhānassa  parampara hetu hoti iti bīja bhūtaḥ asādhāraṇaḥ hetu pathavīāpādiko sādhāraṇo paccayo ti
translated: and so it is twofold by way of time. The underlying tendency to ignorance is the condition by way of the immediate antecedent condition for the manifestation of ignorance.🔽The earlier underlying tendency to ignorance is the condition by way of the prenascent condition for the later manifestation of ignorance.🔽Thus the uncommon cause is the seed-state, and the common condition is the earth, water, etc.

original: viseso pākaṭo yathā, evaṃ avijjānusayo asādhāraṇo hetu, ayonisomanasikāro sādhāraṇo🔽paccayoti viseso daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: visesaḥ pākaṭaḥ yathā evam avijjā anusayaḥ asādhāraṇaḥ hetu a yonisaḥ manasikāraḥ sādhāraṇaḥ  paccayaḥ ti visesaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: and so it is twofold as divided into time. The underlying tendency to ignorance is the condition, as proximate cause, for the manifestation of ignorance. The earlier underlying tendency to ignorance is the condition, as indirect cause, for the later manifestation of ignorance. So the distinction between the two should be understood as follows: the underlying tendency to ignorance is the uncommon cause, like the seed; the condition is the common cause, like the earth, water, etc.

original: “Ettakeneva hetupaccayānaṃ viseso vattabbo”ti vattabbattā “yathā vā pana thālakañcā”tiādi
analyzed: ettakena iva hetu paccayānam visesaḥ vattabbaḥ ti vattabbattā yathā vā pana thālakam ca atiādi
translated: “But is that the only distinction to be made between the two?”—In order to show that there is not, the text goes on to say “Or as the dish and the spoon” ,

original: vuttaṃ. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana – “yathā vā panātiādināpi hetupaccayavibhāgameva dassetī”ti
analyzed: vuttam aṭṭhakathāyam pana yathā vā pana ati ādinā api hetu paccaya vibhāgam eva dasseti iti
translated: but in the Commentary it is said: “Or as the dish and the spoon: this is stated in order to show the distinction between the root-cause condition and the condition by decisive support” .

original: vuttaṃ. Tattha padīpassa paccayabhūtaṃ thālakañca vaṭṭi ca telañca padīpassa sabhāvahetu
analyzed: vuttam tattha padīpassa paccaya bhūtam thālakam ca vaṭṭi ca telañca padīpassa sabhāva hetu
translated: Herein, the dish and the spoon, which are the conditions for the flame, are the flame’s natural root-cause condition,

original: samānahetu na hotīti yojanā. “Padīpassa paccayabhūtampi thālakādikaṃ sabhāvahetu
analyzed: samāna hetu na hoti iti yojanā padīpassa paccaya bhūtam pi thālaka ādikam sabhāva hetu
translated: The construction is: “It is not a like cause.”

original: na hotīti kasmā saddahitabba”nti vattabbattā “na hi sakkā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Padīpassa
analyzed: na hoti iti kasmā saddahitabbam ti vattabbattā na hi sakkā atiādi vuttam padīpassa
translated: “But why should we believe that the bowl, etc., which are conditions for the flame, are not its individual essence?”🔽Because the bowl, etc., which are conditions for the flame, are not the flame’s individual essence,

original: paccayabhūtaṃ anaggikaṃ aggirahitaṃ thālakañca vaṭṭiñca telañca dīpetuṃ jāletuṃ hi
analyzed: paccaya bhūtam anaggikam aggi rahitam thālakam ca vaṭṭiñca telam ca dīpetum jāletum hi
translated: since they cannot be ignited or burned,

original: yasmā na sakkā, tasmā purimo padīpo pacchimassa padīpassa sabhāvahetu hoti viya,
analyzed: yasmai na sakkā tasmai purimo padīpo pacchimassa padīpassa sabhāva hetu hoti viya
translated: therefore, just as the preceding flame is the individual essence cause of the subsequent flame,🔽so the bowl, etc., are not the individual essence cause.

original: evaṃ thālakādikaṃ sabhāvahetu na hoti. Iti evaṃpakāro sabhāvo samāno padīpo hetu
analyzed: evam thālaka ādikam sabhāva hetu na hoti iti evaṃpakāraḥ sabhāvaḥ samānaḥ padīpaḥ hetu
translated: Thus the flame, which is a like individual essence, is the cause,

original: hoti yathā, parabhāvo asamāno thālakādiko paccayo hoti yathā ca, tathā ajjhattiko🔽sabhāvo hetu hoti, bāhiro asamāno paccayo hoti. Janako avijjānusayo avijjāpariyuṭṭhānassa
analyzed: hoti yathā para bhāvaḥ asamāno thālaka ādiko paccayaḥ hoti yathā ca tathā ajjhattiko  sabhāvaḥ hetu hoti bāhiraḥ asamānaḥ paccayaḥ hoti janakaḥ avijjā anusayaḥ avijjā pariyuṭṭhānassa
translated: and the bowl, etc., which are unlike individual essences, are the conditions.🔽The generating underlying tendency to ignorance is the cause of the manifestation of ignorance;

original: hetu hoti, pariggāhako upatthambhako paccayo hoti. Aññehi phalehi asādhāraṇo hetu
analyzed: hetu hoti pariggāhakaḥ upatthambhakaḥ paccayaḥ hoti aññehi phalehi asādhāraṇaḥ hetu
translated: the supporting and consolidating condition is the condition. The cause is not shared by other fruits.

original: hoti, sabbehi phalehi sādhāraṇo paccayo hotīti yojetvā padīpopamāyapi hetupaccayānaṃ🔽pākaṭo viseso daṭṭhabboti adhippāyo.
analyzed: hoti sabbehi phalehi sādhāraṇaḥ paccayaḥ hoti iti yojetvā hetu paccayānam  pākaṭaḥ visesaḥ daṭṭhabbaḥ ti adhippāyaḥ
translated: and it is a condition for all fruits in common. The meaning intended is that the distinction between the cause condition and the other conditions can be seen to be clear by the simile of the lamp.

original: Hetupaccayappabhedaṃ kāraṇaṃ parikkhāroti ācariyena vuttaṃ, tassa kāraṇassa kāraṇabhāvo🔽ca phalāpekkho hoti, tasmā “yo kāraṇabhāvo yenākārena hoti, katamo so kāraṇabhāvo,🔽katamo so ākāro”ti pucchitabbattā ca “yaṃ phalaṃ yena visesena hoti, katamaṃ taṃ
analyzed: hetu paccaya ppabhedam kāraṇam parikkhāro ti ācariyena vuttam tassa kāraṇassa kāraṇa bhāvaḥ  ca phala apekkho hoti tasmā yaḥ kāraṇa bhāvaḥ yena ākārena hoti katamaḥ saḥ kāraṇa bhāvaḥ  katamaḥ so ākāraḥ ti pucchitabba ttā ca yam phalam yena visesena hoti katamam tam
translated: The teacher has said, “The reason is the analysis of the cause condition.” The reason for that is🔽that the state of being a cause is dependent on the fruit. Therefore, since it has to be asked, “What is the state of being a cause, in what way does it occur?,”🔽and since it has to be asked, “What is the fruit, in what way does it occur?,”

original: phalaṃ, katamo so viseso”ti pucchitabbattā ca “kāraṇaphalānaṃ yo sambandho hoti,🔽katamo so sambandho”ti pucchitabbattā ca taṃ sabbaṃ vibhāvetuṃ “avupacchedattho”tiādi
analyzed: phalam katamaḥ so viseso ti pucchitabba ttā ca kāraṇa phalānam yaḥ sambandho hoti  katamaḥ so sambandhaḥ iti pucchitabba ttā ca tam sabbam vibhāvetum
translated: and since it has to be asked, “What is the relationship between the cause and the fruit?”🔽all that has been analysed by the statement beginning, “The meaning of non-interruption.”

original: vuttaṃ. Ayamanusandhyattho ca aṭṭhakathāyaṃ “idāni yasmā kāraṇaṃ ‘parikkhāro’ti vuttaṃ,
analyzed: vuttam ayam anusandhi attho ca aṭṭhakathāyam idāni yasmā kāraṇam parikkhāro ti vuttam
translated: And the meaning of the connection here is stated in the commentary thus: “Now, since the cause is called ‘requisite,’

original: kāraṇabhāvo ca phalāpekkhāya, tasmā kāraṇassa yo kāraṇabhāvo yathā ca so hoti, yañca
analyzed: kāraṇa bhāvaḥ ca phala apekkhāya tasmā kāraṇassa yaḥ kāraṇa bhāvaḥ yathā ca saḥ hoti yat ca
translated: And the state of being a cause is dependent on the fruit. Therefore, in order to show what the state of being a cause is, how it comes about,

original: phalaṃ, yo ca tassa viseso, yo ca kāraṇaphalānaṃ sambandho, taṃ sabbaṃ vibhāvetuṃ
analyzed: phalam yaḥ ca tassa visesaḥ yaḥ ca kāraṇa phalānam sambandho tam sabbam vibhāvetum
translated: what the fruit is, what the difference between them is, and what the connection between cause and fruit is,

original: ‘avupacchedattho’tiādi vutta”nti iminā vuttoti daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: av upaccheda atthaḥ tiādi vuttanti iminā vuttaḥ ti daṭṭhabbo
translated: ‘The meaning of non-interruption, etc.’ is said. This should be understood as stated.

original: Tattha avupacchinnassa hetupaccayasaṅkhātassa kāraṇassa yo anupacchedattho atthi,🔽so anupacchedattho santatiattho hoti phalena sambandhattā, yañca kāraṇaṃ attano phalassa
analyzed: tattha hetu paccaya saṅkhātassa kāraṇassa yaḥ anupaccheda atthaḥ atthi  saḥ an upaccheda atthaḥ santati atthaḥ hoti phalena yat ca kāraṇam phalassa
translated: Herein, the meaning of non-interruption of the cause called ‘causal condition’ is🔽the meaning of continuity, because it is connected with the fruit. And the cause that ceases having given rise to its fruit and having supported it

original: janakaṃ upatthambhakaṃ hutvā nirujjhati, so anupacchinno eva nāma hotīti. Yañca phalaṃ🔽aññassa kāraṇaṃ hutvā nirujjhati, tasmiṃ anupacchinne tassa ca santatiattho hoti.
analyzed: janakam upatthambhakam hutvā nirujjhati saḥ an upacchinnaḥ eva nāma hoti iti yat ca phalam  aññassa kāraṇam hutvā nirujjhati tasmin an upacchinne tassa ca santati atthaḥ hoti
translated: is said to be uninterrupted. And the fruit that ceases having become the cause of another fruit🔽has the meaning of continuity in the uninterrupted.

original: Yaṃ pana phalaṃ aññassa phalassa kāraṇaṃ ahutvā nirujjhati, taṃ upacchinnaṃ hoti,
analyzed: yam pana phalam aññassa phalassa kāraṇam a hutvā nirujjhati tam upacchinnam hoti
translated: But the fruit that ceases without becoming the cause of another fruit is interrupted,

original: yathā taṃ arahato cuticittanti. Kāraṇato nibbattassa phalassa yo nibbattiattho atthi,
analyzed: yathā tam arahataḥ cuti cittan ti kāraṇataḥ nibbattassa phalassa yaḥ nibbatti attho atthi
translated: and the consciousness of the Arahant’s fall is the fruit.🔽The meaning of arising that there is of the aggregates arisen from a cause is the meaning of fruit.

original: so nibbattiattho phalattho hoti. Paṭisandhikkhandhānaṃ yo paṭisandhiattho paṭisandahanattho🔽atthi, so paṭisandhiattho punabbhavattho punabbhavanattho hoti. Kilesānaṃ yo palibodhattho
analyzed: saḥ nibbatti atthaḥ phala atthaḥ hoti paṭisandhi khandhānam yaḥ paṭisandhi atthaḥ paṭisandahana tthaḥ  atthi so paṭisandhi attho punabbhava ttho punabbhavana ttho hoti kilesānam yo palibodha attho
translated: The meaning of rebirth that there is of the aggregates of rebirth, the meaning of being reborn,🔽The meaning of obstruction that there is of defilements, the meaning of arising in the continuity,

original: santāne uppajjanattho atthi, so palibodhattho pariyuṭṭhānattho hoti. Kilesānaṃ maggena
analyzed: santāne uppajjana tthaḥ atthi so palibodha tthaḥ pariyuṭṭhāna tthaḥ hoti kilesānam maggena
translated: The meaning of non-eradication that there is of defilements by the path is the meaning of inherent tendency.

original: yo asamugghātattho atthi, so asamugghātattho anusayattho hoti. Avijjāya catunnaṃ🔽saccānaṃ yo asampaṭivedhattho atthi, so asampaṭivedhattho avijjattho hoti. Arahattamaggena
analyzed: yaḥ a samugghāta tthaḥ atthi saḥ a samugghāta tthaḥ anusaya tthaḥ hoti avijjāya catunnam  saccānam yaḥ a sampaṭivedha ttho atthi saḥ a sampaṭivedha ttho avijja tthaḥ hoti arahatta maggena
translated: The meaning of non-penetration that there is of ignorance of the four truths is the meaning of ignorance.

original: yo apariññātattho atthi, so apariññātattho viññāṇassa paṭisandhiviññāṇassa bījattho hoti.
analyzed: yaḥ a pariññāta attho atthi saḥ a pariññāta attho viññāṇassa paṭisandhi viññāṇassa bīja attho hoti
translated: The meaning of non-full-understanding that there is of the path of Arahantship is the meaning of the seed of rebirth-linking consciousness.

original: Ettāvatā kāraṇabhāvo ca kāraṇākāro ca phalañca phalaviseso ca ācariyena vibhatto,
analyzed: ettāvatā kāraṇa bhāvaḥ ca kāraṇa ākāro ca phalañca phala viseso ca ācariyena vibhatto
translated: To this extent the Master has analysed the state of being a cause, the state of being a condition, fruit, and the distinction between fruits.

original: amhehi ca ñāto, “katamo paramparahetupaccayattho, katamo ca sambandhattho”ti pucchitabbattā
analyzed: amhehi ca ñātaḥ katamo parampara hetu paccaya ttho katamo ca sambandha ttho ti pucchitabba ttā
translated: and we have asked, “What is the meaning of the causal relation as a series and what is the meaning of the relation of decisive support?”

original: “yattha avupacchedo”tiādi vuttaṃ. Yattha yassaṃ rūpārūpapavattiyaṃ avupacchinnassa🔽hetupaccayappabhedassa kāraṇassa yo avupacchedo atthi, so avupacchedo tattha tissaṃ
analyzed: vuttam yattha rūpa arūpa pavattiyam  hetu paccaya ppabhedassa kāraṇassa yaḥ av upacchedaḥ atthi saḥ tattha tissam
translated: “Where there is no interruption” is said. Where there is no interruption of a cause classed as root-cause, etc.,🔽in the occurrence of material and immaterial dhammas, that is the continuity there.

original: rūpārūpapavattiyaṃ santati hoti. Yattha yassaṃ rūpārūpapavattiyaṃ yā santati atthi,
analyzed: rūpa arūpa pavattiyam santati hoti rūpa arūpa pavattiyam yā santati atthi
translated: Where there is continuity, there is production of material and immaterial dhammas.

original: sā santatitattha rūpārūpapavattiyaṃ nibbatti hotītiādinā yojetvā paramparahetuādiko viññātabbo.
analyzed: sā santati tattha rūpa arūpa pavattiyam nibbatti hoti itiādinā yojetvā parampara hetu ādikaḥ viññātabbaḥ
translated: The causal relation as a series, etc., should be understood by applying the words “production,” etc., in the appropriate places.

original: Sīlakkhandhoti parisuddhasīlakkhandho. Samādhikkhandhassāti mahaggatakkhandhassa,
analyzed: sīla kkhandho ti parisuddha sīla kkhandho samādhi khandhassa ati mahaggata kkhandhassa
translated: The virtue category: the virtue category that is purified. The concentration category: the concentration category that is exalted.

original: samādhipaṭṭhāno hi mahaggatadhammo. Paññākkhandhoti maggaphalapaññāpadhānakkhandho.
analyzed: samādhi paṭṭhānaḥ hi mahaggata dhammo paññā kkhandho ti magga phala paññā apadhāna kkhandho
translated: For the exalted states of consciousness have concentration as their proximate cause. The understanding category: the understanding category that is the principal factor.

original: So hi vimuttiñāṇadassanasaṅkhātassa paccavekkhaṇañāṇakkhandhassa paccayo hoti. Titthaññutādīnaṃ
analyzed: saḥ hi vimutti ñāṇa dassana saṅkhātassa paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇa kkhandhassa paccayaḥ hoti titthaññu tā ādīnam
translated: For this is a condition for the aggregate of reviewing knowledge called the knowledge of reviewing deliverance.

original: attho padaṭṭhānahāravibhaṅgavaṇṇanāyaṃ vuttova.🔽Sabhāvo hetūti ācariyena vutto, “kīdiso so sabhāvo hetū”ti pucchitabbattā “yathā🔽vā pana cakkhuñca paṭiccā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Cakkhuviññāṇaṃ cakkhuñca cakkhundriyañca🔽paṭicca nissayaṃ katvā rūpe paṭicca ārammaṇaṃ katvā uppajjati. Tattha cakkhādīsu
analyzed: sabhāvaḥ hetu iti ācariyena vutto kīdiso saḥ sabhāvaḥ hetu iti pucchitabbattā yathā  vā pana cakkhuñca paṭicca atiādi vuttam cakkhu viññāṇam cakkhuñca cakkhu indriyam ca  paṭicca nissayam katvā rūpe paṭicca ārammaṇam katvā uppajjati tattha cakkhu ādīsu
translated: The meaning of the words “is the ford, the crossing, the bridge” and so on is given in the commentary on the section of the Niddesa dealing with the Padas.

original: cakkhundriyaṃ ādhipateyyapaccayatāya indriyapaccayatāya cakkhuviññāṇassa paccayo,
analyzed: cakkhu indriyam ādhipateyya paccaya tāya indriya paccaya tāya cakkhu viññāṇassa paccayaḥ
translated: The teacher has said that the specific nature is the cause. Since it has to be asked, “What is that specific nature, the cause?” it is said, “Or else, with eye and with forms” and so on. Eye-consciousness arises with eye and with forms, with eye as the dominant condition and with forms as the object condition. Herein, as regards the eye, etc., the eye faculty is a condition for eye-consciousness by means of the condition of faculty.

original: rūpārammaṇaṃ purejātārammaṇapaccayatāya paccayo, āloko sannissayatāya upanissayatāya
analyzed: rūpa ārammaṇam purejāta ārammaṇa paccaya tāya paccayaḥ āloko sannissaya tāya upanissaya tāya
translated: The object, the visible-form, is a condition by means of the condition of prenascence object. Light is a condition by means of the condition of support and by means of the condition of decisive support.

original: paccayo hoti. So paccayo honto phalena cakkhuviññāṇena asamānattā sabhāvo hetu na
analyzed: paccayaḥ hoti saḥ paccayaḥ honto phalena cakkhu viññāṇena asamāna ttā sabhāvaḥ na
translated: Being a condition, it is the specific nature, the cause, since it is not the same as the fruit, the eye-consciousness.

original: hoti, paccayo ca hoti manasikāro. Kiriyamanodhātu pana phalena cakkhuviññāṇena viññāṇabhāvena🔽samānattā sabhāvo hetu hoti yathā, evaṃ saṅkhārā nāmakkhandhabhāvena samānattā viññāṇassa
analyzed: hoti paccayaḥ ca hoti manasikāro kiriya manaḥ dhātu pana phalena cakkhu viññāṇena viññāṇa bhāvena  samāna ttā sabhāvaḥ hetu hoti yathā evam saṅkhārāḥ nāma kkhandha bhāvena samāna ttā viññāṇassa
translated: and it is a condition for the mind-element. But the functional mind-element is a cause as a similar- ness in the sense of being consciousness, since it is similar to eye-consciousness as the result of that.🔽And formations are a cause as a similarity in the sense of the mental-data aggregate, since they are similar to consciousness as the result of that.

original: paccayā hontā sabhāvo hetu honti. Viññāṇaṃ nāmarūpena ekasantativasena samānattā
analyzed: paccayāḥ hontā sabhāvaḥ hetu honti viññāṇam nāma rūpena eka santati vasena samānattā
translated: And consciousness is a cause as a similarity in the sense of the continuity of mentality-materiality, since it is similar to mentality-materiality as the result of that.

original: nāmarūpassa paccayo hontaṃ sabhāvo hetu hoti. Iminā nayena “nāmarūpaṃ saḷāyatanassā”tiādīsupi🔽attho veditabbo. Evaṃ vuttappakāro hetu, paccayo janako, upatthambhako ca yo koci
analyzed: nāma rūpassa paccayaḥ hontam sabhāvaḥ hetu hoti iminā nayena nāma rūpam saḷāyatanassa ati ādīsu pi  atthaḥ veditabbaḥ evam vutta ppakāraḥ hetu paccayaḥ janakaḥ upatthambhakaḥ ca yaḥ koci
translated: The meaning should be understood in this way in the other instances beginning with “Mentality-materiality is a condition for the sixfold base” .🔽So any cause that is a condition in the way already stated, whether it generates or it merely supports,

original: upanissayo balavapaccayo hoti, sabbo so hetupaccayo janakaupatthambhako janitabbupatthambhiyassa🔽phalassa parikkharaṇato abhisaṅkharaṇato nippariyāyato parikkhāro nāma.
analyzed: upanissayaḥ balava paccayaḥ hoti sabbaḥ saḥ hetu paccayaḥ janaka opatthambhakaḥ janitabba upatthambhiyassa  phalassa parikkharaṇataḥ abhisaṅkharaṇataḥ nippariyāyataḥ parikkhāraḥ nāma
translated: is a cause condition. And any condition that is a support, whether it generates or it merely supports,🔽is a support condition. The former is called a “requisite condition” because it is necessary for the arising of the result that is generated or supported.

original: “Vuttappakāro hetupaccayo parikkhāro nāmāti kena amhehi saddahitabbo”ti vattabbattā
analyzed: vutta ppakāraḥ hetu paccayaḥ parikkhāraḥ nāma ati kena amhehi saddahitabbaḥ iti vattabbattā
translated: Since it is necessary for the arising of the result that is generated or supported, it is called a “requisite condition” .

original: “tenāhā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tena kāraṇabhūtena sabbassa hetupaccayassa parikkhārabhāvena
analyzed: tena āha atiādi vuttam tena kāraṇa bhūtena sabbassa hetu paccayassa parikkhāra bhāvena
translated: “Therefore” and so on is said. By that reason, which is the condition for all conditions, the characteristic of the container

original: āyasmā mahākaccāno “ye dhammā yaṃ dhammaṃ janayantī”ti yaṃ vacanaṃ āha, tena vacanena🔽saddahitabbo, “ye dhammā yaṃ dhammaṃ janayantī”ti vacanaṃ nissāya tumhehi sallakkhetabboti adhippāyo.
analyzed: āyasman mahākaccāno ye dhammāḥ yam dhammam janayanti iti yam vacanam āha tena vacanena  saddahitabbaḥ ye dhammāḥ yam dhammam janayanti iti vacanam nissāya tumhehi sallakkhetabbaḥ ti adhippāyaḥ
translated: The venerable Mahākaccāna said the statement “Those things that give rise to a certain thing,” by that statement🔽it should be believed. Relying on the statement “Those things that give rise to a certain thing,” it should be discerned by you. This is the intention.

original: “Ettakova parikkhāro hāro yuñjitabbo”ti vattabbattā “niyutto parikkhāro hāro”ti vuttaṃ, yo yo parikkhāro hāro yuñjitabbo, so so parikkhāro hāro nīharitvā yutto yuñjitabboti.
analyzed: ettakaḥ iva parikkhāraḥ hāraḥ yuñjitabbo ti vattabbattā niyuttaḥ parikkhāraḥ hāro ti vuttam yaḥ yaḥ parikkhāraḥ hāro yuñjitabbo saḥ saḥ parikkhāraḥ hāro nīharitvā yuttaḥ yuñjitabbo iti
translated: In order to say “Only this much of the container mode should be applied,” it is said “The container mode is applied,” the container mode that should be applied, that container mode should be brought out and applied.

original: Iti parikkhārahāravibhaṅge sattibalānurūpā racitā
analyzed: iti parikkhāra hāra vibhaṅge satti bala anurūpā racitā
translated: Thus, in the analysis of the container mode, it is composed according to the strength of the saw.

original: Vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The analysis is finished.

original: Paṇḍitehi pana aṭṭhakathāṭīkānusārena gambhīrattho vitthārato vibhajitvā gahetabboti.
analyzed: paṇḍitehi pana aṭṭhakathā ṭīkā anusārena gambhīra atthaḥ vitthārataḥ vibhajitvā gahetabbaḥ ti
translated: But by the wise, according to the commentary on the subcommentary, the deep meaning should be taken in detail, having analyzed it.

original: 16. Samāropanahāravibhaṅgavibhāvanā
analyzed: samāropana hāra vibhaṅga vibhāvanā
translated: The analysis of the superimposition mode

original: 50. Yena yena saṃvaṇṇanāvisesabhūtena parikkhārahāravibhaṅgena suttatthānaṃ hetupaccayo
analyzed: yena yena saṃvaṇṇanā visesa bhūtena parikkhāra hāra vibhaṅgena sutta tthānam hetu paccayaḥ
translated: By what kind of special exposition, by what kind of analysis of the requisites of nutriment, is the source of the Thread demonstrated?🔽…

original: vibhatto, so…pe… vibhaṅgo paripuṇṇo, “katamo samāropanahāravibhaṅgo”ti pucchitabbattā
analyzed: vibhattaḥ sope vibhaṅgo paripuṇṇo katamo samāropana hāra vibhaṅgo ti pucchitabbattā
translated: The analysis is complete. “What is the analysis of the mode of Conveying a Re-Arraying? “

original: “tattha katamo samāropano hāro”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha tesu niddiṭṭhesu soḷasasu desanāhārādīsu
analyzed: tattha katamaḥ samāropanaḥ hāra iti ādi vuttam tattha tesu niddiṭṭhesu soḷasasu desanā hāra ādīsu
translated: “Herein, what is the mode of Conveying a Re-Arraying? “

original: katamo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso samāropano hāro samāropanahāravibhaṅgo nāmāti pucchati. “Ye🔽dhammā yaṃmūlā”tiādiniddesassa idāni mayā vuccamāno “ekasmiṃ padaṭṭhāne yattakāni
analyzed: katamaḥ saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ samāropanaḥ hāro samāropana hāra vibhaṅgaḥ nāma ati pucchati ye  dhammā idāni mayā vuccamānaḥ ekasmin padaṭṭhāne yattakāni
translated: “Herein, what is the special exposition, the mode of Conveying a Re-Arraying, called the analysis of the mode of Conveying a Re-Arraying? “

original: padaṭṭhānāni otarantī”tiādiko vitthārasaṃvaṇṇanāviseso samāropanahāravibhaṅgo nāma.🔽“Kittake padaṭṭhāne sutte vutte kittakāni padaṭṭhānāni samāropayitabbānī”ti pucchitabbattā
analyzed: padaṭṭhānāni otaranti iti ādikaḥ vitthāra saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ samāropanahāravibhaṅgaḥ nāma  kittake padaṭṭhāne sutte vutte kittakāni padaṭṭhānāni samāropayitabbāni iti pucchitabbattā
translated: “The special exposition that I am now giving, namely, ‘ In whatever instances the ideas that have a root have a root in this or that instance ‘ , and so on, is called the analysis of the mode of Conveying a Re-Arraying.🔽“ When a Thread is stated in so many instances, how many instances should be re-arranged? “

original: “ekasmiṃ padaṭṭhāne”tiādi vuttaṃ. Ekasmiṃ padaṭṭhāne sutte vutte sati avuttāni yattakāni
analyzed: ekasmin padaṭṭhāna itiādi vuttam ekasmin padaṭṭhāne sutte vutte sati avuttāni yattakāni
translated: “ In one instance “ and so on is said. When a Thread is stated in one instance, how many instances, not stated, should be re-arranged?

original: padaṭṭhānāni otaranti samosaranti, sabbāni tāni avuttāni padaṭṭhānāni sutte vuttāni
analyzed: padaṭṭhānāni otaranti samosaranti sabbāni tāni avuttāni padaṭṭhānāni sutte vuttāni
translated: and the grounds for the ideas that are the bases for the ideas that are the grounds for the ideas that are the bases for the ideas that are the grounds for the ideas that are the bases for the ideas that are the grounds for the ideas that are the bases for the ideas that are the bases for the ideas that are the bases for the ideas that are the bases for the ideas that are the bases for the ideas that are the bases for the ideas that are the bases for the ideas that are the bases for the ideas that are the bases for the ideas that are the bases for the ideas that are the bases for the ideas that are the bases for the ideas that are

original: viya niddhāraṇavasena ānetvā desanāya āropayitabbāni. “Kāni viya samāropayitabbānī”ti
analyzed: viya niddhāraṇa vasena ānetvā desanāya āropayitabbāni kāni viya samāropayitabbāni iti
translated: The terms of expression descend and converge. All those terms of expression not mentioned in the sutta should be brought in by way of definition and imposed on the teaching, just as if they were mentioned in the sutta. “How should they be imposed?”

original: vattabbattā “yathā āvaṭṭe”tiādi vuttaṃ. Āvaṭṭe hāre ekasmiṃ padaṭṭhāne sutte vutte
analyzed: vattabba ttā yathā āvaṭṭa iti ādi vuttam āvaṭṭe hāre ekasmin padaṭṭhāne sutte vutte
translated: In order to answer this question, the text says, “As in the case of the strands of hair.” When one strand of hair is mentioned in the sutta,

original: sati sutte avuttāni bahukāni padaṭṭhānāni otaranti, tāni bahukāni padaṭṭhānāni pariyesitabbāni
analyzed: sati sutte avuttāni bahukāni padaṭṭhānāni otaranti tāni bahukāni padaṭṭhānāni pariyesitabbāni
translated: many other strands of hair not mentioned in the sutta descend and converge on it. Those many strands of hair should be sought out.

original: yathā, evaṃ samāropane hārepi bahukāni padaṭṭhānāni desanāya samāropayitabbānīti attho.🔽“Kevalaṃ pana padaṭṭhānavaseneva samāropanā kātabbā kiṃ, udāhu aññavasenāpi samāropanā
analyzed: yathā evam samāropane hāre pi bahukāni padaṭṭhānāni desanāya samāropayitabbāni iti atthaḥ  kevalam pana pada ṭṭhāna vasena iva samāropanā kātabbā kim udāhu añña vasena api samāropanā
translated: The meaning is that in the same way, in the case of the strands of hair of imposition, many terms of expression should be imposed on the teaching.

original: kātabbā ki”nti vattabbattā aññavasenāpi samāropanā kātabbā; tasmā samāropanā catubbidhā
analyzed: kātabbā kinti vattabba ttā añña vasena api samāropanā kātabbā tasmā samāropanā catubbidhā
translated: “But should imposition be done only by way of terms of expression, or should imposition be done by other ways as well?” In order to answer this question, the text says, “Imposition is to be done by other ways as well.” Therefore, in order to show that imposition should be done in four ways,

original: kātabbāti dassento “tattha samāropanā catubbidhā”tiādimāha. Tattha tatthāti tāsu
analyzed: kātabbā ti dassentaḥ tattha samāropanā catubbidhā ti ādim āha tattha tattha ati tāsu
translated: the text says, “Therein, imposition is fourfold.” Therein means in those ways.

original: samāropayitabbasamāropanāsu padaṭṭhānaṃ padaṭṭhānasamāropanā, vevacanaṃ vevacanasamāropanā,
analyzed: samāropayitabba samāropanāsu padaṭṭhānam padaṭṭhāna samāropanā vevacanam vevacana samāropanā
translated: The footing-as-boon-to-be-ascertained is the footing-as-ascertainment. The synonym-as-boon-to-be-ascertained is the synonym-as-ascertainment.

original: bhāvanā bhāvanāsamāropanā, pahānaṃ pahānasamāropanā, iti iminā pabhedena samāropanā catubbidhā kātabbā.
analyzed: bhāvanā bhāvanā samāropanā pahānam pahāna samāropanā iti iminā pabhedena samāropanā catubbidhā kātabbā
translated: The development-as-boon-to-be-ascertained is the development-as-ascertainment. The abandoning-as-boon-to-be-ascertained is the abandoning-as-ascertainment. So this ascertainment is fourfold by this analysis.

original: “Tāsu catubbidhāsu samāropanāsu katamā padaṭṭhānasamāropanā”ti pucchitabbattā tathā🔽pucchitvā padaṭṭhānasamāropanaṃ dassetuṃ “tattha katamā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Sutte vuttena
analyzed: tāsu catubbidhāsu samāropanāsu katamā padaṭṭhāna samāropanā ati pucchitabba ttā tathā  pucchitvā padaṭṭhāna samāropanam dassetum tattha katamā tiādi vuttam sutte vuttena
translated: As to these four kinds of ascertainment, which is the footing-as-ascertainment? Because of the need to ask this,

original: padaṭṭhānena sutte avuttānaṃ padaṭṭhānānaṃ samāropanā katamāti pucchati.
analyzed: padaṭṭhānena sutte a vuttānam padaṭṭhānānam samāropanā katamā iti pucchati
translated: and after asking it, in order to show the footing-as-ascertainment, this is said: “Herein, which is the footing-as-ascertainment? ” He asks: “Which is the footing-as-ascertainment of the footings not stated in the Thread by means of the footing stated in the Thread? ”

original: Sabbapāpassa akusalassa yaṃ akaraṇaṃ akaraṇahetu sāsanaṃ atthi, etaṃ sāsanaṃ buddhānaṃ🔽sāsanaṃ ovādo hoti, atha vā akaraṇaṃ akaraṇatthāya yaṃ sāsanaṃ atthi, etaṃ buddhānaṃ
analyzed: sabba pāpassa akusalassa yam a karaṇam a karaṇa hetu sāsanam atthi etam sāsanam buddhānam  sāsanam ovādaḥ hoti atha vā akaraṇam akaraṇa atthāya yam sāsanam atthi etam buddhānam
translated: The non-doing of any evil, unprofit, is a teaching of the Buddhas,🔽and that teaching of the Buddhas is an admonition. Or alternatively, the non-doing is a teaching of the Buddhas for the sake of non-doing, and that teaching of the Buddhas is an admonition, not anyone else’s teaching. The meaning is:

original: sāsanaṃ ovādo hoti, na yassa kassaci sāsananti attho. Akaraṇanti hi sampadānatthe
analyzed: sāsanam ovādaḥ hoti na yassa kassaci sāsananti atthaḥ a karaṇam ti hi sampadāna atthe
translated: “Non-doing” is in the sense of “accomplishment” .

original: pavattaṃ paccattavacanaṃ yathā “kissa atthāya kimattha”nti. Kusalassa sampadā sampadāya
analyzed: pavattam paccatta vacanam yathā kissa atthāya kimatthanti kusalassa sampadā sampadāya
translated: The word sampadā is used in the sense of “accomplishment of the wholesome” as in “kusalassa sampadā” .🔽The word sāsana is used in the sense of “the teaching of the Buddhas” as in “etaṃ buddhānaṃ sāsanaṃ” .

original: yaṃ sāsanaṃ atthi, etaṃ buddhānaṃ sāsanaṃ. Sacittapariyodāpanaṃ sacittapariyodāpanatthaṃ
analyzed: yam sāsanam atthi etam buddhānam sāsanam sa citta pariyodāpanam sa citta pariyodāpana attham
translated: The word sacittapariyodāpana is used in the sense of “purification of one’s own mind” as in “sacittapariyodāpanatthaṃ” .

original: yaṃ sāsanaṃ atthi, etaṃ buddhānaṃ sāsanaṃ hoti.
analyzed: yam sāsanam atthi etam buddhānam sāsanam hoti
translated: The word sāsana is used in the sense of “the teaching of the Buddhas” as in “etaṃ buddhānaṃ sāsanaṃ” .

original: Iti evaṃpakārena vuttassa tassa sāsanassa kiṃ padaṭṭhānanti visesassa visesapadaṭṭhānaṃ🔽puna pucchati. Idaṃ sucaritattayaṃ sāsanassa ovādassa padaṭṭhānaṃ sucaritattayena
analyzed: iti evaṃpakārena vuttassa tassa sāsanassa kim padaṭṭhānam ti visesassa visesa padaṭṭhānam  puna pucchati idam su caritattayam sāsanassa ovādassa padaṭṭhānam su caritattayena
translated: Thus, what is the basis of that teaching which is spoken of in this way? The word visesapadaṭṭhāna is used in the sense of “the special basis”🔽of the teaching. The word ovāda is used in the sense of “instruction” as in “ovādo buddhāna” .🔽The word padaṭṭhāna is used in the sense of “basis” as in “padaṭṭhānaṃ sucaritattaya” .🔽The word sucaritattaya is used in the sense of “the three kinds of good conduct” as in “sucaritattaya” .🔽The word hetunā is used in the sense of “by means of” as in “sucaritattayahetunā” .🔽The word sāsanattā is used in the sense of “because of the teaching” as in “sāsanattā” .

original: hetunā sāsanattāti daṭṭhabbaṃ yathā “annena vasatī”tiādi. “Sucaritattaye padaṭṭhāne
analyzed: hetunā sā āsana ttā ati daṭṭhabbam yathā annena vasati itiādi su carita ttaye padaṭṭhāne
translated: The word padaṭṭhāna is used in the sense of “basis” as in “padaṭṭhānaṃ sucaritattaya” .🔽The word vutte is used in the sense of “when it is said” as in “vutte katamaṃ padaṭṭhānaṃ samāropayitabba” .

original: vutte katamaṃ padaṭṭhānaṃ samāropayitabba”nti pucchitabbattā “tattha yaṃ kāyikañcā”tiādi
analyzed: vutte katamam padaṭṭhānam samāropayitabbanti pucchitabba ttā tattha yam
translated: The word samāropayitabba is used in the sense of “what should be applied” as in “samāropayitabba” .🔽The word khandhattaya is used in the sense of “the three aggregates” as in “khandhattaya” .

original: vuttaṃ. Idaṃ khandhattayaṃ sāsanassa padaṭṭhānaṃ samāropayitabbaṃ, “khandhattaye
analyzed: vuttam idam khandha ttayam sāsanassa padaṭṭhānam samāropayitabbam khandha ttaye
translated: The word padaṭṭhāna is used in the sense of “basis”

original: padaṭṭhāne samāropayite katamaṃ samāropayitabba”nti pucchitabbattā “tattha sīlakkhandho
analyzed: padaṭṭhāne samāropayite katamam samāropayitabbanti pucchitabba ttā tattha sīla kkhandho
translated: The answer is: “Herein, the aggregate of concentration is the trunk of the tree,🔽The answer is: “Herein, the aggregate of understanding is the branches and foliage of the tree,🔽The answer is: “Herein, the aggregate of deliverance is the flowers of the tree,🔽The answer is: “Herein, the aggregate of knowledge and vision of deliverance is the fruits of the tree,🔽The answer is: “Herein, the fruit of Stream-Entry is the first fruit of the tree,🔽The answer is: “Herein, the fruit of Arahantship is the supreme fruit of the tree,

original: cā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Idaṃ samathavipassanādvayaṃ sāsanassa padaṭṭhānaṃ samāropayitabbaṃ.🔽“Samathavipassanādvaye padaṭṭhāne samāropayite katamaṃ padaṭṭhānaṃ samāropayitabba”nti
analyzed: ca atiādi vuttam idam samatha vipassanā dvayam sāsanassa padaṭṭhānam samāropayitabbam  samatha vipassanā dvaye padaṭṭhāne samāropayite katamam padaṭṭhānam samāropayitabbanti
translated: The answer is: “Herein, the fruit of Once-Return is the second fruit of the tree,🔽The answer is: “Herein, the fruit of Non-Return is the third fruit of the tree,🔽The answer is: “Herein, the fruit of Hermit-Enlightenment is the fourth fruit of the tree,🔽The answer is: “Herein, the fruit of Buddhahood is the supreme fruit of the tree,🔽The answer is: “Herein, the fruit of the Hermit Enlightened One is the supreme fruit of the tree,

original: pucchitabbattā “tattha samathassa phala”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Idaṃ phaladvayaṃ sāsanassa🔽padaṭṭhānaṃ samāropayitabbaṃ.🔽Sāsanassa padaṭṭhānāni samāropayitabbānīti ācariyena niddhāretvā vibhattāni, amhehi🔽ca ñātāni, “idāni katamassa katamaṃ padaṭṭhānaṃ samāropayitabba”nti pucchitabbattā
analyzed: pucchitabba ttā tattha samathassa phala ntiādi vuttam idam phala dvayam sāsanassa  padaṭṭhānam samāropayitabbam  sāsanassa padaṭṭhānāni samāropayitabbāni iti ācariyena niddhāretvā vibhattāni amhehi  ca ñātāni idāni katamassa katamam padaṭṭhānam samāropayitabbanti pucchitabba ttā
translated: The answer is: “Herein, the fruit of the Pacceka Buddha is the supreme fruit of the tree,🔽The answer is: “Herein, the fruit of the Buddha is the supreme fruit of the tree,🔽The answer is: “Herein, the fruit of the Hermit Enlightened One is the supreme fruit of the tree,🔽The answer is: “Herein, the fruit of the Pacceka Buddha is the supreme fruit of the tree,🔽The answer is: “Herein, the fruit of the Buddha is the supreme fruit of the tree,🔽The answer is: “Herein, the fruit of the Hermit Enlightened One is the supreme fruit of the tree,

original: “vanaṃ vanathassā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Idaṃ kāmaguṇapañcakaṃ vanaṃ taṇhābhūtassa vanathassa
analyzed: vanam vanathassa atiādi vuttam idam kāma guṇa pañcakam vanam taṇhā bhūtassa vanathassa
translated: The answer is: “Herein, the fruit of the Pacceka Buddha is the supreme fruit of the tree,🔽The answer is: “Herein, the fruit of the Buddha is the supreme fruit of the tree,🔽The answer is: “Herein, the fruit of the Hermit Enlightened One is the supreme fruit of the tree,🔽The answer is: “Herein, the fruit

original: padaṭṭhānaṃ taṇhāvatthubhāvato, “itthī”ti vā “puriso”ti vā nimittaggāhasaṅkhātaṃ
analyzed: padaṭṭhānam taṇhā vatthu bhāvataḥ itthī iti vā puriso ti vā nimitta ggāha saṅkhātam
translated: It is the footing for craving because it is the basis for craving.🔽This forest called “woman” or “man” is the footing for the forest fire called the sign of sex.

original: idaṃ vanaṃ “aho cakkhu, aho sotaṃ, aho ghānaṃ, aho jivhā, aho kāyo”ti tesaṃ tesaṃ🔽aṅgapaccaṅgānaṃ anubyañjanaggāhasaṅkhātassa vanathassa padaṭṭhānaṃ samāropayitabbaṃ.
analyzed: idam vanam aho cakkhu aho sotam aho ghānam aho jivhā aho kāyo ti tesam tesam  aṅga paccaṅgānam anubyañjana ggāha saṅkhātassa vanathassa padaṭṭhānam samāropayitabbam
translated: This forest called “eye,” etc., is the footing for the forest fire called the various parts of the body and the various minor signs.

original: Apariññātaṃ dvādasāyatanasaṅkhātaṃ idaṃ vanaṃ saṃyojanasaṅkhātassa vanathassa padaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: apariññātam dvādasa āyatana saṅkhātam idam vanam saṃyojana saṅkhātassa vanathassa padaṭṭhānam
translated: This forest called the twelve bases, which is not fully understood, is the footing for the forest fire called the fetters.

original: samāropayitabbaṃ, āyatanaṃ paṭicca saṃyojanuppajjanato anusayasaṅkhātaṃ idaṃ vanaṃ🔽pariyuṭṭhānasaṅkhātassa vanathassa padaṭṭhānaṃ samāropayitabbaṃ. “Pañcakāmaguṇādīnaṃ🔽vanabhāvo ca taṇhādīnaṃ vanathabhāvo ca kena amhehi saddahitabbo”ti vattabbattā “tenāha
analyzed: samāropayitabbam āyatanam paṭicca saṃyojana uppajjanataḥ anusaya saṅkhātam idam vanam  pariyuṭṭhāna saṅkhātassa vanathassa padaṭṭhānam samāropayitabbam pañca kāmaguṇa ādīnam  vana bhāvaḥ ca taṇhā ādīnam vanatha bhāvaḥ ca kena amhehi saddahitabbaḥ iti vattabbattā tena āha
translated: The forest called the six bases is the footing for the forest fire called the arising of the fetters, and the forest called the underlying tendency is the footing for the forest fire called the obsession.🔽“By whom should we believe that the five cords of sense desire, etc., are a forest and craving, etc., are a forest fire?”—in order to answer this he said “Therefore the Blessed One said” .

original: bhagavā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tena pañcakāmaguṇādīnaṃ vanabhāvena ca taṇhādīnaṃ vanathabhāvena
analyzed: bhagavā iti ādi vuttam tena pañca kāmaguṇa ādīnam vana bhāvena ca taṇhā ādīnam
translated: By the fact that the five cords of sense desire, etc., are a forest and by the fact that craving, etc., are a forest fire,

original: ca bhagavā “chetvā vanañca vanathañcā”ti yaṃ vacanaṃ āha, tena bhagavato vacanena
analyzed: ca bhagavān śetvā vanam ca vanatham ca ati yam vacanam āha tena bhagavataḥ vacanena
