analyzed: arakkhitena cittena ati ādi sutta atthaḥ veneyyānam arahatta phala vimutti mukhena ācariyena  vicayitaḥ vibhattaḥ amhehi ca ñātaḥ desakassa dasa bala samannāgatassa dasa balāni  katham vicayitabbāni iti pucchitabba ttā tattha yaḥ desayati so dasa bala samannāgataḥ tiādi  vuttam aṭṭhakathāyam pana
translated: The meaning of the sutta beginning with “With an unguarded mind” is analysed and shown by the teacher in the way beginning with the deliverance of the fruit of arahantship for the sake of those who are teachable.🔽We know it.

original: “Iti mahāthero ‘tasmā rakkhitacittassā’ti gāthāya vasena arahattaphalavimuttimukhena
analyzed: iti mahā thero tasmā rakkhita cittassa ati gāthāya vasena arahatta phala vimutti mukhena
translated: “How should the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the one who possesses the ten powers of the

original: vicayahārasampātaṃ niddisanto, desanākusalatāya anekehi suttappadesehi tassā pubbabhāgapaṭipadāya🔽bhāvanāvisesānaṃ bhāvanānisaṃsānañca vibhajanavasena nānappakārato vicayahāraṃ dassetvā,
analyzed: vicaya hāra sampātam niddisantaḥ desanā kusala tāya anekehi sutta ppadesehi tassā pubbabhāga paṭipadāya  bhāvanā visesānam bhāvanā nisaṃsānam ca vibhajana vasena nānā pakārataḥ vicaya hāram dassetvā
translated: Having shown the analysis of the meaning of the word “development” in this way by means of many passages in the suttas,🔽he now said “Therein, he who teaches” in order to show it by means of the ten powers of a Perfect One.

original: idāni dasannaṃ tathāgatabalānampi vasena taṃ dassetuṃ ‘tattha yo desayatī’tiādimāhā”ti –🔽Vuttaṃ. Tattha tatthāti tesu samathavipassanaṃ bhāvayantesu sāsitabbasāsakesu. Dasabalasamannāgato
analyzed: idāni dasannam tathāgata balānam pi vasena tam dassetum tattha yaḥ desayati itiādim āha ati  vuttam tattha tattha ati tesu samatha vipassanam bhāvayantesu sāsitabba sāsakesu dasa bala samannāgato
translated: This is the commentary “therein.”

original: yo desako satthā “arakkhitena cittenā”tiādidhammaṃ deseti, ovādena sāvake na visaṃvādayati,
analyzed: yaḥ desakaḥ satthā arakkhitena cittena ati ādi dhammam deseti ovādena sāvake na visaṃvādayati
translated: Therein, he who teaches: the teacher who possesses the ten powers teaches the Dhamma beginning with “With a mind unguarded” and so on, and he does not deceive his pupils by his advice.

original: tassa desakassa satthuno dasa balāni vicayitabbānīti yojanā.
analyzed: tassa desakassa satthunaḥ dasa balāni vicayitabbāni iti yojanā
translated: The ten powers of that teacher who teaches should be analyzed.🔽How does he teach?🔽The answer is: “He teaches in three ways.”

original: “Kinti desetī”ti pucchitabbattā “so tividha”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Tesu dasasu tathāgatabalesu
analyzed: kinti deseti iti pucchitabba ttā saḥ tividha ntiādi vuttam tesu dasasu tathāgata balesu
translated: Of the ten powers of a Perfect One,🔽the knowledge of what is possible and what is impossible is called the first power of a Perfect One.

original: ṭhānāṭṭhānañāṇaṃ paṭhamaṃ tathāgatabalaṃ nāma, “taṃ balaṃ kathaṃ vicayitabba”nti
analyzed: ṭhānāṭṭhāna ñāṇam paṭhamam tathāgata balam nāma tat balam katham vicayitabbanti
translated: “How should that power be analyzed?”

original: pucchitabbattā “so tathā ovadito”tiādi vuttaṃ. Attho aṭṭhakathāyaṃ vutto, pāḷivasenapi🔽pākaṭo. “Etaṃ ṭhānaṃ na vijjatī”ti jānanaṃ aṭṭhānañāṇaṃ nāma, “etaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjatī”ti
analyzed: pucchitabba ttā so tathā ovadito tiādi vuttam atthaḥ aṭṭhakathāyam vutto pāḷi vasena api  pākaṭaḥ etam ṭhānam na vijjati iti jānanam aṭṭhānañāṇam nāma etam ṭhānam vijjati iti
translated: “He was thus advised” is said because he was to be asked. The meaning is stated in the commentary. It is also clear from the text itself.🔽The knowledge that “This is impossible” is called the knowledge of the impossible. The knowledge that “This is possible” is called the knowledge of the possible.

original: jānanaṃ ṭhānañāṇaṃ nāmāti ṭhānāṭṭhānānaṃ jānanañāṇaṃ paṭhamaṃ tathāgatabalaṃ vicayitabbanti
analyzed: jānanam ṭhāna ñāṇam nāma ati ṭhāna aṭṭhānānam jānana ñāṇam paṭhamam tathāgata balam
translated: “He was thus advised” is said because he should be asked. The meaning is stated in the Commentary. It is also clear from the text itself. The knowledge of what is possible and impossible is called the knowledge of what is possible and impossible. The knowledge of what is possible is called the knowledge of what is possible. The knowledge of what is possible and impossible should be investigated as the first power of the Tathāgata.

original: adhippāyo veditabbo. (1)
analyzed: adhippāyaḥ veditabbaḥ
translated: This is the intention.

original: 57. Ṭhānāṭṭhānañāṇaṃ paṭhamaṃ tathāgatabalaṃ ācariyena vicayitaṃ vibhattaṃ amhehi
analyzed: ṭhāna aṭṭhāna ñāṇam paṭhamam tathāgata balam ācariyena vicayitam vibhattam amhehi
translated: The knowledge of what is possible and impossible, the first power of the Tathāgata, has been investigated and explained by the teacher and understood by us.

original: ca ñātaṃ, “kathaṃ sabbatthagāminipaṭipadāñāṇaṃ dutiyatathāgatabalaṃ vicayitabba”nti🔽pucchitabbattā “iti ṭhānāṭṭhānatā”ti vuttaṃ. “Ayaṃ paṭipadā imasmiṃ bhave gāminī,
analyzed: ca ñātam katham sabbattha gāmini paṭipadā ñāṇam dutiya tathāgata balam  pucchitabba ttā iti ṭhāna aṭṭhāna tā ti vuttam ayam paṭipadā imasmin bhave gāminī
translated: “How should the knowledge of the way leading everywhere, the second power of the Tathāgata, be investigated?”

original: ayaṃ paṭipadā imasmiṃ bhave gāminī”ti sabbattha gāminiyā paṭipadāya jānanañāṇaṃ sabbatthagāminipaṭipadāñāṇaṃ
analyzed: ayam paṭipadā imasmin bhave gāminī iti sabbattha gāminiyā paṭipadāya jānana ñāṇam sabbattha gāmini paṭipadā ñāṇam
translated: Because he should be asked, “Thus the possible and the impossible” is said. “This way leads to this state of existence, this way leads to this state of existence,” the knowledge of the way leading everywhere is the knowledge of the way leading everywhere.

original: nāmāti sabbatthagāminipaṭipadāñāṇaṃ dutiyaṃ tathāgatabalaṃ vicayitabbanti adhippāyo. (2)
analyzed: nāma ati sabbattha gāmini paṭipadā ñāṇam dutiyam tathāgata balam vicayitabbanti adhippāyaḥ
translated: The intention is that the second Power of the Cognized, namely, the knowledge of the way leading to the cessation of the various ideas, should be investigated.

original: 59. Sabbatthagāminipaṭipadāñāṇaṃ dutiyaṃ tathāgatabalaṃ ācariyena vicayitaṃ, amhehi
analyzed: sabbattha gāmini paṭipadā ñāṇam dutiyam tathāgata balam ācariyena amhehi
translated: The second Power of the Cognized, namely, the knowledge of the way leading to the cessation of the various ideas, has been investigated by the teacher and by us

original: ca ñātaṃ, “kathaṃ anekadhātunānādhātuñāṇaṃ tatiyaṃ tathāgatabalaṃ vicayitabba”nti🔽pucchitabbattā “iti sabbatthagāminī paṭipadā”tiādi vuttaṃ. “Ayaṃ dhātu ca ayaṃ dhātu
analyzed: ca ñātam katham aneka dhātu nānā dhātu ñāṇam tatiyam tathāgata balam  pucchitabba ttā iti sabbattha gāminī paṭipadā ati ādi vuttam ayam dhātu ca ayam dhātu
translated: and is known. ‘ How should the third Power of the Cognized, namely, the knowledge of the various elements, be investigated? ’

original: ca anekadhātu nāma, ayaṃ dhātu ca ayaṃ dhātu ca nānādhātu nāmā”ti anekadhātunānādhātūnaṃ
analyzed: ca aneka dhātu nāma ayam dhātu ca ayam dhātu ca nānā dhātu nāma ati
translated: Since this is so, ‘ the way leading to the cessation of the various ideas ’ and so on is said. The meaning is that the knowledge of the various elements and the knowledge of the several elements is the knowledge of the various elements and the knowledge of the several elements.

original: jānanañāṇaṃ anekadhātunānādhātuñāṇaṃ nāmāti anekadhātunānādhātuñāṇaṃ tatiyaṃ tathāgatabalaṃ vicayitabbanti. (3)
analyzed: jānana ñāṇam aneka dhātu nānā dhātu ñāṇam nāma ati aneka dhātu nānā dhātu ñāṇam tatiyam tathāgata balam
translated: The intention is that the third Power of the Cognized, namely, the knowledge of the various elements and the knowledge of the several elements, should be investigated.

original: 60. Anekadhātunānādhātuñāṇaṃ tatiyaṃ tathāgatabalaṃ ācariyena vicayitaṃ vibhattaṃ,
analyzed: aneka dhātu nānā dhātu ñāṇam tatiyam tathāgata balam ācariyena vicayitam vibhattam
translated: The third Power of the Cognized, namely, the knowledge of the various elements and the knowledge of the several elements, has been investigated and analysed by the teacher and by us

original: amhehi ca ñātaṃ, “kathaṃ sattānaṃ nānādhimuttikatāñāṇaṃ catutthaṃ tathāgatabalaṃ
analyzed: amhehi ca ñātam katham sattānam nānā adhimuttika tā ñāṇam catuttham tathāgata balam
translated: and is known. ‘ How should the fourth Power of the Cognized, namely, the knowledge of beings’ manifold inclinations, be investigated? ’

original: vicayitabba”nti pucchitabbattā “iti anekadhātunānādhātukassa lokassā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vicayitabbanti pucchitabba ttā iti aneka dhātu nānā dhātukassa lokassa atiādi vuttam
translated: “It should be investigated” is said because it should be asked about.🔽The knowledge of knowing the various ways of resolving of beings is

original: “Ime sattā evaṃ adhimuttā, ime sattā evaṃ adhimuttā”ti sattānaṃ adhimuccanānaṃ jānanañāṇaṃ
analyzed: ime sattāḥ evam adhimuttāḥ ime sattāḥ evam adhimuttā ati sattānam adhimuccanānam jānana ñāṇam
translated: the knowledge of the various ways of resolving of beings.

original: sattānaṃ nānādhimuttikatāñāṇaṃ nāmāti sattānaṃ nānādhimuttikatāñāṇaṃ catutthaṃ tathāgatabalaṃ vicayitabbanti. (4)
analyzed: sattānam nānā adhimuttika tā ñāṇam nāma ati sattānam nānā adhimuttika tā ñāṇam catuttham tathāgata balam
translated: The knowledge of the various ways of resolving of beings, the fourth power of a Buddha, should be investigated.

original: Sattānaṃ nānādhimuttikatāñāṇaṃ catutthaṃ tathāgatabalaṃ ācariyena vibhattaṃ, amhehi
analyzed: sattānam nānā adhimuttika tā ñāṇam catuttham tathāgata balam ācariyena vibhattam amhehi
translated: The knowledge of the various ways of resolving of beings, the fourth power of a Buddha, has been explained by the teacher and🔽has been understood by us.

original: ca ñātaṃ, “kathaṃ vipākavemattatāñāṇaṃ pañcamaṃ tathāgatabalaṃ vicayitabba”nti pucchitabbattā
analyzed: ca ñātam katham vipāka vematta tā ñāṇam pañcamam tathāgata balam pucchitabba ttā
translated: “How should the knowledge of the various results of kamma, the fifth power of a Buddha, be investigated?” is asked because it should be asked about.

original: “iti te yathādhimuttā cā”tiādi vuttaṃ. “Evaṃ adhimuttānaṃ sattānaṃ idaṃ kammaṃ kaṇhaṃ,
analyzed: iti te yathā adhimuttā ca atiādi vuttam evam adhimuttānam sattānam idam kammam kaṇham
translated: “Thus, in accordance with their way of resolving” is said. “For beings who resolve in this way, this kamma is dark,

original: imassa kaṇhakammassa ayaṃ vipāko. Idaṃ kammaṃ sukkaṃ, imassa sukkakammassa ayaṃ vipāko”ti
analyzed: imassa kaṇha kammassa ayam vipākaḥ idam kammam sukkam imassa sukka kammassa ayam vipākaḥ ti
translated: for this dark kamma this is the result. This kamma is bright, for this bright kamma this is the result.”

original: evamādīhi vipākānaṃ nānattajānanañāṇaṃ vipākavemattatāñāṇaṃ nāmāti vipākavemattatāñāṇaṃ
analyzed: evamādīhi vipākānam nānatta jānana ñāṇam vipāka vematta tā ñāṇam nāma ati vipāka vematta tā ñāṇam
translated: Knowledge of the diversity of results such as these is called “knowledge of the diversity of results.”

original: pañcamaṃ tathāgatabalaṃ vicayitabbanti.
analyzed: pañcamam tathāgata balam
translated: So this is how the fifth power of the Tathāgata should be examined.

original: 62. Vipākavemattatāñāṇaṃ pañcamaṃ tathāgatabalaṃ ācariyena vicayitaṃ, amhehi ca ñātaṃ,
analyzed: vipāka vematta tā ñāṇam pañcamam tathāgata balam ācariyena vicayitam amhehi ca ñātam
translated: The fifth power of the Tathāgata, namely, knowledge of the diversity of results, has been examined by the teacher and understood by us.

original: “kathaṃ jhānānaṃ saṃkilesavodānavuṭṭhānañāṇaṃ chaṭṭhaṃ tathāgatabalaṃ vicayitabba”nti
analyzed: katham jhānānam saṃkilesa vodāna vuṭṭhāna ñāṇam chaṭṭham tathāgata balam
translated: “How should knowledge of the defilement, cleansing, and emergence of jhānas be examined as the sixth power of the Tathāgata?”

original: pucchitabbattā “iti tathā samādinnāna”ntiādi vuttaṃ. “Evaṃ samādinnānaṃ kammānaṃ
analyzed: pucchitabba ttā iti tathā samādinnāna ntiādi vuttam evam samādinnānam kammānam
translated: The answer is given in the way beginning, “So too, when his bodily actions are well undertaken … his verbal actions are well undertaken.”

original: jhānānaṃ vimokkhānaṃ samādhīnaṃ samāpattīnaṃ ayaṃ saṃkileso, idaṃ vodānaṃ, idaṃ vuṭṭhānaṃ,🔽evaṃ saṃkilissati, evaṃ vodāyati, evaṃ vuṭṭhahatī”ti jhānānaṃ saṃkilesavodānavuṭṭhānānaṃ
analyzed: jhānānam vimokkhānam samādhīnam samāpattīnam ayam saṃkilesaḥ idam vodānam idam vuṭṭhānam  evam saṃkilissati evam vodāyati evam vuṭṭhahati iti jhānānam saṃkilesa vodāna vuṭṭhānānam
translated: “This is the defilement, this is the cleansing, this is the emergence, of the jhānas, liberations, concentrations, and attainments.”🔽Knowledge without obstruction of the defilement, cleansing, and emergence of the jhānas

original: anāvaraṇañāṇaṃ jhānānaṃ saṃkilesavodānavuṭṭhānañāṇaṃ nāmāti jhānānaṃ saṃkilesavodānavuṭṭhānañāṇaṃ
analyzed: anāvaraṇa ñāṇam jhānānam saṃkilesa vodāna vuṭṭhāna ñāṇam nāma ati jhānānam saṃkilesa vodāna vuṭṭhāna ñāṇam
translated: is called “knowledge of the defilement, cleansing, and emergence of jhānas.”

original: chaṭṭhaṃ tathāgatabalaṃ vicayitabbanti. (5)🔽63. Jhānānaṃ saṃkilesañāṇaṃ chaṭṭhaṃ tathāgatabalaṃ ācariyena vicayitaṃ, “kathaṃ
analyzed: chaṭṭham tathāgata balam  jhānānam saṃkilesa ñāṇam chaṭṭham tathāgata balam ācariyena vicayitam katham
translated: The sixth power of the Tathāgata should be investigated.”

original: indriyaparopariyattavemattatāñāṇaṃ sattamaṃ tathāgatabalaṃ vicayitabba”nti pucchitabbattā
analyzed: indriya para upari yatta vematta tā ñāṇam sattamam tathāgata balam pucchitabba ttā
translated: The sixth power of the Tathāgata, the knowledge of the defilement and cleansing of jhānas, has been investigated by the teacher. “How should the seventh power of the Tathāgata, the knowledge of the diversity of the faculties of other beings and other persons, be investigated?”🔽because it should be asked.

original: “iti tasseva samādhissā”tiādi vuttaṃ. “Evaṃ ādhipateyyaṭṭhena indriyāni, evaṃ akampiyaṭṭhena
analyzed: iti tassa iva samādhissa atiādi vuttam evam ādhipateyya ṭṭhena indriyāni evam akampiya ṭṭhena
translated: “Thus, in the sense of predominance, the faculties; in the sense of unshakability, the powers” —

original: balānī”ti jānanena saha “ayaṃ mudindriyo, ayaṃ majjhindriyo, ayaṃ tikkhindriyo”ti
analyzed: balāni iti jānanena saha ayam mud indriyaḥ ayam majjhindriyaḥ ayam tikkhindriyaḥ ti
translated: knowing this, together with “This is a blunt faculty, this is a medium faculty, this is an acute faculty,”

original: parasattānaṃ parapuggalānaṃ indriyabalānaṃ amudumajjhādhimattatājānanañāṇaṃamudumajjhādhimattatājānanañāṇaṃ🔽indriyaparopariyattavemattatāñāṇaṃ nāmāti indriyaparopariyattavemattatāñāṇaṃ sattamaṃ
analyzed: para sattānam para puggalānam indriya balānam a mudu majjha adhimatta tā jānana ñāṇam a mudu majjha adhimatta tā jānana ñāṇam  indriya para upari yatta vematta tā āñāṇam nāma ati indriya para upari yatta vematta tā āñāṇam sattamam
translated: the knowledge of the diversity of the faculties of other beings and other persons, the knowledge of the diversity of the faculties of other beings and other persons

original: tathāgatabalaṃ vicayitabbanti. (6)
analyzed: tathāgata balam
translated: the seventh power of the Tathāgata should be investigated.”

original: 64. Indriyaparopariyattañāṇaṃ sattamaṃ tathāgatabalaṃ ācariyena vicayitaṃ, “kathaṃ
analyzed: sattamam tathāgata balam ācariyena katham
translated: The seventh power of the Tathāgata, the knowledge of the diversity of the faculties of other beings and other persons, has been investigated by the teacher. “How should the eighth power of the Tathāgata, the knowledge of the order of the paths of other beings and other persons, be investigated?”

original: pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇaṃ aṭṭhamaṃ tathāgatabalaṃ vicayitabbaṃ, kathaṃ dibbacakkhuñāṇaṃ
analyzed: pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇam aṭṭhamam tathāgata balam katham dibba cakkhu ñāṇam
translated: The knowledge of the recollection of past lives is the eighth power of a Realised One that should be investigated. How is the knowledge of the divine eye

original: navamaṃ tathāgatabalaṃ vicayitabba”nti pucchitabbattā “iti tattha yaṃ anekavihita”ntiādi
analyzed: navamam tathāgata balam pucchitabba ttā iti tattha yam aneka vihita ntiādi
translated: the ninth power of a Realised One that should be investigated?” Because it should be asked thus, “Therefore, in regard to that, the many kinds” etc.

original: vuttaṃ. “Ekaṃ jāti”ntiādinā jātivasena vā “evaṃnāmo”tiādinā nāmagottavaṇṇāhārasukhadukkhapaṭisaṃvedanāya🔽pariyantavasena vā sākārassa sauddesassa anekavihitapubbenivāsassa taṃtaṃbhavassa
analyzed: vuttam ekam jāti nti ādinā jāti vasena vā evaṃnāmā iti ādinā nāma gotta vaṇṇa āhāra sukha dukkha paṭisaṃvedanāya  pariyanta vasena vā sa ākārassa sa uddesassa aneka vihita pubbenivāsassa taṃ taṃbhavassa
translated: is said. “One birth” etc. is by way of the life-birth. “So named” etc. is by way of name, family, complexion, food, pleasure and pain,

original: asesato jānanañāṇaṃ pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇaṃ nāmāti pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇaṃ aṭṭhamaṃ
analyzed: asesataḥ jānana ñāṇam pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇam nāma ati pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇam aṭṭhamam
translated: and by way of the limit. The knowledge of the recollection of past lives is called the knowledge of the recollection of past lives. The knowledge of the recollection of past lives is the eighth

original: tathāgatabalaṃ vicayitabbanti. (7)🔽Cavamānaupapajjamānahīnapaṇītasuvaṇṇadubbaṇṇasugataduggatayathākammūpagānaṃ sattānaṃ
analyzed: tathāgata balam  cavamāna a upapajjamāna hīna paṇīta suvaṇṇa dubbaṇṇa sugata duggata yathā kammūpagānam sattānam
translated: power of a Realised One that should be investigated.

original: asesato cutūpapātānaṃ jānanañāṇaṃ dibbacakkhuñāṇaṃ nāmāti dibbacakkhuñāṇaṃ navamaṃ
analyzed: asesataḥ cutūpapātānam jānana ñāṇam dibba cakkhu ñāṇam nāma ati dibba cakkhu ñāṇam navamam
translated: The knowledge of the divine eye is called the knowledge of the divine eye. The knowledge of the divine eye is the ninth

original: tathāgatabalaṃ vicayitabbanti. (8-9)
analyzed: tathāgata balam
translated: power of a Realised One that should be investigated.

original: Pubbenivāsādiaṭṭhamanavamaṃ tathāgatabalaṃ ācariyena vicayitaṃ vibhattaṃ, “kathaṃ🔽sabbāsavakkhayañāṇaṃ dasamaṃ tathāgatabalaṃ vicayitabba”nti pucchitabbattā “iti tattha🔽ya”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Bodhimūle saṃkilesamāranihanaṃ ñāṇaṃ uppannaṃ, idaṃ kilesamāranihanaṃ
analyzed: pubbenivāsa ādi aṭṭhama navamam tathāgata balam ācariyena vicayitam vibhattam katham  sabba āsava kkhaya ñāṇam dasamam tathāgata balam iti tattha  yan ti ādi vuttam bodhi mūle saṃkilesa māra nihanam ñāṇam uppannam idam kilesa māra nihanam
translated: The Teacher has investigated and analysed the ninth, the Tathāgata’s power of the knowledge of the recollection of past lives. Now, how is the tenth, the Tathāgata’s power of the knowledge of the passing away and reappearance of beings, to be investigated? Thus he said, “So there,

original: ñāṇaṃ sabbāsavakkhayañāṇaṃ nāmāti sabbāsavakkhayañāṇaṃ dasamaṃ tathāgatabalaṃ vicayitabbanti
analyzed: ñāṇam sabba āsava khaya ñāṇam nāma ati sabba āsava kkhaya ñāṇam dasamam tathāgata balam
translated: the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers arose in him at the root of the Enlightenment Tree, and this knowledge of the destruction of the cankers is called the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers. The knowledge of the destruction of the cankers is to be investigated as the tenth Tathāgata’s power.

original: ayaṃ saṅkhepattho. Vitthārato pana pāḷito ca aṭṭhakathāto ca yatipotānampi pākaṭo
analyzed: ayam saṅkhepa atthaḥ vitthārato pana pāḷitaḥ ca aṭṭhakathāto ca yati potānam pi pākaṭaḥ
translated: This is the brief meaning. But the detailed meaning can be known from the text and the commentary.

original: bhaveyyāti maññitvā na dassito.(10)🔽“Ettakova vicayahārasampāto paripuṇṇo”ti vattabbattā “niyutto vicayo hārasampāto”ti
analyzed: bhaveyya ati maññitvā na  ettakaḥ iva vicaya hāra sampāto paripuṇṇo ti vattabbattā niyuttaḥ vicayaḥ hāra sampāto ti
translated: It is not given here, thinking that it would be obvious to those who are diligent.🔽In order to say that the fulfilment of the investigation and search is complete in this way, he said, “The investigation is complete, the search is complete.”

original: vuttaṃ. Ye ye suttappadesatthā vuttā, te te suttappadesatthā yena yena saṃvaṇṇanāvisesabhūtena
analyzed: vuttam ye ye sutta ppadesa tthāḥ vuttā te te sutta ppadesa tthāḥ yena yena saṃvaṇṇanā visesa bhūtena
translated: The meanings of the passages in the suttas that have been stated are the special kinds of commendation.

original: vicayahārasampātena vicayitabbā, so so saṃvaṇṇanāvisesabhūto vicayahārasampāto niyutto
analyzed: vicaya hāra sampātena vicayitabbā saḥ so saṃvaṇṇanā visesa bhūtaḥ vicaya hāra sampātaḥ niyuttaḥ
translated: The meaning of the text should be investigated by one who is equipped with the means of investigation. The means of investigation, which is a special kind of commentary, is set forth.

original: yathārahaṃ nīharitvā yujjitabboti attho gahetabboti.
analyzed: yathāraham nīharitvā yujjitabbaḥ uti atthaḥ gahetabbaḥ iti
translated: The meaning should be grasped by taking it up after investigating it according to the method.

original: Iti vicayahārasampāte sattibalānurūpā racitā
analyzed: iti vicaya hāra sampāte satti bala anurūpā racitā
translated: Thus the means of investigation has been composed in accordance with the strength of the knife.

original: Vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The exposition of the means of investigation is finished.

original: Paṇḍitehi pana…pe… gahetabboti.
analyzed: paṇḍitehi panape gahetabbo ti
translated: But the meaning should be grasped by the wise after investigating it by the means of investigation.

original: 3. Yuttihārasampātavibhāvanā
analyzed: yutti hāra sampāta vibhāvanā
translated: The exposition of the means of coordination

original: 65. Yena yena vicayahārasampātena suttappadesatthā ācariyena vicayitabbā, amhehi🔽ca ñātā, so vicayahārasampāto paripuṇṇo, “katamo yuttihārasampāto”ti pucchitabbattā🔽“tattha katamo yuttihārasampāto”tiādi vuttaṃ. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana – “evaṃ nānānayehi
analyzed: yena yena vicaya hāra sampātena sutta ppadesa tthāḥ ācariyena amhehi  ca ñātā so vicaya hāra sampāto paripuṇṇo katamaḥ yutti hāra sampāto ti pucchitabba ttā  tattha katamaḥ yutti hāra sampāto tiādi vuttam aṭṭhakathāyam pana evam nānā nayehi
translated: The meaning of the text should be investigated by the teacher by means of the means of investigation, and it should be known by us🔽also. That means of investigation is complete. Since the means of coordination should be asked about,

original: vicayahārasampātaṃ vitthāretvā idāni yuttihārasampātādīni dassetuṃ ‘tattha katamo🔽yuttihārasampāto’tiādi āraddha”nti vuttaṃ. Tatthāti tesu desanāhārasampātādīsu soḷasasu
analyzed: vicaya hāra sampātam vitthāretvā idāni yutti hāra sampāta ādīni dassetum tattha katamaḥ 🔽yutti hāra sampātaḥ ti ādi āraddhanti vuttam tattha ati tesu desanā hāra sampāta ādīsu soḷasasu
translated: “What is the means of coordination?” is stated. But in the commentary it is said: “Having thus extended the means of investigation by various methods, in order to show now the means of coordination, etc., ‘What is the means of coordination?’ and so on is begun.” Therein, among those sixteen,

original: hārasampātesu katamo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso yuttihārasampāto nāmāti pucchati, pucchitvā
analyzed: hāra sampātesu katamaḥ saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ yutti hāra sampātaḥ nāma ati pucchati pucchitvā
translated: What is the difference in the commendation? The commendation of the reasoning is called the commendation of the fulfilment of the wearing of the jewel.

original: yasmiṃ suttappadese vuttānaṃ atthānaṃ yuttibhāvo vicāretabbo, taṃ suttappadesaṃ nīharituṃ –
analyzed: yasmin sutta ppadese vuttānam atthānam yutti bhāvaḥ vicāretabbaḥ tam sutta ppadesam nīharitum
translated: Having asked, he now extracts the sutta passage in order to examine the reasoning of the things stated in the sutta passage:

original: “Tasmā rakkhitacittassa, sammāsaṅkappagocaro;
analyzed: tasmā rakkhita cittassa sammā saṅkappa gocaraḥ
translated: “Therefore, with guarded mind, with right thought as his domain,

original: Sammādiṭṭhipurekkhāro, ñatvāna udayabbayaṃ;
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhi purekkhāraḥ ñatvānaḥ udaya bbayam
translated: With right view as his forerunner, having understood rise and fall,

original: Thinamiddhābhibhū bhikkhu, sabbā duggatiyo jahe”ti. –
analyzed: thinamiddha abhibhū bhikkhu sabbāḥ duggatiyaḥ jaheti
translated: The monk who has overcome sloth and torpor abandons all bad destinations.”

original: Vuttaṃ. Tassaṃ gāthāyaṃ tasmā arakkhitacittassa māravasānugatattā satisaṃvaraindriyasaṃvarādivasena🔽bhikkhu rakkhitacitto assa bhaveyya, tasmā kāmavitakkādimicchāsaṅkappagocarassa māravasānugatattā
analyzed: vuttam gāthāyam tasmai arakkhita cittassa māra vasa anugata ttā sati saṃvara aindriya saṃvara ādi vasena  bhikkhu rakkhita cittaḥ assa bhaveyya tasmā kāma vitakka ādi micchā saṅkappa gocarassa māra vasa anugata ttā
translated: This is said. In this verse, with guarded mind: because of being followed by Mara’s army,🔽the monk should have a guarded mind by way of the restraint of mindfulness, the restraint of the faculties, etc.🔽Therefore, with right thought as his domain: because of being followed by Mara’s army by way of the domain of wrong thought beginning with thought of sense desires,

original: nekkhammasaṅkappādivasena bhikkhu sammāsaṅkappagocaro assa bhaveyya, tasmā micchādiṭṭhihatacittassa
analyzed: nekkhamma saṅkappa ādi vasena bhikkhu sammāsaṅkappa gocaraḥ assa bhaveyya tasmā micchādiṭṭhi hata cittassa
translated: the monk should have right thought as his domain by way of renunciation-thought, etc.🔽Therefore, with right view as his forerunner:

original: māravasānugatattā yonisomanasikārena bhikkhu udayabbayaṃ ñatvāna sammādiṭṭhipurekkhāro
analyzed: māra vasā anugata ttā yoniso manasikārena bhikkhu udaya bbayam ñatvāna sammādiṭṭhi purekkhāro
translated: Because of being followed by Mara’s realm, the bhikkhu, by right reflection, having known rise and fall,🔽would have right view as his forerunner.

original: assa bhaveyya, tasmā thinamiddhena hatacittassa māravasānugatattā vīriyavasena bhikkhu
analyzed: assa bhaveyya tasmā thinam iddhena hata cittassa māra vasa anugata ttā vīriya vasena bhikkhu
translated: Therefore, because of being followed by Mara’s realm, the bhikkhu, by energy,

original: thinamiddhābhibhū assa bhaveyya, tādiso bhikkhu sabbā duggatiyo jahe jahissatīti attho veditabbo.🔽“Tassaṃ gāthāyaṃ kathaṃ yuttibhāvo vicāretabbo”ti vattabbattā “tasmā rakkhitacittassā”tiādi
analyzed: thinamiddha abhibhū assa bhaveyya tādisaḥ bhikkhu sabbāḥ duggatiyaḥ jahe jahissati iti atthaḥ veditabbaḥ  gāthāyam katham yutti bhāvaḥ vicāretabbaḥ ti vattabba ttā tasmā rakkhita cittassa atiādi
translated: would be overcome by sloth and torpor. Such a bhikkhu would abandon all bad destinations. The meaning should be understood thus.

original: vuttaṃ. Rakkhitacittassa sammāsaṅkappagocaro bhavissatīti attho yujjati eva, no na🔽yujjati. Micchāsaṅkappānampi jahitattā sammādiṭṭhipurekkhāro hutvā viharanto udayabbayaṃ
analyzed: vuttam rakkhita cittassa sammāsaṅkappa gocaraḥ bhavissati iti atthaḥ yujjati eva no na  yujjati micchā saṅkappānam pi jahita ttā sammādiṭṭhi purekkhāro hutvā viharantaḥ udaya bbayam
translated: “How should the method be considered in this stanza?” In order to show this, “Therefore, of one who guards his mind” and so on is said. The meaning is suitable thus: “Of one who guards his mind, the province will be right thought.” It is not unsuitable.

original: paṭivijjhissatīti attho yujjati sammādiṭṭhipurekkhārassa udayabbayānupassanāsambhavato.
analyzed: paṭivijjhissati iti atthaḥ yujjati sammādiṭṭhi purekkhārassa udaya bbaya anupassanā asambhavataḥ
translated: Because of the abandoning of wrong thoughts, the meaning is suitable thus: “Dwelling with right view as his forerunner, he will penetrate rise and fall.” Because of the possibility of the contemplation of rise and fall in one who has right view as his forerunner.

original: Udayabbayaṃ paṭivijjhanto sabbā duggatiyo jahissatīti attho yujjati udayabbayānupassanānukkamena
analyzed: udaya bbayam paṭivijjhanto sabbāḥ duggatiyaḥ jahissati iti atthaḥ yujjati udaya bbaya anupassanā anukkamena
translated: The meaning that fits is: “He will penetrate rise and subsidence and so will abandon all bad destinations.”🔽For the noble path comes about in the order in which rise and subsidence are given attention.

original: ariyamaggasambhavato. Sabbā duggatiyo jahanto sabbāni duggativinipātabhayāni samatikkamissatīti
analyzed: ariya magga sambhavataḥ sabbāḥ duggatiyaḥ jahantaḥ sabbāni duggati vinipāta bhayāni samatikkamissati iti
translated: The meaning that fits is: “Abandoning all bad destinations he will surmount all fears of bad destinations.”

original: attho yujjati sabbesaṃ duggativinipātabhayānaṃ anuppajjanato.
analyzed: atthaḥ yujjati sabbesam duggati vinipāta bhayānam an uppajjanato
translated: For all fears of bad destinations and unhappy destinations do not arise.🔽Because it should be said that “The fulfilment of the method of interpretation is complete in this way,”

original: “Ettakova yuttihārasampāto paripuṇṇo”ti vattabbattā “niyutto yuttihārasampāto”ti
analyzed: ettakaḥ iva yutti hāra sampāto paripuṇṇo ti vattabbattā niyuttaḥ yutti hāra sampāto ti
translated: it is said that “The fulfilment of the method of interpretation is applied.”

original: vuttaṃ. Yena yena saṃvaṇṇanāvisesabhūtena yuttihārasampātena suttappadesatthānaṃ
analyzed: vuttam yena yena saṃvaṇṇanā visesa bhūtena yutti hāra sampātena sutta ppadesa tthānam
translated: The meaning is that the fulfilment of the method of interpretation, which is a particular kind of commendation, should be taken as the meaning to be got from the words of the text🔽by which the method of interpretation is to be investigated.

original: yuttibhāvo vicāretabbo, so so saṃvaṇṇanāvisesabhūto yuttihārasampāto niyutto yathārahaṃ
analyzed: yutti bhāvaḥ vicāretabbo saḥ so saṃvaṇṇanā visesa bhūtaḥ yutti hāra sampātaḥ niyuttaḥ yathāraham
translated: So the fulfilment of the method of interpretation, which is a particular kind of commendation, should be applied as appropriate

original: niddhāretvā yujjitabboti attho gahetabboti.
analyzed: niddhāretvā yujjitabbaḥ iti atthaḥ gahetabbaḥ iti
translated: and the meaning should be taken as the meaning to be got.

original: Iti yuttihārasampāte sattibalānurūpā racitā
analyzed: iti yutti hāra sampāte satti bala anurūpā racitā
translated: Thus the fulfilment of the method of interpretation has been composed in accordance with the force of the knife.

original: Vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The exposition is ended.

original: Paṇḍitehi pana…pe… gahetabboti.
analyzed: paṇḍitehi panape gahetabbo ti
translated: But by the wise the method of interpretation should be applied as appropriate and the meaning should be taken as the meaning to be got.

original: 4. Padaṭṭhānahārasampātavibhāvanā
analyzed: pada ṭṭhāna hāra sampāta vibhāvanā
translated: The fulfilment of the method of interpretation

original: 66. Yena yena yuttihārasampātena suttappadesatthānaṃ yuttibhāvo ācariyena vibhāvito,
analyzed: yena yena yutti hāra sampātena sutta ppadesa thānam yutti bhāvaḥ ācariyena vibhāvito
translated: The teacher has analysed the meaning of the passage of the Thread by means of the fulfilment of the Mode of Conveying a Conversion,

original: amhehi ca ñāto, so yuttihārasampāto paripuṇṇo, “katamo padaṭṭhānahārasampāto”ti pucchitabbattā
analyzed: amhehi ca ñāto so yutti hāra sampāto paripuṇṇo katamo padaṭṭhāna hāra sampāto ti pucchitabba ttā
translated: and we have understood it. That fulfilment of the Mode of Conveying a Conversion is complete. Now, since it is the fulfilment of the Mode of Conveying Requisites that has to be asked about next,

original: “tattha katamo padaṭṭhāno hārasampāto”ti pucchati.
analyzed: tattha katamo padaṭṭhānaḥ hāra sampāto ti pucchati
translated: he asks “ What is the fulfilment of the Mode of Conveying Requisites? “ .

original: Pucchitvā yasmiṃ suttappadese vuttāni padaṭṭhānāni nīharitāni, taṃ suttappadesaṃ
analyzed: pucchitvā yasmin sutta ppadese vuttāni padaṭṭhānāni nīharitāni tam sutta ppadesam
translated: Having asked, he shows the passage of the Thread in which the requisites are stated,

original: nīharituṃ “tasmā rakkhitacittassa, sammāsaṅkappagocaroti gāthā”ti vuttā. Gāthāttho🔽vuttova. “Katame gāthātthā katamesaṃ dhammānaṃ padaṭṭhānānī”ti pucchitabbattā “tasmā
analyzed: nīharitum tasmā rakkhita cittassa sammā saṅkappa gocaraḥ ti gāthā ati vuttā gāthā attho  vuttaḥ uva katame gāthā atthā katamesam dhammānam padaṭṭhānāni iti pucchitabba ttā tasmā
translated: and in order to extract that passage of the Thread he says “ Therefore, with guarded mind, the range of right thinking “ . The meaning of the verse

original: rakkhitacittassā”tiādi vuttaṃ. “Tasmā rakkhitacittassā”ti suttappadesassa atthabhūtā
analyzed: rakkhita cittassa atiādi vuttam tasmā rakkhita cittassa ati sutta ppadesassa attha bhūtā
translated: is stated. Since it is the meaning of the verses and the requisites of the ideas stated that have to be asked about next, he says “ Therefore, with guarded mind “ , and so on. The meaning of the passage of the Thread “ Therefore, with guarded mind “ is

original: indriyesu guttadvāratā tiṇṇaṃ sucaritānaṃ padaṭṭhānaṃ nāma sucaritapāripūriyā āsannakāraṇattā.
analyzed: indriyesu gutta dvāra tā tiṇṇam su caritānam padaṭṭhānam nāma su carita pāripūriyā āsanna kāraṇa ttā
translated: guarding of the doors of the sense faculties, which is the requisite for the three kinds of good conduct, since it is the proximate cause for the fulfilment of good conduct.

original: “Sammāsaṅkappagocaro”ti suttappadesassa atthabhūtā nekkhammasaṅkappādayo sammāsaṅkappā
analyzed: sammā saṅkappa gocaro ti sutta ppadesassa attha bhūtāḥ nekkhamma saṅkappa ādayo sammā saṅkappāḥ
translated: Right intention is the intention of renunciation, etc., which are the meaning of the sutta passage “The province of right intention” .

original: samathassa padaṭṭhānaṃ nāma kāmacchandaādinīvaraṇavikkhambhanassa āsannakāraṇattā.
analyzed: samathassa padaṭṭhānam nāma kāmacchanda ādi nīvaraṇa vikkhambhanassa āsanna kāraṇa ttā
translated: It is the footing for serenity because it is the proximate cause for the suppression of the hindrances of lust, etc.

original: “Sammādiṭṭhipurekkhāro”ti suttappadesassa atthabhūtā kammassakatāsammādiṭṭhi ca sappaccayanāmarūpadassanasammādiṭṭhi
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhi purekkhāro ti sutta ppadesassa attha bhūtā kammassaka tā sammādiṭṭhi ca sappaccaya nāma rūpa dassana sammādiṭṭhi
translated: Right view is the right view that one has in seeing the ownership of kamma, etc., and the right view that one has in seeing mentality-materiality with its conditions.

original: ca vipassanāya padaṭṭhānaṃ nāma aniccānupassanādīnaṃ visesakāraṇattā. “Ñatvāna udayabbaya”nti
analyzed: ca vipassanāya padaṭṭhānam nāma anicca anupassanā ādīnam visesa kāraṇa ttā ñatvāna udayabbayanti
translated: It is the footing for insight because it is the cause for the special qualities of the contemplations of impermanence, etc.

original: suttappadesassa atthabhūtā udayabbayānupassanāpaññā dassanabhūmiyā padaṭṭhānaṃ nāma🔽paṭhamamaggādhigamassa āsannakāraṇattā. “Thinamiddhābhibhū bhikkhū”ti suttappadesassa
analyzed: sutta ppadesassa attha bhūtā udaya bbaya anupassanā paññā dassana bhūmiyā padaṭṭhānam nāma  paṭhama magga adhigamassa āsanna kāraṇa ttā thinamiddha abhibhū bhikkhū ti sutta ppadesassa
translated: The knowledge of contemplation of rise and fall is the footing for the plane of seeing because it is the proximate cause for the attaining of the first path.

original: atthabhūtaṃ thinamiddhābhibhavanaṃ vīriyassa padaṭṭhānaṃ nāma āsannakāraṇattā. “Sabbā
analyzed: attha bhūtam thinam iddha abhibhavanam vīriyassa padaṭṭhānam nāma āsanna kāraṇa ttā sabbā
translated: The suppression of stiffness and torpor is the footing for energy because it is the proximate cause for it.🔽The abandoning of the hindrances is the footing for the enlightenment factors because it is the proximate cause for them.

original: duggatiyo jahe”ti suttappadesassa atthabhūtā pahātabbajahanabhāvanāya ariyamaggabhāvanāya
analyzed: duggatiyaḥ jaheti sutta ppadesassa attha bhūtā pahātabba jahana bhāvanāya ariya magga bhāvanāya
translated: and he will leave the states of loss” .

original: padaṭṭhānaṃ nāma pahātabbappahānena ariyamaggabhāvanāpāripūrisambhavato.
analyzed: padaṭṭhānam nāma pahātabba ppahānena ariya magga bhāvanā pāripūri sambhavato
translated: The footing is the development of the noble path consisting in abandoning and in giving up, which is the meaning of the sutta passage.🔽Because the fulfilment of the development of the noble path comes about through the abandoning of what should be abandoned and the giving up of what should be given up,🔽it is said, “The footing-as-carrying-out is fulfilled by being yoked” .

original: “Ettakova padaṭṭhānahārasampāto paripuṇṇo”ti vattabbattā “niyutto padaṭṭhāno hārasampāto”ti
analyzed: ettakaḥ iva padaṭṭhāna hāra sampātaḥ paripuṇṇo ti vattabbattā niyuttaḥ padaṭṭhānaḥ hāra sampāto ti
translated: Because it should be said that the carrying-out of the footing is fulfilled by the particular kind of commendation,🔽the footing-as-carrying-out is fulfilled by the particular kind of commendation,

original: vuttaṃ. Yena yena saṃvaṇṇanāvisesabhūtena padaṭṭhānahārasampātabhūtena suttappadesatthāni🔽padaṭṭhānāni nīharitāni, so so saṃvaṇṇanāvisesabhūto padaṭṭhānahārasampāto niyutto
analyzed: vuttam yena yena saṃvaṇṇanā visesa bhūtena padaṭṭhāna hāra sampāta bhūtena sutta ppadesa tthāni  padaṭṭhānāni nīharitāni saḥ saḥ saṃvaṇṇanā visesa bhūto padaṭṭhāna hāra sampātaḥ niyutto
translated: which is the meaning of the sutta passage that has been brought out by the particular kind of commendation.

original: yathārahaṃ niddhāretvā yujjitabboti attho gahetabboti.
analyzed: yathāraham niddhāretvā yujjitabbaḥ uti atthaḥ gahetabbaḥ iti
translated: The meaning is that it should be taken as being brought out and yoked in the appropriate way.

original: Iti padaṭṭhānahārasampāte sattibalānurūpā racitā
analyzed: iti padaṭṭhāna hāra sampāte satti bala anurūpā racitā
translated: So the carrying-out of the footing has been composed in accordance with the force of the saw.

original: Vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The exposition is ended.

original: Paṇḍitehi pana…pe… gahetabboti.
analyzed: paṇḍitehi panape gahetabbo ti
translated: But by the wise the meaning should be taken🔽As stated in the commentaries.

original: 5. Lakkhaṇahārasampātavibhāvanā
analyzed: lakkhaṇa hāra sampāta vibhāvanā
translated: Exposition of the carrying-out of the characteristic

original: 67. Yena yena padaṭṭhānahārasampātena suttappadesatthāni padaṭṭhānāni ācariyena niddhāritāni,
analyzed: yena yena padaṭṭhāna hāra sampātena sutta ppadesa tthāni padaṭṭhānāni ācariyena niddhāritāni
translated: The teacher has extracted the terms of expression for the sutta passages by means of the terms of expression for the headings,

original: amhehi ca ñātāni, so padaṭṭhānahārasampāto paripuṇṇo, “katamo lakkhaṇahārasampāto”ti
analyzed: amhehi ca ñātāni so padaṭṭhāna hāra sampāto paripuṇṇo katamo lakkhaṇa hāra sampāto ti
translated: and we know them. The terms of expression for the headings are complete. “What is the terms of expression for the characteristics?”

original: pucchitabbattā “tattha katamo lakkhaṇo hārasampāto”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha tesu desanāhārasampātādīsu
analyzed: pucchitabba ttā tattha katamaḥ lakkhaṇaḥ hāra sampātaḥ tiādi vuttam tattha tesu desanā hāra sampāta ādīsu
translated: “Herein, what is the terms of expression for the characteristics?” is said because it should be asked.🔽Herein, among these sixteen terms of expression for the terms of expression for the teaching, etc.,

original: soḷasasu hārasampātesu katamo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso lakkhaṇahārasampāto nāmāti pucchati.
analyzed: soḷasasu hāra sampātesu katamaḥ saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ lakkhaṇa hāra sampāto nāma ati pucchati
translated: what is the difference in the commentarial exposition called the terms of expression for the characteristics?

original: “Katamehi suttatthehi samānalakkhaṇā katame dhammā gahitā”ti pucchitabbattā “tasmā”tiādi
analyzed: katamehi sutta atthehi samāna lakkhaṇā katame dhammā gahitā ati pucchitabba ttā tasmā atiādi
translated: “What ideas are included by what ideas that have the same characteristics as the sutta passages?” is said because it should be asked.

original: vuttaṃ. “Tasmā rakkhitacittassa, sammāsaṅkappagocaro”ti suttappadesena vuttaṃ idaṃ
analyzed: vuttam tasmā rakkhita cittassa sammāsaṅkappa gocaraḥ ti sutta ppadesena vuttam idam
translated: “Therefore, the province of right thinking for one who guards the mind” is said.

original: rakkhaṇaṃ satindriyaṃ gahitaṃ, satindriye gahite saddhādipañcindriyāni gahitāni bhavanti
analyzed: rakkhaṇam sat indriyam gahitam sat indriye gahite saddhā ādi pañca indriyāni gahitāni bhavanti
translated: This guarding is included by the faculty of mindfulness. When the faculty of mindfulness is included, the five faculties beginning with faith are included.

original: indriyaṭṭhena samānalakkhaṇattā. “Sammādiṭṭhipurekkhāro”ti suttappadesena vuttā sammādiṭṭhi
analyzed: indriya ṭṭhena samāna lakkhaṇa ttā sammādiṭṭhi purekkhāro ti sutta ppadesena vuttā sammādiṭṭhi
translated: because of the similarity of characteristic in the sense of faculty. The right view stated in the passage “Preceded by right view” is included by right view.

original: gahitā, sammādiṭṭhiyā gahitāya ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo gahito bhavati. Taṃ kissa hetūti
analyzed: gahitā sammādiṭṭhiyā gahitāya ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo gahito bhavati tam kissa hetu uti
translated: When right view is included, the Noble Eightfold Path is included. Why is that?

original: kāraṇaṃ pucchati. Pucchitvā kāraṇamāha “sammādiṭṭhito hī”tiādinā. Sammādiṭṭhihetuto
analyzed: kāraṇam pucchati pucchitvā kāraṇam āha sammādiṭṭhitaḥ hi itiādinā sammādiṭṭhi hetutaḥ
translated: He asks the reason. Having asked, he states the reason: “Because of right view” and so on.

original: sammāsaṅkappo hi yasmā pabhavati, tasmā, sammāsaṅkappato sammāvācā hi yasmā pabhavati,
analyzed: sammā saṅkappaḥ hi yasmai pabhavati tasmai sammā saṅkappataḥ sammā vācā hi yasmai pabhavati
translated: Because right thought arises from right view,🔽because right speech arises from right thought,

original: tasmā, sammāvācāto sammākammanto hi yasmā pabhavati, tasmā, sammākammantato sammāājīvo
analyzed: tasmā sammā vācātaḥ sammā kammantaḥ hi yasmā pabhavati tasmā sammā kammantataḥ sammāājīvaḥ
translated: because right action arises from right speech,🔽because right livelihood arises from right action,

original: hi yasmā pabhavati, tasmā, sammāājīvato sammāvāyāmo hi yasmā pabhavati, tasmā, sammāvāyāmato
analyzed: hi yasmai pabhavati tasmai sammāājīvataḥ sammāvāyāmaḥ hi yasmai pabhavati tasmai sammāvāyāmataḥ
translated: because right effort arises from right livelihood,🔽because right mindfulness arises from right effort,

original: sammāsatihi yasmā pabhavati, tasmā, sammāsatito sammāsamādhi hi yasmā pabhavati,
analyzed: yasmai pabhavati tasmai sammā satitaḥ hi yasmai pabhavati
translated: because right concentration arises from right mindfulness,

original: tasmā, sammāsamādhito sammāvimutti hi yasmā pabhavati, tasmā, sammāvimuttito sammāvimuttiñāṇadassanaṃ
analyzed: tasmā sammāsamādhitaḥ sammāvimutti hi yasmā pabhavati tasmā sammāvimuttitaḥ sammāvimutti ñāṇa dassanaṃ
translated: therefore, since the knowledge and vision of Right Liberation comes from Right Liberation,

original: hi yasmā pabhavati, tasmā, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo gahito bhavatīti.🔽“Ettakova lakkhaṇahārasampāto paripuṇṇo”ti vattabbattā “niyutto lakkhaṇo hārasampāto”ti
analyzed: hi yasmai pabhavati tasmai ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo gahitaḥ bhavati iti  ettakaḥ iva lakkhaṇa hāra sampātaḥ paripuṇṇaḥ ti vattabbattā niyuttaḥ lakkhaṇaḥ hāra sampāto ti
translated: therefore the Noble Eightfold Path is included.🔽“This much is the fulfilment of the Thread’s meaning by the inclusion of the characteristic in the phrasing” should be said.

original: vuttaṃ. Yena yena saṃvaṇṇanāvisesabhūtena lakkhaṇahārasampātena suttappadesatthā🔽samānalakkhaṇena gahitā bhavanti, so so saṃvaṇṇanāvisesabhūto lakkhaṇahārasampāto
analyzed: vuttam yena yena saṃvaṇṇanā visesa bhūtena lakkhaṇa hāra sampātena sutta ppadesa tthā  samāna lakkhaṇena gahitāḥ bhavanti saḥ saḥ saṃvaṇṇanā visesa bhūtaḥ lakkhaṇa hāra sampāto
translated: Since the Thread’s meaning is included by the fulfilment of the Thread’s meaning by the inclusion of the characteristic in the phrasing, which is a particular kind of commendation,🔽that fulfilment of the Thread’s meaning by the inclusion of the characteristic in the phrasing, which is a particular kind of commendation,

original: niyutto yathārahaṃ niddhāretvā yujjitabboti attho gahitoti.
analyzed: niyuttaḥ yathāraham niddhāretvā yujjitabbaḥ iti atthaḥ gahito ti
translated: is included by the meaning “is to be applied by the inclusion of the characteristic in the phrasing as is appropriate”.

original: Iti lakkhaṇahārasampāte sattibalānurūpā racitā
analyzed: iti lakkhaṇa hāra sampāte satti bala anurūpā racitā
translated: So the inclusion of the characteristic in the phrasing has been composed in accordance with the strength of the knife.

original: Vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The exposition is ended.

original: Paṇḍitehi pana…pe… gahetabboti.
analyzed: paṇḍitehi panape gahetabbo ti
translated: But by the wise the Thread’s meaning is to be included by the inclusion of the characteristic in the phrasing, and so on.

original: 6. Catubyūhahārasampātavibhāvanā
translated: . The exposition of the fulfilment of the Thread’s meaning by the inclusion of the characteristic in the phrasing in the fourfold array

original: 68. Yena yena lakkhaṇahārasampātena suttappadesatthā samānalakkhaṇena gahitā, so
analyzed: yena yena lakkhaṇa hāra sampātena sutta ppadesa tthā samāna lakkhaṇena gahitā so
translated: . Since the Thread’s meaning is included by the fulfilment of the Thread’s meaning by the inclusion of the characteristic in the phrasing, which is a particular kind of commendation,

original: lakkhaṇahārasampāto paripuṇṇo, “katamo catubyūhahārasampāto”ti pucchitabbattā “tattha
analyzed: lakkhaṇa hāra sampāto paripuṇṇaḥ katamo catu byūha hāra sampāto ti pucchitabba ttā tattha
translated: The fulfilment of the discernment of the characteristics has been completed. Now, in order to ask, “What is the fulfilment of the discernment of the fourfold array? “ ,

original: katamo catubyūho hārasampāto”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha tesu desanāhārasampātādīsu soḷasasu
analyzed: katamaḥ catu byūhaḥ hāra sampāto tiādi vuttam tattha tesu desanā hāra sampāta ādīsu soḷasasu
translated: “Herein, what is the fulfilment of the discernment of the fourfold array? “ is said. Herein, among these sixteen fulfilments of discernment, beginning with the fulfilment of the discernment of teaching,

original: hārasampātesu katamo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso catubyūhahārasampāto nāmāti pucchati.
analyzed: hāra sampātesu katamo saṃvaṇṇanā viseso catu byūha hāra sampātaḥ nāma ati pucchati
translated: he asks, “What is the fulfilment of the discernment of the fourfold array called the distinction of exposition? “

original: “Katamasmiṃ sutte katame nirutyādhippāyanidānapubbāparānusandhayo niddhāritā”ti pucchitabbattā🔽“tasmā”tiādi vuttaṃ. “Tasmā rakkhitacittassā”ti suttappadese “rakkhīyate rakkhita”nti
analyzed: katamasmim sutte katame nirutya adhippāya nidāna pubba apara anusandhayaḥ niddhāritā ati pucchitabba ttā  tasmā tiādi vuttam tasmā rakkhita cittassa nti sutta ppadese rakkhīyate rakkhitan ti
translated: In order to ask, “In which sutta are the purport, the cause, the prior and subsequent, and the investigation extracted? “

original: niruttiṃ “paripālīyatī”ti iminā pariyāyena dasseti, itisaddassa ādyatthattā “cintetīti🔽cittaṃ, attano santānaṃ cinotīti cittaṃ, paccayehi citanti cittaṃ, cittavicittaṭṭhena
analyzed: niruttim paripālīyati iti iminā pariyāyena dasseti iti saddassaḥ ādi attha tā cinteti iti  cittam attanaḥ santānam cinoti iti cittam paccayehi citanti cittam citta vicitta ṭṭhena
translated: “Therefore” is said. In the sutta passage, “of one who guards the mind” , he shows the reading “rakkhita” by the synonym “paripālita” . Since the word “iti” has the meaning of “beginning” ,🔽“It thinks , thus it is mind ; it is mind because it thinks its own continuity; it is mind because it is thought by conditions; it is mind in the sense of the various kinds of thinking ;

original: cittaṃ, cittakaraṇaṭṭhena cittaṃ, rakkhitaṃ cittaṃ yassāti rakkhitacitto. Sammā saṅkappetīti
analyzed: cittam citta karaṇa ṭṭhena cittam rakkhitam cittam yassa ati rakkhita cittaḥ sammā saṅkappeti iti
translated: it is mind in the sense of the act of thinking . One who has guarded the mind is one who has the guarded mind. He rightly directs , thus he is a director .

original: sammāsaṅkappo, gāvo caranti etthāti gocaro, gocaro viyāti gocaro, sammāsaṅkappo gocaro
analyzed: sammā saṅkappaḥ gāvaḥ caranti ettha ati gocaraḥ gocaraḥ viya ati gocaro sammā saṅkappaḥ gocaro
translated: Right intention is the pasture. The cows go there, thus it is a pasture. Like a pasture, thus it is a pasture. Right intention is the pasture.

original: assāti sammāsaṅkappagocaro. Sammā passatīti sammādiṭṭhi, sammādiṭṭhi purekkhāro assāti
analyzed: assa ati sammā saṅkappa gocaraḥ sammā passati iti sammādiṭṭhi sammādiṭṭhi purekkhāro assa ati
translated: The cow is the one with right intention as his pasture. He sees rightly, thus he is one of right view. The one with right view as his forerunner is

original: sammādiṭṭhipurekkhāro. Jānātīti ñatvāna. Udayo ca vayo ca udayabbayaṃ. Thinañca middhañca
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhi purekkhāraḥ jānāti iti udayo ca vayo ca udaya bbayam thinam ca middham ca
translated: the one with right view as his forerunner. He knows, thus knowing. Arising and falling away are arising and falling away. Drowsiness and sleep are

original: thinamiddhaṃ, abhibhavatīti abhibhū, thinamiddhaṃ abhibhūti thinamiddhābhibhū. Bhikkhatīti
analyzed: thinamiddham abhibhavati iti abhibhū thinamiddham abhibhū iti thinamiddha abhibhū bhikkhati iti
translated: drowsiness and sleep. He overcomes, thus he is the overcomer. Drowsiness and sleep are overcome by him, thus he is the overcomer of drowsiness and sleep. He begs, thus he is a bhikkhu.

original: bhikkhū”ti niruttipi nīharitā. Tenāha – “iti-saddo ādyattho”ti. Esā vuttappakārā
analyzed: bhikkhū ti nirutti pi nīharitā tena āha iti saddo ādi atthaḥ ti esā vutta ppakārā
translated: The derivation is also brought out. Hence it is said: “The word iti has the meaning of the beginning” . This description of the kind stated

original: paññatti nirutti nāmāti nīharitā.
analyzed: paññatti nirutti nāmāti nīharitā
translated: is called the derivation.

original: Idha suttappadese bhagavato ko adhippāyoti ce puccheyya, ye sappurisā sabbāhi duggatīhi
analyzed: idha sutta ppadese bhagavato kaḥ adhippāyaḥ ti ce puccheyya ye sappurisā sabbāhi duggatīhi
translated: If one were to ask: “What is the Blessed One’s purport in this sutta passage? ”—one might answer: “He who is desirous of being released from all evil destinies

original: parimuccitukāmā bhavissanti, te sappurisā dhammacārino rakkhitacittā bhavissantīti
analyzed: parimuccitu kāmāḥ bhavissanti te sappurisāḥ dhamma cārinaḥ rakkhita cittāḥ bhavissanti iti
translated: will be a good person, a virtuous one, and one who guards his mind” .

original: ayaṃ adhippāyo. Ettha “tasmā rakkhitacittassā”tiādisuttappadese bhagavato adhippāyoti nīharitabbo.
analyzed: ayam adhippāyaḥ ettha tasmā rakkhita cittassa ati ādi sutta ppadese bhagavato adhippāyaḥ ti nīharitabbaḥ
translated: This is the purport. Herein, the following Thread-passage should be cited as the Blessed One’s purport: ‘ Therefore, with guarded cognizance ‘ .

original: “Katamaṃ nidāna”nti ce puccheyya, kokāliko sāriputtamoggallānesu theresu cittaṃ arakkhitvā
analyzed: katamam nidānam ti ce puccheyya kokāliko sāriputta moggallānesu theresu cittam a rakkhitvā
translated: If he were to ask ‘ What is the Source? ‘, he should be told that it is Kokalika who, having failed to guard his cognizance against the Elder Sariputta and the Elder Moggallana,

original: padosayitvā mahāpadumaniraye yasmā upapanno, yasmā bhagavā ca satiārakkhena samannāgato
analyzed: padosayitvā mahāpaduma niraye yasmai upapannaḥ yasmai bhagavā ca sati ārakkhena samannāgato
translated: and having misrepresented them, was reborn in the Great Hell of Red-hot Metal, and that since the Blessed One is possessed of mindfulness-guarding

original: sabbā duggatiyo jahati, tasmā ca sabbā duggatiyo jahitukāmo bhikkhu sappuriso rakkhitacitto
analyzed: sabbāḥ duggatiyaḥ jahati tasmā ca sabbāḥ duggatiyaḥ jahitu kāmo bhikkhu sappurisaḥ rakkhita citto
translated: and since he who is desirous of abandoning all bad destinations should be a person of right conduct with guarded cognizance,

original: assa bhaveyyāti nidānaṃ nīharitabbaṃ.
analyzed: assa bhaveyya ati nidānam nīharitabbam
translated: it is the Source that should be cited.

original: “Katamo pubbāparasandhī”ti ce puccheyya, suttamhi “satiyā cittaṃ rakkhitabba”nti🔽yaṃ vacanaṃ vuttaṃ, tena pubbavacanena ayaṃ “tasmā rakkhitacittassa…pe… sabbā duggatiyo
analyzed: katamo pubba apara sandhi iti ce puccheyya suttamhi satiyā cittam rakkhitabbanti  yam vacanam vuttam tena pubba vacanena ayam tasmā sabbāḥ duggatiyaḥ
translated: If he were to ask ‘ What is the Conjunction? ‘, he should be told that the passage in the Thread ‘ With mindfulness one’s cognizance should be guarded ‘🔽is the first statement, and that the Thread-passage ‘ Therefore, with guarded cognizance … he abandons all bad destinations ‘ is the second statement, and that the two statements are in conjunction, are connected, are in continuity,

original: jahe”ti suttappadeso anusandhi saṃsandati sametīti pubbaparānusandhi niddhāritabboti.
analyzed: jaheti sutta ppadesaḥ anusandhi saṃsandati sameti iti pubba para anusandhi niddhāritabbaḥ ti
translated: so that the Conjunction should be cited as the continuity of the two statements.

original: “Ettakova catubyūhahārasampāto paripuṇṇo”ti vattabbattā “niyutto catubyūho hārasampāto”ti
analyzed: ettakaḥ iva catu byūha hāra sampāto paripuṇṇo ti vattabbattā niyuttaḥ catu byūhaḥ hāra sampāto ti
translated: “The fourfold recitation-sequence fulfilment is just this much” should be said. Therefore it was said: “The fourfold recitation-sequence is fulfilled by the sequence.”

original: vuttaṃ. Yena yena saṃvaṇṇanāvisesabhūtena catubyūhahārasampātena nirutyādhippāyanidānapubbāparānusandhi
analyzed: vuttam yena yena saṃvaṇṇanā visesa bhūtena catu byūha hāra sampātena nirutya adhippāya nidāna pubba apara anusandhi
translated: By whatever fulfilment of the fourfold recitation-sequence which is a special kind of commendation, the purpose of the Thread, the source, the prior and subsequent sequence,

original: niddhāritabbo, so so saṃvaṇṇanāvisesabhūto catubyūhahārasampāto niyutto yathārahaṃ
analyzed: niddhāritabbo saḥ saḥ saṃvaṇṇanā visesa bhūto catu byūha hāra sampātaḥ niyuttaḥ yathāraham
translated: and the meaning indicated, should be demonstrated, that fulfilment of the fourfold recitation-sequence which is a special kind of commendation should be demonstrated in the right place

original: niddhāretvā yujjitabboti attho gahetabboti.
analyzed: niddhāretvā yujjitabbaḥ iti atthaḥ gahetabbaḥ iti
translated: and taken as the meaning to be construed.

original: Iti catubyūhahārasampāte sattibalānurūpā racitā
analyzed: iti catur byūha hāra sampāte satti bala anurūpā racitā
translated: Thus the fulfilment of the fourfold recitation-sequence has been composed in accordance with the force of the needle.

original: Vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Analysis is ended.

original: Paṇḍitehi pana…pe… gahetabboti.🔽7. Āvaṭṭahārasampātavibhāvanā🔽69. Yena yena catubyūhahārasampātena nirutyādhippāyanidānapubbāparānusandhayo vibhattā,
analyzed: paṇḍitehi panape gahetabbo ti  āvaṭṭa hāra sampāta vibhāvanā  yena yena catu byūha hāra sampātena nirutya adhippāya nidāna pubba apara anusandhayaḥ vibhattā
translated: But by the wise the Thread’s meaning should be taken as the meaning to be construed.🔽The Analysis of the Fulfilment of the Revolving Recollection🔽The fourfold recitation-sequence fulfilment by which the purpose of the Thread, the source, the prior and subsequent sequence,

original: so catubyūhahārasampāto paripuṇṇo, “katamo āvaṭṭahārasampāto”ti pucchitabbattā “tattha
analyzed: saḥ catu byūha hāra sampātaḥ paripuṇṇaḥ katamaḥ āvaṭṭa hāra sampāto ti pucchitabba ttā tattha
translated: and the meaning indicated, are demonstrated, is fulfilled. Since it is the fulfilment of the fourfold recitation-sequence that should be asked about, namely “What is the fulfilment of the revolving recollection? “ it was said:

original: katamo āvaṭṭo hārasampāto”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha katamo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso āvaṭṭahārasampāto nāmāti pucchati.
analyzed: katamaḥ āvaṭṭaḥ hāra sampāto tiādi vuttam tattha katamaḥ saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ āvaṭṭa hāra sampāto nāma ati pucchati
translated: “What is the method of the turning and the method of the string?” Herein, he asks: what is the difference in the exposition called the method of the turning and the method of the string?🔽Because it is necessary to ask: “What are the Threads’ meanings and how are they to be turned? ” he says “ Therefore” , etc.

original: “Katame suttatthā kathaṃ āvaṭṭetabbā”ti pucchitabbattā “tasmā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Nekkhammasaṅkappasaṅkhātasammāsaṅkappabahulo
analyzed: katame sutta atthā katham āvaṭṭetabbā ti pucchitabba ttā tasmā itiādi vuttam nekkhamma saṅkappa saṅkhāta sammāsaṅkappa bahulaḥ
translated: One who is rich in right reflection called reflection on renunciation

original: kasiṇādivasena, avihiṃsāsaṅkappasaṅkhātasammāsaṅkappabahulo mettādivasena adhigatāya
analyzed: kasiṇa ādi vasena avihiṃsā saṅkappa saṅkhāta sammāsaṅkappa bahulaḥ mettā ādi vasena adhigatāya
translated: by means of the kasiṇa, etc., and one who is rich in right reflection called reflection on harmlessness by means of loving-kindness, etc.,🔽is one who steadies his cognizance by means of the unification of cognizance already reached. He is called one who guards cognizance against defilement.

original: cittekaggatāya cittaṃ ṭhapento saṃkilesato rakkhitacitto nāma hoti, “tasmā rakkhitacittassa,🔽sammāsaṅkappagocaro”ti iminā rakkhitacitte vutte sati yā ekaggatā āvaṭṭetabbā, sā
analyzed: citta ekagga tāya cittam ṭhapento saṃkilesataḥ rakkhita cittaḥ nāma hoti tasmā rakkhita cittassa  sammā saṅkappa gocaraḥ ti iminā rakkhita citte vutte sati yā ekagga tā āvaṭṭetabbā sā
translated: Therefore, for one who guards cognizance,🔽the range of right reflection is the unification that should be turned by means of the mindfulness stated in the words “ The range of right reflection” .🔽This unification is serenity.

original: ayaṃ ekaggatā samatho. “Sammādiṭṭhipurekkhāro”ti iminā sammādiṭṭhipurekkhāre vutte
analyzed: ayam ekagga tā samatho sammādiṭṭhi purekkhāro ti iminā sammādiṭṭhi purekkhāre vutte
translated: For one who has right view as his forerunner,🔽the understanding that should be turned by means of the mindfulness stated in the words “ For one who has right view as his forerunner” is this understanding.🔽This understanding is insight.

original: sati yā paññā āvaṭṭetabbā, sā ayaṃ paññā vipassanā. “Ñatvāna udayabbaya”nti iminā
analyzed: sati yā paññā āvaṭṭetabbā sā ayam paññā vipassanā ñatvāna udayabbayanti iminā
translated: “ Having known rise and fall” ,

original: udayabbayañāṇasamannāgate vutte sati yā dukkhaparijānanā āvaṭṭetabbā, sā ayaṃ dukkhaparijānanā🔽dukkhapariññā. “Thinamiddhābhibhū bhikkhū”ti iminā puggalādhiṭṭhānena yaṃ thinamiddhābhibhavanaṃ
analyzed: udaya bbaya ñāṇa samannāgate vutte sati yā dukkha parijānanā āvaṭṭetabbā sā ayam dukkha parijānanā  dukkha pariññā thinamiddha abhibhū bhikkhu iti iminā puggala adhiṭṭhānena yam thinamiddha abhibhavanam
translated: When the knowledge of rise and subsidence is mentioned, the full understanding of suffering that should be demonstrated is this full understanding of suffering.

original: vuttaṃ, idaṃ thinamiddhābhibhavanaṃ samudayappahānaṃ. “Sammā duggatiyo jahe”ti iminā
analyzed: vuttam idam thinam iddha abhibhavanam samudaya ppahānam sammā duggatiyaḥ jaheti iminā
translated: The abandoning of origin is this overcoming of agitation and lethargy mentioned in the passage beginning, “The bhikkhu should train himself thus: ‘I shall be an undeluded noble one, one who acts in full awareness when going forward and returning’ ” .

original: yo sabbaduggatijahanasaṅkhāto anuppādo vutto, so ayaṃ anuppādo nirodho. Iti dukkhapariññāya🔽pariññetabbaṃ dukkhasaccaṃ āvaṭṭetabbaṃ, samudayappahānena pahātabbaṃ samudayasaccaṃ
analyzed: yaḥ sabba duggati jahana saṅkhātaḥ anuppādaḥ vutto saḥ ayam anuppādaḥ nirodhaḥ iti dukkha pariññāya  pariññetabbam dukkha saccam āvaṭṭetabbam samudaya ppahānena pahātabbam samudaya saccam
translated: The cessation is this non-arising that is mentioned in the passage beginning, “He should abandon evil, unprofitable states that have arisen” .

original: āvaṭṭetabbaṃ, nirodhena nirodhasaccaṃ āvaṭṭetabbaṃ, samathavipassanāhi maggasaccaṃ🔽āvaṭṭetabbanti imāni cattāri saccāni āvaṭṭetabbānīti.
analyzed: āvaṭṭetabbam nirodhena nirodha saccam āvaṭṭetabbam samatha vipassanāhi magga saccam  āvaṭṭetabbanti imāni cattāri saccāni āvaṭṭetabbāni iti
translated: Thus the truth of suffering should be demonstrated by the full understanding of suffering, the truth of origin by the abandoning of origin, the truth of cessation by the cessation, and the truth of the path by serenity and insight.🔽This is how the four truths should be demonstrated.

original: “Ettakova āvaṭṭo hārasampāto paripuṇṇo”ti vattabbattā “niyutto āvaṭṭo hārasampāto”ti
analyzed: ettakaḥ iva āvaṭṭaḥ hāra sampāto paripuṇṇo ti vattabbattā niyuttaḥ āvaṭṭaḥ hāra sampāto ti
translated: “This demonstration of the four truths by the four steps is the complete demonstration of the four truths by the four steps” .

original: vuttaṃ. Yena yena saṃvaṇṇanāvisesabhūtena āvaṭṭahārasampātena samathādayo āvaṭṭetabbā,
analyzed: vuttam yena yena saṃvaṇṇanā visesa bhūtena āvaṭṭahāra sampātena samatha ādayaḥ āvaṭṭetabbā
translated: The particular kind of commendation, which is a means of access, by which the kinds of skill in aggregates, etc., are to be accessed,

original: so so saṃvaṇṇanāvisesabhūto āvaṭṭahārasampāto niyutto yathārahaṃ niddhāretvā yujjitabboti attho gahetabboti.
analyzed: saḥ saḥ saṃvaṇṇanā visesa bhūtaḥ āvaṭṭahāra sampātaḥ niyuttaḥ yathāraham niddhāretvā yujjitabbaḥ iti atthaḥ gahetabbaḥ iti
translated: is defined as a particular kind of commendation, which is a means of access. It should be taken as meaning that it should be grasped by extracting it as appropriate.

original: Iti āvaṭṭahārasampāte sattibalānurūpā racitā
analyzed: iti āvaṭṭahāra sampāte satti bala anurūpā racitā
translated: So this has been composed in accordance with the force of the simile of the saw.

original: Vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The exposition of the means of persistence is ended.

original: Paṇḍitehi pana…pe… gahetabboti.
analyzed: paṇḍitehi panape gahetabbo ti
translated: But it should be grasped by the wise, etc.

original: 8. Vibhattihārasampātavibhāvanā
translated: Exposition of the means of analysis

original: 70. Yena yena āvaṭṭahārasampātena suttatthā āvaṭṭetabbā, so āvaṭṭahārasampāto paripuṇṇo,🔽“katamo vibhattihārasampāto”ti pucchitabbattā “tattha katamo vibhattihārasampāto”tiādi
analyzed: yena yena āvaṭṭahāra sampātena sutta tthā āvaṭṭetabbā saḥ āvaṭṭahāra sampātaḥ paripuṇṇaḥ  katamaḥ vibhatti hāra sampāto ti pucchitabba ttā tattha katamaḥ vibhatti hāra sampāto tiādi
translated: The means of access by which the meanings of the suttas are to be accessed is complete,🔽“What is the means of analysis?” should be asked.

original: vuttaṃ. Tattha katamo saṃvaṇṇanāviseso vibhattihārasampāto nāmāti pucchati.
analyzed: vuttam tattha katamaḥ saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ vibhatti hāra sampātaḥ nāma ati pucchati
translated: “What is the particular kind of commendation called the means of analysis?” he asks.

original: “Katame suttatthā kattha vibhattā”ti pucchitabbattā “tasmā rakkhitacittassā”tiādi
analyzed: katame pucchitabbattā tasmā rakkhita cittassa atiādi
translated: “What are the meanings of the suttas? Where are they analysed?” should be asked.

original: vuttaṃ. Yā “tasmā…pe… gocaro”ti gāthā vuttā, tissaṃ gāthāyaṃ vutto kusalapakkho dhammo
analyzed: vuttam yā gocaraḥ iti gāthā vuttā tissam gāthāyam vutto kusala pakkhaḥ dhammo
translated: This is what was said. The verse that goes: “Therefore, having seen a visible object with the eye,🔽he should not grasp at its general appearance or secondary characteristics.🔽He should practice restraint over the eye faculty.🔽This is the way to restrain the eye faculty.”

original: kusalapakkhena dhammena satisaṃvaro dhammo niddisitabbo vibhajitabbo, akusalapakkhena
analyzed: kusala pakkhena dhammena sati saṃvaraḥ dhammaḥ niddisitabbaḥ vibhajitabbaḥ akusala pakkhena
translated: The profitable side of things stated in this verse should be demonstrated and analyzed by means of the profitable side of things,

original: dhammena niddisitabbo vibhajitabbo.🔽Kathaṃ? “Rakkhitacittassā”ti padena vutto kusalapakkho satisaṃvaro dhammo “cakkhudvārasaṃvaro…pe…
analyzed: dhammena niddisitabbaḥ vibhajitabbaḥ  katham rakkhita cittassa ati padena vutto kusala pakkho sati saṃvaro dhammo
translated: and it should be demonstrated and analyzed by means of the unprofitable side of things.

original: manodvārasaṃvaro”ti chabbidhena kusalapakkhena dhammena niddisitabbo vibhajitabbo.🔽“Sammāsaṅkappo”ti padena vutto kusalapakkho sammāsaṅkappo dhammo “nekkhammasaṅkappo
analyzed: manodvāra saṃvaro ti chabbidhena kusala pakkhena dhammena niddisitabbaḥ vibhajitabbaḥ  sammāsaṅkappo ti padena vutto kusala pakkho sammāsaṅkappaḥ dhammo nekkhamma saṅkappo
translated: How? The profitable side of things stated in the words “For one who guards the mind” should be demonstrated and analyzed by means of the sixfold profitable side of things beginning with “Restraint of the eye faculty” and ending with “Restraint of the mind faculty.”

original: abyāpāda-saṅkappo avihiṃsāsaṅkappo”ti tividhena kusalapakkhena dhammena vibhajitabbo.
analyzed: a byāpāda saṅkappo a vihiṃsā saṅkappo ti tividhena kusala pakkhena dhammena vibhajitabbo
translated: The profitable side of things stated in the words “Right intention” should be analyzed by means of the threefold profitable side of things beginning with “Intention of renunciation” and ending with “Intention of non-ill will.”

original: “Sammādiṭṭhipurekkhāro”ti padena vuttā kusalapakkhā dhammajāti “dukkhe ñāṇaṃ, dukkhasamudaye
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhi purekkhāro ti padena vuttā kusala pakkhā dhamma jāti dukkhe ñāṇam dukkha samudaye
translated: The profitable side of things stated in the words “With right view as his forerunner” should be analyzed by means of the profitable side of things beginning with “Knowledge of suffering” and ending with “Knowledge of the path.”

original: ñāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhe ñāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhagāminipaṭipadāya ñāṇaṃ, pubbante ñāṇaṃ,
analyzed: ñāṇam dukkha nirodhe ñāṇam dukkha nirodha gāmini paṭipadāya ñāṇam pubbante ñāṇam
translated: Knowledge of the origin of suffering, knowledge of the cessation of suffering, knowledge of the way leading to the cessation of suffering, knowledge of the past,

original: aparante ñāṇaṃ, pubbantāparante ñāṇaṃ, idappaccayatāpaṭiccasamuppannesu dhammesu
analyzed: apara ante ñāṇam pubbanta apara ante ñāṇam idappaccaya tā paṭicca samuppannesu dhammesu
translated: knowledge of the future, knowledge of the past and future, knowledge of the states subject to cause and condition,

original: ñāṇa”nti aṭṭhavidhena kusalapakkhena dhammena vibhajitabbā. “Ñatvāna udayabbaya”nti🔽padena vuttaṃ kusalapakkhaudayabbayañāṇaṃ dhammajātaṃ paññāsavidhena udayabbayañāṇena
analyzed: ñāṇanti aṭṭhavidhena kusala pakkhena dhammena vibhajitabbā ñatvāna udayabbayanti  padena vuttam kusala pakkha odaya bbaya ñāṇam dhamma jātam paññāsavidhena udaya bbaya ñāṇena
translated: knowledge of the Dhamma.” The Dhamma, which is the profitable side, should be analyzed according to the eight kinds of knowledge. “Having known the rise and fall”

original: kusalapakkhena vibhajitabbaṃ. “Thinamiddhābhibhū”ti padena vuttaṃ thinamiddhābhibhavanaṃ🔽kusalapakkhaṃ dhammajātaṃ “sotāpattimaggābhibhavanaṃ sakadāgāmimaggābhibhavanaṃ anāgāmimaggābhibhavanaṃ
analyzed: kusala pakkhena vibhajitabbam thinamiddha abhibhūti padena vuttam thinamiddha abhibhavanam  kusala pakkham dhamma jātam sotāpatti magga abhibhavanam sakadāgāmi magga abhibhavanam anāgāmi magga abhibhavanam
translated: is the knowledge of the rise and fall of the profitable side stated by the line “Having known the rise and fall.” That knowledge of the rise and fall of the profitable side should be analyzed according to the fifty kinds of knowledge of rise and fall. “Having overcome doubt”

original: arahattamaggābhibhavana”nti catubbidhena kusalapakkhena vibhajitabbaṃ.
analyzed: arahatta magga abhibhavananti catubbidhena kusala pakkhena vibhajitabbam
translated: is the profitable side stated by the line “Having overcome doubt.” That profitable side should be analyzed according to the four kinds of profitable side, namely, “overcoming the stream-entry path, overcoming the once-return path, overcoming the non-return path, overcoming the Arahant path.”

original: Satisaṃvaro kusalapakkho “lokiyo satisaṃvaro, lokuttaro satisaṃvaro”ti dubbidhena
analyzed: sati saṃvaro kusala pakkhaḥ lokiyaḥ sati saṃvaro lokuttaraḥ sati saṃvaraḥ ti dubbidhena
translated: The profitable side of restraint by mindfulness should be analyzed according to the two kinds, namely, “mundane restraint by mindfulness, supramundane restraint by mindfulness.”

original: vibhajitabboti. Lokiyo satisaṃvaro kāmāvacarovāti ekavidhena vibhajitabbo. Lokuttarā
analyzed: vibhajitabbo ti lokiyaḥ sati saṃvaro ekavidhena vibhajitabbaḥ lokuttarā
translated: It can be classed as one kind, namely, mundane restraint of mindfulness.

original: satisaṃvaro “dassanabhūmi, bhāvanābhūmī”ti dubbidhena vibhajitabbo. Kāmāvacaro satisaṃvaro🔽“kāyānupassanāsatisaṃvaro vedanānupassanāsatisaṃvaro cittānupassanāsatisaṃvaro dhammānupassanāsatisaṃvaro”ti
analyzed: sati saṃvaraḥ dassana bhūmi bhāvanā bhūmi iti dubbidhena vibhajitabbaḥ kāmāvacaraḥ sati saṃvaro  kāya anupassanā sati saṃvaraḥ vedanā anupassanā sati saṃvaraḥ citta anupassanā sati saṃvaraḥ dhamma anupassanā sati saṃvaraḥ iti
translated: It can be classed as two kinds, namely, mundane and supramundane restraint of mindfulness.🔽It can be classed as four kinds, namely, restraint of mindfulness by contemplation of the body, and so on.

original: catubbidhena vibhajitabbo. Lokuttaro satisaṃvaropi tathā catubbidhena vibhajitabbo.
analyzed: catubbidhena vibhajitabbaḥ lokuttaraḥ sati saṃvaraḥ api tathā catubbidhena vibhajitabbaḥ
translated: It can be classed as four kinds, namely, mundane and supramundane restraint of mindfulness by contemplation of the body, and so on.

original: Sammāsaṅkappasammādiṭṭhiyopi lokiyalokuttaravasena dubbidhādibhedena vibhajitabbā.
analyzed: lokiya lokuttara vasena dubbidha ādi bhedena vibhajitabbā
translated: Right thought and right view can be classed as two kinds, namely, mundane and supramundane, and so on.

original: Padaṭṭhānenapi padaṭṭhānahārasampāte vuttanayena vibhajitabbā.🔽Akusalapakkhena “arakkhitena cittenā”ti padena vutto asaṃvaro “cakkhuasaṃvaro …pe…
analyzed: padaṭṭhānena api padaṭṭhāna hāra sampāte vutta nayena vibhajitabbā  akusala pakkhena arakkhitena cittena ati padena vuttaḥ asaṃvaro cakkhu asaṃvaro pe
translated: They can be classed according to the “refrain” and according to the “refrain” in the “exposition of the faculties” .

original: kāyaasaṃvaro, copanakāyaasaṃvaro, vācāasaṃvaro, manoasaṃvaro”ti aṭṭhavidhena vibhajitabbo.
analyzed: kāya asaṃvaro copana kāya asaṃvaro vācā asaṃvaro manaḥ asaṃvaro ti aṭṭhavidhena vibhajitabbo
translated: Non-restraint, which is mentioned in the unprofitable section in the phrase “with unrestrained mind” , can be classed as eight kinds, namely, non-restraint as to eye, and so on.

original: “Micchādiṭṭhihatenā”ti padena gahito micchāsaṅkappo “kāmavitakko byāpādavitakko vihiṃsāvitakko”ti🔽tividhena vibhajitabbo. “Micchādiṭṭhī”ti padena vuttā micchādiṭṭhi “dukkhe aññāṇaṃ…pe…idappaccayatāpaṭiccasamuppannesu
analyzed: micchā diṭṭhi hatena ati padena gahitaḥ micchā saṅkappaḥ kāma vitakkaḥ byāpāda vitakkaḥ vihiṃsā vitakkaḥ ti  tividhena vibhajitabbaḥ micchādiṭṭhi iti padena vuttā micchādiṭṭhi dukkhe
translated: Wrong thinking, which is included by the words “with wrong view as its condition,” should be analyzed into the three kinds: sensual desire, ill will, and cruelty.

original: dhammesu aññāṇa”nti aṭṭhavidhena vibhajitabbā, dvāsaṭṭhidiṭṭhividhenapi vibhajitabbā.
analyzed: dhammesu aññāṇanti aṭṭhavidhena vibhajitabbā dvāsaṭṭhi diṭṭhi vidhena api vibhajitabbā
translated: Wrong view, which is mentioned by the words “wrong view,” should be analyzed into the eight kinds: “ignorance of suffering … down to … ignorance of the way leading to the cessation of suffering,” and also into the sixty-two views.

original: Thinamiddhaṃ pañcavidhena sasaṅkhārikavidhena vibhajitabbaṃ.
analyzed: thinamiddham pañcavidhena sa saṅkhārika vidhena vibhajitabbam
translated: Sloth and torpor should be analyzed into the fivefold analysis of what is compounded.

original: “Ettakova vibhattihārasampāto paripuṇṇo”ti vattabbattā “niyutto vibhattihārasampāto”ti🔽vuttaṃ. Yena yena saṃvaṇṇanāvisesabhūtena vibhattihārasampātena suttappadesatthā🔽vibhattā, so so saṃvaṇṇanāvisesabhūto vibhattihārasampāto niyuttoti yathāraha niddhāretvā
analyzed: ettakaḥ iva vibhatti hāra sampāto paripuṇṇo ti vattabbattā niyuttaḥ vibhatti hāra sampāto ti  vuttam yena yena saṃvaṇṇanā visesa bhūtena vibhatti hāra sampātena sutta ppadesa atthā  vibhattā saḥ saḥ saṃvaṇṇanā visesa bhūtaḥ vibhatti hāra sampātaḥ niyuttaḥ iti yathāraha niddhāretvā
translated: In order to show that the fulfilment of the analysis of terms is complete in this way, it is said: “The fulfilment of the analysis of terms is completed by the method of definition.”

original: yujjitabboti attho gahetabboti.
analyzed: yujjitabbaḥ iti atthaḥ gahetabbaḥ iti
translated: The meaning is that the fulfilment of the analysis of terms, which is a special kind of exposition, should be extracted and applied in the way appropriate to each case, in order to expound the meaning of the passage of the text by means of the fulfilment of the analysis of terms, which is a special kind of exposition.

original: Iti vibhattihārasampāte sattibalānurūpā racitā
analyzed: iti vibhatti hāra sampāte satti bala anurūpā racitā
translated: So this is the way of the analysis and the way of the combination fulfilled by the power of the rod.

original: Vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vibhāvanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The analysis is finished.

original: Paṇḍitehi pana…pe… gahetabboti.
analyzed: paṇḍitehi panape gahetabbo ti
translated: But the wise should take it thus …

original: 9. Parivattanahārasampātavibhāvanā🔽71. Yena yena vibhattihārasampātena suttappadesatthā vibhattā, so vibhattihārasampāto
analyzed: parivattana hāra sampāta vibhāvanā  yena yena vibhatti hāra sampātena sutta ppadesa tthā vibhattā so vibhatti hāra sampātaḥ
translated: The analysis of the way of the combination by the way of the reversal🔽The way of the analysis and the way of the combination by which the meaning of the passage of the Thread is analysed is fulfilled.

original: paripuṇṇo, “katamo parivattanahārasampāto”ti pucchitabbattā “tattha katamo parivattano🔽hārasampāto”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: paripuṇṇo katamo parivattana hāra sampāto ti pucchitabbattā tattha katamo parivattano  hāra sampātaḥ tiādi vuttam
translated: “What is the way of the combination by the way of the reversal?”

original: “Katame suttappadesatthā kathaṃ parivattetabbā”ti pucchitabbattā “tasmā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: katame sutta ppadesa tthā katham parivattetabbā ati pucchitabba ttā tasmā itiādi vuttam
translated: “What is the meaning of the passage of the Thread? How is it to be reversed?”🔽“Therefore … … the province” .

original: Yā “tasmā…pe… gocaro”ti gāthā vuttā, tāya gāthāya yā samathavipassanā niddhāritā,
analyzed: yā gocarā iti gāthā vuttā tāya gāthāya yā samatha vipassanā niddhāritā
translated: The concentration and insight demonstrated by that verse

original: tāya samathavipassanāya bhāvitāya akusalānaṃ nirodho phalaṃ payojanaṃ hoti, pariññātaṃ
analyzed: tāya samatha vipassanāya bhāvitāya akusalānam nirodho phalam payojanam hoti pariññātam
translated: are developed, and the fruit and purpose is the cessation of the unprofitable.🔽Suffering is fully understood,

original: dukkhaṃ hoti, samudayo pahīno hoti, maggo bhāvito hotīti parivattetabbo. Paṭipakkhena
analyzed: dukkham hoti samudayaḥ pahīnaḥ hoti maggaḥ bhāvitaḥ hoti iti parivattetabbaḥ paṭipakkhena
translated: the origin is abandoned, the path is developed.🔽By the opposite

original: pana samathavipassanāya abhāvitāya akusalānaṃ anirodho, apariññātaṃ dukkhaṃ, samudayo
