Since the establishment of the True Nature of the Dispensation is included in the root-terms in the section on the ‘Collection of Threads’ and so on, and is not shown in its own individual form, therefore

original: mūlapadehi paṭṭhānaṃ niddhāretabbaṃ, evaṃ paṭṭhānatopi mūlapadāni niddhāretabbānīti
analyzed: mūla padehi paṭṭhānam niddhāretabbam evam paṭṭhānataḥ pi mūla padāni niddhāretabbāni iti
translated: just as the establishment of the True Nature of the Dispensation can be deduced from the root-terms, so too the root-terms can be deduced from the establishment of the True Nature of the Dispensation.

original: dassanatthaṃ ‘aṭṭhārasa mūlapadā kuhiṃ daṭṭhabbā? Sāsanapaṭṭhāne’ti āhā”ti –🔽Vuttaṃ. Sāsanapaṭṭhāne aṭṭhārasa mūlapadā daṭṭhabbāti ācariyena vuttā, “katamaṃ taṃ
analyzed: dassana attham aṭṭhārasa mūla padā kuhim daṭṭhabbā sāsana paṭṭhānā iti āha ati  vuttam sāsanapaṭṭhāne aṭṭhārasa mūlapadāḥ daṭṭhabbā ti ācariyena vuttā katamam tam
translated: “The eighteen root-terms should be seen in the Sāsana-paṭṭhāna.”

original: sāsanapaṭṭhāna”nti pucchitabbattā “tattha katamaṃ sāsanapaṭṭhāna”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Tatthāti
analyzed: sāsana paṭṭhānam ti pucchitabba ttā tattha katamam sāsana paṭṭhāna ntiādi vuttam tattha ati
translated: The teacher has said that the eighteen root-terms should be seen in the Sāsana-paṭṭhāna. “What is that Sāsana-paṭṭhāna?” should be asked. Therefore, “What is the Sāsana-paṭṭhāna?” is said. Therein means

original: tesu aṭṭhārasamūlapadasāsanapaṭṭhānesu katamaṃ taṃ sāsanapaṭṭhānanti idāni mayā niddhāriyamānaṃ🔽bhagavatā desitaṃ saṃkilesabhāgiyādisuttaṃ sāsanapaṭṭhānaṃ nāmāti vissajjeti. Sāsananti🔽pariyattisāsanaṃ. Paṭṭhānanti tassa pariyattisāsanassa saṃkilesabhāgiyatādīhi pakārehi
analyzed: tesu aṭṭhārasa mūlapada sāsana paṭṭhānesu katamam tam sāsana paṭṭhānam ti idāni mayā niddhāriyamānam  bhagavatā desitam saṃkilesabhāgiya ādi suttam sāsana paṭṭhānam nāma ati vissajjeti sāsananti  pariyatti sāsanam paṭṭhānan ti tassa pariyatti sāsanassa saṃkilesa bhāgiya tā ādīhi pakārehi
translated: among those eighteen root-terms and the Sāsana-paṭṭhāna. What is that Sāsana-paṭṭhāna? Now, the sutta taught by the Blessed One, which is being extracted by me,🔽is called the Sāsana-paṭṭhāna. Sāsana means

original: ṭhānaṃ pavattanaṃ paṭṭhānaṃ, taṃdīpanasuttaṃ pana idha paṭṭhānaṃ nāma. Tena vuttaṃ
analyzed: ṭhānam pavattanam paṭṭhānam taṃdīpana suttam pana idha paṭṭhānam nāma tena vuttam
translated: the scriptures. Paṭṭhāna means the establishment, the occurrence, of that scriptural sāsana by means of the modes beginning with the states partaking of corruption. The sutta that illustrates that is called the paṭṭhāna here. Therefore it is said:

original: – “saṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ sutta”ntiādi. Atha vā sāsananti adhisīlaadhicittaadhipaññāsikkhattayaṃ
analyzed: saṃkilesa bhāgiyam suttanti ādi atha vā adhi sīla adhicitta adhi paññā sikkhattayam
translated: “The sutta partaking of corruption,” and so on. Or alternatively, sāsana means the three trainings in higher virtue, higher consciousness, and higher wisdom;

original: sāsanaṃ nāma, taṃ sikkhattayaṃ patiṭṭhahati etena saṃkilesādināti paṭṭhānaṃ, sikkhattayassa
analyzed: sāsanam nāma tam sikkhattayam patiṭṭhahati etena saṃkilesa ādinā ati paṭṭhānam sikkhattayassa
translated: The Dispensation is established in the three trainings. It is the establishment of the three trainings.

original: sāsanassa paṭṭhānanti sāsanapaṭṭhānaṃ. Tadādhārabhūtaṃ suttampi ṭhānyūpacārato sāsanapaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: sāsanassa paṭṭhānanti sāsana paṭṭhānam tad ādhāra bhūtam suttam pi sāsana paṭṭhānam
translated: The establishment of the Dispensation is the establishment of the Dispensation. The sutta that is the basis for that is called the establishment of the Dispensation by extension.

original: nāma. Taṃ sāsanapaṭṭhānasuttaṃ sarūpato dassetuṃ –🔽“Saṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ, vāsanābhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ, nibbedhabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ, asekkhabhāgiyaṃ
analyzed: nāma tam sāsana paṭṭhāna suttam sarūpataḥ dassetum  saṃkilesa bhāgiyam suttam vāsanā bhāgiyam suttam nibbedha bhāgiyam suttam asekkha bhāgiyam
translated: To show the sutta on the establishment of the Dispensation in its own nature,🔽“A sutta that is concerned with corruption, a sutta that is concerned with the hinterland, a sutta that is concerned with penetration, a sutta that is concerned with the adept,

original: suttaṃ, saṃkilesabhāgiyañca vāsanābhāgiyañca suttaṃ, saṃkilesabhāgiyañca nibbedhabhāgiyañca
analyzed: suttam saṃkilesa bhāgiyañca vāsanā bhāgiyañca suttam saṃkilesa bhāgiyañca nibbedha bhāgiyañca
translated: a sutta that is concerned with corruption and the hinterland, a sutta that is concerned with corruption and penetration,

original: suttaṃ, saṃkilesabhāgiyañca asekkhabhāgiyañca suttaṃ, saṃkilesabhāgiyañca nibbedhabhāgiyañca🔽asekkhabhāgiyañca suttaṃ, saṃkilesabhāgiyañca vāsanābhāgiyañca nibbedhabhāgiyañca
analyzed: suttam saṃkilesa bhāgiyañca asekkha bhāgiyañca suttam saṃkilesa bhāgiyañca nibbedha bhāgiyañca  asekkha bhāgiyam ca suttam saṃkilesa bhāgiyam ca vāsanā bhāgiyam ca nibbedha bhāgiyam ca
translated: a sutta that is concerned with corruption and the adept, a sutta that is concerned with corruption and penetration and the adept,

original: suttaṃ, vāsanābhāgiyañca nibbedhabhāgiyañca suttaṃ, taṇhāsaṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ,
analyzed: suttam vāsanā bhāgiyañca nibbedha bhāgiyañca suttam taṇhā saṃkilesa bhāgiyam suttam
translated: a sutta that is concerned with corruption and the hinterland and penetration and the adept, a sutta that is concerned with the hinterland and penetration, a sutta that is concerned with the corruption of craving,

original: diṭṭhisaṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ, duccaritasaṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ, taṇhāvodānabhāgiyaṃ
analyzed: diṭṭhi saṃkilesa bhāgiyam suttam duccarita saṃkilesa bhāgiyam suttam taṇhā vodāna bhāgiyam
translated: Discourse dealing with corruption by view, discourse dealing with corruption by misconduct, discourse dealing with purification by craving,

original: suttaṃ, diṭṭhivodānabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ, duccaritavodānabhāgiyaṃ sutta”nti –
analyzed: suttam diṭṭhi vodāna bhāgiyam suttam duccarita vodāna bhāgiyam suttanti
translated: discourse dealing with purification by view, discourse dealing with purification by misconduct” .

original: Vuttaṃ. “Tesu suttesu ye saṃkilesādayo bhagavatā vuttā, tesu saṃkilesādīsu saṃkileso
analyzed: vuttam tesu suttesu ye saṃkilesa ādayaḥ bhagavatā vuttā tesu saṃkilesa ādīsu saṃkilesaḥ
translated: This has been said. “In these discourses, the corruptions, etc., stated by the Blessed One, how many kinds of corruption are there among these corruptions, etc.,

original: kittako”ti pucchitabbattā “tattha saṃkileso tividho taṇhāsaṃkileso diṭṭhisaṃkileso🔽duccaritasaṃkileso”ti vuttaṃ. Tatthāti tesu suttantesu saṃkilesādīsu dhammesu. “Tividhe🔽tasmiṃ saṃkilese taṇhāsaṃkileso katamena kusalena visujjhatī”ti pucchitabbattā “tattha
analyzed: kittako ti pucchitabbattā tattha saṃkilesaḥ tividhaḥ taṇhā saṃkileso diṭṭhi saṃkileso  duccarita saṃkileso ti vuttam tattha ati tesu suttantesu saṃkilesa ādīsu dhammesu tividhe  tasmin saṃkilese taṇhā saṃkileso katamena kusalena visujjhati iti pucchitabba ttā tattha
translated: beginning with corruption? “ It is because of the need to ask this question that the following is stated: “Herein, corruption is threefold: corruption by craving, corruption by view,

original: taṇhāsaṃkileso samathena visujjhatī”ti vuttaṃ. Tatthāti tasmiṃ tividhe taṇhāsaṃkilesādike.
analyzed: taṇhā saṃkilesaḥ samathena visujjhati iti vuttam tattha ati tasmin tividhe taṇhā saṃkilesa ādike
translated: corruption by misconduct” . Herein: among these states beginning with corruption in these discourses. “In this threefold corruption, by what profitable is corruption by craving purified? “ It is because of the need to ask this question that the following is stated: “Herein, corruption by craving is purified by serenity” . Herein: in this threefold corruption beginning with corruption by craving.

original: “So samatho khandhesu katamo khandho”ti pucchitabbattā “so samatho samādhikkhandho”ti
analyzed: so samathaḥ khandhesu katamaḥ khandho ti pucchitabba ttā so samathaḥ samādhi khandho ti
translated: “This serenity, which is one of the categories, is which category? “ It is because of the need to ask this question that the following is stated: “This serenity is the concentration category” .

original: vuttaṃ. “Diṭṭhisaṃkileso kena visujjhatī”ti pucchitabbattā “diṭṭhisaṃkileso vipassanāya
analyzed: vuttam diṭṭhi saṃkileso kena visujjhati iti pucchitabba ttā diṭṭhi saṃkileso vipassanāya
translated: “By what is the defilement of view purified?” Because this must be asked, it is said: “The defilement of view is purified by insight.”

original: visujjhatī”ti vuttaṃ. “Sā vipassanā katamo khandho”ti vattabbattā “sā vipassanā paññākkhandho”ti
analyzed: visujjhati iti vuttam sā vipassanā katamaḥ khandho ti vattabbattā sā vipassanā paññā kkhandho ti
translated: “What category is that insight?” Because this must be said, it is said: “That insight is the category of understanding.”

original: vuttaṃ. “Duccaritasaṃkileso kena visujjhatī”ti vattabbattā “duccaritasaṃkileso sucaritena🔽visujjhatī”ti vuttaṃ. “Taṃ sucaritaṃ katamo khandho”ti vattabbattā “taṃ sucaritaṃ
analyzed: vuttam duccarita saṃkileso kena visujjhati iti vattabbattā duccarita saṃkilesaḥ su caritena  visujjhati iti vuttam tam su caritam katamaḥ khandho ti vattabbattā tam su caritam
translated: “By what is the defilement of misconduct purified?” Because this must be said, it is said: “The defilement of misconduct is purified by good conduct.”🔽“What category is that good conduct?” Because this must be said, it is said: “That good conduct is the category of virtue.”

original: sīlakkhandho”ti vuttaṃ. “Tasmiṃ sīle ṭhitassa puggalassa kiṃ bhavatī”ti vattabbattā
analyzed: sīla khandhaḥ ti vuttam tasmin sīle ṭhitassa puggalassa kim bhavati iti vattabbattā
translated: “What happens to the person who is established in that virtue?” Because this must be said,

original: “tassa sīle patiṭṭhitassā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Sīle sucaritasaṅkhāte sīlakkhandhe patiṭṭhitassa
analyzed: tassa sīle patiṭṭhitassa atiādi vuttam sīle su carita saṅkhāte sīlakkhandhe patiṭṭhitassa
translated: it is said: “For one established in virtue,” etc. For the virtuous person who is established in virtue, which is called good conduct, the category of virtue,

original: tassa sīlavantassa puggalassa bhavesu kāmabhavarūpārūpabhavesu āsatti bhavapatthanā
analyzed: tassa sīlavantassa puggalassa bhavesu kāma bhava rūpa arūpa bhavesu āsatti bhava patthanā
translated: there is attachment to, and longing for, existences, i.e. the existences of the sense sphere, the fine-material sphere, and the immaterial sphere.

original: yadi uppajjati, evaṃsāyanti evaṃ assa ayanti padacchedo. Evaṃ sati assa sīle patiṭṭhitassa
analyzed: yadi uppajjati evam assa padacchedaḥ evam sati assa sīle patiṭṭhitassa
translated: If it arises, it goes thus: thus is the analysis of the words. When it is thus, for one who is established in virtue,

original: ayaṃ āsatti bhavapatthanā samathavipassanābhāvanāmayapuññakiriyavatthu ca bhavati,
analyzed: ayam āsatti bhava patthanā samatha vipassanā bhāvanā maya puñña kiriya vatthu ca bhavati
translated: If it arises, it is thus that it comes to be. The analysis of the words is this: “Evaṃsāyanti” = “evaṃ assa ayanti.” When it is thus, then this coming to be is the aspiration for becoming, and it is the basis for the accumulation of merit consisting in the development of serenity and insight.

original: ca-saddena dānamayasīlamayapuññakiriyavatthu ca bhavatīti attho saṅgahito. Tatrāti
analyzed: ca saddena dāna maya sīla maya puñña kiriya vatthu ca bhavati iti attho saṅgahito tatra ati
translated: The word “ca” in the text includes the basis for the accumulation of merit consisting in giving and virtue.🔽“Tattha” = in those sensual-sphere, fine-material-sphere, and immaterial-sphere existences.

original: tesu kāmabhavarūpārūpabhavesu upapattiyā saṃvattatīti.
analyzed: tesu kāma bhava rūpa arūpa bhavesu upapattiyā saṃvattati iti
translated: “It leads to rebirth” = it leads to rebirth in those existences.

original: “Saṃkilesādayo yehi suttehi dassitā, tāni suttāni kittakānī”ti vattabbattā “imāni🔽cattāri suttānī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Asādhāraṇāni saṃkilesabhāgiyasuttavāsanābhāgiyasuttanibbedhabhāgiyasuttaasekkhabhāgiyasuttāni
analyzed: saṃkilesa ādayaḥ yehi suttehi dassitā tāni suttāni kittakāni iti vattabbattā imāni  cattāri suttāni itiādi vuttam asādhāraṇāni saṃkilesa bhāgiya sutta vāsanā bhāgiya sutta nibbedha bhāgiya sutta asekkha bhāgiya suttāni
translated: Since it should be said, “The suttas in which the defilements, etc., are shown are how many?,” it is said, “These four suttas.”🔽The four suttas are the suttas on the defilements, the suttas on the residues, the suttas on penetration, and the suttas on the adepts.

original: cattāri suttāni bhavanti, sādhāraṇāni saṃkilesabhāgiyavāsanābhāgiyasutta, saṃkilesabhāgiyanibbedhabhāgiyasutta,
analyzed: cattāri suttāni bhavanti sādhāraṇāni saṃkilesa bhāgiya vāsanā bhāgiya sutta saṃkilesa bhāgiya nibbedha bhāgiya sutta
translated: The common suttas are the suttas on the defilements and the residues, the suttas on the defilements and penetration,

original: saṃkilesabhāgiyaasekkhabhāgiyasutta, vāsanābhāgiyanibbedhabhāgiyasuttāni katāni missitāni
analyzed: saṃkilesa bhāgiya asekkha bhāgiya sutta vāsanā bhāgiya nibbedha bhāgiya suttāni katāni missitāni
translated: The Suttantas dealing with Corruption, and those dealing with the Adept, and those dealing with the Residues, and those dealing with Penetration, are made up and mixed.🔽They make four. So there are eight Suttantas. These same eight Suttantas of the kinds already stated

original: cattāri bhavanti. Iti aṭṭha suttāni bhavanti. Tāniyeva vuttappakārāni aṭṭha suttāni🔽bhavanti. Sādhāraṇāni vāsanābhāgiyaasekkhabhāgiyasuttanibbedhabhāgiyaasekkhabhāgiyasutta-
analyzed: cattāri bhavanti iti aṭṭha suttāni bhavanti tāni eva vutta ppakārāni aṭṭha suttāni  bhavanti sādhāraṇāni vāsanā bhāgiya asekkha bhāgiya sutta nibbedha bhāgiya asekkha bhāgiya sutta
translated: are made up and mixed. The Suttantas dealing with the Residues and those dealing with the Adept, which are common to both,🔽and the Suttantas dealing with Penetration and those dealing with the Adept, which are common to both,🔽and the Suttantas dealing with Corruption and those dealing with the Residues and those dealing with Penetration, which are common to both,

original: saṃkilesabhāgiyavāsanābhāgiyanibbedhabhāgiyasuttasaṃkilesa- bhāgiyavāsanābhāgiyaasekkhabhāgiyasutta-
analyzed: saṃkilesa bhāgiya vāsanā bhāgiya nibbedha bhāgiya sutta saṃkilesa bhāgiya vāsanā bhāgiya asekkha bhāgiya sutta
translated: and the Suttantas dealing with Corruption and those dealing with the Residues and those dealing with the Adept, which are common to both,🔽and the Suttantas dealing with Corruption and those dealing with Penetration and those dealing with the Adept, which are common to both,

original: saṃkilesabhāgiyanibbedhabhāgiyaasekkhabhāgiyasutta- vāsanābhāgiyanibbedhabhāgiyaasekkhabhāgiyasutta-🔽saṃkilesabhāgiyavāsanābhāgiyanibbedhabhāgiyaasekkhabhāgiyasutta- nevasaṃkilesabhāgiyanavāsanā-
analyzed: saṃkilesa bhāgiya nibbedha bhāgiya asekkha bhāgiya sutta vāsanā bhāgiya nibbedha bhāgiya asekkha bhāgiya sutta  saṃkilesa bhāgiya vāsanā bhāgiya nibbedha bhāgiya asekkha bhāgiya sutta neva saṃkilesa bhāgiya na vāsanā
translated: and the Suttantas dealing with the Residues and those dealing with Penetration and those dealing with the Adept, which are common to both,

original: bhāgiyananibbedhabhāgiyanaasekkhabhāgiyasuttāni katāni missitāni aṭṭha suttāni bhavantīti
analyzed: bhāgiya na nibbedha bhāgiya na asekkha bhāgiya suttāni katāni missitāni aṭṭha suttāni bhavanti iti
translated: and the Suttantas dealing with Corruption and those dealing with the Residues and those dealing with Penetration and those dealing with the Adept, which are common to both, and the Suttantas dealing with Neither-Corrupting-nor-Adept, which are not common to both, and the Suttantas dealing with the Residues, which are not common to both, and the Suttantas dealing with Penetration, which are not common to both, and the Suttantas dealing with the Adept, which are not common to both, are made up and mixed. They make eight Suttantas.

original: soḷasa suttāni bhavanti. Tesu soḷasasuttesu cattāri ekakāni suttāni ca cattāri dukāni
analyzed: soḷasa suttāni bhavanti tesu soḷasa suttesu cattāri ekakāni suttāni ca cattāri dukāni
translated: there are sixteen Suttas. Of these sixteen Suttas, four are single Suttas, and four are double Suttas,

original: suttāni ca dve tikāni ca pāḷiyaṃ āgatāni, dve dukāni suttāni ca dve tikāni ca dve🔽catukkāni suttāni ca aṭṭhakathāyaṃ āgatāni.
analyzed: suttāni ca dve tikāni ca pāḷiyam āgatāni dve dukāni suttāni ca dve tikāni ca dve  catukkāni suttāni ca aṭṭhakathāyam āgatāni
translated: and two are triple Suttas as they occur in the text, and two are double Suttas and two are triple Suttas as they occur in the Commentary.🔽“If the whole of the ninefold Scriptures, namely, the Discourses, mixed prose and verse, etc.,🔽is analysed by means of the method of analysis, then the whole of the ninefold Scriptures, namely, the Discourses, mixed prose and verse, etc.,

original: “Yadi paṭṭhānanayena vuttappakārāni soḷasa suttāniyeva vibhattāni, evaṃ sati suttageyyādinavavidhaṃ🔽sakalaṃ pariyattisāsanaṃ paṭṭhānanayena avibhattaṃ bhaveyyā”ti vattabbattā “imehi🔽soḷasahi suttehī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Paṭṭhānanayena vibhattehi soḷasahi imehi suttehi navavidhaṃ
analyzed: yadi paṭṭhāna nayena vutta ppakārāni soḷasa vibhattāni evam sati sutta geyya ādi navavidham  sakalam pariyatti sāsanam paṭṭhāna nayena avibhattam bhaveyya ati vattabbattā imehi  soḷasahi suttehi itiādi vuttam paṭṭhāna nayena vibhattehi soḷasahi imehi suttehi navavidham
translated: is analysed by means of the method of analysis, then the whole of the ninefold Scriptures, namely, the Discourses, mixed prose and verse, etc.,🔽is analysed by means of the method of analysis, then the whole of the ninefold Scriptures, namely, the Discourses, mixed prose and verse, etc.,🔽is analysed by means of the method of analysis, then the whole of the ninefold Scriptures, namely, the Discourses, mixed prose and verse, etc.,🔽is analysed by means of the method of analysis, then the whole of the ninefold Scriptures, namely, the Discourses, mixed prose and verse, etc.,

original: sakalaṃ pariyattisuttaṃ paṭṭhānanayena vibhattaṃyeva hutvā bhinnaṃ bhavati. Saṃkilesabhāgiyādipabhedāya
analyzed: sakalam pariyatti suttam paṭṭhāna nayena hutvā bhinnam bhavati saṃkilesa bhāgiya ādi pabhedāya
translated: is analysed by means of the method of analysis, then the whole of the ninefold Scriptures, namely, the Discourses, mixed prose and verse, etc.,🔽is analysed by means of the method of analysis, then the whole of the ninefold Scriptures, namely, the Discourses, mixed prose and verse, etc.,

original: gāthāya gāthā anuminitabbā, saṃkilesabhāgiyādipabhedena veyyākaraṇena veyyākaraṇaṃ
analyzed: gāthāya gāthā anuminitabbā saṃkilesabhāgiya ādi pabhedena veyyākaraṇena veyyākaraṇam
translated: is analysed by means of the method of analysis, then the whole of the ninefold Scriptures, namely, the Discourses, mixed prose and verse, etc.,🔽is analysed by means of the method of analysis, then the whole of the ninefold Scriptures, namely, the Discourses, mixed prose and verse, etc.,🔽is analysed by means of the method of analysis, then the whole of the ninefold Scriptures, namely, the Discourses, mixed prose and verse, etc.,🔽is analysed by means of the method of analysis, then the whole of the ninefold Scriptures, namely, the Discourses, mixed prose and verse, etc.,🔽is analysed by means of the method of analysis, then the whole of the ninefold Scriptures, namely, the Discourses, mixed prose and verse, etc.,🔽is analysed by means of the method of analysis, then the whole of the ninefold Scriptures, namely, the Discourses, mixed prose and verse, etc.,

original: anuminitabbaṃ. Saṃkilesabhāgiyādipabhedena suttena suttaṃ anuminitabbaṃ bhavatiyevāti.
analyzed: anuminitabbam saṃkilesa bhāgiya ādi pabhedena suttena suttam anuminitabbam bhavatiyā iva ati
translated: and it is by inference that one sutta can be inferred from another.

original: 90. “Tesu soḷasasu saṃkilesabhāgiyādīsu suttesu katamaṃ saṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ sutta”nti🔽pucchitabbattā “tattha katamaṃ saṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ sutta”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Tatthāti tesu
analyzed: tesu soḷasasu saṃkilesabhāgiya ādīsu suttesu katamam saṃkilesabhāgiyam suttan ti  pucchitabba ttā tattha katamam saṃkilesa bhāgiyam sutta nti ādi vuttam tattha ati tesu
translated: “Among these sixteen suttas beginning with those dealing with corruption, which sutta deals with corruption?”

original: soḷasasu saṃkilesabhāgiyādīsu suttesu katamaṃ suttaṃ saṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ nāmāti pucchati.
analyzed: soḷasasu saṃkilesabhāgiya ādīsu suttesu katamam suttam saṃkilesabhāgiyam suttam nāma ati pucchati
translated: Because this question has to be asked, the following is stated: “Herein, which sutta deals with corruption?” Herein, among these sixteen suttas beginning with those dealing with corruption, which sutta is called one dealing with corruption?

original: “Kāmandhā jālasañchannā, taṇhāchadanachāditā;
analyzed: kāmandhā jāla sañchannā taṇhā chadana chāditā
translated: “Blind with lust, veiled in a net, covered by a canopy of craving,

original: Pamattabandhanābaddhā, macchāva kumināmukhe;
analyzed: kuminā mukhe
translated: Bound by the fetter of negligence, like fish in the mouth of a trap,

original: Jarāmaraṇamanventi, vaccho khīrapakova mātara”nti. –
analyzed: jarā maraṇam anventi
translated: They come to old age and death, like calves to their mothers” .

original: Idaṃ suttaṃ saṃkilesabhāge vācakañāpakabhāvena pavattanato saṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ
analyzed: idam suttam saṃkilesa bhāge vācaka ñāpaka bhāvena pavattanataḥ saṃkilesabhāgiyam suttam
translated: This sutta is called one dealing with corruption because it occurs in the mode of expounding and teaching that deals with corruption.

original: nāma. Ye sattā kāmandhā kāmena andhā jālasañchannā taṇhāchadanena chāditā, pamattabandhanāya
analyzed: nāma ye sattā kāma andhā kāmena andhā jāla sañchannā taṇhā chadanena chāditā pamatta bandhanāya
translated: Those beings who are blind with lust, who are blinded by lust, who are veiled in a net, who are covered by a canopy of craving, who are bound by the fetter of negligence,

original: baddhā bandhitabbā, te satte jarāmaraṇaṃ anveti, yathā taṃ kumināmukhe ye macchā
analyzed: baddhā bandhitabbā te satte jarā maraṇam anveti yathā tam kumināmukhe ye macchā
translated: those who are bound are to be bound, and old age and death follow after those beings, just as the shadow follows a person who stands in the sun.

original: gahitā, te macche jarāmaraṇaṃ anveti iva, evaṃ te satte jarāmaraṇaṃ anveti. Khīrapako
analyzed: gahitā te macche jarā maraṇam anveti iva evam te satte jarā maraṇam anveti
translated: and those beings are pursued by aging-and-death, just as the fish in the mouth of the net are pursued by the net.

original: vaccho mātaraṃ anveti iva, evaṃ te satte jarāmaraṇaṃ anvetīti yojanā kātabbā. Atha🔽vā khīrapako vaccho mātaraṃ anveti iva, kumināmukhe gahitā macchā jarāmaraṇaṃ anventi
analyzed: vacchaḥ mātaram anveti iva evam te satte jarā maraṇam anveti iti yojanā kātabbā atha  vā khīrapakaḥ vacchaḥ mātaram anveti iva kuminā mukhe gahitāḥ macchāḥ jarā maraṇam anventi
translated: Just as a young calf pursues its mother, so those beings are pursued by aging-and-death.

original: iva ca, evaṃ ye sattā kāmandhā pamattabandhanāya bandhitabbā, te sattā jarāmaraṇaṃ anventīti yojanā.
analyzed: iva ca evam ye sattā kāmandhā pamatta bandhanāya bandhitabbā te sattāḥ jarā maraṇam anventi iti yojanā
translated: Or else, just as a young calf pursues its mother, and just as the fish in the mouth of the net are pursued by the net, so those beings who are bound by the bonds of heedlessness and are to be pursued by aging-and-death are pursued by aging-and-death.

original: “Idaṃ suttaṃyevā”ti vattabbattā –🔽“Cattārimāni, bhikkhave, agatigamanāni. Katamāni cattāri? Chandāgatiṃ gacchati, dosāgatiṃ
analyzed: idam suttam yeva ati vattabbattā  cattāri imāni bhikkhave agati gamanāni katamāni cattāri chanda āgatim gacchati dosa āgatim
translated: “This sutta should be quoted.”

original: gacchati, mohāgatiṃ gacchati, bhayāgatiṃ gacchati, imāni kho, bhikkhave, cattāri
analyzed: gacchati moha āgatim gacchati bhaya āgatim gacchati imāni kho bhikkhave cattāri
translated: “Bhikkhus, there are these four ways of undertaking things. What four? One undertakes things through desire, through hatred, through delusion, and through fear. These are the four ways of undertaking things.

original: agatigamanāni. Idamavoca bhagavā, idaṃ vatvāna sugato, athāparaṃ etadavoca satthā –
analyzed: agati gamanāni idam avoca bhagavā idam vatvāna sugataḥ atha aparam etat avoca satthā
translated: and the going of one who has no destination. The Blessed One said this; and when the Well-Farer had said this, the Teacher further said this:

original: “Chandā dosā bhayā mohā, yo dhammaṃ ativattati;
analyzed: chandā dosā bhayā mohā yaḥ dhammaṃ ativattati
translated: “He who, through desire, through hatred, through fear, through delusion, transgresses the Dhamma,

original: Nihīyati tassa yaso, kāḷapakkheva candimā”ti. –
analyzed: nihīyati tassa yasaḥ kāḷapakkhā iva candimā ati
translated: His fame declines like the waning moon in the dark fortnight.”

original: Idaṃ saṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ suttanti –
analyzed: idam saṃkilesa bhāgiyam
translated: This is the sutta that belongs with the Corruptions.

original: Vuttaṃ. Chandā chandahetunā dosā dosahetunā bhayā bhayahetunā mohā mohahetunā yo
analyzed: vuttam chandā chanda hetunā dosāḥ dosa hetunā bhayāḥ bhaya hetunā mohāḥ moha hetunā yo
translated: This is said. He who, through desire, through hatred, through fear, through delusion, transgresses the Dhamma, the Dhamma of a True Man,

original: rājādiko yo vinayadharādiko vā dhammaṃ sappurisadhammaṃ ativattati atikkamitvā vattati,
analyzed: rāja ādikaḥ yaḥ vinayadhara ādikaḥ vā dhammam sappurisa dhammam ativattati atikkamitvā vattati
translated: he who transgresses the Dhamma, the Dhamma of a True Man, by a king, etc., or by one who knows the Discipline, etc.,

original: tassa rājādino vā tassa vinayadharādino vā yaso kitti ca parivāro ca bhogo ca nihīyati.
analyzed: tassa rāja ādinaḥ vā tassa vinaya dhara ādinaḥ vā yaso kitti ca parivāro ca bhogo ca nihīyati
translated: his fame, his reputation, his retinue, and his wealth decline.

original: Candimā kāḷapakkhe pabhāya nihīyati iva, evaṃ nihīyatīti yojanā.
analyzed: candimā kāḷapakkhe pabhāya nihīyati iva evam nihīyati iti yojanā
translated: Just as the moon’s radiance declines in the dark fortnight, so does his. This is the construction.

original: “Ettakaṃyevā”ti vattabbattā “manopubbaṅgamā dhammā…pe… cakkaṃva vahato padanti idaṃ saṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ sutta”nti vuttaṃ. Attho pākaṭo. Aṭṭhakathāyampi vibhatto.
analyzed: ettakam yeva iti vattabba ttā manaḥ pubbaṅgamā dhamma āpe cakkam iva vahataḥ padan ti idam saṃkilesa bhāgiyam suttan ti vuttam atthaḥ pākaṭaḥ aṭṭhakathāyam pi vibhatto
translated: In order to say “Just this much,” it is said: “Ideas have their mind as their forerunner, mind is their chief, and they are mind-made. If one speaks or acts with a defiled mind, then suffering follows one, even as the wheel follows the hoof of the draught-ox” . This is the sutta that belongs with the Corruptions. The meaning is evident. It is analysed in the Commentary too.

original: “Middhī yadā hoti mahagghaso ca, niddāyitā samparivattasāyī;
analyzed: middhī yadā hoti mahat hasaḥ ca niddāyitā samparivatta sāyī
translated: “When a man is overcome by sloth and torpor, and sleeps and slumbers and loves to lie abed,

original: Mahāvarāhova nivāpapuṭṭho, punappunaṃ gabbhamupeti mando”ti. –
analyzed: mahāvarāhaḥ iva nivāpa puṭṭhaḥ punappunam gabbham upeti mando ti
translated: Then like a great hog wallowing in ordure, the fool again and again returns to the womb.”

original: Idaṃ suttampi saṃkilesabhāge visaye vācakañāpakabhāvena pavattanato saṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ🔽suttaṃ nāma. Nivāpapuṭṭho mahāvarāho gāmasūkaro niddāyitā supanasīlo samparivattasāyī
analyzed: idam suttam pi saṃkilesa bhāge visaye vācaka ñāpaka bhāvena pavattanato saṃkilesabhāgiyam  suttam nāma nivāpapuṭṭhaḥ mahāvarāhaḥ gāmasūkaraḥ niddāyitā supana sīlaḥ samparivatta sāyī
translated: This sutta is called “concerned with corruption” because it occurs in the section on corruption and because it teaches by means of terms that express corruption.🔽The great hog wallowing in ordure is like the fool who sleeps and slumbers and loves to lie abed.

original: hoti iva, evaṃ yo mando satto yadā mahagghaso hoti, so mando satto middhī thinamiddhābhibhūto🔽hutvā niddāyitā muduphassasayane muduhatthehi parāmasito samparivattasāyī punappunaṃ
analyzed: hoti iva evam yaḥ mandaḥ sattaḥ yadā mahat hasaḥ hoti saḥ mandaḥ sattaḥ middhī thinamiddha abhibhūto  hutvā niddāyitā mudu phassa sayane mudu hatthehi parāmasito samparivatta sāyī punappunam
translated: When the fool is overcome by sloth and torpor, he sleeps and slumbers.

original: gabbhaṃ upetīti yojanā.
analyzed: gabbham upeti iti yojanā
translated: When he is fond of lying abed, he is fond of lying on a soft bed, and he is fond of being caressed by soft hands. He returns again and again to the womb.

original: “Ayasāva malaṃ samuṭṭhitaṃ, tatuṭṭhāya tameva khādati;
analyzed: ayasā ava malam samuṭṭhitam tatuṭṭhāya tam eva khādati
translated: “Like rust that springs from iron And feeds upon the iron itself,

original: Evaṃ atidhonacārinaṃ, sāni kammāni nayanti duggati”nti. –
analyzed: evam atidhona cārinam sāni kammāni nayanti
translated: So too, the evil deeds of one Who is excessively greedy lead him to states of misery.”

original: Idaṃ suttampi saṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ nāma. Ayasā ayato samuṭṭhitaṃ jātamalaṃ tatuṭṭhāya
analyzed: idam suttam pi saṃkilesabhāgiyam suttam nāma ayasā ayataḥ samuṭṭhitam jāta malam
translated: The rust that arises from iron eats away at the iron itself.

original: tato ayato uṭṭhahitvā tameva ayaṃ khādati iva, evaṃ atidhonacārinaṃ atikkamitvā dhonacāripuggalaṃ
analyzed: tatas ayatas uṭṭhahitvā tam eva ayam khādati iva evam ati dhona cārinam atikkamitvā dhona cāri puggalam
translated: So too, the evil-doer, having gone beyond the person who practices virtue,

original: sāni sayaṃ katāni akusalakammāni duggatiṃ nayantīti yojanā.
analyzed: sāni sayam katāni akusala kammāni duggatim nayanti iti yojanā
translated: leads himself to the evil states by his own evil deeds.

original: “Coro yathā sandhimukhe gahīto, sakammunā haññati bajjhate ca;
analyzed: coraḥ yathā sandhi mukhe gahītaḥ sa kammunā haññati bajjhate ca
translated: “As a thief caught at the breach is ruined and destroyed by his own deed,

original: Evaṃ ayaṃ pecca pajā parattha, sakammunā haññati bajjhate cā”ti. –
analyzed: evam ayam pecca pajā parattha sa kammunā haññati bajjhate ca ati
translated: So after death this man, in the other world, is ruined and destroyed by his own deed.”🔽This sutta is also called “Sutta of Corruption.”

original: Idaṃ suttampi saṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ nāma. Sandhimukhe rājapurisādīhi gahito coro
analyzed: idam suttam pi saṃkilesabhāgiyam suttam nāma sandhi mukhe rāja purisa ādīhi gahitaḥ coro
translated: A thief caught at the breach by the king’s men

original: sakammunā attanā katena corakammena haññati ca bajjhate ca yathā, evaṃ ayaṃ pāpakārinī🔽pajā parattha paraloke pecca sakammunā sayaṃ katena akusalakammunā satthādīhi haññati
analyzed: sa kammunā attanā katena cora kammena haññati ca bajjhate ca yathā evam ayam pāpa kārinī  parattha para loke sattha ādīhi haññati
translated: is ruined and destroyed by his own deed, by his own act of thievery. So too, this evil-doer,🔽having gone beyond the person who practices virtue, leads himself to the evil states by his own evil deeds, by his own evil act of evil-doing.

original: ca addubandhanādīhi bajjhate cāti yojanā.
analyzed: ca addu bandhana ādīhi bajjhate ca ati yojanā
translated: After death, in the other world, he is ruined and destroyed by his own deed, by his own evil deed, by the sword and other weapons.

original: “Sukhakāmāni bhūtāni, yo daṇḍena vihiṃsati;
analyzed: sukha kāmāni bhūtāni yaḥ daṇḍena vihiṃsati
translated: “He who with rod or weapon harms those who desire happiness,

original: Attano sukhamesāno, pecca so na labhate sukha”nti. –🔽Idaṃ suttampi saṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ nāma. Attano sukhaṃ esāno esamāno yo satto🔽aññāni sukhakāmāni bhūtāni daṇḍena vihiṃsati, so hiṃsako satto paraloke pecca sukhaṃ
analyzed: attanaḥ sukham esānaḥ pecca saḥ na labhate sukhanti  idam suttam pi saṃkilesa bhāgiyam suttam nāma attanaḥ sukham esānaḥ esamānaḥ yaḥ satto  aññāni sukha kāmāni bhūtāni daṇḍena vihiṃsati saḥ hiṃsako satto para loke pecca sukham
translated: Seeking his own happiness, after death he does not obtain happiness.”

original: na labhatīti yojanā.🔽“Gunnaṃ ce taramānānaṃ, jimhaṃ gacchati puṅgavo;
analyzed: na labhati iti yojanā  gunnam ce jimham gacchati puṅgavaḥ
translated: This sutta, too, is called a sutta of corruption. The meaning is this: He who with rod or weapon harms other beings who desire happiness, seeking his own happiness, that harming being after death does not obtain happiness in the other world.

original: Sabbā tā jimhaṃ gacchanti, nette jimhaṃ gate sati.
analyzed: sabbā tāḥ jimham gacchanti na id te jimham gate sati
translated: “If the leader of a herd of cattle is going astray, all the cattle go astray, following the leader who is going astray.

original: “Evameva manussesu, yo hoti seṭṭhasammato;
analyzed: evam eva manussesu yaḥ hoti seṭṭha sammataḥ
translated: “So too, among human beings, he who is considered the best,

original: So ce adhammaṃ carati, pageva itarā pajā;
analyzed: saḥ ce adhammam carati pagā iva itarā pajā
translated: if he practices what is contrary to the Dhamma, then all the people follow him in practicing what is contrary to the Dhamma.

original: Sabbaṃ raṭṭhaṃ dukkhaṃ seti, rājā ce hoti adhammiko”ti. –🔽Idaṃ suttampi saṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ nāma. Nadiṃ taramānānaṃ gunnaṃ puṅgavo jimhaṃ
analyzed: sabbam raṭṭham dukkham seti rājā ce hoti adhammikaḥ ti  idam suttam pi saṃkilesa bhāgiyam suttam nāma nadim taramānānam gunnam puṅgavaḥ jimham
translated: The whole country lies in misery if the king is unrighteous.”

original: ce gacchati, evaṃ nette jimhaṃ gate sati sabbā tā gāviyo jimhaṃ gacchanti yathā,
analyzed: ce gacchati evam na id te jimham gate sati sabbā tāḥ gāviyaḥ jimham gacchanti yathā
translated: This sutta, too, is called a sutta of corruption. If the leader of a herd of cattle going across a river goes astray, then all the cattle go astray, following the leader who is going astray.

original: evameva manussesu yo rājā seṭṭhasammato, so rājā adhammaṃ carati, evaṃ raññe adhammaṃ
analyzed: evam eva manussesu yaḥ rājā seṭṭha sammataḥ saḥ rājā adhammam carati evam raññe adhammam
translated: so too, among men, the king who is considered the best, if that king conducts himself unrighteously, then in that king’s realm🔽

original: carante sati itarā pajā pageva paṭhamameva adhammaṃ carati. Rājā adhammiko ce hoti,
analyzed: carante sati itarā pajā pagā iva paṭhamam eva adhammam carati rājā adhammikaḥ ce hoti
translated: So too, among men, the king is considered the best. If the king behaves unrighteously, then the other people will do likewise. If the king is unrighteous,

original: evaṃ raññe adhammike sati sabbaṃ raṭṭhaṃ dukkhaṃ setīti yojanā.
analyzed: evam raññe adhammike sati sabbam raṭṭham dukkham seti iti yojanā
translated: then the whole kingdom suffers.

original: “Sukiccharūpā vatime manussā, karonti pāpaṃ upadhīsu rattā;
analyzed: su kiccha rūpāḥ vatime manussā karonti pāpam upadhīsu rattā
translated: “These men, who are so hard to discipline, do evil, greedy for sensual desires;

original: Gacchanti te bahujanasannivāsaṃ, nirayaṃ avīciṃ kaṭukaṃ bhayānaka”nti. –
analyzed: gacchanti te bahu jana sannivāsam nirayam avīcim kaṭukam bhayānakanti
translated: They go to the fearful, terrible Avīci Hell, the abode of many people.”

original: Idaṃ suttampi saṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ nāma. Ye manussā upadhīsu kāmaguṇūpadhīsu
analyzed: idam suttam pi saṃkilesabhāgiyam suttam nāma ye manussāḥ upadhīsu kāma guṇa upadhīsu
translated: This sutta, too, is called a sutta of corruption. Those men who, greedy for sensual desires, i.e. for the sensual desires of the five cords of sense desire,

original: rattā rāgābhibhūtā hutvā pāpaṃ akusalakammaṃ karonti, ime pāpakammakarā manussā sukiccharūpā🔽vata suṭṭhu kicchāpannarūpā vata bhavanti, te pāpakammakarā manussā kaṭukaṃ bhayānakaṃ
analyzed: rattāḥ rāga abhibhūtāḥ hutvā pāpam akusala kammam karonti ime pāpa kamma karāḥ manussā su kiccha rūpā  vata suṭṭhu kicchā āpanna rūpāḥ vata bhavanti te pāpa kamma karāḥ manussā kaṭukam bhayānakam
translated: are overcome by lust and do evil, unwholesome kamma, these men who do evil are so hard to discipline,

original: bahujanasannivāsaṃ nirayaṃ avīciṃ gacchantīti yojanā.
analyzed: bahu jana sannivāsam nirayam avīcim gacchanti iti yojanā
translated: so difficult to train. They go to the fearful, terrible Avīci Hell, the abode of many people.

original: “Phalaṃ ve kadaliṃ hanti, phalaṃ veḷuṃ phalaṃ naḷaṃ;
analyzed: phalam kadalim hanti phalam veḷum phalam naḷam
translated: The fruit destroys the plantain tree, the fruit the bamboo, the fruit the reed.

original: Sakkāro kāpurisaṃ hanti, gabbho assatariṃ yathā”ti. –
analyzed: sakkāraḥ kāpurisam hanti gabbhaḥ assatarim yathā ati
translated: Respect destroys the wicked man, as the foal destroys the mare.

original: Idaṃ suttampi saṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ nāma. Phalaṃ kadaliyā phalaṃ kadaliṃ ve ekantena
analyzed: idam suttam pi saṃkilesa bhāgiyam suttam nāma phalam kadaliyā phalam kadalim ekantena
translated: This sutta is also called a sutta of corruption. The fruit of the plantain tree destroys the plantain tree,

original: hanti yathā, phalaṃ veḷuṃ ve ekantena hanti yathā, phalaṃ naḷaṃ ve ekantena hanti
analyzed: hanti yathā phalam veḷum ve ekantena hanti yathā phalam naḷam ve ekantena hanti
translated: the fruit of the bamboo destroys the bamboo, the fruit of the reed destroys the reed,

original: yathā, gabbho assatariṃ mātaraṃ ve ekantena hanti yathā, evaṃ sakkāro kāpurisaṃ ve🔽ekantena hantīti yojanā.
analyzed: yathā gabbhaḥ assatarim mātaram ve ekantena hanti yathā evam sakkāraḥ kāpurisam ve  ekantena hanti iti yojanā
translated: as the foal destroys the mare, so respect destroys the wicked man.

original: “Kodhamakkhagaru bhikkhu, lābhasakkāragāravo;
analyzed: kodha makkha garu bhikkhu lābha sakkāra gāravaḥ
translated: The monk who is angry, conceited, and full of respect for gain and honor,

original: Sukhette pūtibījaṃva, saddhamme na virūhatī”ti. –
analyzed: pūti bījam va saddhamme na virūhati iti
translated: like a rotten seed in good soil, does not grow in the true Dhamma.

original: Idaṃ suttampi saṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ nāma. Sukhette sundare khettepi khittaṃ pūtibījaṃ
analyzed: idam suttam pi saṃkilesa bhāgiyam suttam nāma su khette sundare khette pi khittam pūti bījam
translated: This sutta is also called a sutta of corruption. Just as a rotten seed sown in good, beautiful soil

original: na ruhati iva, evaṃ yo bhikkhu lābhasakkāragāravo kodhaṃ kujjhanalakkhaṇaṃ kodhaṃ,
analyzed: na ruhati iva evam yaḥ bhikkhu lābha sakkāra gāravaḥ kodham kujjhana lakkhaṇam kodham
translated: does not grow, so a monk who is full of respect for gain and honor, who is angry, who has the characteristic of being angry,

original: makkhaṃ paraguṇasīlamakkhanalakkhaṇaṃ makkhañca garuṃ katvā carati, so caranto bhikkhu
analyzed: makkham para guṇa sīla makkhana lakkhaṇam makkham ca garum katvā carati saḥ carantaḥ bhikkhu
translated: The one who goes about making much of flattery, which is characterized by the flattery of others’ virtue,

original: saddhammasmiṃ na ruhatīti yojanā.🔽91. “Idhāhaṃ, bhikkhave, ekaccaṃ puggalaṃ paduṭṭhacittaṃ evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca🔽pajānāmi…pe… iti me suta”nti idaṃ suttampi saṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ nāma. Bhikkhave
analyzed: saddhammasmin na ruhati iti yojanā  idha aham bhikkhave ekaccam puggalam paduṭṭha cittam evam cetasā cetaḥ paricca  pajānāmi pe iti me sutam ti idam suttam pi saṃkilesa bhāgiyam suttam nāma bhikkhave
translated: does not grow in the true Dhamma.🔽“Here, bhikkhus, having encompassed mind with mind I understand a certain person thus: ‘This person so behaves, so conducts himself, has taken such a path that on the dissolution of the body, after death, he will reappear in a happy destiny in the heavenly world.’

original: idha sāsane, loke vā ahaṃ ekaccaṃ puggalaṃ paduṭṭhacittaṃ mama cetasā tassa ceto🔽cittaṃ paricca paricchinditvā buddhacakkhunā evaṃ pajānāmi. “Kathaṃ pajānāmī”ti ce
analyzed: idha sāsane loke vā aham ekaccam puggalam paduṭṭha cittam mama cetasā tassa cetaḥ  cittam paricca paricchinditvā buddha cakkhunā evam pajānāmi katham pajānāmi iti ce
translated: “Here, bhikkhus, having encompassed mind with mind I understand a certain person thus: ‘This person so behaves, so conducts himself, has taken such a path that on the dissolution of the body, after death, he will reappear in a state of deprivation, in an unhappy destiny, in perdition, in hell.’🔽“Here, bhikkhus, having encompassed mind with mind I understand a certain person thus: ‘This person so behaves, so conducts himself, has taken such a path that on the dissolution of the body, after death, he will reappear in a happy destiny in the heavenly world.’

original: puccheyya, yañca paṭipadaṃ paṭipanno, yañca maggaṃ samāruḷho ayaṃ puggalo yathā yāya🔽duppaṭipadāya yena dummaggena iriyati pavattati, tāya duppaṭipadāya tena dummaggena
analyzed: puccheyya yat ca paṭipadam paṭipannaḥ yat ca maggam samāruḷhaḥ ayam puggalaḥ yathā yāya 🔽duppaṭipadāya yena dummaggena iriyati pavattati tāya duppaṭipadāya tena dummaggena
translated: “Here, bhikkhus, having encompassed mind with mind I understand a certain person thus: ‘This person so behaves, so conducts himself, has taken such a path that on the dissolution of the body, after death, he will reappear in a state of deprivation, in an unhappy destiny, in perdition, in hell.’

original: imamhi imasmiṃ samaye duppaṭipajjanakāle ayaṃ duppaṭipannaṃ paṭipanno dummaggasamāruḷho
analyzed: imamhi imasmin samaye duppaṭipajjana kāle ayam duppaṭipannam paṭipannaḥ dummagga samāruḷhaḥ
translated: At this time, in this period of difficulty in practice, this person who is practising the difficult practice, who has mounted the difficult path,

original: puggalo ce kālaṃ kareyya, evaṃ sati ābhataṃ vatthu nikkhittaṃ yathā, evaṃ niraye
analyzed: puggalo ce kālam kareyya evam sati ābhatam vatthu nikkhittam yathā evam niraye
translated: if he were to die, then in that case the matter would be laid down as if it were laid down in hell.

original: nikkhitto. Taṃ kissa hetu? Bhikkhave assa puggalassa cittaṃ paduṭṭhaṃ padositaṃ hi
analyzed: nikkhittaḥ tam kissa hetu bhikkhave assa puggalassa cittam paduṭṭham padositam hi
translated: Why is that? Because, monks, this person’s mind is corrupted, is corrupted by hate,

original: yasmā hoti, tasmā nikkhitto. Evaṃ idha sāsane, loke vā cetopadosahetu ca pana ekacce
analyzed: yasmai hoti tasmai nikkhittaḥ evam idha sāsane loke vā cetaḥ upadosa hetu ca pana ekacce
translated: because it is so, it is laid down. Thus in this Dispensation, or in the world, and because of the corruption of mind, some

original: sattā puggalā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ upapajjantīti
analyzed: sattā puggalā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam upapajjanti iti
translated: beings, some people, on the break up of the body, after death, reappear in a lower place, a bad destination, a state of suffering, in hell.🔽I understand this matter.” The Fortunate One said this, and after saying this, having said this, the Teacher said this further:

original: pajānāmīti. Etamatthaṃ bhagavā avoca. Tattha tasmiṃ sutte etaṃ “paduṭṭhacittaṃ ñatvāna…pe…
analyzed: pajānāmi iti etam attham bhagavā avoca tattha tasmin sutte etam paduṭṭha cittam
translated: In this discourse this verse was said: “Having known the corrupted mind…

original: nirayaṃ so upapajjatī”ti gāthāvacanaṃ iti evaṃ vuccati.
analyzed: nirayam saḥ upapajjati iti gāthā vacanam iti evam vuccati
translated: he is reborn in hell.”

original: Satthā idha sāsane, loke vā paduṭṭhacittaṃ ekaccaṃ puggalaṃ ñatvāna bhikkhūnaṃ santike
analyzed: satthā idha sāsane loke vā paduṭṭha cittam ekaccam puggalam ñatvāna bhikkhūnam santike
translated: The Teacher, in this Dispensation, or in the world, having known a certain person with a corrupted mind, in the presence of the monks

original: etamatthaṃ byākāsi. Imamhi imasmiṃ samaye ayaṃ puggalo ce kālaṃ kayirātha, evaṃ sati
analyzed: etam attham imamhi imasmin samaye ayam puggalaḥ ce kālam evam sati
translated: he explained the meaning of this. If this person were to die at this time, then,

original: paduṭṭhacittasamaṅgī hi nirayasmiṃ upapajjeyya, puggalassa cittaṃ padūsitaṃ hi yasmā
analyzed: paduṭṭha citta samaṅgī hi nirayasmin upapajjeyya puggalassa cittam padūsitam hi yasmā
translated: because of his evil mind, he would be reborn in hell. Because his mind is evil,

original: hoti, tasmā upapajjeyya, cetopadosahetu sattā duggatiṃ gacchanti ābhataṃ vatthuṃ
analyzed: tasmai upapajjeyya cetaḥ upadosa hetu sattā duggatim gacchanti ābhatam vatthum
translated: therefore he would be reborn. Because of the corruption of the mind beings go to a bad destination,

original: nikkhipeyya yathā, evamevaṃ tathāvidho duppañño so padosacitto puggalo kāyassa bhedā
analyzed: nikkhipeyya yathā evam evam tathāvidhaḥ duppaññaḥ saḥ padosa citto puggalo kāyassa bhedā
translated: just as if one were to throw away a purchased article. In the same way, that person of such kind, of such an evil mind, with the breakup of the body,

original: paraṃ maraṇā nirayaṃ upapajjatīti ayampi attho bhagavatā vutto, iti me mayā sutanti yojanā.
analyzed: param maraṇā nirayam upapajjati iti ayam pi atthaḥ bhagavatā vuttaḥ iti me mayā sutam ti yojanā
translated: after death, is reborn in hell. This meaning was spoken by the Fortunate One, thus I heard.

original: “Sace bhāyatha dukkhassa, sace vo dukkhamappiyaṃ;
analyzed: sace bhāyatha dukkhassa sace vaḥ dukkham appiyam
translated: “If you fear suffering, if suffering is not dear to you,

original: Mākattha pāpakaṃ kammaṃ, āvi vā yadi vā raho.
analyzed: mākattha pāpakam kammaṃ vā yadi vā raho
translated: Do not do evil deeds, either in public or in private.

original: “Sace ca pāpakaṃ kammaṃ, karissatha karotha vā;
analyzed: sace ca pāpakam kammam karissatha karotha vā
translated: “If you do evil deeds, or if you have done them,

original: Na vo dukkhā pamutyatthi, upeccapi palāyata”nti. –
analyzed: na vaḥ dukkhā upecca api
translated: There is no escape from suffering, even if you run away.”

original: Idaṃ suttampi saṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ nāma. Sappurisā tumhe dukkhassa jātidukkhajarādukkhabyādhidukkhamaraṇadukkhaapāyadukkha-🔽atītavaṭṭamūlakadukkhaanāgatavaṭṭamūlakadukkhapaccuppannāhāramūlakadukkhāti aṭṭhavidhassa
analyzed: idam suttam pi saṃkilesa bhāgiyam suttam nāma sappurisā tumhe dukkhassa jāti dukkha jarā dukkha byādhi dukkha maraṇa dukkha apāya dukkha  atīta vaṭṭa mūlaka dukkha anāgata vaṭṭa mūlaka dukkha paccuppanna āhāra mūlaka dukkha ati aṭṭhavidhassa
translated: If you fear the eight kinds of suffering, namely, the suffering of birth, the suffering of old age, the suffering of sickness, the suffering of death, the suffering of the states of deprivation,🔽the suffering rooted in the past round, the suffering rooted in the future round, and the suffering rooted in the present nutriment,

original: dukkhassa sace bhāyatha, vo tumhehi dukkhaṃ tathā aṭṭhavidhaṃ dukkhaṃ sace appiyaṃ,
analyzed: dukkhassa sace bhāyatha vaḥ tumhehi dukkham tathā aṭṭhavidham dukkham sace appiyam
translated: and if you dislike the eight kinds of suffering,

original: evaṃ sati āvi vā yadi raho vā pāpakaṃ kammaṃ mākattha mā akattha. Sappurisā tumhe
analyzed: evam sati āvi vā yadi rahaḥ vā pāpakam kammam mā akattha mā akattha sappurisā tumhe
translated: then whether in public or in private do not commit evil.

original: āvi vā yadi raho vā pāpakaṃ kammaṃ sace karissatha vā sace karotha vā, evaṃ sati🔽upeccapi sañciccāpi palāyataṃ palāyantānaṃ vo tumhākaṃ dukkhā aṭṭhavidhā dukkhato
analyzed: āvi vā yadi rahaḥ vā pāpakam kammam sace karissatha vā sace karotha vā evam sati  upetam ca api sañcit ca api palāyatam palāyantānam vaḥ tumhākam dukkhāḥ aṭṭhavidhāḥ dukkhato
translated: Whether in public or in private, if you commit evil,

original: pamutti muccanaṃ natthevāti yojanā.
analyzed: pamutti muccanam nattha iva ati yojanā
translated: then there is no escape for you, whether you run away or not, from the eight kinds of suffering.

original: “Adhammena dhanaṃ laddhā, musāvādena cūbhayaṃ;
analyzed: adhammena dhanam laddhā musāvādena ca ubhayam
translated: “Having gained wealth by unjust means, and having deceived others by lying,

original: Mameti bālā maññanti, taṃ kathaṃ nu bhavissati.
analyzed: mama iti bālāḥ maññanti tam katham nu bhavissati
translated: foolish people think: ‘It is mine.’ But how will that be?

original: “Antarāyā su bhavissanti, sambhatassa vinassati;
analyzed: antarāyā su bhavissanti sambhatassa vinassati
translated: “There will be obstacles, and what is stored up will be lost.

original: Matā saggaṃ na gacchanti, nanu ettāvatā hatā”ti. –
analyzed: matā saggam na gacchanti nanu ettāvatā hatā ati
translated: When dead, they do not go to heaven. Are they not ruined by this?”🔽This sutta is also called “Sutta of the Corruptions.”

original: Idaṃ suttampi saṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ nāma. Ye bālā adhammena ca musāvādena ca dhanaṃ
analyzed: idam suttam pi saṃkilesabhāgiyam suttam nāma ye bālāḥ adhammena ca musāvādena ca dhanam
translated: The fools, by means of the unrighteousness and falsehood,

original: saviññāṇāviññāṇaṃ sabbaṃ labhitabbaṃ dhanaṃ laddhā ubhayaṃ dhanaṃ “mama dhana”nti🔽maññanti, tesaṃ bālānaṃ taṃ ubhayaṃ dhanaṃ kathaṃ kena nu pakārena bhavissati, adhammena🔽sambhatattā ciraṭṭhitikaṃ na hoti. Antarāyā rājantarāyādayo antarāyā tesaṃ bālānaṃ
analyzed: sa viññāṇa aviññāṇam sabbam labhitabbam dhanam laddhā ubhayam dhanam mama dhananti  maññanti tesam bālānam tam ubhayam dhanam katham kena nu pakārena bhavissati adhammena  cira ṭṭhitikam na hoti antarāyāḥ rājantarāya ādayaḥ antarāyā tesam bālānam
translated: obtain all the wealth, both that which is conscious and that which is not conscious. Having obtained the wealth, they think: “This wealth is mine.”🔽How will that wealth of the fools be? By what means will it be? Because it is stored up by unrighteousness, it will not last long. There will be obstacles for the fools,

original: bhavissanti. Yena adhammavohārādikena yaṃ dhanaṃ sambhataṃ, assa adhammavohārādikassa
analyzed: bhavissanti yena adhamma vohāra ādikena yam dhanam sambhatam assa adhamma vohāra ādikassa
translated: such as obstacles from the king, etc. By means of the unrighteousness, etc., the wealth which is stored up,

original: taṃ sambhataṃ dhanaṃ vinassati. Matā marantā te bālā saggaṃ sugatiṃ na gacchanti.
analyzed: tam sambhatam dhanam vinassati matā marantā te bālā saggam sugatim na gacchanti
translated: that stored-up wealth of the unrighteousness, etc., will be lost. When dead, the fools do not go to heaven, to the good destination.

original: Sugati hi sobhanehi bhogehi aggoti “saggo”ti adhippetā. Ettāvatā ettakena diṭṭhadhammikasamparāyikānaṃ
analyzed: sugati hi sobhanehi bhogehi aggo ti saggo ti adhippetā ettāvatā ettakena diṭṭhadhammika samparāyikānam
translated: For a good destination is a destination with good enjoyments, and it is called “heaven” because it is not gone to by the bad.🔽So far, by the loss of these benefits for himself in the here and now and in the life to come,

original: attahitānaṃ hāyanena te bālā hatā vinaṭṭhā bhavanti nanūti yojanā.
analyzed: atta hitānam hāyanena te bālāḥ hatāḥ vinaṭṭhāḥ bhavanti nanu iti yojanā
translated: those fools are ruined, destroyed, is the construction.

original: “Kathaṃ khaṇati attānaṃ, kathaṃ mittehi jīrati;
analyzed: katham khaṇati attānam katham mittehi jīrati
translated: How does he dig himself up? How does he age among his friends?

original: Kathaṃ vivaṭṭate dhammā, kathaṃ saggaṃ na gacchati”.
analyzed: katham vivaṭṭate dhammā katham saggam na gacchati
translated: How does he turn away from the True Idea? How does he not go to heaven?

original: “Lobhā khaṇati attānaṃ, luddho mittehi jīrati;
analyzed: lobhā khaṇati attānam luddhaḥ mittehi jīrati
translated: Through greed he digs himself up; through greed he ages among his friends;

original: Lobhā vivaṭṭate dhammā, lobhā saggaṃ na gacchatī”ti. –
analyzed: lobhā vivaṭṭate dhammā lobhā saggam na gacchati iti
translated: Through greed he turns away from the True Idea; through greed he does not go to heaven.

original: Idaṃ suttampi saṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ nāma. Yojanattho pākaṭo.
analyzed: idam suttam pi saṃkilesabhāgiyam suttam nāma yojana atthaḥ pākaṭaḥ
translated: This sutta too is a sutta of the kind called “concerned with corruption.” The meaning of the construction is evident.

original: “Caranti bālā dummedhā, amitteneva attanā;
analyzed: caranti bālāḥ dummedhāḥ amittena iva attanā
translated: Fools, witless, go about

original: Karontā pāpakaṃ kammaṃ, yaṃ hoti kaṭukapphalaṃ.
analyzed: karontā pāpakam kammam yam hoti kaṭuka phalam
translated: Doing evil deeds that have a bitter fruit.🔽That deed is not well done

original: “Na taṃ kammaṃ kataṃ sādhu, yaṃ katvā anutappati;
analyzed: na tam kammam katam sādhu yam katvā anutappati
translated: For which one later on repents;🔽Weeping with a tearful face

original: Yassa assumukho rodaṃ, vipākaṃ paṭisevatī”ti. –
analyzed: yassa assu mukhaḥ rodam vipākam paṭisevati iti
translated: One experiences its result.

original: Idaṃ suttampi saṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ nāma. Dummedhā nippaññā bālā amittena pāpakaṃ
analyzed: idam suttam pi saṃkilesa bhāgiyam suttam nāma dummedhāḥ nippaññāḥ bālāḥ amittena pāpakam
translated: “The foolish, the dull, the ignorant,

original: kammaṃ kataṃ iva, evaṃ attanā kaṭukapphalaṃ yaṃ kammaṃ kataṃ hoti, taṃ pāpakaṃ kataṃ🔽kammaṃ karontā caranti. Yaṃ kammaṃ katvā karonto pacchā anutappati, taṃ kataṃ kammaṃ
analyzed: kammam katam iva evam attanā kaṭuka phalam yam kammam katam hoti tam pāpakam katam  kammam karontā caranti yam kammam katvā karontaḥ pacchā anutappati tam katam kammam
translated: As if a wicked deed were done by an enemy, so too, when a deed is done by oneself that has a bitter fruit, that wicked deed is done.

original: na sādhu. Yassa kammassa vipākaṃ rodaṃ rudanto assumukho paṭisevati, taṃ kataṃ kammaṃ na sādhūti yojanā.
analyzed: na sādhu yassa kammassa vipākam rodam rudantaḥ assu mukhaḥ paṭisevati tam katam kammam na sādhu iti yojanā
translated: Those who do a deed that they will later regret, that deed is done and not good. That deed whose result one experiences weeping, weeping with a tearful face, that deed is done and not good.

original: “Dukkaraṃ duttitikkhañca…pe… avītarāgo”ti idaṃ suttampi saṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ nāma. Suttattho aṭṭhakathāyaṃ vitthārato vutto.
analyzed: dukkaram avīta rāgo ti idam suttam pi saṃkilesabhāgiyam suttam nāma suttatthaḥ aṭṭhakathāyam vitthārato vutto
translated: “Difficult to do, hard to endure … unfree from lust” — this sutta too is called a sutta of corruption. The meaning of the sutta is given in detail in the commentary.🔽“One who measures the immeasurable,

original: “Appameyyaṃ paminanto, kodha vidvā vikappaye;
analyzed: appameyyam paminantaḥ kodha vidvā vikappaye
translated: The wise one should not measure;🔽The one who measures the immeasurable,

original: Appameyyaṃ pamāyinaṃ, nivutaṃ taṃ maññe akissava”nti. –
analyzed: appameyyam pamāyinam nivutam tam maññe a kissavanti
translated: It seems to me, is covered over with ignorance.”

original: Idaṃ suttampi saṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ nāma. Idha sāsane appameyyaṃ appameyyaguṇaṃ
analyzed: idam suttam pi saṃkilesa bhāgiyam suttam nāma idha sāsane appameyyam appameyya guṇam
translated: This sutta too is called a sutta of corruption. Here in the Dispensation the immeasurable is the immeasurable good quality of the Buddha.

original: khīṇāsavaṃ puggalaṃ “ayaṃ khīṇāsavo puggalo ettakasīlo ettakasamādhi ettakapañño”ti
analyzed: khīṇāsavam puggalam ayam khīṇāsavaḥ puggalaḥ ettaka sīlaḥ ettaka samādhi ettaka pañño ti
translated: “This person is one whose cankers are destroyed. He is of such virtue, such concentration, such wisdom, such freedom.”

original: paminanto ko puthujjano vikappaye. Appameyyaṃ khīṇāsavapuggalaṃ pamāyinaṃ pamāyantaṃ
analyzed: paminantaḥ kaḥ puthujjanaḥ vikappaye appameyyam khīṇāsava puggalam pamāyinam pamāyantam
translated: What ordinary man would be able to measure him?🔽The ordinary man who would measure the immeasurable, the person whose cankers are destroyed,

original: taṃ puthujjanaṃ ayaṃ nivutaṃ avakujjapaññaṃ akissavaṃ apaññanti maññe maññāmīti yojanā.🔽“Purisassa hi jātassa, kuṭhārī jāyate mukhe;
analyzed: tam puthujjanam ayam nivutam avakujja paññam a kissavam a paññanti maññe maññāmi iti yojanā  purisassa hi jātassa kuṭhārī jāyate mukhe
translated: that ordinary man is blind, I think, and sightless.”

original: Yāya chindati attānaṃ, bālo dubbhāsitaṃ bhaṇaṃ.
analyzed: yāya chindati attānam bālaḥ dubbhāsitam bhaṇam
translated: “When a man is born, a hatchet is born in his mouth With which he cuts himself, the fool who speaks ill.

original: “Na hi satthaṃ sunisitaṃ, visaṃ halāhalaṃ iva;
analyzed: na hi sattham su nisitam visam halāhalam iva
translated: “No weapon is so sharp as words, No poison like the poison of the tongue.

original: Evaṃ viraddhaṃ pāteti, vācā dubbhāsitā yathā”ti. –
analyzed: evam viraddham pāta iti vācā dubbhāsitā yathā ati
translated: Thus a man is quickly destroyed By the evil words he has spoken.”

original: Idaṃ suttampi saṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ nāma. Dubbhāsitaṃ ariyūpavādasaṅkhātaṃ pharusavācaṃ
analyzed: idam suttam pi saṃkilesabhāgiyam suttam nāma dubbhāsitam ariya upavāda saṅkhātam pharusa vācam
translated: This sutta, too, is called a sutta of corruption. Harsh speech is evil speech called “reproach of the noble ones.”

original: bhaṇaṃ bhaṇanto bālo duṭṭho puriso yāya kuṭhārīsadisiyā dubbhāsitavācāya attānaṃ
analyzed: bhaṇam bhaṇantaḥ bālaḥ duṭṭhaḥ puriso yāya kuṭhārī sadisiyā dubbhāsita vācāya attānam
translated: Speaking it, speaking evil speech, the fool, the wicked man, with a speech that is like a hatchet, cuts himself.

original: chindati, sā kuṭhārīsadisī dubbhāsitavācā jātassa purisassa mukhe jāyate jāyati,
analyzed: chindati sā kuṭhārī sadisī dubbhāsita vācā jātassa purisassa mukhe jāyate jāyati
translated: It cuts, and that is like a hatchet. Evil speech is born in the mouth of a man who is born.

original: sā dubbhāsitavācā mukhe jāyati iva, evaṃ sunisitaṃ satthaṃ mukhe na jāyati, yathā
analyzed: sā dubbhāsita vācā mukhe jāyati iva evam su nisitam sattham mukhe na jāyati yathā
translated: That evil speech is born in the mouth, just as a very sharp sword is not born in the mouth,

original: halāhalaṃ visaṃ mukhe na jāyati, dubbhāsitā vācā apāyesu viraddhaṃ puggalaṃ pāteti
analyzed: halāhalam visam mukhe na jāyati dubbhāsitā vācā apāyesu viraddham puggalam pāta iti
translated: just as the halāhala poison is not born in the mouth, evil speech throws a person who has fallen into the lower realms down,

original: yathā, evaṃ sunisitaṃ satthaṃ apāyesu na pāteti, halāhalaṃ visaṃ apāyesu na pātetīti yojanā.
analyzed: yathā evam su nisitam sattham apāyesu na pāta iti halāhalam visam apāyesu na pāta iti iti yojanā
translated: just as a very sharp sword does not throw one down into the lower realms, just as the halāhala poison does not throw one down into the lower realms.

original: “Yo nindiyaṃ pasaṃsati, taṃ vā nindati yo pasaṃsiyo;
analyzed: yaḥ nindiyam pasaṃsati tam vā nindati yaḥ pasaṃsiyaḥ
translated: “He who praises the blameworthy, or blames the praiseworthy,

original: Vicināti mukhena so kaliṃ, kalinā tena sukhaṃ na vindati.
analyzed: vicināti mukhena saḥ kalim kalinā tena sukham na vindati
translated: Grinds his teeth with his mouth, and through that grinding he does not find happiness.

original: “Appamatto ayaṃ kali, yo akkhesu dhanaparājayo;
analyzed: appamattaḥ ayam kali yaḥ akkhesu dhana parājayaḥ
translated: “This is a small grinding, that one is defeated in dice and loses his wealth;

original: Sabbassāpi sahāpi attanā, ayameva mahantataro kali;
analyzed: sabbassa api saha api attanā ayam eva mahantataraḥ kali
translated: Even though it is all of it together with himself, this is a greater grinding;

original: Yo sugatesu manaṃ padosaye.
analyzed: yaḥ sugatesu manam pada usaye
translated: That one is hostile to the well-gone ones.

original: “Sataṃ sahassānaṃ nirabbudānaṃ, chattiṃsatī pañca ca abbudāni;
analyzed: satam sahassānam nirabbudānam chattiṃsatī pañca ca abbudāni
translated: “A hundred thousand nirabbudas, thirty-six and five abbudas;

original: Yamariyagarahī nirayaṃ upeti, vācaṃ manañca paṇidhāya pāpaka”nti. –
analyzed: nirayam upeti vācam manaḥ ca paṇidhāya
translated: Having laid down evil speech and mind.”🔽This sutta too is called a sutta of corruption.

original: Idaṃ suttampi saṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ nāma. Yo puggalo nindiyaṃ duccaraṃ dussīlaṃ
analyzed: idam suttam pi saṃkilesabhāgiyam suttam nāma yaḥ puggalaḥ nindiyam duccaram dussīlam
translated: The person who praises a person who is blameworthy, who is of bad conduct, who is unvirtuous,

original: puggalaṃ pasaṃsati, so pasaṃsako puggalo mukhena kaliṃ vicināti upacināti, tena kalinā
analyzed: puggalam pasaṃsati saḥ pasaṃsakaḥ puggalaḥ mukhena kalim vicināti upacināti tena kalinā
translated: that person who praises, by his mouth accumulates corruption, and by that corruption

original: sukhaṃ na vindati. Yo sucārī sīlavā puggalo pasaṃsiyo hoti, taṃ vā sucāriṃ vā sīlavantaṃ
analyzed: sukham na vindati yaḥ su cārī sīlavā puggalaḥ pasaṃsiyaḥ hoti tam vā su cārim vā sīlavantam
translated: he does not find happiness. The person who is of good conduct, who is virtuous, who is praiseworthy,

original: puggalaṃ yo puggalo nindati, so nindanto puggalo mukhena kaliṃ vicināti upacināti,
analyzed: puggalam yaḥ puggalaḥ nindati saḥ nindantaḥ puggalaḥ mukhena kalim vicināti upacināti
translated: that person who reviles, by his mouth accumulates corruption,

original: tena kalinā sukhaṃ na vindati.
analyzed: tena kalinā sukham na vindati
translated: and by that corruption he does not find happiness.

original: Attanā sahāpi sabbassa dhanassa vasenapi akkhesu yo dhanaparājayo bhavati, ayaṃ kali
analyzed: attanā saha api sabbassa dhanassa vasena api akkhesu yaḥ dhana parājayaḥ bhavati ayam kali
translated: Even with all his wealth, by the power of all his wealth, the one who is defeated in gambling, this is corruption,

original: ayaṃ dhanaparājayo appamatto hoti. Yo puggalo sugatesu manaṃ padosaye, tassa puggalassa
analyzed: ayam dhana parājayaḥ appamattaḥ hoti yaḥ puggalo sugatesu manam tassa puggalassa
translated: this defeat in gambling is a small matter. The person who is hostile to the Well-Farers,

original: yo kali bhavati, ayameva kali mahantataro hoti.
analyzed: bhavati ayam eva kali mahantataraḥ
translated: the corruption that is his, this corruption is greater.

original: Kasmā? Vācañca manañca paṇidhāya ariyagarahī puggalo yaṃ kālaṃ pāpakaṃ nirayaṃ upeti,
analyzed: kasmai vācam ca manaṃ ca paṇidhāya ariya garahī puggalaḥ yam kālam pāpakam nirayam upeti
translated: Why? The person who reviles the Noble Ones, having spoken and thought, when he goes to a bad destination,

original: so kālo “sataṃ sahassānaṃ nirabbudānañca chattiṃsa nirabbudāni ca pañca abbudāni
analyzed: saḥ kālaḥ satam sahassānam nirabbudānam ca chattiṃsa nirabbudāni ca pañca abbudāni
translated: that time is equal to “a hundred thousand years, thirty-six thousand years, five thousand years

original: ca yasmiṃ kāle gaṇīyantī”ti tena kālena samo hoti, tasmā mahantataro hotīti yojanā.
analyzed: ca yasmin kāle gaṇīyanti iti tena kālena samaḥ tasmāt mahantataraḥ hoti iti yojanā
translated: in the time when they are counted.” Therefore the calculation is that it is greater.

original: “Yo lobhaguṇe anuyutto…pe…
analyzed: yaḥ lobha guṇe
translated: “The one who is devoted to the qualities of greed…

original: Gacchasi kho papataṃ ciraratta”nti. –
analyzed: gacchasi khalu papatam
translated: You are going to the fall for a long time.”

original: Idaṃ suttampi saṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ nāma. Yo puggalo lobhaguṇe anuyutto anu punappunaṃ
analyzed: idam suttam pi saṃkilesabhāgiyam suttam nāma yaḥ puggalaḥ lobha guṇe anuyuttaḥ anu punappunam
translated: This discourse is also called a discourse belonging to the category of corruption. The person who is devoted to the qualities of greed, again and again

original: yutto hoti, so puggalo aññe puggale vacasā paribhāsati, assaddho kadariyo avadaññū
analyzed: yuttaḥ hoti so puggalaḥ aññe puggale vacasā paribhāsati assaddhaḥ kadariyaḥ a vadaññū
translated: is devoted, that person verbally reviles other people, is faithless, miserly, and ungrateful

original: buddhānaṃ ovādaññū na hoti, maccharī pesuṇiyaṃ pesuṇiyasmiṃ anuyutto hoti.
analyzed: buddhānam ovāda ññū na hoti maccharī pesuṇiyam pesuṇiyasmiṃ anuyuttaḥ hoti
translated: is not obedient to the advice of the Buddhas, is selfish, and is devoted to slander.

original: Mukhadugga mukhavisama vibhūta vigatabhūta anariya bhūnahu buddhivināsaka pāpaka
analyzed: mukha dugga mukha visama vibhūta vigata bhūta anariya bhūnahu buddhi vināsaka pāpaka
translated: Face-ugly, face-uneven, destroyed, departed, unnoble, gone-to-the-ground, mind-destroyer, wicked

original: dukkaṭakāri purisanta purisalāmaka kali alakkhi avajātaputta tvaṃ nerayiko asi. Idha
analyzed: dukkaṭa kāri purisanta purisa lāmaka kali alakkhi avajāta putta tvam nerayikaḥ asi idha
translated: “You are a man who does evil, a man of the lowest caste, a wretch, a bastard, you are bound for hell. Here

original: idāni bahubhāṇī mā hohi.
analyzed: idāni bahu bhāṇī mā hohi
translated: now, don’t talk so much.

original: Ahitāya rajaṃ attani mā ākirasi mā pakkhipasi. Kibbisakāri tvaṃ sante khīṇāsave puggale
analyzed: ahitāya rajam attani mā ākirasi mā pakkhipasi kibbisa kāri tvam sante khīṇāsave puggale
translated: Don’t bring on yourself the dust of infamy. You who do evil, you who revile

original: garahasi, bahūni duccaritāni kammāni carasi, caritvā tvaṃ cirarattaṃ racanavirahitaṃ🔽papataṃ narakaṃ nirayaṃ gacchasi kho ekaṃsenāti yojanā.🔽Nānāvidhaṃ saṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ ācariyena niddhāritaṃ, amhehi ca ñātaṃ, “katamaṃ
analyzed: bahūni duccaritāni kammāni carasi caritvā tvam cira rattam racana virahitam  narakam nirayam gacchasi kho eka aṃsena ati yojanā  nānāvidham saṃkilesa bhāgiyam suttam ācariyena niddhāritam amhehi ca ñātam katamam
translated: the good people who are free from the cankers, you who do many evil deeds, having done them, you will go to hell, which is devoid of pleasure,🔽which is falling, which is all-round unbroken, which is without a gap, without a doubt.”

original: vāsanābhāgiyaṃ sutta”nti pucchitabbattā “tattha katamaṃ vāsanābhāgiyaṃ sutta”ntiādi🔽vuttaṃ. Tatthāti tesu soḷasasu saṃkilesabhāgiyādīsu suttesu katamaṃ suttaṃ vāsanābhāgiyaṃ
analyzed: vāsanābhāgiyam suttanti pucchitabba ttā tattha katamam vāsanābhāgiyam suttanti ādi  vuttam tattha ati tesu soḷasasu saṃkilesabhāgiya ādīsu suttesu katamam suttam vāsanābhāgiyam
translated: The Teacher has extracted the sutta which belongs to the category of defilement in various ways, and we have understood it. “Which sutta belongs to the category of the residual impressions?”🔽“Herein, which sutta belongs to the category of the residual impressions?”

original: suttaṃ nāmāti pucchati. “Manopubbaṅgamā dhammā…pe… chāyāva anapāyinī”ti idaṃ vāsanābhāge
analyzed: suttam nāma ati pucchati manaḥ pubbaṅgamā chāyā u anapāyinī iti idam vāsanā bhāge
translated: “Herein” means: among the sixteen suttas beginning with the category of defilement. Which sutta is called the sutta belonging to the category of the residual impressions? “The thoughts are preceded by mind, they are of the mind, made of mind” …🔽“like a shadow that does not depart” . This sutta belongs to the category of the residual impressions.

original: puññabhāge visaye vācakañāpakabhāvena pavattanato vāsanābhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ nāma. Attho pākaṭo.
analyzed: puññabhāge visaye vācaka ñāpaka bhāvena pavattanataḥ vāsanābhāgiyam suttam nāma atthaḥ pākaṭaḥ
translated: because it occurs in the sense of the profitable section as prompting and instigating speech, is called a Thread with prompting. The meaning is evident.

original: 93. “Mahānāmo sakko bhagavantaṃ etadavoca…pe… apāpikā kālaṅkiriyā”ti idaṃ suttampi
analyzed: mahānāmaḥ sakkaḥ bhagavantam etat avocape a pāpikā kālaṅkiriyā ati idam suttam pi
translated: “The Sakyan Mahānāma said to the Blessed One: ‘Venerable sir, I have a son called Sigalaka, who lives at home honoured and esteemed by me.

original: vāsanābhāge puññabhāge visaye vācakañāpakabhāvena pavattanato vāsanābhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ nāma. Attho pākaṭo.
analyzed: vāsanā bhāge puñña bhāge visaye vācaka ñāpaka bhāvena pavattanataḥ vāsanābhāgiyam suttam nāma atthaḥ pākaṭaḥ
translated: because it occurs in the sense of the profitable section as prompting and instigating speech, is called a Thread with prompting. The meaning is evident.

original: “Sukhakāmāni bhūtāni, yo daṇḍena na hiṃsati;
analyzed: sukha kāmāni bhūtāni yaḥ daṇḍena na hiṃsati
translated: “Those who do not harm living beings Who are fond of happiness,

original: Attano sukhamesāno, pecca so labhate sukha”nti. –
analyzed: attanaḥ sukham esānaḥ pecca saḥ labhate sukhanti
translated: Who seek their own happiness hereafter,

original: Idaṃ suttampi vāsanābhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ nāma. Attho pākaṭo.
analyzed: idam suttam pi vāsanābhāgiyam suttam nāma attho pākaṭaḥ
translated: This Thread is called a Thread with prompting. The meaning is evident.🔽“If cattle are crossing a ford, And the king is righteous too,

original: “Gunnaṃ ce taramānānaṃ…pe… rājā ce hoti dhammiko”ti idaṃ suttampi vāsanābhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ nāma. Attho pākaṭo.
analyzed: rājā ce hoti dhammikaḥ ti idam suttam pi vāsanābhāgiyam suttam nāma attho pākaṭo
translated: This Thread is called a Thread with prompting. The meaning is evident.

original: 94. “Bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati…pe… evaṃ pajānātī”ti idaṃ suttampi vāsanā…pe… suttaṃ nāma. Attho pākaṭo.
analyzed: bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati pe evam pajānāti iti idam suttam pi vāsanāpe suttam nāma attho pākaṭaḥ
translated: “The Blessed One was once staying at Savatthi … understands thus” . This Thread too is called a Thread with prompting …

original: “Kasmā bhagavā janapadacārikaṃ caratī”ti puccheyya, sattahi kāraṇehi buddhā bhagavanto
analyzed: kasmai bhagavā janapada cārikam carati iti puccheyya sattahi kāraṇehi buddhāḥ bhagavanto
translated: “Why does the Blessed One go on a tour of the country?”🔽The Buddhas, Blessed Ones, go on a tour of the country for seven reasons:

original: janapadacārikaṃ caranti. Katamehi sattahi? Desantaragatānaṃ veneyyānaṃ vinayanatthaṃ,
analyzed: janapada cārikam caranti katamehi sattahi desa antara gatānam veneyyānam vinayana attham
translated: to discipline those disciples who have gone astray,🔽to arouse zeal in those who are remiss,

original: tatra ṭhitānaṃ ussukkasamuppādanatthaṃ, sāvakānaṃ ekasmiṃ ṭhāne nibaddhavāsanivāraṇatthaṃ,
analyzed: tatra ṭhitānam ussukka samuppādana attham sāvakānam ekasmin ṭhāne nibaddha vāsa nivāraṇa attham
translated: to prevent the resident disciples from settling down in one place,🔽to show that the Buddhas are not attached to dwelling in any one place,

original: attano ca tattha nibaddhavāse anāsaṅgadassanatthaṃ, sambuddhavasitaṭṭhānatāya desānaṃ
analyzed: attano ca tattha nibaddha vāse anāsaṅga dassana ttham sambuddha vasita ṭṭhāna tāya desānam
translated: to make the country a holy place by the Buddha’s presence,

original: cetiyabhāvasampādanatthaṃ, bahūnaṃ sattānaṃ dassanūpasaṅkamanādīhi puññoghappasavanatthaṃ,
analyzed: cetiya bhāva sampādana ttham bahūnam sattānam dassana upasaṅkamana ādīhi puñña ogha ppasavana ttham
translated: to cause many beings to make merit by seeing the Buddha, by paying homage to him, etc.,🔽and to allay any danger of drought.

original: avuṭṭhiādiupaddavūpasamanatthañcāti imehi sattahi kāraṇehi buddhā bhagavanto janapadacārikaṃ🔽carantīti janapadacaraṇakāraṇaṃ veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: avuṭṭhi ādi upaddava upasamanattham ca ati imehi sattahi kāraṇehi buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ janapada cārikam  caranti iti janapada caraṇa kāraṇam veditabbam
translated: These are the reasons why the Buddhas go on a tour of the country.

original: “Ekapupphaṃ cajitvāna, sahassaṃ kappakoṭiyo;
analyzed: eka puppham cajitvāna sahassam kappa koṭiyaḥ
translated: “Having given away a single flower, for a thousand koṭis of eons,🔽among gods and men, he was reborn in happy states;

original: Deve ceva manusse ca, sesena parinibbuto”ti. –
analyzed: deve ca iva manusse ca sesena parinibbutoti
translated: with the remainder he attained Nibbāna.”

original: Idaṃ suttampi vāsanābhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ nāma. Sahassaṃ kappakoṭiyoti sahassaṃ attabhāvato koṭiyo.
analyzed: idam suttam pi vāsanābhāgiyam suttam nāma sahassam kappa koṭiyaḥ ti sahassam atta bhāvato koṭiyaḥ
translated: A thousand times a koṭi of aeons: a thousand times a koṭi of his own existences.

original: “Assatthe haritobhāse, saṃvirūḷhamhi pādape;
analyzed: assatthe haritobhāse saṃvirūḍhamhi pādape
translated: Under a tree with green-shining leaves,

original: Ekaṃ buddhagataṃ saññaṃ, alabhiṃhaṃ patissato.
analyzed: ekam buddha gatam saññam alabhiṃham patissataḥ
translated: I gained a perception of a single Enlightened One, mindful.🔽Today thirty aeons from that time,

original: “Ajja tiṃsaṃ tato kappā, nābhijānāmi duggatiṃ;
analyzed: ajja tiṃsam tatas kappāḥ na abhijānāmi duggatim
translated: I do not recall any ill destiny,🔽The three True Knowledges are realized,

original: Tisso vijjā sacchikatā, tassā saññāya vāsanā”ti. –
analyzed: tissaḥ vijjā sacchikatā tassā saññāya vāsanā ati
translated: That perception’s sequel is this .

original: Idaṃ suttampi vāsanābhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ nāma. Haritobhāseti haritaobhāse. Alabhiṃhanti ahaṃ alabhiṃ.
analyzed: idam vāsanābhāgiyam suttam nāma haritobhāseti haritaobhāse aham aham
translated: This is a Thread-Verse dealing with the sequel to the influence of the past. Green-shining leaves : green-shining leaves. I gained : I gained.

original: “Piṇḍāya kosalaṃ puraṃ…pe… vipāko hoti acintiyo”ti idaṃ suttampi vāsanābhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ🔽nāma. Aggapuggalo anukampako taṇhānighātako muni sambuddho purebhattaṃ piṇḍāya piṇḍaṃ
analyzed: piṇḍāya kosalam puraṃpe vipākaḥ hoti acintiyaḥ ti idam suttam pi vāsanābhāgiyam suttam  nāma agga puggalaḥ anukampako taṇhā nighātakaḥ muni sambuddhaḥ purebhattam piṇḍāya piṇḍam
translated: This is a Thread-Verse dealing with the sequel to the influence of the past.

original: paṭiggaṇhituṃ kosalaṃ puraṃ pāvisi.
analyzed: paṭiggaṇhitum kosalam puram pāvisi
translated: The foremost person, the compassionate one, the sage who has destroyed craving, the Enlightened One, entered the town of Kosala for almsfood in the morning to receive almsfood in the bowl.

original: Yassa purisassa hatthe sabbapupphehi alaṅkato vaṭaṃsako pupphavaṭaṃsakova atthi,
analyzed: yassa purisassa hatthe sabba pupphehi alaṅkataḥ vaṭaṃsako puppha vaṭaṃsakaḥ uva atthi
translated: The bowl of flowers was a vaṭa tree decorated with all flowers in the hand of a man.

original: so ayaṃ puriso rājamaggena kosalapuraṃ pavisantaṃ bhikkhusaṅghapurakkhataṃ devamānusapūjitaṃ
analyzed: saḥ ayam purisaḥ rājamaggena kosala puram pavisantam bhikkhu saṅgha purakkhatam deva mānusa pūjitam
translated: This man saw the Sambuddha, who was being honoured by gods and men, entering the city of Kosambī with the Community of monks in front of him.

original: sambuddhaṃ addasa, disvā haṭṭho cittaṃ pasādesi; pasādetvā sambuddhaṃ upasaṅkami.
analyzed: sambuddham addasa disvā haṭṭhaḥ cittam pasādesi pasādetvā sambuddham upasaṅkami
translated: Having seen (the Buddha), he was delighted and his mind was confident; having gained confidence, he approached the Sambuddha.

original: Upasaṅkamitvā so ayaṃ pasanno hutvā surabhiṃ vaṇṇavantaṃ manoramaṃ taṃ vaṭaṃsakaṃ sambuddhassa sehi pāṇībhi upanāmesi.
analyzed: upasaṅkamitvā saḥ ayam pasannaḥ hutvā surabhim vaṇṇavantam manoramam tam vaṭaṃsakam sambuddhassa sehi pāṇībhi upanāmesi
translated: Having approached, this man, being full of faith, offered with his own hands that fragrant, beautiful, delightful Vaṭa flower to the Sambuddha.

original: Tato buddhassa lapanantarā lapanassa vadanassa antarā aggisikhā vaṇṇā sahassaraṃsi
analyzed: tatas buddhassa lapana antarā lapanassa vadanassa antarā aggi sikhā vaṇṇā sahassa raṃsi
translated: Then from the mouth of the Buddha, from the middle of the mouth, a light like the flame of a fire, with a thousand rays,

original: okkā pabhā nikkhami, abbhā vijju nikkhamati iva, evaṃ ānanā sahassaraṃsi nikkhamitvā
analyzed: okkā pabhā nikkhami abbhā vijju nikkhamati iva evam ānanā sahassaraṃsi nikkhamitvā
translated: emerged, just as a lightning flash emerges from the sky, and in the same way, having emerged from the mouth with a thousand rays,

original: ādiccabandhuno sīse tikkhattuṃ padakkhiṇaṃ karitvāna parivaṭṭetvā muddhani antaradhāyatha.
analyzed: ādiccabandhunaḥ sīse tikkhattum padakkhiṇam karitvāna parivaṭṭetvā muddhani antaradhāyatha
translated: after going round the head of the Sun’s Kinsman (the Buddha) three times to the right, it disappeared in his head.

original: Ānando acchariyaṃ abbhutaṃ lomahaṃsanaṃ idaṃ pāṭihāriyaṃ disvā cīvaraṃ ekaṃsaṃ karitvā etaṃ abravi – “mahāmuni, sitakammassa hetu ko? Taṃ hetuṃ byākarohi, dhammāloko bhavissatī”ti.
analyzed: ānandaḥ acchariyam abbhutam lomahaṃsanam idam pāṭihāriyam disvā cīvaram ekaṃsam karitvā etam abravi mahā muni sita kammassa hetu kaḥ tam hetum byākarohi dhamma ālokaḥ bhavissati iti
translated: Ānanda, seeing this wonderful, marvellous, hair-stirring miracle, arranged his upper robe on one shoulder, and said this to the Fortunate One: “What is the cause, Great Seer, of this white radiance? Please explain the cause of this, Fortunate One, there will be those who understand the Dhamma.”

original: Yassa bhagavato sabbadhammesu ñāṇaṃ sadā pavattati, kaṅkhāvitaraṇo muni so bhagavā
analyzed: yassa bhagavataḥ sabba dhammesu ñāṇam sadā pavattati kaṅkhā vitaraṇaḥ muni saḥ bhagavā
translated: The Fortunate One, who has knowledge of all things, the Sage who has crossed over doubt,

original: kaṅkhiṃ vematikaṃ ānandaṃ theraṃ etaṃ abravi. Ānanda, yo sopuriso mayi cittaṃ pasādayi,
analyzed: kaṅkhim vematikam ānandam theram etam abravi ānanda yaḥ so purisaḥ mayi cittam
translated: said this to the Elder Ānanda, who was doubtful and uncertain: “Ānanda, that person who had faith in me,

original: so puriso caturāsītikappāni duggatiṃ na gamissati, devesu devasobhaggaṃ dibbaṃ rajjaṃ🔽pasāsitvā manujesu raṭṭhe sakalaraṭṭhe manujindo rājā bhavissati. So puriso carimaṃ
analyzed: saḥ purisaḥ catur āsīti kappāni duggatim na gamissati devesu deva sobhaggam dibbam rajjam  pasāsitvā manujesu raṭṭhe sakala raṭṭhe manujindo rājā bhavissati so puriso carimaṃ
translated: that person will not go to a bad destination for eighty-four thousand aeons, and after ruling as a King of the Gods among the Gods for a divine aeon,
