original: pabbajitvā, dhammataṃ sacchikatvā ca dhutarāgo vaṭaṃsako nāma paccekabuddho bhavissati.
analyzed: pabbajitvā dhammataṃ sacchikatvā ca dhuta rāgaḥ vaṭaṃsakaḥ nāma paccekabuddhaḥ bhavissati
translated: and ruling as a King of Men among humans in the whole country, he will go forth in his last existence, and after realising the Dhamma for himself, he will become a Paccekabuddha named Vaṭaṃsika, who is free from passion.”

original: Tathāgate vā sammāsambuddhe vā paccekasambuddhe vā tassa tathāgatassa sāvake vā citte pasannamhi dakkhiṇā appakā nāma natthi.
analyzed: tathāgate vā sammāsambuddhe vā paccekasambuddhe vā tassa tathāgatassa sāvake vā citte pasannamhi dakkhiṇā appakā nāma natthi
translated: And so too there is no smallness in the gift when the mind is confident in a Perfect Buddha, or in a Paccekabuddha, or in a disciple of a Perfect Buddha.

original: Buddhā evaṃ ettakāti acintiyā bhavanti. Buddhadhammā buddhaguṇā evaṃ ettakāti acintiyā
analyzed: buddhāḥ evam ettakā ati acintiyāḥ bhavanti buddha dhammāḥ buddha guṇāḥ evam ettakāḥ ati acintiyāḥ
translated: The Buddhas are inconceivable, the Buddhas’ ideas and the Buddhas’ special qualities are inconceivable,

original: bhavanti, acintiye pasannānaṃ vipāko puññavipāko evaṃ ettakoti acintiyo hotīti etaṃ abravīti yojanā.
analyzed: bhavanti acintiye pasannānam vipāko puñña vipāko evam ettako ti acintiyaḥ hoti iti etam abravīti yojanā
translated: the ripening of the fruit of the inconceivable confidence is inconceivable.

original: 96. “Idhāhaṃ, bhikkhave, ekaccaṃ puggalaṃ…pe… ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā iti me
analyzed: idha aham bhikkhave ekaccam ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me
translated: “Here, bhikkhus, I see one kind of person … This too was said by the Blessed One, so I have heard.

original: suta”nti idaṃ suttampi vāsanābhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ nāma. Bhikkhave, idha imasmiṃ sāsane🔽ahaṃ ekaccaṃ puggalaṃ evaṃ mama cetasā ekaccassa puggalassa ceto cittaṃ paricca buddhacakkhunā
analyzed: sutam ti idam suttam pi vāsanābhāgiyam suttam nāma bhikkhave idha imasmin sāsane  aham ekaccam puggalam evam mama cetasā ekaccassa puggalassa cetaḥ cittam paricca buddha cakkhunā
translated: This discourse too is called “Discourse with a Refrain” .🔽“Here, bhikkhus, I see one kind of person …

original: evaṃ pajānāmi, yathā yena pakārena ayaṃ puggalo yañca dānādipaṭipadaṃ paṭipanno,
analyzed: evam pajānāmi yathā yena pakārena ayam puggalaḥ yat ca dāna ādi paṭipadam paṭipannaḥ
translated: I understand the mind of that person with my mind thus: ‘If this person were to die on the spot, he would be cast down into hell.’🔽And why? Because this person misrepresents his view of the Dhamma taught by me.

original: yañca dassanādimaggaṃ samāruḷho hutvā taṃ paṭipadaṃ, maggañca iriyati pavatteti,🔽imamhi imasmiñca samaye ayaṃ puggalo ce kālaṃ kareyya, evaṃ sati ābhataṃ vatthuṃ
analyzed: yam ca dassana ādi maggam samāruḷhaḥ hutvā tam paṭipadam maggam ca iriyati pavattā iti  imamhi imasmin ca samaye ayam puggalaḥ ce kālam kareyya evam sati vatthum
translated: And when he has mounted the path of seeing, etc., and he keeps to that practice, he keeps to the path,

original: nikkhipati yathā, evaṃ tāya paṭipadāya tena maggena sagge attanikkhitto bhave. Taṃ
analyzed: nikkhipati yathā evam tāya paṭipadāya tena maggena sagge atta nikkhittaḥ bhave tam
translated: if he were to die at that time, then in that case he would be deposited in heaven by that practice, by that path.

original: kissa hetu? Bhikkhave, assa puggalassa cittaṃ hi yasmā pasannaṃ pasāditaṃ, tasmā
analyzed: kissa hetu bhikkhave assa puggalassa cittam hi yasmā pasannam pasāditam tasmā
translated: Why is that? Because, bhikkhus, his mind is clear, purified, and bright,

original: nikkhitto bhave. Idha sāsane, loke vā ekacce sattā puggalā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā
analyzed: nikkhittaḥ bhave idha sāsane loke vā ekacce sattā puggalā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā
translated: therefore he would be deposited in heaven. Here in the Dispensation, or in the world, some beings, some persons, by body-breakup after death

original: sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ cetopasādahetu kho pana upapajjantīti evaṃ ahaṃ pajānāmīti bhagavā
analyzed: sugatim saggam lokam cetaḥ upasāda hetu kho pana upapajjanti iti evam aham pajānāmi iti bhagavā
translated: are reborn in a happy destiny, in the heavenly world. Because of the confidence in mind. Thus I understand it.

original: etamatthaṃ avoca. Tattha tasmiṃ atthe saṅgahavasena pavattaṃ etaṃ “pasannacittaṃ
analyzed: etam attham avoca tattha tasmin atthe saṅgaha vasena pavattam etam pasanna cittam
translated: The Blessed One spoke this meaning. Herein, this statement of the verse, “Having known the mind that is confident, …

original: ñatvāna…pe… saggaṃ so upapajjatī”ti gāthāvacanaṃ vuccati. Ayampi attho bhagavatā
analyzed: saggam so upapajjati iti gāthā vacanam vuccati ayam pi atthaḥ bhagavatā
translated: … he is reborn in heaven,” is said by way of a summary of that meaning. This meaning also was spoken by the Blessed One,

original: vutto, iti me mayā sutanti yojanā.
analyzed: iti me mayā sutanti yojanā
translated: thus it is to be construed.

original: “Suvaṇṇacchadanaṃ nāvaṃ…pe… etādisaṃ katapuññā labhi”nti idaṃ suttampi vāsanābhāgiyaṃ
analyzed: suvaṇṇa chadanam na avaṃpe etādisam kata puññāḥ labhinti idam suttam pi vāsanābhāgiyam
translated: “A golden-covered ship … such a one as this, the virtuous obtain” — this sutta, too, is a sutta of the type that deals with the “residue” .

original: suttaṃ nāma. Nāri devadhītā suvaṇṇacchadanaṃ suvaṇṇālaṅkārehi chāditaṃ nāvaṃ āruyha
analyzed: suttam nāma nāri deva dhītā suvaṇṇa chadanam suvaṇṇa alaṅkārehi chāditam nāvam āruyha
translated: The goddess Nari boarded a ship covered with gold and adorned with golden ornaments,

original: tiṭṭhasi, pokkharaṇiṃ devapokkharaṇiṃ ogāhasi, padumaṃ pāṇinā chindasi.
analyzed: tiṭṭhasi pokkharaṇim deva pokkharaṇim ogāhasi padumam pāṇinā chindasi
translated: and stood there. You entered a lotus pond, a divine lotus pond, and you cut a lotus with your hand.

original: Devate kena kammena te tava tādiso vaṇṇo tādiso ānubhāvo tādisī juti bhavati, devate
analyzed: devate kena kammena te tava tādisaḥ vaṇṇo tādisaḥ ānubhāvaḥ tādisī juti bhavati devate
translated: Goddess, by what deed do you have such beauty, such majesty, such radiance? Goddess,

original: te tava ye keci bhogā manasā icchitā bhavanti, te bhogā ca kena kammena uppajjanti.
analyzed: te tava ye keci bhogāḥ manasā icchitāḥ bhavanti te bhogāḥ ca kena kammena uppajjanti
translated: all your possessions, which are desired by the mind, by what deed do they arise?

original: Devate me pucchitā tvaṃ saṃsa saṃsāhi idaṃ sabbaṃ kissa kammassa ca phalanti sakko pucchati.
analyzed: devate me pucchitā tvam saṃsa saṃsāhi idam sabbam kissa kammassa ca phalanti sakkaḥ pucchati
translated: Goddess, I ask you, explain to me all this: “What is the fruit of what deed?” Sakka asks.

original: Devarājena pucchitā sā devadhītā attamanā hutvā pañhaṃ puṭṭhā sakkassa byākāsi. Devarājā
analyzed: devarājena pucchitā sā deva dhītā attamanāḥ hutvā pañham puṭṭhā sakkassa devarājā
translated: The goddess, asked by the king of the gods, being pleased, explained the question to Sakka, who had asked:

original: addhānaṃ dīghamaggaṃ paṭipannā ahaṃ yasassino kassapassa bhagavato manoramaṃ thūpaṃ
analyzed: addhānam dīgha maggam paṭipannā aham yasassinaḥ kassapassa bhagavataḥ manoramam thūpam
translated: “I was traveling a long distance on the road. I saw the beautiful stupa of the illustrious Kassapa, the Blessed One,

original: addassaṃ, disvā tattha thūpe cittaṃ pasādesiṃ. Pasannāhaṃ sehi pāṇīhi padumapupphehi
analyzed: addassam disvā tattha thūpe cittam pasādesim pasannā aham sehi pāṇīhi paduma pupphehi
translated: and having seen it, I had faith in the monument there. With my own hands I worshipped it with lotus flowers,

original: pūjesiṃ. Tasseva kammassa idaṃ sabbaṃ phalaṃ vipāko bhave. Katapuññāhaṃ etādisaṃ
analyzed: pūjesim tassa iva kammassa idam sabbam phalam vipākaḥ bhave kata puññāham etādisam
translated: and this is the result of that deed. Having made merit I have received such a reward.”

original: phalaṃ alabhinti sakkassa byākāsi. Iti me sutanti mahāmoggallāno vadatīti yojanā.
analyzed: phalam sakkassa iti me mahāmoggallānaḥ vadati iti yojanā
translated: Thus have I heard. The Elder Moggallāna said this.🔽Or it may be interpreted thus: “The sutta is complete with the perfuming portion, just as it was originally heard.”

original: “Yathāniddhāritasuttāniyeva vāsanābhāgiyasuttāni paripuṇṇānī”ti vattabbattā “dānakathā
analyzed: yathā vāsanābhāgiya suttāni paripuṇṇāni iti vattabbattā dāna kathā
translated: In order to show this, the following is said: “The talk on giving,

original: sīlakathā saggakathā puññakathā puññavipākakathāti idaṃ vāsanābhāgiya”ntiādi vuttaṃ.🔽Tattha yāya desanāya dānañca dānaphalañca dassitaṃ, sā desanā dānakathā nāma. Yāya🔽desanāya sīlañca sīlaphalañca dassitaṃ, sā desanā sīlakathā nāma. Yāya desanāya saggā
analyzed: sīla kathā sagga kathā puñña kathā puñña vipāka kathā ti idam vāsanābhāgiya ntiādi vuttam  tattha yāya desanāya dānam ca dāna phalam ca dassitam sā desanā dānakathā nāma yāya  desanāya sīlam ca sīla phalam ca dassitam sā desanā sīlakathā nāma yāya desanāya saggā
translated: the talk on virtue, the talk on heaven, the talk on merit, the talk on the ripening of merit—this is the perfuming portion.”

original: ca saggesu nibbattāpakañca kammaṃ dassitaṃ, sā saggakathā nāma. Yāya desanāya dānasīlabhāvanādivasena
analyzed: ca saggesu nibbattāpakam ca kammam dassitam sā saggakathā nāma yāya desanāya dāna sīla bhāvanā ādi vasena
translated: Herein, the teaching by which giving and the fruit of giving are shown is called the talk on giving. The teaching by which virtue and the fruit of virtue are shown is called the talk on virtue. The teaching by which the heavens and the kamma that leads to rebirth in the heavens are shown is called the talk on heaven. The teaching by which giving, virtue, meditation, etc., are shown is called the talk on merit. The teaching by which the fruit of giving, the fruit of virtue, the fruit of meditation, etc., are shown is called the talk on the ripening of merit.

original: dasavidhaṃ puññakammaṃ dassitaṃ, sā puññakathā nāma. Yāya desanāya tādisassa puññakammassa
analyzed: dasavidham puñña kammam dassitam sā puññakathā nāma yāya desanāya tādisassa puñña kammassa
translated: The tenfold meritorious action is shown, and that is called the meritorious talk.🔽By which teaching such a meritorious action

original: vividho ayaṃ vipāko imassa puññassa vipākoti niyametvā dassito, sā puññavipākakathā nāma.
analyzed: vividhaḥ ayam vipākaḥ imassa puññassa vipāko ti niyametvā dassitaḥ sā puñña vipākakathā nāma
translated: is shown by determining that this is the result of this merit, that is called the meritorious result talk.

original: Dasabaladharānaṃ sammāsambuddhānaṃ uddissakatesu sarīradhātuṃ abbhantare ṭhapetvā
analyzed: dasa baladharānam sammāsambuddhānam uddissa katesu sarīra dhātum abbhantare ṭhapetvā
translated: For the relics of the ten powers, the fully enlightened Buddhas, inside the stūpas made of ashes

original: paṃsūhi katesu thūpesu ye narā pasannā, te narā tattha thūpe kāraṃ puññaṃ katvā saggesu
analyzed: paṃsūhi katesu thūpesu ye narā pasannā te narā tattha thūpe kāram puññam katvā saggesu
translated: and sand, those faithful people, having made merit there at the stūpa,

original: uppajjitvā pamodantīti yojanā. Idaṃ suttaṃ vā…pe… suttaṃ.
analyzed: uppajjitvā pamodanti iti yojanā idam suttam vāpe suttam
translated: are reborn in the heavens and rejoice. This is the interpretation. This sutta is... and so on up to... the sutta.

original: 97. Devaputtasarīravaṇṇā devaputtasarīrasadisavaṇṇā subhagasaṇṭhiti sobhaggayuttasaṇṭhānā
analyzed: deva putta sarīra vaṇṇā deva putta sarīra sadisa vaṇṇā subhaga saṇṭhiti sobhagga yutta saṇṭhānā
translated: The color of the divine body, the color similar to the divine body, the beautiful arrangement, the arrangement endowed with splendor

original: sabbe janā udakena paṃsuṃ temetvā thūpaṃ vaḍḍhetha, so ayaṃ thūpo kassa puggalassa thūpoti pucchati.
analyzed: sabbe janāḥ udakena paṃsum temetvā thūpam vaḍḍhetha so ayam thūpo kassa puggalassa thūpo ti pucchati
translated: All people should moisten the sand with water and increase the stūpa. This stūpa is the stūpa of which person? he asks.

original: Sugatte sundaragatte devate tasmiṃ thūpe pasannā ime devamanujā kāraṃ puññaṃ karontā
analyzed: su gatte sundara gatte devate tasmin thūpe pasannāḥ ime deva manujā kāram puññam karontā
translated: The gods, the beautiful gods, the deities, faithful in that stūpa, these gods and humans, making merit,

original: hutvā jarāmaraṇato pamuccare. So ayaṃ thūpo mahesino dasabaladhammadhārino sugatassa
analyzed: hutvā jarā maraṇataḥ pamuccare saḥ ayam thūpaḥ mahesinaḥ dasa bala dhamma dhārinaḥ sugatassa
translated: and so are freed from old age and death. This is the monument of the Great Seer, the one with the ten powers, the one who bears the Dhamma, the Well-farer.

original: thūpoti veditabboti āhāti yojanā. Idaṃ suttaṃ vā…pe… suttaṃ.
analyzed: thūpaḥ iti veditabbaḥ ti āha ati yojanā idam suttam vāpe suttam
translated: It should be known as a monument. This is the verse…

original: Yāhaṃ yā ahaṃ mahesino thūpaṃ cattāri uppalāni ca mālañca abhiropayiṃ, tena mayā
analyzed: yā aham yā aham mahesinaḥ thūpam cattāri uppalāni ca mālam ca tena mayā
translated: The four lotuses and the garland that I placed on the monument of the Great Seer, by that

original: kataṃ taṃ puññaṃ uḷāraṃ vata āsi ahosi. Tato kappato ajja kappā tiṃsaṃ dharanti satthuno
analyzed: katam tam puññam uḷāram vata āsi ahosi tatas kappataḥ ajja kappā tiṃsam dharanti satthunaḥ
translated: the merit I made was very great indeed. Since then, for thirty-three aeons, I have been remembered by the Teacher.

original: thūpaṃ pūjetvā tattakāni duggatiṃ na jānāmi, vinipātaṃ na gacchāmīti yojanā. Idaṃ
analyzed: thūpam pūjetvā tattakāni duggatim na jānāmi vinipātam na gacchāmi iti yojanā idam
translated: Having worshipped the monument, I do not know of any bad destination, I do not go to a bad destination. This is the verse…

original: suttaṃ vā…pe… suttaṃ.
analyzed: suttam vāpe suttam
translated: The verse…

original: Ahaṃ bāttiṃsalakkhaṇadharassa bāttiṃsalakkhaṇadharena sampannassa vijitavijayassa
analyzed: aham bāttiṃsa lakkhaṇa dharassa bāttiṃsa lakkhaṇa dharena sampannassa vijita vijayassa
translated: I worshipped the monument of the one who bears the thirty-two marks, the one who is endowed with the thirty-two marks, the victorious,

original: lokanāthassa thūpaṃ apūjesiṃ, pūjetvā satasahassaṃ kappe āyukappe pamudito āsiṃ.
analyzed: lokanāthassa thūpam apūjesim pūjetvā sata sahassam kappe āyu kappe pamuditaḥ āsim
translated: the protector of the world. Having worshipped, for a hundred thousand aeons, in the aeon of life, I was joyful.

original: Mayā yaṃ puññaṃ pasutaṃ, tena puññena vinipātaṃ anāgantuna anāgantvā devasobhaggaṃ
analyzed: mayā yam puññam pasutam tena puññena vinipātam anāgantunā an āgantvā deva sobhaggam
translated: By the merit that I have made, by that merit, not having gone to a bad destination, not having gone, I have become the foremost of gods.

original: sampattiṃ ca devarajjāni ca tāni akāriṃ. Atha vā devasobhaggañca mayā kāritaṃ, rajjāni ca mayā kāritāni.
analyzed: sampattim ca deva rajjāni ca tāni akārim atha vā deva sobhaggam ca mayā kāritam rajjāni ca mayā kāritāni
translated: and the glory of the gods and the kingship of the gods I have done. Or else: the glory of the gods and the kingship of the gods have been done by me.

original: Adantadamakassa sāsane yaṃ cakkhu paññācakkhu paṇihitaṃ, tathā cittaṃ yaṃ vimuttacittaṃ
analyzed: a danta damakassa sāsane yam cakkhu paññā cakkhu paṇihitam tathā cittam yam vimutta cittam
translated: In the Dispensation of the Tamer of the Untamed, the eye of wisdom, the eye of wisdom that is directed, and the mind that is liberated,

original: paṇihitaṃ, taṃ sabbaṃ paññācakkhu vimuttacittaṃ me mayā laddhaṃ, ahaṃ vidhutalatāsaṅkhātataṇhā
analyzed: paṇihitam tat sabbam paññā cakkhu vimutta cittam me mayā laddham aham vidhuta latā saṅkhāta taṇhā
translated: the mind that is liberated and directed, all that wisdom-eye and liberated-mind has been obtained by me, I have burnt up craving called the tangled skein,

original: hutvā vimuttacittā phalavimuttacittasampannā amhīti avocāti yojanā. Idaṃ suttaṃ vā…pe… suttaṃ.
analyzed: hutvā vimutta cittā phala vimutta citta sampannā amhi iti avoca ati yojanā idam suttam vāpe suttam
translated: and I have become one who is liberated-minded, one who is endowed with the fruit of liberation, I have spoken. This Thread is the Thread called “The Skein of Craving” .

original: 98. Vimuttacitte phalavimuttacittasampanne akhile pañcacetokhīlarahite anāsave araṇavihārimhi
analyzed: vimutta citte phala vimutta citta sampanne akhile pañca cetaḥ khīla rahite anāsave araṇa vihārimhi
translated: In the one who is liberated-minded, who is endowed with the fruit of liberation, who is complete, who is without the five lower fetters, who is without influxes, who is living the life of no-conflict,

original: araṇavihārasīle asaṅgamānase alaggamānase paccekabuddhasmiṃ sāmākapatthodanamattameva dakkhiṇaṃ adāsiṃ.
analyzed: araṇa vihāra sīle asaṅga mānase alagga mānase paccekabuddhasmim sāmāka patthodana mattam eva dakkhiṇam adāsim
translated: in the Paccekabuddha who is of no-conflict virtue, who is of no-conflict mind, who is unattached, who is unfettered, I gave a gift of just a single bowl of rice-gruel.

original: Tasmiṃ paccekabuddhe uttamaṃ dhammaṃ paccekabodhidhammaṃ okappayiṃ “so uttamo dhammo
analyzed: tasmin paccekabuddhe uttamam dhammam pacceka bodhi dhammam okappayim saḥ uttamaḥ dhammaḥ
translated: In that Paccekabuddha I established the supreme Dhamma, the Paccekabuddha’s Awakening Dhamma: “That supreme Dhamma

original: atthī”ti saddahiṃ. Evaṃ ariyavihārena vihārīhi paccekabuddhehi me mama saṅgamo kato
analyzed: atthi iti saddahim evam ariya vihārena vihārīhi paccekabuddhehi me mama saṅgamaḥ kato
translated: I agreed. Thus I met with those Paccekabuddhas who lived the Ariyan life.

original: siyā bhave, kudāsupi ca ahaṃ apekkhavā mā bhaveyyanti mānasaṃ tasmiñca dhamme paṇidhesiṃ
analyzed: siyā bhave ca aham apekkhavā mā bhaveyya nti mānasam tasmin ca dhamme paṇidhesiṃ
translated: I made a wish in my mind that I might not be desirous of rebirth, and I made a vow in regard to that Dhamma,

original: “iminā paccekabuddhena laddhadhammaṃ ahampi sacchikareyya”nti cittaṃ paṇidahiṃ.
analyzed: iminā paccekabuddhena laddha dhammam aham pi sacchikareyyanti cittam paṇidahim
translated: “May I realise the Dhamma that was attained by this Paccekabuddha.”

original: Tasseva paccekabuddhe katasseva kammassa vipākato ahaṃ dīghāyukesu amamesu “mama
analyzed: tassa iva paccekabuddhe katassa iva kammassa vipākataḥ aham dīgha āyukesu amamesu mama
translated: As a result of that deed done to that Paccekabuddha I was reborn a thousand times among the Long-lived Divinities, who are free from passion,

original: pariggaho”ti pariggahābhāvena apariggahesu visesagāmīsu ahīnagāmīsu kurūsu uttarakurūsu
analyzed: pariggahaḥ ti pariggaha abhāvena apariggahesu visesa gāmīsu ahīna gāmīsu kurūsu uttarakurūsu
translated: among the Kurus, who are free from passion, who are not subject to decline, who are not subject to loss, who are not subject to destruction, who are not subject to confusion, who are not subject to being overcome, who are not subject to being overcome by others,

original: pāṇīsu sattesu sahassakkhattuṃ upapajjatha upapajjiṃ.
analyzed: pāṇīsu sattesu sahassakkhattum upapajjatha upapajjim
translated: among the Pāṇḍavas, among the Satas.

original: Tasseva kammassa vipākato vicitramālābharaṇānulepīsu yasassīsu parivāravantesu tidaso devo ahaṃ visiṭṭhakāyūpagato hutvā sahassakkhattuṃ upapajjatha.
analyzed: tassa iva kammassa vipākataḥ vicitra mālā ābharaṇa anulepīsu yasassīsu parivāravantesu tidasaḥ devaḥ aham visiṭṭha kāya upagataḥ hutvā sahassa kkhattum upapajjatha
translated: As a result of that deed I was reborn a thousand times as the god Tidasa, who is endowed with a special body, who is adorned with a variegated garland, with ornaments and ointments, who is famous, who is surrounded by a retinue,

original: Tasseva kammassa vipākato ahaṃ vimuttacitto akhīlo anāsavo hutvā hitāhitāsīhi kusalākusalavītivattehi
analyzed: tassa iva kammassa vipākataḥ aham vimutta cittaḥ akhīlaḥ anāsavaḥ hutvā hita ahita āsīhi kusala akusala vītivattehi
translated: As a result of that same deed, I, being free of mind, free of blemish, free of passion, having passed beyond what is to be known and not to be known,

original: antimadehadhāribhi imehi paccekabuddhehi, buddhasāvakehi vā me mama samāgamo āsi.🔽“Sīlavato yaṃ icchitaṃ, taṃ samijjhate”ti imaṃ vacanaṃ tathāgato jino paccakkhaṃ
analyzed: antima deha dhāribhi imehi paccekabuddhehi buddha sāvakehi vā me mama samāgamaḥ āsi  sīlavataḥ yam icchitam tam samijjhata iti imam vacanam tathāgataḥ jinaḥ paccakkham
translated: had association with these Paccekabuddhas, who were bearing their last bodies, or with the Buddha’s disciples.🔽The Victor, the Realised One, having seen for himself,

original: katvā avaca kho, yathā yathā yena yena pakārena me manasā vicintitaṃ, tathā tathā
analyzed: katvā avaca yathā yathā yena yena pakārena me manasā vicintitam tathā tathā
translated: said this: “Whatever is wished for by one who is virtuous, that succeeds.” In whatever way, in whatever manner, whatever was thought by my mind, in that way,

original: tena tena pakārena samiddhaṃ bhavati. Ayaṃ bhavo antimo bhavoti yojanā. Idaṃ suttaṃ vā…pe… suttaṃ.
analyzed: tena tena pakārena samiddham bhavati ayam bhavaḥ antimaḥ bhavaḥ iti yojanā idam suttam vāpe suttam
translated: in that manner, it was successful. This existence is the last existence. This is the Thread, or … the Thread.

original: Ekatiṃsamhi kappamhi jino anejo anantadassī “sikhī”ti itināmako uppajji. Tassāpi
analyzed: ekatiṃsamhi kappamhi jinaḥ anejaḥ ananta dassī sikhī iti iti nāmakaḥ uppajji tassa api
translated: In the twenty-first aeon the Victor, the Unperturbed One, the Infinite Seer, named “Sikhī” arose. To that

original: bhagavato rājā bhātā sikhiddhe ca sikhī itināmake buddhe ca tassa bhagavato dhamme
analyzed: bhagavataḥ rājā bhātā sikhiddhe ca sikhī iti nāmake buddhe ca tassa bhagavato dhamme
translated: Blessed One the King was a brother, and he was devoted to the Buddha named “Sikhī” and to the Blessed One’s Dhamma,

original: ca abhippasanno lokavināyakamhi parinibbute sati devātidevassa naruttamassa mahesino
analyzed: ca abhippasanno loka vināyakamhi parinibbute sati devātidevassa naruttamassa mahesino
translated: and when the Leader of the World had finally attained Nibbāna, he was devoted to the Great Seer, the God of Gods, the Best of Men,🔽and he had a shrine made for the Realised One, the Buddha, the Best of Men.

original: vipulaṃ mahantaṃ samantato gāvutikaṃ thūpaṃ akāsiṃ.
analyzed: vipulam mahantam samantataḥ gāvutikam thūpam akāsim
translated: I built a vast, great, all-around-beautiful stūpa.

original: Tasmiṃ thūpe baliṃ pūjābaliṃ abhihārī manusso jātisumanaṃ paggayha pahaṭṭho pūjesi.
analyzed: tasmin thūpe balim pūjā balim abhihārī manussaḥ jāti sumanam paggayha pahaṭṭhaḥ pūjesi
translated: A man who was making an offering, a worship-offering, to that stūpa, having put up a jasmine flower, worshipped.

original: Assa manussassa ekaṃ pupphaṃ vātena paharitaṃ hutvā patitaṃ. Ahaṃ taṃ patitaṃ ekaṃ
analyzed: assa manussassa ekam puppham vātena paharitam hutvā patitam aham tam patitam ekam
translated: A flower of his was struck by the wind and fell down. I took that fallen

original: pupphaṃ gahetvā tasseva pupphasāmikassa adāsiṃ.
analyzed: puppham gahetvā tassa iva puppha sāmikassa adāsim
translated: flower and gave it to the owner of the flower.

original: So manusso pupphasāmiko abhippasannacitto hutvā maṃ “tvameva etaṃ ekaṃ pupphaṃ pūjā”ti
analyzed: saḥ manussaḥ puppha sāmikaḥ abhippasanna cittaḥ hutvā mam tvam eva etam ekam puppham pūjā ati
translated: The man, the owner of the flower, being very pleased, gave it to me, saying: “You worship with this one flower.”🔽The syllable da in dadāsī is a prefix. I, having taken that one flower,

original: adāsi. Dadāsīti ettha da-kāro āgamo. Ahaṃ taṃ ekaṃ pupphaṃ gahetvā buddhaṃ buddhaguṇaṃ
analyzed: adāsi dadāsi iti ettha dakāraḥ āgamaḥ aham tam ekam puppham gahetvā buddham buddha guṇam
translated: remembering again and again the Buddha and the Buddha’s qualities,

original: punappunaṃ anussaranto yasmiṃ kappe abhiropayiṃ, tato kappato ajja kappā tiṃsaṃ ahesuṃ.
analyzed: punappunam anussarantaḥ yasmin kappe abhiropayim tatas kappataḥ ajja kappā tiṃsam ahesuṃ
translated: in the aeon in which I made the offering, since that aeon, thirty aeons have passed.

original: Tesu kappesu duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, vinipātañca na gacchāmi, idaṃ phalaṃ thūpapūjāya
analyzed: tesu kappesu duggatim na abhijānāmi vinipātam ca na gacchāmi idam phalam thūpa pūjāya
translated: In those aeons I do not know of any bad destination, and I do not go to the lower worlds, this is the fruit of worshipping a stūpa.

original: phalanti avocāti yojanā. Idaṃ suttaṃ vā…pe… suttaṃ.
analyzed: phalanti avoca ati yojanā idam suttam vāpe suttam
translated: The explanation is: “I said it is the fruit.” This sutta is the same as … and so on as the sutta.

original: Brahmadattassa brahmadattanāmakassa rājino kapilaṃ nāma nagaraṃ suvibhattaṃ bhāgato
analyzed: brahmadattassa brahmadatta nāmakassa rājinaḥ kapilam nāma nagaram suvibhattam bhāgataḥ
translated: The city of Kapila, belonging to the king Brahmadatta, was well laid out,

original: suṭṭhu vibhattaṃ, mahāpathaṃ mahāpathasampannaṃ ākiṇṇaṃ, nānājātikehi manussehi paripuṇṇaṃ,
analyzed: suṭṭhu vibhattam mahāpatham mahāpatha sampannam ākiṇṇam nānā jātikehi manussehi paripuṇṇam
translated: well built, with a great highway, well supplied with food, crowded with people of all nations,

original: iddhaṃ phītañca āsi.
analyzed: iddham phītam ca āsi
translated: and prosperous and flourishing.

original: Pañcālānaṃ tattha puruttame ahaṃ kummāsaṃ vikkiṇiṃ, so ahaṃ yasassinaṃ upariṭṭhaṃ
analyzed: pañcālānam tattha puruttame aham kummāsam vikkiṇim saḥ aham yasassinam upariṭṭham
translated: In the chief city of the Pañcālas I was selling cakes, and I saw the famous Paccekabuddha Ariṭṭha

original: upasamīpe ṭhitaṃ ariṭṭhaṃ nāma sambuddhaṃ paccekabuddhaṃ addasiṃ, disvā haṭṭho cittaṃ
analyzed: upasamīpe ṭhitam ariṭṭham nāma sambuddham paccekabuddham addasim disvā haṭṭhaḥ cittam
translated: standing near the top of the hill. When I had seen him, I was thrilled, and I calmed my mind,

original: pasādetvā naruttamaṃ ariṭṭhaṃ me gehasmiṃ yaṃ dhuvabhattaṃ vijjatha vijji, tena dhuvabhattena nimantesiṃ.
analyzed: pasādetvā naruttamam ariṭṭham me gehasmin yam dhuva bhattam vijjatha vijji tena dhuva bhattena nimantesiṃ
translated: and invited the best of men, Ariṭṭha, to take his regular meal in my house.

original: Yato ca yasmiṃ kāle ca kattiko yassaṃ pannarasīpuṇṇo, sā puṇṇamāsī pannarasī upaṭṭhitā,
analyzed: yatas ca yasmin kāle ca kattikaḥ pannarasī puṇṇaḥ sā puṇṇamāsī pannarasī upaṭṭhitā
translated: And when the time came, on the day of the full moon,

original: tato ca tasmiṃ kāle ca ahaṃ navaṃ dussayugaṃ gayha ariṭṭhassa ariṭṭhanāmakassa paccekabuddhassa upanāmesiṃ.
analyzed: tatas ca tasmin kāle ca aham navam dussayugam gayha ariṭṭhassa ariṭṭha nāmakassa paccekabuddhassa upanāmesiṃ
translated: I took a new pair of garments and presented them to the Paccekabuddha Ariṭṭha.

original: Naruttamo anukampako kāruṇiko taṇhānighātako muni paccekabuddho pasannacittaṃ maṃ ñatvāna paṭiggaṇhi.
analyzed: naruttamaḥ anukampako kāruṇiko taṇhā nighātakaḥ muni paccekabuddho pasanna cittam mam ñatvāna paṭiggaṇhi
translated: The Supreme Man, the compassionate, the merciful, the sage who had destroyed the craving, the Paccekabuddha, knowing that my heart was full of faith, accepted (my offering).

original: Ahaṃ kalyāṇaṃ buddhavaṇṇitaṃ kammaṃ karitvāna deve ca manusse ca sandhāvitvā tato cuto bārāṇasiyaṃ nagare aḍḍhe kulasmiṃ seṭṭhissa ekaputtako uppajjiṃ, pāṇehi ca piyataro āsiṃ.
analyzed: aham kalyāṇam buddha vaṇṇitam kammam karitvāna deve ca manusse ca sandhāvitvā tatas cutaḥ bārāṇasiyam nagare aḍḍhe kulasmim seṭṭhissa eka puttakaḥ uppajjim pāṇehi ca piyataraḥ āsim
translated: I, having done a good deed, praised by the Buddha, having wandered among the gods and men, after passing away from there, was reborn in the city of Bārāṇasī in a rich family as the only son of a merchant, and was dearer than life itself.

original: Tato ca tasmiṃ kāle viññutaṃ patto hutvā devaputtena codito ahaṃ pāsādā oruhitvāna sambuddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ gotamaṃ upasaṅkamiṃ.
analyzed: tatas ca tasmin kāle viññutam pattaḥ hutvā devaputtena coditaḥ aham pāsādāḥ oruhitvāna sambuddham bhagavantam gotamam upasaṅkamiṃ
translated: Then at that time, having attained maturity, and being urged on by a god, I descended from the palace and approached the Sambuddha, the Fortunate One Gotama.

original: So sambuddho bhagavā gotamo anukampāya me dhammaṃ adesesi. Dukkhaṃ dukkhasaccañca🔽dukkhasamuppādaṃ samudayasaccañca dukkhassa atikkamaṃ nirodhasaccañca ariyaṃ aṭṭhaṅgikaṃ
analyzed: saḥ sambuddhaḥ bhagavā gotamaḥ anukampāya me dhammaṃ adesesi dukkham dukkha saccaṃ ca  dukkha samuppādam samudaya saccañca dukkhassa atikkamam nirodha saccañca ariyam aṭṭhaṅgikam
translated: That Sambuddha, the Fortunate One Gotama, out of compassion, taught me the Dhamma. (He taught me) suffering, the Truth of Suffering

original: dukkhūpasamagāminaṃ maggaṃ maggasaccañca iti cattāri saccāni desitāni, taduppādakaṃ
analyzed: dukkha upasama gāminam maggam magga saccam ca iti cattāri saccāni desitāni tad uppādakam
translated: (He taught me) the arising of suffering, the Truth of the Arising of Suffering (He taught me) the overcoming of suffering, the Truth of the Overcoming of Suffering (He taught me) the noble eight-fold path which leads to the stilling of suffering, the Truth of the Path. Thus the four truths were taught, and the Dhamma

original: dhammaṃ muni bhagavā gotamo adesayi.
analyzed: dhammam muni bhagavā gotamaḥ adesayi
translated: which causes their arising was taught by the sage, the Fortunate One Gotama.

original: Ahaṃ tassa bhagavato gotamassa vacanaṃ sutvā sāsane rato hutvā vihariṃ, ahaṃ rattindivaṃ atandito hutvā samathaṃ paṭivijjhiṃ.
analyzed: aham tassa bhagavataḥ gotamassa vacanam sutvā sāsane rataḥ hutvā viharim aham rattindivam a tanditaḥ hutvā samatham paṭivijjhim
translated: Having heard the word of the Blessed One Gotama, I was pleased with the Dispensation, and I lived delighting in it, and day and night I was diligent and penetrated the calm.

original: Ajjhattañca ye āsavā, bahiddhā ca ye āsavā maggena samucchinnā āsuṃ, sabbe te āsavā me mama vijjiṃsu, puna na ca uppajjare.
analyzed: ajjhattam ca ye āsavāḥ bahiddhā ca ye āsavāḥ maggena samucchinnāḥ āsum sabbe te āsavā me mama vijjiṃsu puna na ca uppajjare
translated: And whatever defilements there were within, and whatever defilements there were without, all those defilements were cut off by the path, and they did not arise again.

original: Dukkhaṃ “pariyantakataṃ yassa dukkhassā”ti pariyantakataṃ āsi, ayaṃ samussayo jātimaraṇasaṃsāro
analyzed: dukkham pariyanta katam yassa dukkhassa ati pariyanta katam āsi ayam samussayaḥ jāti maraṇa saṃsāro
translated: The suffering that had a limit was made to have an end, this was the end of birth and death, the end of the round of rebirths,

original: carimo antimo āsi, idāni imassa attabhāvassa anantaraṃ punabbhavo mama natthīti avocāti🔽yojanā. Yaṃ nānāvidhaṃ vāsanābhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ udāharaṇavasena niddhāritaṃ, idaṃ nānāvidhaṃ

Idaṃ suttaṃ nibbedhabhāge sekkhadhamme visaye🔽vācakañāpakabhāvena pavattanato nibbedhabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ nāma.🔽“Ettakamevā”ti vattabbattā “sīlavato”tiādi vuttaṃ. Ānanda, sīlavato puggalassa “kinti
analyzed: uddham brahma loke adhas kāmāvacare bhave sabbadhi sabbesu bhavesu vippamuttaḥ arahā 🔽ayam nāma dhammaḥ aham asmi iti anānupassī evam vimuttaḥ arahā atiṇṇa pubbam ogham 🔽apunabbhavāya udatāri uttiṇṇaḥ iti yojanā idam suttam nibbedha bhāge sekkha dhamme visaye 🔽vācaka ñāpaka bhāvena pavattanataḥ nibbedhabhāgiyam suttam nāma 🔽ettakam evā ti vattabbattā sīlavato tiādi vuttam ānanda sīlavato puggalassa kim ti
translated: The Thread-bearing Teacher has extracted the Thread-bearing Discourses of the various kinds of the category of what-is-subject-to-cancelling, and we have come to know them, but now the question is “ Which is the Thread-bearing Discourse of the category of penetration? “ , so “ Herein, which is the Thread-bearing Discourse of the category of penetration? “ is said. Herein, of the sixteen Thread-bearing Discourses of the category of corruption, etc., which is the Thread-bearing Discourse of the category of penetration? is what is asked. The one who is “ released “ in all kinds of becoming, both above in the Brahma-world and below in the sensual-desire world, is the Arahant. “ He who, not contemplating ‘ This is my self ‘, is thus released, the Arahant, has crossed the flood that had not been crossed before, and he has crossed over for the non-reappearance of being “ . This Thread-bearing Discourse is called “ of the category of penetration “ because it occurs in the sense of the Initiate’s ideas in the category of penetration. “ So much “ is said, so “ Of the virtuous “ is said.
