the

original: pajaheyya, bhāvayanto puggalo pañca saddhindriyādīni ca uttari bhāvaye bhāveyya.🔽Pañcasaṅgātigo rāgasaṅgadosasaṅgamohasaṅgamānasaṅgadiṭṭhisaṅgātigo bhikkhu oghatiṇṇoti
analyzed: pajaheyya bhāvayantaḥ puggalo pañca saddhi indriya ādīni ca uttari bhāvaye bhāveyya  pañca saṅga atigaḥ rāga saṅga dosa saṅga moha saṅga māna saṅga diṭṭhi saṅga atigaḥ bhikkhu ogha tiṇṇaḥ ti
translated: and he would abandon them, and he would develop the five faculties of faith, etc., further and further.🔽A bhikkhu who has gone beyond the five strands, namely, the strands of sense desire, of ill will, of stiffness and torpor, of agitation and worry, and of doubt, is called “one who has crossed the flood” .

original: kāmoghabhavoghadiṭṭhoghaavijjoghatiṇṇoti vuccati kathīyatīti yojanā. “Pañca chinde🔽pañca jahe”ti idaṃ vacanaṃ dassanaṃ nāma. “Pañca cuttari…pe… vuccatī”ti ayaṃ pāḷi
analyzed: vuccati kathīyati iti yojanā pañca chinde  pañca jaheti idam vacanam dassanam nāma pañca vuccati iti ayam pāḷi
translated: He is called “one who has crossed the flood of sense desires, the flood of becoming, the flood of views, and the flood of ignorance” .🔽The passage beginning “He should cut five ,

original: bhāvanā nāma. Idaṃ “pañcā”tiādikaṃ suttaṃ dassanañca bhāvanā ca hoti.
analyzed: bhāvanā nāma idam pañca atiādikam suttam dassanam ca bhāvanā ca hoti
translated: and abandon five” is called “seeing.” The passage beginning “He should develop five” is called “development.” This sutta beginning with “five” is both seeing and development.

original: “Tīṇimāni, bhikkhave”tiādīsu yojanā pākaṭā. (8)
analyzed: tīṇi imāni bhikkhave ti ādīsu yojanā pākaṭā
translated: The interpretation of the passage beginning “Bhikkhus, there are these three” is clear.

original: 116. “Sabbapāpassa akaraṇaṃ…pe… buddhāna sāsana”nti idaṃ suttaṃ sammāsambuddhassa vacanabhāvato sakavacanaṃ nāma. Attho heṭṭhā vuttova.
analyzed: sabba pāpassa akaraṇam pe buddhāna sāsanam ti idam suttam sammāsambuddhassa vacana bhāvataḥ sakavacanam nāma attho heṭṭhā vuttaḥ vuttaḥ va
translated: The sutta beginning “Abstaining from all evil” is called “the Blessed One’s own words” because it is the word of the Perfectly Enlightened One. The meaning has been given above.

original: Bhikkhave, bālassa bālalakkhaṇāni bālaupalakkhaṇakāraṇāni bālanimittāni “ayaṃ bālo”ti
analyzed: bhikkhave bālassa bāla lakkhaṇāni bāla upalakkhaṇa kāraṇāni bāla nimittāni ayam bālaḥ ti
translated: Bhikkhus, the characteristics of a fool, the qualities of a fool, the indications of a fool are these. “This is a fool” is said of him.

original: gahaṇakāraṇāni bālāpadānāni bālassa apadānāni porāṇāni viruḷhāni kammāni yehi bālalakkhaṇādīhi
analyzed: gahaṇa kāraṇāni bāla apadānāni bālassa apadānāni porāṇāni viruḷhāni kammāni yehi bāla lakkhaṇa ādīhi
translated: The reasons for the designation of a fool are the fool’s designations, the fool’s old, long-standing, accumulated kamma-formations by which wise men recognize a fool as a fool by means of the fool’s characteristics, etc.

original: bālaṃ “bālo”ti pare paṇḍitā sañjānanti, imāni bālalakkhaṇāni mayā vuccamānāni tīṇi.🔽Katamāni tīṇi? Bhikkhave, bālo duccintitacintī ca duccintitaṃ abhijjhābyāpādamicchādassanaṃ
analyzed: bālam bālaḥ iti pare sañjānanti imāni bāla lakkhaṇāni mayā vuccamānāni tīṇi  katamāni tīṇi bhikkhave bālaḥ duccintita cintī ca duccintitam abhijjhā byāpāda micchā dassanam
translated: These are the three characteristics of a fool that I am going to describe.🔽What are the three? The fool, bhikkhus, thinks evil thoughts, he speaks evil speech, he does evil deeds.

original: cintī ca hoti, dubbhāsitabhāsī dubbhāsitaṃ musāvādādiṃ bhāsī ca hoti. dukkaṭakammakārī🔽ca dukkaṭaṃ pāṇātipātādikammaṃ kārī ca hoti. Bhikkhave, bālassa…pe… bālāpadānāni
analyzed: cintī ca hoti dubbhāsita bhāsī dubbhāsitam musāvāda ādim bhāsī ca hoti dukkaṭa kamma kārī  ca dukkaṭam pāṇātipāta ādi kammam kārī ca hoti bhikkhave bālassape bāla apadānāni
translated: The fool, bhikkhus, thinks evil thoughts, he speaks evil speech, he does evil deeds. These, bhikkhus, are the three things that the fool possesses by which the wise recognize him as a fool. The wise man, bhikkhus, thinks good thoughts, he speaks good speech, he does good deeds.

original: iminā mayā vuttāni tīṇi kho bhavanti. Sukkapakkho pana vuttavipariyāyena veditabbo.
analyzed: iminā mayā vuttāni tīṇi kho bhavanti sukkapakkhaḥ pana vutta vipariyāyena veditabbaḥ
translated: The wise man, bhikkhus, thinks good thoughts, he speaks good speech, he does good deeds. These, bhikkhus, are the three things that the wise man possesses by which the wise recognize him as a wise man. These three things, bhikkhus, are the opposite of the three things just mentioned.

original: Idaṃ “tīṇimāni bhikkhave”tiādikaṃ vacanaṃ sammāsambuddhassa vacanabhāvato sakavacanaṃ nāma.
analyzed: idam tīṇi imāni bhikkhave ti ādikam vacanam sammāsambuddhassa vacana bhāvataḥ sakavacanam nāma
translated: This statement beginning with the words “There are, bhikkhus, these three things” is called the Blessed One’s own statement.

original: Pathavīsamo vitthato sambodho nāma natthi. Pātaṃ vuṭṭhaṃ udakaṃ ābhuso lābhi gaṇhātīti
analyzed: pathavī samaḥ vitthataḥ sambodhaḥ nāma natthi pātam vuṭṭham udakam ābhusaḥ lābhi gaṇhāti iti
translated: The water that falls from the sky is taken by the one who has a basin.🔽There is no one as deep as the nether world. There is no one as high as Mount Meru.

original: pātālo, pātālena samo pātālasamo ninno na vijjati. Merusamo unnato natthi, cakkavattisadiso
analyzed: pātālaḥ pātālena samaḥ pātāla samaḥ ninnaḥ na vijjati meru samaḥ unnataḥ natthi cakka vatti sadiso
translated: There is no man like a wheel-turning monarch.

original: poriso natthīti yojanā. Idaṃ “pathavīsamo”tiādikaṃ vacanaṃ parassa devassa vacanabhāvato paravacanaṃ hoti.
analyzed: porisaḥ natthi iti yojanā idam pathavī samaḥ ti ādikam vacanam parassa devassa vacana bhāvataḥ paravacanam hoti
translated: This statement beginning with “as the earth” is a statement of another, since it is a statement of another god.

original: “Devānaṃ inda, tava subhāsitena jayo hotī”ti vatvā “vepacitti, tava subhāsitena jayo🔽hotū”ti vatvā “vepacitti, tvaṃ gāthaṃ bhaṇa bhaṇāhī”ti avoca. Bhikkhave, atha kho
analyzed: devānam inda tava su bhāsitena jayaḥ hoti iti vatvā vepacitti tava su bhāsitena jayaḥ  hotu uti vatvā vepacitti tvam gātham bhaṇa bhaṇāhi iti avoca bhikkhave atha kho
translated: “O Indra of the gods, victory is yours by your good speech.” Saying this, he said, “Vepacitti, victory is yours by your good speech.

original: asurindo vepacitti imaṃ vuccamānaṃ gāthaṃ abhāsi “te paṭisedhako no ce assa no ce
analyzed: asurindaḥ vepacitti imam vuccamānam gātham abhāsi te paṭisedhakaḥ no ce assa no ce
translated: Vepacitti, you speak a verse, speak!” To the asura lord Vepacitti, who was thus addressed, the Blessed One said, “If there were no one to oppose them,

original: bhaveyya, evaṃ sati bālā bhiyyo pakujjheyyuṃ, tasmā dhīro paṇḍito bhusena daṇḍena bālaṃ nisedhaye”ti.
analyzed: bhaveyya evam sati bālāḥ bhiyyas pakujjheyyum tasmai dhīraḥ paṇḍitaḥ bhusena daṇḍena bālam nisedhaya iti
translated: if there were no one to oppose them, then fools would be even more angry. Therefore, the wise one, the wise one, should restrain the fool with a heavy punishment.”

original: Gāthāya, bhikkhave, asurindena vepacittinā bhāsitāya asurā anumodiṃsu, devā tuṇhī🔽ahesuṃ. Bhikkhave, atha kho asurindo vepacitti devānaṃ indaṃ sakkaṃ etaṃ vacanaṃ
analyzed: gāthāya bhikkhave asurindena vepacittinā bhāsitāya asurāḥ anumodiṃsu devā tuṇhī  ahesum bhikkhave atha kho asurindaḥ vepacitti devānam indam sakkam etam vacanaṃ
translated: When the asura lord Vepacitti had recited this verse, the asuras applauded it, but the devas were silent.

original: avoca “devānaminda, tvaṃ gāthaṃ bhaṇa bhaṇāhī”ti etaṃ vacanaṃ avoca. Bhikkhave, atha
analyzed: avoca devānaminda tvam gātham bhaṇa bhaṇāhi iti etam vacanam avoca bhikkhave atha
translated: Then Vepacitti said to Sakka, lord of the devas, ‘Lord of the devas, you recite a verse.’🔽Then Sakka recited this verse:

original: kho devānamindo sakko imaṃ gāthaṃ abhāsi “bālassa paṭisedhanaṃ paraṃ paccatthikaṃ
analyzed: kho devānamindaḥ sakkaḥ imam gātham abhāsi bālassa paṭisedhanam param paccatthikam
translated: ‘The wise one, mindful, fully aware,🔽knows the other’s anger to be aroused.

original: saṅkupitaṃ ñatvā sato satimā yo paṇḍito kodhato upasammati, tassa paṇḍitassa etadeva
analyzed: saṅkupitam ñatvā sataḥ satimā yaḥ paṇḍito kodhataḥ tassa paṇḍitassa etat eva
translated: The wise one, when angry, is pacified;

original: upasamaṃ varanti ahaṃ maññe”ti.🔽Gāthāya, bhikkhave, devānamindena sakkena bhāsitāya devā anumodiṃsu, asurā tuṇhī🔽ahesuṃ. Bhikkhave, atha kho devānamindo sakko asurindaṃ vepacittiṃ etaṃ vacanaṃ avoca
analyzed: upasamam varanti aham maññe iti  gāthāya bhikkhave devānamindena sakkena bhāsitāya devāḥ anumodiṃsu asurāḥ tuṇhī  ahesum bhikkhave atha kho devānamindaḥ sakkaḥ asurindam vepacittim etam vacanam avoca
translated: I think that pacification is the best.’🔽When the deva lord Sakka had recited this verse, the devas applauded it, but the asuras were silent.🔽Then Sakka said to Vepacitti, lord of the asuras, ‘Vepacitti, you recite a verse.’

original: “vepacitti, tvaṃ gāthaṃ bhaṇāhī”ti etaṃ vacanaṃ avoca. Bhikkhave, atha kho asurindo
analyzed: vepacitti tvam gātham bhaṇāhi iti etam vacanam avoca bhikkhave atha kho asurindo
translated: Then Vepacitti recited this verse:

original: vepacitti imaṃ gāthaṃ abhāsi “vāsava yadā titikkhati, tadā naṃ titikkhantaṃ puggalaṃ
analyzed: vepacitti imam gātham abhāsi vāsava yadā titikkhati tadā nam titikkhantam puggalam
translated: Vepacitti spoke this verse: “When Vāsava endures, then the person who endures

original: bālo “ayaṃ me bhayā titikkhatī”ti maññati, titikkhāya etadeva vajjaṃ ahaṃ passāmi.
analyzed: bālaḥ ayam me bhayā titikkhati iti maññati titikkhāya etat eva vajjam aham passāmi
translated: The fool thinks: ‘He endures out of fear of me.’ I see this alone as the fault in endurance.

original: Vāsava gogaṇo palāyinaṃ gavaṃ ajjhottharati iva, evaṃ dummedho khamantaṃ bhiyyo ajjhāruhati ajjhottharati.
analyzed: vāsava go gaṇaḥ palāyinam gavam ajjhottharati iva evam dummedhaḥ khamantam bhiyyas ajjhāruhati ajjhottharati
translated: Vāsava, like a herd of cattle chases a fleeing cow, so the fool, the more he is endured, the more he goes on to revile.

original: Gāthāya, bhikkhave, asurindena vepacittinā bhāsitāya asurā anumodiṃsu, devā tuṇhī🔽ahesuṃ. Jāyamāne ca goyuddhe paṭhamaṃ dveyeva goṇā yujjhanti, gogaṇo pana yāva eko🔽goṇo na palāyati, tāva olokentova tiṭṭhati. Yadā ca eko goṇo palāyati, tadā sabbo🔽goṇo taṃ palāyinaṃ gavaṃ bhiyyo ajjhottharatīti goyuddhasabhāvo veditabbo. “Atha
analyzed: gāthāya bhikkhave asurindena vepacittinā bhāsitāya asurāḥ anumodiṃsu devā tuṇhī  ahesum jāyamāne ca go yuddhe paṭhamam dveyā iva goṇāḥ yujjhanti go gaṇaḥ pana yāvaḥ ekaḥ  goṇaḥ na palāyati tāva olokento iva tiṭṭhati yadā ca ekaḥ goṇo palāyati tadā sabbo  goṇaḥ tam palāyinam gavam bhiyyas ajjhottharati iti go yuddha sabhāvaḥ veditabbaḥ atha
translated: In the verse, monks, spoken by the Lord of the Asuras, Vepacitti, the Asuras rejoiced, the gods were silent.🔽And in the arising of the battle of the bulls, first two bulls fight, but the herd of bulls, as long as a single bull does not flee,

original: kho”tiādīnaṃ yojanattho pākaṭo.
analyzed: kho ti ādīnam yojana atthaḥ pākaṭaḥ
translated: stands watching. But when a single bull flees, then all the bulls go on to revile that fleeing cow even more. The nature of the battle of the bulls should be understood. “Then” and so on, the meaning of the explanation is clear.

original: Vepacitti, yo puggalo titikkhati, taṃ khamantaṃ puggalaṃ “ayaṃ me bhayā titikkhatī”ti
analyzed: vepa citti yaḥ puggalaḥ titikkhati tam khamantam puggalam ayam me bhayā titikkhati iti
translated: “Vepacitti, the person who forgives the person who is angry, if the person who forgives thinks: ‘This person is angry with me out of fear,’

original: kāmaṃ maññatu vā, mā maññatu vā, taṃ maññanaṃ nipphalameva. Atthā sadatthaparamā
analyzed: kāmam maññatu vā mā maññatu vā tam maññanam nipphalam eva atthā sadattha paramā
translated: whether he thinks that or not, that thought of his is fruitless. There is no greater good than forgiveness.

original: bhavanti. Khantyā khantito bhiyyo sadattho nāma na vijjati.
analyzed: bhavanti khantyā khantitaḥ bhiyyas sadatthaḥ nāma na vijjati
translated: Forgiveness is better than anger. There is no forgiveness better than forgiveness.

original: Yo balavā santo dubbalassa have titikkhatīti tassa balavantassa taṃ titikkhanaṃ paramaṃ khantinti sappurisā āhu, dubbalo niccaṃ khamati eva.
analyzed: yaḥ balavā santaḥ dubbalassa have titikkhati iti tassa balavantassa tam titikkhanam paramam khantin ti sappurisāḥ āhu dubbalaḥ niccam khamati eva
translated: If a strong person forgives a weak person, that forgiveness of his is the highest forgiveness, say the good people, for the weak person always forgives.

original: Yassa bālassa bālabalaṃ atthi, tassa bālassa bālabalaṃ “abala”nti sappurisā āhu,🔽yassa dhammaguttassa yaṃ balaṃ atthi, tassa dhammaguttassa tassa balassa paṭivattā
analyzed: yassa bālassa bāla balam atthi tassa bālassa bāla balam abalanti sappurisāḥ āhu  yassa dhamma guttassa yam balam atthi tassa dhamma guttassa tassa balassa paṭivattā
translated: If a fool has the strength of a fool, the strength of that fool is weak, say the good people,🔽if a righteous person has the strength of a righteous person, there is no one to oppose

original: paṭippharitvā vattā na vijjati.
analyzed: paṭippharitvā vattā na vijjati
translated: or to go against the strength of that righteous person.

original: Vepacitti, yo puggalo kuddhaṃ paṭhamaṃ kujjhantassa paṭikujjhati, so paṭikujjhanto
analyzed: vepa citti yaḥ puggalo kuddham paṭhamam kujjhantassa paṭikujjhati saḥ paṭikujjhantaḥ
translated: “Vepacitti, the person who is angry when the other person is first angry,

original: puggalo tena paṭikujjhanena tassa paṭhamaṃ kujjhantassa pāpapuggalassa pāpapuggalato
analyzed: puggalaḥ tena paṭikujjhanena tassa paṭhamam kujjhantassa pāpa puggalassa pāpa puggalato
translated: The person who, through that anger, is more angry than the bad person who first got angry,

original: pāpiyo eva pāpataro hīnataro eva bhave.
analyzed: pāpiyaḥ eva pāpataraḥ hīnataraḥ eva bhave
translated: is worse, more wicked, and more contemptible than the bad person.

original: Vepacitti, yo sappuriso sato satimā paraṃ saṅkupitaṃ ñatvā paṭhamaṃ kujjhantassa🔽appaṭikujjhantova bhave, so sappuriso dujjayaṃ saṅgāmaṃ jeti nāma, attano ca parassa
analyzed: yaḥ sappuriso sataḥ satimā param saṅkupitam ñatvā paṭhamam kujjhantassa  a paṭikujjhantaḥ iva bhave so sappurisaḥ dujjayam saṅgāmam jeti nāma attano ca parassa
translated: Vepacitti, the good person who, being mindful and aware, when knowing that another is angry,

original: ca ubhinnaṃ atthaṃ carati nāma.
analyzed: ca carati nāma
translated: does not get angry, is said to win a hard-to-win battle, and is said to do what is beneficial for both himself and another.

original: Attano ca parassa ca tikicchantānaṃ ubhinnaṃ kodho upasammati, ye janā dhammassa
analyzed: attanaḥ ca parassa ca tikicchantānam ubhinnam kodhaḥ upasammati ye janāḥ dhammassa
translated: When those who wish to heal both themselves and others are free from anger, those people

original: khantidhammassa atthe, catusaccadhamme vā akovidā bhavanti, te janā khamantaṃ sappurisaṃ
analyzed: khanti dhammassa atthe catusacca dhamme vā akovidāḥ bhavanti te janāḥ khamantam sappurisam
translated: who are patient with the Dhamma, or with the meaning of the Dhamma, or with the Four Noble Truths,

original: “ayaṃ bālo”ti maññanti, tesaṃ akovidānaṃ janānaṃ taṃ maññanaṃ nipphalanti.
analyzed: ayam bālaḥ iti maññanti tesam a kovidānam janānam tam maññanam nipphalanti
translated: think that the patient good person is a fool. The thinking of those unwise people is fruitless.

original: Gāthāsu, bhikkhave, devānamindena sakkena bhāsitāsu devā anumodiṃsu, asurā tuṇhī
analyzed: gāthāsu bhikkhave devānamindena sakkena bhāsitāsu devāḥ anumodiṃsu asurā tuṇhī
translated: When the verses were spoken by Sakka, lord of the devas, the devas rejoiced, but the asuras were silent.

original: ahesunti yojanā. Idaṃ “bhiyyo bālā”tiādikaṃ vacanaṃ sakkavepacittīnaṃ vacanabhāvato
analyzed: ahesun ti yojanā idam bhiyyas bāla ati ādikam vacanam sakka vepa cittīnam vacana bhāvato
translated: is the construction. This statement beginning with “More foolish still” is

original: paravacanaṃ nāma. (9)
analyzed: paravacanam nāma
translated: the statement of others, since it is the words of Sakka and Vepacitti.🔽The bowl that has been attained now and the requisites of sensual pleasure

original: 117. Pattaṃ etarahi adhigataṃ yañca kāmūpakaraṇaṃ, āyatiṃ pattabbaṃ adhigataṃ yañca🔽kāmūpakaraṇaṃ atthi, etaṃ ubhayaṃ rajānukiṇṇaṃ rāgarajādikiṇṇaṃ iti āturassa āturānaṃyeva🔽puggalānaṃ santike anusikkhato anusikkhantassa sikkhāsārā hutvā upaṭṭhahanti, sīlaṃ
analyzed: pattam etarahi adhigatam yat ca kāma upakaraṇam āyatim pattabbam adhigatam yat ca  atthi etam ubhayam raja anu kiṇṇam rāga raja ādi kiṇṇam iti āturassa  puggalānam santike anusikkhataḥ anusikkhantassa sikkhāsārāḥ hutvā upaṭṭhahanti sīlam
translated: that have been attained in the future, all that is covered with dust, covered with the dust of lust, etc.,🔽for the sick, for those who are sick,🔽the training rules stand as the essence of the training for one who trains, who is training, in the presence of those persons.

original: vataṃ jīvitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ ime sikkhāsārā hutvā upaṭṭhahantīti ye upaṭṭhānasārā
analyzed: vatam jīvitam brahmacariyam ime sikkhā sārāḥ hutvā upaṭṭhahanti iti ye upaṭṭhāna sārāḥ
translated: The training rules stand as the essence of the training, the essence of virtue, the essence of life, the essence of the holy life.

original: puggalā sārato gahetvā ṭhitā. Ettha sīlaṃ nāma “na karomī”ti oramaṇaṃ. Vataṃ nāma
analyzed: puggalā sārataḥ gahetvā ṭhitāḥ ettha sīlam nāma na karomi iti oramaṇam vatam nāma
translated: Those persons who stand by taking as the essence the essence of the training rules. Herein, the training rules are as follows: “I do not do” is virtue.

original: bhojanakiccakaraṇādi. Jīvitaṃ nāma ājīvo. Brahmacariyaṃ nāma methunavirativisesabhāvo
analyzed: bhojana kicca karaṇa ādi jīvitam nāma ājīvaḥ brahmacariyam nāma methuna virati visesa bhāvo
translated: “I do” is life. The holy life is the state of abstinence from sexual intercourse and from the various kinds of wrongness.

original: veditabbo. Tesaṃ upaṭṭhānasārānaṃ puggalānaṃ ayaṃ vādo eko paṭhamo anto lāmako. Ye
analyzed: veditabbaḥ tesam upaṭṭhāna sārānam puggalānam ayam vādaḥ ekaḥ paṭhamaḥ antaḥ lāmakaḥ ye
translated: This is how it should be understood. This is the first extreme of those persons who stand by taking as the essence the essence of the training rules.

original: ca puggalā “kāmesu doso natthī”ti evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino hutvā ṭhitā, tesaṃ puggalānaṃ
analyzed: ca puggalā kāmesu doso natthi iti evaṃvādinaḥ evaṃdiṭṭhinaḥ hutvā ṭhitā tesam puggalānam
translated: and the other two persons who are established in the view that there is no danger in sense pleasures,

original: ayaṃ vādo eko dutiyo anto lāmako. Iccete ubho antā antavādā puggalā kaṭasivaḍḍhanā
analyzed: ayam vādaḥ ekaḥ dutiyaḥ antaḥ lāmakaḥ icca ete ubho antā antavādā puggalā
translated: this view is the second extreme. Thus these two extremes are the extreme views of persons who increase the cemetery,

original: kaṭasiyo diṭṭhiṃ vaḍḍhenti. Ete ubho ante attakilamathānuyoge kāmasukhallikānuyoge
analyzed: diṭṭhim vaḍḍhenti ete ubho ante atta kilamatha anuyoge kāma sukhallika anuyoge
translated: the cemetery being the view. These two extremes are the practice of self-mortification and the practice of sense pleasures.

original: eke puggalā anabhiññāya olīyanti, eke puggalā atidhāvantīti yojanā. Idaṃ “yañca patta”ntiādikaṃ
analyzed: eke puggalāḥ an abhiññāya olīyanti eke puggalāḥ atidhāvanti iti yojanā idam yat ca
translated: Some persons, not knowing, are attached to these, and some persons go too far. This is the interpretation. This statement beginning with “what is attained”

original: vacanaṃ paresaṃ puggalānaṃ vacanabhāvato paravacanaṃ nāma.
analyzed: vacanam paresam puggalānam vacana bhāvataḥ paravacanam nāma
translated: is called “the words of others” because it is the words of other persons.

original: Ye ca sammādiṭṭhipuggalā te ubho ante attakilamathānuyogakāmasukhallikānuyoge abhiññāya🔽tatra ca ante na ahesuṃ. Tena ca abhijānanena te ubho ante na amaññiṃsu, tesaṃ sammādiṭṭhipuggalānaṃ
analyzed: ye ca sammādiṭṭhi puggalā te ubho ante atta kilamatha anuyoga kāma sukhallika anuyoge abhiññāya  tatra ca ante na ahesum tena ca abhijānanena te ubho ante na amaññiṃsu tesam sammādiṭṭhi puggalānam
translated: And those persons who have right view, knowing both extremes, the practice of self-mortification and the practice of sense pleasures,🔽are not in those extremes. And by that knowledge they do not imagine those two extremes. For those persons who have right view,

original: vaṭṭaṃ tividhaṃ vaṭṭaṃ paññāpanāya natthi. Iti evaṃ idaṃ “ye cā”tiādikaṃ vacanaṃ
analyzed: vaṭṭam tividham vaṭṭam paññāpanāya natthi iti evam idam ye ca ati ādikam vacanam
translated: there is no basis for the threefold round. Thus this statement beginning with “and those who”

original: bhagavato vacanabhāvato sakavacanaṃ nāma. Ayaṃ udāno “yañca pattaṃ…pe… paññāpanāyā”ti
analyzed: bhagavataḥ vacana bhāvataḥ sakavacanam nāma ayam udānaḥ yat ca pattaṃpe paññāpanāya ati
translated: The Blessed One’s words are called “one’s own words.” This verse is called “a verse of joy” in the way already stated.

original: ayaṃ udāno vuttanayena sakavacanañca paravacanañca hoti.🔽Pasenadi nāma kosalo kosalissaro rājā bhagavantaṃ etaṃ “idha mayhaṃ…pe… tesaṃ piyo
analyzed: ayam udānaḥ vutta nayena sakavacanam ca paravacanam ca hoti  pasenadi nāma kosalaḥ kosalissaraḥ rājā bhagavantam etam idha tesam piyaḥ
translated: This verse is one’s own words and another’s words.

original: attā”ti vacanaṃ avoca. Bhante, idha rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa mayhaṃ mama cetaso🔽cittassa evaṃ parivitakko udapādi, kesaṃ sattānaṃ attā piyo nu kho, kesaṃ sattānaṃ🔽attā appiyo nu kho iti etaṃ parivitakkanaṃ udapādi. Bhante, tassa mayhaṃ etaṃ parivitakkanaṃ
analyzed: attā ati vacanam avoca bhante idha rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa mayham mama cetasaḥ  cittassa evam parivitakkaḥ udapādi kesam sattānam attā piyaḥ nu kho kesam sattānam  attā appiyaḥ nu kho iti etam parivitakkanam udapādi bhante tassa mayham etam parivitakkanam
translated: King Pasenadi of Kosala, the lord of the Kosalans, said this to the Blessed One: “Here, venerable sir, while I was alone in seclusion, this train of thought appeared to my awareness: ‘For which beings is self dear, for which beings is self not dear?’ This train of thought appeared to my awareness.

original: ahosi, ye ca keci sattā kāyena duccaritaṃ caranti kho…pe… manasā duccaritaṃ caranti
analyzed: ye ca keci sattā kāyena duccaritam caranti khope manasā duccaritam caranti
translated: Venerable sir, this train of thought occurred to me: ‘Those beings who conduct themselves bodily, verbally, and mentally in a way that is not noble, who are not following the way of the ariyans, who do not have the Dhamma as their guide, who are not practising in accordance with the Dhamma, who are not firm in the Dhamma, who do not conduct themselves, practise, and persist in accordance with the Dhamma—

original: kho, tesaṃ sattānaṃ attā appiyo kho. Te duccaritaṃ carantā sattā “no attā piyo”ti
analyzed: kho tesam sattānam attā appiyaḥ kho te duccaritam carantā sattā no attā piyaḥ ti
translated: for these beings self is not dear. These beings, conducting themselves, practising, and persisting in a way not in accordance with the Dhamma, will not have self dear.’

original: evaṃ kiñcāpi vadeyyuṃ, atha kho tesaṃ duccaritaṃ carantānaṃ sattānaṃ attā appiyova.
analyzed: evam kiñca api vadeyyum atha kho tesam duccaritam carantānam sattānam attā appiyaḥ uva
translated: Although they might say this, still the self of those beings who are doing misconduct is not dear to them.

original: Taṃ kissa hetu? Appiyo appiyassa anatthāya yaṃ duccaritaṃ kareyya, taṃ duccaritaṃ
analyzed: tam kissa hetu appiyaḥ appiyassa anatthāya yam duccaritam kareyya tam duccaritam
translated: Why is that? Because what misconduct they would do for the sake of an undear self, that misconduct

original: te duccaritaṃ carantā sattā attanāva. sayameva. Attano anatthāya hi yasmā karonti,
analyzed: te duccaritam carantā sattā attanāva sayam eva attanaḥ anatthāya hi yasmai karonti
translated: they themselves, themselves, do. Because they do it for their own harm,

original: tasmā tesaṃ duccaritaṃ carantānaṃ sattānaṃ attā appiyovāti etaṃ parivitakkanaṃ ahosi.
analyzed: tasmā tesam duccaritam carantānam sattānam attā appiyaḥ uvā ti etam parivitakkanam ahosi
translated: therefore the self of those beings who are doing misconduct is not dear to them.

original: Bhante, ye ca keci sattā kāyena sucaritaṃ caranti kho…pe… manasā sucaritaṃ caranti
analyzed: bhante ye ca keci sattā kāyena su caritam caranti khope manasā su caritam caranti
translated: “Venerable sir, those beings who are doing good bodily conduct, good verbal conduct, good mental conduct

original: kho, tesaṃ sucaritaṃ carantānaṃ sattānaṃ attā piyo kho, te sucaritaṃ carantā sattā🔽“no attā appiyo”ti evaṃ kiñcāpi vadeyyuṃ, atha kho tesaṃ sucaritaṃ carantānaṃ sattānaṃ
analyzed: kho tesam su caritam carantānam sattānam attā piyaḥ kho te su caritam carantā sattā  no attā appiyaḥ ti evam kiñca api vadeyyum atha kho tesam su caritam carantānam sattānam
translated: those beings who are doing good conduct, their self is dear to them.

original: attā piyova. Taṃ kissa hetu? Piyo piyassa atthāya yaṃ sucaritaṃ careyya, taṃ sucaritaṃ
analyzed: attā piyaḥ uva tam kissa hetu piyaḥ piyassa atthāya yam su caritam careyya tam su caritam
translated: “Although they might say this, still the self of those beings who are doing good conduct is dear to them. Why is that? Because what good conduct they would do for the sake of a dear self, that good conduct🔽they themselves, themselves, do. Because they do it for their own benefit,

original: te sucaritaṃ carantā sattā attanāva sayameva attano atthāya hi yasmā karonti, tasmā
analyzed: te su caritam carantā sattā attanāva sayam eva attana u atthāya hi yasmai karonti tasmai
translated: They thought thus: “Beings who are doing good are doing it for their own benefit, for their own sake. Therefore

original: tesaṃ sucaritaṃ carantānaṃ sattānaṃ attā piyovāti etaṃ parivitakkanaṃ ahosi. Etaṃ
analyzed: tesam su caritam carantānam sattānam attā piyaḥ uvāti etam parivitakkanam ahosi etam
translated: they are doing good for their own dear selves.” This was their reflection.

original: vacanaṃ avocāti yojanā.
analyzed: vacanam avocāti yojanā
translated: The meaning of the words “they said” is to be construed as follows: “Thus it is, great king.”

original: “Evametaṃ mahārājā”ti vacanaṃ paṭhamaṃ vatvā “ye hi kecī”tiādike bhagavato vuttavacanepi yojanā tatheva kātabbā.
analyzed: evam etam mahā rāja ati vacanam paṭhamam vatvā ye hi keci iti ādike bhagavataḥ vutta vacane pi yojanā tathā iva kātabbā
translated: Having said this, the construction of the words spoken by the Exalted One, “Whoever, great king,” and so forth, should be understood in the same way.

original: Gāthāsu pana yo paṇḍito attānaṃ “piya”nti ce jaññā, evaṃ sati so paṇḍito naṃ attānaṃ
analyzed: gāthāsu pana yaḥ paṇḍitaḥ attānam piyanti ce jaññā evam sati so paṇḍitaḥ naṃ attānam
translated: In the verses, however, the meaning is as follows: If a wise person knows himself as “dear,” then that wise person

original: pāpena kammena na saṃyuje na saṃyojeyya, taṃ vacanaṃ hi saccaṃ piyaṃ attānaṃ sulabhaṃ
analyzed: pāpena kammena na saṃyuje na saṃyojeyya tam vacanam hi saccam piyam attānam sulabham
translated: should not be joined with evil action, should not be joined. For that statement is true: “One’s dear self is not easily obtained.”

original: na hoti, dukkaṭakārinā sukhaṃ sulabhaṃ na hoti.🔽Antakena maccunā adhipannassa mānusaṃ bhavaṃ jahato pajahantassa tassa maraṇamukhe
analyzed: na hoti dukkaṭa kārinā sukham sulabham na hoti  antakena maccunā adhipannassa mānusam bhavam jahataḥ pajahantassa tassa maraṇa mukhe
translated: For one who does evil, happiness is not easily obtained.🔽When one is seized by the end-maker, the Lord of Death, and is leaving, abandoning human existence, what is one’s own?

original: ṭhitassa sattassa kiṃ sakaṃ hoti, maraṇamukhe ṭhito so satto kiñca ādāya paralokaṃ
analyzed: ṭhitassa sattassa kim sakam hoti maraṇa mukhe ṭhitaḥ saḥ satto kiñca ādāya para lokaṃ
translated: When one stands at the gate of death, what does one take along to the other world?

original: gacchati, chāyā gacchantaṃ sattaṃ anapāyinī iva, evaṃ assa paralokagatassa sattassa kiñca anugaṃ hoti.
analyzed: gacchati chāyā gacchantam sattam anapāyinī iva evam assa para loka gatassa sattassa kiñca anugam hoti
translated: and the shadow follows the moving man without leaving him, so too, when the being has gone to the other world, the two kinds of action, good and bad, follow him.

original: Iti bhagavā evaṃ pucchati, pucchitvā “ubho”tiādivissajjanavacanañca āha. Idha loke🔽yo macco yaṃ puññañca yaṃ pāpañca ubho kamme kurute karoti, tassa paralokagatassa
analyzed: iti bhagavā evam pucchati pucchitvā āha idha loke  yaḥ maccaḥ yam puññam ca yam pāpam ca ubho kamme kurute karoti tassa para loka gatassa
translated: Thus the Blessed One asks this question and gives the answer beginning with the words, “Both the good and the bad” .🔽Here in this world, whatever good and bad actions a mortal being does, makes,🔽they are his own in the other world too.

original: maccassa taṃ puññapāpadvayaṃ sakaṃ hoti. Paralokaṃ gato macco taṃva puññapāpadvayaṃ
analyzed: maccassa tam puñña pāpa dvayam sakam hoti para lokam gataḥ macco puñña pāpa dvayam
translated: When the mortal being has gone to the other world, he goes to the other world taking with him the two kinds of action, good and bad,

original: ādāya paralokaṃ gacchati, chāyā gacchantaṃ sattaṃ anapāyinī iva, evaṃ assa paralokagatassa
analyzed: ādāya para lokam gacchati chāyā gacchantam sattam anapāyinī iva evam assa para loka gatassa
translated: just as the shadow follows the moving man without leaving him. So too, when the mortal being has gone to the other world,

original: maccassa taṃva puññapāpadvayaṃ anugaṃ hoti.
analyzed: maccassa puñña pāpa dvayam anugam hoti
translated: the two kinds of action, good and bad, follow him.

original: Tasmā paṇḍito samparāyikaṃ samparāye phalanibbattāpakaṃ kalyāṇaṃ nicayaṃ nicayanto
analyzed: tasmā paṇḍitaḥ samparāyikam samparāye phala nibbattāpakam kalyāṇam nicayam nicayantaḥ
translated: Therefore the wise one, accumulating good,🔽should make merit for the sake of the next world.

original: hutvā kareyya. Pāṇinaṃ paralokasmiṃ puññāni patiṭṭhā honti, iti bhagavā āhāti yojanā
analyzed: hutvā kareyya pāṇinam para lokasmin puññāni patiṭṭhā honti iti bhagavā āha ati yojanā
translated: Merit is a support for mortals in the other world. Thus the Blessed One said.

original: kātabbā. Idaṃ “rājā pasenadī”tiādikaṃ suttaṃ kosalarañño vacanabhāvato paravacanaṃ🔽hoti. “Evametaṃ, mahārāja, evametaṃ mahārājā”tiādikā anugīti bhagavato vacanabhāvato
analyzed: kātabbā idam rājā pasenadī iti ādikam suttam kosala raññaḥ vacana bhāvataḥ paravacanam  evam etam mahā rāja evam etam mahā rāja ati ādikāḥ bhagavataḥ vacana bhāvataḥ
translated: This sutta beginning with “King Pasenadi” is the words of another,🔽because it is the words of the King of Kosala. The repetition beginning with “So it is, great king, so it is, great king” is the Blessed One’s words,🔽because it is the words of the Blessed One.

original: sakavacanaṃ hoti. Idaṃ dvayaṃ vacanaṃ sakavacanañca paravacanañca hoti. (10)
analyzed: sakavacanam ha iti idam dvayam vacanam sakavacanam ca paravacanam ca
translated: This sutta beginning with “King Pasenadi” is the other’s words because it is the words of the King of Kosala. The anugiti beginning with “So it is, great king, so it is, great king” is one’s own words because it is the Blessed One’s words. This pair is words, and it is one’s own words and the other’s words.

original: 118. Pañhe pucchite idaṃ dukkhasaccaṃ abhiññeyyaṃ, idaṃ samudayasaccaṃ pahātabbaṃ,🔽idaṃ maggasaccaṃ bhāvetabbaṃ, idaṃ nirodhasaccaṃ, phalaṃ vā sacchikātabbaṃ, ime kusalākusalā
analyzed: pañhe pucchite idam dukkha saccam abhiññeyyam idam samudaya saccam pahātabbam  idam magga saccam bhāvetabbam idam nirodha saccam phalam vā sacchikātabbam ime kusala akusalā
translated: When a question is asked, this is the truth of suffering to be fully known, this is the truth of origin to be abandoned,

original: dhammā evaṃ kusalākusalabhāvena gahitā anavajjasāvajjabhāvena vā gahitā sukhavipākadukkhavipākabhāvena
analyzed: dhammāḥ evam kusala akusala bhāvena gahitāḥ anavajja sāvajja bhāvena vā gahitā sukha vipāka dukkha vipāka bhāvena
translated: this is the truth of the path to be developed, this is the truth of cessation to be realized as the fruit, these are wholesome and unwholesome states thus taken as wholesome and unwholesome states, or thus taken as blameless and blameworthy, or thus taken as having pleasant and painful results,

original: vā gahitā, idaṃ iṭṭhavipākaṃ idaṃ aniṭṭhavipākaṃ phalaṃ nibbattayaiti evaṃgahitānaṃ
analyzed: vā gahitā idam iṭṭha vipākam idam aniṭṭha vipākam phalam nibbattaya eti evaṃgahitānam
translated: this has a desirable result, this has an undesirable result, thus taken,

original: tesaṃ kusalākusaladhammānaṃ ayaṃ vuḍḍhi attho, ayaṃ hāni atthoti. Iti idaṃ “pañhe
analyzed: tesam kusala akusala dhammānam ayam vuḍḍhi atthaḥ ayam hāni atthaḥ iti idam pañhe
translated: for those wholesome and unwholesome states, this is the meaning of increase, this is the meaning of decrease. Thus this is a question

original: pucchite”tiādikaṃ suttaṃ vissajjanīye atthe vācakañāpakabhāvena pavattanato vissajjanīyaṃ nāma.
analyzed: pucchitā iti ādikam suttam vissajjanīye atthe vācaka ñāpaka bhāvena pavattanataḥ vissajjanīyam nāma
translated: The sutta beginning with the words “When asked” is called “responsive” because it occurs in the mode of answering a question.

original: “Uḷāro buddho bhagavā”ti iminā padena buddhauḷārataṃ ekaṃseneva ekakoṭṭhāseneva niddise.
analyzed: uḷāraḥ buddhaḥ bhagavā iti iminā padena buddha oḷāra tam ekaṃsena iva eka koṭṭhāsena iva niddise
translated: By the phrase “The Buddha, the Blessed One, is sublime” he shows the sublimity of the Buddha by one factor alone.

original: “Svākkhāto dhammo”ti iminā padena dhammasvākkhātataṃ ekaṃseneva ekakoṭṭhāseneva niddise.
analyzed: su ākkhātaḥ dhammaḥ ti iminā padena dhamma su ākkhāta tam ekaṃsena iva eka koṭṭhāsena iva niddise
translated: By the phrase “The Dhamma is well proclaimed” he shows the well-proclaimedness of the Dhamma by one factor alone.

original: “Suppaṭipanno saṅgho”ti iminā padena saṅghasuppaṭipattiṃ ekaṃseneva ekakoṭṭhāseneva
analyzed: su paṭipannaḥ saṅghaḥ ti iminā padena saṅgha su paṭipattim ekaṃsena iva eka koṭṭhāsena iva
translated: By the phrase “The Sangha is practicing well” he shows the good practice of the Sangha by one factor alone.

original: niddise “sabbe saṅkhārā aniccā”ti iminā padena saṅkhārāniccataṃ ekaṃseneva niddise.
analyzed: niddise sabbe saṅkhārāḥ aniccā ati iminā padena saṅkhāra anicca tam ekaṃsena iva niddise
translated: By the phrase “All formations are impermanent” he shows the impermanence of formations by one factor alone.

original: “Sabbe saṅkhārā dukkhā”ti iminā padena saṅkhāradukkhataṃ ekaṃseneva niddise. “Sabbe🔽dhammā anattā”ti iminā padena dhammānattataṃ ekaṃseneva niddise. “Sabbe saṅkhārā
analyzed: sabbe saṅkhārāḥ dukkhā ti iminā padena saṅkhāra dukkha tam ekaṃsena iva niddise sabbe  dhammā anattā ti iminā padena dhamma anatta tam ekaṃsena iva niddise sabbe saṅkhārā
translated: By the phrase “All formations are suffering” he shows the suffering of formations by one factor alone.🔽By the phrase “All dhammas are nonself” he shows the nonselfhood of dhammas by one factor alone.🔽By the phrase “All dhammas are nonself” he shows the nonselfhood of dhammas by one factor alone.

original: anattā”ti avatvā “sabbe dhammā anattā”ti vuttena iminā padena saṅkhārehi aññaṃ yaṃ
analyzed: anattā ati avatvā sabbe dhammā anattā ati vuttena iminā padena saṅkhārehi aññam yam
translated: By the phrase “All dhammas are nonself” he shows the nonselfhood of dhammas by one factor alone.🔽By the phrase “All dhammas are nonself” he shows the nonselfhood of dhammas by one factor alone.🔽By the phrase “All dhammas are nonself” he shows the nonselfhood of dhammas by one factor alone.

original: vā pana maggaphalanirodhasamāpattidhammajātaṃ atthi, taṃ maggaphalanirodhasamāpattidhammajātampi
analyzed: vā pana magga phala nirodha samāpatti dhamma jātam atthi tam magga phala nirodha samāpatti dhamma jātam pi
translated: Or else, the states consisting of the path, fruit, cessation, and attainment are, and they are🔽states consisting of the path, fruit, cessation, and attainment.

original: evaṃjātiyaṃ evaṃ ekaṃsabyākaraṇīyanti maggaphalanirodhasamāpattidhammajātassāpi anattataṃ
analyzed: evaṃjātiyam evam magga phala nirodha samāpatti dhamma jātassa api anatta tam
translated: Thus, the fact that the states consisting of the path, fruit, cessation, and attainment are not-self is🔽taught by the Exalted One in the same way, by the same method, as he teaches the not-self nature of the aggregates. This is the method of interpretation.

original: ekaṃseneva niddiseti yojanā. Idaṃ “uḷāro”tiādikaṃ suttaṃ vissajjanīye buddhauḷāratādike
analyzed: ekaṃsena iva niddisa iti yojanā idam uḷāra uti ādikam suttam vissajjanīye buddha oḷāra tā ādike
translated: This sutta, beginning with the words “Uḷāraṃ,” is called “discernment” because it occurs in the form of a statement of the greatness of the Buddha, etc.,

original: vācakañāpakabhāvena pavattanato vissajjanīyaṃ nāma.
analyzed: vācaka ñāpaka bhāvena pavattanataḥ vissajjanīyam nāma
translated: in the sense of revealing and making known.

original: Naradammasārathi ākaṅkhato te bhagavato manasā sabbaññutaññāṇasahitādimanasā vicintitaṃ🔽ñeyyadhammaṃ devā manussā sabbe pāṇino na jaññā na jāneyyuṃ. Santaṃ araṇaṃ samādhiṃ
analyzed: nara damma sārathi ākaṅkhataḥ te bhagavataḥ manasā sabbaññuta ññāṇa sahita ādi manasā vicintitam  ñeyya dhammam devā manussā sabbe pāṇinaḥ na jaññāḥ na jāneyyum santam araṇam samādhim
translated: If the Exalted One, the leader of men to be tamed, were to think with his mind accompanied by the knowledge of omniscience,🔽then all beings, gods and men, would not know, would not understand, the knowable dhammas that he would think of.

original: nisevato te bhagavato manasā vicintitā kasiṇāpi sabbe pāṇino na jaññā na jāneyyuṃ.
analyzed: nisevataḥ te bhagavataḥ manasā vicintitā kasiṇā api sabbe pāṇinaḥ na jaññā na jāneyyum
translated: If the Exalted One, the leader of men to be tamed, were to think with his mind accompanied by concentration, then all beings would not know, would not understand, the kasiṇas that he would think of.

original: Kasiṇāpi vā kasiṇārammaṇāya paññāyapi na jaññā na jāneyyuṃ. Kasiṇāpīti ettha ca “kasiṇāyapī”ti
analyzed: vā kasiṇa ārammaṇāya na jaññā na jāneyyum kasiṇā api iti ettha ca kasiṇāya api iti
translated: Or else, “kasiṇāpi” means “kasiṇas and the wisdom that has kasiṇas as its object.”

original: vattabbepi ya-kāra lopavasena “kasiṇāpī”ti vuttaṃ. Atha vā “yaṃ ākaṅkhati yaṃ ākaṅkhanaṃ
analyzed: vattabbe api yakāra lopa vasena kasiṇā api iti vuttam atha vā yam ākaṅkhati yam ākaṅkhanam
translated: Or else, the question “What is that desire, what is that desire-and-longing,

original: karoti, taṃ ākaṅkhanaṃ kiṃ katama”nti pucchitaṃ pañhaṃ aññesaṃ avisayattā avissajjanīyaṃ🔽hotīti yojanā. Idaṃ “ākaṅkhato”tiādikaṃ suttaṃ avissajjanīye visaye vācakañāpakabhāvena
analyzed: karoti tam ākaṅkhanam kim katamanti pucchitam pañham aññesam a visaya ttā a vissajjanīyam  hoti iti yojanā idam ākaṅkhato ti ādikam suttam a vissajjanīye visaye vācaka ñāpaka bhāvena
translated: what is that desire-and-longing that he does?” is unanswerable because it is not within the province of others.🔽The construction is this: “The desire, the desire-and-longing, the desire-and-longing that he does is what.”

original: pavattanato avissajjanīyaṃ nāma.🔽Bhagavā sīlakkhandhe sīlakkhandhahetu ettako etaparimāṇo, bhagavā samādhikkhandhe🔽samādhikkhandhahetu ettako etaparimāṇo, bhagavā paññākkhandhe paññākkhandhahetu ettako🔽etaparimāṇo, bhagavā vimuttikkhandhe vimuttikkhandhahetu ettako etaparimāṇo, bhagavā
analyzed: pavattanataḥ a vissajjanīyam nāma  bhagavā sīla kkhandhe sīla kkhandha hetu ettakaḥ eta parimāṇaḥ bhagavā samādhi kkhandhe  samādhi kkhandha hetu ettakaḥ eta parimāṇaḥ bhagavā paññā kkhandhe paññā kkhandha hetu ettakaḥ  eta parimāṇaḥ bhagavā vimutti khandhe vimutti khandha hetu ettakaḥ eta parimāṇaḥ bhagavā
translated: This sutta beginning with “One who desires” is called “unanswerable” because it occurs as a statement and an intimation that the question is unanswerable on a subject that is unanswerable.

original: vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhe vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhahetu ettako etaparimāṇo, bhagavā
analyzed: vimutti ñāṇa dassana khandhe vimutti ñāṇa dassana hetu ettakaḥ eta parimāṇaḥ bhagavā
translated: The Blessed One is so much, is of such a measure, in the virtue category, in the cause of the virtue category; the Blessed One is so much, is of such a measure, in the concentration category, in the cause of the concentration category; the Blessed One is so much, is of such a measure, in the understanding category, in the cause of the understanding category; the Blessed One is so much, is of such a measure, in the emancipation category, in the cause of the emancipation category; the Blessed One is so much, is of such a measure, in the knowledge and vision of emancipation category, in the cause of the knowledge and vision of emancipation category.

original: iriyāyaṃ kāyavacīsamācāre kāyavacīsamācārahetu ettako etaparimāṇo, bhagavā pabhāve🔽ānubhāvahetu ettako etaparimāṇo, bhagavā hitesitāyaṃ mettāhetu ettako etaparimāṇo,
analyzed: kāya vacī samācāre kāya vacī samācāra hetu ettakaḥ eta parimāṇaḥ bhagavā pabhāve  ānubhāva hetu ettakaḥ eta parimāṇaḥ bhagavā hitesita ayam mettā hetu ettakaḥ eta parimāṇaḥ
translated: In the matter of deportment, in the matter of bodily and verbal conduct, in the matter of the cause of bodily and verbal conduct, the Blessed One is so much, of such a measure.🔽In the matter of the cause of radiance, the Blessed One is so much, of such a measure. In the matter of the cause of loving kindness in the matter of welfare, the Blessed One is so much, of such a measure.

original: bhagavā karuṇāyaṃ karuṇāhetu ettako etaparimāṇo, bhagavā iddhiyaṃ iddhividhahetu
analyzed: bhagavā karuṇāyam karuṇā hetu ettakaḥ eta parimāṇaḥ bhagavā iddhiyam iddhividha hetu
translated: In the matter of the cause of compassion in the matter of compassion, the Blessed One is so much, of such a measure. In the matter of the cause of the various kinds of psychic power in the matter of psychic power, the Blessed One is so much, of such a measure.

original: ettako etaparimāṇoti avissajjanīyoti yojanā. Idaṃ “ettako”tiādikaṃ suttaṃ avissajjanīye
analyzed: ettako eta parimāṇo ti avissajjanīyaḥ ti yojanā idam ettakaḥ iti ādikam suttam avissajjanīye
translated: This is the interpretation of the word “so much” in the sutta.

original: visaye vācakañāpakabhāvena pavattanato avissajjanīyaṃ nāma.
analyzed: visaye vācaka ñāpaka bhāvena pavattanataḥ avissajjanīyam nāma
translated: This sutta is called “unanswerable” because it occurs in the form of a statement of the fact that cannot be answered.

original: Bhikkhave, arahato sammāsambuddhassa tathāgatassa loke uppādā uppādahetu tiṇṇaṃ ratanānaṃ
analyzed: bhikkhave arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa tathāgatassa loke uppādāḥ uppāda hetu tiṇṇam ratanānam
translated: “Bhikkhus, with the arising of the Arahant, the Perfectly Enlightened One, the Realised One, the Supremely Enlightened One, in the world, the arising, the coming forth of the three treasures is to be expected.

original: uppādo sambhavati, āyatiṃ buddharatanassa uppādo sambhavati, ekassa buddharatanassa
analyzed: uppādaḥ sambhavati āyatim buddha ratanassa uppādaḥ sambhavati ekassa buddha ratanassa
translated: The arising, the coming forth of the Buddha-treasure in the future is to be expected. The arising, the coming forth of the one Buddha-treasure

original: dharamānakkhaṇena hi aññassa buddharatanassa anuppajjanato āyatinti vuttaṃ, dhammaratanassa
analyzed: dharamāna kkhaṇena hi aññassa buddha ratanassa anuppajjanataḥ āyatinti vuttam dhammaratanassa
translated: is to be expected, because at the time of the existence of one Buddha-treasure, the arising of another Buddha-treasure does not occur. Therefore it is said “in the future.” The arising, the coming forth of the Dhamma-treasure🔽is to be expected.

original: uppādo sambhavati, saṅgharatanassa uppādo sambhavatīti tīṇi ratanāni. “Tāni tīṇi
analyzed: uppādaḥ sambhavati saṅgha ratanassa uppādaḥ sambhavati iti tīṇi ratanāni tāni tīṇi
translated: the arising of the Community Jewel. “These three jewels,

original: ratanāni guṇato kiṃpamāṇānī”ti pucchite sati tāni tīṇi ratanāni guṇato etaparimāṇānīti
analyzed: ratanāni guṇataḥ kiṃpamāṇāni iti pucchite sati tāni tīṇi ratanāni guṇataḥ eta parimāṇāni iti
translated: how great are they in virtue?” When this is asked, it should not be answered that “these three jewels are so great in virtue.”

original: na vissajjitabbānīti yojanā. Idaṃ “tathāgatassā”tiādikaṃ suttaṃ avissajjanīye visaye
analyzed: na vissajjitabbāni iti yojanā idam tathāgatassa ati ādikam suttam a vissajjanīye visaye
translated: This Thread beginning with “The Tathagata” is called “unanswerable”

original: vācakañāpakabhāvena pavattanato avissajjanīyaṃ nāma.
analyzed: vācaka ñāpaka bhāvena pavattanataḥ avissajjanīyam nāma
translated: because it occurs in the way of a pointer and a guide in the case of an unanswerable subject.

original: Buddhavisayo puggalaparo puggalapadhāno pañho avissajjanīyo, buddhavisayāva puggalaparoparaññutā
analyzed: buddha visayaḥ puggala paraḥ puggala padhānaḥ pañhaḥ a vissajjanīyaḥ buddha visayā ava puggala para uparaññu tā
translated: The question, which has a person as its subject and a person as its end, and which is about the Buddha, is unanswerable.🔽The Buddha’s knowledge of the difference between a person’s being a person and his being not a person is unanswerable.

original: avissajjanīyā. Bhikkhave, avijjānīvaraṇānaṃ sattānaṃ pubbā koṭi na paññāyati taṇhāsaṃyojanānaṃ,🔽sakiṃ nirayaṃ sandhāvataṃ saṃsarataṃ sattānaṃ, sakiṃ tiracchānayoniṃ sandhāvataṃ
analyzed: a vissajjanīyā bhikkhave avijjā nīvaraṇānam sattānam pubbā koṭi na paññāyati taṇhā saṃyojanānam  sakim nirayam sandhāvatam saṃsaratam sattānam sakim tiracchānayonim sandhāvatam
translated: “Bhikkhus, there is no beginning of beings’ wandering on, who as they wander on keep running up and down, but a time comes when beings wandering on with ignorance as their cause and craving as their bond,🔽now and then run up and down in hell,🔽now and then run up and down in the animal womb,

original: saṃsarataṃ sattānaṃ, sakiṃ pettivisayaṃ sandhāvataṃ saṃsarataṃ sattānaṃ, sakiṃ asurayoniṃ
analyzed: saṃsaratam sattānam sakim pettivisayam sandhāvatam saṃsaratam sattānam sakim asura yonim
translated: now and then run up and down in the realm of ghosts,

original: sandhāvataṃ saṃsarataṃ sattānaṃ, sakiṃ deve sandhāvataṃ saṃsarataṃ sattānaṃ, sakiṃ🔽manusse sandhāvataṃ saṃsarataṃ sattānaṃ pubbā koṭi na paññāyati na dissati na upalabbhatīti.🔽“Sā pubbā koṭi katamā”ti kenaci kataṃ pucchanaṃ avissajjanīyaṃ saṃsārassa pubbakoṭiyā🔽abhāvato avissajjanīyaṃ hoti. “Na paññāyatī”ti desanā sāvakānaṃ ñāṇavekallena katā,
analyzed: sandhāvatam saṃsaratam sattānam sakim deve sandhāvatam saṃsaratam sattānam sakim  manusse sandhāvatam saṃsaratam sattānam pubbā koṭi na paññāyati na dissati na upalabbhati iti  sā pubbā koṭi katamā ati kenaci katam pucchanam a vissajjanīyam saṃsārassa pubba koṭiyā  abhāvataḥ avissajjanīyam hoti na paññāyati iti desanā sāvakānam ñāṇa vekallena katā
translated: of beings running and wandering (through samsara), of beings running and wandering (through samsara) once among the gods, of beings running and wandering (through samsara) once among human beings, the former end is not discerned, is not seen, is not made known.🔽“What is that former end?” is a question asked by someone that should not be answered, because of the non-existence of a former end of samsara,🔽it is not to be answered. “Is not discerned” is a teaching given to disciples because of the incompleteness of their knowledge,

original: na attano ñāṇavekallena. “Na paññāyatī”ti desanā attano ceva sāvakānañca ñāṇavekallena🔽kātabbā siyāti codanaṃ manasi katvā “duvidhā buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ desanā”tiādi🔽vuttaṃ. Attā upanetabbo etissā desanāyāti attūpanāyikā. Paro upanetabbo etissā desanāyāti🔽parūpanāyikā. “Katamā attūpanāyikā desanā, katamā parūpanāyikā desanā”ti pucchitabbattā
analyzed: na attano ñāṇa vekallena na paññāyati iti desanā attano ca iva sāvakānam ca ñāṇa vekallena 🔽kātabbā siyā iti codanam manasi katvā duvidhā buddhānam bhagavantānam desanā atiādi 🔽vuttam attā upanetabbaḥ etissā desanāya ati attūpanāyikā paraḥ upanetabbaḥ etissā desanāya ati 🔽parūpanāyikā katamā attūpanāyikā desanā katamā parūpanāyikā desanā ti pucchitabbattā
translated: “For beings running and wandering (through samsara) …” means for beings running and wandering (through samsara) once as a god, once as a human, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god, once as a human, once as a god

original: niyametvā dassetuṃ “na paññāyatī”tiādi vuttaṃ. “Na paññāyatī”ti desanā sāvakānaṃ🔽netabbānaṃ vasena desitattā parūpanāyikā desanā nāma, “natthi buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ
analyzed: niyametvā dassetum na paññāyati itiādi vuttam na paññāyati iti desanā sāvakānam  netabbānam vasena desita ttā parūpanāyikā desanā nāma natthi buddhānam bhagavantānam
translated: and it is said, “It is not known,” in order to show it by way of restriction. “It is not known” is a teaching that is called “a teaching that leads to another” because it is taught for the sake of disciples who are to be led. “There is no Buddha, there is no Dhamma, there is no Saṅgha,🔽there is no path, there is no practice, there is no realization, there is no attainment, there is no one who attains Nibbāna.”

original: avijānanā”ti desanā attano netabbassa vasena desitattā attūpanāyikā desanā nāma.🔽“Natthi buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ avijānanā”ti vuttattā pubbāya koṭiyā abhāvato eva
analyzed: avijānanā ati desanā attanaḥ netabbassa vasena desita ttā attūpanāyikā desanā nāma  natthi buddhānam bhagavantānam avijānanā ati vutta ttā pubbāya koṭiyāḥ abhāvato eva
translated: and so it is said, “It is not known.” The teaching, “It is not known,” is called a teaching that leads to the other because it is taught for the sake of disciples who are to be led. The teaching, “There is nothing that is not known to the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,” is called a teaching that leads to oneself because it is taught for the sake of oneself who is to be led.

original: na paññāyatīti viññāyati, bhagavato ñāṇassa paññāpanaṃ kātuṃ asamatthattā na paññāyatīti🔽na viññāyati tena aṭṭhakathāyaṃ “natthi buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ avijānanāti etena
analyzed: na paññāyati iti viññāyati bhagavato ñāṇassa paññāpanam kātum asamattha ttā na paññāyati iti  na viññāyati tena aṭṭhakathāyam na atthi buddhānam bhagavantānam etena
translated: Since it is said, “There is nothing that is not known to the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,” it is known that it is not known because of the non-existence of a prior limit.

original: purimāya koṭiyā abhāvato eva na paññāyati, na tattha ñāṇassa paṭighātoti dassetī”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: purimāya koṭiyā abhāvataḥ eva na paññāyati na tattha ñāṇassa paṭighāto ti dasseti iti vuttam
translated: It is not known because it is impossible to make known the knowledge of the Blessed One. Therefore in the commentary it is said, “By this it is shown that it is not known because of the non-existence of a prior limit, and that there is no obstruction to knowledge there.”

original: “Kathaṃ pana buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ avijānanāya natthibhāvovijānitabbo”ti vattabbattā
analyzed: katham pana buddhānam bhagavantānam a vijānanāya natthi bhāvaḥ vijānitabbaḥ iti vattabbattā
translated: Since it is said, “But how is the non-existence of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, not knowing to be known?”

original: avijānanāya natthibhāvaṃ jānāpetuṃ “yathā bhagavā kokālikaṃ bhikkhu”ntiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: a vijānanāya natthi bhāvam jānāpetum yathā bhagavā kokālikam bhikkhun ti ādi vuttam
translated: “In order to make him understand the non-existence of what he does not understand, the following was said: ‘As the Blessed One did with the bhikkhu Kokālika.’

original: Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana – “yaṃ pana atthi, taṃ aññesaṃ appameyyampi bhagavato na appameyyanti🔽bhagavato sabbattha appaṭihatañāṇataṃ dassetuṃ ‘yathā bhagavā kokālikaṃ bhikkhuṃ🔽ārabbhā’tiādimāhā”ti vuttaṃ. Bhagavā kokālikaṃ bhikkhuṃ ārabbha “kīva dīghaṃ nu kho,🔽bhante, padume niraye āyuppamāṇa”nti pañhaṃ pucchitvā nisinnaṃ aññataraṃ bhikkhuṃ
analyzed: aṭṭhakathāyam pana yam pana atthi tam aññesam appameyyam pi bhagavataḥ na appameyyanti  bhagavato sabbattha appaṭihata ñāṇa tam dassetuṃ yathā bhagavā kokālikam bhikkhum  ārabbha ati ādim āha ati vuttam bhagavā kokālikam bhikkhum ārabbha kīva dīgham nu kho  bhante padume niraye āyu ppamāṇam ti pañham pucchitvā nisinnam aññataram bhikkhum
translated: But in the Commentary it is said: ‘But what exists is not immeasurable for the Blessed One, though it is for others.

original: yathā yena pakārena “seyyathāpi…pe… āghātetvā”ti evamāha. Tato tena pakārena avijānanāya🔽natthibhāvo vijānitabboti attho gahetabbo.
analyzed: yathā yena pakārena evam āha tatas tena pakārena a vijānanāya  natthi bhāvaḥ vijānitabbaḥ ti atthaḥ gahetabbaḥ
translated: In order to show that the Blessed One’s knowledge is unobstructed in all fields, the following was said: “As the Blessed One did with the bhikkhu Kokālika.” The Blessed One was sitting after asking a bhikkhu who was sitting after asking a question, “How long, venerable sir, is the life span in the Paduma hell?”

original: Bhikkhu, tvaṃ sallakkhehi, kokāliko vīsatikhāriko kosalako tilavāho rāsiṃ katvā ṭhapito,
analyzed: bhikkhu tvam sallakkhehi kokālikaḥ vīsatikhārikaḥ kosalakaḥ tila vāhaḥ rāsim katvā ṭhapitaḥ
translated: “Bhikkhu, you reckon, Kokālika has twenty cartloads of sesame seed stored up in the granary.

original: tato tilato puriso vassasatassa vassasatassa accayena ekamekaṃ tilaṃ uddhareyya,
analyzed: tatas tilataḥ purisaḥ vassa satassa vassa satassa accayena ekam ekam tilam uddhareyya
translated: Then a man, after the lapse of a hundred years, would remove one grain of sesame seed,

original: so vīsatikhāriko kosalako tilavāho iminā uddharānupakkamena khippataraṃ parikkhayaṃ🔽pariyādānaṃ seyyathāpi gaccheyya, eko abbudo nirayo parikkhayaṃ pariyādānaṃ na tveva🔽gaccheyya. Vīsati abbudā nirayā tattake kāle parikkhayaṃ pariyādānaṃ seyyathāpi gaccheyyuṃ,
analyzed: saḥ vīsati khārikaḥ kosalakaḥ tila vāhaḥ iminā uddhara anupakkamena khippataram parikkhayam  pariyādānam sā iyyathā api gaccheyya ekaḥ abbudaḥ nirayaḥ parikkhayam pariyādānam na tu eva  gaccheyya vīsati abbudā nirayā tattake kāle parikkhayam pariyādānam seyyathā api gaccheyyuṃ
translated: and that twenty-fold Kosalan sesame store would be exhausted more quickly by this method of removal🔽than would a single hell of the Avīci hell. Twenty Avīci hells would be exhausted in the same time

original: evameva eko nirabbudo nirayo tattake kāle parikkhayaṃ pariyādānaṃ na tveva gaccheyya.
analyzed: evam eva ekaḥ nirabbudaḥ nirayaḥ tattake kāle parikkhayam pariyādānam na tu eva gaccheyya
translated: that a single Nirabbuda hell would last.

original: Esa nayo sesesupi. Sāriputtamoggallānesu cittaṃ āghātetvā padumaṃ nirayaṃ kokāliko
analyzed: esa nayo sesesu pi sāriputta moggallānesu cittam āghātetvā padumam nirayam kokāliko
translated: The same method of calculation applies to the rest. After he had harboured thoughts of hate towards Sāriputta and Moggallāna, Kokālika

original: bhikkhu upapanno kho, bhikkhu, tvaṃ evaṃ sallakkhehīti bhagavā āhāti yojanā. Bhagavā
analyzed: bhikkhu upapannaḥ kho bhikkhu tvam evam sallakkhehi iti bhagavā āha ati yojanā bhagavā
translated: was reborn in the Paduma hell. The Blessed One said: “Monk, you should consider thus: ‘This is the result of that kind of kamma.’ ”

original: “ayaṃ appameyyo ayaṃ asaṅkhyeyyo”ti vā na kiñci āha. “Tasmiṃ appameyye katamo appameyyo,
analyzed: ayam appameyyaḥ ayam asaṅkhyeyyaḥ iti vā na kiñci āha tasmin appameyye katamaḥ appameyyaḥ
translated: The Blessed One did not say “This is immeasurable” or “This is incalculable.” In the immeasurable, which is immeasurable?

original: tasmiṃ asaṅkhyeyye katamo asaṅkhyeyyo”ti kenaci kataṃ pucchanaṃ buddhavisayattā avissajjanīyaṃ.
analyzed: tasmin asaṅkhyeyye katamaḥ asaṅkhyeyyaḥ iti kenaci katam pucchanam buddha visaya tā a vissajjanīyam
translated: “In that incalculable, which is the incalculable?” This question asked by someone is not to be answered because it is about the Buddha.

original: Idaṃ appameyyaasaṅkhyeyyasuttaṃ vuttanayena avissajjanīyaṃ. (11)
analyzed: idam appameyya asaṅkhyeyya suttam vutta nayena a vissajjanīyam
translated: This discourse on the immeasurable and the incalculable is not to be answered in the way stated.

original: 119. “Yadā so upako”tiādīsu yojanā pākaṭā.
analyzed: yadā yojanā pākaṭā
translated: In the passages beginning “When that Upaka,” the interpretation is clear.🔽The question asked by Upaka, “How is the Victor in appearance?” is to be answered.

original: “Kathaṃ kena pakārena jino”ti upakena kataṃ pucchanaṃ “kilesappahānapakārena jino”ti🔽vissajjanīyattā vissajjanīyaṃ. “Kena pakārena jino”ti upakena kataṃ pucchanaṃ “pāpakānaṃ
analyzed: katham kena pakārena jinoti upakena katam pucchanam kilesa pahāna pakārena jinoti  vissajjanīya ttā vissajjanīyam kena pakārena jinoti upakena katam pucchanam pāpakānam
translated: “The Victor is in the appearance of the abandoning of defilements.”🔽The question asked by Upaka, “By what appearance is the Victor?” is to be answered.🔽“The Victor is by the appearance of the conquering of evil things.”

original: dhammānaṃ jitattā jino”ti vissajjanīyattā vissajjanīyaṃ. “Katamo jino”ti kataṃ pucchanaṃ
analyzed: dhammānam jita ttā jinoti vissajjanīya ttā vissajjanīyam katamaḥ jinoti katam pucchanam
translated: The question asked, “What is the Victor?” is not to be answered.

original: “rūpādiko jino”ti vā “rūpādikaṃ muñcitvā añño jino”ti vā vissajjetuṃ asakkuṇeyyattā
analyzed: rūpa ādikaḥ jinoti vā rūpa ādikam muñcitvā aññaḥ jinoti vā vissajjetum
translated: “The Victor is the visible-form aggregate, etc.,” or “apart from the visible-form aggregate, etc., there is another Victor,” cannot be answered.

original: avissajjanīyaṃ. “Katamo āsavakkhayo, katamo rāgakkhayo, katamo dosakkhayo, katamo
analyzed: avissajjanīyam katamaḥ āsava khayaḥ katamaḥ rāga kkhayaḥ katamaḥ dosa kkhayaḥ katamaḥ
translated: “What is the destruction of cankers? What is the destruction of lust? What is the destruction of hatred? What is the destruction of delusion?”

original: mohakkhayo”ti kataṃ pucchanaṃ “nibbānaṃ āsavakkhayo”ti vā “arahattamaggo āsavakkhayo”ti
analyzed: moha kkhayo ti katam pucchanam nibbānam āsava kkhayo ti vā arahatta maggo āsava kkhayo ti
translated: “The destruction of delusion” is a question. “The destruction of cankers is Nibbāna” or “The destruction of cankers is the path of arahatship” or “The destruction of lust is the fruit of arahatship” is an answer.

original: vā “arahattaphalaṃ rāgakkhayo”ti vā iti evamādinā vissajjanīyattā vissajjanīyaṃ.
analyzed: vā arahatta phalam vā iti evamādinā vissajjanīya ttā vissajjanīyam
translated: So it is of this kind that a question is answerable and an answer is a question.

original: “Kittako āsavakkhayo, kittako rāgakkhayo, kittako dosakkhayo, kittako mohakkhayo”ti
analyzed: kittakaḥ āsava kkhayaḥ kittakaḥ rāga kkhayaḥ kittakaḥ dosa kkhayaḥ kittakaḥ moha kkhayaḥ ti
translated: “How many kinds of destruction of cankers are there? How many kinds of destruction of lust? How many kinds of destruction of hate? How many kinds of destruction of delusion?”

original: kataṃ pucchanaṃ “ettako etaparimāṇo āsavakkhayo”ti evamādinā avissajjanīyattā avissajjanīyaṃ.
analyzed: katam pucchanam ettakaḥ eta parimāṇaḥ āsava kkhayo ti evamādinā a vissajjanīya ttā a vissajjanīyam
translated: is a question. “There is this much destruction of cankers” is an answer. So it is of this kind that a question is unanswerable and an answer is a question.

original: Idaṃ vuttappakāraṃ suttaṃ vuttanayena vissajjanīyañca avissajjanīyañca hoti. (12)🔽“Tathāgato satto atthī”ti pucchanaṃ “pañcakkhandhe upādāya paññāpetabbo sattabhūto🔽atthī”ti vissajjanīyattā vissajjanīyaṃ. “Atthi rūpa”nti kataṃ pucchanaṃ rūpassa vissajjamānattā
analyzed: idam vutta ppakāram suttam vutta nayena vissajjanīyam ca a vissajjanīyam ca hoti  tathāgataḥ satto atthi iti pucchanam pañca kkhandhe upādāya paññāpetabbaḥ satta bhūto  atthi iti vissajjanīya ttā vissajjanīyam atthi rūpan ti katam pucchanam rūpassa vissajjamāna ttā
translated: This kind of sutta is of this kind that a question is answerable and an answer is a question.🔽“Is there a self? Is there a being? Is there a soul? Is there a man? Is there a human being? Is there a person? Is there a human individual? Is there a human personality? Is there a human person? Is there a human being? Is there a human soul? Is there a human self?”🔽is a question. “The five aggregates of grasping are to be taught as a self” is an answer. So it is of this kind that a question is answerable and an answer is a question.

original: “āmantā”ti vissajjanīyattā vissajjanīyaṃ, “rūpaṃ tathāgato”ti kataṃ pucchanaṃ tathābhāvato
analyzed: āmantā ati vissajjanīya ttā vissajjanīyam rūpam tathāgato ti katam pucchanam tathābhāvato
translated: “Is there material form?” is a question. “There is material form” is an answer.🔽“Yes, sir” is an answer. So it is of this kind that a question is answerable and an answer is a question.🔽“Is the Tathāgata material form?” is a question. “No, sir” is an answer.

original: alabbhanato avissajjanīyattā avissajjanīyaṃ. “Rūpavā tathāgato”tiādīsupi esa nayo
analyzed: a labbhanataḥ a vissajjanīya ttā a vissajjanīyam rūpavā tathāgataḥ ti ādīsu pi esa nayaḥ
translated: because it cannot be obtained, because it cannot be answered, it is unanswerable. The same method applies in the case of the questions “Is the Tathāgata handsome?”

original: yathāsambhavaṃ yojetabbo. Idaṃ vuttappakāraṃ suttaṃ vuttanayena vissajjanīyañca avissajjanīyañca hoti.
analyzed: yathāsambhavam yojetabbaḥ idam vutta ppakāram suttam vutta nayena vissajjanīyam ca a vissajjanīyam ca hoti
translated: and so on. This sutta of the above-mentioned type is answerable and unanswerable in the way stated.

original: “Passati bhagavā dibbena cakkhunā…pe… yathākammūpage satte pajānātī”ti kataṃ pucchanaṃ
analyzed: passati bhagavā dibbena cakkhunā āpe yathākammūpage satte pajānāti iti katam pucchanam
translated: The question “Does the Blessed One see with his divine eye … does he know with his mind the minds of beings … does he understand the way to cross the round of rebirths?”

original: “passati bhagavā”ti vā…pe… “pajānāti bhagavā”ti vā vissajjanīyattā vissajjanīyaṃ.
analyzed: passati bhagavā ati vāpe pajānāti bhagavā ati vā vissajjanīya ttā vissajjanīyam
translated: is answerable because it can be answered “The Blessed One sees” or “The Blessed One knows” or “The Blessed One understands.”

original: “Katame sattā, katamo tathāgato”ti kataṃ pucchanaṃ paramatthato alabbhanato avissajjanīyattā avissajjanīyaṃ.🔽“Atthi tathāgato”ti kataṃ pucchanaṃ heṭṭhā vuttanayena vissajjanīyaṃ. “Atthi tathāgato
analyzed: katame sattā katamo tathāgato ti katam pucchanam paramatthataḥ a labbhanataḥ a vissajjanīya ttā a vissajjanīyam  atthi tathāgato ti katam pucchanam heṭṭhā vutta nayena vissajjanīyam atthi tathāgato
translated: The question “What are beings? What is the Tathāgata?” is unanswerable because it cannot be answered, because it cannot be obtained in the ultimate sense.

original: paraṃ maraṇā”ti kataṃ pucchanaṃ “atthi tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā”ti vissajjamāne sati
analyzed: param maraṇā ti katam pucchanaṃ atthi tathāgato param maraṇā ti vissajjamāne sati
translated: The question “Is there a Tathāgata?” is answerable because it can be answered in the way stated above. The question “Is there a Tathāgata after death?” is answerable if it is answered “There is a Tathāgata after death.”

original: ca idhaloko eva paralokoti āpajjati, “natthi tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā”ti vissajjamāne
analyzed: ca idha lokaḥ eva para lokaḥ oti āpajjati na atthi tathāgato param maraṇā ti vissajjamāne
translated: and he concludes that there is no other world, and that this world is the only world.🔽And when the question is put thus, “Does the Tathāgata exist after death?” he concludes that there is another world, different from this world.

original: sati ca idhalokato añño paralokoti āpajjati, tasmā avissajjanīyattā avissajjanīyaṃ.🔽Idaṃ vuttappakāraṃ suttaṃ vissajjanīye visaye ca avissajjanīye visaye ca vācakañāpakabhāvena
analyzed: sati ca idha lokataḥ añño para loko ti āpajjati tasmā a vissajjanīya ttā a vissajjanīyam  idam vutta ppakāram suttam vissajjanīye visaye ca a vissajjanīye visaye ca vācaka ñāpaka bhāvena
translated: Therefore, because it cannot be answered, it is unanswerable.

original: pavattanato vissajjanīyañca avissajjanīyañca hoti.
analyzed: pavattanataḥ vissajjanīyañca a vissajjanīyañca hoti
translated: This sutta of the kind stated is called “answerable” and “unanswerable” because it occurs as a statement and as an intimation in the answerable and unanswerable domains.

original: 120. Nānāvidhaṃ vissajjanīyāvissajjanīyasuttaṃ ācariyena niddhāritaṃ, amhehi ca ñātaṃ, “katamaṃ suttaṃ kamma”nti pucchitabbattā “tattha katamaṃ kamma”ntiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: nānāvidham vissajjanīya avissajjanīya suttam ācariyena niddhāritam amhehi ca ñātam katamam suttam kamman ti pucchitabbattā tattha katamam kamman tiādi vuttam
translated: The teacher has extracted the sutta of various kinds that is answerable and unanswerable. We have understood it. Since it should be asked, “Which sutta is the deed?” the text says, “Herein, which is the deed?”🔽The meaning of the passage beginning, “Of one overcome by the Destroyer” is clear because of the method stated above.

original: “Antakenādhipannassā”tiādīsu attho heṭṭhā vuttanayattā pākaṭo “maraṇenābhibhūtassa…pe…
