original: chāyā sāyanhasamayaṃ pathaviyaṃ seyyathāpi olambanti ajjholambanti abhippalambanti
analyzed: chāyā sāyanha samayam pathaviyam seyyathā api olambanti ajjholambanti abhippalambanti
translated: (The sick and the

original: yathā, bhikkhave, evameva bālaṃ…pe… abhippalambanti. Bhikkhave, tatra tasmiṃ upaṭṭhānākāre🔽upaṭṭhānākārahetu bālassa katapāpassa evaṃ parivitakko hoti “me mayā kalyāṇaṃ akataṃ
analyzed: yathā bhikkhave evam eva bālaṃpe abhippalambanti bhikkhave tatra tasmin upaṭṭhāna ākāre  upaṭṭhāna ākāra hetu bālassa kata pāpassa evam parivitakkaḥ hoti me mayā kalyāṇam a katam
translated: Just as the waves of a great ocean toss and turn the dead bodies of snakes, etc., so too, the waves of the defilements toss and turn the fool, the worthless man, the evil man, the man of little merit.🔽Herein, bhikkhus, in regard to the appearance of the object,

original: vata, me mayā kusalaṃ akataṃ vata, bhīruttāṇaṃ kataṃ vata, me mayā pāpaṃ kataṃ vata,🔽me mayā luddaṃ kataṃ vata, me mayā kibbisaṃ kataṃ vata, bho agilāna sappurisa akatakalyāṇānaṃ
analyzed: vata me mayā kusalam a katam vata bhīruttāṇam katam vata me mayā pāpam katam vata  me mayā luddam katam vata me mayā kibbisam katam vata bho agilāna sappurisa a kata kalyāṇānam
translated: because of the appearance of the object, the fool, the worthless man, the evil man, the man of little merit, thinks thus: “I have not done what is good, I have not done what is wholesome, I have not made myself a shelter from anguish.🔽I have done what is evil, I have done what is wicked, I have done what is blamable.

original: akatakusalānaṃ akatabhīruttāṇānaṃ katapāpānaṃ kataluddānaṃ katakibbisānaṃ yāvatā
analyzed: a kata kusalānam a kata bhīruttāṇānam kata pāpānam kata luddānam kata kibbisānam yāvatā
translated: O good man, O good man, I who have not done what is good, I who have not done what is wholesome, I who have not made myself a shelter from anguish, I who have done what is evil, I who have done what is wicked, I who have done what is blamable,

original: gati duggati atthi, taṃ gatiṃ ahaṃ pecca gacchāmī”ti evaṃ parivitakko hoti. Evaṃ
analyzed: gati duggati atthi tam gatim aham pecca gacchāmi iti evam parivitakkaḥ hoti evam
translated: wherever the destination of those who have done what is evil, who have done what is wicked, who have done what is blamable, may it be my destination too.” Thus he thinks.

original: vitakkento so bālo socati kilamati paridevati, urattāḷiṃ kandati sammohaṃ āpajjatīti yojanā.
analyzed: vitakkentaḥ saḥ bālaḥ socati kilamati paridevati uras tāḷim kandati sammoham āpajjati iti yojanā
translated: Thinking thus, the fool grieves, languishes, and laments; he weeps beating his breast and becomes confused.

original: Pabbatakūṭānaṃ chāyā nāma sūriyuggamanakālepi pathaviyā olambantīpi chāyā hāyanavasena
analyzed: pabbatakūṭānam chāyā nāma sūri yuj gamana kāle pi pathaviyā olambantī pi chāyā hāyana vasena
translated: The shadow of the mountain peaks, at sunrise, hangs over the earth, and the shadow diminishes.

original: olambanti. Sāyanhasamayaṃ pana chāyā vaḍḍhanavasena olambanti, tatheva kammānipi
analyzed: olambanti sāyanha samayam pana chāyā vaḍḍhana vasena olambanti tathā iva kammāni pi
translated: and in the evening they hang down because of the lengthening of the shadows. So too, the kamma-formations manifest themselves at that time because of their lengthening.

original: tasmiṃ kāle vaḍḍhanavasena upaṭṭhahanti, tasmā tameva vaḍḍhanupaṭṭhānaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: tasmin kāle vaḍḍhana vasena upaṭṭhahanti tasmai tam eva vaḍḍhan upaṭṭhānam sandhāya
translated: Therefore, referring to that very manifestation of their lengthening,

original: “sāyanhasamaya”nti vuttaṃ. Sukkapakkhepi yojanā kaṇhapakkhe yojanānusārena kātabbā.
analyzed: sāyanha samayam ti vuttam sukka pakkhe pi yojanā kaṇha pakkhe yojana anusārena kātabbā
translated: it is said, “in the evening.” The explanation in the bright fortnight should be done in accordance with that in the dark fortnight.

original: Idaṃ “puna capara”ntiādikaṃ suttadvayaṃ kusalakammaakusalakammesu vācakañāpakabhāvena
analyzed: idam puna ca param ti ādikam sutta dvayam kusala kamma akusala kammesu vācaka ñāpaka bhāvena
translated: This pair of suttas beginning with the words “Again, bhikkhus” is stated

original: pavattanato kammaṃ nāma.
analyzed: pavattanato kammam nāma
translated: by way of the manifestation of the kamma-formations as the “kamma” that occurs in the sense of the doer of kamma.

original: Nānāvidhaṃ kammaṃ ācariyena niddhāritaṃ, amhehi ca ñātaṃ, “katamo vipāko”ti pucchitabbattā🔽tattha katamo vipāko”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha tesu aṭṭhavīsatividhesu lokiyādīsu sāsanapaṭṭhānesu
analyzed: nānāvidham kammam ācariyena niddhāritam amhehi ca ñātam katamaḥ vipākaḥ ti pucchitabbattā  tattha katamaḥ vipāka iti ādi vuttam tattha tesu aṭṭhavīsatividhesu lokiya ādīsu sāsana paṭṭhānesu
translated: The teacher has extracted and we have understood the various kinds of kamma. Now, since it is necessary to ask, “What is the result?,”🔽it is said, “Herein, what is the result?” Herein, he asks, “What is the result among the twenty-eight kinds of mundane and supramundane states of the dispensation?”

original: katamo vipākoti pucchati. Bhikkhave, vo tumhehi ye manussattasaddhāpaṭilābhādayo
analyzed: katamaḥ vipākaḥ ti pucchati bhikkhave vaḥ tumhehi ye manussatta saddhā paṭilābha ādayo
translated: Bhikkhus, you have obtained the human state endowed with the eight factors, etc.,

original: paṭiladdhā, te manussattasaddhāpaṭilābhādayo vo tumhākaṃ lābhā bhavanti. Tumhehi
analyzed: paṭiladdhā te manussatta saddhā paṭilābha ādayaḥ vaḥ tumhākam lābhāḥ bhavanti tumhehi
translated: You have gained human faith, etc., and this is a gain for you.

original: pabbajitvā yaṃ catupārisuddhisīlādisampādanaṃ laddhaṃ, taṃ catupārisuddhisīlādisampādanaṃ🔽vo tumhākaṃ suladdhaṃ bhavati. Bhikkhave, yo buddhuppādo navamo khaṇo tumhehi laddho,
analyzed: pabbajitvā yam catu pārisuddhi sīla ādi sampādanam laddham tam catu pārisuddhi sīla ādi sampādanam  vaḥ tumhākam su laddham bhavati bhikkhave yaḥ buddhuppādaḥ navamaḥ khaṇaḥ tumhehi laddhaḥ
translated: You have gone forth and have gained the fulfilment of the four kinds of purity, and this is a gain for you.

original: so buddhuppādo navamo khaṇo vo tumhākaṃ brahmacariyavāsāya paṭiladdho bhavati.
analyzed: saḥ buddhuppādaḥ navamaḥ khaṇaḥ vaḥ tumhākam brahmacariya vāsāya paṭiladdhaḥ bhavati
translated: You have gained the ninth instant, the instant of the arising of the Buddha, and this is a gain for you, for the life of purity can be lived only in the instant of the arising of the Buddha.

original: Bhikkhave, mayā chaphassāyatanikā nāma nirayā diṭṭhā, tattha tesu diṭṭhesu chaphassāyatanikesu🔽nāma nirayesu yaṃ kiñci rūpaṃ cakkhunā passati, taṃ aniṭṭharūpaṃyeva passati, no
analyzed: bhikkhave mayā chaphassāyatanikā nāma nirayā diṭṭhā tattha tesu diṭṭhesu chaphassāyatanikesu  nāma nirayesu yam kiñci rūpam cakkhunā passati tam aniṭṭha rūpam yeva passati no
translated: I have seen the hells called the Six Bases, bhikkhus. When one sees those hells called the Six Bases,

original: iṭṭharūpaṃ. Akantarūpaṃyeva passati, no kantarūpaṃ. Amanāparūpaṃyeva passati, no manāparūpaṃ.
analyzed: iṭṭha rūpam a kanta rūpam yeva passati no kanta rūpam a manāpa rūpam yeva passati no manāpa rūpam
translated: whatever form one sees with the eye is only unpleasing, not pleasing; only disagreeable, not agreeable; only repulsive, not attractive.

original: Yaṃ kiñci saddaṃ sotena…pe… ghānena…pe… jivhāya…pe… kāyena…pe… yaṃ kiñci dhammaṃ
analyzed: yam kiñci saddam sotenape ghānenape jivhāyape kāyenape yam kiñci dhammaṃ
translated: Whatever sound one hears with the ear… Whatever odour one smells with the nose… Whatever flavour one tastes with the tongue… Whatever tangible one touches with the body… Whatever

original: manasā vijānāti, taṃ aniṭṭhadhammaṃyeva vijānāti, no iṭṭhadhammaṃ. Akantadhammaṃyeva
analyzed: manasā vijānāti tam an iṭṭha dhammaṃ yā iva vijānāti no iṭṭha dhammam a kanta dhammaṃ yā iva
translated: He cognizes with the mind, and he cognizes only what is unlovely, not what is lovely. He cognizes only what is impermanent, not what is permanent.

original: vijānāti, no kantadhammaṃ. Amanāpadhammaṃyeva vijānāti, no manāpadhammanti pāṭho
analyzed: vijānāti no kanta dhammam amanāpa dhammaṃyā iva vijānāti no manāpa dhammanti pāṭhaḥ
translated: He cognizes with the mind what is unlovely, not what is lovely. He cognizes what is not desirable, not what is desirable. He cognizes what is disagreeable, not what is agreeable.

original: yutto. “Aniṭṭharūpaṃyeva vijānāti, no iṭṭharūpa”ntiādipāṭho ayutto, katthaci pāḷiyaṃ🔽ayuttapāṭho diṭṭho. Sukkapakkhe vuttanayavipariyāyena yojanā kātabbā. Ayaṃ vuttappakārā
analyzed: yuttaḥ aniṭṭha rūpam yeva vijānāti no iṭṭha rūpam ti ādi pāṭhaḥ ayuttaḥ katthaci  ayutta pāṭhaḥ diṭṭhaḥ sukka pakkhe vutta naya vipariyāyena yojanā kātabbā ayam vutta ppakārā
translated: The reading “He cognizes what is unlovely, not what is lovely” is not correct. In some texts a reading that is not correct is found.🔽The interpretation should be given in the opposite way to that stated in the bright side.

original: “lābhā vo, bhikkhave”tiādiko pāṭho vipāke vācakañāpakabhāveneva pavattanato vipāko nāma.
analyzed: lābhāḥ vaḥ bhikkhave iti ādikaḥ pāṭhaḥ vipāke vācaka ñāpaka bhāvena iva pavattanataḥ vipākaḥ nāma
translated: The reading beginning “It is your gain, bhikkhus” is called fruition because it occurs as a mere intimation and indication of fruition.

original: Mārisā niraye paccamānānaṃ amhākaṃ sabbaso nimujjanaummujjanavasena saṭṭhivassasahassāni paripuṇṇāni, nirayassa anto pariyosānaṃ kadā kasmiṃ kāle bhavissati.
analyzed: mārisāḥ niraye paccamānānam amhākam sabbasas nimujjana ummujjana vasena saṭṭhi vassa sahassāni paripuṇṇāni nirayassa antaḥ pariyosānam kadā kasmim kāle bhavissati
translated: “Friends, we have been roasting in hell for sixty thousand years, being constantly submerged and emerging. When will the end of hell come?

original: Nirayassa anto pariyosānaṃ natthi. Nirayassa anto pariyosānaṃ kuto atthi? Nirayassa
analyzed: nirayassa antaḥ pariyosānam natthi nirayassa antaḥ pariyosānam kuto atthi nirayassa
translated: “There is no end to hell. How can there be an end to hell?

original: anto pariyosānaṃ amhākaṃ na paṭidissati. Mārisā, yadā tumhe ca ahañca seṭṭhiputtā
analyzed: antar pariyosānam amhākam na paṭidissati mārisā yadā tumhe ca ahañca seṭṭhi puttā
translated: The end of hell is not seen for us. Sirs, when you and I were born as sons of merchants,

original: jātā, tadā tuyhaṃ tumhākañca mayhaṃ mama ca pāpaṃ hi yasmā pakataṃ pakārehi kataṃ,
analyzed: jātā tadā tuyham tumhākam ca mayham mama ca pāpam hi yasmai katam
translated: then, because of the evil that was done by you and me,

original: tasmā nirayassa anto pariyosānaṃ amhākaṃ na dissatīti ayaṃ pāṭho vipāke vācakañāpakabhāvena
analyzed: tasmā nirayassa antaḥ pariyosānam amhākam na dissati iti ayam pāṭhaḥ vipāke vācaka ñāpaka bhāvena
translated: therefore the end of hell is not seen for us. This reading is by way of the explanation of the ripening.

original: pavattanato vipāko nāma. (13)
analyzed: pavattanataḥ vipākaḥ nāma
translated: () Ripening is so called because of its occurrence.🔽The man who is a doer of what is not Dhamma, who is heedless in regard to profitable things,

original: 121. Adhammacārī naro kusaladhammesu pamatto hi yasmā hoti, tasmā so adhammacārī
analyzed: a dhamma cārī naraḥ kusala dhammesu pamattaḥ hi yasmai hoti tasmai saḥ a dhamma cārī
translated: because of that he is a doer of what is not Dhamma,🔽heedless. Wherever, wherever, whatever, whatever bad destination that heedless man goes to,

original: pamatto naro yahiṃ yahiṃ yaṃ yaṃ duggatiṃ gacchati, taṃ taṃ gacchantaṃ adhammacāriṃ🔽naṃ naraṃ attanā carito so dhammova hanati. Kimiva hanati? Sayaṃ attanā gahito kaṇhasappo
analyzed: pamattaḥ naraḥ yahim yahim yam yam duggatim gacchati tam tam gacchantam adhamma cāriṃ  nam naram attanā carito saḥ dhammaḥ uva hanati kim iva hanati sayam attanā gahitaḥ kaṇha sappo
translated: going there, that man who is a doer of what is not Dhamma,🔽is killed by that very Dhamma that he himself has done. What does he kill? Just as a black snake

original: gaṇhantaṃ janaṃ hanati yathā, evaṃ attanā carito adhammo adhammacāriṃ naṃ hanati.
analyzed: gaṇhantam janam hanati yathā evam attanā caritaḥ adhammaḥ adhamma cārim nam hanati
translated: that is seized kills the person who seized it, so too that Dhamma that is not Dhamma, that was done by himself, kills that man who is a doer of what is not Dhamma.

original: “Na hi dhammo adhammo cā”tiādigāthāya attho pākaṭo. Idaṃ suttadvayaṃ kamme ca vipāke
analyzed: na hi dhammaḥ adhammaḥ ca ati ādi gāthāya attho pākaṭaḥ idam sutta dvayam kamme ca vipāke
translated: The meaning of the verse “No, not Dhamma, not non-Dhamma” is clear. The meaning of the two sutta passages is clear in regard to kamma and its result.

original: ca vācakañāpakabhāvena pavattanato kammañca vipāko ca hoti.
analyzed: ca vācaka ñāpaka bhāvena pavattanato kammaṃ ca vipāko ca hoti
translated: The meaning of the verse “No, not Dhamma and not non-Dhamma” is clear. This pair of suttas is both kamma and its result, because it occurs as a statement and an intimation of kamma and its result.

original: Bhikkhave, tumhe puññānaṃ mā bhāyittha; bhikkhave, yadidaṃ yaṃ idaṃ “puññānī”ti adhivacanaṃ🔽pavattaṃ; etaṃ “puññānī”ti adhivacanaṃ iṭṭhassa kantassa piyassa manāpassa sukhassa🔽sukhavipākajanakassa kammassa adhivacanaṃ hoti. Bhikkhave, ahaṃ dīgharattaṃ katānaṃ
analyzed: bhikkhave tumhe puññānam mā bhāyittha bhikkhave yat idam yam idam puññāni iti adhivacanam  pavattam etam puññāni iti adhivacanam iṭṭhassa kantassa piyassa manāpassa sukhassa  sukha vipāka janakassa kammassa adhivacanam hoti bhikkhave aham dīgharattam katānam
translated: “Monks, do not fear merit. Monks, this is a term for merit,🔽for what is called ‘merit’ is a term for kamma that produces a desirable, lovely, agreeable result, pleasant and joyful,

original: puññānaṃ dīgharattaṃ paccanubhūtaṃ iṭṭhaṃ kantaṃ piyaṃ manāpaṃ abhijānāmi kho. “Kathaṃ
analyzed: puññānam dīgharattam paccanubhūtam iṭṭham kantam piyam manāpam abhijānāmi kho katham
translated: that is, for kamma that has a pleasant ripening. Monks, I know of no other single thing so varied and so complex in its ripening as kamma.

original: abhijānāmī”ti ce puccheyya, pubbe satta vassāni mettacittaṃ mettāya sahitaṃ dutiyajjhānacittaṃ
analyzed: abhijānāmi iti ce puccheyya pubbe satta vassāni metta cittam mettāya sahitam dutiya jjhāna cittam
translated: “How do I know this? Once, for seven aeons of world-dissolution, I developed the mind of loving-kindness, the mind of the second jhana,

original: bhāvetvā satta saṃvaṭṭavivaṭṭakappe imaṃ lokaṃ manussalokaṃ puna na āgamāsiṃ. Satta
analyzed: bhāvetvā satta saṃvaṭṭa vivaṭṭa kappe imam lokam manussa lokam puna naḥ āgamāsim satta
translated: and for seven aeons of world evolution and dissolution I did not return to this human state. I was reborn among the gods for seven aeons,

original: saṃvaṭṭavivaṭṭakappeti cettha saṃvaṭṭaggahaṇena saṃvaṭṭaṭṭhāyī, vivaṭṭaggahaṇena
analyzed: saṃvaṭṭa vivaṭṭa kappā iti ca ittha saṃvaṭṭa ggahaṇena saṃvaṭṭa ṭṭhāyī vivaṭṭa ggahaṇena
translated: Herein, the words “at the time of the world’s dissolution and evolution” include the time of the world’s duration.

original: vivaṭṭaṭṭhāyīpi gahitāti veditabbā. Sesesupi evameva gahetabbo. Bhikkhave, saṃvaṭṭamāne
analyzed: vivaṭṭa ṭṭhāyī ipi gahitā ati veditabbā sesesu pi evam eva gahetabbaḥ bhikkhave saṃvaṭṭamāne
translated: Herein, by the word “contraction” the time of contraction is included, and by the word “expansion” the time of expansion is included. This is how it should be understood.

original: kappe ahaṃ ābhassarūpago homi, vivaṭṭakappe suññaṃ brahmavimānaṃ upapajjāmi. Bhikkhave,🔽tatra brahmavimāne tatra upapajjamāne upapajjamānahetu ahaṃ brahmā homi, aññe mahānubhāvena
analyzed: kappe aham ābhassa rūpago homi vivaṭṭa kappe suññam brahma vimānam upapajjāmi bhikkhave  tatra brahma vimāne tatra upapajjamāne upapajjamāna hetu aham brahmā homi aññe mahā anubhāvena
translated: When the world is contracting, bhikkhus, I go to the Ābhassara Brahma-world. When the world is expanding, I am reborn in an empty mansion of Brahmās.🔽There, bhikkhus, in that mansion of Brahmās, when others are reborn there, I am the Great Brahmā, the Conqueror, the Unconquered, the All-Seeing, the All-Powerful, the Lord, the Maker and Creator, the Supreme Being, the Ordainer, the Almighty, the Father of All That Have Been and Shall Be.🔽I am the one who makes them so.🔽I am the one who sends them there.

original: abhibhavanato abhibhū, aññehi anabhibhavanato anabhibhūto mahābrahmā homi, aññadatthu
analyzed: abhibhavanataḥ abhibhū aññehi an abhibhavanataḥ an abhibhūtaḥ mahā brahmā homi
translated: I am the one who sends them there.🔽I am the one who sends them there.

original: ekaṃsena daso ahaṃ vasavattī homi.
analyzed: ekaṃsena dasaḥ aham vasa vattī homi
translated: I am the one who sends them there.🔽I am the one who sends them there.🔽I am the one who sends them there.🔽I am the one who sends them there.🔽I am the one who sends them there.🔽I am the one who sends them there.🔽I am the one who sends them there.🔽I am the one who sends them there.🔽I am the one who sends them there.🔽I am the one who sends them there.🔽I am the one who sends them there.🔽I am the one who sends them there.🔽I am the one who sends them there.🔽I am the one who sends them there.🔽I am the one who sends them there.

original: Bhikkhave, ahaṃ devānamindo sakko chattiṃsakkhattuṃ ahosiṃ kho, dhammiko dhammarājā
analyzed: bhikkhave aham devānamindo sakkaḥ chattiṃsa khattum ahosim kho dhammikaḥ dhamma rājā

analyzed: cāturantaḥ vijitāvī cakka ratana ādi satta ratana samannāgataḥ cakkavatti rājā
translated: I am the one who sends them there.🔽I am the one who sends them there.🔽I am the one who sends them there.🔽I am the one who sends them there.🔽I am the one who sends them there.🔽I am the one who sends them there.🔽I am the one who sends them there.🔽I am the one who sends them there.🔽I am the one who sends them there.🔽I am the one who sends them there.🔽I am the

original: anekasatakkhattuṃ ahosiṃ, padesarajjassa rājabhāve ko pana vādo.
analyzed: aneka sata kkhattum ahosim padesa rajjassa rāja bhāve kaḥ pana vādaḥ
translated: I was a local king many hundreds of times, not to speak of a Wheel-turning Monarch.

original: Bhikkhave, tassa cakkavattirājabhūtassa mayhaṃ etaṃ parivitakkanaṃ ahosi “yena phalena
analyzed: bhikkhave tassa cakkavatti rāja bhūtassa mayham etam parivitakkanam ahosi yena phalena
translated: “Monks, as a Wheel-turning Monarch, this occurred to me: ‘By what fruit,

original: yena vipākena ahaṃ etarahi evaṃmahiddhiko evaṃmahānubhāvo amhi, taṃ idaṃ phalaṃ kissa
analyzed: yena vipākena aham etarahi evaṃmahiddhikaḥ evaṃmahā anubhāvaḥ amhi tam idam phalam kissa
translated: by what result, am I now so powerful and mighty? That fruit,

original: kammassa phalaṃ nu kho, so ayaṃ vipāko kissa kammassa vipāko nu kho”ti etaṃ parivitakkanaṃ
analyzed: kammassa phalam nu kho so ayam vipākaḥ kissa kammassa vipākaḥ nu kho ti etam parivitakkanam
translated: that result, is from what action?’ This occurred to me:

original: ahosi. Bhikkhave, tassa vitakkentassa mayhaṃ etaṃ parivitakkanaṃ ahosi “yena phalena
analyzed: ahosi bhikkhave tassa vitakkentassa mayham etam parivitakkanam ahosi yena phalena
translated: “Monks, as I was reflecting, this occurred to me: ‘By what fruit,

original: yena vipākena ahaṃ etarahi evaṃmahiddhiko evaṃmahānubhāvo amhi, me pavattaṃ taṃ idaṃ
analyzed: yena vipākena aham etarahi evaṃmahiddhikaḥ evaṃmahā anubhāvaḥ amhi me pavattam tam idam
translated: by what result, am I now so powerful and mighty? That fruit,🔽that result, is from three actions. That result,

original: phalaṃ tiṇṇaṃ kammānaṃ phalaṃ kho, so ayaṃ vipāko tiṇṇaṃ kammānaṃ vipāko kho, seyyathidaṃ🔽katamesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ kammānaṃ phalaṃ vipāko? Dānassa damassa saṃyamassāti tiṇṇaṃ kammānaṃ
analyzed: phalam tiṇṇam kammānam phalam kho so ayam vipākaḥ tiṇṇam kammānam vipākaḥ kho sā iyyathidam 🔽katamesam tiṇṇam kammānam phalam vipākaḥ dānassa damassa saṃyamassa ati tiṇṇam kammānam
translated: that result, is from three actions, namely:🔽from giving, self-control, and restraint.’

original: phalaṃ vipāko”ti etaṃ parivitakkanaṃ ahosīti avocāti yojanā.🔽Tattha tasmiṃ “mā, bhikkhave, puññānaṃ bhāyitthā”tiādike sutte yañca dānaṃ, yo ca
analyzed: phalam etam parivitakkanam ahosi iti avoca ati yojanā  tattha tasmim mā bhikkhave puññānam bhāyittha ati ādike sutte yat ca dānam yaḥ ca
translated: and the fruit is the ripening” .🔽Herein, in the sutta beginning, “Do not be afraid of merit, bhikkhus” , the three things, namely, the giving, the taming, and the restraining, are the action that is the means of expression and intimation.

original: damo, yo ca saṃyamo atthi, idaṃ dānādittayaṃ kammaṃ, taṃvācakañāpakaṃ suttampi kammaṃ🔽nāma. Tappaccayo taṃkammapaccayo paccayuppannabhūto paccanubhūto yo vipāko atthi,
analyzed: damaḥ yaḥ ca saṃyamaḥ atthi idam dāna ādittayam kammam suttam pi kammam  nāma tad paccayaḥ tad kamma paccayo paccaya uppanna bhūtaḥ paccanubhūtaḥ yaḥ vipākaḥ atthi
translated: The sutta that is the means of expression and intimation of that action is the action that is the means of expression and intimation.🔽The ripening that is the outcome of that action that is the means of expression and intimation is the ripening.

original: etaṃ vipāke phalampi pakkhipitabbaṃ, ayaṃ vipāko taṃvācakañāpako pāṭhopi vipāko nāma.
analyzed: etam vipāke phalam pi pakkhipitabbam ayam vipākaḥ pāṭhaḥ api vipākaḥ nāma
translated: The fruit that is included in the ripening should also be included here. The ripening that is the means of expression and intimation of that is the ripening that is the means of expression and intimation.

original: Cūḷakammavibhaṅgo cūḷakammavipākaputhuttavibhāgo tathā vattabbo.
analyzed: cūḷa kamma vibhaṅgo cūḷa kamma vipāka puthutta vibhāgaḥ tathā vattabbo
translated: The short analysis of action and the short analysis of the priority and posteriority of the ripening of action should be understood in the same way.

original: Todeyyaputtassa subhassa māṇavassa yaṃ suttaṃ bhagavatā desitaṃ, tattha sutte vuttā
analyzed: todeyya puttassa subhassa māṇavassa yam suttam bhagavatā desitam tattha sutte vuttā
translated: In the case of the sutta taught by the Blessed One to the brahmin student Todeyya, the things stated there

original: ye pāṇātipātādayo dhammā appāyukadīghāyukatāya saṃvattanti, ye hiṃsanādayo dhammā
analyzed: ye pāṇa atipāta ādayaḥ dhammāḥ appāyuka dīgha āyuka tāya saṃvattanti ye hiṃsana ādayaḥ dhammāḥ
translated: that lead to a short life, etc., are the things that lead to a long life, etc., namely, the abstentions from killing living beings, etc.,🔽and the things that lead to the harming, etc., of others are the things that lead to the non-harming, etc., of others, namely, the killing of living beings, etc.

original: bahvābādhaappābādhatāya saṃvattanti, ye usūyanādayo dhammā appesakkhamahesakkhatāya
analyzed: bahu ābādha appābādha tāya saṃvattanti ye usūyana ādayaḥ dhammāḥ appesakkha mahesakkha tāya
translated: they lead to being little respected and greatly respected,🔽they lead to being ugly and beautiful,

original: saṃvattanti, ye kodhādayo dhammā dubbaṇṇasuvaṇṇatāya saṃvattanti, ye agāravādayo
analyzed: saṃvattanti ye kodha ādayaḥ dhammāḥ dubbaṇṇa suvaṇṇa tāya saṃvattanti ye agārava ādayo
translated: they lead to being of low birth and of high birth,🔽they lead to having little wealth and having great wealth,

original: dhammā nīcakulikauccakulikatāya saṃvattanti, ye maccherādayo dhammā appabhogamahābhogatāya🔽saṃvattanti, ye asallakkhaṇādayo dhammā duppaññapaññavantatāya saṃvattanti. Idaṃ🔽pāṇātipātasattayugaṃ kammaṃ, taṃvācakañāpakaṃ suttampi kammaṃ nāma. Tattha subhasutte
analyzed: dhammāḥ nīca kulika auccakulika tāya saṃvattanti ye macchera ādayaḥ dhammāḥ appabhoga mahā bhoga tāya  saṃvattanti ye asat lakkhaṇa ādayaḥ dhammāḥ duppañña paññavanta tāya saṃvattanti idam  pāṇa atipāta satta yugam kammam suttam api kammam nāma tattha subha sutte
translated: they lead to being unwise and being wise.🔽This is the pair of seven sets of action that is action that is stated and also action that is stated in the Suttas. Herein, the long life and short life stated in the Subha Sutta … down to … the unwise and the wise stated there,

original: yā appāyukadīghāyukatā vuttā…pe… yā duppaññapaññavantatā vuttā, so ayaṃ appāyukadīghāyukatādiko🔽vipāko, taṃvācakañāpakapāṭhopi vipāko. Idaṃ subhasuttaṃ kusalākusalakamme ceva vipāke
analyzed: yā appāyuka dīgha āyuka tā vuttā ape yā duppañña paññavanta tā vuttā so ayam appāyuka dīgha āyuka tā ādikaḥ  vipākaḥ idam subha suttam kusala akusala kamme ca iva vipāke
translated: this is the result. The reading that states and makes known that is also the result.

original: ca vācakañāpakabhāvena pavattanato kammañca vipāko ca hoti. (14)
analyzed: ca vācaka ñāpaka bhāvena pavattanato kammaṃ ca vipāko ca hoti
translated: This Subha Sutta is action and also the result because it occurs as the stating and making known of profitable and unprofitable action and of its result.

original: 122. Yo puggalo vacīduccaritaparivajjanena vācānurakkhī bhaveyya, abhijjhādianuppādanena
analyzed: yaḥ puggalaḥ vacī duccarita parivajjanena vācā anurakkhī bhaveyya abhijjhā ādi an uppādanena
translated: The person who would be a guardian of speech by avoiding verbal misconduct,🔽who would be restrained in mind by not arousing covetousness, etc.,

original: manasā saṃvuto bhaveyya, pāṇātipātādipajahanena kāyena akusalaṃ na kayirā, iti tayo
analyzed: manasā saṃvutaḥ bhaveyya pāṇa atipāta ādi pajahanena kāyena akusalam na iti
translated: and who would not do what is unprofitable by body by abandoning killing living beings, etc., would purify these three courses of action,

original: ete kammapathe visodhaye, so puggalo isippaveditaṃ maggaṃ ariyaṃ aṭṭhaṅgikaṃ maggaṃ🔽ārādhaye ārādhayeyyāti yojanā. Idaṃ “vācānurakkhī”tiādikaṃ suttaṃ kusale vācakañāpakabhāvena
analyzed: ete kamma pathe visodhaye so puggalaḥ isi ppaveditam maggam ariyam aṭṭhaṅgikam maggaṃ  ārādhaye ārādhayeyya iti yojanā idam vācā anurakkhi iti ādikam suttam kusale vācaka ñāpaka bhāvena
translated: and he would make his own the noble eightfold path proclaimed by the wise.

original: pavattanato kusalaṃ nāma.
analyzed: pavattanataḥ kusalam nāma
translated: This sutta, which begins with the words “A guardian of speech,” is called “profitable” because it occurs in the profitable plane of consciousness.🔽The person who has no bodily misconduct, which is action that leads to an unhappy destination,

original: Yassa puggalassa kāyena dukkaṭaṃ duggatisaṃvattaniyakammaṃ natthi, vācāya dukkaṭakammaṃ🔽natthi, manasā dukkaṭakammaṃ natthi, tīhi ṭhānehi uppajjanaṭṭhānehi saṃvutaṃ taṃ
analyzed: yassa puggalassa kāyena dukkaṭam duggati saṃvattaniya kammaṃ natthi vācāya dukkaṭa kammaṃ  natthi manasā dukkaṭa kammam natthi tīhi ṭhānehi uppajjana ṭṭhānehi saṃvutam tam
translated: who has no verbal misconduct,🔽and who is restrained in these three ways, in the three places where misconduct arises, I declare to be a brāhmaṇa.

original: puggalaṃ “brāhmaṇa”nti ahaṃ vadāmīti yojanā. Idaṃ gāthāvacanaṃ vuttanayena kusalaṃ nāma.
analyzed: puggalam brāhmaṇanti aham vadāmi iti yojanā idam gāthā vacanam vutta nayena kusalam nāma
translated: This verse is called “profitable” in the way already stated.

original: “Tīṇimāni, bhikkhave…pe… kusalamūlānī”ti idaṃ vacanaṃ vuttanayena kusalaṃ. Bhikkhave,
analyzed: tīṇi imāni bhikkhave pe kusala mūlāni iti idam vacanam vutta nayena kusalam bhikkhave
translated: “Bhikkhus, there are these three roots of what is unskillful. “

original: kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ samāpattiyā vijjā pubbaṅgamā hoti, hirī ca ottappañca anudevāti
analyzed: kusalānam dhammānam samāpattiyāḥ vijjā pubbaṅgamā hoti hirī ca ottappam ca
translated: “Bhikkhus, for the attainment of the as-yet-unattained, for the achievement of the as-yet-unachieved, for the realization of the as-yet-unrealized, knowledge & vision is foremost, with shame & compunction following along. “

original: yojanā. Idaṃ vacanaṃ vuttanayena kusalaṃ nāma.🔽Māluvā sālaṃ rukkhaṃ onataṃ bhūmiyaṃ patanaṃ karoti iva, tathā yassa janassa accantaṃ
analyzed: yojanā idam vacanam kusalam nāma  māluvā sālam rukkham onatam bhūmiyam patanam karoti iva tathā yassa janassa accantam
translated: This statement is skillful in the way already stated.

original: dvīsu tīsu bhavesu dussīlyaṃ atthi, so jano attānaṃ onataṃ apāyesu pākaṭaṃ karoti.🔽Anatthakāmo jano yathā anatthaṃ icchati, tathā anatthaṃ karoti yathā, tathā īdiso
analyzed: dvīsu tīsu bhavesu dussīlyam atthi saḥ janaḥ attānam onatam apāyesu pākaṭam karoti  anattha kāmaḥ janaḥ yathā anattham icchati tathā anattham karoti yathā tathā īdisaḥ
translated: Just as a māluva creeper, when it has climbed a sāla tree, makes it wither away and lie there shriveled and brown, in the same way, when a person is utterly unvirtuous, he makes himself lie there shriveled and brown in the nether world.🔽Just as a person who wishes harm, who wishes evil, does harm and evil, in the same way, this unvirtuous person does harm and evil to himself.

original: dussīlo naṃ attānaṃ anatthaṃ karotīti yojanā. Idaṃ “yassā”tiādikaṃ vacanaṃ vuttanayena akusalaṃ.
analyzed: dussīlaḥ nam attānam anattham karoti iti yojanā idam yassa ati ādikam vacanam vutta nayena akusalam
translated: This statement beginning with “Whose” is unskillful in the way already stated.

original: Asmamayaṃ asmasaṅkhātaṃ pāsāṇamaṇimayaṃ vajiraṃ vajirassa uṭṭhānasaṅkhātaṃ pāsāṇamaṇiṃ
analyzed: asma mayam asma saṅkhātam pāsāṇa maṇi mayam vajiram vajirassa uṭṭhāna saṅkhātam pāsāṇa maṇim
translated: The diamond, which is made of stone, is the best of stones.

original: abhimatthati vidhaṃseti iva, tathā attanā hi sayameva kataṃ attajaṃ attasambhavaṃ
analyzed: vidhaṃsa iti iva tathā attanā hi sayam eva katam atta jam atta sambhavam
translated: so evil, which is self-made, self-originated,🔽crushes the foolish man who does evil.

original: pāpaṃ dummedhaṃ pāpaṃ karontaṃ janaṃ abhimatthatīti yojanā. Idaṃ “attanā hī”tiādikaṃ
analyzed: pāpam dummedham pāpam karontam janam abhimatthati iti yojanā idam hi iti ādikam
translated: The words “self-made” and so on

original: vacanaṃ vuttanayena akusalaṃ.
analyzed: vacanam vutta nayena akusalam
translated: are unwholesome in the way already stated.🔽The gods, who are shunned by the virtuous,

original: Devate kusalehi vivajjitā akusalā dasa kammapathe niseviya katvā garahā gārayhā bhavanti,
analyzed: devate kusalehi vivajjitāḥ akusalāḥ dasa kamma pathe niseviya katvā garahāḥ gārayhāḥ bhavanti
translated: are reproached for following the ten courses of unwholesome kamma.🔽The foolish, the dull-witted, are roasted in the hells.

original: bālamatī mandabuddhino nirayesu paccareti yojanā. Idaṃ “dasa kammapathe”tiādikaṃ
analyzed: bāla matī manda buddhinaḥ nirayesu paccara iti yojanā idam dasa kamma patha iti ādikam
translated: The sutta beginning with the words “the ten courses of unwholesome kamma”

original: suttaṃ vuttanayena akusalaṃ.
analyzed: suttam vutta nayena akusalam
translated: is unwholesome in the way already stated.🔽The words “Bhikkhus, there are these three roots of what is unwholesome”

original: “Tīṇimāni, bhikkhave…pe… akusalamūlānī”ti idaṃ vacanaṃ vuttanayena akusalaṃ. (15)🔽Yādisaṃ yaṃ bījaṃ vapate, taṃ bījaṃ tādisaṃ phalaṃ harate iva, tathā kalyāṇakārī
analyzed: tīṇi imāni bhikkhave pe akusala mūlāni iti idam vacanam vutta nayena akusalam  yādisam yam bījam vapate tam bījam tādisam phalam harate iva tathā kalyāṇa kārī
translated: are unwholesome in the way already stated.🔽As whatever seed a man sows, that seed he reaps as fruit,

original: paṇḍito kalyāṇaṃ phalaṃ harate, pāpakārī bālo ca pāpakaṃ phalaṃ harateti yojanā.
analyzed: kalyāṇam phalam harate pāpa kārī bālaḥ ca pāpakam phalam harata iti yojanā
translated: so the wise man who does good reaps good as fruit, and the foolish man who does evil reaps evil as fruit.

original: Tattha “yādisa”ntiādike sutte “kalyāṇakārī kalyāṇa”nti yaṃ vacanaṃ āha, idaṃ vacanaṃ
analyzed: tattha sutte kalyāṇa kārī yam vacanam āha idam vacanam
translated: Herein, in the sutta beginning with the words “As is the deed so is the result” the words “The doer of good goes to a good state”

original: kusalaṃ. “Pāpakārī ca pāpaka”nti yaṃ vacanaṃ āha, idaṃ vacanaṃ akusalaṃ. Idaṃ dvivacanaṃ
analyzed: kusalam pāpa kārī ca yam vacanam āha idam vacanam akusalam idam dvi vacanam
translated: are a statement of profitable action. The words “The doer of evil goes to an evil state” are a statement of unprofitable action. This

original: vuttanayena kusalañca akusalañca hoti.🔽Kalyāṇakārī sappurisā subhena kammena suggatiṃ vajanti gacchanti, pāpakārī kāpurisā
analyzed: vutta nayena kusalam ca akusalam ca hoti  kalyāṇa kārī sappurisā subhena kammena suggatim vajanti gacchanti pāpa kārī kāpurisā
translated: pair of statements is profitable and unprofitable in the way already stated.

original: asubhena kammunā apāyabhūmiṃ vajanti gacchanti, kammassa abhisaṅkhāraviññāṇasahagatakammassa
analyzed: asubhena kammunā apāya bhūmim vajanti gacchanti kammassa abhisaṅkhāra viññāṇa sahagata kammassa
translated: The doer of good, the good person, goes to a good destination by means of a good deed. The doer of evil, the bad person, goes to an evil destination by means of an evil deed. By the exhaustion of the kamma that is accompanied by consciousness that is the formation of kamma,

original: khayā khayanato vimuttacetasā samucchedavimuttipaṭippassaddhivimutticittā te sappurisā🔽asubhe nibbanti. Kimiva nibbanti? Indhanakkhayā joti nibbāti iva, tathā te sappurisā
analyzed: khayā khayanataḥ vimutta cetasā samuccheda vimutti paṭippassaddhi vimutti cittā te sappurisā  asubhe nibbanti kim iva nibbanti indhana kkhayā nibbāti iva tathā te sappurisā
translated: by the exhaustion of the exhaustion, the good person, with mind liberated, with mind that is the surcease of bondage, with mind that is the surcease of the defilements,

original: kammassa khayā anavasesakhayanato nibbantīti yojanā. Tattha tasmiṃ “subhenā”tiādigāthāvacane
analyzed: kammassa khayāḥ anavasesa khayanataḥ nibbanti iti yojanā tattha tasmim subhena ati ādi gāthā vacane
translated: goes out. Like what? Like a flame that goes out with the exhaustion of the fuel. So too, the good person goes out by the exhaustion of kamma without remainder. Herein, in the stanza beginning with the words “By a good deed”

original: “subhena…pe… suggati”nti yaṃ vacanaṃ āha, idaṃ “subhena…pe…suggati”nti vacanaṃ kusale🔽vācakañāpakabhāvena pavattanato kusalaṃ nāma. “Apāyabhūmiṃ asubhena kammunā”ti yaṃ
analyzed: subhenape suggatin ti yam vacanam āha idam vacanam kusale  vācaka ñāpaka bhāvena pavattanataḥ kusalam nāma apāya bhūmim asubhena kammunā ati yam
translated: The words “By the beautiful, … to a good destination” are called “beautiful, … to a good destination” because they occur as a statement that is good.

original: vacanaṃ āha, idaṃ “apāya…pe… kammunā”ti vacanaṃ akusale vācakañāpakabhāvena pavattanato
analyzed: vacanam āha idam kammunā ati vacanam akusale vācaka ñāpaka bhāvena pavattanato
translated: The words “By the ugly, … to the plane of misery” are called “ugly, … to the plane of misery” because they occur as a statement that is bad.

original: akusalaṃ nāma. Idaṃ “subhenā”tiādikaṃ gāthāvacanaṃ vuttanayena kusalañca akusalañca hoti. (16)
analyzed: akusalam nāma idam subhena ati ādikam gāthā vacanam vutta nayena kusalam ca akusalam ca hoti
translated: This stanza is good and bad in the way stated.

original: 123. “Yathāpi bhamaro pupphaṃ…pe… munī care”ti idaṃ gāthāvacanaṃ anuññāte caraṇe vācakañāpakabhāvena pavattanato anuññātaṃ nāma.
analyzed: yathā api bhamaro pupphaṃpe munī cara iti idam gāthā vacanam anuññāte caraṇe vācaka ñāpaka bhāvena pavattanataḥ anuññātam nāma
translated: The words “Just as a bee, without alighting on a flower, … the sage should go” are called “permitted” because they occur as a statement that is permitted.

original: Bhamaro nāma puppharasapivanagahaṇavasena caraṇako madhukarādiko bhamaro. So puppharasaṃ
analyzed: bhamaraḥ nāma puppha rasa pivana gahaṇa vasena caraṇakaḥ madhukara ādikaḥ bhamaraḥ saḥ puppha rasam
translated: A bee is a honey-maker, etc., that goes about gathering the juice of flowers.

original: gaṇhanto mandavego hutvā pupphañca vaṇṇañca gandhañca avināsetvā yāvadatthaṃ puppharasaṃ
analyzed: gaṇhantaḥ manda vegaḥ hutvā puppham ca vaṇṇam ca gandham ca a vināsetvā yāvadattham puppha rasam
translated: When it gathers the juice of a flower, it does so slowly, without destroying the flower’s colour and scent, and it takes as much as it needs.

original: pivitvā madhukaraṇatthāya ca puppharasaṃ gahetvā madhukaraṇaṭṭhānaṃ vanasaṇḍaṃ paleti.
analyzed: pivitvā madhukaraṇa atthāya ca puppha rasam gahetvā madhukaraṇa ṭhānam vana saṇḍam paleti
translated: and having drunk it, he goes to the forest to make honey, taking the flower juice for the purpose.

original: Pupphavaṇṇagandhā pākatikāva honti. Evameva piṇḍāya gāmaṃ pavisanto muni pasādajanakaṃ
analyzed: puppha vaṇṇa gandhāḥ pākatikāḥ ava honti evam eva piṇḍāya gāmam pavisantaḥ muni pasāda janakam
translated: The colour and smell of the flowers are just as they were before. So too, the sage, when he enters the village for alms, should generate the confidence of those who are doubtful,

original: ālokanavilokanagamanatiṭṭhanādikaṃ janetvā pītisomanassasahitaṃ pasādaṃ janetvā saddhādeyyaṃ
analyzed: ālokana vilokana gamana tiṭṭhana ādikam janetvā pīti somanassa sahitam pasādam janetvā saddhā ādeyyam
translated: and he should generate confidence in those who have no confidence, and he should confirm the confidence of those who have confidence, by his way of looking at, looking away from, walking, standing, etc.,🔽and he should receive almsfood given in faith, just enough to sustain himself,

original: piṇḍapātaṃ yāpanamattaṃ paṭiggahetvā gāmato nikkhamitvā udakaphāsukaṭṭhāne vane bhesajjaṃ
analyzed: piṇḍapātam yāpana mattam paṭiggahetvā gāmataḥ nikkhamitvā udaka phāsuka ṭṭhāne vane bhesajjam
translated: and after leaving the village he should enter the forest and, as if anointing himself with the medicine of the forest,

original: limpanto viya, kantāre puttamaṃsaṃ khādanto viya, piṇḍapātaṃ paccavekkhitvā paribhuñjitvā
analyzed: limpantaḥ viya kantāre putta maṃsam khādantaḥ viya piṇḍapātam paccavekkhitvā paribhuñjitvā
translated: as if eating the flesh of his own son in a desert, he should review the almsfood and eat it.

original: bhamaro vane madhuṃ karoti viya, kammaṭṭhānānurūpaṃ vanasaṇḍaṃ pavisitvā jhānamaggaphalanibbattanatthāya
analyzed: bhamaraḥ vane madhum karoti viya kammaṭṭhāna anurūpam vana saṇḍam pavisitvā jhāna magga phala nibbattana tthāya
translated: Then, as if a bee were to make honey in the forest, he should enter the forest and, in order to produce jhāna, path, and fruit,

original: samaṇadhammakaraṇatthāya gāme care careyyāti adhippāyo veditabbo.🔽“Tīṇimāni, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ karaṇīyāni…pe… imāni kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ
analyzed: samaṇa dhamma karaṇa tthāya gāme care careyya ati adhippāyaḥ veditabbaḥ 🔽tīṇi imāni bhikkhave bhikkhūnam karaṇīyāni pe imāni kho bhikkhave bhikkhūnam
translated: in order to do the ascetic’s duties, he should go and wander in the village from time to time. This is the meaning here.

original: tīṇi karaṇīyānī”ti idaṃ suttaṃ bhagavatā anuññāte ācāre atthe vācakañāpakabhāvena
analyzed: tīṇi karaṇīyāni iti idam suttam bhagavatā anuññāte ācāre atthe vācaka ñāpaka bhāvena
translated: The Thread called “The Three Things to be Done” is called “permitted” because it occurs as a statement and an intimation of the meaning of the permitted conduct permitted by the Blessed One.

original: pavattanato anuññātaṃ nāma. Tasmiṃ sutte yo bhikkhu sīlaṃ pāti rakkhati, iti rakkhaṇato🔽so bhikkhu pāti nāma. Yaṃ sīlaṃ taṃ pātiṃ bhikkhuṃ apāyādidukkhato moceti, iti mocanato
analyzed: pavattanato anuññātam nāma tasmim sutte yaḥ bhikkhu sīlam pāti rakkhati iti rakkhaṇato  so bhikkhu pāti nāma yam sīlam tam pātim bhikkhum apāya ādi dukkhataḥ moceti iti mocanato
translated: In that Thread, the bhikkhu who keeps and guards virtue is called “a keeper”🔽because of his keeping. The virtue that is that virtue delivers the bhikkhu who is a keeper of it from the suffering of the states of loss, etc.,

original: taṃ sīlaṃ pātimokkhaṃ nāma. Yena sīlena bhikkhu saṃvaritabbacakkhundriyādikaṃ saṃvarati,
analyzed: tam sīlam pātimokkham nāma yena sīlena bhikkhu saṃvaritabba cakkhu indriya ādikam saṃvarati
translated: and so it is called “a deliverance” . The virtue by means of which a bhikkhu guards the eye faculty, etc.,

original: iti saṃvaraṇakaraṇato taṃ sīlaṃ saṃvaraṃ nāma, pātimokkhaṃ eva saṃvaraṃ pātimokkhasaṃvaraṃ,🔽pātimokkhasaṃvarena saṃvuto samannāgato hutvā saṃvuṇanato catuiriyāpathesu cārako
analyzed: iti saṃvaraṇa karaṇataḥ tam sīlam saṃvaram nāma pātimokkham eva saṃvaram pātimokkha saṃvaram  pātimokkha saṃvarena saṃvutaḥ samannāgataḥ hutvā saṃvuṇanataḥ catu iriyāpathesu cārako
translated: and so it is called “a restraint” . The virtue that is the restraint is the restraint by the Pātimokkha.🔽Being restrained by the restraint of the Pātimokkha, he is called “restrained by the restraint of the Pātimokkha” because of his being restrained by his refraining from transgression in the four modes of deportment.

original: hoti, iti saṃvuṇanato bhikkhu pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto nāma. Viharati catuiriyāpathe
analyzed: hoti iti saṃvuṇanataḥ bhikkhu pātimokkha saṃvara saṃvutaḥ nāma viharati catu iriyāpathe
translated: He lives, he conducts himself, in the four modes of deportment.

original: pavatteti. Vārittacāraṃ vajjetvā cārittasīlaṃ ādāya caraṇaṃ ācāro, agocare vajjetvā
analyzed: pavattā iti vāritta cāram vajjetvā cāritta sīlam ādāya caraṇam ācāraḥ agocare vajjetvā
translated: Conduct is the conduct that is virtue, which is undertaken by avoiding what is to be avoided in the case of conduct, and

original: gocare caraṇaṃ gocaroti. Attho vuccamāno ativitthāro bhavissati, tasmā kiñcimattaṃ
analyzed: gocare caraṇam gocaraḥ ti atthaḥ vuccamānaḥ ati vitthāraḥ bhavissati tasmā kiñcimattam
translated: The meaning of the word “resort” is “going to a resort.” But if we were to explain the meaning, it would be too much. Therefore,

original: kathetvā sāsanapaṭṭhānasuttabhāvaṃ kathessāma.🔽“Ettakameva suttaṃ ‘anuññāta’nti niddhāritabba”nti vattabbattā “dasayime, bhikkhave,
analyzed: kathetvā sāsana paṭṭhāna sutta bhāvam kathessāma  ettakam eva suttam anuññātanti niddhāritabbanti vattabbattā dasa yime bhikkhave
translated: having explained a little, we shall show how it is a sutta of the Dispensation.

original: dhammā pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Idaṃ “dasā”tiādikaṃ suttampi🔽anuññāte dasavidhe paccavekkhitabbe dhamme vācakañāpakabhāvena pavattanato anuññātaṃ
analyzed: dhammā pabbajitena abhiṇham paccavekkhitabbā atiādi vuttaṃ idam dasa ati ādikam suttam pi  anuññāte dasavidhe paccavekkhitabbe dhamme vācaka ñāpaka bhāvena pavattanataḥ anuññātam
translated: “This sutta should be determined as ‘permitted’ only to this extent”: because it is said, “Monks, these ten things should be often reflected upon by one gone forth.” This sutta beginning with “ten” is also🔽called “permitted” because it occurs as a declarer and announcer of the ten things to be reflected upon that are permitted. “These three things should be done by one gone forth …”: this sutta is also called

original: nāma. “Tīṇimāni…pe… karaṇīyānī”ti idaṃ suttampi anuññāte tividhe sucarite vācakañāpakabhāvena🔽pavattanato anuññātaṃ nāma.
analyzed: nāma karaṇīyāni iti idam suttam pi anuññāte tividhe su carite vācaka ñāpaka bhāvena  pavattanataḥ anuññātam nāma
translated: “permitted” because it occurs as a declarer and announcer of the three kinds of good conduct that are permitted.

original: Nānāvidhaṃ anuññātaṃ suttaṃ ācariyena niddhāritaṃ, amhehi ca ñātaṃ, “katamaṃ suttaṃ paṭikkhitta”nti pucchitabbattā “tattha katamaṃ paṭikkhitta”ntiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: nānāvidham anuññātam suttam ācariyena niddhāritam amhehi ca ñātam katamam suttam paṭikkhittanti pucchitabbattā tattha katamam paṭikkhittantiādi vuttaṃ
translated: The teacher has determined the sutta that is permitted in various ways, and we have understood it. Because it is necessary to ask, “Which sutta is prohibited?” it is said, “Herein, which is prohibited?”

original: “Natthi puttasamaṃ pemaṃ, natthi gosamitaṃ dhanaṃ;
analyzed: natthi putta samam pemam natthi go samitam dhanam
translated: “There is no love like love for a child, there is no wealth like cattle and corn,

original: Natthi sūriyasamā ābhā, samuddaparamā sarā”ti. –
analyzed: natthi sūriya samā ābhā samudda paramā sarāti
translated: There is no light like the light of the sun, there is no ocean like the ocean.”

original: Idaṃ devaputtavacanaṃ paṭikkhipanto bhagavā –
analyzed: idam devaputta vacanam paṭikkhipantaḥ bhagavā
translated: The Blessed One, in rejecting this statement of the divine prince,

original: “Natthi attasamaṃ pemaṃ, natthi dhaññasamaṃ dhanaṃ;
analyzed: natthi atta samam pemam natthi dhañña samam dhanam
translated: “There is no love like love for self, there is no wealth like grain,

original: Natthi paññāsamā ābhā, vuṭṭhi ve paramā sarā”ti. –
analyzed: natthi paññāsamā ābhā vuṭṭhi ve paramā sarāti
translated: There is no light like the light of wisdom, there is no ocean like the rain.”

original: Gāthaṃ āha. Ettha etasmiṃ gāthādvaye yaṃ “natthi puttasamaṃ pema”ntiādikaṃ purimakaṃ
analyzed: gātham āha ettha etasmim gāthā dvaye yam natthi putta samam pemanti ādikam purimakam
translated: He spoke this stanza. Herein, in this pair of stanzas, the first,🔽“There is no love like love for a child,” etc.,

original: hoti. Idaṃ “natthi puttasamaṃ pema”ntiādikaṃ devaputtavacanaṃ bhagavatā paṭikkhittattā,
analyzed: hoti idam natthi putta samam deva putta vacanam bhagavatā
translated: is a statement of the divine prince. Since that is rejected by the Blessed One,

original: paṭikkhitte atthe pavattanato ca paṭikkhittaṃ nāma.
analyzed: paṭikkhitte atthe pavattanato ca paṭikkhittam nāma
translated: it is called “rejected” because it is rejected and because it occurs in a rejected context.

original: Dubbhikkhakāle vā kantāre vā mātāpitaro puttadhītaro ghātetvāpi attānameva posenti,
analyzed: dubbhikkha kāle vā kantāre vā mātā pitaro putta dhītaraḥ ghātetvā api attānam eva posenti
translated: For in a famine or in a desert people even kill their parents and children in order to keep themselves alive,

original: tasmā “natthi attasamaṃ pema”nti vuttaṃ. Dubbhikkhakālādīsu hiraññasuvaṇṇasārādīni,
analyzed: tasmā natthi atta samam peman ti vuttam dubbhikkha kāla ādīsu hirañña suvaṇṇa sāra ādīni
translated: so it is said “There is no love like love for self.” In a famine, etc., gold, silver, gems,

original: gomahiṃsādīnipi dhaññagahaṇatthāya dhaññassāmikānaṃ datvā dhaññameva gaṇhanti, tasmā
analyzed: gomahiṃsa ādīni pi dhañña gahaṇa atthāya dhañña sāmikānam da tvā dhaññam eva gaṇhanti tasmā
translated: and they give away cows, buffaloes, etc., for the sake of the grain, taking the grain in exchange.🔽Therefore it was said: “There is no wealth equal to grain” .

original: “natthi dhaññasamaṃ dhana”nti vuttaṃ. Sūriyādīnaṃ ābhā paccuppannatamaṃ ekadesaṃva
analyzed: natthi dhañña samam dhanan ti vuttam sūriya ādīnam ābhā paccuppannatamam eka desam va
translated: The light of the sun, etc., dispels only a part of the darkness that is present,

original: vinodeti, paññā pana dasasahassilokadhātumpi ekapajjotaṃ ekobhāsaṃ kātuṃ samatthā,
analyzed: vinodeti paññā pana dasa sahassi lokadhātum pi eka pajjotam eka ubhāsam kātum samatthā
translated: but wisdom is able to make the ten-thousand world-element one bright shining flame,

original: atītānāgatapaccuppannadhammakoṭṭhāsesupi paṭicchādakaṃ kilesatamampi vidhamati, tasmā🔽“natthi paññāsamā ābhā”ti vuttaṃ. Samuddo bhūmiyā ca ekadeseyeva tiṭṭhati, so ca🔽deve avuṭṭhe sati khayanasabhāvo bhaveyya, vuṭṭhi pana koṭisatasahassacakkavāḷesupi
analyzed: atīta anāgata paccuppanna dhamma koṭṭhāsesu pi paṭicchādakam kilesatamam api vidhamati tasmā  natthi paññāsamā ābhāti vuttam samuddaḥ bhūmiyā ca eka dese iva tiṭṭhati so ca  deve a vuṭṭhe sati khayana sabhāvaḥ bhaveyya pana koṭi sata sahassa cakkavāḷesu pi
translated: and it dispels the darkness of defilements that conceals the categories of states that are past, future, and present. Therefore it was said: “There is no light equal to wisdom” .

original: yāva ābhassarā brahmalokāpi pūrā bhavati, tasmā “vuṭṭhi ve paramāsarā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: yāva ābhassarā brahma lokā api pūrā bhavati tasmā vuttaṃ
translated: The ocean stands on one place only, on the earth, and if the gods do not rain, it will dry up. But the rain that falls on the ten-thousand world-element fills the world-element of a hundred thousand, a million, a hundred thousand million, and an incalculable world-element. Therefore it was said: “The rain is the best of waters” .

original: “Idameva paṭikkhittaṃ niddhāritabba”nti vattabbattā “tīṇimāni bhikkhave”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: idam eva paṭikkhittam niddhāritabban ti vattabbattā tīṇi imāni bhikkhave tiādi vuttam
translated: “This is the one to be rejected and set aside” .

original: Idaṃ “tīṇimānī”tiādikaṃ suttampi paṭikkhitte duccarite vācakañāpakabhāvena pavattanato🔽paṭikkhittaṃ nāma. (17)
analyzed: idam tīṇimāni iti ādikam suttam pi paṭikkhitte duccarite vācaka ñāpaka bhāvena pavattanato  paṭikkhittam nāma
translated: This sutta beginning with the words “There are these three” is called “rejected” because it occurs in the sense of rejecting, in the sense of showing what is to be rejected.

original: 124. Nānāvidhaṃ paṭikkhittaṃ ācariyena niddhāritaṃ, amhehi ca ñātaṃ, “katamaṃ anuññātañca paṭikkhittañcā”ti pucchitabbattā “tattha katamaṃ anuññātañcā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: nānāvidham paṭikkhittam ācariyena niddhāritam amhehi ca ñātam katamam anuññātam ca paṭikkhittam ca ati pucchitabbattā tattha katamam anuññātam ca atiādi vuttaṃ
translated: . The Teacher has pointed out various kinds of rejected things, and we have understood them. Now, in order to ask, “What are the permitted and the rejected things?” the question is asked, “What are the permitted things?”

original: Bhūripaññabhūripaññavanta gotama, taṃ bhūripaññaṃ gotamaṃ ahaṃ pucchāmi. Idha loke🔽anekā yā janatā bhītā, sā janatā kiṃsu katamā bhave. Yo ca maggo anekāyatano iti
analyzed: bhūripañña bhūripaññavanta gotama tam bhūripaññam gotamam aham pucchāmi idha loke  anekā yā janatā bhītā sā janatā kiṃsu katamā bhave yaḥ ca maggo aneka āyatano iti
translated: O Gotama, you are endowed with great wisdom, I ask you, O Gotama, who are endowed with great wisdom. In this world🔽there are many people who are frightened. What kind of people are they? And the path

original: pavutto, so ca maggo kiṃsu katamo bhave. Kismiṃ dhamme ṭhito jano paralokaṃ na bhāye
analyzed: pavuttaḥ saḥ ca maggo kiṃsu katamaḥ bhave kismin dhamme ṭhitaḥ janaḥ para lokam na bhāye
translated: which is said to be of many aspects, what kind of path is that? In what state of things do people stand

original: na bhāyeyyāti pucchatīti yojanā.
analyzed: na pucchati iti yojanā
translated: that they do not fear the other world? That is the meaning of the question.

original: Devaputta yo jano sammāvācañca paṇidhāya, sammāmanañca paṇidhāya, kāyena pāpāni akubbamāno
analyzed: deva putta yaḥ janaḥ sammā vācam ca paṇidhāya sammā manam ca paṇidhāya kāyena pāpāni a kubbamānaḥ
translated: O divine one, people who have set up right speech and right resolve, and who do not commit evil deeds with the body,

original: ca bhave, ayaṃ eko. Bahvannapānaṃ gharaṃ āvasanto ca bhave, ayaṃ eko. Saddho saddhāsampanno
analyzed: ca bhave ayam ekaḥ bahu anna pānam gharam ca bhave ayam ekaḥ saddho saddhā sampanno
translated: and he has faith, is endowed with faith,🔽and he is gentle, is gentle through the softness of mind,

original: cittamudubhāvena mudu ca bhave, ayaṃ eko. Vadaññū yācakānaṃ yācanavasena vuttavacanaññū
analyzed: citta mudu bhāvena mudu ca bhave ayam ekaḥ vadaññū yācakānam yācana vasena vutta vacanaññū
translated: and he is a giver, is one who gives to those who ask,🔽and he is a sharer, is one who shares after having given,

original: hutvā saṃvibhāgī ca bhave, ayaṃ eko. Iti etesu catūsu dhammesu ṭhito jano dhammesu
analyzed: hutvā saṃvibhāgī ca bhave ayam ekaḥ iti etesu catūsu dhammesu ṭhitaḥ janaḥ dhammesu
translated: thus he who stands firm in these four things,

original: ṭhito hutvā paralokaṃ na bhāye na bhāyeyyāti yojanā.
analyzed: ṭhitaḥ hutvā para lokam na bhāye na bhāyeyya iti yojanā
translated: having stood firm in the Dhamma, he should not fear the other world, is the construction.

original: “Tasmiṃ sutte katamaṃ anuññātaṃ, katamaṃ paṭikkhittaṃ nāmā”ti pucchitabbattā “tattha
analyzed: tasmim sutte katamam anuññātam katamam paṭikkhittam nāma ati pucchitabbattā tattha
translated: “What is allowed and what is prohibited in this Thread?” because of the question, “Herein,

original: yaṃ āhā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha tasmiṃ “kiṃsūdhā”tiādipañhāya vissajjane “vācaṃ manañcā”tiādivacane
analyzed: yam āha atiādi vuttam tattha tasmim kiṃsūdha ati ādi pañhāya vissajjane vācam manaṃca ati ādi vacane
translated: what is it?” etc. is said. Herein, in the answer to the question “What is the nutriment for the arising of consciousness?” etc. the words “Speech and mind” etc.

original: “vācaṃ manañca paṇidhāya sammā”ti yaṃ vacanaṃ bhagavā āha, idaṃ “vācaṃ…pe… sammā”ti
analyzed: vācam manaḥ ca paṇidhāya yam vacanam bhagavān āha idam vācaṃpe
translated: are spoken by the Blessed One. This speech, “Speech and mind, having resolved rightly” etc.,

original: vacanaṃ anuññāte vacanīyādike atthe vācakañāpakabhāvena pavattanato anuññātaṃ nāma.
analyzed: vacanam anuññāte vacanīya ādike atthe vācaka ñāpaka bhāvena pavattanataḥ anuññātam nāma
translated: is called “allowed” because it occurs as a speaker and a notifier in the sense of what should be spoken, etc., that is allowed.

original: “Kāyena pāpāni akubbamāno”ti yaṃ vacanaṃ āha, idaṃ “kāyena …pe… māno”ti vacanaṃ pāpakubbena🔽paṭikkhitte vuttanayena pavattanato paṭikkhittaṃ nāma. “Bahvanna…pe… na bhāye”ti
analyzed: kāyena pāpāni a kubbamānaḥ ti yam vacanam āha idam kāyena vacanam pāpa kubbena  paṭikkhitte vutta nayena pavattanataḥ paṭikkhittam nāma bahvannape na bhāyeti
translated: The words “Not doing evil deeds by body” are a prohibition, since they are stated in the way beginning “Not doing evil by body” .

original: yaṃ vacanaṃ āha, idaṃ “bahvanna…pe… na bhāye”ti vacanaṃ vuttanayena anuññātaṃ nāma.
analyzed: yam vacanam āha idam bahu anna pe na bhāya iti vacanam vutta nayena anuññātam nāma
translated: The words “I fear not” are a permission, since they are stated in the way beginning “I fear not” .

original: Idaṃ “vāca”ntiādikaṃ vacanaṃ vuttanayadvayena anuññātañca paṭikkhittañca hoti.
analyzed: idam vācā iti ādikam vacanam vutta naya dvayena anuññātam ca paṭikkhittam ca hoti
translated: The words “By speech” are both a permission and a prohibition, since they are stated in both ways.🔽The words “By not doing any evil” and so on are of the same meaning as before.

original: “Sabbapāpassa akaraṇa”ntiādiko vuttatthova. “Tasmiṃ sabbapāpassātiādike katamaṃ anuññātaṃ, katamaṃ paṭikkhitta”nti vattabbabhāvato “tattha ya”ntiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: sabba pāpassa akaraṇa nti ādikaḥ vutta tthaḥ uva tasmin sabba pāpassa ati ādike katamam anuññātam katamam paṭikkhittan ti vattabba bhāvato tattha yat tiādi vuttam
translated: “Herein, what is permitted and what is prohibited?” is said because it should be asked: “What is permitted and what is prohibited in the words ‘By not doing any evil’ and so on?”

original: Devānaminda, ahaṃ kāyasamācārampi duvidhena vadāmi – sevitabbaṃ anavajjaṃ kāyasamācārampi
analyzed: devānaminda aham kāya samācāram pi duvidhena vadāmi sevitabbam anavajjam kāya samācāram pi
translated: “O chief of the gods, I declare that bodily conduct is twofold: there is bodily conduct that should be pursued, which is blameless;

original: vadāmi, asevitabbaṃ sāvajjaṃ kāyasamācārampi ahaṃ vadāmi. Vacīsamācārādīsupi vuttanayānusārena yojanā kātabbā.
analyzed: vadāmi asevitabbam sāvajjam kāya samācāram pi aham vadāmi vacī samācāra ādīsu pi vutta naya anusārena yojanā kātabbā
translated: and there is bodily conduct that should not be pursued, which is blamable. The same method of explanation is to be applied to verbal conduct and so on.

original: “Kiñca vaḍḍhanahāyanaṃ āgamma kāyasamācārādikaṃ sevitabbāsevitabbabhedena vutta”nti
analyzed: kiñca vaḍḍhana hāyanam āgamma kāya samācāra ādikam sevitabba asevitabba bhedena vuttan ti
translated: “What is it that, by reason of the increase of unprofitable things and the decrease of profitable things, is to be avoided, and what is it that, by reason of the increase of profitable things and the decrease of unprofitable things, is to be cultivated?”

original: vattabbabhāvato “kiñcetaṃ paṭiccā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Akusaladhammavaḍḍhanaṃ, kusaladhammahāyanañca
analyzed: vattabba bhāvataḥ kiñca itam paṭicca atiādi vuttam akusala dhamma vaḍḍhanam kusala dhamma hāyanam ca
translated: Because it is necessary to say this, “What, by reason of what, is it to be avoided?” and so on is said.

original: paṭicca kāyasamācārādayo na sevitabbā, kusaladhammavaḍḍhanaṃ, akusaladhammahāyanañca
analyzed: paṭicca kāya samācāra ādayaḥ na sevitabbā kusala dhamma vaḍḍhanam akusala dhamma hāyanam ca
translated: By reason of the increase of unprofitable things and the decrease of profitable things, bodily conduct, etc., are to be avoided. By reason of the increase of profitable things and the decrease of unprofitable things,

original: paṭicca kāyasamācārādayo sevitabbāti sallakkhetabbā. (18)
analyzed: paṭicca kāya samācāra ādayaḥ sevitabbā ati sallakkhetabbā
translated: bodily conduct, etc., are to be cultivated. This is how they are to be discerned.

original: 125. Nānāvidhaṃ anuññātañca paṭikkhittañca ācariyena niddhāritaṃ, amhehi ca ñātaṃ,🔽“katamo suttaviseso thavo”ti pucchitabbattā tathā pucchitvā ayaṃ suttaviseso thavo🔽nāmāti viññāpetuṃ “tattha katamo thavo”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha tatthāti tesu aṭṭhavīsatividhesu
analyzed: nānāvidham anuññātam ca paṭikkhittam ca ācariyena niddhāritam amhehi ca ñātam  katamaḥ sutta visesaḥ thavaḥ ti pucchitabba ttā tathā pucchitvā ayam sutta visesaḥ thavaḥ  nāma ati viññāpetum tattha katamo thavaḥ tiādi vuttam tattha tattha ati tesu aṭṭhavīsatividhesu
translated: The Teacher has pointed out and we have understood the various things that are permitted and prohibited.🔽“What is the difference in the Threads?”—because it is necessary to ask this, it is asked thus. In order to make known that this is the difference in the Threads, “What is the difference in the Threads?” and so on is said.

original: lokiyādīsu sāsanapaṭṭhānasuttesu katamo suttaviseso thavo nāmāti pucchati.
analyzed: lokiya ādīsu sāsana paṭṭhāna suttesu katamaḥ sutta visesaḥ thavaḥ nāma ati pucchati
translated: Herein, in those twenty-eight kinds of Threads beginning with the mundane and supramundane is asked “What is the difference in the Threads?”

original: Maggānaṃ jaṅghamaggadiṭṭhimaggādīnaṃ aṭṭhaṅgiko sammādiṭṭhimaggaṅgādiaṭṭhaṅgiko maggo🔽seṭṭho uttamo. Saccānaṃ vacīsaccakhattiyādisammutisaccaparamatthasaccānaṃ caturo
analyzed: maggānam jaṅgha magga diṭṭhi magga ādīnam aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ sammādiṭṭhi maggaṅga ādi aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo  seṭṭhaḥ uttamaḥ saccānam vacī sacca khattiya ādi sammuti sacca paramattha saccānam caturo
translated: the path of the eight factors is the best, the highest.

original: dukkhasamudayanirodhanirodhagāminipaṭipadāvasena caturo ariyasaccā padā seṭṭhā uttamā.
analyzed: caturo ariya saccā seṭṭhā uttamā
translated: Of truths, such as the truth of the word, the truth of the khattiya, etc., and the truth of convention, and the truth of the ultimate , the four noble truths, which are the four truths of suffering, of the origin of suffering, of the cessation of suffering, and of the way leading to the cessation of suffering, are the best, the highest.

original: Dhammānaṃ sabbasaṅkhatasappaccayadhammānaṃ virāgo asaṅkhatanibbānasaṅkhāto virāgo
analyzed: dhammānam sabba saṅkhata sappaccaya dhammānam virāgaḥ asaṅkhata nibbāna saṅkhātaḥ virāgaḥ
translated: Of dhammas, such as all conditioned dhammas and dhammas with conditions, and the dhammas of fading away, which are the dhammas of fading away called the unconditioned and Nibbāna,🔽the dhamma of fading away is the best, the highest.

original: dhammo seṭṭho uttamo. Dvipadānaṃ sabbadevamanussādīnaṃ dvipadānaṃ cakkhumā pañcavidhacakkhumā🔽bhagavā seṭṭho uttamoti yojanā. Ayaṃ “maggānaṭṭhaṅgiko”tiādisuttaviseso thave atthe
analyzed: dhammo seṭṭhaḥ uttamaḥ dvipadānam sabba deva manussa ādīnam dvipadānam cakkhumā pañcavidha cakkhumā  bhagavā seṭṭhaḥ uttamaḥ ti yojanā ayam magga anaṭṭhaṅgikaḥ iti ādi sutta viseso thave atthe
translated: Of bipeds, such as all gods, men, etc., and bipeds with eyes, the Blessed One, who has the five eyes, is the best, the highest.🔽This is the difference in the Thread. It is called “the Thread of the eight factors of the Path” and so on.

original: vācakañāpakabhāvena pavattanato thavo nāma.
analyzed: vācaka ñāpaka bhāvena pavattanataḥ thavaḥ nāma
translated: It is called “the Thread of the eight factors of the Path” and so on because it occurs as a guide to the meaning of the words.

original: “Ayameva suttaviseso thavo”ti vattabbattā “tīṇimāni bhikkhave”tiādi vuttaṃ. Apadā
analyzed: ayam eva sutta visesaḥ thavaḥ ti vattabbattā tīṇi imāni bhikkhave tiādi vuttam apadā
translated: “This Thread-difference is the Thread” should be said. That is why “There are these three, bhikkhus” is said.

original: ahimacchādayo vā, dvipadā manussasakuṇapakkhijātikādayo vā, catuppadā hatthiassagomahiṃsādayo
analyzed: ahi maccha ādayaḥ vā dvipadāḥ manussa sakuṇa pakkhi jātika ādayaḥ vā catuppadāḥ hatthi assa go mahiṃsa ādayaḥ
translated: or the four-footed, such as elephants, horses, oxen, buffaloes, etc.,🔽or the many-footed, such as centipedes, etc.,

original: vā, bahuppadā satapadiādayo vā, rūpino kāmarūpasattā vā, arūpino arūpasattā vā, saññino🔽sattaviññāṇaṭṭhitisattā vā, asaññino asaññasattā vā, nevasaññīnāsaññino bhavagge
analyzed: vā bahuppadā satapadi ādayaḥ vā rūpino kāma rūpa sattāḥ vā arūpino arūpa sattāḥ vā saññino  satta viññāṇa ṭṭhiti sattāḥ vā asaññinaḥ asañña sattāḥ vā nevasaññīna asaññinaḥ bhavagge
translated: or the formless, such as formless beings,🔽or the percipient, such as beings in the seven heavenly worlds of the sensuous realm,🔽or the non-percipient, such as non-percipient beings,🔽or the neither-percipient-nor-non-percipient, such as beings reborn in the plane of nothingness,

original: nibbattasattā vā yāvatā yattakā sattā saṃvijjanti, tesaṃ tattakānaṃ apadādīnaṃ sattānaṃ
analyzed: nibbatta sattāḥ vā yāvatā yattakā sattā saṃvijjanti tesam tattakānam a pada ādīnam sattānam
translated: as many as there are beings, as many as there are kinds of beings,

original: yadidaṃ yo ayaṃ arahaṃ sammāsambuddho tathāgato uppanno, so ayaṃ arahaṃ sammāsambuddho
analyzed: yat idam yaḥ ayam araham sammāsambuddhaḥ tathāgataḥ uppannaḥ saḥ ayam araham sammāsambuddhaḥ
translated: this Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened,

original: tathāgato aggaṃ aggoti akkhāyati, seṭṭhaṃ seṭṭhoti akkhāyati, pavaraṃ pavaroti akkhāyati, ayaṃ paṭhamo aggo.
analyzed: tathāgataḥ aggam aggo ti akkhāyati seṭṭham seṭṭho ti akkhāyati pavaram pavaro ti akkhāyati ayam paṭhamaḥ aggaḥ
translated: is declared to be the foremost of all beings, the best of all beings, the best seen of all beings. This is the first foremost thing.🔽Or of formed dhammas, which have conditions and inherent nature,

original: Saṅkhatānaṃ dhammānaṃ vā sappaccayasabhāvānaṃ vā, asaṅkhatānaṃ paccayehi asaṅkharitānaṃ
analyzed: saṅkhatānam dhammānam vā sappaccaya sabhāvānam vā asaṅkhatānam paccayehi a saṅkharitānam
translated: or of unformed dhammas, which are not formed by conditions,

original: paṇṇattimattabhūtānaṃ dhammānaṃ vā yāvatā yattakā paṇṇattī voharīyanti, tattakehi🔽paṇṇattīhi paññapetabbānaṃ tesaṃ saṅkhatāsaṅkhatānaṃ dhammānaṃ yadidaṃ yo ayaṃ madanimmadano…pe…🔽yo ayaṃ nirodho, yaṃ idaṃ nibbānamaggaphalānamālambaṇaṃ bhavati, so ayaṃ madanimmadanādiko
analyzed: paṇṇatti matta bhūtānam dhammānam vā yāvatā yattakā paṇṇattī voharīyanti tattakehi  paṇṇattīhi paññapetabbānam tesam saṅkhata asaṅkhatānam dhammānam yat idam yaḥ ayam mada nimmadana upe  yaḥ ayam nirodhaḥ yam idam nibbāna magga phalānam ālambaṇam bhavati saḥ ayam mada nimmadana ādikaḥ
translated: for as many as are the terms for the ideas that are describable by those terms, whether formed or unformed,🔽this idea, namely, the stilling of the mad, the quelling of the fever, …

original: dhammo aggaṃ aggoti akkhāyati…pe… akkhāyati, ayaṃ dutiyo aggo.🔽Saṅghānaṃ yāvatā paṇṇatti, gaṇānaṃ yāvatā paṇṇatti, mahājanasannipātānaṃ yāvatā paṇṇatti
analyzed: dhammaḥ aggam aggo ti akkhāyati pe akkhāyati ayam dutiyaḥ aggaḥ  saṅghānam yāvatā paṇṇatti gaṇānam yāvatā paṇṇatti mahā jana sannipātānam yāvatā paṇṇatti
translated: the cessation, the stilling of the five lower fetters, which is the object of the path and fruit, is called the foremost, the best, … is called the foremost, the best.🔽or as many as are the terms for the groups, for the assemblies, for the great gatherings,

original: voharīyanti, tattakehi paṇṇattīhi paññapetabbānaṃ tesaṃ saṅghagaṇādīnaṃ yāni imāni
analyzed: voharīyanti tattakehi paṇṇattīhi paññapetabbānam tesam saṅgha gaṇa ādīnam yāni imāni
translated: for as many as are the terms for the groups, for the assemblies, for the great gatherings, that are describable by those terms,🔽these four types of persons, these pairs of men, these eight types of person, …

original: cattāri puggalāni purisayugāni, ye ime aṭṭha purisapuggalā…pe… lokassa yaṃ idaṃ puññakkhettaṃ🔽saṃvijjati, so ayaṃ catupurisayugādiko tathāgatasāvakasaṅgho aggaṃ aggoti akkhāyati…pe…
analyzed: cattāri puggalāni purisa yugāni ye ime aṭṭha lokassa yat idam puññakkhettam 🔽saṃvijjati saḥ ayam catu purisa yuga ādikaḥ tathāgata sāvaka saṅgho aggam aggo ti akkhāyati pe
translated: this field of merit for the world,🔽this is called the foremost, the best.

original: akkhāyati, ayaṃ tatiyo aggo. Imāni tīṇi tathāgatanibbānaariyasaṅgharatanāni aggāni bhavanti.🔽Sabbalokuttaro apadādisabbasattalokato uttaro satthā ca, kusalapakkhato kusalaanavajjapakkhabhāvato🔽uttaro dhammo ca, narasīhassa satthuno gaṇo ca iti tīṇi satthudhammagaṇaratanāni🔽aggāni, tāni tīṇi satthudhammagaṇaratanāni visissare guṇavasena visissanti.
analyzed: akkhāyati ayam tatiyaḥ aggaḥ imāni tīṇi tathāgata nibbāna ariya saṅgha ratanāni aggāni bhavanti  sabba lokuttaraḥ a pada ādi sabba satta lokataḥ uttaraḥ satthā ca kusala pakkhataḥ kusala anavajja pakkha bhāvato  uttaraḥ dhammo ca narasīhassa satthunaḥ gaṇo ca iti tīṇi satthu dhamma gaṇa ratanāni  aggāni tāni tīṇi satthu dhamma gaṇa ratanāni visissare guṇa vasena
translated: This is the third best. These are the three best things, the Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One

original: Samaṇapadumasañcayo sare ruhamānaṃ padumaṃ sobhanaṃ iva sāsane sobhanasamaṇapadumasamūho🔽gaṇo ca, dhammavaro ca, vidūnaṃ sakkato naravaradamako naravarānaṃ brahmadevamanussarājarājamahāmaccādīnaṃ🔽damako anudamako cakkhumā sambuddho ca iti tīṇi gaṇadhammabuddharatanāni lokassa uttari bhavanti.
analyzed: samaṇa paduma sañcayaḥ sare padumam sobhanam iva sāsane sobhana samaṇa paduma samūhaḥ 🔽gaṇo ca dhammavaro ca brahma deva manussa rāja rāja mahā macca ādīnam 🔽damakaḥ anudamakaḥ cakkhumā sambuddhaḥ ca iti tīṇi gaṇa dhamma buddha ratanāni lokassa uttari bhavanti
translated: This is the third best. These are the three best things, the Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One’s Realised One

original: Appaṭisamo satthā ca, nirupadāho niggataupadāho, sabbo dhammo ca ariyo gaṇavaro ca🔽iti yāni tīṇi buddhadhammagaṇaratanāni aggāni, tāni tīṇi…pe… nāni khalu ekaṃsena🔽visissare visissanti.🔽Saccanāmo avitathasaccadesanato saccanāmo khemo sabbābhibhū sabbe manussadevādike🔽anabhibhavamānopi guṇātirekavasena abhibhavamāno viya pavattanato sabbābhibhū jino🔽ca, saccadhammo avitathasabhāvato saccadhammo ca, tassa saccadhammassa uttari uttamo🔽añño dhammo natthi, viññūnaṃ niccaṃ pūjito pūjāraho ariyasaṅgho ca iti tīṇi lokassa
analyzed: appaṭisamaḥ satthā ca nirupadāhaḥ niggata aupadāhaḥ sabbo dhammo ca ariyaḥ gaṇa varo ca  iti yāni tīṇi buddha dhamma gaṇa ratanāni aggāni tāni nāni khalu ekaṃsena  visissare visissanti  sacca nāmaḥ avitatha sacca desanato sacca nāmaḥ khemaḥ sabba abhibhū sabbe manussa deva ādike  an abhibhavamānaḥ api guṇa atireka vasena abhibhavamānaḥ viya pavattanataḥ sabba abhibhū jinaḥ  ca sacca dhammo avitatha sabhāvato sacca dhammo ca tassa sacca dhammassa uttari uttamaḥ  aññaḥ dhammaḥ natthi viññūnam niccam pūjito pūjā raho ariya saṅgho ca iti tīṇi lokassa
translated: The Teacher, incomparable, free from grief, grief-dispelling, all of whose taints are blown away,

original: uttari uttamāni bhavanti.🔽Ekāyanapadassa vacanattho aṭṭhakathāyaṃ bahudhā vutto. Jātikhayantadassī hitānukampī
analyzed: uttari uttamāni bhavanti 🔽ekāyana padassa vacana atthaḥ aṭṭhakathāyam bahudhā vuttaḥ jāti khayanta dassī hita anukampī
