original: bhagavā ekāyanaṃ maggaṃ pajānāti. “Yaṃ ekāyanaṃ maggaṃ pajānāti, tena maggena kiṃ🔽taratī”ti vattabbabhāvato “etena maggenā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Yaṃ maggaṃ bhagavā jānāti,🔽etena maggena pubbe atītamaddhānaṃ buddhādayo ariyā oghaṃ saṃsāroghaṃ tariṃsu, anāgatamaddhānaṃ🔽tarissanti, ye cāpi buddhādayo paccuppanne uppajjanti, te cāpi buddhādayo paccuppanne
analyzed: bhagavā ekāyanam maggam pajānāti yam ekāyanam maggam pajānāti tena maggena kim  tarati iti vattabba bhāvataḥ etena maggena atiādi vuttam yam maggam bhagavā jānāti  etena maggena pubbe atīta maddhānam buddha ādayaḥ ariyāḥ ogham saṃsāra ogham tariṃsu anāgata maddhānam  tarissanti ye ca api buddha ādayaḥ paccuppanne uppajjanti te ca api buddha ādayaḥ paccuppanne
translated: The Blessed One knows the one-way path. Since it is proper to ask, “By what path does he cross over?” the answer is given, “By this path.” The path that the Blessed One knows is the path by which in the past the Noble Ones, the Buddhas, etc., crossed over the flood, the flood of the round of rebirths. In the future the Noble Ones, the Buddhas, etc., will cross over the flood by this same path. And the Noble Ones, the Buddhas, etc., who have arisen in the present are crossing over the flood by this same path.

original: taranti, visuddhipekkhā visuddhiṃ apekkhamānā sattā devamanussaseṭṭhaṃ tādisaṃ yathāvuttaguṇaṃ🔽taṃ sammāsambuddhaṃ namassanti, iti ayaṃ nānāvidhasuttavisesopi thave ratanattaye,
analyzed: taranti visuddhi pekkhāḥ visuddhim apekkhamānāḥ sattāḥ deva manussa seṭṭham tādisam yathā vutta guṇam  tam sammāsambuddham namassanti iti ayam nānāvidha sutta visesaḥ api thave
translated: The Blessed One knows the one-way path. “What does one cross over by means of the one-way path that he knows?”—because this is what should be said, it is said thus: “By means of this path.” The path that the Blessed One knows, by means of this path, in the past, in the period before this aeon, the Noble Ones, the Buddhas, etc., crossed over the flood, the flood of the round of rebirths. In the future, in the period after this aeon, they will cross over the flood by means of this path. And those Buddhas, etc., who arise in the present, the Buddhas, etc., in the present, cross over the flood. Beings who seek purity, who seek purification, pay homage to that kind of Perfect One, the Best of men and gods, who has the aforesaid special qualities. Thus this variety of suttas, too, is called “the basis of the Dispensation” because it occurs in the form of a statement and a declaration of the special qualities of the Three Jewels.🔽This is the commentary on the section on the basis of the Dispensation.

original: ratanattayaguṇe ca vācakañāpakabhāvena pavattanato thavo nāma. Iccetaṃ sāsanapaṭṭhānasuttavisesadassako🔽saṃvaṇṇanāvisesopi sāsanapaṭṭhānaṃ nāmāti veditabbo.
analyzed: ca vācaka ñāpaka bhāvena pavattanataḥ thavaḥ nāma icca etam sāsana paṭṭhāna sutta visesa dassako 🔽saṃvaṇṇanā visesaḥ api sāsana paṭṭhānam nāma ati veditabbo
translated: The special exposition of the special qualities of the Three Jewels should be understood as the basis of the Dispensation.

original: Amhākācariya tumhehi amhākācariyehi soḷasappabhedasaṃkilesabhāgiyādisāsanapaṭṭhānasuttañceva🔽aṭṭhavīsatividhaṃ lokiyādisāsanapaṭṭhānasuttañca niddhāritaṃ, amhehi ca ñātaṃ, “tesu🔽saṃkilesabhāgiyādīsu sāsanapaṭṭhānasuttavisesesu katamaṃ suttavisesaṃ katamena suttavisesena
analyzed: tumhehi amhāka cariyehi  aṭṭhavīsatividham lokiya ādi sāsana paṭṭhāna suttam ca niddhāritam amhehi ca ñātam tesu  saṃkilesabhāgiya ādīsu sāsana paṭṭhāna sutta visesesu katamam sutta visesam katamena sutta visesena
translated: Our teachers have extracted from the scriptures the suttas of the Dispensation classed as pertaining to corruption, etc., in sixteen ways,🔽and the suttas of the Dispensation classed as pertaining to the world, etc., in twenty-eight ways, and we have learnt them. Now, of these different kinds of suttas of the Dispensation classed as pertaining to corruption, etc.,

original: saṃsanditvā niddisitabba”nti vattabbattā “tattha lokiyaṃ sutta”ntiādi āraddhaṃ. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ
analyzed: saṃsanditvā niddisitabban ti vattabba ttā tattha lokiyam suttanti ādi āraddham aṭṭhakathā ayam
translated: which different kind of sutta should be interpreted by being combined with which different kind of sutta? ” So he began the answer with the words, “Herein, the sutta pertaining to the world” .

original: pana – “evaṃ duvidhampi sāsanapaṭṭhānaṃ nānāsuttapadāni udāharantena vibhajitvā idāni
analyzed: pana evam duvidham pi sāsana paṭṭhānam nānā sutta padāni udāharantena vibhajitvā idāni
translated: But in the commentary it is said, “Having thus quoted the various suttas classed as the two kinds of Dispensation, he now divides them and shows them.

original: saṃkilesabhāgiyādīhi saṃsanditvā dassetuṃ puna ‘lokiyaṃ sutta’ntiādi āraddha”nti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: saṃkilesa bhāgiya ādīhi saṃsanditvā dassetum puna lokiyam suttanti ādi āraddhanti vuttam
translated: Now, in order to show them by combining them with the suttas classed as pertaining to corruption, etc., he began again with the words, ‘The sutta pertaining to the world’ ” .

original: Tattha tatthāti tesu soḷasavidhesu saṃkilesabhāgiyādīsu sāsanapaṭṭhānasuttavisesesu
analyzed: tattha tattha ati tesu soḷasavidhesu saṃkilesabhāgiya ādīsu sāsana paṭṭhāna sutta visesesu
translated: Herein, herein, in these different kinds of suttas of the Dispensation classed as pertaining to corruption, etc., in the sixteen ways.

original: ceva aṭṭhavīsatividhesu lokiyādīsu sāsanapaṭṭhānasuttavisesesu ca akusalapakkhe pavattaṃ🔽lokiyaṃ suttaṃ saṃkilesabhāgiyasuttena samānatthabhāvena saṃsandati, kusalapakkhe
analyzed: ca iva aṭṭhavīsatividhesu lokiya ādīsu sāsana paṭṭhāna sutta visesesu ca akusala pakkhe pavattam  lokiyam suttam saṃkilesabhāgiya suttena samānattha bhāvena saṃsandati kusala pakkhe
translated: and in the twenty-eight kinds of Thread classed according to the Dispensation’s footing, etc.,🔽the mundane Thread that occurs in the unprofitable section is similar in meaning to the Thread classed as subject to defilement, so it is connected with that. The mundane Thread that occurs in the profitable section

original: pavattaṃ lokiyaṃ suttaṃ vāsanābhāgiyasuttena samānatthabhāvena saṃsandati, tasmā🔽lokiyaṃ suttaṃ ekavidhampi saṃkilesabhāgiyena ca vāsanābhāgiyena ca dvīhi suttehi
analyzed: pavattam lokiyam suttam vāsanābhāgiya suttena samāna attha bhāvena saṃsandati tasmā  lokiyam suttam ekavidham pi saṃkilesa bhāgiyena ca vāsanā bhāgiyena ca dvīhi suttehi
translated: is similar in meaning to the Thread classed as subject to ripening, so it is connected with that. So

original: niddisitabbaṃ. Dassanapakkhe pavattaṃ lokuttaraṃ suttaṃ dassanabhāgiyena samānatthabhāvena🔽saṃsandati, bhāvanāpakkhe pavattaṃ lokuttaraṃ suttaṃ bhāvanābhāgiyena samānatthabhāvena
analyzed: niddisitabbam dassana pakkhe pavattam lokuttaram suttam dassana bhāgiyena samāna attha bhāvena  saṃsandati bhāvanā pakkhe pavattam lokuttaram suttam bhāvanā bhāgiyena samāna attha bhāvena
translated: mundane Thread, though of one kind only, can be demonstrated by means of the two Threads classed as subject to defilement and subject to ripening. The supramundane Thread that occurs in the seeing section is similar in meaning to the Thread classed as seeing,🔽so it is connected with that. The supramundane Thread that occurs in the development section is similar in meaning to the Thread classed as development,

original: saṃsandati, asekkhapakkhe pavattaṃ lokuttaraṃ suttaṃ asekkhabhāgiyena samānatthabhāvena
analyzed: saṃsandati asekkha pakkhe pavattam lokuttaram suttam asekkha bhāgiyena samāna attha bhāvena
translated: so it is connected with that. The supramundane Thread that occurs in the Adept section is similar in meaning to the Thread classed as Adept,

original: saṃsandati, tasmā lokuttarampi suttaṃ dassanabhāgiyena ca bhāvanābhāgiyena ca asekkhabhāgiyena
analyzed: saṃsandati tasmā lokuttaram pi suttam dassana bhāgiyena ca bhāvanā bhāgiyena ca asekkha bhāgiyena
translated: so it is connected with that. So supramundane Thread, though of one kind only, can be demonstrated by means of the three Threads classed as seeing, development, and Adept.

original: ca tīhi suttehi niddisitabbaṃ. Vuttanayānusārena sesesupi saṃsandanayojanā kātabbā.
analyzed: ca tīhi suttehi niddisitabbam vutta naya anusārena sesesu pi saṃsandana yojanā kātabbā
translated: and it should be demonstrated by means of the three Suttas. The method of combining and interpreting the rest should be done in the same way as has been shown.

original: Amhākācariya tumhehi amhākācariyehi nayadassanavasena suttavisesasaṃsandanaṃ dassitaṃ,
analyzed: tumhehi amhākā cariyehi naya dassana vasena sutta visesa saṃsandanam dassitam
translated: Our teachers have shown you the combining of the different Suttas by the method of the teachers.

original: amhehi ca ñātaṃ, “kimatthāya saṃkilesabhāgiyādibhedena vibhajitvā bhagavatā vutta”nti🔽vattabbattā “vāsanābhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ saṃkilesabhāgiyassa suttassa nigghātāyā”tiādi
analyzed: amhehi ca ñātam kim atthāya saṃkilesa bhāgiya ādi bhedena vibhajitvā bhagavatā vuttan ti  vattabbattā vāsanā bhāgiyam suttam saṃkilesa bhāgiyassa suttassa nigghātāya atiādi
translated: We have understood it. But we must ask: “For what purpose did the Blessed One teach the Suttas after dividing them into the categories of the Corruptions, etc.?”

original: vuttaṃ. Ettha ca suttavasena suttatthā gahitā.
analyzed: vuttam ettha ca sutta vasena suttatthā gahitā
translated: Therefore it was said: “A sutta dealing with the corruptions is for the purpose of abolishing a sutta dealing with the corruptions” , and so on. And here the meaning of the Suttas is taken as the subject.

original: “Yaṃ sattādhiṭṭhānaṃ ācariyena niddhāritaṃ, taṃ sattādhiṭṭhānaṃ kittakehi suttehi🔽vibhajitvā niddisitabba”nti vattabbattā “lokuttaraṃ suttaṃ sattādhiṭṭhānaṃ chabbisatiyā
analyzed: yam satta adhiṭṭhānam ācariyena niddhāritam tam satta adhiṭṭhānam kittakehi suttehi  vibhajitvā niddisitabbanti vattabbattā lokuttaram suttam satta adhiṭṭhānam chabbisatiyā
translated: “The subject that the teacher has demonstrated as having beings for its ground: how many Suttas must that subject having beings for its ground be divided by and demonstrated by?”

original: puggalehi niddisitabba”nti vuttaṃ. “Te chabbīsati puggalā katihi suttehi samanvesitabbā”ti
analyzed: puggalehi niddisitabbanti vuttam te chabbīsati puggalā katihi suttehi samanvesitabbā ti
translated: Therefore it was said: “A supramundane sutta having beings for its ground must be demonstrated by twenty-six kinds of persons” . “Those twenty-six kinds of persons must be sought in how many Suttas?”

original: vattabbattā “te tīhī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Dassanabhāgiyena sattādhiṭṭhānena, bhāvanābhāgiyena
analyzed: vattabba ttā te tīhi itiādi vuttam dassana bhāgiyena satta adhiṭṭhānena bhāvanā bhāgiyena
translated: “The three” is said because it is to be stated. By the basis of success that is a factor of penetration, by the basis of success that is a factor of development,

original: sattādhiṭṭhānena, asekkhabhāgiyena sattādhiṭṭhānena cāti tīhi suttehi te chabbīsati
analyzed: satta adhiṭṭhānena asekkhabhāgiyena satta adhiṭṭhānena ca ati tīhi suttehi te chabbīsati
translated: “With which with which” is said in order to show which suttas should be sought out. With the three suttas, namely, the one dealing with the seen, that dealing with the developed, and that dealing with the disciple in higher training.

original: puggalā samanvesitabbā.🔽“Katamehi katamehi katamaṃ katamaṃ suttaṃ niddisitabba”nti vattabbattā “tattha dassanabhāgiya”ntiādi🔽vuttaṃ. Tattha tatthāti tesu tīsu dassanabhāgiyādīsu suttesu. Tatthāti vā tesu chabbīsatiyā🔽puggalesu. Sattādhiṭṭhānekadesaṃ dassanabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ ekabījinā puggalena ca niddisitabbaṃ…pe…🔽dhammānusārinā puggalena ca niddisitabbaṃ, iti imehi pañcahi puggalehi sattādhiṭṭhānekadesaṃ
analyzed: puggalā samanvesitabbā  katamehi katamehi katamam katamam suttam niddisitabbanti vattabbattā tattha dassana bhāgiya ntiādi  vuttam tattha tattha ati tesu tīsu dassanabhāgiya ādīsu suttesu tattha ati vā tesu chabbīsatiyā  puggalesu satta adhiṭṭhāna eka desam dassana bhāgiyam suttam eka bījinā puggalena ca niddisitabbam pe  dhamma anusārinā puggalena ca niddisitabbam iti imehi pañcahi puggalehi satta adhiṭṭhāna eka desam
translated: The twenty-six types of persons should be sought out with the three suttas.

original: dassanabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ niddisitabbaṃ. Ettha ca dassanaggahaṇena sotāpattiphalaṭṭhāpi
analyzed: dassana bhāgiyam suttam niddisitabbam ettha ca dassana ggahaṇena sotāpatti phala ṭṭhāpi
translated: “Which which suttas should be demonstrated with which which persons?” In order to show this, “Herein, that dealing with the seen” is said. Herein, in the three suttas dealing with the seen, etc. Herein, in the twenty-six types of persons. A part of the seen-dealing sutta should be demonstrated with the once-returner type of person, a part of the seen-dealing sutta should be demonstrated with the non-returner type of person, a part of the seen-dealing sutta should be demonstrated with the one-seeder type of person, a part of the seen-dealing sutta should be demonstrated with the clan-to-clan type of person, a part of the seen-dealing sutta should be demonstrated with the seven-lives-at-most type of person, a part of the seen-dealing sutta should be demonstrated with the faith-liberated type of person, a part of the seen-dealing sutta should be demonstrated with the Dhamma-liberated type of person, a part of the seen-dealing sutta should be demonstrated with the body-witness type of person, a part of the seen-dealing sutta should be demonstrated with the one attained-to-view type of person, a part of the seen-dealing sutta should be demonstrated with the faith- devotee type of person, a part of the seen-dealing sutta should be demonstrated with the Dhamma-follower type of person. Thus a part of the seen-dealing sutta should be demonstrated with these ten types of persons. And here the word “seen” includes the one who has attained to the fruit of stream-entry.

original: gahitā, tasmā ekabījikolaṃkolasattakkhattuparamā phalaṭṭhāpi gahitā.
analyzed: gahitā tasmai eka bījika ulaṃkola satta kkhattu paramā phala ṭṭhā api gahitā
translated: so the one-seed and the clan-to-clan type are included too.

original: Saddhānusārī pana yo vipassanākkhaṇe saddhaṃ dhuraṃ katvā sotāpattimaggaṃ nibbatteti,
analyzed: saddhā anusārī pana yaḥ vipassanā kkhaṇe saddham dhuram katvā sotāpatti maggam nibbatteti
translated: But the faith-liberated type is one who, at the moment of insight, produces the stream-entry path by making faith prominent.

original: so puggalo nibbattetabbasotāpattimaggakkhaṇe saddhānusārī nāma, saddhāya samāpattiṃ
analyzed: so puggalaḥ nibbattetabba sotāpatti magga kkhaṇe saddhānusārī nāma saddhāya samāpattim
translated: That type of person is called “one who is liberated by faith” at the moment of the stream-entry path that is being produced.🔽He recollects the attainment by faith,

original: anussarati, iti saddhāya samāpattiyā anussaraṇato sotāpattimaggaṭṭho puggalo saddhānusārī
analyzed: anussarati iti saddhāya samāpattiyāḥ anussaraṇataḥ sotāpatti magga ṭṭho puggalo saddhā anusārī
translated: so he is called “one liberated by faith” because of the recollection of the attainment by faith.🔽That type of person, at the moment of the fruit of stream-entry, is called “one liberated in both ways” because he is liberated by faith in the path and by understanding in the fruition.

original: nāma. So puggalo sotāpattiphalakkhaṇe saddhāya vimuttattā saddhāvimutto hutvā ekabījikolaṃkolasattakkhattuparamo🔽bhavati. Yo pana puggalo vipassanākkhaṇe paññaṃ dhuraṃ katvā sotāpattimaggaṃ nibbatteti,
analyzed: nāma so puggalo sotāpatti phala kkhaṇe saddhāya vimutta ttā saddhā vimuttaḥ hutvā eka bījika ulaṃkola satta kkhattu paramaḥ  bhavati yaḥ pana puggalaḥ vipassanā kkhaṇe paññam dhuram katvā sotāpatti maggam nibbatteti
translated: He is either a one-seed or a clan-to-clan type.🔽But the one who is liberated by understanding is one who, at the moment of insight, produces the stream-entry path by making understanding prominent.

original: so puggalo nibbattetabbasotāpattimaggakkhaṇe dhammānusārī nāma, dhammena paññāya
analyzed: so puggalaḥ nibbattetabba sotāpatti magga kkhaṇe dhammānusārī nāma dhammena paññāya
translated: That type of person is called “one who is liberated by understanding” at the moment of the stream-entry path that is being produced.🔽He recollects the attainment by understanding,

original: samāpattiṃ anussarati, iti dhammena paññāya samāpattiyā anussaraṇato dhammānusārī
analyzed: samāpattim anussarati iti dhammena paññāya samāpattiyāḥ anussaraṇataḥ dhamma anusārī
translated: so he is called “one liberated by understanding” because of the recollection of the attainment by understanding.

original: nāma. So puggalo phalakkhaṇe diṭṭhiyā paññāya nirodhaṃ pattattā diṭṭhipatto hutvā
analyzed: nāma so puggalaḥ pha lakkhaṇe diṭṭhiyā paññāya nirodham pattattā diṭṭhi patto hutvā
translated: and the word “person” is understood. At the moment of fruition he is one who has attained cessation by means of seeing and understanding, and so he is a “one who has attained by seeing” .🔽He is either a single-seeded one, and so on, or a one who is at the end of the process.

original: ekabīji…pe… paramo bhavati. Dhammoti cettha paññā gahitā. Iti pabhedato dve maggaṭṭhā,
analyzed: eka bījipe paramaḥ bhavati dhammaḥ ti ca ittha paññā gahitā iti pabhedato dve maggaṭṭhā
translated: “Dhamma” here is understanding. So, classified, there are two in the path and six in the fruition.

original: cha phalaṭṭhāti aṭṭhahi ariyapuggalehi, sampiṇḍite pana pañcahi ariyapuggalehi sattādhiṭṭhānekadesaṃ
analyzed: cha aṭṭhahi ariya puggalehi sampiṇḍite pana pañcahi ariya puggalehi satta adhiṭṭhāna eka desam
translated: But when the eight kinds of noble person are combined, the sutta can be demonstrated in five noble persons, in one part of the seven foundations,

original: dassanabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ niddisitabbaṃ.
analyzed: dassana bhāgiyam suttam niddisitabbam
translated: and in the seen-as-a-part.

original: Imesaṃ ekabījiādīnaṃ puggalānaṃ sattādhiṭṭhānekadesatthattā ceva dassanabhāgiyatthattā
analyzed: imesam ekabīji ādīnam puggalānam satta adhiṭṭhāna eka desa tthattā ca iva dassana bhāgiya tthattā
translated: Because these persons beginning with the single-seeded one are in one part of the seven foundations and in the seen-as-a-part,

original: ca sattādhiṭṭhānekadesaṃ dassanabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ ettakehi puggalehi niddisitabbanti
analyzed: ca satta adhiṭṭhāna eka desam dassana bhāgiyam suttam ettakehi puggalehi niddisitabbanti
translated: the sutta can be demonstrated in so many persons.

original: niyametvā ācariyena vibhattaṃ, amhehi ca ñātaṃ, “sattādhiṭṭhānekadesaṃ dassanabhāgiyaṃ
analyzed: niyametvā ācariyena vibhattam amhehi ca ñātam satta adhiṭṭhāna eka desam dassana bhāgiyam
translated: The teacher has therefore analysed it by defining it thus, and we have understood it.

original: suttaṃ kittakehi puggalehi niddisitabba”nti pucchitabbattā –
analyzed: suttam kittakehi puggalehi niddisitabbanti pucchitabba ttā
translated: But since it is necessary to ask, “In how many persons can the sutta be demonstrated in one part of the seven foundations and in the seen-as-a-part? ” ,

original: “Bhāvanābhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ dvādasahi puggalehi niddisitabbaṃ sakadāgāmiphalasacchikiriyāya🔽paṭipannena, sakadāgāminā, anāgāmiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipannena, anāgāminā, antarāparinibbāyinā,🔽upahaccaparinibbāyinā, asaṅkhāraparinibbāyinā, sasaṅkhāraparinibbāyinā, uddhaṃsotena
analyzed: bhāvanābhāgiyam suttam dvādasahi puggalehi niddisitabbam sakadāgāmi phala sacchikiriyāya  paṭipannena sakadāgāminā anāgāmi phala sacchikiriyāya paṭipannena anāgāminā antarā aparinibbāyinā  upahacca parinibbāyinā asaṅkhāra parinibbāyinā sa saṅkhāra parinibbāyinā uddhaṃsotena
translated: one who is practising for realization of the fruit of once-returner,

original: akaniṭṭhagāminā, saddhāvimuttena, diṭṭhippattena, kāyasakkhinā cāti bhāvanābhāgiyaṃ
analyzed: akaniṭṭha gāminā saddhā vimuttena diṭṭhi ppattena kāya sakkhinā ca ati bhāvanā bhāgiyam
translated: one who is a once-returner, one who is practising for realization of the fruit of non-returner, one who is a non-returner, one who attains nibbāna in the interval, one who attains nibbāna upon landing, one who attains nibbāna without prompting, one who attains nibbāna with prompting, one who goes upstream to the highest gods, one who is liberated by faith, one who has attained to view, and one who is a body-witness. A discourse dealing with development

original: suttaṃ imehi dvādasahi puggalehi niddisitabba”nti –
analyzed: suttam imehi dvādasahi puggalehi niddisitabbanti
translated: should be demonstrated in these twelve persons.”

original: Vuttaṃ. Tatthāpi sattādhiṭṭhānekadesaṃ bhāvanābhāgiyaṃ suttanti gahetabbaṃ. Sakadā…pe…🔽pannena sakadāgāmimaggaṭṭhena puggalena, sakadāgāminā sakadāgāmiphalaṭṭhena, anāgāmi…pe…
analyzed: vuttam tattha api satta adhiṭṭhāna eka desam bhāvanā bhāgiyam suttanti gahetabbam sakadāpe  pannena sakadāgāmi magga ṭṭhena puggalena sakadāgāminā sakadāgāmi phala ṭṭhena anāgāmi pe
translated: This is said. And there too, a part of the sevenfold establishment should be taken as a discourse dealing with development. One who is practising for realization of the fruit of once-returner is a person in the position of the path of once-returner;

original: pannena anāgāmimaggaṭṭhena, anāgāminā anāgāmiphalaṭṭhena, avihādīsu pañcasu suddhāvāsesu
analyzed: pannena anāgāmi magga ṭṭhena anāgāminā anāgāmi phala ṭṭhena aviha ādīsu pañcasu suddhāvāsesu
translated: one who is a once-returner is a person in the position of the fruit of once-returner; one who is practising for realization of the fruit of non-returner is a person in the position of the path of non-returner; one who is a non-returner is a person in the position of the fruit of non-returner; one who attains nibbāna in the interval is a person in the position of the path of the third stage; one who attains nibbāna upon landing is a person in the position of the fruit of the third stage; one who attains nibbāna without prompting is a person in the position of the path of the fourth stage; one who attains nibbāna with prompting is a person in the position of the fruit of the fourth stage; one who goes upstream to the highest gods is a person in the position of the path of the fifth stage; one who is liberated by faith is a person in the position of the fruit of the fifth stage; one who has attained to view is a person in the position of the path of the sixth stage; one who is a body-witness is a person in the position of the fruit of the sixth stage.

original: āyuvemajjhaṃ anatikkamitvā arahattaṃ patvā parinibbāyanasabhāvena antarāparinibbāyīnāmakena
analyzed: āyu vemajjham an atikkamitvā arahattam patvā parinibbāyana sabhāvena antarāparinibbāyī nāmakena
translated: who attain Nibbāna in the middle of their life-span, by way of attaining Arahantship and then attaining Nibbāna,

original: anāgāminā, āyuvemajjhaṃ atikkamitvā arahattaṃ patvā parinibbāyanasabhāvena upahaccaparinibbāyīnāmakena🔽anāgāminā, asaṅkhārena appayogena arahattaṃ patvā parinibbāyanasabhāvena asaṅkhāraparinibbāyīnāmakena🔽anāgāminā, sasaṅkhārena sappayogena arahattaṃ patvā parinibbāyanasabhāvena sasaṅkhāraparinibbāyīnāmakena
analyzed: anāgāminā āyu vemajjham atikkamitvā arahattam patvā parinibbāyana sabhāvena upahaccaparinibbāyī nāmakena  anāgāminā asaṅkhārena appayogena arahattam patvā parinibbāyana sabhāvena asaṅkhāraparinibbāyīnāmakena  anāgāminā sa saṅkhārena sa payogena arahattam patvā parinibbāyana sabhāvena sa saṅkhāraparinibbāyī nāmakena
translated: who attain Nibbāna upon landing, by way of attaining Arahantship and then attaining Nibbāna,🔽who attain Nibbāna without exertion, by way of attaining Arahantship and then attaining Nibbāna,🔽who attain Nibbāna with exertion, by way of attaining Arahantship and then attaining Nibbāna,

original: anāgāminā, avihādīhi uddhaṃ atappādīsu upapattisotena arahattaṃ patvā parinibbāyanasabhāvena
analyzed: anāgāminā a vihā ādīhi uddham a tappa ādīsu upapatti sotena arahattam patvā parinibbāyana sabhāvena
translated: who attain Nibbāna by way of the upper stream, by way of attaining Arahantship and then attaining Nibbāna,

original: uddhaṃsotanāmakena anāgāminā, akaniṭṭhaṃ gantvā arahattaṃ patvā parinibbāyanasabhāvena
analyzed: uddhaṃsota nāmakena anāgāminā akaniṭṭham gantvā arahattam patvā parinibbāyana sabhāvena
translated: who go to the highest heaven, by way of attaining Arahantship and then attaining Nibbāna,

original: akaniṭṭhagāmīnāmakena anāgāminā, saddhāya vimuttattā saddhāvimuttanāmakena anāgāminā,
analyzed: akaniṭṭhagāmī nāmakena anāgāminā saddhāya saddhāvimutta nāmakena anāgāminā
translated: who are liberated by faith, by way of attaining Arahantship and then attaining Nibbāna,

original: diṭṭhiyā paññāya nirodhaṃ pattattā diṭṭhippattanāmakena anāgāminā cāti imehi ekādasahi
analyzed: diṭṭhiyā paññāya nirodham patta ttā diṭṭhippatta nāmakena anāgāminā ca ati imehi ekādasahi
translated: and the non-returner called “one who has attained to view” because he has attained cessation by means of view.

original: ajhānalābhīpuggalehi ca, kāyena nāmakāye phuṭṭhānaṃ arūpajhānānaṃ anantaraṃ nibbānaṃ
analyzed: ajhāna lābhī puggalehi ca kāyena nāmakāye phuṭṭhānam arūpa jhānānam anantaram nibbānam
translated: and those who have not obtained jhāna, who realize Nibbāna immediately next to the immaterial jhānas that are touched by the body.

original: sacchikaroti, iti sacchikaraṇato kāyasakkhīnāmakena jhānalābhinā cāti dvādasahi puggalehi niddisitabbaṃ.🔽Imesaṃ vuttappakārānaṃ puggalānaṃ sattādhiṭṭhānekadesatthattā ceva bhāvanābhāgiyatthattā🔽ca sattādhiṭṭhānekadesaṃ bhāvanābhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ ettakehi puggalehi niddisitabbanti🔽niyametvā ācariyena vibhattaṃ, amhehi ca ñātaṃ, “kittakehi puggalehi sattādhiṭṭhānekadesaṃ
analyzed: sacchikaroti iti sacchikaraṇataḥ kāya sakkhī nāmakena jhāna lābhinā ca ati dvādasahi puggalehi niddisitabbam  imesam vutta ppakārānam puggalānam satta adhiṭṭhāna eka desa tthattā ca iva bhāvanā bhāgiya tthattā  ca satta adhiṭṭhāna eka desam bhāvanā bhāgiyam suttam ettakehi puggalehi niddisitabbanti  niyametvā ācariyena vibhattam amhehi ca ñātam kittakehi puggalehi satta adhiṭṭhāna eka desam
translated: It should be demonstrated by these twelve persons, namely, by the “body witness” who realizes it by means of the body, and by those who have obtained jhāna.🔽The teacher has analyzed the sutta in this way, and we have understood it thus, as to the persons by whom the sutta, which is a part of the section on the seven kinds of persons and is concerned with the development of understanding, should be demonstrated.

original: asekkhabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ niddisitabba”nti vattabbattā –
analyzed: asekkhabhāgiyam suttam niddisitabbanti vattabbattā
translated: Now, since it should be said: “The sutta, which is a part of the section on the adepts and is concerned with the development of understanding, should be demonstrated by so many persons,”

original: “Asekkhabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ navahi puggalehi niddisitabbaṃ saddhāvimuttena, paññāvimuttena,
analyzed: asekkha bhāgiyam suttam navahi puggalehi niddisitabbam saddhā vimuttena paññā vimuttena
translated: “The sutta, which is a part of the section on the adepts and is concerned with the development of understanding, should be demonstrated by nine persons, namely, by one liberated-by-faith, by one liberated-by-wisdom,

original: suññatavimuttena, animittavimuttena, appaṇihitavimuttena, ubhatobhāgavimuttena, samasīsinā,
analyzed: suññata vimuttena animitta vimuttena appaṇihita vimuttena ubhatobhāga vimuttena samasīsinā
translated: with one liberated by faith, with one liberated by understanding, with one liberated by both parts, with one who is a bodily witness,

original: paccekabuddhehi, sammāsambuddhehi cāti asekkhabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ imehi navahi puggalehi niddisitabba”nti –
analyzed: paccekabuddhehi sammāsambuddhehi ca ati asekkha bhāgiyam suttam imehi navahi puggalehi niddisitabbanti
translated: with Paccekabuddhas, with Fully Enlightened Ones.”

original: Vuttaṃ. Tattha sattādhiṭṭhānekadesaṃ asekkhabhāgiyaṃ suttaṃ niddisitabbanti yojetabbaṃ.
analyzed: vuttam tattha satta adhiṭṭhāna eka desam asekkha bhāgiyam suttam niddisitabban ti yojetabbam
translated: This is said. Herein, a sutta of the Adept’s province should be demonstrated with a part of the seven foundations is to be construed.

original: Saddhāya kilesehi vimuttattā arahattaphalakkhaṇe saddhāvimutto arahā, tena saddhāvimuttena.
analyzed: saddhāya kilesehi vimutta ttā arahatta phalakkhaṇe saddhā vimuttaḥ arahā tena saddhā vimuttena
translated: One liberated by faith is an Arahant at the moment of the fruition of Arahantship because of being liberated from defilements by faith. With one liberated by faith.

original: Paññāya vimuttattā arahattaphalakkhaṇe paññāvimutto arahā, tena paññāvimuttena. Suññatavipassanāsaṅkhātena🔽anattānupassanena vimuttattā suññatavimutto arahā, tena suññatavimuttena. Animittānupassanāsaṅkhātena
analyzed: paññāya vimutta ttā arahatta phala kkhaṇe paññā vimuttaḥ arahā tena paññā vimuttena suññata vipassanā saṅkhātena  anatta anupassanena vimutta ttā suññata vimuttaḥ arahā tena suññata vimuttena a nimitta anupassanā saṅkhātena
translated: One liberated by understanding is an Arahant at the moment of the fruition of Arahantship because of being liberated by understanding. With one liberated by understanding. With one liberated by both parts is an Arahant at the moment of the fruition of Arahantship because of being liberated by both faith and understanding. With one liberated by both parts.🔽With one liberated by emptiness is an Arahant at the moment of the fruition of Arahantship because of being liberated by the contemplation of not-self, which is called “emptiness” . With one liberated by emptiness.

original: aniccānupassanena vimuttattā animittavimutto arahā, tena animittavimuttena. Appaṇihitānupassanāsaṅkhātena
analyzed: anicca anupassanena vimutta ttā animitta vimuttaḥ arahā tena animitta vimuttena appaṇihita anupassanā saṅkhātena
translated: With one liberated by the signless is an Arahant at the moment of the fruition of Arahantship because of being liberated by the contemplation of impermanence, which is called “signless” . With one liberated by the signless. With one liberated by the desireless is an Arahant at the moment of the fruition of Arahantship because of being liberated by the contemplation of pain, which is called “desireless” . With one liberated by the desireless.

original: dukkhānupassanena vimuttattā appaṇihitavimutto arahā, tena appaṇihitavimuttena. Ubhato
analyzed: dukkha anupassanena vimutta ttā appaṇihita vimuttaḥ arahā tena appaṇihita vimuttena ubhatas
translated: he is liberated by the contemplation of pain, he is an Arahant, liberated by both sides, by that he is liberated by both sides.

original: rūpakāyanāmakāyato ubhatobhāgato vimuttattā ubhatobhāgavimutto arahā, tena ubhatobhāgavimuttena.
analyzed: rūpa kāya nāma kāyataḥ ubhatobhāgataḥ vimuttattā ubhatobhāga vimuttaḥ arahā tena ubhatobhāga vimuttena
translated: He is liberated by the signless liberation because he is liberated by insight into suffering. He is liberated by the desireless liberation because he is liberated by insight into the five aggregates as far as the state of the Stream-Enterer. He is liberated by the void liberation because he is liberated by insight into the five aggregates as far as the state of the Once-Returner. He is liberated by the desireless liberation because he is liberated by insight into the five aggregates as far as the state of the Non-Returner. He is liberated by the signless liberation because he is liberated by insight into the five aggregates as far as the state of the Arahant. He is liberated by the desireless liberation because he is liberated by insight into the five aggregates as far as the state of the Arahant.

original: Purimā pañca puggalā ajhānalābhino gahitā, ubhatobhāgavimutto pana jhānalābhīgahito.
analyzed: purimā pañca puggalāḥ ajhāna lābhinaḥ gahitāḥ ubhatobhāga vimuttaḥ pana jhāna lābhī gahito
translated: The first five persons are included among those who have not attained jhana. But the one liberated in both ways is included among those who have attained jhana.

original: Samasīsī nāma iriyāpathasamasīsī, rogasamasīsī, jīvitasamasīsīti tividhā honti. Imesu
analyzed: samasīsī nāma iriyāpatha samasīsī roga samasīsī jīvita samasīsī iti tividhāḥ honti imesu
translated: The “equal-headed” are of three kinds: those equal-headed in posture, those equal-headed in disease, and those equal-headed in life.

original: tīsu samasīsīsu yo arahā catūsu iriyāpathesu ekekasmiṃ iriyāpathe arahattaṃ patvā🔽aññaṃ iriyāpathaṃ asaṅkamitvā tasmiṃ tasmiṃ iriyāpatheyeva parinibbāyati, ayaṃ arahā
analyzed: tīsu samasīsīsu yaḥ arahā catūsu iriyāpathesu ekekasmin iriyāpathe arahattam patvā  aññam iriyāpatham a saṅkamitvā tasmin tasmin iriyāpathe iya iva parinibbāyati ayam arahā
translated: Of these three kinds of equal-headed, the Arahant who attains Arahantship in each of the four postures and🔽does not change to another posture until he passes away is called one equal-headed in posture.🔽The Arahant who attains Arahantship when a certain disease is present and

original: iriyāpathasamasīsī nāma. Yo arahā yasmiṃ roge uppanne arahattaṃ patvā tato rogato🔽anuṭṭhahitvā tasmiṃ rogeyeva parinibbāyati, ayaṃ arahā rogasamasīsī nāma. Yo arahā
analyzed: iriyāpathasamasīsī nāma yaḥ arahā yasmin roge uppanne arahattam patvā tatas rogataḥ 🔽anuṭṭhahitvā tasmin roge iva parinibbāyati ayam arahā rogasamasīsī nāma yaḥ arahā
translated: does not recover from that disease but passes away in that same disease is called one equal-headed in disease. The Arahant who attains Arahantship at a certain age and

original: paccavekkhaṇavīthiyānantaraṃ bhavaṅgaṃ otaritvā tato maraṇāsannajavanavīthiyānantarameva🔽parinibbāyati, ayaṃ arahā vārasamatāya jīvitasamasīsī nāma. Vārasamatāti ca paccavekkhaṇavīthi
analyzed: paccavekkhaṇa vīthiyā anantaram bhavaṅgam otaritvā tatas maraṇa āsanna javana vīthiyā anantaram eva  parinibbāyati ayam arahā vārasamatāya jīvitasamasīsī nāma vārasamatā ati ca paccavekkhaṇa vīthi
translated: After the life-continuum has descended from the cognitive series of reviewing, then immediately next to the impulsion cognitive series that is near to death,

original: maggavithyānuvattakattā paccavekkhaṇavīthianantaraṃ pavattamānāyapi maraṇāsannavīthi
analyzed: paccavekkhaṇa vīthi anantaram maraṇa āsanna vīthi
translated: he attains Nibbāna. This is called “equal in life and in head” because of equality of moments. And “equality of moments” is said because the impulsion cognitive series that is near to death🔽is next to the cognitive series of reviewing, though it occurs after the path cognitive series.

original: maggavīthianantaraṃ pavattāti vattabbārahā, tasmā vīthianantaratā vārasamatā nāma.
analyzed: magga vīthi anantaram tasmā vīthi anantara tā vārasama tā nāma
translated: Therefore it is said that it is next to the cognitive series of reviewing.

original: Tāya vārasamatāya ca jīvitasamasīsī vutto.🔽Saha paṭisambhidāhi arahattaṃ pāpuṇīti etthapi paccavekkhaṇavīthiyānantaraṃ bhavaṅgaṃ
analyzed: tāya vāra sama tāya ca jīvita sama sīsī vutto  saha paṭisambhidāhi arahattam pāpuṇīti ettha api paccavekkhaṇa vīthiyā anantaram bhavaṅgam
translated: So he is called “equal in life and in head” because of that equality of moments.🔽“He reached Arahantship together with the discriminations”: here too, after the life-continuum has descended from the cognitive series of reviewing,

original: otaritvā bhavaṅgato vuṭṭhāya pavattavīthiyā paṭisambhidāñāṇāni pavattanti. Vuttanayena
analyzed: otaritvā bhavaṅgataḥ vuṭṭhāya pavatta vīthiyā paṭisambhidā ñāṇāni pavattanti vutta nayena
translated: the discriminations occur in the cognitive series that arises from the life-continuum.🔽He is said to have reached “together with the discriminations” because of equality of moments in the way already stated.

original: vīthianantaratāya vārasamatāya “saha paṭisambhidāhī”ti vuttaṃ. Bhagavato sabbaññutaññāṇampi
analyzed: vīthi anantaratāya vārasama tāya saha vuttam bhagavataḥ sabbaññuta ññāṇam pi
translated: The Blessed One’s knowledge of omniscience

original: paccavekkhaṇavīthiyānantaraṃ bhavaṅgaṃ otaritvā bhavaṅgato vuṭṭhāya pavattavīthiyā
analyzed: paccavekkhaṇa vīthiyā anantaram bhavaṅgam otaritvā bhavaṅgataḥ vuṭṭhāya pavatta vīthiyā
translated: and after that it enters the life-continuum, and after that it arises in the cognitive series that occurs next to the life-continuum,

original: paṭhamaṃ pavattatīti veditabbaṃ. Iminā jīvitasamasīsinā, sabbehi paccekabuddhehi,
analyzed: paṭhamam pavattati iti veditabbam iminā jīvitasamasīsinā sabbehi paccekabuddhehi
translated: it should be understood that it is the first to arise.🔽And with this “life-continuum” the nine kinds of persons, namely, all Paccekabuddhas,

original: sabbehi sammāsambuddhehi cāti imehi navahi puggalehi sattādhiṭṭhānekadesaṃ asekkhabhāgiyaṃ
analyzed: sabbehi sammāsambuddhehi ca ati imehi navahi puggalehi satta adhiṭṭhāna eka desam asekkha bhāgiyam
translated: all Perfectly Enlightened Ones,

original: suttaṃ niddisitabbaṃ.
analyzed: suttam niddisitabbam
translated: can be demonstrated as a part of the “undeclared” sutta that has the seven ideas as its ground.

original: Imesaṃ puggalānaṃ sattādhiṭṭhānekadesatthattā ceva asekkhabhāgiyatthattā ca evaṃ
analyzed: imesam puggalānam satta adhiṭṭhāna eka desa tthattā ca iva asekkhabhāgiya tthattā ca evam
translated: And because these persons have the seven ideas as their ground and because they are a part of the undeclared sutta,

original: iminā “lokuttaraṃ suttaṃ sattādhiṭṭhāna”ntiādinā pakārena vuttehi imehi chabbīsatiyā🔽puggalehi ariyehi dassanabhāgiyavāsanābhāgiyaasekkhabhāgiyasuttānaṃ vasena lokuttaraṃ🔽suttaṃ sattādhiṭṭhānekadesaṃ suttaṃ niddisitabbaṃ.
analyzed: iminā lokuttaram suttam satta adhiṭṭhāna nti ādinā pakārena vuttehi imehi chabbīsatiyā  puggalehi ariyehi dassana bhāgiya vāsanā bhāgiya asekkha bhāgiya suttānam vasena lokuttaram  suttam satta adhiṭṭhāna eka desam suttam niddisitabbam
translated: with this “supramundane sutta has the seven ideas as its ground” and so on,🔽the twenty-six kinds of noble persons can be demonstrated as a part of the sutta that has the seven ideas as its ground.

original: Imesaṃ chabbīsatiyā puggalānaṃ sakalalokuttarasuttatthattā ceva sattādhiṭṭhānekadesasuttatthattā
analyzed: imesam chabbīsatiyā puggalānam sakala lokuttara sutta atthattā ca iva satta adhiṭṭhāna eka desa sutta atthattā
translated: And because these twenty-six kinds of persons have the whole of the supramundane sutta as their ground and because they have a part of the sutta that has the seven ideas as its ground,

original: ca lokuttaraṃ sattādhiṭṭhānekadesaṃ suttaṃ. Ettakehi puggalehi niddisitabbanti ācariyena🔽niyametvā vibhattaṃ, amhehi ca ñātaṃ, “lokiyaṃ sattādhiṭṭhānekadesaṃ suttaṃ kittakehi🔽puggalehi niddisitabba”nti vattabbattā “lokiyaṃ suttaṃ sattādhiṭṭhānaṃ ekūnavīsatiyā
analyzed: ca lokuttaram satta adhiṭṭhāna eka desam suttam ettakehi puggalehi niddisitabbanti ācariyena  niyametvā vibhattam amhehi ca ñātam lokiyam satta adhiṭṭhāna eka desam suttam kittakehi  puggalehi niddisitabbanti vattabba ttā lokiyam suttam satta adhiṭṭhānam ekūnavīsatiyā
translated: and the supramundane, which is a part of the type that has a living being as its object.🔽The teacher has limited the exposition to this extent, and we have understood it thus. Now, in order to say, “How many kinds of persons are the mundane type that has a living being as its object to be demonstrated?” the text says, “The mundane sutta that has a living being as its object is to be demonstrated by nineteen kinds of persons.”

original: puggalehi niddisitabba”ntiādi vuttaṃ. “Te ekūnavīsati lokiyā puggalā katamehi dhammehi🔽niddiṭṭhā samanvesitabbā”ti vattabbattā “te caritehī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Te ekūnavīsati🔽lokiyā puggalā caritehi caritavisesehi niddiṭṭhā samanvesitabbāti. “Kathaṃ caritehi🔽niddiṭṭhā”ti vattabbattā “keci rāgacaritā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Rāgacaritadosacaritādīhi
analyzed: puggalehi niddisitabba ntiādi vuttam te ekūnavīsati lokiyā puggalā katamehi dhammehi  niddiṭṭhā samanvesitabbā ati vattabba ttā te caritehi itiādi vuttam te ekūnavīsati  lokiyā puggalā caritehi carita visesehi niddiṭṭhā samanvesitabbā ati katham caritehi  niddiṭṭhā iti vattabbattā keci rāga carita atiādi vuttam rāga carita dosa carita ādīhi
translated: “What are the nineteen mundane types of persons to be sought out as demonstrated by these things?” In order to say this, the text says, “They are to be sought out by means of the practices.”🔽The nineteen mundane types of persons are to be sought out as demonstrated by means of the practices, the different kinds of practice.🔽“How are they demonstrated by means of the practices?” In order to say this, the text says, “Some are of greedy temperament.”

original: caritehi ekūnavīsati lokiyapuggalā rāgacaritā, keci dosacaritā…pe… mohacarito cāti
analyzed: caritehi ekūnavīsati lokiya puggalā rāga caritā keci moha carito ca ati
translated: The nineteen mundane types of persons are demonstrated by means of the practices, the different kinds of practice, such as the practice of the greedy temperament, the practice of the greedy temperament that is unconcentrated, and so on. Some are of greedy temperament, some are of hating temperament, some are of deluded temperament, and some are of speculative temperament.

original: niddiṭṭhā. Iti niddiṭṭhehi imehi ekūnavīsatiyā puggalehi lokiyasattādhiṭṭhānekadesaṃ🔽suttaṃ niddisitabbaṃ. “Lokiya”nti sāmaññavasena vuttampi “saṃkilesabhāgiyaṃ lokiya”nti
analyzed: niddiṭṭhāḥ iti niddiṭṭhehi imehi ekūnavīsatiyā puggalehi lokiya satta adhiṭṭhāna eka desam  suttam niddisitabbam lokiyanti sāmañña vasena vuttam pi saṃkilesa bhāgiyam lokiyanti
translated: They are shown. So the Thread that is of the world and has a living being as its meaning in part is shown by these nineteen persons.

original: visesato viññātabbaṃ.🔽Lokiyaṃ sattādhiṭṭhānekadesaṃ suttaṃ ettakehi puggalehi niddisitabbanti ācariyena🔽niyametvā vibhattaṃ, amhehi ca ñātaṃ, “vāsanābhāgiyaṃ sattādhiṭṭhānekadesaṃ suttaṃ
analyzed: visesataḥ viññātabbam  lokiyam satta adhiṭṭhāna eka desam suttam ettakehi puggalehi niddisitabbanti ācariyena  niyametvā vibhattam amhehi ca ñātam vāsanā bhāgiyam satta adhiṭṭhāna eka desam suttam
translated: Though the word “of the world” is said in a general sense, it should be known in particular as “that which is of the world and is of corruption’s side” .

original: katamehi puggalehi niddisitabba”nti vattabbattā “vāsanābhāgiya”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Vāsanābhāgiyaṃ
analyzed: katamehi puggalehi niddisitabbanti vattabbattā vāsanābhāgiya ntiādi vuttam vāsanābhāgiyam
translated: The Thread that is of the world and has a living being as its meaning in part is shown by so many persons, the teacher has decided and analysed, and we have understood. Now it is said “That which is of the world and is of purification’s side and has a living being as its meaning in part is shown by what persons? “ , and so “That which is of the world and is of purification’s side” is said.

original: sattādhiṭṭhānekadesaṃ suttaṃ sīlavantehi puggalehi, dhammehi ca niddisitabbanti yojetabbaṃ.
analyzed: satta adhiṭṭhāna eka desam suttam sīlavantehi puggalehi dhammehi ca niddisitabban ti yojetabbam
translated: That which is of the world and is of purification’s side and has a living being as its meaning in part is shown by persons who are virtuous and by those who are Dhamma-minded, it should be construed.

original: “Kittakā sīlavantapuggalā”ti vattabbattā “te sīlavanto pañca puggalā”ti vuttaṃ. “Kittakā
analyzed: kittakā sīlavanta puggalā ti vattabbattā te sīlavantaḥ pañca puggalā ti vuttam kittakā
translated: Since it is said “ How many are the persons who are virtuous? “ , it is said “ Those who are virtuous are five persons “ . “ How many are the persons who are Dhamma-minded? “ , and so “ Those who are Dhamma-minded are five persons “ is said.

original: dhammā”ti vattabbattā “pakatisīla”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – pakatisīlavanto🔽ca samādānasīlavanto ca cittappasādavanto ca samathavanto ca vipassanāvanto cāti🔽pañca puggalā, pakatisīladhammo ca samādānasīladhammo ca cittappasādadhammo ca samathadhammo
analyzed: dhammā ti vattabbattā pakati sīla ntiādi vuttam idam vuttam hoti pakati sīlavanto  ca samādāna sīlavanto ca citta pasādavanto ca samathavanto ca vipassanāvanto ca ati  pañca puggalā pakati sīla dhammo ca samādāna sīla dhammo ca citta ppasāda dhammo ca samatha dhammo
translated: “The five kinds of persons are those possessing natural virtue, those possessing virtue of undertaking, those possessing confidence, those possessing serenity, and those possessing insight.🔽The five kinds of ideas are the idea of natural virtue, the idea of virtue of undertaking, the idea of confidence, the idea of serenity, and the idea of insight.

original: ca vipassanādhammo cāti pañca dhammāti imehi pañcahi puggalehi, imehi pañcahi dhammehi🔽vāsanābhāgiyaṃ sattādhiṭṭhānekadesadhammādhiṭṭhānekadesaṃ suttaṃ yathākkamaṃ niddisitabbanti.🔽Lokuttaraṃ sattādhiṭṭhānaṃ suttaṃ dassanabhāgiyavāsanābhāgiyaasekkhabhāgiyasuttehi
analyzed: ca vipassanā dhammo ca ati pañca dhammā ati imehi pañcahi puggalehi imehi pañcahi dhammehi  vāsanā bhāgiyam satta adhiṭṭhāna eka desa dhamma adhiṭṭhāna eka desam suttam yathākkamam niddisitabbanti  lokuttaram satta adhiṭṭhānam suttam dassana bhāgiya vāsanā bhāgiya asekkha bhāgiya suttehi
translated: These five kinds of persons and these five kinds of ideas are respectively illustrated by the Thread dealing with the five categories of persons and the Thread dealing with the five categories of ideas, which are both of the kind dealing with the Soil of Conversion.🔽The Thread dealing with the Supramundane is illustrated by the Thread dealing with the Seeing-Region, the Thread dealing with the Conversion-Region, and the Thread dealing with the Adept’s Region.

original: niddisitabbanti ācariyena niyametvā vibhattaṃ, amhehi ca ñātaṃ, “lokuttaraṃ dhammādhiṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: niddisitabbanti ācariyena niyametvā vibhattam amhehi ca ñātam lokuttaram dhamma adhiṭṭhānam
translated: This is how the teacher has defined and expounded it, and this is how we understand it. The Thread dealing with the Supramundane is illustrated by the Thread dealing with the Adept’s Region.

original: suttaṃ kittakehi suttehi niddisitabba”nti vattabbattā “lokuttaraṃ suttaṃ dhammādhiṭṭhānaṃ…pe…🔽asekkhabhāgiyenā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: suttam kittakehi suttehi niddisitabbanti vattabbattā lokuttaram suttam dhamma adhiṭṭhānam pe  asekkha bhāgiyena iti vuttam
translated: “The supramundane sutta, which is based on the Dhamma, should be demonstrated by the noble path.”

original: “Lokiyañca lokuttarañca sattādhiṭṭhānañca dhammādhiṭṭhānañca kittakehi niddisitabba”nti
analyzed: lokiyañca lokuttarañca satta adhiṭṭhānañca dhamma adhiṭṭhānañca kittakehi niddisitabbanti
translated: “The mundane and the supramundane, which are based on beings and on the Dhamma, should be demonstrated by how many?”🔽“The mundane and the supramundane should be demonstrated by both.”

original: vattabbattā “lokiyañca…pe… ubhayena niddisitabba”nti vuttaṃ. Ubhayenāti lokiyalokuttarena,
analyzed: vattabbattā ubhayena niddisitabbam iti vuttam ubhayena ati lokiya lokuttarena
translated: “Both” means by the mundane and the supramundane,

original: sattādhiṭṭhānadhammādhiṭṭhānena samānatthabhāvena niddisitabbanti.🔽“Ñāṇaṃ kittakehi niddisitabba”nti vattabbattā “ñāṇaṃ paññāyā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Yasmiṃ yasmiṃ sutte ñāṇaṃ āgataṃ, tasmiṃ tasmiṃ sutte ñāṇaṃ ñāṇapariyāyena paññādinā niddisitabbanti.
analyzed: satta adhiṭṭhāna dhamma adhiṭṭhānena samāna attha bhāvena niddisitabbanti  ñāṇam kittakehi niddisitabbanti vattabba ttā ñāṇam paññāya atiādi vuttam yasmim yasmim sutte ñāṇam āgatam tasmim tasmim sutte ñāṇam ñāṇa pariyāyena paññā ādinā niddisitabbanti
translated: by the one based on beings and the one based on the Dhamma, since they have the same meaning.🔽“By how many should knowledge be demonstrated?”🔽“Knowledge should be demonstrated by understanding.” In whatever sutta knowledge is found, that knowledge should be demonstrated by the synonyms for knowledge, such as understanding, and so on.🔽“By how many should the knowable be demonstrated?”

original: “Ñeyyaṃ kittakena niddisitabba”nti vattabbattā “ñeyyaṃ atītānāgatapaccuppannehī”tiādi
analyzed: ñeyyam kittakena niddisitabban ti vattabba ttā ñeyyam atīta anāgata paccuppannehi itiādi
translated: “The knowable should be demonstrated by the past, future, and present.”

original: vuttaṃ. Yasmiṃ yasmiṃ sutte ñeyyaṃ āgataṃ, tasmiṃ tasmiṃ sutte ñeyyaṃ ñeyyapariyāyena niddisitabbanti.🔽“Ñāṇañca ñeyyañca kittakena niddisitabba”nti vattabbattā “ñāṇañca ñeyyañca tadubhayenā”tiādi
analyzed: vuttam yasmim yasmim sutte ñeyyam āgatam tasmim tasmim sutte ñeyyam ñeyya pariyāyena niddisitabbanti  ñāṇam ca ñeyyañca kittakena niddisitabbanti vattabbattā ñāṇam ca ñeyyañca tad ubhayena atiādi
translated: This is said. In whatever sutta the knowable is found, in that sutta the knowable should be demonstrated by the method of the knowable.

original: vuttaṃ. Yasmiṃ yasmiṃ sutte ñāṇañeyyā āgatā, tasmiṃ tasmiṃ sutte ñāṇañeyyā ñāṇañeyyapariyāyena niddisitabbanti.
analyzed: vuttam yasmim yasmim sutte ñāṇa ñeyyā āgatā tasmim tasmim sutte ñāṇa ñeyyā ñāṇa ñeyya pariyāyena niddisitabbanti
translated: “And by how much is the knowledge and the knowable to be demonstrated?” In order to say this, “By both of them” is said. In whatever sutta the knowledge and the knowable are found, in that sutta the knowledge and the knowable should be demonstrated by the method of the knowledge and the knowable.

original: Dassanasutte yathā niddiṭṭhaṃ, tathā upadhārayitvā labbhamānato niddisitabbaṃ. Bhāvanāsutte🔽yathā niddiṭṭhaṃ, tathā upadhārayitvā labbhamānato niddisitabbaṃ. Tadubhayaṃ dassanañca
analyzed: dassana sutte yathā niddiṭṭham tathā upadhārayitvā labbhamānataḥ niddisitabbam bhāvanā sutte  yathā niddiṭṭham tathā upadhārayitvā labbhamānataḥ niddisitabbam tat ubhayam dassanañca
translated: In the sutta on seeing, it should be demonstrated by way of what is found by considering it in the way it is demonstrated. In the sutta on development,

original: bhāvanā ca sutte yathā niddiṭṭhaṃ, tathā upadhārayitvā labbhamānato niddisitabbaṃ.
analyzed: bhāvanā ca sutte yathā niddiṭṭham tathā upadhārayitvā labbhamānataḥ niddisitabbam
translated: it should be demonstrated by way of what is found by considering it in the way it is demonstrated. Both of them, seeing and development, in the sutta, should be demonstrated by way of what is found by considering it in the way it is demonstrated.

original: “Sakavacanaṃ paravacana”ntiādīsupi evameva visuṃ visuṃ ca ekato ca sutte yathā niddiṭṭhaṃ,
analyzed: evam eva visum visum ca ekatas ca sutte yathā niddiṭṭham
translated: In the case of “one’s own words and the words of others,” etc., in this way, separately and together, in the sutta, it should be demonstrated by way of what is found by considering it in the way it is demonstrated.

original: tathā upadhārayitvā labbhamānato niddisitabbanti yojanā kātabbā. “Ettakameva niddisitabba”nti
analyzed: tathā upadhārayitvā labbhamānataḥ niddisitabbanti yojanā kātabbā ettakam eva niddisitabbanti
translated: and it should be interpreted as “because it is found when it is sought in this way.”

original: vattabbattā “yaṃ vā panā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vattabba ttā yam vā pana atiādi vuttam
translated: “Only this much should be demonstrated”🔽is said.🔽“Because it should be said that kamma is the cause of kamma-result,” etc., is said.

original: “Vipākassa hetu kammamevā”ti vattabbattā “duvidho hetū”tiādi vuttaṃ. Kilesā saṃkilesabhāgiyasuttena🔽samānatthabhāvena niddisitabbā. Taṇhāsaṅkhāto samudayo vā kilesasaṅkhāto samudayo
analyzed: vipākassa hetu kammam evā ti vattabbattā duvidhaḥ hetu utiādi vuttam kilesā saṃkilesabhāgiya suttena  samāna attha bhāvena niddisitabbā taṇhā saṅkhātaḥ samudayaḥ vā kilesa saṅkhātaḥ samudayaḥ
translated: The defilements should be demonstrated by the similarity of meaning with the “corrupted” sutta.

original: vā akusalasaṅkhāto samudayo vā saṃkilesabhāgiyena suttena samānatthabhāvena niddisitabbo.🔽Lokiyakusalahetusaṅkhāto samudayo vā lokiyakusalasaṅkhāto samudayo vā vāsanābhāgiyena
analyzed: vā akusala saṅkhātaḥ samudayaḥ vā saṃkilesabhāgiyena suttena samānattha bhāvena niddisitabbaḥ  lokiya kusala hetu saṅkhāto samudayaḥ vā lokiya kusala saṅkhātaḥ samudayaḥ vā vāsanābhāgiyena
translated: The origination consisting in craving, or the origination consisting in defilements, or the origination consisting in the unprofitable, should be demonstrated by the similarity of meaning with the “corrupted” sutta.

original: suttena samānatthabhāvena niddisitabbo.
analyzed: suttena samāna attha bhāvena niddisitabbaḥ
translated: The origination consisting in the cause of the mundane profitable, or the origination consisting in the mundane profitable, should be demonstrated by the similarity of meaning with the “habit-forming” sutta.

original: Kammañca vipāko ca yathārahaṃ labbhamānasuttena niddisitabboti sāmaññavasena vibhatto,
analyzed: kamman ca vipāko ca yathāraham labbhamāna suttena niddisitabbaḥ iti sāmañña vasena vibhattaḥ
translated: Kamma and kamma-result should be demonstrated by the sutta that is appropriate to them.🔽The general method of demonstration is finished.

original: “kusalaṃ katamena niddisitabba”nti vattabbattā “tattha kusala”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Tatthāti🔽tesu aṭṭhavīsatiyā sāsanapaṭṭhānasuttesu kusalaṃ catūhi suttehi samānatthabhāvena🔽niddisitabbaṃ. “Katamehi catūhī”ti vattabbattā “vāsanābhāgiyenā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Lokiyakusalaṃ🔽vāsanābhāgiyena niddisitabbaṃ samānatthattā, lokuttarakusalaṃ dassanabhāgiyena, vāsanābhāgiyena,🔽asekkhabhāgiyena ca yathārahaṃ samānatthabhāvena niddisitabbaṃ. Kusalaṃ ettakehi
analyzed: kusalam katamena niddisitabban ti vattabbattā tattha kusala ntiādi vuttam tattha ati  tesu aṭṭhavīsatiyā sāsana paṭṭhāna suttesu kusalam catūhi suttehi samāna attha bhāvena  niddisitabbam katamehi catūhi iti vattabbattā vāsanābhāgiyena atiādi vuttam lokiya kusalam  vāsanā bhāgiyena niddisitabbam samāna attha ttā lokuttara kusalam dassana bhāgiyena vāsanā bhāgiyena  asekkhabhāgiyena ca yathāraham samāna attha bhāvena niddisitabbam kusalam ettakehi
translated: “By which of these should the profitable be demonstrated?” In order to show this, “Herein, the profitable” is stated. Herein,

original: niddisitabbanti niyametvā vibhattaṃ, “akusalaṃ katamena niddisitabba”nti vattabbattā
analyzed: niddisitabbanti niyametvā vibhattam akusalam katamena niddisitabbanti vattabbattā
translated: among the twenty-eight Threads of the Dispensation, the profitable should be demonstrated by the four Threads in virtue of the fact that they have the same meaning. In order to show which four, “By the Thread Dealing with What is Corrupted by Lust, etc.,” is stated. The profitable that is mundane should be demonstrated by the Thread Dealing with What is Corrupted by Lust, and the profitable that is supramundane should be demonstrated by the Thread Dealing with Seeing, by the Thread Dealing with What is Corrupted by Lust, and by the Thread Dealing with the Adept, according as is appropriate, in virtue of the fact that they have the same meaning. The profitable has been demonstrated by specifying it thus as to be demonstrated by these four. In order to show by which of them the unprofitable should be demonstrated,

original: “akusala”ntiādi vuttaṃ. “Kusalañca akusalañca katamena niddisitabba”nti vattabbattā
analyzed: akusalam tiādi vuttam kusalam ca akusalam ca katamena niddisitabbanti vattabbattā
translated: “The unprofitable” is stated. In order to show by which of them the profitable and the unprofitable should be demonstrated,

original: “kusalañca akusalañca tadubhayena niddisitabba”nti vuttaṃ. Yasmiṃ yasmiṃ sutte tadubhayaṃ
analyzed: kusalam ca akusalam ca tad ubhayena niddisitabban ti vuttam yasmim yasmim sutte tat ubhayam
translated: “The profitable and the unprofitable should be demonstrated by both of them” is stated. In whatever Thread both of them occur,

original: āgataṃ, tasmiṃ tasmiṃ sutte āgatena tadubhayena niddisitabbaṃ.
analyzed: āgatam tasmim tasmim sutte āgatena tat ubhayena niddisitabbam
translated: and what is stated in the various suttas.

original: “Anuññātaṃ katamena niddisitabba”nti vattabbattā “anuññāta”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Anuññātaṃ
analyzed: anuññātam katamena niddisitabban ti vattabbattā anuññāta nti ādi vuttam anuññātam
translated: “What is permitted should be demonstrated by what?” should be said. That is why “What is permitted” is said.🔽What is permitted should be demonstrated by what is the same as what is permitted by the Blessed One.

original: bhagavato anuññātāya samānatāya niddisitabbaṃ. “Katividhaṃ anuññāta”nti vattabbattā
analyzed: bhagavataḥ anuññātāya samāna tāya niddisitabbam katividham anuññātan ti vattabbattā
translated: “How many kinds of what is permitted are there?” should be said.

original: “taṃ pañcavidha”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Yaṃ anuññātaṃ yāsu yāsu bhūmīsu dissati, taṃ anuññātaṃ
analyzed: tam pañcavidha nti ādi vuttam yam anuññātam yāsu yāsu bhūmīsu dissati tam anuññātam
translated: That is why “It is of five kinds” is said. What is permitted is seen in such and such planes. That what is permitted

original: tāsu tāsu bhūmīsu āgatena samānena kappiyānulomena niddisitabbaṃ.
analyzed: tāsu tāsu bhūmīsu āgatena samānena kappiya anulomena niddisitabbam
translated: should be demonstrated by what is allowable and in conformity with what is stated in those planes.

original: Anuññātaṃ iminā niddisitabbanti ācariyena niyametvā vibhattaṃ, “paṭikkhittaṃ katamena
analyzed: anuññātam iminā niddisitabbanti ācariyena niyametvā vibhattam paṭikkhittam katamena
translated: “What is permitted should be demonstrated by this” has been analyzed by the Teacher after making a definition.

original: niddisitabba”nti vattabbattā “paṭikkhittaṃ bhagavatā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Bhagavatā paṭikkhittaṃ
analyzed: niddisitabbanti vattabbattā paṭikkhittam bhagavatā atiādi vuttam bhagavatā paṭikkhittam
translated: “What is prohibited should be demonstrated by what?” should be said. That is why “What is prohibited by the Blessed One” is said.

original: bhagavatā paṭikkhittakāraṇena sutte āgatena vatthunā kāraṇaphalabhāvena niddisitabbaṃ.
analyzed: bhagavatā paṭikkhitta kāraṇena sutte āgatena vatthunā kāraṇa phala bhāvena niddisitabbam
translated: What is prohibited by the Blessed One should be demonstrated by the reason and the result stated in the sutta for the reason of the prohibition by the Blessed One.

original: Yaṃ paṭikkhittaṃ yāsu yāsu bhūmīsu dissati, taṃ pana paṭikkhittaṃ tāsu tāsu bhūmīsu
analyzed: yam paṭikkhittam yāsu yāsu bhūmīsu dissati tam pana paṭikkhittam tāsu tāsu bhūmīsu
translated: But that which is prohibited is seen in these and those planes.

original: āgatena pākaṭena akappiyānulomena niddisitabbaṃ.
analyzed: āgatena pākaṭena akappiya anulomena niddisitabbam
translated: What is prohibited in the various contexts should be pointed out by means of what is permitted in those same contexts.

original: “Anuññātañca paṭikkhittañca katamena niddisitabba”nti vattabbattā “anuññātañca paṭikkhittañca
analyzed: anuññātañca paṭikkhittañca katamena niddisitabbanti vattabbattā anuññātañca paṭikkhittañca
translated: “What is permitted and what is prohibited should be pointed out by means of what is permitted and what is prohibited.”🔽“What is permitted and what is prohibited should be pointed out by means of both.” What is permitted and what is prohibited should be pointed out by means of what is permitted and what is prohibited in the same sutta.

original: tadubhayena niddisitabba”nti vuttaṃ. Yasmiṃ yasmiṃ sutte anuññātañca paṭikkhittañca
analyzed: tad ubhayena niddisitabbanti vuttam yasmim yasmim sutte anuññātam ca paṭikkhittam ca
translated: “What is praiseworthy should be pointed out by means of praise.”

original: āgataṃ, tasmiṃ tasmiṃ sutte āgatena tadubhayena niddisitabbaṃ.🔽“Thavo katamena niddisitabbo”ti vattabbattā “thavo pasaṃsāyā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Yasmiṃ🔽yasmiṃ sutte yā yā pasaṃsā āgatā, tasmiṃ tasmiṃ sutte āgatāya tāya tāya pasaṃsāya
analyzed: āgatam tasmim tasmim sutte āgatena tat ubhayena niddisitabbam  thavaḥ katamena niddisitabbo ti vattabbattā thavaḥ pasaṃsāya atiādi vuttam yasmin  yasmim sutte yā yā pasaṃsā āgatā tasmim tasmim sutte āgatāya tāya tāya pasaṃsāya
translated: What is praiseworthy should be pointed out by means of the praise found in the same sutta.

original: thavo niddisitabbo. “Yo thavo pasaṃsāya niddisitabbo, so thavo katividhena niddisitabbo”ti
analyzed: thavaḥ niddisitabbaḥ yaḥ thavaḥ pasaṃsāya niddisitabbo so thavaḥ katividhena niddisitabbo ti
translated: “What is praiseworthy should be pointed out by means of praise. How many kinds of praiseworthy things are there?”

original: vattabbattā “so pañcavidhenā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Bhagavato thavo ca dhammassa thavo ca
analyzed: vattabbattā so pañcavidhena atiādi vuttam bhagavataḥ thavaḥ ca dhammassa thavaḥ ca
translated: “The fivefold” is stated in order to show the fivefold. The fivefold is to be understood as the fivefold of the Blessed One, the fivefold of the Dhamma,

original: ariyasaṅghassa thavo ca ariyadhammānaṃ sikkhāya thavo ca lokiyaguṇasampattiyā thavo
analyzed: ariya saṅghassa thavaḥ ca ariya dhammānam sikkhāya thavaḥ ca lokiya guṇa sampattiyā thavaḥ
translated: the fivefold of the Noble Sangha, the fivefold of the training in the Noble Dhamma, and the fivefold of the perfection of mundane qualities.

original: cāti pañcavidhena veditabbo. Iti evaṃ vuttappakārena pañcavidhena thavo niddisitabbo.
analyzed: ca ati pañcavidhena veditabbaḥ iti evam vutta ppakārena pañcavidhena thavaḥ niddisitabbaḥ
translated: Thus the fivefold should be demonstrated in this way, in the fivefold manner stated.

original: Amhākācariya amhākācariyena aṭṭhārasa mūlapadā sāsanapaṭṭhāne daṭṭhabbāti vuttā,
analyzed: amhākā cariya amhākā cariyena aṭṭhārasa mūla padā sāsana paṭṭhāne daṭṭhabbā iti vuttā
translated: Our teachers say that the eighteen root-terms should be seen in the establishment of the Dispensation.

original: “katamāni tāni aṭṭhārasa mūlapadānī”ti pucchitabbattā “indriyabhūmī”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: katamāni tāni aṭṭhārasa mūlapadāni iti pucchitabba ttā indriya bhūmi itiādi vuttam
translated: “What are those eighteen root-terms?” is stated in order to show the eighteen root-terms.

original: Sāsanapaṭṭhāne indriyabhūmi saddhindriyādiindriyabhūmi yehi navahi padehi niddisitabbā,
analyzed: sāsana paṭṭhāne indriya bhūmi saddhi indriya ādi indriya bhūmi yehi navahi padehi niddisitabbā
translated: In the establishment of the Dispensation, the plane of the spiritual faculties, the plane of the spiritual faculties beginning with faith, should be demonstrated by means of the nine terms.

original: sāsanapaṭṭhāne kilesabhūmi yehi navahi padehi niddisitabbā, evaṃ iminā pakārena etāni
analyzed: sāsana paṭṭhāne yehi navahi padehi niddisitabbā evam iminā pakārena etāni
translated: In the establishment of the Dispensation, the plane of defilements should be demonstrated by means of the nine terms. In this way,

original: mūlapadāni nava padāni kusalapadāni, nava padāni akusalapadānīti aṭṭhārasa mūlapadāni
analyzed: mūla padāni nava padāni kusala padāni nava padāni akusala padāni iti aṭṭhārasa mūla padāni
translated: these root-terms are nine terms of wholesome terms and nine terms of unwholesome terms, thus the eighteen root-terms.

original: honti. Sāsanapaṭṭhāne daṭṭhabbā, “kena kāraṇena aṭṭhārasa mūlapadā sāsanapaṭṭhāne
analyzed: honti sāsanapaṭṭhāne daṭṭhabbā kena kāraṇena aṭṭhārasa mūlapadā sāsanapaṭṭhāne
translated: “Why are the eighteen root-terms to be seen in the establishment of the Dispensation?”

original: daṭṭhabbāti viññāyatī”ti vattabbattā “tathā hī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tathā hīti tato eva
analyzed: daṭṭhabbā ati viññāyati iti vattabbattā tathā hi itiādi vuttam tathā hi iti tatas eva
translated: “Because of that” is said in order to show that. “Because of that” means because of the eighteen root-terms being to be seen in the establishment of the Dispensation.

original: aṭṭhārasamūlapadānaṃ sāsanapaṭṭhāne daṭṭhabbattā “aṭṭhārasa mūlapadā kuhiṃ daṭṭhabbā?
analyzed: aṭṭhārasa mūlapadānam sāsanapaṭṭhāne daṭṭhabba ttā aṭṭhārasa mūlapadā kuhim daṭṭhabbā
translated: “Where are the eighteen root-terms to be seen?

original: Sāsanapaṭṭhāne”ti yaṃ vacanaṃ vuttaṃ, tena vacanena viññāyatīti. “Kena mūlapadānaṃ
analyzed: sāsana paṭṭhānā iti yam vacanam vuttam tena vacanena viññāyati iti kena mūlapadānam
translated: In the establishment of the Dispensation,” is the statement that is shown by that statement.🔽“By what is the eighteenfold nature of the root-terms shown?”

original: navakusalapadanavaakusalapadabhāvena aṭṭhārasabhāvo viññāyatī”ti vattabbattā “tenāhā”tiādi
analyzed: nava kusala pada nava akusala pada bhāvena aṭṭhārasa bhāvaḥ viññāyati iti vattabbattā tena āha atiādi
translated: “By the nine profitable terms and the nine unprofitable terms,” is said in order to show that.

original: vuttaṃ. Tena mūlapadānaṃ navakusalapadanavaakusalapadabhāvato āyasmā mahākaccāno –
analyzed: vuttam tena mūla padānam nava kusala pada nava akusala pada bhāvataḥ āyasmā mahākaccāno
translated: “By that” means by the nine profitable terms and the nine unprofitable terms. The venerable Maha Kaccana said:

original: “Navahi ca padehi kusalā, navahi ca yujjanti akusalapakkhā;
analyzed: navahi ca padehi kusalāḥ navahi ca yujjanti akusala pakkhāḥ
translated: “By nine terms they are profitable, By nine terms they are unprofitable,

original: Ete kho mūlapadā, bhavanti aṭṭhārasa padānī”ti. –
analyzed: ete kho mūla padāḥ bhavanti aṭṭhārasa padāni iti
translated: These are the root-terms, They become eighteen terms.”

original: Yaṃ vacanaṃ āha, tena “navahi…pe… padānī”ti vacanena mūlapadānaṃ navakusalapadanavaakusalapadabhāvena aṭṭhārasabhāvo viññāyatīti.
analyzed: yam vacanam āha tena nava hipe padāni iti vacanena mūla padānam nava kusala pada nava akusala pada bhāvena aṭṭhārasa bhāvaḥ viññāyati iti
translated: The statement “ninefold … and so on … and so on” shows the eighteenfold nature of the root terms by way of the ninefold wholesome and ninefold unwholesome terms.

original: “Yaṃ yaṃ saṃkilesabhāgiyādisoḷasavidhaṃ sāsanapaṭṭhānañceva yaṃ yaṃ lokiyādiaṭṭhavīsatividhaṃ🔽sāsanapaṭṭhānañca ācariyena niddhāritaṃ, ettakameva paripuṇṇaṃ, aññaṃ sāsanapaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: yam yam saṃkilesa bhāgiya ādi soḷasavidham sāsana paṭṭhānam ca iva yam yam lokiya ādi aṭṭha vīsatividham  sāsana paṭṭhānam ca ācariyena niddhāritam ettakam eva paripuṇṇam aññam sāsana paṭṭhānam
translated: “The sixteen kinds of promulgation of the Dispensation that are included in the category of corruption, and so on, and the twenty-eight kinds of promulgation of the Dispensation that are included in the category of mundane, and so on,🔽that have been extracted by the teacher, are complete in this way. There is no other promulgation of the Dispensation

original: niddhāretvā yuttaṃ yujjitabbaṃ natthī”ti vattabbattā “niyuttaṃ sāsanapaṭṭhāna”nti
analyzed: niddhāretvā yuttam yujjitabbam na atthi iti vattabba ttā niyuttam sāsana paṭṭhānan ti
translated: that should be extracted and added to this.” Therefore, “the promulgation of the Dispensation is complete” is said.

original: vuttaṃ. Yathāniddhāritasāsanapaṭṭhānato yaṃ yaṃ aññaṃ sāsanapaṭṭhānaṃ niddhāritaṃ
analyzed: vuttam yathā niddhārita sāsana paṭṭhānataḥ yam yam aññam sāsana paṭṭhānam niddhāritam
translated: The meaning that should be taken is this: “Whatever other promulgation of the Dispensation there is, apart from the promulgation of the Dispensation that has been extracted,

original: atthi, taṃ taṃ aññaṃ sāsanapaṭṭhānaṃ niyuttaṃ yathārahaṃ niddhāretvā yuttaṃ yujjitabbanti attho gahetabboti.
analyzed: atthi tam tam aññam sāsana paṭṭhānam niyuttam yathāraham niddhāretvā yuttam yujjitabbanti atthaḥ gahetabbaḥ iti
translated: that other promulgation of the Dispensation is complete in that it should be extracted and added to this in the appropriate way.”

original: “Yaṃ loko pūjayate…pe… niyuttaṃ sāsanapaṭṭhānanti yattako vacanakkamo bhāsito, ettakena
analyzed: yam loko niyuttam sāsana paṭṭhānam ti yattakaḥ vacana kkamaḥ bhāsitaḥ ettakena
translated: “The promulgation of the Dispensation is complete” is said in this way: “Whatever the world worships … and so on …🔽and so on” is the statement of the order of the words.

original: vacanakkamena kiṃ netti samattā, udāhu asamattā”ti vattabbattā “ettāvatā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vacana kkamena kim na itti samattā udāhu asamattā ati vattabbattā ettāvatā atiādi vuttam
translated: “How far does the method of expression go? Is it complete or incomplete?” In order to show this, the words “to this extent” are stated.

original: Āyasmatā mahākaccānena yā netti bhāsitā, bhagavatā sā netti anumoditā, mūlasaṅgītiyaṃ🔽saṅgāyantehi therāsabhehi yā netti saṅgītā, sā netti “yaṃ loko pūjayate…pe… niyuttaṃ
analyzed: āyasmatā mahākaccānena yā netti bhāsitā bhagavatā sā netti anumoditā mūlasaṅgītiyam  saṅgāyantehi therāsabhehi yā na itti saṅgītā sā na itti yam lokaḥ
translated: The method of expression spoken by the venerable Mahākaccāna was approved by the Blessed One.🔽The method of expression recited by the elders who recited the root collection

original: sāsanapaṭṭhāna”nti ettāvatā vacanakkamena samattā paripuṇṇāva hoti.
analyzed: sāsana paṭṭhānam ti ettāvatā vacana kkamena samattā paripuṇṇā ava hoti
translated: is complete and fulfilled to this extent: “What the world worships … is applied to the establishment of the Dispensation.”

original: Iti samattāya āyasmatā mahākaccānena bhāsitāya bhagavatā anumoditāya mūlasaṅgītiyaṃ🔽saṅgāyantehi therāsabhehi saṅgītāya nettiyā atthavaṇṇanā saddhammapālanāmena mahādhammarājagurunā
analyzed: iti sa mattāya āyasmatā mahākaccānena bhāsitāya bhagavatā anumoditāya  saṅgāyantehi thera āsabhehi saṅgītāya nettiyā attha vaṇṇanā saddhammapāla nāmena mahā dhamma rāja gurunā
translated: Thus, the commentary on the method of expression recited by the venerable Mahākaccāna,🔽approved by the Blessed One, recited in the root collection🔽by the elders who recited it, composed by the great elder Mahādhammarājaguru,

original: mahātherena racitā jinaputtānaṃ hitakarā nettivibhāvanā chabbīsādhikanavasate sakkarāje
analyzed: mahā therena racitā jinaputtānam hita karā netti vibhāvanā chabbīsa adhika nava sate sakka rāje
translated: who is called Saddhammapālanā, for the benefit of the Victor’s sons,

original: sāvaṇamāse sukkapakkhe navamadivase sūriyuggamanasamaye samattā.
analyzed: sāvaṇa māse sukka pakkhe navama divase sūri yuggamana samaye samattā
translated: is completed on the ninth day of the bright fortnight of the month of Sāvana, at sunrise, in the two hundred and sixty-sixth year of the Sasana.

original: Iti sāsanapaṭṭhāne sattibalānurūpā racitā vibhāvanā
analyzed: iti sāsana paṭṭhāne satti bala anurūpā racitā vibhāvanā
translated: Thus the exposition has been composed in accordance with the strength of the weapon in the dispensation.

original: Niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: niṭṭhitā
translated: Thus the exposition composed in accordance with the strength of the sword of the establishment of the Dispensation is finished.

original: Nigamanakathā
analyzed: nigamana kathā
translated: The Conclusion

original: Sabbasattuttamo nātho, loke uppajji nāyako;
analyzed: sabba sattuttamaḥ nāthaḥ loke uppajji nāyakaḥ
translated: The Protector, the Lord, the Leader, supreme over all beings, arose in the world;

original: Sambuddho gotamo jino, anekaguṇalaṅkato.
analyzed: sambuddhaḥ gotamaḥ jinaḥ aneka guṇa laṅkataḥ
translated: The Sambuddha, the Victor, Gotama, adorned with many virtues.

original: Sāsanaṃ tassa seṭṭhassa, aṭṭhavassasatādhikaṃ;
analyzed: sāsanam tassa seṭṭhassa aṭṭha vassa sata adhikam
translated: His Dispensation, that of the Best One, for more than eight hundred years,

original: Dvisahassaṃ yadā pattaṃ, nimmalaṃ vaḍḍhanaṃ subhaṃ.
analyzed: dvi sahassam yadā pattam nimmalam vaḍḍhanam subham
translated: When it reached two thousand years, pure, prosperous, and beautiful.

original: Tadā bhūmissaro mahādhammarājā mahiddhiko;
analyzed: tadā bhūmissaraḥ mahā dhamma rājā mahiddhikaḥ
translated: Then the Lord of the Land, the Great King of Righteousness, of great power;

original: Āṇācakkena sāreti, rājā noanuvattake.
analyzed: āṇācakkena sāreti rājā noanuvattake
translated: Sent a messenger to the King, to follow his example.

original: Laddhā setagaje vare, loke vimhayajānake;
analyzed: laddhā setagaje vare loke vimhaya jānake
translated: Having obtained excellent white elephants, causing wonder in the world;

original: Appamatto mahāvīro, puññaṃ katvābhimodati.
analyzed: appamattaḥ mahāvīro puññam katvā abhimodati
translated: The Great Hero, being heedful, having made merit, rejoiced.

original: Tasmiṃ vasseva sāvaṇe, māse navamadivase;
analyzed: tasmin vassā iva sāvaṇe māse navama divase
translated: In that very year, in the month of Sāvana, on the ninth day;

original: Sūriyuggamane kāle, nibbattāyaṃ vibhāvanā.
analyzed: sūri yuj gamane kāle nibbattā ayam vibhāvanā
translated: At the time of sunrise, this exposition was composed.

original: Yattakaṃ sāsanaṃ ṭhitaṃ, tattakaṃ racitaṃ mayā;
analyzed: sa āsanam ṭhitam tattakam racitam mayā
translated: As long as the Dispensation remained, for that long I composed this;

original: Ṭhātu nettivibhāvanā, jinaputtahitāvahā.
analyzed: ṭhātu jinaputta hita āvahā
translated: The Netti Exposition, bringing benefit to the Victor's sons.

original: Iti taṃ racayantena, puññaṃ adhigataṃ mayā;
analyzed: iti tam racayantena puññam adhigatam mayā
translated: Thus by one composing it, merit was attained by me;

original: Hontu tassānubhāvena, sabbe vimuttibhāgino.
analyzed: hontu tassa anubhāvena sabbe vimutti bhāginaḥ
translated: By its power, may all become sharers in liberation.

original: Rājadevī puttanattā, panattā ca sajātikā;🔽Sabbe rajjasukhe ṭhatvā, carantu caritaṃ sukhī.
analyzed: rājadevī puttanattā panattā ca sajātikā  sabbe rajja sukhe carantu caritam sukhī
translated: The queen, out of love for her son, and out of love for her own people,🔽May all live happily, having attained the happiness of sovereignty, and may they live the holy life.

original: Devo kāle suvassatu, sabbo raṭṭhajano sukhī;
analyzed: devaḥ kāle suvassatu sabbaḥ raṭṭha janaḥ sukhī
translated: May the god rain in season, may all the people of the country be happy,

original: Aññamaññaṃ ahiṃsanto, piyo hotu hitāvahoti.
analyzed: aññam aññam a hiṃsantaḥ piyaḥ hotu hita āvahaḥ iti
translated: May they be mutually harmless, dear, and helpful to each other.

original: Nettivibhāvinī niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: niṭṭhitā
translated: The Netti Commentary is finished.
